Reviews.Title: “In the middle of everything, great, but huge hotel. Have not had a bad stay!”
Reviews.Author: Rhapsodyinblue
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here several times, usually on points, which makes it even better. The hotel is in a great location, convernient to both business destinations as well as tourist attractions, public transportation, etc. You walk into the enormous lobby and it feels like you are in the hub of New York, busy with people coming and going. The rooms are very comfortable, large and modern. Flat screen TV, wireless internet (for a charge), etc. This place has what it needs, wondrful location, upscale, close to public transportation, lots of restaurants, etc. Treat yourself!

Reviews.Title: “For that price......You can find better......”
Reviews.Author: klewis0906
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week on business. Its ok. A lot of Spring Breakers. Lobby is always crowded. Rooms are kind of small. Room service is very, very expensive. Drinks in the bar are watered down and pricey. In room movies $17.99. Really? Bathrooms are small. Tub is the smallest tub I have ever seen in life. I'm 5'10". Head almost to the ceiling when in the shower. I couldn't imagine a man 6ft and over. And please don't be anything larger than a size 0. It would be hard to turn around in there. The only plus is the location right in the middle of the Business District - so I walked to my office everyday. And a few blks from Time Square and Theater District, so I was right in the middle of all the action. Subway entrance right on the corner. My daughter and girlfriend came up midweek so we could hang out for the weekend. The location was actually great. Here's the highlight of my stay: I changed rooms on my 2nd day because my windows were dirty, I wanted to enjoy my view. I would have changed on my 1st night, but I was tired after travelling all night. I did call that evening to give advanced notice that I wanted to change. I was thinking that would give them a head start in preparation. I also called the next morning before leaving for work hoping my new room would be ready upon my return. At 5pm after a full day of work, I'm exhausted, I kid you not - This is how it went: 1. Went to front desk and asked for room change. She gave me the key to the new room. 2. Went to the new room on the 25th floor to find that the room key doesn’t work 3. Went back downstairs to get a working key 4. Went back upstairs to the 25th floor to check out the room, and found that the view was of parking garages. Original room had dirty windows, but did have slight view of the main drag. 5. Went back downstairs to advise that I didn’t like the room. She gives me another room. 6. Go back upstairs to the 32nd floor the room is ok…. Not great. So I drop off my laptop and purse, and proceed to the original room to pack my bags. 7. Get to original room 28th floor, guess what? They had deactivated my room key. 8. Had to go back downstairs get the key for my original room re-keyed. I explained that I had now been running up and down the elevators trying to find a decent room. If I hadnt been staying an entire week, it wouldn't have been a big deal. So the lady tells me she has the perfect room for me on the 49th floor. So I say ok, thinking I'm getting a nice upgrade or something due to all the inconvenience. Now I have to go to three rooms - the old/new room to pick up my purse and laptop, the original room to get my bags, and then to my new "perfect" room. 9. After all that – I get my bags from the original room, I retrieve my laptop from the other room. Get to the final room, and guess what? The blinds don’t go all the way up! Argh! I was so MAD I could have screamed!! I tried to find a lesson in all of that and decided, at least I got some exercise! LOL!! The moral of this story..... stick with your first room!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: HTJ4
Reviews.Content: Though we were at the Sheraton only one night (Sat. night, March 31), we had an excellent experience. We were given a very quiet, beautifully appointed room on the 48th floor. The shower was great, the beds comfy, and everything fresh and clean. Elevators were quick and efficient. When we arrived the lobby was packed with people checking in. (groups I think). Even though the staff was extremely busy, they were friendly, professional and gave very personal service. Location is fabulous for subway or walking. We really, really enjoyed our stay. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & staff”
Reviews.Author: dxbcanuck
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location, as mentioned by other reviewers. The higher the room, the less street noise and better view. Very friendly, helpful staff at front desk, concierge and especially in the executive lounge on the 44th floor. Paid an extra $50/day total for executive lounge access (for two of us) and it was well worth it. Nice breakfast spread in the morning (6:30-11 on weekdays, 7:30-11 on weekends), including fresh fruit and berries (love the raspberries and blueberries :), Greek yogurt, fresh bagels, breads and other pastries with assortment of spreads, cereals including muesli and hot oatmeal, Starbucks coffee, tea & hot chocolate. It was nice not to have to leave the hotel in the morning and to be able to enjoy this lovely high-quality buffet in a relaxed atmosphere. In the afternoon (5:30-8pm) there are appetizers and soft drinks on offer (cash bar with a nice assortment of cocktails and wines). The offerings included a selection of crudités, cheeses, crackers, hot appetizers (crab cakes, mini spring rolls, sesame chicken strips when we were there) and what tasted like homemade potato chips with spicy seasoning and a cream cheese dip...yummy! The lounge also has free wifi access (free wifi in the lobby as well but it is always quite busy and noisy and you are lucky if you can find a place to sit). Well worth the extra $25 per day for each of us. Overall, a great place to stay. I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Room Condition”
Reviews.Author: etphonehm
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for the weekend two nights, 3/29-3/30. Was checked in by a very pleasant young lady. Since I was moving hotel and checked in to Sheraton early, the room was not ready but the hotel provided free storage to my luggage. That was wonderful. The room was renovated tastefully with things in mint condition. Room was also well-lit, have nice decor and a view from the 19th floor. Starbucks coffee provided in the room was a nice touch. I wouldn't expect any less from a 4* hotel. Hotel location cannot be any better as the subway stop is right out of the hotel around the corner. Central Park and Time Square are only a few short blocks away. The only negative thing was that there were a lot of student staying in the hotel on the two nights I was there. Some of them happened to be on my floor and their behaviors were typical high school/college students - slamming doors, talking loudly and hanging out in the hallways as if they were in their dorm rooms. I apologize in advance for stereotyping them and there must be some well-behaved young people in the midst. Unfortunately, I just could not get a restful sleep the night before I had to catch a flight the next morning!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SunnyRob40
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel several times recently. The location is extremely convenient, especially to Times Square, theaters, etc. and is a relatively quick drive from Laguardia. Try to get above the 30th floor, as the lower floors can experience a lot of street noise. Also, while their gym is very nice, they do charge $10/day ($20 for total stay) to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel that we've found in New York”
Reviews.Author: smithoosevern
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, 5 minutes from Times Sq & the same for Central park. Our party of 3 arrived at 9pm (2am UK time) as indicated when we booked, told room not ready for 2hrs offered a meal which we decloined but accepted breakafast. When we did book in we as all guests no doubt were intimidated by the 'MINI-BAR' conditions, if you stored your own items they would be charged as the shelves have scales, if you used there items or even looked then once removed for more than 30 seconds would be charged, we kept well clear. The room was excellent, bed was so comfortable. Breakfast was superb and the staff couldn't do enough for you. I negotiated for the other 2 days for complimentary breakfast which was given, if they hadn't I would have gladly paid. Had a lovely holiday but the hotel was the icing on the cake.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the key with a comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: George P
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days and found it within nice walking distance of Central Park , Times Square with its theatres and Carnegie Hall. A subway entrance is nearby which would get you around the city although we did not need to use it. [We have stayed near the Grand Central Railway Station before with easy access to the Empire State Building, Macys etc and it just comes down to where your interests lie at the time and how close to them you wish to be.] There are numerous restaurants around the hotel but our great favourite was the fixed menu at Petrossian 7th and 59th for wonderful food and special decor where mirrors are used to great effect. Maison across the street was very good for breakfast and snacks at reasonable prices. We did not dine in the hotel because, from what we saw, it lacked what the above offered. It was also generally busy. We were on the 33rd floor and whist there was no view as such from our room beyond the offices opposite it was of acceptable standard and tidy and clean. The numerous elevators easily and quickly got us to our desired level Reception were very helpful when queries were raised.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Jade C
Reviews.Content: A superb hotel right down in the middle of new york. Just a stroll away from central park, broadway, etc. Great breakfast & comfy rooms

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: daliwzrd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and were part of a group performing up the street at Carnegie Hall. The proximity of this hotel to everything we were interested in was great. Not only was it close to Carnegie Hall but Central Park, Broadway (saw Wicked!), shopping on Fifth Avenue, Grand Central Station, etc. Everyone at the hotel was courteous and helpful. The ONLY gripe I had was the shortage of caffeinated coffee left in the room. Some days they didn't leave any coffee and others only decaf. However, as soon as I complained, I was given a $50 credit so I could order room service coffee. Problem solved. Would definitely stay here again and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “First Impressions Are Lasting”
Reviews.Author: dabax
Reviews.Content: First, let me begin by stating that a co-worker and I stayed at the Sheraton from August 27, 2010 thru August 30, 2010. I know I am almost 2 years behind writing this review but I just joined TA and thought the experience was worth reviewing. That being said, I loved everything about the Sheraton Towers. When we arrived and entered the lobby, I was overwhelmed by the turn of the century charm coupled with the modern amenities and technology. The marble on the floors and walls were immaculate and there was always a computer available for easy internet access. Service was awesome. Upon checking in, the clerk immediately offered an upgrade to our room -- seeing that we were both big guys. She gave us adjoining rooms with a spectacular view of 7th Avenue. Wow!!! What a way to start an awesome weekend for the 1st visit to New York, New York -- a city so nice they named it twice!! Each morning before we ventured out into the big city for breakfast and touring, I got in my morning workout in the best fitness center that a visiting guest could ask for. It was like having Bally's or LA Fitness in your home. Everything that a fitness freak could ask for was available. The Sheraton sits between Central Park and Broadway. Both are well within walking distance. Thanks Sheraton for a great experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay There Again!”
Reviews.Author: Karen B
Reviews.Content: The rooms are lovely, the beds really are divine! Helpful staff! We stayed on the 39th floor! No noise to speak of! Walking distance to nearly everything! All else...is a $4.00 cab fare! Cheesecake at Carnegies across the street is worthy of a late night treat in bed! My best compliment...'I'd stay there again!"

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: teacher_md
Reviews.Content: We book through Priceline and this is the second time we've been placed at Sheraton New York, This time we were assigned one of the newly renovated rooms. I have to say it was MUCH nicer than the last room we had. Better furniture, better decor, better room arrangement. The hotel wasn't as crowded as last time. Overall, a much better stay. The staff were friendly and helpful. Would be fine if Priceline sends us there again in the future!@

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Will957
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Sheraton a few times over the last 3 years both before and after the referb. This stay was as good as all the others. Fantastic location, nice upgraded room with a very comfortable bed. A point to bare in mind that this is a HUGE hotel even by US standards and you have to expect some of the factors that come with that. The odd wait at check in/out, a busy lobby and lots of other guests. Even with this in mind I would return again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Gumbo3
Reviews.Content: I stayed as a lone traveller in the Sheraton for three nights and it provided everything that I was expecting an needing. Good location for Time Square, Central Park etc...and easy cab ride to other tourist destinations. Can from airport costs $45 an the traffic can be quite bad but that was to be expected. The room service and food was good and the hotel bar served its purpose. My only criticism i that the bar staff are not the most sociable and they shut the bar bang in 1230am when I thought it stayed open until 1am. However there is an Irish bar opposite that stayed open until 4am and was full of interesting characters. The hotel lobby area is very active and noisy, and you can her the street noise in your room but it is bearable. The rooms are basic but provides nice teas and coffees and the tv and Movie selection is good if you want a quiet night in. There is also a Starbucks next door which is convenient and a good steak house called 'Bobbys Van' nearby. I would use this hotel again for short stays.

Reviews.Title: “Kesa and Sheraton went above & beyond!”
Reviews.Author: MontanaJana
Reviews.Content: I recently hosted a business event at the Sheraton New York Hotel & Towers and was really delighted with my choice to base it there. Staffer Kesa Bajamunde went above & beyond in helping me with food and logistics planning and even upgraded us to a beautiful penthouse suite when it became evident that the junior suite I'd reserved wouldn't be big enough for the RSVPs we received. I was amazed when I discovered she did that as a no-fee courtesy for us. Being the head of a nonprofit, this was greatly appreciated. The suite was stunningly beautiful and supremely comfortable - just the combination you want - and featured views of Times Square AND Central Park. Our guests were awed! The catering staff went out of their way to adjust to my adjustments, which was not easy. All of my interactions with staff at the desk to the gym were great. I remain very grateful and will look forward to going back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for NYC during the Holidays”
Reviews.Author: jackwnoho
Reviews.Content: Got a good deal of $89 naming my own price on Priceline to spend a couple days in Manhattan window shopping and getting in the festive Holiday spirit in late December before Christmas. Centrally located near MidTown, just a block from the Ed Sullivan Theater. Room was clean, a bit small though. The hotel lobby has a Starbucks during the day which is converted to the lounge at night.

Reviews.Title: “Not great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Julie T
Reviews.Content: We asked for a king and got a room with two double beds - my husband and I are both 6ft tall! The charge on the mini-bar based on weight is a rip-off. Milk, tea, cups and glasses should be provided in the room. Internet access should be free!

Reviews.Title: “A good convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: oldalStt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Sheraton Towers in NYC for the last two years while she attended a professional meeting held at the hotel. It is a good, clean, dependable hotel to stay at if you are participating in a meeting at the hotel. But it is a large, busy hotel and not a charming boutique one. It is about four short blocks from Central Park, about 10 short blocks from the theater district, and close to several subway stops. It is a safe area to walk in, day or night. Each time we go there I think "there must be a more charming place to stay" but I have not found it and will probably stay here again if we attend another meeting held there. One small tip, there is a Lindy's restaurant very near the hotel. We thought it would be a reasonable place for breakfast but, although the food and service was OK $42.00 seemed like way too much for the minimal breakfast we had. There is also a restaurant/deli/grocery out the side door of the hotel and on the same block that was much more reasonable but, again, lacking charm, but reasonable food and reasonable prices (for New York). We went to the (almost) top of the Empire State Building and it certainly is a good view of the city. If you like Dim Sum (Chinese lunch pastries) the Jing Fong Restaurant in Chinatown is certainly worth a visit. It is up a long escalator and is huge, The maximum occupancy sign said not more than 800+ people at a time. It certainly was authentic and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Big and impersonal”
Reviews.Author: MattFletcher
Reviews.Content: This is a massive hotel, one of New York's largest. The lobby is crowded, queues are very slow for checkin and checkout. Rooms are large and comfortable. Rooms service is average and the lobby coffee shop is a mini Starbucks. Location is good, close to Times Square etc. It annoyed me intensely that I had to pay to check my bag when my room wasnt ready for me to checkin, even as an SPG member! A rather impersonal experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel North of Times Square”
Reviews.Author: chicagolouis
Reviews.Content: close to two subway stops and times square, but far enough away from bad noise

Reviews.Title: “This place is GREAT”
Reviews.Author: Bill N
Reviews.Content: Went to celebrate my wifes birthday and attend concert at Radio City Music Hall. We were greeted at the from desk with Cristina wishing my wife a Happy Birthday. Our room was upgraded, champange and strawberries sent to the room from management on the spot. Staff is wonderfull, even with a packed house and the NCAA Basketball tourney in town. We"ve stayed at other hotels in New York and this was the GREATEST. I booked on priceline and was made to feel like a king. THIS PLACE MAKES EVERYONE FEEL SPECIAL!!! Great staff, super location, walikg distance to everything from Times Square, fine dining, shopping and Broadway. THE FANTASTIC STAFF MAKES THIS PLACE SUPER SPECIAL.

Reviews.Title: “Great property and great location!”
Reviews.Author: SalemSoccerMom
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I went to NYC for a long weekend and had an amazing time! The hotel was wonderful, the service great and the location was the best! The rooms have been renovated and we just loved it! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “The best way to stay in NYC!!”
Reviews.Author: ladyk724
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel. The location could not be better. But- the best part is the staff!! We had a relatively small problem.....tv reception... but my husband was anxious to watch a big basketball game! Kenny Mafindon (spelling?) was in charge and did everything to help with the problem. A real professional! The concierge knows EVERYTHING about NY. We have stayed in many hotels in NY and never enjoyed a place so much. (and we got it for a great price on Priceline.com) Thanks to Kenny and all for making this a weekend we will always remember.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Towers in the Heart of the Theatre District, NYC”
Reviews.Author: JeffreyMehr
Reviews.Content: It's expensive, but pays back in value. Get a conference rate if you can. Staff is extremely courteous and helpful, no exceptions in my experience. Special kudos to bell staff Raphe, Eddie, bell captain David, Ali, and a concierge whose name I didn't get, but who saw me struggling with a cart full of PA and musical instruments and wheeled it to the lobby for me. He refused a tip saying he just did it out of courtesy--it wasn't really his job. When you travel with 250 lb of equipment as I do, support from the bell staff is essential! Complimentary coffee/tea in-room. Charges for wi-fi in the room; free wi-fi in lobby and conference areas. In-hotel restaurant is pricey, but also a Starbucks in the lobby with lower prices and decent coffee.

Reviews.Title: “50 th in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Kerry A
Reviews.Content: The hotel was being renovated while we were there in August 2011. Very busy hotel, but the girls on the reception were very abrupt and and not exactly too keen to help with anything. The rooms were ok but quite noisy...the bars and restaurant were also average. Great location able to walk to most attractions. Alot of smokers outside the entrance to the hotel,that was a bit unpleasant as were all the discarded butts and rubbish. For a large hotel chain I think that was overlooked.......wouldn't go back would try a smaller hotel. My first time to New York and I adored it!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The best location close to everything”
Reviews.Author: leorma
Reviews.Content: The hotel z Has the best possible location for tourists in ny. The new rooms are beautiful and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Manzeer
Reviews.Content: I was overall satisfied. Only thing that was upsetting is that I had to pay $10 per day to use the fitness room. Also, internet is such a widely used ammenity at hotels around the world and all hotels should offer free WIFI throughout the hotel (and not just in the lobby). I arrived early and had to wait for my room to be cleaned, which is no big deal, but this hotel should have public restrooms close to the reception desk! I had to walk to a totally separate floor through a maze of hallways to find the rest room. Also, your rooms with two double beds have a super small bathroom! Otherwise the staff were very friendly, and loved the location (only a 5 min walk to Time Square).

Reviews.Title: “Not the best... not the worst.”
Reviews.Author: WantToSeeTheWorld_12
Reviews.Content: The good thing about the hotel was that it was clean and, while the room was a bit cramped, it was perfectly acceptable. The not so good thing about the hotel was that its staff was somewhat less than friendly. Its not that they were rude, they just didn't go out of their way to be polite or helpful. However, the best thing about the hotel was its location. It is within walking distance of most major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “One word - renovation!”
Reviews.Author: PDCE-85
Reviews.Content: Seems s a bit futile to review a hotel that has already been reviewed 2,600 times, though I can certainly add my voice to the enthusiastic crowd that will insist that you ask for a renovated room. We got our room on Priceline at a very reasonable price, but we were also 'upgraded' to a renovated room. in fact, she told us our room on the 17th floor had only come on line the day before, suggesting that we were the very first people to stay in the room. This might explain why there was no toilet paper holder, which was strangely disconcerting! The rooms are REALLY small. That makes sense for a hotel near Times Square, but it still surprised me! They are trying to capture the sleek European style, for which I would say they were mildly successful. The bed was only a double, but the linens were crisp and the mattress was excellent. Perhaps they were working on the 18th floor, but during the day, there was definitely a good bit of construction noise. Not overwhelming, but you couldn't escape it either. Seems that will be going on for quite a while yet. So we got lucky. Great location. Easy walking to the major subway lines. We skipped the valet parking and used a self serve garage around the corner. Probably saved $20!

Reviews.Title: “very nice clean hotel, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: totallyoutofhand
Reviews.Content: Great, clean hotel with very nice rooms. Nice location, MOMA is right around the corner, the park is close by, Tiffanys, Cartier, Times Square. Great little french restaurant "Maison" right around the corner, for breakfast or lunch, American Handmade Gallery. Great larger type deli for take out or eat in around the corner also. Only negative was no fan in the bathroom and thin walls. Bring earplugs. Room was very clean. Nice bedding.

Reviews.Title: “tourist central”
Reviews.Author: schnugchi
Reviews.Content: Very large hotel in the heart of Times Square. Very busy hotel and fittingly so during the holiday season. Rooms were clean and compact, bed and bedding were comfy. Like most large hotels, no free wifi available in rooms. Kind of a hassle if you want to avoid large crowds in the lobby. Succumbed to paying for internet access inside the room.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Liz E
Reviews.Content: Easy reach of Central Park and Times Square. Amazing bedrooms, great service from hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Average comfort”
Reviews.Author: ranger505
Reviews.Content: The room is nicely appointed, if not a bit cramped.... A Hampton Inn has larger rooms. Clean and mold-odor free. Avoid the Hudson Market Burger restaurant in the lobby. Expensive, limited menue of nothing but burgers. Decent size patty, but it ends there. Frozen fries, tastless withered pickel on the side. Asked for a glass of water with lemon which arrived room temp, no ice. Servers were far more interested in talking and texting on their cell phones, had to go to the counter to get my check after waiting. Hotel undergoing renovations, so it seems the other eating places are closed.

Reviews.Title: “Ok. Get renovated room”
Reviews.Author: chocolatecookie123
Reviews.Content: Stayed on business. First time old horrible room. Second time much better renovated room on 9th floor Gift shop was $22 for an umbrellA. Hotel had no loaners. Forgot deodorant but hotel sent free amenities which was very helpful. Old room was dirty with soiled sheets. New room was lovely no complAints. Big hotel and during prime time can be a bit crazy to checking. Not my first choice in NYC but renovated rooms are good.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Swiss783
Reviews.Content: I have been an SPG Platinum Member for many years who travels constantly and I have stayed several times at this hotel over the past years. This time I was with part of my family. The staff went our of their way to make sure we get a spacious suite and even contacted us before arrival. The lounge in the tower floor has magnificent views and the complementary breakfast is lovely. The staff up there, some of whom have been there for years, are very polite. The hotel itself is very large and sometimes noisy, but well suited for families. the rooms are nothing special, but generally above midtown Manhattan standard (especially the renovated ones). The location is, of course, excellent as is the view from some of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: missedme
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for one night pre-cruise. I took a chance booking through Priceline and we were very happy with what we got. It is literally a two minute walk into Times Square and just far enough away to not hear all the noise. It is also close to the Hop On- Hop Off tour stops for anyone who wants to go sightseeing (a great way to sight see for anyone who is interested). The room and bathroom were very clean. I read about some people complaining about renovations and dampness - we never experienced either. I couldn't help but be reminded of our hotel rooms in New York New York, Las Vegas and that is a good thing! Only real downfall - Wi-Fi costs $15 a day. But there is an internet cafe type-thing down in the main foyer that you can log onto for free if you are staying at the hotel. Definitely recommend to anyone visiting the Big Apple!

Reviews.Title: “Really good experience”
Reviews.Author: betz_12
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had a girls getaway in NYC last week. We stayed at the Sheraton. Our room was beautifully decorated. Everything was clean and fresh. The service was wonderful, everyone was friendly and helpful. We had drinks and snacks in the bar, very enjoyable. The location can't be beat. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific NYC location—with some small caveats.”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust_jules
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Sheraton for a few nights while we were having work done on our apartment. I booked through Hotwire and was very pleased with the quality and accommodations during our stay. First off, the location is great. The B, D and E subway station is literally a few steps outside the hotel and Times Square is a few blocks down. For those not familiar with the area/city, I would recommend researching food options in advance as the surrounding places are either overpriced, mediocre or both. I read some of the previous posts about the ongoing renovations, so at check-in I requested a renovated room and we got one. The gentleman at the front desk gave my 4-year-old a coloring book and crayons—a nice touch. We are a family of three so we got a room with two double-beds, and while the rooms are very nice, they are tiny. I think a couple staying in a queen-bed room would be a bit more spacious. I have stayed at Sheratons around the world and this room was by far the smallest but its a fantastic location. The beds were very comfy, it was very quiet on the 20th floor and blackout shades worked great. The renovated rooms are very streamline—no table but a shelf along the wall, a computer chair and a lounge chair. Housekeeping was very accommodating, the internet in the room worked well (extra fee) and room service was prompt. As others have noted, room service and the mini bar is EXPENSIVE. $5.99 for a diet coke from the mini-bar (or room service). I will say that the amount of food you get is a lot, my husband and I could have easily shared one sandwich/entree. The service charge is steep too—$9.00. It's fine if you can expense it or use as a tax write-off. Also, we tried to use the mini-bar as a fridge—DON'T! We were not warned that if you removed something from the mini-bar you are charged for it, and it doesn't really keep things cold. I explained this to the front desk and they removed the charges. This is a great hotel if you are staying in NYC for a few days. Anything longer, the size would get to me, especially with kids. And definitely research your restaurant/store options ahead of time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location.”
Reviews.Author: mgtravelpro
Reviews.Content: Room was a bit small but average size for NYC. Everything else is great here. Awesome location on 7th Ave and 52nd. Nice lobby with Starbucks type items. Nice bar with grill food. Breakfast buffet. 4 blocks from Central Park, Times Square, Radio City, Rockefeller Centre, all Bway shows.

Reviews.Title: “Family Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Stephen172268
Reviews.Content: The hotel is under going a gradual refurbishment and many of the rooms are in a desperate state with dampness and 1970's decor and fittings. It took 3 attempts to find a room that matched what we booked, each time the reception staff had no idea what sort of room they were sending me to and didn't really care I was unhappy. We avoided doing anything other sleeping & showering in the hotel as the prices were very expensive and the dining room looked awful. However the location is excellent and everything is reached by walking if you have the time and energy. We walked from Battery Park back up to Mid-Manhattan, it took about 90 minutes but its a great way to see the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in NYC”
Reviews.Author: banker562
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at this hotel from Feb 16-19th. The room was booked through Priceline and we couldn't have picked any better property. The rooms are very small and very standard, which is standard for NYC, but ours was very clean and newly renovated. Along with the small room you will also get a very small bathroom. Hotel Staff was beyond helpful and treated us as if we booked directly with the property without any discounts. This hotel location can not be beat! We were within minutes of Times Square, Central Park, lots of shopping, Letterman Theater and so many other must see NYC locations! The best part is the Subway Line that is on the same corner as the hotel and we used this line throughout our entire stay. There are countless diners and restaurants within blocks of the hotel and the entertainment of Broadway is just steps away! The hotel itself doesn't offer much in terms of dining but there is so much nearby that you are almost overwhelmed by all of the choices. Pick this hotel based on location and try Priceline for a great rate, you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location....”
Reviews.Author: knit8
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 3 night stay at the Sheraton. I didn't know what to expect from the mixed reviews written about this property. It exceeded my expectations! The location is unbeatable as you are in close walking distance to TImes Square for the Theater, 5th Avenue shopping and Central Park. I lived in NYC for several years and have stayed at various properties. This is an awesome location. As far as the accomodations...we had a room on the 39th floor that was newly renovated. It was a nice size room as we are a family of four. Bathroom was small but was fine by New York standards. The only thing that I didn't like about the hotel was the lobby. It is not well configured and not enough comfortable seating. I recommend the Sheraton if you want to be close to all of the major sights and subways. I will return to this hotel on location alone!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and values”
Reviews.Author: JTAtl
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend in NYC and it was my first time at the Sheraton Towers. Great location for walking to Times Sq and Theaters. A short walk to other shopping and restaurants. Very convenient for taking the train as well. Service at the hotel was excellent, free wi-fi in the lobby. The hotel is almost finished remodeling and our room was a good size for NYC, clean and nicely appointed. Got a good deal on Priceline for $120 night. I would stay there again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Not too impressed..”
Reviews.Author: Dreemz05
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Sheraton towers during the holidays and the lobby was busier than JFK. At check in, I requested a complimentary upgrade to a standard renovated room, and the concierge sternly told me "No!" and that I should be "grateful" that I was receiving an early check in time rather than requesting anything complimentary. It was a $40/night upgrade, and I foolishly declined it. As soon as I entered my room, I was completely grossed out. Not only was the room hot and humid with the smell of mildew, but the window was completely boarded up so no sunlight could enter in. I felt like I was in a dungeon. My husband and I went down to the lobby and had to ask for the manager three times. Each time we were told that he was in a meeting, he was not around, or something else they managed to make up.We patiently waited for half an hour. Finally upon speaking with the manager, we argued for 10 minutes before he agreed to give us a room that didn't have boarded up windows (was this too much to ask for?). Temperature control in these rooms was a nightmare. Either the room was too hot and humid, or after we turned off the heat, it was too cold. Don't touch anything in the mini fridge unless you are willing to pay for it. We got charged for items we didn't consume. All of the items have sensors on them and you get charged if anything is moved around. The cable tv didn't work and we didn't even feel like it was worth bothering with. The toiletries are a joke. To be fair however, the room was clean, the beds were comfortable and the room was a decent size for NYC standards. Also, the location is unbeatable. The complimentary starbucks coffee in the room was nice. Upon request, we received bathrobes (one of the bathrobes was torn with holes in it). If you stay in a renovated room, you may not encounter some of the problems we did. However if you don't stay in a renovated room, I definitely do not recommend this hotel. The service however, was a shame. With over 1,000 guest rooms, this hotel is HUGE. It seems to me that this hotel has more guests than it can handle and it can only provide you with the bare minimum. With the sheer quantity of guests checking in every day, this hotel can offer competitive rates online and can really care less if you care to come back. I'll be sure to book elsewhere on my next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Best customer service ever!”
Reviews.Author: SandraK6411
Reviews.Content: Reserved a room at the Sheraton via Priceline..... Can I just say that EVERY staffer that we encountered was top notch! It started with the woman who checked us in....I wish I had remembered her name....carried through to our server at the Link Lounge and was topped off with by far the best wait staff I have ever experienced at a hotel breakfast buffet. That wonderful woman's name was Tilly and she was fantastic. I might also add that I had two young children with me on this trip and they were treated like special guests. thank you Sheraton for a great stay. Good lick with the renovation....it didn't bother/impact our stay in the very least.

Reviews.Title: “really small, dirty, & near elevator”
Reviews.Author: kdoOregon
Reviews.Content: OK, we got a priceline great deal, BUT this room was really bad. My husband checked and we didn't see any bedbugs, but that is as far as we'll go. We were only here one night (arriving late), so it wasn't worth making a fuss. Now, if this were a two star hotel, I would have given it a better rating. But, this is listed on trip advisor as a four star hotel. The room was really, really small with only a queen bed in it. There were no wash clothes (we didn't want to shower . . .) The door to the bathroom had wood peeling off of it. There were permanent stains on the carpet. And, we were right next to the elevator, so there was a periodic "ding" "ding" "ding" all night. I gave it a two star review because the people who worked there were nice and the location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and I got a great deal!”
Reviews.Author: deshanko
Reviews.Content: Spent a Friday and Saturday night in NYC. Got a great deal at the Sheraton on priceline, $110/night using the name your own price feature. The room was large for NYC standards. It was reasonably clean. The bathroom was large and clean as well. We didn't eat or drink site, so I'm not sure what the bar here is like. I'd come back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, renovated rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: Aljono4ka
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sheraton 6 nights and got one of the renovated rooms (most part of the hotel was being renovated while we were there, but we dig not hear any noise cause by the constuction, luckily). So the room was nice and cosy and clean, with very comfortable bed and tidy bathroom. The hotel is huge, so unless you are à VIP customer, you may find the service as impersonal, but we did not mind, we got help we needed it ( to book à table at Morton's, to book a helicopter flight, to find addresses on the map, the consierge was very helpful! And we got a privite car + driver to the Newark airport and it was cheaper than taking a taxi. The only minus is that the hotel charges when you leave your bags in the luggage room (in all the places I have been to, it's allas been à free of charge service.

Reviews.Title: “Dont get stuck in an unrenovated room!”
Reviews.Author: jason711
Reviews.Content: Even though the comments on here from the hotel make it seem like you have a low chance of getting an unrenovated room, don't take your chances! I actually stayed here a few weeks ago and got presumably upgraded because I am a spg gold member to one of the renovated rooms. That room was great. This time around, I got placed on the 6th floor, right by the elevator, in an unrenovated room. The entire floor was dated, carpet was worn/dingy looking, and the rooms matched as well. The bed was not comfortable (very different from upgraded room) and the room was noisy because it was by the elevator. I went down to complain and the front desk lady was nice but told me they were sold out. After some looking, I ended up in another unrenovated room on the 8th floor, this time away from elevator but 2 full beds instead of 1 queen. Another downside is the heater is hard to get it to the right temperature so it was either too hot or cold all night. Fortunately I am only here for 1 night so I can manage. I will be crossing the Sheraton off of my list of new York hotels I'm willing to stay in until all the rooms are renovated. Its not worth the risk to end up in one, especially when they list themselves as a 4* establishment!

Reviews.Title: “Modern business/conference hotel and a great night's sleep.”
Reviews.Author: Thomas_and_Sarah
Reviews.Content: Huge modern hotel with rooms furnished to a high standard. Felt very safe though lifts not keycard activated like in some other new york hotels. Stayed as part of a conference so did not experience any non conference food, but what was served was very good. All mod cons including an overpriced shop with all basics in the foyer : 11 USD for a single deoderant! Best walking a block to duane reade if you need groceries! Friendly and helpful staff and free wifi in lobby otherwise 15 dollars a day in room. I often stuggle to sleep well in hotels but not here. Comfy bed and aircon set at right temp to ensure good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Shockingly bad”
Reviews.Author: Vchick
Reviews.Content: We travelled for a 5 day visit in February to celebrate a birthday. We arrived at 7pm and were told that the rooms were not ready. Considering check-in is 3pm and I had spent a lot of money on the trip I asked to see the manager. We were left waiting at the reception desk for around 15 minutes before the manager eventually came. I had booked a twin room with 2 doubles and a double room with 1 queen bed. After a further 10 minute wait, Lucas miraculously found us 2 rooms which were clean- two twin rooms with 2 double beds. When I said this was not what I had booked, Lucas informed me it didn't matter what I booked- the hotel would decide what kind of room I got and they couldn't honour all guest requests- why make it an option then. After further argument and debate we agreed to take the twin room and wait for a double. We took the elevator to the 8th floor which was a construction site. In fact, the adjoining room to room 804 had a 'Danger! Do not enter' sign on the door and there was a dirty towel under the door, obviously to keep the dust out. The room was small, dark and old fashioned. Not at all what I would expect from Sheraton! We went back down to reception to wait a further 20 minutes to sort the mess out. Again, we were told the hotel was full and that no other rooms were ready. Eventually they agreed to give us a renovated room that was a twin and were still trying to find a double. Not how I imagined I would be spending Saturday evening in New York! We went to the room on the 19th floor which was nice but it was a double not a twin. Back to reception again! We decided to leave them to sort it out and go for dinner and hopefully get a room when we returned. We finally got all guests in our party checked in at 10.40 p.m. having travelled for over 18 hours from the UK. We did not receive any apology and were given no information about the hotel or breakfast/restaurant details. I found the staff to be insincere and rude. However, it is a great location and the renovated rooms are nice althoughI could hear construction work going on at 7am. Will never return to this hotel. Have stayed in the Grand Hyatt before and would thoroughly recommend it and is in an equally great location.

Reviews.Title: “Gross hotel, bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Cynd113
Reviews.Content: I hate to do bad reviews, but this hotel was terrible. I travel to NYC frequently for work, and this time was there for a work conference. I was told that part of the hotel was being redone, so maybe it will be better...however if you stay in this hotel MAKE SURE you are not in the old part. I was on the 6th floor and was so disappointed. It was loud, the bed was uncomfortable, there was hair on the wall of my shower and the TV didn't work. Seriously disappointing...there are so many places to stay in NYC, don't waste your time.

Reviews.Title: “Big Improvements, Love the club level service”
Reviews.Author: AshJosephM
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at Starwood chains and happen to be back at Sheraton Towers since my usual Starwood hotel didn't have any rooms available. I walked into the lobby just to find it the same as in my previous review. The rooms were still small though having a double bed this time makes me feel I have a bigger room. The lady at the counter gave me an upgrade to the club level which in addition to being in a higher floor offers access to the club lounge. I had tried the club lounge at the Sheraton in Long Island last year and it was terrible but the Sheraton Towers is quite tender. The bar tender who was extremely polite and professional told me that their is a new sheraton standard guideline. One of the reasons the Sheraton Manhattan across the street is no longer a sheraton but just the manhattan. The lounge is quite, comfortable, and cozy. There are Tvs at every corner but the volume is soft. The appetizers were good. Later tonight I am going to check out the gym. But this is nice, not to mention great location.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Noodle0730
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with a weekend in New York City, picked this hotel randomly, and we are so glad he did. This hotel was the perfect base camp for our first trip into the Big Apple. The room is a little small if you are used to traveling out west, but are actually a good size for New York. Other reviewers mentioned that the walls seem a little thin, and it is true you hear a little hallway noise, but each night we were so tired from exploring the city, I really didn't feel this was a problem. I slept like a rock. The renovations are complete and so any construction issues should not be a concern. From the hotel, we were easily able to walk to Central Park (note: jog the Park counterclockwise, not clockwise like these tourists did.), both of our Broadway theaters, Rockefeller Center, 5th Ave shopping, Carnegie Hall, Times Square and so much more. Don't worry about finding places to eat. Within a few blocks of the hotel, there are inexpensive delis for a quick and inexpensive (by NY standards) meal, or pizza (try Fluffy's or Ray's). There are also nicer restaurants within 5 blocks for pre-or post theater meals. We did brave the subway to get to the West Village and to the 9/11 Memorial but everything else we wanted to do was so close that we could just walk. The staff was quick and polite. When we return, we will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Sheraton Quality”
Reviews.Author: Olivia V
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about the hotel is the location. It seems like they are overbooked thanks to their location and they just don't care for anything else. The rooms are very small and the furniture is very old. We stayed in other Sheratons and were very happy with them (we are even Sheraton club members) and this one doesn't compare at all. Yes you can walk to the MET, Central Park, Radio City, Rockefeller center, and the Times Sq. and there are restaurants around it and that's about it. We stayed there for 4 nights and the first day our room wasn't cleaned! At the check-in we told them we are a honeymoon couple and they didn't even offer us anything, not even a honeymoon package for purchase. Our room was at the end of the corridor, at the corner without a view (again no honeymoon treats that we received in other hotels) and cold air was coming in from the window in mid-December in New York. On top of that the heating system is so old that we couldn't even adjust the heat. They don't have any good restaurants in the hotel, you have to go out to eat everyday. There is a parking area below the hotel, where you need to use the valet parking. The price is normal for NY, but during check-out, they had only one person working as valet and it took about an hour to get our car back. We had to wait in the cold, windy garage with out bags for one hour. I recommend that you stay at another hotel, there are many other hotels in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Some drawbacks...”
Reviews.Author: mom2four1966
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, quiet rooms and excellent beds. The rooms are a little small (having never been to NY, I'm spoiled to larger rooms). Housekeeping was a little lax for such a nice place - only got 1 washcloth one day, they didn't replace the coffee cups another day, and they threw away important paperwork of mine. Maybe that particular person will be fired, and you would get much better, but I was a little disappointed in that. 3 sets of elevators for the different floors I'm sure helped things - could be a little confusing. The lobby can get crowded (what's not in NY) and a line for check-in. Concierge was excellent and always helpful with great maps, and the location can't be beat for being 6 blocks from Times Square and 4 blocks from Central Park - right on the B line subway

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a Manhattan weekend”
Reviews.Author: tjohn192000
Reviews.Content: With two subway stops in less than a block (including one directly outside the lobby) and walking distance to time square, rockefeller center and all the shows this is a great location. Check in is quick and easy. A large elevator bank ensures that you get to and from your room with little wait. The rooms are typical for a good hotel in Manhattan, not huge but very neat and clean. The club lounge has an excellent view with good breakfast and evening snacks. I wish I would have stayed here everytime in Manhattan. I will stay in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service at the Sheraton NY and Towers”
Reviews.Author: jenncsw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Towers for about a week in early February, 2012. The hotel is in a great location in midtown Manhattan. It is walking distance to all Broadway theater, as well as Times Square. Lots of restaurants and other entertainment are nearby. We stayed in one of the newly renovated rooms on the 35th floor, which was an upgrade offered to us by the hotel. The room is about 250 square feet. The bathroom is pretty small and doesn't have a lock on the door. However, it was clean and decorated tastefully. The flat screen TV in the room is huge (about 42 inches, recessed into the wall). There is a long, narrow desk with drawer space running under the T.V., a very good use of the small space. We couldn't hear any of the noise from the street, even with the window cracked. The beds were the most comfortable that I've slept in for quite a while, nice bedding and plenty of pillows. We never heard any noise from the hotel either. The internet in the room is overpriced at $14.95 a day, but there are PC's in the lobby that have free internet. It was a little slow, but sure beat the price of in-room internet. The interactions we had with the desk staff were excellent, and they solved our problems right away. They also delivered a fruit basket and bottled water to our room upon arrival-very nice touch! Overall, this is a great deal for the location, and service was superb. I'd definitely recommend this hotel to any family on a trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing NYC Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LA-Dallas
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Sheraton New York Hotel & Towers was incredible adding to the delightful accomodations making the trip one to remember. The location of the hotel provided an easy launch point to attractions- both via cab and subway. Check-in was quick and easy with Rachel. Jose & Lazarus made wonderful dinner recommendations & reservations on Friday and Saturday nights, respectfully. Ernesto capped the trip off with un-surpassed service at brunch prior to departure. Sheraton New York Hotel & Towers will absolutely be the hotel we use next time and every time hereafter.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: lolitanj2
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times before and this was my best stay yet. I was given a renovated room which was decent in size and clean. A big improvement over the old rooms. The beds were comfy too. Housekeeping was very nice and ready to help us with anything. Check in was smooth and friendly as well ( but I did check in at 10 am). At 3 pm I have always noted a huge line for check ins. The location is excellent with easy subway access.

Reviews.Title: “An old building in the center of all tourist activities”
Reviews.Author: bobiguzman
Reviews.Content: Strategically located in the center of all tourist destinations & activities, the Sheraton Hotel NYC maybe considered an old (probably antiquated) building that offers (not so) comfortable, yet comparatively expensive, experience like any newer hotel anywhere else in the world would offer. The guestroom is spacious enough to sleep & dine. It has a coffee maker and 1-cup Starbucks sachets to enjoy drinking coffee anytime in your room. Internet access if very slow, sometimes impossible, in the guestroom. The lobby is spacious with a few comfortable seats. Even in this area, internet access is not fast enough for comfort. Breakfast near the lobby's Hudson Market-- it's delicious & sumptuous.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: cinclus
Reviews.Content: Excellent position half way between Central Park and Times Square. On the whole I found the hotel pretty mediocre; in fact, its past might have been much brighter than it is at the moment. The lobby was dull and really chaotic and the receptionists at the desk resulted no to be that helpful. While rooms were small and old, the bed was extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to NYC to see Anderson Cooper”
Reviews.Author: Flyinsquirrel
Reviews.Content: Everyone was so great at the Sheraton NY Hotel & Towers especially Elizabeth at the front desk,she was very helpful and even gave us upgraded rooms that were renovated.Great location, close to almost everything and I loved the free internet and computers in the lobby!.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton NYC”
Reviews.Author: gyroman2k
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice, just expensive, but what isnt in NYC. It is situated just a few blocks from Times Square. Did not like the $15 fee just for internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel for doing business”
Reviews.Author: motowninchapelhill
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel every January for 10 days for business. They have completely renovated all the rooms. Its taken them a few years and Ive suffered through some noisy stays in 2010 and 2011. But, the renovation is now complete and the rooms are now immaculate, clean, and modern. The hotel has everyone one needs, and the staff are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Midtown Location for the Broadway Bound”
Reviews.Author: pherbert217
Reviews.Content: Last summer, I took my 17 year old son up to NYC for a few days to look at colleges and go to a few Broadway shows since he is a theatre lover. Not sure about how it would work out with us in the same room, it was great! We booked a AAA special with parking included (the parking garage is right off the lobby!) so it was easy to just pull in, hand them the keys and walk into the lobby of the hotel! Room was very nice and clean and beds were very comfy. Hotel lobby was very upscale with lots of hustle and bustle going on. We could walk or take a cab or subway from right outside the main entrance. Soooo easy if you are going to the Broadway shows. Lots of restaurants around. Very walkable to Rockefeller Center too. I would definitely stay there again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Maria S
Reviews.Content: We got a room which was newly renovated and equipped for handicaps = more space. It was difficult to find a hotel with 2 separate beds - but here we found the perfect room. Positive: big room, really good location, comfortable bed, extremely nice staff, good price! Negative: noise from other rooms through the walls, the room wasn't properly cleaned. It was very dusty on the tables and the lamps during the whole stay. The shampoo bottles etc. were not changed everyday although we were using them - cleaning should be better at a hotel like this. I had one bad experience which I wouldn't expect at a hotel of this level. I got sick on our second day (sinus infection). After many phonecalls and waiting I finally got a doctor's appointment (doctor coming to our room). The doctor was about 80 years old - took my fever and looked into my throat, didn't listen to me at all (this was my 5th sinus infection in 1 year - I knew that I had it). He said that since I don't have fever I just need to take some salt water and I will get better. For this I paid 300 dollars!!! The next day I went to Duane Read Pharmacy where there was a doctor who immediatly said that I am so sick that I need to get antibiotics - especially since we are flying back in 2 days. I got the antibiotics and some painkillers and got a bit better for the flight back. BUT - I really recommend the hotel to make a deal with a better and a bit younger doctor. I wouldn't want him to examine my children if they were sick! But all in all a very nice hotel at a great location - within walking distance to Times Square and other great attractions!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: Airedalesrock
Reviews.Content: I got a room at this hotel for an overnight stay with a friend through Priceline, paying only $99 for a Saturday night. Can't beat that price for this great location! The room was small and I don't know if it was one of the refurbished rooms or not--it seemed well-appointed and clean, and we barely used it so we didn't mind the size. Sometimes with a Priceline room you get stuck with what is left, but when I checked in and asked for 2 beds instead of the one King, my room was changed with no problem. It was really nice just to walk a few blocks to the Broadway theatre to see our show. I parked at the hotel and paid the $57 valet parking fee--which was expensive, but very convenient, easy in and out, and i would have spent that on train fare getting into NYC anyway. The one negative comment I have is that the walls were paper thin and I could hear another guest constantly coughing as if she were right in my room. Luckily I was able to download a white noise app on my phone, so it blocked out the noise--otherwise I would have heard every single noise outside the room all night. Can't beat that great location, especially for a quick visit. I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: SK6
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the Sheraton. Really good location and a few blocks breathing space from Times square. Nicely appointed rooms and hallways. Lovely bar downstairs and free internet for guests. The Lobby was always buzzing with activity. There was a problem with work being done next to my room and it was unbearable for most of the day, a $250 comp made things better though! Also the hotel restaurant is basically just a fast food outlet and it needs improving. I would stop at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location....... That's about it..”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller947
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights during our recent visit to NYC.. It was a great location (52nd & 7th) just a few blocks from Times square.... After reading several reviews here, we upgraded to a newly renovated room.. Even the receptionist screwed her nose up at the thought of staying in the older rooms...... The renovated room was nice.. New fixtures and fittings and a coat of paint.. That's about it.. Noise from adjoining rooms was very noticeable, as was the room noise as you walk down the corridor... Breakfast in the restaurant was average at best.. Buffet style food was mediocre.. Not worth the $50..

Reviews.Title: “Starwood Platinum Beware”
Reviews.Author: RMGTravel
Reviews.Content: Since the renovations, the Sheraton hotel is nice. The rooms are modest in size (especially if you dont have Starwood status) but nice since they have been made over. The issue I have is that as a Starwood Platinum guest and having stayed just in the past year over 5 times at the Sheraton New York - never have I received an upgrade or "special room". I travel over 100 nights a year - and dont expect special treatment - but it helps. Most Starwood hotels note your return and try to make the stay that much better. After discussing with my colleagues - they too experienced the same treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location in heart of NYC”
Reviews.Author: Paul H
Reviews.Content: I know it's a bit delayed but I wanted to let everyone know what a great hotel this is. We visited in February 2011 when I surprised by wife with a surprise trip to New York for her 40th birthday. The amazing service started before we had even left London when I contacted the hotel to see if there was anything they could do help make my wife's stay even more special and received a reply from Ingrid, the General Managers executive assistant. She asked various details about my wife's tastes and our travel details, plus arranged an early check-in & late check-out to coincide with out flights. On the day we arrived at the hotel, all the staff were extremely friendly and helpful as you would expect from a Sheraton Hotel. When we got to our room we were blown away by what Ingrid had arranged! My wife's favourite CD was playing in the room and on the table there was a large bouquet of flowers, balloons, a beautiful personalised cake, bottle of wine & glasses plus a hand-written birthday card and gift of Sheraton luggage tags from the hotel. It was such an amazing gesture and way beyond what we could ever have imagined Ingrid and the hotel would do for my wife. The hotel itself was superb, with a spotless room with excellent facilities including an extremely comfortable bed and a personal Starbucks coffee machine! :-) The hotel was undergoing some renovation during the time we stayed but at no time did this disturb our stay and all the public areas were pristine. Location wise we could not have wished for better with a view of Central Park from our window and just 5 minutes walk into Times Square. I would not hesitate in recommending the Sheraton New York Hotel & Towers to anyone visiting New York City and we will certainly stay there again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and affordable rate”
Reviews.Author: Porfiriopicante
Reviews.Content: We booked a last minute trip to NY and stayed at this hotel mainly because of the location. It's currently undergoing some renovations but the staff and hotel otherwise were great. It's a great location if you are visiting the sights with a B, D & E subway metro line stop just out the door. We arrived at around 3pm and our room was not ready yet but after walking around for and hr or so it was ready and we received a upgrade since we are Starwood members. Overall it was nice and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend experience at the Sheraton New York 7th Avenue”
Reviews.Author: Jodi M
Reviews.Content: Our weekend started off by having one of the best experiences I have ever had with a reception desk employee. I had reserved 5 rooms for the weekend. My request was for one room to be on a separate floor and the other 4 rooms required two to be feather free. The woman at the reception desk greeted me with a smile that never faded throughout the entire check in process. She asked a number of questions and even though I had more requests she continued to respond with a smile and a response that was consistently "I will be happy to accomodate this request" . We were checked-in quickly and efficiently. I thought "Wow this is going so smoothly I have to ask her name and make sure I folllow up with a comment to let everyone know what a great experience this has been." When we went to our rooms they were exactly as she had said they would be and every request was met! Kudos to Nicole Young for making our weekend in New York the best yet!!

Reviews.Title: “couldn't ask for better location”
Reviews.Author: kjsErie_Pennsylvania
Reviews.Content: great location subway about 10 steps out of the door-we walked to central park as well as times square and used the subway for all other travels-especially when wearing heels. We found it to be the upscale hotel we have known the Sheraton to be and after reading reviews before going about the renovation I was a little nervous but I picked this place due to location..they are doing a great job with renovations fun carpeting-streamlined rooms they used every square foot and made a nice room to stay and very very clean..If all Sheraton's look like this one I recommend thumbs up.KJS

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all around”
Reviews.Author: Bridget M
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews we were on guard for our stay. The first set of room keys we were given didn't work, which I blame more on technology than the staff. When we went back down to the front desk they were very apologetic and ended up upgrading us to a refurbished room. This was totally unsolicited and very welcome. The upgraded rooms are great. Not bigger than the others but definitely nicer. The location is unbeatable. Times Square is a five minute walk south and Central Park is a five minute walk north. There are several MTA stations nearby and always a couple of cabs out front. Look for a good price on one of the discount travel websites and it'll be one of the best deals in New York.

Reviews.Title: “felt like a number”
Reviews.Author: katiebear_85
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in an amazing location, subway was right on the corner, it was a short walk to time square, and central park, & there was an information center just across the road, no free wifi in the room, which was suprizing for the amount of money i paid to stay here, had to take my laptop down to the lobby, thank god i had that, as there was only a handful of public computers which were always taken no matter what time of day or night, rooms where small, but that is to be expected in NYC, but i was just unlucky to have a room right next to the lift's, very noisy, don't think i'd stay here again, just because i felt like a number not a valued customer, this hotel is huge, and it was quite pricey, but i did have a fantastic location. very undecided.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mblip
Reviews.Content: We booked the the Sheraton for 5 nights in preference to the W on Lexington Ave where we usually stay because the W rooms do not have sufficient drawer space or dressers. We arrived early and after a brief wait, with assistance from Lacy Lazerus, we were able to get in to a room on the 44th floor where the club lounge is located. The room was small but well appointed and we had ample drawers to unpack and sufficient space to store luggage out of the way. The room was spotless (no bedbugs) and the housekeeping staff was efficient and responsive. The bathroom is small and we missed a tub - but the shower worked just fine with lots of hot water. We enjoyed the lounge facilities - breakfasts, evening snacks, fresh brewed coffee or tea, and fruit all day, internet, the fantastic views in all directions, and the smiling faces of Lacy and Zoe. The elevators were remarkably available and fast. Although the hotel is huge, we never experienced any problem or felt overwhelmed. The work out facility is fabulous - spacious, with all new top of the line equipment. The location of the hotel provides easy access to Broadway theater, many subway lines, walking distance to affordable as well as world class restaurants. The MoMA is down the street. If you are planning to stay at a Starwood property and can't spring for the St Regis - this is the place to stay, especially if you can book with Starwood points. We look forward to our return visit. Only glitch - the TV service was problematic. Some channels were not available in our room - PBS especially - but fortunately we were able to see Downton Abbey in the Club Lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, renovations completed”
Reviews.Author: Munky7
Reviews.Content: I stay here almost exclusively when in NYC. Easy access to the train lines I need, blocks from Time square, Hells kitchen and other major attractions. The hotel finally finished all room renovations and its much nicer than just a 18 months ago. Modernized rooms, not huge but what do you expect in Manhattan. Rate fluctuate a lot based on season and events so you need to watch for that. Need to stop charging for the internet access too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but Room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: sultancs
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in great location. Lobby has great vibe and is full of energy. I've stayed as an spg gold my last 3 stays there and my room was old, carpet and bedding wrinkled, and furniture heavily scratched. My colleagues tell me that their rooms were nice and renovated and they didn't have spg status. Not sure why they would consisently give the better rooms to the non spg. Definitely not what I expect from Sheraton. Because of risk that I could end up on shabby floor in shabby room, I won't be staying here again until all renovations are done.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff, and rooms”
Reviews.Author: gnr5
Reviews.Content: I usually never write reviews, but my stay was well worth it! My wife and I took a weekend gateway and we were afraid due to other reviews. However, our stay was perfect! The cleaning crew took very good care of us. The rooms are a little small but this is standard in NYC. It was very helpful to have a cafeteria in the lobby and a store where you can get water, medicine, etc etc. PLUS, the location is amazing, you have the train station right outside the hotel and you can get to virtually any place on NYC from there. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfy room”
Reviews.Author: Flightpro
Reviews.Content: Some tripadvisor members are not really satisfied with this Sheraton property. However, after staying 4 nights at this place last week, I do not agree with them. Lucky for us we were booked in a renovated room in the lower tower on the 8th floor. The beds were nice and I loved the HD TV with plenty of channels to choose from. What I do missed were some extra electric powerpoints. Only two where hidden behind the bed and the TV. The ones that were mounted on the desk did not work unfortunately. The bathroom was clean and looked fresh. There was only one shower head, instead of the usual 'heavenly (dual head) shower' that you can find at many other Starwood hotels. The fact that you have to pay for internet in your room is a big minus. Something that hopefully will change in the near future. It is about time that travellers can demand this feature at every hotel. Why do you stil have no free wifi access at a lot of 4 star hotels, whereas the 3 star places are offering it on a complimentary basis? Shame on you hotel bosses!!! With its location just a few streets away from Times Square and the Subway (E train to JFK) literally around the corner, we had no complaints at all. Maybe that is the best reason why you should choose for this hotel in specific. (By the way, do not expect a romantic place or a hotel with lots of character.) This all plus a Priceline rate of only US$110 + tax per night is making the Sheraton Hotel & Towers one of the best deals you can get at this moment if you want to stay at a safe, clean and decent place.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton NY Hotel & Towers was ok. Comfortable/Clean”
Reviews.Author: datkat99
Reviews.Content: The room was not overly spectacular, but it was clean and the beds were comfortable. ( they said it was newly renovated) Two small doubles ( no real sprawling room in these beds!) Coffee in room was good, (Starbucks) TV nice. Excellent, helpful, and friendly bellmen. They have luggage check at $3.25 per bag which can be a little steep if you are an overpacker like me... It Costs for internet ( which is ucky @ 14.95 per 24 hr ) but oh well, you go with the flow, if you want to stay wired! I would stay again. I pricelined the room however so I did not pay full price ( paid $130 plus tax and fees = 315 for two nights) so based on location ( just off Times Square on 7th avenue) it was a great deal! Thank you Priceline & Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “$50 upgrade to Club Lounge well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: ellasbabe
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate for the weekend via Priceline for this hotel & for an additional $50 a day we were upgraded to a new room and Club Level, which gave us access to the Club Lounge. That basically covered breakfast both mornings, coffee and drinks during the day and an afternoon snack during in the evenings, all ''meals'' were made with very fresh and quality ingredients. The lounge also has free Wi-Fi, which enabled us to avoid having to go downstairs to the lobby to check our emails. Our room was on the 44th floor (same as the lounge), so if you want to make sure you hear less foot traffic you may want to ask for a room on another Club Floor or at the other end of the corridor at least. The hotel location is perfect, walking distance to Rockefeller center for some morning ice-skating (to beat the everning crowds), just accross the subway station and some fantastic shopping on 5th avenue! Everything about the newly renovated tower is great, except for the horrible wind-tunnel elevators, they seem to have been skipped in this massive renovation project...it made me woosy almost every time :S

Reviews.Title: “Good visit-great location!”
Reviews.Author: mikriVictoria
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel this past weekend for two nights - it was our first visit to NYC. I had read for many weeks before the good and the bad about this hotel, and I am very thankful to say we had nothing but a good experience there and a fantastic time in NYC. We arrived at the hotel after flying all night, just after noon and there were no lineups, we went straight to the check in desk and was greeted by a very friendly lady at the desk. She originally was going to put us on the 9th floor but after reading all the reviews about getting an renovated room I asked her if we could have a renovated room instead and yes I did have to pay the $40 upgrade fee, but we got a great room on the 40th floor. No the rooms are not big, but they are very comfortable with everything you need. We were quite comfortable and had a nice view of the city around us. The hotel is so close to everything- it was great. We found the staff all very friendly and helpful if we ever had any questions about anything. If there were any negatives it would be no free wi fi in the room, which wasn't really too bad, you could go down to the lobby where there was free wi fi for 30 minutes. We could also hear other people in the rooms around us, not loud or anything but you could definitely hear them talking and we could hear the whoosh of the elevators. The hotel lobby did get busy throughout the day and night but we never had to wait in line for anything - we checked our bags on our last day after we checked out b/c our plane did not leave till later in the evening - again no line up to drop off and just a small one to p/u our luggage - I don't know maybe we just got lucky with the line ups. The rooms were clean, nicely decorated with comfy beds. I would definitely stay here again though and I would recommend it to people coming to NYC for a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: luisarestegui
Reviews.Content: First time in NYC great location close to everything got a lot of great tips from the stuff specially the front desk associate her name is Debbie. if you can get the club lounge level is worth the upgrade

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: paul v
Reviews.Content: The location was very good, almoste clean. The inconvenient came when the bellboy (a 45 years old short guy) obtrusive ''insisted'' to carry out our luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Nice Room, Thin Walls”
Reviews.Author: uncvic
Reviews.Content: Overall, the Sheraton Towers is a decent hotel, but the walls are paper-thin. Room size is fairly small, but the bed was above average. There were times when it seemed as if people in the hall were actually in our room. I managed to score a good deal on Hotwire, so I can't really complain too much. If I had to pay the regular rate, I would have been unhappy with the choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Holiday”
Reviews.Author: baallen33
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times. This was by far the best trip. We upgraded to the club lounge level (had to pay even though we are spg-gold). It was worth it. Had a nice view. The room was nice and clean. The front desk associate was very friendly (I forget her name)! ... one issue-- EVERY time we goto this hotel, a minibar charge ALWAYS shows up on my credit card... only a few dollars. The hotel's way to contact billing is a pain. You have to call, then send an email, then respond to the email with another address etc etc etc, so I just pay the few dollars. I figure it their way of collecting additional revenue.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated rooms are awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Annette T
Reviews.Content: At check in I was asked if I wanted to pay $50 more to upgrade to a newly renovated room, which would also include cocktail hour with appetizers, water and juice 24hrs, and breakfast.... Since I had only paid $109 on Priceline I said YES still a great price for NY city. Especially with the add ons and I was having a breakfast meeting the next morning which I was able to have in the club lounge on 44th. Firstly the cocktail hour appetizers were excellent, healthy choices as well as tasty bites like pigs in a blanket and home made potato chips, great cheese board with crackers, preserves and fruit.
