There is a Starbucks machine which grinds and then makes a fresh house blend coffee for breakfast too. But, the room, it was great! Comfortable bedding, flat screen tv, gorgeous central park view (through a couple of buildings, but still), the shower AMAZING! Love a hotel without the shower in bath! Everything clean, fresh and stylish. The hallways also looked great, nice carpet, paint, style. Loved it. Hope very much to be back!! Oh and location in midtown, excellent, short walk to Times Square. Ask for a renovated room!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, hotel was just OK.”
Reviews.Author: LittleMac1969
Reviews.Content: This hotel's location was very convenient, It was clean and comfortable. However, it was very stark and lacking in amenities. It didn't seem to live up to the Sheraton name. The lines for check-in and baggage check were HUGE! Usually, when I spend that much time waiting in line, it's for an amusement park ride! Everyone was very professional, but extra staff should be added to cut down on the wait time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect. Don't believe negative reviews!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kevingthomas
Reviews.Content: Staying here for anniversary. Bought this thru Priceline and was very nervous due to all of the negative reviews. Most/all of the rooms are now refurbished. Location is amazing - 1/2 way between central park and times square, a few blocks from gershwin with a subway stop at the corner. Staff have been great. Room is clean and although not "large" it's fine for a NYC visit. Starbucks in the hotel and Carnegie deli and a little market across the street. I love new York in the winter!

Reviews.Title: “Vey aesthetically pleasing!”
Reviews.Author: Jackie L
Reviews.Content: Very nice. The service was a bit of a letdown though (sorry guys, you are probably good people) because the concierges seemed a bit tired. The rooms however - wow! Very nice and you can lookout onto the very nice pool and gym (by the way, the pool is awesome).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, OK rooms.”
Reviews.Author: lolgennari
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for 6 nights and overall it was a good choice. We were upgraded to a superior room due to works on building, and the room was clean but very small. Bathroom was very basic and I had to ask for a shower cap. Housekeeping was average, and I could see that our bathroom sink was not cleaned daily. The only thing I found outrageous is that we were charged $3.25 for each of our bags to be stored in the hotel for 2 hours after check out. I have never been charged for that before. Overall the best thing about the hotel is its location. Service and rooms are ok but not necessarily the standard you would expect in a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: goodtogo33
Reviews.Content: This one of the smallest rooms I have ever had in the US. Cramped claustrophobic depressing. Service is uncaring to rude. It's not cheap and would not be worth saving money anyway. Just avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay at! but...”
Reviews.Author: Moopsz
Reviews.Content: So we got a great deal for the room. It is a nice hotel outside my bedroom. They were doing renovations on the outside of the building, so my windows was covered. You couldn't see the daylight. That aside... it has that classical feeling. It's a nice place to stay, location is great. They have the most impressive gym I have ever seen in a hotel ( but there is an extra fee!). Wifi is available for free ( but only in the lobby). Which is annoying because I carry my tabled instead of my laptop when I'm on vacation. Otherwise, staff is very nice and quite helpful. Rooms were clean. *Oh, this was my first experience of being charged to keep my luggage for the day of checkout. It was about $3.50 per bag. You should know! Now the pool is indicated on their website. but it is in THE BUILDING ACCROSS ( The manhattan). You should know that.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but clean and in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Mand_je2627
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice. Overall, the rooms are clean and beds are comfortable. You can find some reasonably priced rooms if you search or perhaps bid online and the location of the hotel is ideal, within walking distance of Central Park, Times Square, Rockerfeller Center, 5th Ave etc. I did not find the service to be the best simply because the first time I stayed there it was for my brother's birthday (and his first time in New York) and I asked the concierge if there was anything special the hotel could do to help me make the occasion unforgettable. The concierge said that they would of course send some amenities to the room (wine, nibbles etc). This never happened despite two follow up calls from me after hours had passed. I figure they never actually had any intention of doing anything and simply fed me a lie so I would walk away. So, I am left with the impression that this is not a hotel that goes 'above and beyond' in the interest of customer service and satisfaction, however, this is a hotel I would recommend if you are just looking for somewhere basic, clean and in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving Day Parade”
Reviews.Author: marcGF
Reviews.Content: 20 of us went to the Sheraton for 2 night with their special Thanksgiving Parade viewing rooms. It was an awesome hotel to stay at and a great location. Thanks to a very special employe Sharon G. who took care of all our room needs, it was an memory for a life time. Thanks Sharon

Reviews.Title: “1st Stay at A Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: BMTSatelliteBeach_Fl
Reviews.Content: Allways stay at the Hilton, but was talked into staying here by my friend. Wasn't dissapointed, now granted in wasn't a Hilton, but would stay again. Had everything you need and was clean with very good service.

Reviews.Title: “First terrible Starwood Hotel experience in a long time”
Reviews.Author: Sgupte
Reviews.Content: Checked in at midnight after waiting in line for 15 mins. Had called earlier in the day to confirm that I had a room with a king bed in the renovated tower and was reassured on both. After finally getting my keys I walk up to the 10th floor only to see crumbling plaster and wallpaper from the walls. I hope this isn't the renovated section. I then walk into my room to find two double beds and toilet paper in the toilet. I take my bags downstairs only to be told that there aren't any more rooms available and I'd have to wait till tomorrrow for an upgrade. What a terrible experience so far.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding stay with my family”
Reviews.Author: nolesPlymouth_MA
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal on priceline and when I was checking inn I asked to be in a renovated room. The front desk agent told me for a renovated room there would be a charge of $40.00. I said OK but I need a room with double beds because my two year old son needed a bed. He then replied "since you need a double bed and only available in a renovated room, I will waive the $40 and give you a renovated room". I was very impressed with customer service from the time we pulled our car up, bell service and parking. Great location and new room was great. We would def stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Debbie M
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two night stay at the Sheraton and had a great visit. I was deciding between the Marriott Marquis, the W and the Sheraton and I was so happy with my choice. We arrived at the hotel around noon and while our room was not quite ready, our luggage was easily stored and upon our return to the hotel around 3:30pm, our luggage was easily retrieved and our room was ready. The room was nicely appointed and easily accessed from the lobby elevators. At hotels this size, usually the elevators take forever, we virtually never had to wait for a hotel to get to our room or get down to the lobby. While this is a large hotel, all of the employees from the doorman, to the bellhop to the front desk manager (Kenny), was very friendly and quite attentive to our needs. I did have direct contact with Kenny, and I must say that he went out of his way to ensure that my families needs were met. We also loved the location of this hotel. While we were prepared to take taxis everywhere, my family, including two young children ended up walking most places, including Rockefeller Center, Central Park, American Girl, Times Square, FAO Schwartz, amongst other places. In addition, we took the subway to the Upper West Side and down to Union Square. The subway was easily accessible. As a result, we saved a lot of money not having to use taxis at all. My daughters, husband and I can't wait to return to NYC and we will definitely stay at this Sheraton when we return!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Buenzli
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night, got a good deal on Priceline. Hotel is accordingly to Manhattan standards, rooms are equipped adequately to, beds are comfortable, bathroom a bit on the smaller side but that is normal in NYC. Location is great, not too close to Time Square, yet, in immediate walking distance. Hotel could need a bit of a facelift, lobby seems a bit like a train station, big and not very personal, also when we got back to the hotel Saturday, there was a crowd of guys hanging out in front of the hotel that looked a bit shady, didn't feel safe around them, concierge didn't seem to care much.

Reviews.Title: “ok...but i wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: donhannan
Reviews.Content: let me start by saying that this was our 2nd visit to NYC,so i feel i have something to compare it to...our first stay was at The Grand Hyatt and i definately preferred that one over this...location is very good-close to everything you might come to the big apple for,first impressions of the exterior hotel were just ok-didn't give me the same fuzzy feeling that i got from the Hyatt...the lobby wasnt particularly grand either,not horrible,just nothing special...the room-again,not horrible,just nothing to get excited about,i know you don't come to NY to sit in your room,but it is nice to look forward to coming back and taking some time out from the hustle and bustle,but again,i just didnt get that here,personally i prefer to stay in a better hotel away from times sq then the other way around....to sum up,if you are reading this because you are thinking of booking it,i would say price up The Grand Hyatt-if its around the same price,go for that instead...OR if you are reading up because you have already booked,you will love it,because nothing beats being right in the heart of Manhattan and the buzz that comes with it...am just about to embark on trip number 3 to the big apple,this time at the Affinia Manhattan,report coming soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price”
Reviews.Author: Mary Ellen J
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the convenience of this hotel. Subway stop right outside the door that took us everywhere we needed to go, location was centrally located to Times Square and Central Park. The hotel room was a good size, updated and clean. Lobby was energetic, places to hang out and lots of close by necessities such as Starbucks and a great deli/mini-grocers right behind the hotel that had everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Guachoo
Reviews.Content: Spent Jan 2012 in the Sheraton for a Business Trip. Really good location and well within walking distance of Times Square and Central Park. Room was nice and clean. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: joe1110
Reviews.Content: Spent Christmas 2011 in the Sheraton. Really good location and well within walking distance of Times Square and Central Park. Room was nice and clean. It had a big bed and enough space to store your clothes. Couldnt fault it. Would love to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location. Rooms Tired.”
Reviews.Author: OBD2142
Reviews.Content: Basics: Good Location. Good water pressure & plenty of hot water. Complimentary coffee/coffee maker in room. USA Today papers availble for pickup by the elevators. Shampoo/Conditioner/Lotion nice. No shower caps provided. No complaints with bedding. Unfortunately the rooms are tired and in need of updated. My understanding is construction/updating is being made in the tower where I did not stay. I was told I would be happier without the extra noise if I stayed in the older area. Having said that, I was disappointed with the maintenance in my room. There was a large 'crayola orange red' spot on the carpeting between the beds. I'm sure a permissive adult was allowing their children to raise havoc in this room. (I think the hotel should clean carpets or patch with such a stain!). Worse than this, there was granola left on the floor under the nightstand on check in. I didn't notice it the 1st night because I was so tired and crashed. The next day I telephoned guest services and asked if they would vacuum. I telephoned each day for 3 days before this was cleaned. Two of my conversations were with managers. Finally the night before the morning of my checkout, the room was vacuumed. YUK! Big YUK! (At least it's been cleaned for the next guest in that room.) I also suggested to management that housekeepers should re-set clocks in rooms. Mine was set to the wrong time with an alarm. I just unplugged it. However, two mornings in a row the alarm in the room next to me rang non-stop. (It wasn't THAT loud - I have to assume that the walls have decent insulation.) The room temperature is not regulated with a thermostat. There is an antiquated unit you need to adjust when you are too warm/too cool.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Sheraton I used to know.”
Reviews.Author: Brandy146
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Sheraton once before, we decided to stay here again for New Years celebrations, as the hotel is close to everything. Fifth Avenue is a very short walk and you can see Broadway from the Hotel. We arrived two days before New Years Eve. We were given our room and gladly went up for we had been travelling for a long time. We arrived at our room and sadly, were disappointed. The room was okay but nothing special. The huge TV seemed bigger than the room itself. The bed was large though and comfortable. The biggest disappointment was the bathroom. It was tiny. The bath towels were on some sort of scaffolding which held up the sink and could have done with being replaced a while ago. We thought we wouldn't be spending too much time in the room, so just put our bags down and went out to the fun of New York. We came home later and could hear absolutely everything which was going on in the halls and other rooms. The sound proofing obviously non-existent. As our package with the hotel contained buffer breakfast, we went to the restaurant for breakfast the next day. The staff were very nice. The food was okay but nothing special. We went out again and came back later in the day to have a drink in the bar. There were two females on at the time who seemed to be far more interested in talking to eachother than either clearing tables or serving people. My advice here is if you are in a hurry for the theatre or dinner don't go to the bar for a quick drink unless you go to the barman, who are very efficient. We gave up going to the bar in the Sheraton in the end and went elsewhere because we got fed up with waiting to spend money. We had a great time celebrating New Years in New York but sadly, it was because of the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas at Sheraton New York 2011”
Reviews.Author: ElaineRed
Reviews.Content: This is a very busy hotel but in a good location. Prior to arriving we did request a re-furbished room, but on arrival were put in an old room which was very tired with stained carpets, torn curtains and tatty furniture with a huge tv taking up a third of the room. We naturally complained, and after my husband tipped the recepionist $20 we were put into a refurbed room which was much better with a plasma tv on the wall. Check your mini bar on arrival as we were charged on our departure for drinks which we had not had and which are hugely expensive!! Staff were helpful generally although when leaving our bags on our last day with the bag check - I handed over the money ($3.25 per bag) and was expecting change when the guy just didn't come back!! Charming, so he got himself a good tip without it being offered!!

Reviews.Title: “If it's been a while, you need to try this one again.”
Reviews.Author: bbrig
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in December - in spite of being told by co-workers that this place is "dated". Clearly, they haven't been here in a while. Like a lot of Sheratons, this one has recently been renovated. I found the rooms to be very nice and modern. There is no such thing as a "value" in Midtown, but for this location, this hotel provides a very comfortable and modern room for the money.

Reviews.Title: “If your a 4 star I am the king of Spain .”
Reviews.Author: Tuckepoo
Reviews.Content: Room was so outdated and the carpet was filthy , paint was chipping off the doors , bathroom was tiny and had a toilet that barely flushed. I did stay in a "traditional" room. I never knew "traditional" was another word for "crappy". I stay @ sheratons all over the world and usually enjoy my stay. I can't believe they would let a massive property in the greatest city in the world go to the dogs. What a shame.

Reviews.Title: “big city, big comfort”
Reviews.Author: sheltolb
Reviews.Content: attending a big annual conference in nyc for the past few years is both exhausting and exhilerating! but this sheraton (not the primary conference location) does a good job in making the long-distance traveler feel comfortable, especially with the beds and linens. although the rooms are a bit small, they are fully equipped. i do miss the real coffee cups that were provided with the coffee-maker - now it's a paper starbucks cup with a one cup portion machine. the location is a winner - but when will the renovations be complete? the scaffolding has been in place outside for three years! the staff is quite professional, attentive and quickly responsive. i will continue to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and Outdated”
Reviews.Author: SoccerNerd
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sheraton for two nights on points and cash. Rating of 5-star is a joke...more like 2-star. --I am a SPG Gold and we were given an older room, extremely small, w/ chips on the furniture, Minibar did not open, etc. --Had to call more than once as room did not have wash clothes, the ones we did receive were stained. --The wind howls through the hallways and creates a cold draft under the doors. --Most importantly there is currently construction at this hotel (not disclosed as "special conditions"). The drilling from the room above us started at 7:30am and went as late at 10pm. This was not pleasant if you are looking to take a load off and rest during the day. Business travelers may no notice but tourists beware. If you are SPG or prefer Starwood stay at the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “GLIB Tour”
Reviews.Author: BoroniaBoy
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel and some rooms are in serious need of renovation. The service was good and breakfast was fine. Again the same internet issue - west coast versus east coast. All of our west coast hotels provided wireless internet access in the room free of charge. This and all other east coast hotels charge for that privilege. One word of warning - if asked to give your credit card details for access to wireless internet disconnect immediately - it is not legit. Hotels will add that cost onto your bill and not ask for those details so beware.

Reviews.Title: “Over all a really good stay!!”
Reviews.Author: CatharineS128
Reviews.Content: We found the sheraton Hotel and Towers to be a very good stay, rooms were nice and sizable, not too small or too big though. It was also very clean and the beds were so comfortable. The service was good. The best part about it for us was its location...2 minutes from time square, 5 minutes from central park. Empire state, public library, grand central station all 20 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “A Sheraton with no standards.... very disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: Jenny54321
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in to checked out, we have never been more disappointed in a hotel.... especially being a Sheraton. Arriving at 1 am after a 6 hour flight, we had to wait at the front desk for someone to appear to check us in. The first room we were given wasn't made up. Then we were given a room with the safe locked in it, and of course with traveling we had stuff to put in it, so had to wait for security to come open it. There was a soaking wet towel hanging in the bathroom, and no room service menu in the room. (We called for a menu, but it didn't arrive until after we had ordered and eaten already!) The only thing this hotel has going for it is the great location.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints here”
Reviews.Author: rayrayray
Reviews.Content: I won tickets to SNL so my wife and I took a shot on this place b/c of its location. We made the right decision. We were only in the hotel to sleep and occasionally recoup and the Sheraton was an excellent place to do that. Beautiful lobby. Great location (only a block from Letterman and Broadway, a few blocks from Times Square and also a short distance from Central Park). There's even a Subway entrance right next to the hotel. I was timid at first, but once I figured it out (Thank you Google Maps for the free app), I was moving around NYC like a pro. In the room, you will find complimentary Starbucks coffee a flat screen TV and a bed. We met a couple at Letterman from S.C. staying at the same place. They were placed in a construction area, informed the front desk and were upgraded to a renovated room for free. If you haven't stayed in NYC before, this is a good place to start. It was wonderful for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: tcz20000
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to everything. Walking distance to Time Square, the Broadway District and Central Park. There is a subway terminal right around the corner that you can catch a train right to the World Trade Center.

Reviews.Title: “Great view”
Reviews.Author: angelaperu
Reviews.Content: We had a great time, upgraded to a great room, nice service at the lounge , even though the hotel was packed most of the staff did their best to keep a smile while we had any requests.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Lonaki
Reviews.Content: It was the best week ever. Everyone in the hotel was so friendly, kind, generous and so helpful in every way possible. The Manager Angel was especially kind and so down to earth. I would recommend this hotel to anybody who is going to New York.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotels I've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: davidcc9
Reviews.Content: From the very beginning it was a bad experience, the front desk staff, arrogant, poorly trained with comments from the Front Desk Supervisor stating "it doesn't matter whether you are gold or platinum there are no rooms (even though we were confirmed to have rooms and they were prepaid in the Club Level). The rooms on the executive level are basic, small and no frills. Although advertised to have water bottles, the entire 3 day stay no waters were to be seen. The rooms on the executive floors were small and certainly not worth the $500+ per day that they charge. The club lounge was always crowded, the hotel operator, concierge or guest services operator had long waits to answer and one would eventually hang up because of the long wait. No one ever apologized for anything that went wrong. By the way the pool and spa are in a hotel across the street, so if you work out in their fitness center (it was nice) you have to get dressed and go across the street if you want to swim or take in a sauna after your work out. went to look at it and it was dirty and old. It was like the staff was doing the guest a favor for staying there and no one ever said "How may I help you". This hotel does not deserve to be a member of the SPG family. As a frequent traveler and a soon to be Platinum member of SPG, the company should be embarrassed to have this hotel as part of its offering of properties. The ENTIRE staff needs to be trained on customer service and hospitality services. This was 2 stays in one, first and last, at this hotel >

Reviews.Title: “Really.... Most spartan room I've been in”
Reviews.Author: Ken K
Reviews.Content: OK- Pricelined for a 1 night stay in NYC to see a play. Must have been the smallest room in the place (I hope, because if there are any others you are in for a sorry time). TV didn't work, nor did the AC and the place was hot in Dec! No kidding, there was 2 1/2 feet from the bed to the wall (room was 9 feet wide by 20 feet long) 1 picture on the wall, you coundn't sit in the bathroom and close the door. Very crowded lobby and public spaces, and don't enev get in a cab in this area at peak times, you'll just sit and run the meter. On check out, when in line a very nice and seeming helpful manager said if prepaid I could just drop my keys. Later I got a bill for $147 for mini bar and parking (didn't touch the mini bar and paid directly for parking) After multipel call to accounting (try it, you will laugh) finially insisted on speaking with a real person. Still waiting for the credit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: David R
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Sheraton NY Hotel and Towers - the rooms are very clean, comfortable and well renovated. The service was outstanding. We had two glitches with our room that were taken care of immediately. Kenny Imafidon the Front Desk manager was very considerate and responsive. Next time in NYC...we will be back here!

Reviews.Title: “Disastrous stay - no focus on guests”
Reviews.Author: leighcecilia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Sheraton the week between Christmas & New Year's, so I know that it's a busy week, unprecedented volumes of guests, blah blah blah. The hotel did not staff to accommodate the volume, however, so the line to check in took 40 minutes, followed by another 25 minute wait to drop luggage because our room wasn't ready! When I asked if they couldn't take the luggage from me during check in to avoid the line to drop it off, I was told No and walked away from with no further explanation. After that lovely introduction to the hotel, we learned that they had unadvertised renovations taking place throughout the entire hotel that started at 6:45 a.m. and continued until midnight. Not kidding. When I called to complain that the two rooms surrounding ours and the one directly above us seemed to be the site of jackhammer parties while my son was trying to nap, it took them SIX calls to connect me to anyone who'd actually answer the phone and talk to me about it. Their answer was that they'd told their third party partners about it (it was not posted on Hotwire), and that they felt it was reasonable to follow that timeline of construction. The result was my older two children (9 and 6 years old) literally crying in frustration as they tried to sleep at 10 o'clock after exhausting themselves sightseeing, and then I was awakened the next morning before 7 by hammering. Seriously unacceptable. Not to mention that the room was SO hot with no working air conditioning that all of us were tossing and turning from that all night, too. My take on this whole situation is this: I understand that hotels have to renovate (and our room at the Sheraton needed it), but the general approach was so flawed and so unfriendly to guests that I can't excuse the hotel for their approach. They didn't segment the construction at all to contain it to certain closed pockets of the hotel at a time, and their idea of which times were appropriate to be banging and hammering and drilling were so out of whack with reality that I couldn't believe it. We did get free parking to supposedly make up for it after nine total calls and a visit to the front desk where they could no longer ignore us ($90 for 26 hours of parking anyway!!) , but believe me, it didn't. Completely frustrating, disappointing, disastrous stay. This Sheraton, in my opinion, just doesn't care much about their guests.

Reviews.Title: “finally renovated”
Reviews.Author: ManiBagga
Reviews.Content: Hotel has recently been renovated. Rooms are open and very comfortable. The new decor is inviting and over all pretty good. Club lounge is nice if you are platinum. (the food is not as nice !!!).

Reviews.Title: “beware under construction”
Reviews.Author: Vasto5
Reviews.Content: Please be aware that this hotel is under construction. Very very noisy construction that goes on from 6 am until 9 pm. My biggest complaint is that at no time during our check in did the front desk staff give us any indication that the jack hammering would begin promptly at 6:00 am right next door to our room!!! She did however try to force us into paying for an upgrade. I think it was horrible customer service. Once we were aware of this and complained to the manager we were given free upgrade and starwood points.....we were not the only ones. I believe their policy is lets see what we can get away with. If you do choose this hotel INSIST on being accommodated in the renovated section of the hotel floors 29 and higher. If you can possibly get breakfast included it is a good breakfast but extremely expensive if you are paying for it out of pocket. The very good news is that it is perfectly located, close to everything. It is difficult to rate the rooms because our first room in the construction zone was clean but I can't say much else about it, the second renovated room was clean and very nice. I have stayed at the Sheraton before and did have a much better experience, I would stay there again I would just be better prepared at check in!!! Free internet is only available in the hotel lobby and the computers

Reviews.Title: “Worth it”
Reviews.Author: GrandeSanJuan
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times and will stay again whenever I have to go to New York. The have now remodeled. The location is perfect. The friendliness of the bar tenders and coziness of the lobby bar are great. Plenty of very good restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and Very Nice Staff!”
Reviews.Author: luv2goontrips
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at a Sheraton and we were impressed! The hotel is going through renovations but we didn't notice any noise from construction during our stay (week before Christmas). We were gone sightseeing, shopping, etc so we were really only in the hotel early in the mornings and during the sleep hours. The location was superb! We got to all of our main destinations very quickly (Central Park, Rockefeller Center, Times Square are so close). The staff that we encountered were extremely helpful and very friendly...even the car attendents were nice. The only cons were that when we arrived at noon there was only 2 employees working at the check in/check out desk and the line was huge. And our room was pretty tight with 2 double beds and I never like having a refrigerator in the room thats stocked with stuff the hotel provides. I prefer to have an empty refrigerator...that is more guest friendly. Overall we really enjoyed ourselves and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: DW3325
Reviews.Content: Second time visit to New York ...first time was in February...stayed at different hotel. This time we stayed at Sheraton NY December 31, January 1 and January 2. Millions of people in New York, but Sheraton made us feel at home. I would recommend this hotel. Excellent location in Time Square. We could see ball drop ACROSS the street from the hotel. COMMENTS: Transportation: Hotel parking was expensive $42.50 per day...PLUS all the taxes. Less than 24 hours of parking was $100.00. If seeking a true New York experience, I would recommend you take the mass transit system--bus and subway (N-Q-R yellow line) from/to LaQuardia Airport to/from hotel. Take OUTBOUND/INBOUND (make sure of your direction) M-60 bus (15 mins. to/from subway) $2.25 per person with a FREE transfer onto/off of the subway. Then take yellow line (Astoria Blvd.) to hotel (another 22 mins.), getting off at 57 St. and 7th Avenue. Hotel is just two SHORT blocks away. Trip for three was $6.75, instead of $55.00 for taxi ($45.00 plus tip). Fun experience, we felt very safe. ...... 9/11 Memorial: FREE tickets available from Sheraton concierge. The restaurant next store to the 9/11 Memorial ticket place called the Stage Door Deli (Vesey and Church Streets..bright red awning) was delicious, extremely friendly and reasonably priced [for New York]. ..... Hotel Concierge: Ask for FREE places to visit. Concierge was quick to spend "my" money. She tried SELLING me tickets for a water taxi tour ($26.95 per person) that would take us to the 9/11 Memorial, only to find out we could get free tickets each morning at the Concierge Desk. Hotel receives a certain amount of free tickets each day. Also, Concierge tried selling us a $1,700 package for New Years to see ball drop. We braved the weather and eight hours instead and for FREE saw the ball drop. Would only do it once though. I would rather walk around. If within three blocks of entertainment on New Year's Eve, you can hear performers. We were at least eight blocks away....two blocks from front of hotel toward ball drop. We COULDN'T HEAR A THING :( No New Year's Eve ombiance...not what you see on TV...only if three blocks away from ball drop. We just STOOD for eight hours talking to people around us. . . . Pets: Hotel is definitely a pet-friendly hotel (under 40 pds.). HOWEVER, no grass in Manhattan. Central Park was five blocks away. There were a few shrubs and little landscaping in front of hotel our dog used. Also, there is a grass area in front of the library a few blocks away. Bottom line, no grass. Stores do allow dogs, but we didn't see many animals, not like in Washington, D.C. and Chicago. We didn't expect this in New York. Chicago and Washington, D.C. are VERY pet-friendly including the outstide... Central Park: This place is wonderful. We walked and walked. Architecture was amazing (bridges, fountain, etc.). We walked for a good three hours with our dog. Ice skating available too. All in all, good trip. Would return to New York again and to the Sheraton. We used all Starwood points the first night, then 1/2 and 1/2 the second night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!!”
Reviews.Author: asidwell
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to New York and we found it absolutely fantastic! We arrived at 10pm on Friday 16th December.. The lobby was very busy, I think there were office parties going on and after a 8 hour flight, waiting 2 and a half hours in passport control and an hours drive from the airport I did find it quite overwhelming!! The staff on reception were very friendly and we got seen to immediately. Our room was a bit on the small side, as described as cozy but all we wanted it for was a pit stop so was perfect for us. We were on the 16th floor and the view from our room was amazing. The location was more than I could have asked for, it was central to everything. The room were cleaned every day & towels were changed too. I don't think the hallway was hoovered for the whole of our 5 day stay but that didn't bother me. The staff on selling tickets and tours were very friendly and arranged everything we asked for, the concierge was also very helpful and booked our car back to the airport for us. The bar was a bit on the expensive side but that's what you get at Times Square... Don't go to New York unless you like fast food, that's all your gonna get and it's pricey too. Overall an amazing holiday & we would deffinatly go back and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beat my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Pemelia
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 5 days at the Sheraton New York Hotel & Towers. I was met with kindness and friendly service every step of the way. My room was upgraded at no cost when I mentioned the special circumstances of my trip. I had a beautifully upgraded room on the 41st floor. Stellar views and a bed that felt like Heaven! Each staff member I met was courteous and extremely helpful. The location cannot be beat either. I will absolutely stay at the Sheraton when I return to New York!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Megan T
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to NYC and the Sheraton was fantastic! You cannot beat the location and the hustle and bustle of the hotel lobby adds to the great city experience. We opted for the $40 per night upgrade after booking through Expedia and it was well worth it. A small price to pay for a new, modern,clean room experience. Staff were all very friendly and welcoming. A quick ($30-40) cab ride from laguardia airport and steps away from central park and time square. Download a subway map to your handheld device and walk just steps outside the hotel to several subway platforms. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: BeeCee33706
Reviews.Content: This stay was our fifth or sixth stay at this hotel, for a business conference. Because the conference is scheduled just before Christmas every year, we have invited family members to come with us to New York a few of those times. This year, due to the number of family members coming with us, we elected to get a suite. It made sense to have a place where everyone could "light" in one place before or after excursions. We had been told back in the spring suites would not be available as phase two renovations would be underway. I called the local reservation person and told her why we needed the suite and she made it happen. I should also say we were only getting one other room there. She was competent and friendly. A few weeks before our stay, I called to ask her if we could have a small lighted Christmas tree in the living room of the suite. She said she had never had that request but would get back with me. It was approved; so I then asked her if I could ship the tree and ornaments directly to her, of course, she said. She emailed me when the shipment arrived so I would not "worry". Although this hotel's check-in time was 3pm, we arrived at the hotel at noon, fully expecting to leave our bags with the bell man, and we were told our suite was ready (not the other room, of course). When we got to the suite, the tree and ornaments were out of the shipping boxes and ready for us to decorate the tree. The reservations person (not sure I can give her name) called the room a short time after to be sure all was well. Everyone was incredibly impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Teeny tiny tired room”
Reviews.Author: ktmc25
Reviews.Content: First a disclaimer: we did get this hotel room on Priceline. However having said that, I have had very pleasant experiences with Priceline and Sheraton before. For instance the Sheraton New Orleans we won on Priceline had large clean rooms, excellent service, and a convienent location. This branch was a completely different experience. Starting with check in, which involved standing in line for 40 minutes only to be told a room was not available yet. Fair enough, it was only 12:30p. I showed my Starwood "preferred guest" card and asked if we could be assigned a King bed, the person helping us said no problem. So we checked our bag (another 10 min in line,) and went to enjoy the city. After coming back at 5:30p and waiting another 15 min in line, we were assigned a room (1104 I think). When we got to the room (one of four crammed into a dark corner of the floor) we discovered that it had two double (not even queen) beds. Now a hotel in NYC is a bit of a splurge for us - we usually stay with family or friends - but we wanted a "romantic night" in the city. Suffice it to say - double beds are fine for two friends traveling together but... When I tried to call down to the front desk I realized there was no direct line on our phone. I tried to get connected through "Guest Services" which was actually security, but just waited endlessly on hold. After trying one more time I gave up, since we had to get ready for a show at 7:00. Bed size aside, the room was teeny (par for the course in NY I know,) dingy,completely tired and lacking in most ameneties I've come to expect from a business class hotel. This hotel was actually rated as a 4* on Priceline which I realize does not mean the Four Seasons, but still I would give it 3* at best. Trust me, do not waste your money at this hotel! There are so many choices in NYC don't make the same mistake we did! Even if you are on a tight budget there are better options out there! Try betterbidding.com for help with "educated guesses" on Priceline bids.

Reviews.Title: “It was great”
Reviews.Author: ersl46
Reviews.Content: We stayed on a club level floor, which are the top floors. Our room was small but very nice, I didn't expect it to big because we were in the heart of NYC. We enjoyed using the club lounge for breakfast and cocktails. Many reviews are speaking about a noice problem, which was not noticed maybe because we were above the 40th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel located at the heart of Manhattan that is ideal location for your stay in New York.”
Reviews.Author: Rooneymic51
Reviews.Content: After reading trip advisor reviews I asked for and got a free upgrade to one of their renovated rooms. Yet compact it was ideal for 4 nights stay. Rooms comfortable with views of New York their maid service was very good with our linen changed on request as well as well stocked supply of towels and coffee etc. With only one criticism - do not look at or open the mini-bar because of the sensors below each item will trigger a charge just for picking it up. This can be checked on your large screen TV which was ideal. My summary cannot fault such a large hotel but do not book any trips or Broadway Shows via their desk as they charged me an additional £75 booking charge for 2 x Broadway Show tickets. For those who require show tickets take a 10 min walk to Time Square and book discount tickets from a Ticket Kiosk in the middle of Times Square. (look for the queue around the wedge shaped building - with viewing platform on top of it

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: waqasgondal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to times square and central park. Its clean and nice hotel. Service is good and rooms are comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location....but thats about ALL i have to say that is positive...”
Reviews.Author: JamesE339
Reviews.Content: Just checked into the Sheraton. I have stayed here before, long ago. I remember why i never picked this hotel for my many trips to NYC after this stay. First, let me stay that i average about 200 nights a year in hotels for the past 20 years. I am Platinum with Sheraton, and hold equal or GREATER status with Intercontinental, HIlton, Hyatt, Omni and Peninsula. THis is simply the worst experience i have had in more than 10 years. The check in here took my OVER 90 minutes.(closer to 2 hours) I tried to check in at 4, and waiting in the Platinum line for more than 45 minutes. (THis is supposed to be the expedited line for frequent guests...not so at this hotel). After the ridiculous wait, i was sent to check my bags, where i again waited for 20 minutes. Upon return at 5:30, i waited for more than 35 minutes to get my room key. I was repeatedly told "The hotel is sold out"....when i asked why things are taking too long. Wow. So the hotel is telling me that they cannot handle the rooms they have? They cant handle being 'full'? I thought that was the idea. Poor Sheraton. Who told their staff to say that? Speaks volumes for their training, in my opinion. The staff is simply horrible. Customer service, non existent. When i asked to speak to the front desk manager...he never appeared. He walked by, said he would be back...but never appeared. The line was angry. He didnt seem willing to help, and he should have been checking people in. All hands on deck is not a philosophy that this hotel understands. (Balding/african american man...front desk manager). The Gold/Platinum line was being used by anyone. No one at the hotel cared. "to hell with frequent guests...." They were understaffed at the front desk. They were understaffed to check bags. It was pure chaos. It was pathetic. If you are just looking for a room, and don't care about anything else..you will find clean room upstairs. It is one of the SMALLEST rooms in NYC, but it is clean...and the new furnishings are nice. For me, there are much...MUCH better alternatives for the same price. Even the mega Hilton down the street is much better than this. Larger hotel, more tourists....older rooms, but i would MUCH rather stay there. Want a really better trip? Try Hyatt. Even the Holiday Inns, Hampton Inns and such in the midtown area would be better than this. Yes, the hotel is undergoing a renovation. The aesthetics are nice. I am originally a small town, country boy. They have a saying on the farm: "You cant put lipstick on a pig". Such is the case here. New beds and carpet mean nothing. The heart of this hotel is terrible. I will never be back. I am smart enough to know better. Sheraton has been trying to improve its image for years. They have succeeded at SOME properties. In my opinion, they have failed miserable here. Now, as i write this message....i can hear EVERY word from the room next door. No, its not the guest...its the late night housekeeper, who is YELLING at staff down the hall. Its 10:00 pm...and she has been YELLING for more than 20 minutes (I am in room 4009....she is in the next room). Wow....again, how do they train people here? Do they?

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Hotel, Under Construction, got bitten by a BUG in our room....”
Reviews.Author: CanadaTravelWriter
Reviews.Content: Checked in on Dec 20 for 2 nights for Anniversary celebration. Front Desk agent was friendly and efficient. Following check in, room 1146 was completely filthy and run down definetly not what is dipicted in the pictures on the website nor worth the money. As we should have requested a different room we did not our mistake as the first night I was bitten in the neck by a foreign bug of some kind. The next morning all you could hear was banging and hammering from the construction. Again nothing mentioned at check in. The maids in the hallways wore masks and we heard the hotel workers speaking of air quality tests being done on our floor. Very concerning. Following the first day from the bug bite, I experienced extreme headache, followed by swelling and instant lumps on my head and neck. Upon contacting the Hotel to advise them of my situation, they haven't apologized or returned our calls to find out what was in our room, what the Hotel is willing to do, nothing. I just want to know what country the guests prior to us staying in the room where from, that's it. Now because of the lack of response we are contacting the NYC Health Dept as it is completely unacceptable. I have been prescribed meds and been to the emergency room. Getaway was ruined by the Hotel experience. I would not recommend to anyone visiting NYC.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great hotel, great experience.”
Reviews.Author: eamonncourtney
Reviews.Content: As a 5 star platinum owner and a platinum prefered guest for 11 years, my expections are very high, and we were not disappointed, from the moment we entered the lobby till we checked out 5 days later, We were upgraded and given an arrival gift and welcome letter, for frequent travellers as ourselves it is important to recognise loyality. The hotels' renovated lobby and bedrooms were made with good design, the rooms and bathrooms were clean and fresh, although a tad smaller than other hotel bedrooms but then again this is manhatten. The club lounge was very well laid out and breakfast and evening food was very tasty, I have to mention the club lounge staff and in particuliar VIP Manger Zoe Cohen, who went beyond her role to assist us with our next sheraton stay in vancouver, along with SPG. Supervisor Lacey Lazarus, thank you both. and all the staff at this great guest orientated hotel. e courtney. Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but spotty customer service !”
Reviews.Author: elleng8255
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers on December 23rd and Christmas Eve. After waiting on a long line to check in, we were encouraged to pay a $40.00 upgrade for a renovated room, which were available at 2PM versus 3PM for the non renovated room. Since we were tired after a long trip, we agreed to do so. The room, which was on the 26th floor, was quite nice, although a bit small. When I entered the bathroom, I smelled mildew, and sure enough the shower curtain was quite dirty. I reported this to a very nice maid on the floor and was told she would report it and have it changed. We went out and it was not done after returning late in the evening. I called first thing the next morning and several hours later a maintenance man did change the curtain. We were told it took so long because he was the only maintenance man for the entire hotel! Pretty hard to believe. Overall, we enjoyed our stay. The beds were very comfortable and room was attractive and clean, aside from the shower curtain.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: sylbanno
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a perfect location, speciallly for tourists. As othters reviews say, staff is friendly, no complains about changing money for smaller bills (what i did every day of my stay). The room is the regular size for NY.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for shopping & sight seeing in New York”
Reviews.Author: dexter41
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a week & it was perfectly located for shopping & 10min walk from central park, 5min walk from times square.Our hotel room was on the 40th floor and it was a decent size with the large comfy beds you'd expect from the Sheraton. They have starbucks on the ground floor & free wifi in the lobby. The service was efficient & the guest services guy was more than happy to point us in the direction of decent restaurants and gave us daily tips on how to avoid tourist traps. 5 things to do in new York other than the obvious; 1.buy some trainers they are the only way to get around on foot & the way to tell a native new yorker from a tourist!! 2. Century 21 it's has some great bargains 3. Try a deli chopped salad take away box & celebrity spot in central park 4. Macy's 10% discount card from customer services 5. Look out for big film screenings in the next street to the Sheraton

Reviews.Title: “Great New York Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: rosiee0916
Reviews.Content: My only possible complaint is that the room was pretty small, but hey, it is NYC and that was totally to be expected. Otherwise, we got an excellent price by bidding on the room and would not have gotten anything even remotely as nice for that price anywhere even near the city...much less smack dab in the middle! The location is phenominal. 53rd and 7th. Middle of it all. As a former New Yorker I did find it quite annoying to exit the hotel and step right into the mess that is central mid-town which I used to avoid like the plague as a resident. But for the trip, we were tourists once more. By being extra super nice and showing my SPG card (Starwood preferred guest), I was able to negotiate an upgrade to the newly renovated building. Which I am really glad we did because it still wasn't all that. I mean, it was nice and really clean. It just wasn't top notch. By far, still the best hotel I've stayed in in NYC was the Millenium HIlton down near Ground Zero. Simply by virtue of the fact that I refuse to spend more than $200 a night for a hotel, we have missed out on the truly upscale. But, It was so nice and the rooms were wayyy bigger. But if the question is...will we stay there again? Certainly, and more certainly if we get it for the same price. Actually, I was thinking of booking a bunch of rooms for my family and I when I return in May for graduation. So take that for what it's worth...I'd take my parents/grandparents/loved ones there too. Just get the renovated room.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is nice, but room disappoints.”
Reviews.Author: oldskool66
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located and has very nice common space. Unfortunately, my room was not particularly nice, even for normal Sheraton standards and bathroom was not cleaned properly from prior guest. Front desk was extremely accommodating and apologetic for the cleaning issue. Despite the issue, I will likely return given location and price relative to other area hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped, congested and cluttered!!'”
Reviews.Author: Hotel_Snob_reviewer
Reviews.Content: Lines everywhere, families camped out all over the lobby eating pizza and sandwiches like it was their living room. Service was horrendous waited 36 hours for security to unlock the door for our suite - housekeeping even yelled at security for being slow and lazy.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms but well done”
Reviews.Author: hugh s
Reviews.Content: just got back last night from a week in new york. and we stayed here and found the rooms to be small. Our first trip to NYC and wont be our last. had everything that you needed, just small, the bed was good and flat tv, nice enough shower and bathroom. just small and you could hear the people talking in the hallway. they were just talking if they were laughing you would wake and think they were in the room! we were on the 8th floor and then safe would not work so they moved us to 9th and this room was smaller yet! very nice location and staff was good. Did not spend much time there so it was alright. just the smallest room and most expensive room i have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Second time is NOT the charm”
Reviews.Author: BBuddy
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the hotel, we stayed for 3 nights. Our first stay was only overnight. We stayed at the Sheraton the second weekend of December and NYC was very crowded hence the hotel was booked solid. Apparently so solid that for the third time as a Gold Starpoints member I wasn’t upgraded to better room, in fact I probably got one of the most lousy rooms in the hotel. It was on the 17th floor which is unrenovated (Rm 1719). As many other reviewers have wrote here, the lobby is always busy. We got in the Gold/Platinium line but I think the regular line moved quicker. The room was tiny with only one bureau which had 3 small drawers and one of the drawers was taken up with the items from the mini bar. The desk was along the window and you could hear the guy next door talking on his phone if you were sitting at the desk. There wasn’t much room to get around the front of the bed. It appeared that the room was at least clean, that is until I had to use the bathroom. You pretty much had to close the door if you used the toilet whether you wanted to or not since the door would have hit your knees. The bathroom was very small. There were these disgusting brown splashes (use your imagination) on the side of the tub and behind the toilet tank that were never cleaned the entire time we were there. I just put one of the towels over the area on the tub since I wasn't about to clean it. They did provide us with new shampoo and conditioner every day (many hotels have stopped doing this) and did send up a bowl with a few pieces of fruit and a bottle of water thanking us “Gold” members for using the hotel. I would have rather had a bigger and cleaner room. Additionally, as a Gold member you are supposed to get a late checkout, 4 PM. When I called down on Sunday to confirm (the 4 pm checkout was listed on the folder with the key)the woman on the phone said “We’re full, you have to be out by 2” when I questioned the policy of the late checkout she said “Read your benefits on the web” very curtly. The biggest benefit of this hotel is its location to everything. Radio City is one block over, the subway is right around the corner and Times Square and Central Park is a few blocks away. The bed was very comfortable and one of the only reasons we continue to stay in Starwood properties. However, the bed alone is getting to be not enough since service had really started to decline. I would probably not stay here again if I was to get another unrenovated room.

Reviews.Title: “recent stay in NYC for Xmas Holiday”
Reviews.Author: mbegan58
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here 1 night while seeing a Broadway show. Location is great , however rooms are small and you can't control the heat well. We had to open the windows since we were hot. Also Fireplace in lobby which we liked to sit by during our last stay wasn't working. I believe it was gas and they said it wouldn't work for a couple of weeks. This is inexcusable If I wasn't on points I would've been upset.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: catx
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights with my 10 year old son for annual Xmas father-son trip. First impression is the lobby. Reminds me of a train station, people and bags everywhere. I like busy but this is something else. More like unpleasant. When checking in I get a feeling that the staff is more important than the customers. Nothing specific, just this feeling that they couldn't really care less if I'm there or not. The room is very small, two beds and a bathroom, not even room for a dresser, a 2 foot space between bed and minibar. It is clean, the furniture is nice, the beds are exceptionally comfortable but it is one of the smallest rooms I have ever stayed in and I have over 1500 nights in hotel rooms all over the world. The bathroom is microscopic, nice marble sink and very clean but extremely small. We had Club room access, it is on the 44th floor, so we went there for complimentary breakfast. It was overcrowded, the buffet was a mess, very unappetizing, no tables available, people everywhere. We decided to go to Starbucks instead. We went back in the evening, same scenario. I ordered a glass of Chardonnay, it was $12. Could have had better wine for less in the bar across the street. I have been in Starwood Club rooms all over the world, this is the first one I haven't liked. You may think that this is just the complaints of someone not used to staying in NYC but I have stayed many times at the Westin which is less than 5 minutes away with none of the negative experiences of the Sheraton and for only $60 more per night. The Sheraton isn't bad, it is just not good.

Reviews.Title: “Hope to Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: Traveler3933
Reviews.Content: We were very satisfied with our 2-night stay at the Sheraton. We had stayed a few years ago and it was fine, but it has improved. Thanks to other TripAdvisor reviewers we knew to request a renovated room. We had to wait an extra hour, but it was well worth it. Our room was large by New York standards and was very comfortable. The bedding was awesome. When we entered the room we were disappointed to find that the toilet had been used and not flushed, but hotel staff quickly came and cleaned the bathroom. Otherwise the room was very clean. They offered to move us, but we really liked the room so we stayed. The location of the hotel is extremely convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Best of New York City & Sheratons World Wide”
Reviews.Author: lnANutshell
Reviews.Content: 2nd trip to NYC. Stayed Friday/Saturday. Was a Clinton Convention going on but it was intimate and personal service at the Front Desk. The Concierge servie was Beyond helpful...they have it down to a science...and are "forward thinkers"...especially that tall dark handsome Italian fellow...his name espcapes me but he loves his job. Fast Service...The follow-up at the concierge and front desk is absolutely impecable. Rooms were Warm and Comfortable in colours and in feel. The view was the perfect NYC view. Bed were amazingly comfortable...they just enrobed us. The Bathrooms were spectacularly clean and spacious and classically modern. You felt the aura of NYC in the lobby...while truly busy, also comforting with the link and the bar...in the morning the bar area was the breakfast knook and in the evening it was where you wanted to be. I went with a friend who came from england. Her first time for NYC...and this is where i wanted her to stay....She loved it. Oh....and you NEVER wait for an elevator - lots of them and fast. Everyone has a wonderful story at the hotel about their city... Sheraton New York & Towers.....You set the bar high! Thank you for making our experience The Best of NYC & Sheraton World Wide Jo-Anne

Reviews.Title: “Guest rooms recently renovated”
Reviews.Author: Rumbera1967
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night attending a convention. I was pleasantly surprised by the recently renovated rooms, which was spacious @250-300 sq feet. The room was well-apppointed and the bedding was comfortable. I was on the 30th floor and away from the street traffic. This will be a place I recommend to clients and out-of-town guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for tour groups... which is why there are so many”
Reviews.Author: senti2comun
Reviews.Content: Great location, but this hotel is about as impersonal as it gets. I arrived at 6pm and still was not able to check into my room. Staff to their credit gave me a Wifi voucher (oh yes, you pay for internet in this hotel - and slow internet at that). The lobby is continually filled with tour groups, rooms are nothing special, breakfast is eaten more or less in the middle of the lobby (at least that is what it feels like) and its expensive - better to find one of the local delis - there are plenty around. This hotel is designed for volume tourism and corporate block-bookings for Starwood members on miles award programmes, and it feels like it. Its not particularly good value for money, so look elsewhere if you want something more personal.

Reviews.Title: “great location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: SecretAgentReview
Reviews.Content: Ive been coming to this property for many many years. While I saw a decline and the removal of the butler lounge on the top floor it seems they are trying with the latest room renovations. The location is midtown excellent and walking distance to many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “The Location Trumps any Negatives”
Reviews.Author: VinnyDrysdale
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel helped to make our trip to New York fabulous. Not only is it walking distance to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and Central Park (we also hoofed it to Macy's, the NY Public Library, and the Empire State Building, but that may be too much for some folks), but a subway entrance is right next to the hotel on the SE corner of 53rd and 7th Ave. We took the E train to the 9/11 Memorial. Also, it proved to be a great location because we had David Letterman tickets and the Ed Sullivan Theater is about half a block away. The other thing that helped with our experience is that I got the hotel from 12/11 to 12/14 for $150 a night on Priceline. However, after reading some reviews, I upgraded to a superior/king room for $40 a night. The room was still fairly small, but it was recently renovated and the bed was comfortable. The worst negatives are that 1) there were cup lids behind the desk upon which the coffee maker sets, 2) after checking in, I was told the room would be ready at noon, I returned at 2:30PM and was then told, somewhat rudely, it wouldn't be ready until check-in time, 3PM, and 3) they wanted $15 a day for internet access (I was able to get on the LondonNYC wifi for free). But given all these negatives, I think it will be my first choice the next time I go to Manhattan because of the convenience of its location. Lastly, the lobby is quite pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great NY Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica S
Reviews.Content: I would recommend Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers to anyone traveling to NY! It's right in the middle of Times Square so you can walk to everything, very convenient. Also, the service is fantastic. My husband and I were celebrating our anniversary and the restaurant we had reservations at didn't have a table for us. We went back to the hotel very upset and talked to the concierge. We spoke to Lazaro Hernandez and he was fantastic. He called ahead to another restaurant and requested a quiet table. When we got to the restaurant, they had a table set aside for us in the back with rose petals on it. Thank you Lazaro! The Sheraton is really great if you want to truly experience NY! We've been there a few times now and have not been dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Large hotel. Great location. Very convenient.”
Reviews.Author: Pi31415
Reviews.Content: I really like this Sheraton hotel. It's a direct subway ride from JFK, very convenient for midtown and with the advantages and disadvantages of a large hotel. The rooms are cosy - and very nicely renovated, the club lounge is a real boon and the basement gym is a great alternative to the preferred jog around Central Park. Downsides? Hundreds of people use the 12 elevators (and the club lounge) in tourist 'rush hour' - beware, you can be standing for a long time. The renovated gym has gotten rid of the steam room and sauna - a great shame (and an error of judgement, in my view). As with all NY hotels, rates vary according to demand and can be reasonable one week and off the scale the next!

Reviews.Title: “Its Average”
Reviews.Author: stephanie b
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night with my Mom and daughter on 12/12/11. The location was great. Walking distance to Rockefeller, Times Square, Macys, Bryant Park, etc.. Would I say this is a 4 star hotel? No. The foyer of the hotel is beautiful. The hallways leading to the rooms are outdated and dirty. The room itself while outdated was quite clean. We were on the 12th floor so according to other reviewers maybe this room was just not renovated yet. We were able to check in at 1:00 with no line and our room was ready. The following day we needed to check our luggage and it does cost $3.25 per bag. (I've stayed in many hotels for business and pleasure and this was an absolute first for me.) Parking is absurd. Last year we stayed at The Warwick and parked 1.5 days for $60. The Sheraton for 1.5 days cost me $90! Yikes! Would I stay again? Sure, but not for the full price. I got a great deal on Priceline for this trip. If I paid full price my review might not be so nice. This trip I got what I paid for (a 3 star hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Experience it for yourself. Its worth it”
Reviews.Author: traveling_gal801
Reviews.Content: I always read TripAdvisor prior to my travels and try to post. I travel, for both business and pleasure, and spend over 75+ nights in hotels a year. While this may not make me a road warrior I do feel I can compare hotels fairly. After reading the prior posts, I was dreading the stay at this hotel and considered making a change. Because I am a Starwood Platinum member, I contacted Starwood to make a change of location and explained that the reviews on TripAdvisor were primarily negative. After considering other properties and with our dates, there were no other properties that fit our timeline for this trip, so we gambled, kept our reservations, and it paid off for us. I paid a lot of attention to compare our experience with those of others. We arrived at apx 9PM and were prepared for a long check in line. From curbside to in our room was less than 15 minutes. The check in was smooth and uneventful. I took the tip from another TripAdvisor poster and we took our own luggage up, which really did save a lot of time. Upon arrival, I requested a refrigerator, and additional pillows. They were at our door in apx 10 minutes. We had a renovated room , with a king bed, on the 43rd floor. The room was not huge, but by New York standards (and I have stayed in much smaller NYC rooms) was not small. We had plenty of room to move around. Room was very clean, bed linens were a dream, and there was a long multifunctional desk, dresser, valet along one wall, with a large flat screen TV, and mini bar. Closet space was a bit short, but our suitcases fit under the desk very nicely. Bath was small but enough counter space for items. Bath was extremely clean and plenty of towels were provided. We asked for additional towels, and they were replaced daily. Loved that the bedside lamps had power ports. Great for charging phones. Our room faced 57th street and was very quiet. We also had access to the club lounge which was very nice. Both continental breakfast and evening appetizers are served. Cash bar available in the evenings. For us it was plenty. The lounge is available for drinks and small snacks (usually fruit) 24 hours a day. We did find the lounge could be crowded, and I feel that a small reminder such as a sign should be added, to the lounge, to remind people to be aware of their children. Because there are drink dispensers, open food, toasters and I feel that children should be assisted. It wasn’t horrible, but generally everyone wants to get on their way in the morning and some of the children tended to experiment with the offerings. As a platinum member, wireless internet access was available to me in the lounge and in my room. Great signal with no issued. The lounge was fully staffed and the staffers were extremely courteous, especially given that they were very busy. I did observe long lines at times in the lobby, mostly during late morning and late afternoon. There was a convention that came and went during our stay. We saw a dramatic change during and after the convention was over. Because it was a business convention the lobby bar and “The Link” (Sheraton’s complimentary computer access area) were packed. After the convention, both areas were easily accessible. Location as previously mentioned, by others, is great. Subway, cab, bus, walking, all easily managed and near attractions. Business center in the basement was great as we had to weigh our luggage before heading to the airport. Check out: our folio was delivered to our room as always, we just had to leave the room, no formal check out was required. We did find the staff to be bit stealth, but when called upon they were there immediately and with a smile. We had no issue with any services. There was construction going on, however we could only tell because there was scaffolding at the front of the hotel, we never saw, or heard, anything that indicated work was in progress during our stay. Would I recommend this hotel? Absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the only reason to stay here”
Reviews.Author: BettendorfTraveler
Reviews.Content: I can't think of any other reason to stay here other than the location, which is superb - short walk to virtually every Broadway theater, and close to Fifth Avenue shopping. Customer service is not in this hotel's lexicon. Arrived at the Starwood Preferred desk at 2:45 pm, only to be told the room was not ready - I had to leave and return a short while later and wait in line all over again. (I guess magically dozens or even hundreds of rooms became instantly available fifteen minutes later.) Two of the elevators going up to the first 20 floors were not working that day - the congestion in the lobby and at the elevators was horrible. One evening I returned from my meetings to find four or five housekeeping trolleys parked in my hallway - with luggage, it would be difficult to negotiate the pathway. Not a sign of any housekeeping personnel servicing the rooms. The situation had not changed five hours later, so I called Guest Services to complain. Instead of an apology, I received attitude. At $500 per night for an ordinary room, I expect something better than attitude. The room was clean, somewhat on the small side; the bathroom was even smaller. The showerhead could not be adjusted up or down or even sideways (apparently everybody is the same size) nor could the spray be adjusted. Nice HD TV with only a fair choice of channels. Windows needed washing months ago. Several computers in the lobby for guest use with a reasonable amount of free internet time, but frequently they were all occupied, all too often with children playing games. Bar in the lobby is pleasant, but with relatively few tables considering the size of the hotel - was never able to find a free table to have a drink at the end of the day despite a four-day stay. Having the bar immediately next to the computers is probably not a good idea. I have previously stayed at the Westin Times Square, but switched because of a somewhat better location. Big mistake - should have stayed at the Westin, where the rooms are bigger and nicer and the staff only rarely demonstrate attitude. Will likely not return here except under duress.

Reviews.Title: “rooms”
Reviews.Author: katakam
Reviews.Content: its a great experience, rates are fine, very class and neat rooms. good service. provided good information about city and tourist places, very comfortable beds. prime location and very near to shopping. excellent room service, very good breakfast and food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: williamsm
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Sheraton in late November, 2011. I was on the 33rd floor in one of the remodeled rooms. The location of the Sheraton was perfect for using the subway and walking to my destinations. It was unusually warm that week and if I had a complaint it was that the ac didn't get the room cool enough. I sleep better in a cool room and with the heavy down on the bed it was too warm so I had to tear the bedding apart to use only the sheet. The room was exceptionally quiet though which I didn't even notice until having to move to another hotel for one night due to circumstances having nothing to do with the Sheraton. That hotel was so noisy due to street noise and my room didn't even face the street. Yay Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect the best”
Reviews.Author: cozama1013
Reviews.Content: Just spent three days at this Sheraton, I normally stay at the Westin Times Square, but they were booked up. I've been Starwood Gold for a decade, and when I normally arrive early after a long flight and go to the reception desk and ask if there is a possibility to check in early, every time the person would say let me check and see if any rooms are available. Not here, his immediate response was they were booked up and nothing was available and I should check back at three and maybe later!!!!!! Exact statement. This was happening at 12:45pm, they weren't even busy at the counter. Totally failed at making me feel welcome. I did come back at 2:30 and a much nicer person, said let me check on rooms and was able to put me right into a room. Hotel apperance was nice, but was very crowded, you couldn't find a seat to be able to use your computer. The area was inadequate for that need, because the lobby and a restaurant in the lobby were the only place you had WIFI. When they say high speed internet in every room, better have the capability to plug in an ethernet cable, otherwise you're out of luck. This hotel better understand huge numbers of people have pads and netbooks, no ethernet plugs, very inconvient. On the plus side, they did offer 30 minutes of internet free every day, that was nice. The conceirge people were very nice and helpful when I asked any questions, and put me in touch with some very good restaurants. Rooms were very, very small. So small that they couldn't put the TV at the foot of the bed, it was located seven feet to the left of the bed. The room was just alright. Besides being small, bathroom was old, the shower was very weak and was a disappointment. It was also very warm. When I called about how to get A/C turned on, she told it's winter and no A/C was available, but the room was 80 degrees (my travel alarm has a temp indicator). She told me to open a window. The windows did open, and was able to get the room to cool down a bit, but the noise is incredible, so you couldn't leave them open. The wife and I stipped all the blankets off and slept with just he sheet. We're from the south and use to hot, but not in the bedroom! This hotel is very business oriented, and I don't consider it suitable for people who are on vacation, it just doens't set an atmosphere for a casual theatre get away. The rooms are meant only to sleep in. I have always liked to have a nice room to spend restful time in when in between shopping and site seeing, this room (1933) was a real disappointment and took away from what should have been 3 wonderful days. Well this is my opinion, I could be wrong!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room with a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cassieblut1
Reviews.Content: It has been 5 years since we stayed at this hotel. I returned for a reunion and found that the room improvements are impressive. Though somewhat smallish, the room was adequate for 2. The furnishings were trendy and a large flat screen TV was appreciated. As previously mentioned, the hotel has an outstanding location between Central Park and Times Square. It was also an easy walk to the NBC studios, St. Parick's Cathedral, Radio City and more. Many nice and less pricey (than the hotel) reataurants were located within walking distance. Access to multiple subway lines was easy.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay.”
Reviews.Author: tallden
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before we went on a cruise to New England. We were on the 40th floor. The room was bright and well presented. The beds were very comfortable and clean. The hotel is very near to Times Square and Broadway. Plenty of restaurants and bars are within walking distance. Overall a well run and clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overcrowded”
Reviews.Author: carolinacastro90
Reviews.Content: We had an awful experience at this hotel. We booked it expecting a four star hotel which for us meant reliable, attentive service with clean rooms and a nice environment. Throughout the entire stay the hotel was clearly overbooked. When we got there we had to do about a 40 min line to check into our rooms, it took about ten to fifteen minutes for the elevators to come to the lobby since most of them were broken. The hotel was clearly too run down and in lack of maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “Location,location,location”
Reviews.Author: Gbuyer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for over 20 years. Staff is always pleasant and rooms always clean. It is by far the best location in midtown.

Reviews.Title: “A year makes a difference”
Reviews.Author: withanie
Reviews.Content: Last year, husband and I had a terrible time at this Sheraton on our annual trip to NYC - a year has really made a difference. Room heat issues solved, elevators worked everytime, check in crowded but handled efficiently, overall a positive impression of staff. This year we upgraded to club level and it was worth it. Breakfast was good, cocktail hour a nice add, but really appreciated ability to get coffee / tea whenever, allowing us to avoid the morning lines in the bar. Club lounge set-up could be improved to enhance seating - very crowded all the time, and could use more staff for clearing tables and maintaining food and beverage tables. Running out of bowls at breakfast a miss. A second bartender would help in the evenings - had a 15 minute wait to order 2 glasses of wine.
