Club room a misnomer - very small but renovation has improved space usage. Room was clean and functional, location quiet. As SPG members glad last year's problems resolved.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, undergoing renovation.”
Reviews.Author: tatkei
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for business. Convenient location right next to time square, close to metro station. Rooms are fine, free wifi in lobby like every other Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Sheraton of the 70s -- Not bad.”
Reviews.Author: DrLuv
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here before and enjoyed it more before. The location is superb! Despite being only a few blocks north of Times Square, it is actually fairly quiet. The room was clean enough (unlike the Hyatt Grand Central). Had I been expected to pay the full $300/nt rate, I've have been beyond livid and someone would have been in big trouble. Apparently, they are remodeling and turning it into a part hotel/part condo property. It certainly has potential and one could do a WHOLE lot worse in NYC!! The lobby has nothing to get excited about and unless you are paying top dollar or are an ELITE Starwood member, you can't get into the lounge up high. The room was TINY! Barely any space to move around and the 2 of us bumped into each other more than once. The biggest complaint was that the heater/air circulating unit never worked, unless you wanted heat. We couldn't shut it off!! That was indeed frustrating to come back to a hot room. A couple of times we had to prop the door open simply to get the air moving into the room. Someone had totally rigged a standard air return cover (from Home Depot) across the vent holes and half screwed it down. It wasn't flush and looked completely slapped together, but it functioned and I give them 1 star for creativity ;-). All in all, it was "ok". We kept reminding ourselves that we were there for the sights and NOT the room. That made it acceptable. Otherwise, it would be pretty irritating. I would sum up the hotel this way... if you can get a deal on the rate, go for it. If you are paying $200 or more, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: AnnMarie9583
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend stay. Great location! Stayed in a newly renovated room. Love the bed! Had breakfast one of the mornings at the hotel.. Staff couldn't have been any more accomodating. Would have given you a 5 review but 1. Concierge at checkin ( Mike) was very very rude. fyi He shouldn't be delaing with your customers.. 2.. Cost me $26.00 to store my bags a few hours. I have never been charged for this any where else..

Reviews.Title: “Renovation makes this is a great option in NYC”
Reviews.Author: aussielivingintheUSA
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Sheraton NYC no less than 15 times. Over the last 12 months they have been making tremendous (and much needed) progress on their renovation. The result (still going) makes this a great choice when hitting NYC. The entry, lobby and front desk is sleek and modern with marble. There is a restaurant called The Market - not bad, but essentially just gourmet burgers and no other options. in the morning the bar offers limited coffee, espresso and some very light breakfast... if you are a SPG Platinum Member who reserve a club room you get access to the also very new Sheraton Club Lounge on level 44 - which has some great views over NYC including Central Park. It is open from 6am to 11am for breakfast (cereal, toast, pastries, coffees, teas, juice, fruit - no hot options) it is then open all day and night with complimentary canapes from 5pm to 8pm with a bar (drinks are pretty expensive - only suggestion is that instead of say $8 for a beer, they charge say $5?). The renovated rooms are done very nicely. Very high and large beds and modern decor. Do be careful as not all rooms have been renovated.. I believe just the top 20 floors but check with the hotel. The hotel also has a huge conference facility, business centre and free internet in the lobby. The hotel is in a great location on 53rd St and 7th Avenue - with Central Park only 5 blocks away and Time Square 3-4 blocks the other way and Rockafeller only 2 blocks. I would highly recommend this hotel for business or family.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated or not renovated makes all the difference”
Reviews.Author: JLSManlius
Reviews.Content: I like the hotel, and the location, the Link lounge, and the service is exceptional. But, the real issue for this hotel is simple - some of the rooms are not renovated, and those that are not did not have functional cooling during a pretty warm week last week. Opening the window while awake is fine, but trying to sleep near Times Square with an open window? Forget it. When I complained, they had a fan delivered to the room, which made it bearable, but still less than ideal. The non-renovated rooms are also VERY small. Fine for a business trip in and out, but not great for a 3 day/2 night stay. Though functional, the Internet service in the non-renovated space was by Ethernet cord only and not wireless. Fine for the computer, not fine for the iPad. Bottom line - be sure to ask for a renovated room, or don't stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: leek99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first trip to NYC for our 2011 Macy's TG parade. The rooms were just recently renovated. The room was small but you expect that from NYC. We are Starwood people so we had some amenities that others might not get. We ate the the member's lounge which was very nice. The trip was nice since every was so close. BTW we went cross the street to use the pool. My kids love to swim.

Reviews.Title: “The charm of an airport convention hotel in Midtown Manhattan.”
Reviews.Author: SFBearTraveler
Reviews.Content: There is nothing overtly wrong with this hotel. Its big, clean, centrally located, and in the midst of a major renovation that makes the most of its generally small guest rooms. The beds are comfortable and the staff comes through, even if not overly effusive in their enthusiasm. If you’re going for a theater weekend and are looking for a very convenient place to lay your head between shows, I give this place two big thumbs up. The hotel is a 10-minute walk from any Broadway stage as well as other sites like Rockefeller Plaza, David Letterman’s Ed Sullivan Theater, and the MOMA. If you’re on business and would rather slit your wrists than face the crowds of Times Square every night, I would suggest you find other accommodations. The furnishings in the renovated rooms have been smartly scaled to fit the cramped quarters. The minibar and in-room coffee are tucked into a cleanly stacked corner unit. I have to give a shout out to Starwood for the best in room coffee in the industry. Their single serving Starbucks packets are convenient and absolutely delicious! The long dresser/desk provide adequate working space without overwhelming the room. The generous 40” flat screen TV is wall mounted and out of the way. Like its cousin, the Westin Heavenly Bed, the Sheraton bed is very comfortable and I slept like a baby. I’d skip the hotel bar. It’s crowded, pushy & loud. Oh, and the prices – I paid $20 for a vodka & soda – meh! Walk 2 blocks over to 9th Ave. and enjoy the taverns and culinary renaissance of Hell’s Kitchen. You’ll thank me! They offer a very well equipped and clean gym on the lower level but be aware that hotel guests must pay $10 per day to use the facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality experience”
Reviews.Author: Neil R
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at this hotel. The location is absolutely amazing, walking distance to so many attractions. Having read that the hotel is undergoing renovations, I asked at check-in for a renovated room. The receptionist was very obliging and this request was fine. My room was a good size, nice and clean. I was attending FICO World conference, and was very, very impressed by the conference facilities. The room bill was picked up by work so I can't comment on the value. I was a little bit disappointed that there was a charge to check each bag, as checkout was midday and we were not leaving until 5pm, we had little choice. Other than that, very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton could have been better”
Reviews.Author: BlairsSanAntonioTX
Reviews.Content: Pro. Location location location. Bed queen comfortable Con. Room light didn't work by bed. No control of heat. Room hot. Elevators full. Kids rode up and down until management ran them. Shades on window were ripped to see outside .

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, and excellent Customer Services”
Reviews.Author: SST07
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just came back from New York today. We stayed at Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers from Monday November 28 - Thursday, December 1. For classical music lovers, Carnegie Hall is three short blocks up from the hotel; it takes less than 5 minutes. It is not far from Lincoln Center either; we took M104 bus from 8th avenue and M7 and M104 from Lincoln Center. Our room was newly renovated; furniture arrangements were functional and very comfortable; bathroom layout is also very good. During our stay we had a few extra requests from customer services and the response was very prompt. We even received follow-up calls from the customer service to ensure our request was delivered to our room promptly. Sheraton made our New York stay a very pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: fiddlersu
Reviews.Content: We had a good stay at the Sheraton NY in midtown. The location is excellent for Broadway and Central Park south entrance. We stayed in the Club level room and had access to the lounge which provided a good breakfast. (Continental). It was NY Marathon weekend.. so the whole city was packed with tourist/runners. All the diners were crowded with lines out of door.. so this alone was worth the $50 upgrade fee we paid which also give us access to the good gym and internet access in our room. The lounge was on the 50 floor with nice skyline and partial central park view. The room itself was well designed and beds were very comfortable. We use mostly points so can't vouch on value. The only down side was the check in process took quite a while..

Reviews.Title: “Great Tourist Spot”
Reviews.Author: abomb526
Reviews.Content: I live in NJ but decided to use SPG points to stay in NYC for a wedding. The location is great and yes the lobby is pretty PACKED but check-in is easy and we upgraded to a cub room. I think it is good to do this ONLY if you have more than 2 people, the $50 cost was too much for a couple if you have a family you can save but right outside the hotel is a diner and carts you can get a cheap cup of coffee at...the rooms are not different in size or quality, they are just on a higher floor. The room was comfortable, good for NYC (rooms are known to be very small). I would stay again, like that the location & is only 5 min.. to Central park since I ran there. The only thing I was say is the loaction is not ideal for locals/business travelers as the surrounding Times Square is Packed. It takes forever to leave or catch a cab but the subway line is literally right next to the hotel so this helps a lot if you are traveling for a cheaper mode of transportation and are in town to sightsee.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Locations and Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mendy1133
Reviews.Content: I think Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers is one of the best located hotels in New York. Everything is in a walking distance Times Square, Central Park, 5th Avenue and all the shopping area, the Moma Museum. The Lobby area is a mess at every hour. Regarding the rooms, these are large and the beds are so comfortable!!! Nice space and nice table close to the window for nice breakfast with view on the skyscrapers. Suggestion: bring the luggages by yourself in the room and don't ask for a help to the bell men, it will take a long time to be delivered. It was my second time in that hotel and all my staying was perfect, from the arrival to the departure.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: Thailand_Nov2008
Reviews.Content: Step out of the lobby and turn left - Times Square, turn right - Central Park, around the corner - Rockefeller center - you get the idea... The rooms measure up to Sheraton high standards. Both Mayra (hope I got it right) at check-in desk and the concierge were very helpful. Parking is a problem, but hey - you are in New York! We'll be back...

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving Visit”
Reviews.Author: GoodAdvice47
Reviews.Content: Since I stay in different hotels every week, it is easy to compare NYC hotels. This hotel is an excellent location for walking to several sites including: Central Park, Broadway shows and Times Square. The lobby is always busy with lots of families this time of year. The hotel always a line to C/I and C/O. The rooms are standard rooms unless you upgrade to a suite which are nice. The hotel staff in the Club Lounge failed to address the multiple children constantly running around and playing games on the computers for hours. So if you needed to print your boarding pass or like a quiet getaway, the club lounge at this time of year is not the place. The best part of the stay was the information provided by the concierges. The worst part was the way the hotel handled guests returning from the parade back to the rooms. The security guy funneled everyone between three tables for an hour and several people were crushed or injured due to their poor crowd control system. A better option would have been a queue line waiting for the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel front desk clerk Ahmed needs a lesson in manners”
Reviews.Author: louiebmayer
Reviews.Content: I am really disappointed that I am writing this review because I used to like staying her for the central location on Manhattan but after my last time here I would look else where. I made a reservation hold the Starwood card and travel 7 times a year to NYC but the clerk Ahmed was out of rooms with a king bed and tried to pawn off 2 double beds on me. I told him that I had a reservation and that I could wait until later but he told me they were sold out on king beds. I asked him why did I have the reservation for one in my hand and he kept yelling at me that I didn't. I didn't take to kindly that the desk clerk was shouting at me and spitting while I had a printed reservation in my hand and he was telling me that I could not have the room I reserved at any time during my stay. So much for customer service..... I walked out and went across the street to the Hilton got a larger and cleaner hotel for the same price as a walk in with the bed that I wanted. I notified the manager of the Sheraton a few days later and he told me he would take care of me personally on my next stay. I emailed him and he gave me a highr price than that of any of the websites with hotel deals with a higher star rating......go figure that one out. In today's economy when less people are traveling look at a better hotel than this. NYC has so many hotels

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Crappy hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Netlizard
Reviews.Content: This is a very low end hotel. The lobby is a zoo & there is minimal "service" They even charge you $3.25 per bag to hold your luggage. It's a disgrace. Our room wasn't ready when we checked in but the clerk said it was clean & just needed to be checked by a supervisor. So we went to lunch & returned an hour later. It still hadn't been "checked" but they gave us keys anyway and we went upstairs. The room was clean but there were serious temperature issues. It was like a sauna & we were sweating all night. The hotel room door did not meet the ground-there was over and inch of gap letting in all the light & noise. I wound up stuffing a hand towel into the space to block the light. I would NOT stay here again. Even though the room was the cheapest we could get Thanksgiving weekend ($249) it was a lousy stay.

Reviews.Title: “Renovations Help a Lot”
Reviews.Author: Twain34
Reviews.Content: We booked Club floor rooms using Starwood points. The rooms were a big improvement since the last time we stayed. These had already been renovated with tasteful furniture and a great bed. Even better, there was a couch that doubled as a cot; excellent for a kid to sleep on with no cost. And the location was GREAT for the Thanksgiving Day parade; just walk out and you're there (though the parade route will go through 6th Ave next year). Even nicer was the fact that they had boxed breakfasts for the Club floor guests to take and scope out a spot for the parade at 6:45 (get there even earlier if you want front row). But the place does have it downsides. Parking at $50 for 24 hours. Stay an extra 5 minutes and its another $10. And though there was a "preferred guest reception" desk for Gold members, it was understaffed (the regular line was quicker on two occasions) and there was no big welcome. And it's huge. We've stayed here twice and the new renovated rooms put it back on my list for consideration if Starwood is involved. But it could use a little polish on the service now too.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not too impressed”
Reviews.Author: nyclover999
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights just before Thanksgiving. We booked the room through Priceline and when I called to request a renovated room, was told I would have to pay $40/night to upgrade (contrary to some reviewers who received complementary upgrades to renovated rooms). This was the first time that I was ever told I had to PAY to upgrade a room! Not willing to take a chance on the non-renovated rooms (I had read too made poor reviews), I paid the upgrade fee. We arrived at noon, check in was a breeze. The staff was very impersonal. During our 2 night stay, not one staff member even looked at us or nodded hello! The renovated room was fine, nice furniture. The bed comfy with nice linens and towels provided. The room was slightly smaller than at other hotels I have stayed in NYC, but adequate. Noise from other guests (from hallway and other rooms) was an issue at times (thankfully there were no late partiers). This is an extremely large hotel. The lobby is always bustling and as It was raining terribly on our last evening the lobby was unusually crowded and noisy. Check-in and check-out times can be frenzied because of the number of people coming and going. If you want a less stressful experience, this is not the place! Overall, our stay here was fine, but because of the upgrade issue, doubt that we would stay here again. It is usually the little unexpected perks that hotels offer their customers that brings them back. This hotel offered none.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but horrible service”
Reviews.Author: Elisabeth24
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on priceline for a steal and was very excited to spend a Friday night at the hotel for only $100. We got there early and understood we most likely wouldn't be able to check in, which is totally fine. When we arrived, the line was at least 30 deep and there was only one person working behind the counter. Someone from the hotel walked by and told us that there were no rooms available and that we could check our bags with the bellhop. We then waited on that line for about 20 minutes and then received a receipt from the bellhop. Cut to 10pm when we arrived back at the hotel....my husband went to get the bags and was charged $13 b/c the receipt was dated from the day before. I told the guy working that we had been by earlier in the afternoon, he was completely rude to me and told me there were no managers to speak to as the bellhop/valet is outsourced to another company and that it was too bad for us. We then brought this up to the woman at the check in desk and she also told us that it was outsourced and not her problem. Aggravating! The room and location were nice, just be ready to wait in a lot of lines and no one wanting to take responsibility.

Reviews.Title: “Big. Impersonal.”
Reviews.Author: wacuyco
Reviews.Content: Im a Starwood Gold member so I like to be loyal to it and get points and perks. So, when choices were too little for a business trip to NYC, I stayed here. This hotel is HUGE. I checked in through the Gold Preffered desk and the person didnt even exchange pleasantries and just checked me in. The room was nicely furnished but on the small side (which is typical in NYC). I didnt eat in the hotel as there were a lot of choices around the area. I used the health club twice and had to pay 10$ per visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Kim T
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location in the middle of Manhattan. Staff was friendly. The room was older but for the price we got on Priceline, acceptable given its location.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton New York Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brad T
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful when you walk in and it sets the tone of high quality hospitality, but once you stay you realize the bad service they have. I have a family of 7 including, four teenagers, a school age child, a six-months baby, and a mother. We asked for a roll-away bed for our room and they wouldn't supply it. Over and over we had to ask for towels and coffee and they wouldn't come. Finally, after about three or four calls to the front desk, we got towels and enough coffee for a couple months. I realize it is Thanksgiving time, but that is what these hotels thrive on. Times are tough so I wanted to order my newly braced son some chickeen tenders and they were $12. I realize it is NYC and it will be more expensive, but no chicken tender should be $12.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service made the difference”
Reviews.Author: P G
Reviews.Content: At check-in, a very rude woman (black woman, short hair with red streaks) stated there were no rooms available and we had to wait. No apology, no nothing. Just a to bad you are going to have to wait. I was thrown off by this. When I came back five minutes later to ask a question, a young man helped me. He stated he did not understand why I was not checked-in before, apologized and gave me my room key. Unfortunately during the night, the AC broke. It was very hot and i requested a fan. It took them over 3 hours to come up, didnt show up till 2 am. Christian Rios went out of his way to apologize and check-in with me while I waited for the fan. He again called the following day to make sure everything was ok. It is incredible to me how the hotel can have such extremes in customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Family trip to NYC worked out fine from here - a True review”
Reviews.Author: professorkev
Reviews.Content: This is a non-exaggerated review of or family trip to NYC, wife and 2 kids ages 3.5 & 6. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- I stayed here with my Starwood points and a bit worried about the size of the room due to reviews and was worried about nothing, typical size rooms and worked out fine for us; and we normally do suite hotels. We had a Superior room which was higher floor renovated. We were on the 29th floor and last room at end of the hallway. I found the street noise was tolerable; we could here horns and sirens. What I did not like was hearing the room next to use in the morning (they had a ADHD child) thank god they left the room by 7:30. But still, I have rarely encountered a hotel where I could hear the neighboring room (Red Roof Inn anyone? ) I can not figure out why they never addressed this in the remodel. Decorating of the room was nicely done and we were very comfortable. Bathroom ws somewhat small but nothing worth complain over; it suited us fine. LOCATION: Sweet location; nuff said; just close to everything STAFF: we checked in at 6:00pm and had no wait on a Friday. Housekeeping was fantastic and always responded when we said hello & in English :o) no complaints from them and made sure the gratuity showed our appreciation. CLUB LEVEL: Although we did not have club level, I was able to check it out. All rooms had been remodeled. the lounge was nice however they only offered coffee & Water. No sodas or juices. I guy ordered a scotch & Water; $15 WOW. Their brunch is nothing by a continental, no hot foods. They offer nice seating and 3 computer terminals. I like club levels but ones I stay at usually offer beers & sodas & Juice at no charge plus a hot breakfast. So not worth the extra cost, it's a shame they don't offer more. MY NEGATIVES: .... TERRIBLE TV selection if you have kids; only 1 channel for kid shows. They use Dish TV which had a fuzzy reception on some channels. disappointed they didn't offer more for families. ....No Fridge - Screw the filled fridge, people want a fridge they can use. ....Lack of soundproof from walls & windows. muted street noise I can handle, but hearing people in the morning waking up really ruins an otherwise good nights sleep. They should have insulated walls better. In the end we enjoyed our stay. Elevators were FAST, 15 seconds to go up 29 floors. Avoid rooms near elevator, you'll hear that "woosh" of the elevators fast system. Location was great and hotel clean and nicely remodeled. I would only stay here again if I was on a higher floor and had nobody in the room next to me. Lastly, AVOID the Pedi-taxis (bike taxis) we took one from the hotel to Toys-r-Us, OUCH $62 for four. Live & Learn. Taxis were great and inexpensive ($10 to Grand Central) Enjoy your trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: manderific
Reviews.Content: I had a positive stay at the Sheraton Times Square while in New York for business. This hotel is nicely located, in that it is close to Times Square, but not in the craziest part of the hustle and bustle. I was "upgraded" to a renovated room on one of the top floors. Not sure what the other rooms look like, but this was very nice and relatively spacious for a NYC hotel. Everything was in good shape, modern, and even moderately luxe, such as the bedding, TV, lights and other fixtures, towels, etc. The bathroom was not as nicely upgraded. My only other complaint is that I had problems with the internet in my room (and it was pricey, but I guess that's just New York).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for NY visit”
Reviews.Author: Travelefes
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently during the NY marathon. You can almost touch Times Square. Make sure you stay at a renovated room on one of the top floors (I was located in floor 40). The rooms are small (NY size) but nicely decorated, no noise from the street if you are high up). If you have access to the club lounge it is a great place to have breakfast. Located on the 44th floor you can enjoy a complimentary breakfast (as SPG platinum member) while looking at the sun rising over Central park. Quite a breathtaking view. The lobby area can get very crowded, lots of folks moving about but overall a good spot to start doing some sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Making Changes for the Better”
Reviews.Author: Bus_Travel_TX
Reviews.Content: My last review, back in August, for this property was what I thought to be my last. After staying at the Sheraton for many years, I had noticed the decline in service during the current renovations. I was very disappointed and shared my negative perception of the hotel here on TripAdvisor. To my surprise, the General Manager contacted me directly to address my concerns and share his insight on changes he is implementing at the hotel. I noted that I'd give it some time, but that I would try the Sheraton again. I recently stayed at the hotel again, and DID note a marked improvement. It seems that the stress of such a major renovation may be passing, and I noticed significant improvement in service, facilities, responsiveness and value. Experience at the front desk was great (friendly and prompt) and my room was clean and fully functional. Recognizing that this is a very large hotel, the experience was exactly what I would expect from a Sheraton-Marriott quality hotel. It's not 5 star luxury, but that's not what it set's out to be. Instead, it's a clean, newly renovated, convenient place to stay when visiting New York on business. Given the great location of this hotel and the continual improvements in service, I would no longer count it out as a good option in midtown.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, very average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mel13Uk
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for 4 nights over the marathon weekend in New York. The location really is this hotel's saving grace as everything else about the hotel is pretty ordinary. We found the concierge staff that we spoke with very helpful. We were initially allocated a non-renovated room on the 20th floor which was really awful! It was a corner room, tiny, extremely hot (could not alter the room temp) and noisy (traffic). Whilst the room was clean it was old and tacky + insufficient storage space. The bed was comfortable (king). We were tired from travelling and as it was late we asked if we could change rooms the following day. We had a very helpful lady at reception who changed us to a renovated room on the 34th floor for the next 3 nights (extra $40 per night). The room was SO much better than our 1st room. Bathroom was same size but newer and cleaner. The room was larger (small compared to Asian & European hotel rooms) with new furniture, carpet, etc + good storage space - we were very happy we had changed rooms (we had requested a renovated room prior to arrival but not allocated one). Breakfast is not included and the hotel charges you for everything, such as $15 per day for wifi, $3.50 per bag in luggage storage - the type of things that are usually provided free of charge in most 4 & 5 star hotels. As previously mentioned, the location is really fantastic, so close to most sites, really easy to walk everywhere in Manhattan which we did. If you happen to get a great deal at this hotel then it would be ok - or otherwise maybe if you were in a club room. We will definitely return to New York as we loved the city and had such a fabulous time there. We would not choose this hotel again though as there are so many other nice hotels to choose from in the same area so we will try somewhere different on our next vist to NY.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected for a Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Wrldtrvlr28112
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here for a business conference and was not impressed. They are still under renovations, and as part of the conference group, we all had rooms in the lower section of the hotel, which has not yet been upgraded. The lobby was nice, and the concierge was very helpful in finding us a place for dinner. The reception desk staff were not nearly as courteous when we checked in. I was rather disappointed when I walked down the hall towards my room. The wallpaper was a bit dingy and the carpet as well. The room was disappointing as well. It was small, with two double beds, and only two drawers in the dresser/entertainment stand could be used because the first of the three was filled with snacks. The bathroom was small and there was still a dirty towel hanging on the back of the door. The ice bucket did not have tongs, and there appeared to be some mold on the lid. I filled the bag with ice on my first night and never got a new bag throughout my three-night stay. I was happy to have Starbucks coffee in the room, but after the second night, the supply was not replenished. On the last day, I requested late check-out and was given until 1:00. Our conference ended at noon, after which I immediately went upstairs to pack my last few items and use the bathroom. When I opened the door, one of the lights was on and the curtain was drawn. The housekeeping staff either was not informed that I was not checked out yet or wanted to re-do the room twice because the coffee and tea had been replenished, some of the bathroom items were re-stocked, the bed made and the trash emptied. I suppose this could be why there was still a used towel in the bathroom when I checked in. The meeting rooms were nice, but cold. The breakfast buffet had a very good selection of fresh fruit, hot items, cereal, and breakfast breads and pastries, but was very expensive. I've never spent $35 on breakfast before. The location was excellent - we were able to walk to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Bryant Park, and trekked over to Macy's to see their holiday windows. The dining options in the area are numerous, but a good meal is pricey. I suppose you get what you pay for. All things considered, I don't think this hotel is worth the regular price for a room. Even the group discounted rate that we were given was high, especially after the multiple taxes and fees. The next time I stay in NY, I'll definitely look into other options.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveler24NewYork
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a girls night out. We had concierge level and the lounge was amazing for breakfast. I was impressed. Surprised it was open on the weekend. The room we had was very nice and looked updated recently. The only issue we had was the service at the hotel bar, it was very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Club lounge makes the stay amazing.”
Reviews.Author: gabrielcrew01
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times and the employees in the club lounge make me feel like i am at home everytime. Tomas, Muhammed, and Lacey are so welcoming and remember my family and i every time we come for a visit. I cannot rave enough about their friendliness, excellent service, and amazing can-do attitudes! Please let them know they make my stay worth every moment. I look forward to many more stays in the future. I will not stay anywhere else in the city!

Reviews.Title: “Location great... Service terrible...”
Reviews.Author: tomwmorton
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent... So central to everything, Subway station just next door, Times Square, 5th Avenue, Broadway and Central Park... But location isnt everything... The service at the front desk is very slow... and almost all the staff are rude. The rooms have a layer of dust over everything and it always appears that the carpet isnt vaccummed... And if you want to sleep during the afternoon... No chance! The housekeepers spend most of the time shouting to each other down the hallways!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DavenLou
Reviews.Content: Awesome rooms, great service and a perfect location made our stay at the Sheraton New York perfect. They just renovated and the rooms are beautiful. Free internet in the Lobby's computers and an on-site STarbucks. Concierge were extremely knowledgeable. This is a winner!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: lh2009
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Sheraton Towers for a conference. The room conference rate was $335 and with taxes etc was close to $400 a night. The location was excellent. Room was nice but small. I parked 4 blocks away on 53rd street between 10 and 11th street for $20 a day (with the internet coupon)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel stay!!”
Reviews.Author: airbornliz
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton was great!!! Even with them being under construction outside for a remodel you couldn't hear anything inside. The Sheraton is extremely close to central park, times square and 5th avenue. Perfect location to see all of these sights within walking distance. This is not a hotel you can walk to from Grand Central Station however. The room was clean and all accommodations were new and clean. They even held our bags for a small fee while we went sight seeing after checkout.

Reviews.Title: “to much noise”
Reviews.Author: cullinand17
Reviews.Content: got woke up every morning by noise at 9am , a unwanted wake up call by the hotel couldnt go back to sleep , when i asked about the noise the front desk person told me i should of seen a comment on line about construction there was not one . Will not stay here again hotel made no effect to move our room or offer help

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room, but far from ideal...”
Reviews.Author: davidmeyer
Reviews.Content: Living on the road maybe I come to expect too much from my hotels. The check-in was timely (compared to the last time I stayed here) and the room was very, very nice. However, in the three nights I spent there, I know for a fact that my room was not vacuumed. Additionally, the bathroom STUNK because the shower curtain was in need of cleaning or changing. I mention these things because when you spend as much as you will on this room, you should at least be able to expect a room that gets properly cleaned. The shower curtain...maybe they need to train their cleaning people better. Yes...I will probably stay here again...but make sure you say something IMMEDIATELY if your room is not perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property Near Times Square”
Reviews.Author: swiper4
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights last month for a conference. As a platinum member, I stayed on the 27th floor in the one of renovated rooms. Nice rooms, comfortable bed. Concierge lounge opened recently on 44th floor after being renovated. Nice breakfast items with fresh fruit and a few different coffee options. You can now access lounge 24 hours. Used free bag check service in the lobby as my room was not ready (checked in early). Did not use the gym, rather took nice jog to central park which is not far from hotel. Like the hotel location as it is close but not in times square, and has plenty of eating options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in new york”
Reviews.Author: canadianwarmth
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a great location. Let's face it, you don't go to new york to stay in your room. This hotel has very clean, efficient, "new" rooms. They are big for new york. What the hotel has is location. Walk to times square, columbus circle, central park, 5th avenue shops, carnegie deli and moma in minutes. The hotel is safe. It has good security and efficient service. The newly renovated rooms are a pleasant change This is not a boutique hotel. Its always busy but that's new york!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but needs renos”
Reviews.Author: GregSCanada
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location, close to Central Park and on the edge of the hustle and bustle. The staff were ok. The room I was in needed some upgrading, the carpet was old and the climate control for the room was ineffective.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: kezz38
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on Priceline for this hotel. We had a great check in - no lines at all. The staff at the front desk were very courteous and did not treat us any differently because we had booked through priceline. We were given a king size room which was very very comfortable - great bed! We were on the fifth floor and I was a bit worried about street noise, but no issues at all!! Staff were always helpful, the rooms very clean and you cannot beat the location. Overall a great stay, would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Could be so much better”
Reviews.Author: Mistry76
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business for a couple of days in November. This place has potential, but so many little things made my stay just okay. For starters it took nearly 20 minutes to check in. There were like 3 people doing check-in for a huge hotel in NYC. Come on! Rooms were okay - however when you pay over $400/night - you expect better than okay. I had trouble sleeping because it seemed to go from warm to cold. Finally in the morning of my last stay, it sounded like someone was using a jack-hammer. I couldn't sleep in as it felt like the whole floor was shaking. The place just felt so crowded - so many other better choices in NY.

Reviews.Title: “ok kinds stay”
Reviews.Author: vidhi_goel
Reviews.Content: rooms are just ok the service is kind of Ok need to call india using my card the recetion doesnt have an idea how to use..I dint try food so cant comment. lifts are bit slow and the red carpet dint appeal me in the lift area seems to be pretty old.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing to stay and access the comfots”
Reviews.Author: naveenpai58
Reviews.Content: The trip to New Jersy and New York in 2008 was nice and we could see the most of the places at New York...secondly the environment and the premises of Sheroton at NY was amazing to watch and feel. I just advise all the travellers to feel the experience please.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, no AC”
Reviews.Author: Drew S
Reviews.Content: No modern hotel in this century should lack air-conditioning, even during "winter" months (though November is clearly Autumn...). When I called to ask if the AC unit could be turned on, I was informed that the entire hotel's AC was shut off for the season. When I asked what I should do, I was told to "open a window." Of course, being NYC, if I actually wanted to SLEEP, opening a window was not an option (the hotel is on busy 7th Ave and there was night road construction and jack-hammers). Then, when I said that's not acceptable, I was offered a fan. I said I would take a fan...which came an HOUR-AND-A-HALF later...at 1:30 AM!! Totally unacceptable. Also, my corporate rate of nearly $500 got me the small queen room, even though I was supposed to get a King. I know it's NYC and the rooms there are small, but give me a break. This hotel sucks. Finally, the hotel actually charges you to check your bags. Yes! CHARGES you! Every other hotel on the planet does this complimentary, and of course you tip, but my god $3.50/bag just to put it in the check room? Pathetic. I will never go back here. Stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Not for those who have been before.”
Reviews.Author: Aberfitchfish
Reviews.Content: Overall the Sheraton is nice. It has nice rooms, nice shower, nice service. I was able to easily get a free upgrade from the gentleman at the front desk. They didn't charge me extra for having extra people in the room. So overall the place is great. However, if you've been to New York, use to live there, or just going for some partying, bar hopping, seeing friends, shopping, or business, AND DON'T WANT TO SEE TIMES SQUARE stay away from this hotel. I've gone to college in NYC, and I go multiple times a year, and I just didn't really think about the proximity to times square. Basically times square sucks if you've seen and done it before - it is hectic, busy, hard to move through, and there are way too many tourist. However, if this is what you want, and you don't mind waiting/struggling to get a taxi in the rain or snow because there are 50 million people trying to get one then book this place, because it is nice; however, for me and my friends it would have been more ideal for us to stay away from Times square since we were mainly there to bar hop, see friends, and shop. I recommend not staying in times square even if it is your first time going to NYC... Times square is easy to get to and it is just easier & sometimes cheaper staying a little further out like midtown, chelsea, downtown, central park area, etc... Just my take on things :)

Reviews.Title: “IT'S ALL ABOUT MONEY!””
Reviews.Author: LouiGalicia
Reviews.Content: As first timers in New York, we decided to book Sheraton New York Hotel & Towers because of its location. I’ve read from the reviews that the hotel is ideally situated which means that most of the tourist areas are within walking distance. As soon we landed JFK, I was already looking forward to having a quiet rest in our room as we have arrived late in the evening. As soon as the taxi parked on the side street (not in front), I already noticed the scaffolding in front of the hotel. I told myself that it can’t be. I was so careful to read the reviews and was sure that the comments about the renovations of parts of the hotel would have already finished. There was no warning on the hotel’s website nor did Expedia put a warning about renovations. I thought that the scaffolding was part of the preparations for Thanksgiving or Christmas decorations. Check in was a breeze because there was no crowd. We arrived on a Saturday and booked for a week in order to relax and enjoy Manhattan in all its glory as it is the school’s autumn break in Holland. We were given a room on the 12th floor. Upon opening the door, one couldn’t hear any sigh from excitement or from awe. The room was old and the bed was small. We were with our little girl! The bathroom was clean but the closet was so small we had to leave our clothes in our luggages. The room was clean though. So much for a first impression. I thought that this is New York and we’re paying so much to stay in a hotel, yet hotels in Europe look way too classy. We just had a little bit of freshening up and then we decided to walk on the 7th Ave. towards Times Square. For first timers, Times Square can be very overwhelming. My daughter did not want to go sight seeing anymore. She just wants to be in Times Square all the time. After our dinner which took place at midnight (the City never really sleeps), we went back to the hotel. To our surprise, there was foldable bed outside our door. Well, that’s a nice gesture from the hotel staff, because we really thought they do not provide extra beds for kids. So, we all retired. But, every hour, I couldn’t sleep because the room is not soundproof. I could hear the subways non-stop running, cars and more prominently, the honkings. I could also hear the opening and closing of the elevators and the voices of people who are either just arriving or who were returning late from a night out. I did not sleep at all and I asked myself how rotten will I be after 5 days if I am in this state, when I could have involuntarily crashed completely due to jetlag. As soon as I got up, I went to the bathroom and noticed a coffee machine but with Starbucks coffee pads. Wow, that was a plus. It came complete with the Starbucks disposable coffee cups to go. Now, that’s a nice consolation from what I’ve been through. I hate American brewed coffee. They taste like black colored tea. And to have Starbucks as you jump out of bed is certainly a luxury. I told myself, this hotel isn’t bad after all. I would have preferred a porcelain mug or real coffee cup but I guess I have to do it the American way. But up to now, I haven’t learned how to drink coffee while walking without spilling on myself! But that is forgiveable. My husband tried the fitness and he said it’s nice and good. However, on the morning of checkout, we received a bill (slipped under the door) that includes $40 for the use of the fitness facilities, which I can’t understand because on their website it says that the use of fitness facilities is either $10 per visit or $20 per stay. Our stay was 7 nights and I can’t fathom why on earth we paid $40. I didn’t even go to the gym. But upon clarification at the desk, the extra $20 was apparently taken out of the bill. So indeed it was $20 per stay. Breakfast was not included but we didn’t mind because we wanted to try other breakfast venues. The Link@Sheraton lobby is nice, when it isn’t crowded. In the morning, The Link serves as a Starbucks area and computer lounge. Wifi is free and there are a number of computers and a printer that one can use for free. I found this service good because in the mornings when you don’t want a heavy breakfast, you can just stay here and have a croissant, Danish or fruit plus Starbucks coffee while you check your emails or post your tourist shots on Facebook, in full comfort. However, this area of the lobby can get quite crowded no matter what time of day. In the evening, the Link is transformed to a more appropriate bar/computer lounge. On the second day, I literally slept like a baby. I guess it was the jetlag and fatigue to the max that allowed me. But, on the third day, I woke up to the sound of drillings around 9 am. The drilling was so loud and strong I immediately had a headache. I told myself, no worries, we needed to go out anyway so it was a useful alarm. But the following day, after spending a long night out, we planned a short sleep in because anyway, rain was in the weather forecast. So, we’ve all been sleeping soundly and had gotten so used to the noise outside when suddenly, a loud drilling sound started again, this time at 7:30 am! The sound was so loud and near that it felt like our heads are being drilled. It did not stop. I have recorded it on my Iphone and up to now ‘am surprised how loud the drilling was. Too bad you can only upload photos here on Trip Advisor. Then came the hammering sounds. Now that really pissed me off. Why did Sheraton not put a warning on their website that there are still renovations ongoing, otherwise we could have booked at the Trump Plaza or other hotels where the prices did not differ too much from Sheraton’s for the vacation package that we took? Or we could have been given a room that is far from where the renovations are being done. Sheraton should have taken in consideration that we have booked 7 nights and have come from Europe so it should mean that we were there to have a holiday and a quiet, relaxing week. The hotel should have given extra consideration to those who have booked more nights than just the week-end bookers. But no, this meant that we did not own our time anymore. As soon as the drillings started, we had to jump out of bed, dress up and get out of the hotel. I did not even bothered to ask for an upgrade, because I expected to be just wasting an extra $60 a night just to hear drilling sounds in the morning. All in all, the little extra touches like the Starbucks coffee machine in the room and free wi-fi all served for nothing, if you count how many paracetamols I’ve taken during my stay. I hope my liver is still okay! The renovations and the lack of information about it really degrades this hotel which is so popular. I heard from my Manhattan lawyer friends that this hotel is a favorite venue for President Obama’s fundraisers so I had such very high expectations. I did not dare complain. Coming from Europe, we are not so used to complaining every time. But I guess I have put my complaint here in Trip Advisor. As for coming back to this hotel, I’m still thinking. There are other seemingly nice hotels on 7th Avenue and on Times Square so I maybe checking those out first before considering Sheraton again. It’s plain deception on the hotel’s part. They know that there are floors and wings that will be affected by the renovations yet they played it by ear to see who will complain. They shouldn’t have put guests in those rooms if they are really sincere about ensuring customer’s comfort and satisfaction. Of course there are expectations when you book a hotel. There are expectations of an excellent client service and when in the U.S. there is a high degree of expectation that customers will receive the best service. We did not have demands. We just wanted to sleep and wake up fully rested. Just confirms the City’s reputation that New York is all about money!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: thomasn
Reviews.Content: Like so many other reviews on this hotel it shows, that having a great location and a good names seems often enough for some chains. Sheraton to me was always standing for high quality and money well spent. Not at this place. The rooms are so small, that having 3 larger suitcases for 2 people sleeping in a double bed room already present a logistical challenge. The noise insulation between the rooms is poor, so we could in detail follow the conversation and all the other things, that our neighbors had, returning home each night at about 3am! Also the door was interesting to me. It showed clear signs of forced opening in the past. No effort was taken to remove the scratch marks of the chisel used. Also the door did not at all help to reduce the noise on the hallway. The room was clean and the beds where comfortable. This part was ok. The waiting at the front desk on check in and check out was extreme, but the hotel was supposed to be sold out completely. The fitness center seemed to be well equipped, but spending over $300 for a night, I did not see the point in paying another $10 just on some minutes on the threadmill. Fortunately Central Park is not that far away. I had not too many good experiences with hotels in NYC and this is certainly not changing this.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: JBG72400000
Reviews.Content: If you are going to NYC you have unlimited options when it comes to hotels. so If you want a hotel that genuinely cares about your experience, goes out of their way to service you and makes sure you are comfortable then the Sheraton New York Hotel & Towers is the choice for you. When it comes to service, quality, cleanliness and price you can't find a better hotel anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Priceline users”
Reviews.Author: amf71
Reviews.Content: Got a room for $230 during NYC Marathon (website was offering $430+ for the same room). It's a great location, and despite what other reviews said, I actually found the room size to be decent by NYC standards. Agreed that the check-in line was long, but the desk was fully staffed at the line moved. The front desk was very courteous, allowed me to check in 3 hours early, and gave me a double as requested (always surprising to get anything I ask for when I get a Priceline rate). The bathroom was a bit dated - peeled wallpaper - but really - the room was clean, a good size, and as for noise, I didn't think it was any noiser than any other hotel. I was overwell quite pleased. However, had I paid $400+ for the room I would have been disappointed. It is a 3 start hotel at best, so given the $230 I paid, I was happy. Another $200 I would have expected plush robes, chocolate on the pillow, a beautiful bathroom, etc. Great location - can't beat it. Away from Times Square chaos, close to park, right by subway line.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, amazing location”
Reviews.Author: DeniseBranfoot
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Was concerened after reading some reviews but I think thats just picky and fussy people. Brilliant Location, Great Standard of rooms. Very friendly service. Would most definitely recommend and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Service, Nothings Perfect, Its NYC.”
Reviews.Author: Planedriver9
Reviews.Content: The good. My wife and I had some time off and decided to spend 5 days in one of our favourite cities after our Paris plans got messed up. Im an airline pilot, so when we travel, I never book a hotel until I am actually in the city I want to be in. I used Hot-wire and found and entered 4 star in midtown as the perimeters. Up popped the Sheraton. On to Trip Advisor I went. $183 a night all week, reg $479 (its NYC). Armed with knowing about the reno'd floors and the old ones, off to the hotel we went. Our booking (3rd party) said one Queen bed. Checking in they were totally out of Queens. I knew that my low price I paid was not going to give me a new room or any favours. That said, my wife is pregnant and needs her space while sleeping. I talked with the reception lady named Joy, who was awesome and totally helpful. She was so concerned about my wife's interest and well being. We found one Queen bed after some work, but Joy worked some magic, and our compromise couldn't have worked out better. We ended up on the 40th floor, with 2 double beds, at the end where it was quite, and super new. I stay in 10-14 hotel rooms a month and I know this floor was just redone. Still had that new carpet smell. The rooms are massive for NYC, probably the biggest ive seen in the city. I felt I was in another city they were that big. The hotel is busy as its a conference centre, its NYC, it supposed to be. Times Square is 5 blocks south, you can not get a better spot if your new to this city. The 7th Ave subway is 500ft away, Letterman tapes around the corner, and for you fellow Canadians, theres a Tim Hortons 3 blocks south. The not so good, (minor stuff) Having stayed at a lot of Sheratons around earth, I cant understand why they nickel and dime you on little things. The is no free bag check. They sell it out to a 3rd party company that charges $3 a bag. Even though I only travel carryon, I find this really lame. At $500 a night, I don't think you should charge someone $6 to watch there stuff for 2 hours, plus its not Sheratons fault if something happens. First place I stayed in, that they do this. Also I didn't like the fact a guy told me it was because of space issues. Its one of the biggest places in the city! Free Wifi in lobby, great. $14 a day in the room, Seriously...... I know other hotels do it but its weak. If you want a fridge in your room its $29, really?.... Final thoughts, If you have never been to NYC and are one of those folks who need a big room to feel like they got a good hotel, Stay here. If it shows up on your Price line, or Hotwire, your fine here. If you like dealing with a known chain, stay here. If you don't like crowds, want a boutique hotel, or find the lobby or street noise to loud, don't come to NYC. Thank you again Joy for helping my wife out!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location, terrific staff”
Reviews.Author: Paul P
Reviews.Content: We came to the Sheraton after a horrendous experience at another hotel. We told Mike, part of the Concierge staff about our dilemma and asked if he could help us. He not only made some helpful suggestions on getting out out prepaid hotel stay but arranged for us to get a one bedroom suite on the Club Floor with a separated bedroom and living area with sleeper couch for just a but more than we were paying at the other hotel. It included breakfast and afternoon snacks, use of the Club Lounge all day and free in room internet. We have and will be recommending this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service!”
Reviews.Author: AnshukM
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton in April for 7 nights. There appeared to be some sort of a student conference happening with them occupying most of the hotel. Unfortunately, the hotel staff seemed to think that everyone there was a student and treated everyone horribly. There was no help with luggage at the time of check in, even though it would have been impossible for us to take all of it upstairs by ourselves. The room itself was well appointed and clean but the service was really bad as every time we called to ask for something, we were on hold for at least 3-4 minutes and the operators were always rude. The location of the hotel though was absolutely amazing! Can't go wrong. This would be a great hotel if only the staff cleaned their act up.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Capemon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I lost power due to the October snow storm and needed to stay in the city to get ourselves warm and get back to work. Our front desk check-in was performed by Nicole, who was incredibly friendly and warm. She listened to our story and offered us free breakfast and a late checkout to make sure we could rest and recharge after our stromy ordeal. She really embodied what customer service should be about that you see so rarely these days. The hotel itself is OK if you must stay in midtown, the rooms sure could use a renovation. The walls were not in very good shape, the bathroom was tiny. But if you need a place to crash and be in the heart of the city, this works.

Reviews.Title: “A great time and a great location!”
Reviews.Author: cmenghini
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a weekend in New York and were referred to the Sheraton New York and Towers by my friends from Chicago (my friend Rick who really knows the Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers) and the experience was great. The perfect location to catch a Broadway Show, to walk to Birdland for a great jazz experience and to go to some of the finest restaurants that New York has to offer. Location was great. The staff was excellent and the room (including the bed) was terrific. Bravo for a great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Loyely hotel in New York”
Reviews.Author: JohnLane02
Reviews.Content: Had a great experience with this Sheraton. We stayed in newly renovated rooms. Very nicely appointed. SPG club was recently re-opened and is great. Staff at desk, office, club, housekeeping were all terrific. We'll stay there whenever we are in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Big and small”
Reviews.Author: vacance59
Reviews.Content: We were at the Sheraton for 3 nights for business, at the club level. Our room was very small, the washroom was tiny. Not more than one person at a time in the washroom. The night we arrived the parking was full, there is only 250 spaces for 1000 rooms ! At more than $600.00 per night , it's maybe the price in this area, it's very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: billanddoyle
Reviews.Content: I hate to rate this hotel at this time because they are renovating (hopefully) the entire hotel. The entire outside ground floor is covered with scaffolding - not a pretty sight. They are adding suites of which larger rooms are needed. We had the smallest bathroom that I have ever seen in a hotel - - and I have seen hotels all over the world. 2-people could not stand in the bathroom at the same time. Because of this - you could sit on the 'john', brush your teeth and take a shower all at the same time. Two of the elevators were not working. There was no nice dining room - - just a very casual cafe that specialized in hamburgers. There was a Starbucks coffee shop in the lobby until 3pm and then after that it became a bar! There was a place for a restaurant near the entrance - - but it was and has been closed for a long long time and it was not being renovated. There was a long wait for a room - - so don't expect one if you arrive before 3pm. Despite it all - it was very comfortable. The best plus was that they had a dedicated computer in the lobby for you to issue your own Airline boarding passes (although the line was very long & slow). I am sure that in a year the Sheraton will be a 4-plus star hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton NYC great location”
Reviews.Author: mrplatinumtraveler
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Hotel & Towers on 7th Ave. is a terrific location for any visit to NYC: It is close to Times Square; Broadway, lots of great restaurants nearby, even Javits CC is within walking distance! The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful - they make you feel like you are their favorite customer!

Reviews.Title: “Much Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: Georgina5
Reviews.Content: Usually stay at 4 star hotels and didn't have high expectations for the Sheraton. Have walked by it many, many times and my impression had always been: too big, too crowded. Was booked into this hotel on a business trip. We were upgraded to a lovely suite. The room and bathroom had been recently redone and it showed. Our adjoining room next door was quite small with the typical, tiny NY bathroom. The bathroom in the suite was beautiful: double sinks, tub and separate shower. The lobby was always a zoo, but enjoyed the room very much. We were fortunate not to be on a floor where there were lots of people running around and slamming doors. Many large groups stay at this hotel and the guests can get quite noisy and rambunctious. We also had access to the club level and took advantage of that for breakfast - which is available until 11 a.m. Food choices were wonderful and healthy. If I was booked there again, would want a suite (at the regular rate!).

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you have a renovated room”
Reviews.Author: Mila90
Reviews.Content: We initially were given a non-renovated room. Having booked on Hotwire for under $200 a night, I was not surprised. But after seeing that both are heating and phone were out of order, we requested a change and were given a renovated room. It was very nice, and would have been perfect if the drain in the tub weren't blocked. Wasn't a big deal, though. I liked how there were many elevators and we didn't have to wait too long for one, which is an issue in other similar hotels. Loved the bed, too - very comfortable Sheraton Sweet Sleeper bed.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Staff/Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: SLBCLK
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel to NYC a couple of times a year. We stay in four and five star hotels. This hotel was rated four stars by Expedia. The hotel must be resting on its laurels because this is a three star hotel at best. When we arrived at our room, the toilet was clogged. Worse, we woke up the next morning to ear splitting power tools. The facade of the hotel on the north side is under renovation. The hotel put us in the outside most room adjacent to the construction. The noise of the power drill and jack hammer was so loud that I had to shout into the phone when I called the front desk. I asked for a new room and was told by the front desk that the computer system was down. The manager at the front desk assured me that she would call me when the system was up. Well, the system stayed down all day. I came back to the room to rest at 2 PM but could not stay in the room because of the power tools. I ended up in the lobby until 5 PM when construction stopped. In the meantime, the line to check in wrapped around the lobby. The next day, the system was up. I went to the front desk to ask for another room to get away from the construction. I was told a room would be ready in an hour. I came back an hour later and was told the room was not ready but they would call me. I came back at 5 PM and the room still was not ready but that they said they would call me when it was. The hotel never called. By this time it was Friday night and I assumed correclty that the construction would not continue over the weekend. We left Monday morning without having ever received a call from the hotel. Other issues: There was not heat on a 50 degree day. Our room was uncomfortably cold. Room service trays left in the hallway by other guests did not get picked up for 48 hours. A maid was making up a room next to us at 10:30 PM. She was screaming at someone over her cell phone as she made up the room. Sheraton should be ashamed of this hotel. The staff did not follow up, left room service trays in the halls and made up beds at 10:30 PM. Sounds like the staff needs training and the hotel needs new management. I wont be staying at any Sheraton any time soon.

Reviews.Title: “We will never stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: SecretShppr
Reviews.Content: Like many others have mentioned, this property is NOT up to Sheraton standards or even a seedy motel standard. We arrived around 10p and they did not have a room available for us yet...seemed odd since check in was at 3p. They did provide us with complimentary dinner in one of their restaurants but we waited until after 11p to get a room. When we arrived to the room it was small even for NYC standards and had an overwhelming smell of mildew. We opened the windows to air it out. I went to turn the lamp on and the shade was horribly water stained all the way around. I could not believe that they would leave that lamp shade in the room. The bathroom smelled even worse of mildew and the shower/bath tub was old and so worn that I did not want to use it because it was difficult to tell if it was just old or if it was dirty. The bathroom door had paint that was peeling and wood that was splitting. The room was so disappointing and gross that I pulled the sheets back to inspect the bed. The sheets and bedding were clean so we decided to stay at that point because it was late and we had an international flight out the next day. We will never stay again and would never recommend this hotel. They really cannot do the renovations fast enough. It truly amazed me that Starwood would allow one of their properties to get to this state and I was shocked that they continue to allow guests to reserve rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent service”
Reviews.Author: bano1
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for my business and stay in many different hotels. And I have found that the front desk is the heart of any hotel. I've always been treated well at the Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers, my last experience was with Robert at the front desk, he easily fixed a problem I had made with my reservation. Trust me, there are a lot of hotels that would not have cared or taken the time like he did. It is generally the result of good management to encourage employees to make the extra effort for their customers. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unlike any other Sheraton-go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: checht96
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our anniversary weekend and were greatly disappointed. We had people smoking on our floor and although we notified the front desk, no one helped. Further, the staff were not very responsive except for the doormen. Our first room was two single beds except that we reserved a King-then we had to pay for an upgrade in order to get a room with a king-sized bed! To compensate the hotel manager promised a bottle of red wine which never materialized! Needless to say, we will never stay here again. On a positive note, the location is very convenient to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, compromised room - unpleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: JoyDo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was undergoing renovation when we stayed there, although the website did not mention this. Our room was on the 11th floor, very close to the elevators, and next to some kind of utility room, which was under construction. Our window was blocked by scaffolding, and we were both startled and taken aback to find a workman standing on that scaffolding, working directly outside our room. This tended to interfere with our view and with our privacy while in the room, so we kept the drapes closed most of the time.The drapes were stained, and the carpet had large dark stains as well. The room was very small, even by NYC standards, and at more than $500 a day, it was not inexpensive. The bathroom was not clean: the toilet seat was dirty, and the fixtures had fingerprints and water spots. We complained. A desk clerk explained that we were in an "unrenovated" room, but we could get an upgrade to a renovated room if we paid an extra $40 and became Starwood members. However, this room would not be available until later that day. We told the clerk we'd deal with the room issues later, as we needed to leave for a pressing appointment. We wanted to think about it: we didn't like our accommodations at all, but were offended that we had to pay extra to upgrade from an already-expensive room. We did not return until well after midnight, too tired to deal with switching rooms. This is unfortunate, because we could hear the noisy elevator whistling in the elevator shaft and dinging loudly throughout the night. Construction began at 8:00 a.m. with loud banging on the scaffolding. About an hour or so later, a workman began using a saws-all or similar loud power tool in the utility room next to our room. My husband and I had to yell to hear each other. "Let's get out of here!" we yelled, packed as fast as we could, and left. And of course, although we never did move to the upgraded room, we had nevertheless been charged the $40. We complained again. This time, the desk clerk was very helpful. She removed the upgrade charge, reduced the overall charge by about 20%, and threw in some extra Starwood points. I don't have a problem with that employee - I think she did everything she had discretion to do. I do have a problem with the Sheraton, however. I think the Sheraton deliberately provided a compromised and inadequate room at market rates, apparently on the assumption that it doesn't need to provide accommodations commensurate with their significant cost unless the guests complain.

Reviews.Title: “NO HEAT 34 degrees snowing...”
Reviews.Author: Amy F
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Priceline. After checking in to a dreary cold room on Sat., Oct. 29, the front desk stated there would be no heat in rooms until Monday! They could offer a $50 credit at dining room and extra blankets. This organization (Starwood) owns several Hotels nearby, that could easily have accommodated the many unhappy, cold guests. To make matters worse, the elevator was "out of service" the next morning. We had to walk down 10 flights of stairs! Do not stay at this hotel. It is dangerous.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Room; Not the best value; No real SPG Gold perks”
Reviews.Author: Norcaltransplant
Reviews.Content: Clean room, though showing some signs of age. The air conditioning / heating system was a built in unit in the room that didn't really work and the framing around it was somewhat decrepit--I couldn't change the temperature. Room service is decent and fairly quick, but pricey. Staff was nice at check-in and it was a fairly quiet room. Rooms are decent size for NYC. If you're an SPG Gold member they charge an extra fee to upgrade to a "club level room" but they did offer late check out.

Reviews.Title: “On the lower side of "average"”
Reviews.Author: MyThoughts_10
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel many times in the past, and thought it was good. Since then, I've ventured off to stay at another hotels in NY, and now that I am back, I see the flaws. For one, the staff are unpleasant, unwelcoming and not what you'd expect of hotel staff. I've already come across an impatient & not curteous luggage storage handler, a curt and straight-faced front-desk employee, and a very direct phone operator who cut me off before I could finish my question. There also are marks here and there in the room that make it feel old and "used" and the bug in my room just didn't help. The location is close enough but far enough away from Times Square, so that's an advantage of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic New York Trip!”
Reviews.Author: laraTO
Reviews.Content: We had a great trip for Christmas 2010. My husband and I have been to New York many times and each time we try a new hotel in a different area of the city. This was by far the best hotel and location! It is steps away from Central Park and Times Square. It was great to be able to walk to various locations, especially in the winter. When in New York it is great to be able to walk and this hotel is situated in a great location for that. The room we had was clean and modern and great size, especially in New York! Stay here, its worth the money! We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Very poor service and unhelpful front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: Iain H
Reviews.Content: My Mother and Her Sister flew in from the UK on a trip arranged by Holland America, 3 days in NY and then a Bermuda Cruise. After travelling for nearly 22 hours ( including flight check and hotel transfer) when they tried to book in the Sheraton said they had no reservation for the room and although my Mother had all the confirmation emails printed off and with her the staff left them standing for 2 hours without the offer of a seat or coffee before the situation was resolved. The Hotel 'forgot' to open to emails sent from Holland America confirming payment and reservation, something they do a lot, so beware ! The front desk said at one point " Well lady, we have rooms, you need a room" of course this would invovle having to pay again for pre paid rooms because the staff would not help. The Hotel also wanted to charge $50 for a three minute international call. Once the situation was resolved they checked in to room 3125, when I tried to contact the room from the UK the front desk staff said that My Mother was not listed in that room number on 3 separate calls before finally putting me through. Our American family had arranged to meet My Mother and Her Sister at the Hotel the following day, when they asked the location of the house phone to call the room staff indicated with a waved hand with the words "over there" Over there was not obvious and had to be asked twicw more before the phone could be located. I would advise anyone to stay away from this Hotel there are many great Hotels in NY and this is not one of them

Reviews.Title: “Great & wonderful New York weekend”
Reviews.Author: FamilyVacationer42
Reviews.Content: I have found that when getting cheap rooms through internet sites you get what you paid for. That is why I always reserve my hotel directly from the Hotel. Me and my twelve year old daugther got there on a Friday at 11:30 a.m and they had our room ready. It had a view of central park and the room was impeccable. Room service was great! The people in the lobby were so helpful with my questions since we came from Florida. No problems with noise since our room was at the end. Shower was wonderful. Hotel was in an excellent location between Central Park and Time square.Great staff and I am so thankful you made our experience there so carefree and safe!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but in a great location”
Reviews.Author: b_francoeur
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights, during a trip in NYC. This hotel is very well located, you are a quick walk to Broadway and Time Square. We wait about 30 minutes to check-in, there was a long line-up at the front desk…bigger is not always better! At the check-in the man said to me that there is no more rooms with queen size bed, so we the choice between a room with 2 double beds or a room refurbished with a Murphy queen bed. We choosed the room with the Murphy bed and it was a great choice!! The room was refurbished, very comfortable, with a couch, a plasma TV, etc. The room was in a corner, so we had large windows on both side with a terrific view. They gave us a 75$ credit for choosing this room (because there was no more room with queen size bed). Staying in NYC is very expensive!! We took a buffet breakfast at the hotel and we spent almost all the 75$ credit!! The room was 180$ a night, and the parking next to the hotel was 50-60$ / 24h. We found another parking at 20$ / 24h at 4-5 blocks from the hotel, with a coupon from the web site http://www.iconparkingsystems.com/ So I recommend highly this hotel, if you want to stay in downtown New York. Yes it’s more expensive than staying in New Jersey, but you are in NYC!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot!”
Reviews.Author: Meemer_DC
Reviews.Content: From pre-check in to check out, this place is a wonderful place to stay. The GM regularly writes comments on Trip Advisor, which usually means the hotel really does care about the guest experience. Let me tell you, that is totally true! All of the employees want your experience to be good, and they were all very nice to us. The location is perfect for being a tourist in NYC and there are plenty of things to do within walking distance. John at the Concierge desk never led us astray and we had 4 great dining experiences on his recommendations. Our room was one of the renovated rooms and was perfect. We had a great view of Times Square and woke up daily to the sights of the city! I highly recommend the Sheraton Towers!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for a theatre and park focused trip.”
Reviews.Author: dineanddish
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because the rooms are fairly large for NYC, the location near Boradway, and the great reviews by others on TA. It was a great home base for a trip to nyc. The concierge, often John, never lead us astray and made great dinner recommendations. From check in to our last night, staying here has been a treat.
