Rennovations are underway but they had no effect on us. The walls are a tad thin, but nothing unexpected. We saw a few rather long lines at reception, but never had to wait ourselves. This hotel is a safe bet! Clean rooms, great staff, good location.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location- Convenient for visiting and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Sussexmick
Reviews.Content: We recently visited with friends for our first New York visit. The Hotel was booked via Virgin Holidays in the UK. Our room was as expected in NYC- smaller than average but it was very comfortable with excellent fittings and very confortable 2 x double beds. ( to be fair one queen size would suffice and leave a bit more room). The Hotel itself is really busy but the staff were excellent, from reception to bell boys, they are all so helpful. The HOtel is perfectly situated mid way between Central Park and Times Square and just about everything is walkable or accessible by Subway, bus or taxi. We had an excellent 3 nights and anyone visiting as a tourist to NYC- this cannot be bettered I am sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: SandDT
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel, excellently located for seeing New York. Clean, reasonably sized, well designed rooms, excellent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: world_citizen61
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during Hurricane Irene in August. Despite the confusion and stress created by this event and the extremely large size of the hotel, the staff were extremely professional and helpful. They did not give us any hassels about leaving a day early when we had to change our travel plans. Our room was a good size for New York, quiet, comfortable and newly renovated although the bathroom was a bit on the small size. Location is excellent. The only negative from my perspective was the massive and crowded lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Native New Yorker is impressed and satisfied.”
Reviews.Author: Bbeballerina
Reviews.Content: I'm a native New Yorker who now lives in LA (for better or for worse). Have stayed at the Sheraton 3 times for business and couldn't be happier each time I hear my company has booked us there. I absolutely love the location. Putting myself in tourist shoes, you're really in the center of it all. Steps away from the excitement and visual stimulation of Times Square, the sophistication and allure of Broadway theatre is right there, AND to the north you're a 5-10 minute walk (how quick is your step) to Central Park, luxurious Central Park South, and the official entre to the Upper West side. Sure, the rooms are small. That's almost a given in Manhattan. But they are MODERN and upgraded. And you are really missing out if you're spending a ton of time in the room. (make sure you ask for a renovated room). It's a busy lobby, but this is NY! Enjoy the hustle and bustle! I overheard one businessman in the elevator saying the prices here were better than a competing hotel.... there are lovely boutique and elegant hotels all over the city but the Sheraton just exudes what I love about New York

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton delivers”
Reviews.Author: Norcohorseman
Reviews.Content: Had an unusual reservation... one via corporate account and one off online special -- and the registration desk combined them seamlessly with no need to change rooms. Concierge quite helpful with many requests and room and hallways newly and smartly remodeled. Only complaint is bizarre shower glass divider... seems like guarantee for water damage eventuallyi.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Stewart80
Reviews.Content: We stayed for from oct 12th - 14th. Upon arrival, check in was fast and we were able to check in early. Then we get to our room it is small and dingy and the view was of construction workers located right outside our window. We thought its only 2 days we will deal with it. Then we head out to start our trip and our door would not shut all the way. We then complained and were switched to another room. This room was larger but the same dingy feeling. This hotel charges for the internet and for the gym. When your traveling for business this is inconvenient. The remodeled rooms might be better but I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great bed...great location”
Reviews.Author: wbiety
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights in this property and it suited my needs perfectly. When we checked in the front desk person, I believe her name was Debbie, could not have been more friendly or helpful. She helped us upgrade to the Club level and was very attentive to our needs. The room was handsome, well appointed, if slightly NY small. The bathroom had a rather cramped feel but what I expect in mid-town Manhattan. It was clean with great views, (the 45th floor looking toward Times Square) and remarkably quiet for the location. The bed was exceptional with good pillows. Having 24 hour access to the club on the 44th floor was great. Coffee and juices were always available and the continental breakfast in the morning and hors d'oeuvres in the evening were a real convenience. It was a good place to begin the day and to unwind. The views are stunning in all directions and the staff excellent. The lobby had the feel of a convention hotel, rather open and loud. The Sunday I was there was amazingly crowded with lines of people checking in. It got you ready for the streets outside which are teeming at all times. There is also a subway line, the "E" train, right at the corner which I found very handy for getting around the city. This was even more important as it rained frequently and cabs were at a premium. I would not usually stay right in mid-town but found this hotel to be the perfect place for that area...just far enough away from Times Square and close to transportation. I would stay there again happily. Wm. B.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton - remodeled-”
Reviews.Author: RAG1964
Reviews.Content: I am a starwood platinum member and have stayed in many starwood properties in NY. The Sheraton Towers is my favorite, especially after the remodel. The location is perfect for my work in the city. I especially like the personal treatment I get at the hotel. I love the spg club, it has great views and especially GREAT service. They have an employee, Muhammad, that always remembers my name and always greets me with a smile on his face. He even remembers my wife that joins me once a year on trips to NYC. I would highly recommend the towers. If you go to the club, say hello to Muhammad!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: AussieLeethal
Reviews.Content: We booked it last minute and it was superb. We upgraded to the Sheraton Club for $50 a night at the desk when we checked in. It was well worth it, free breakfast and dinner appetisers and upgrade to higher level. We got an awesome view of Times Square. Its a short walk to Central Park too!

Reviews.Title: “Great location-great service!”
Reviews.Author: Jenna W
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a weekend getaway with friends. Everything was perfect! Location is great-close to all the sights and theatre. Staff was wonderful-friendly, happy, helpful, professional. Rooms were clean, well appointed, and comfortable. Nothing bad to say about this hotel. Front desk helped us with airport transportation (especially Maria ?). Restautant-food was excellent and our waitress Luisa was wonderful and attentive. Bartender made good drinks (no name-oriental male, very nice). Concietge booked theatre and made dinner reservations for all 5 of us. Fantastic! Will stay here again. New SPG member because of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: LucyGrayUK
Reviews.Content: I was rather apprehensive about booking this hotel after reading some of the reviews. However I decided I would give it a try and I am so pleased I did. The hotel is in an excellent position for sightseeing being only a short walk from Times Square. A subway station is nearby and taxis are available outside the hotel. We had a room on the 34th floor It was roomy, comfortable and clean. The staff were very helpful and friendly. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and I will certainly return to this hotel when I visit New York in the future.

Reviews.Title: “above average”
Reviews.Author: lynne1029
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Sheraton for a conference. my advise is to stay above the 30th floor in the renovated rooms. As the rooms on the lower floors looked and smelled like they were in need of a major over haul we did have to make a request for some of the people in our party to be relocated since the mold was so bad in their room. Also the only fridge in the room is stocked with items for you to purchase! It would have been nice for the rate we paid to have a small fridge to be able to keep a bottle of water in to stay cold. The worst part of it all was paying top dollar for these rooms if you wanted internet service it was an additional 14.95 a day what a rip-off. While I understand this hotel is located in Mid-Town Manhatten you would expect some services to be included .

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully renovated rooms in the center of Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: andreGeneva
Reviews.Content: Had not stayed there for years and was happily surprised with the newly renovated rooms. Very comfortable and roomy I stayed on the 25th floor and had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great all rounder”
Reviews.Author: meljup
Reviews.Content: We only had a night here. My good feeling for this hotel is driven partly by the great rate that we got, which always improves your opinion. It is a little overwhelming at check in, it's a huge hotel and the check in experience reminded me a little of the Vegas hotels. Still, they have staff to help at every point and it went smoothly despite the busyness. We had interconnecting rooms, they were fabulously appointed and very clean. The location is awesome. Not close to The madness of times sq, but close enough. Metres from MOMA and the Rockefeller centre and an easy walk to central park. We also used the parking which was reasonable. I have absolutely nothing negative to say about the hotel, it is a slick and efficient operation and I would recommend to anyone visiting NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Really awesome check in and service”
Reviews.Author: SEEITTHRU
Reviews.Content: I am a loyal Starwood client but this is my first time at this property in NYC. Upon arrival I witnessed a HORRIBLE examble of customer service (10-12-2011 about 2pm). The bellman standing by told the "SPG LINE" client in front of me to go ahead and check in with a black woman who was trying to look busy. She rudely told the man... I'm not open!!! That's not why I'm writing. The lady whom I worked with is THE BEST FRONT DESK CLERK I HAVE EVER EXPERIENCED... and I travel 200+ days a year. Her name is Irini P and she gets it. She gets that we have a choice. She gets that our time is valuable. She gets the Starwood branch standards. If there is any thank your or award for this wormam (and I watcher her check in two others) she should get it. Amazing service and I can be picky! Hat's off to whomever hired her. Janne M -

Reviews.Title: “Renovations have genuinely improved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Im_with_Bobo
Reviews.Content: I had reviewed the Sheraton NY last year and have it only three stars. I have added a fourth star because of the renovations. One of my complaints was the inability to control the temperature in the rooms. That has been solved with individual controls for each room. Much better experience. The waiting lines in the lobby to check in were extremely long this time, but that was really the only major negative. Room is fine--standard, fairly small NYC hotel room. Clean, updated. Great bed. Nice flat screem TV. Great shower in a nicely remodeled bathroom. Huge improvement. Buffet in hotel restaurant is outrageously expensive, but simply slip out of the hotel and you can gind better priced food pretty nearby. Great location. Good service. Parking is also terribly expensive, but that is no different from everywhere else in (mdtown) Manhattan. Very nice business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: howardw228
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend night at the Sheraton in order to see a Broadway show. The location is perfect as it is an easy walk to Times Square and the theater district but it is removed from the noise and crowds. It is also readily accessible to the subway system making it easy to get around town. Check in was fast and uncomplicated. We were given a renovated room on an upper floor. The room was immaculate and the bedding seemed new and was definitely free of bugs. The staff was quite friendly and very professional. The hotel seemed pretty full, but we never waited more than one minute for an elevator. Overall, we were quite pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely renovated”
Reviews.Author: rejoyceWashington_DC
Reviews.Content: I spent last night at the Sheraton Towers in mid town Manhattan. Its still under renovation, but noise wasn't too much of an issue. Spacious, modern internet cafe in lobby with free WIFI and computers. Nice conference space too. Good location on 7th Ave close to subways.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience”
Reviews.Author: luke47
Reviews.Content: First of all, I was upgraded to be a better room at no charge. What a great start! The newly renovated rooms are beautiful with the most comfortable bed, huge flat screen TV, and other nice touches. The hotel staff were friendly and professional. The location is the best! I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Thanksgiving (Canadian) Week-end”
Reviews.Author: Ruth C
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent this past Thanksgiving week-end at the Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers. The hotel is lovely and the staff are very friendly and they go out of their way to help you! The room was very clean and modern! We were not on the 7th Avenue side of the building so it was nice and quiet for sleeping! Superb location!! I got a great deal on Priceline.com. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “My week in NYC”
Reviews.Author: LarryAtlanta5
Reviews.Content: This is the email that I sent to one of the managers upon departure. They went above and beyond... Hi - I am checking out today after 6 nights in the Sheraton New York Hotel & Towers. We all had a great week and your champagne and birthday cake were big hits!!! Thanks very much for making this special week even more special. You have converted my sister from a Marriott person to Starwood with your thoughtfulness and exceptional customer service. We look forward to our next stay in New York. Thanks again.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: GRJones3
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 10/7-10/10/11. We had booked a king room on a renovated floor. We arrived early in the day, so the room wasn't ready. We were offered to upgrade to a "club" room with access to the Club for an extra $25 dollars, and we could check in immediately. We thought that was a good deal. When the statement was printed at check out, we were charged $30 instead of $25. We didn't have time to resolve that before we left, so we don't know if they'll make that right. The room was very small. The bathroom was so small, that it was actually difficult for 2 people to get things done at the same time. The shower head spewed water with such force and the design was so poor that the floor was sopping wet after each shower. We called about it, and they had someone angle the shower head a little bit differently which helped only a little. The housekeepers talked LOUDLY in the hall during morning hours. The breakfast buffet in the club was dingy and disappointing. While I'd call it an average hotel, for the price (regardless of location) I thought it was not at all worth it. I wouldn't consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, clean rooms and perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Deanna9
Reviews.Content: We had a newly renovated room on the 42nd floor. Our room was clean, had a partial view to Central Park and was convenient to everything!! The front desk check-in/out was quick and efficient, the security people were very helpful when we had questions! Easy to walk all over Times Square/Broadway, Central Park/5th Ave easy walk and subway around corner to get to lower Manhattan. Perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel; great location”
Reviews.Author: lindaabc
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, big hotel in a great location. It's just a few blocks from Radio City Music Hall. I walked down there in about 10 minutes or less. I also walked a few blocks to "Sister Act." ("Sister Act" was fabulous!) I felt safe in the hotel and surrounding areas. The room was not large if you are used to staying in hotels in cities like Las Vegas, but for a New York hotel, it was very nice. Very clean. The bed was comfortable and bed linens were clean. The clerks and other staff were very helpful and polite. I would recommend this hotel as a good place to stay when in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: blackford1
Reviews.Content: I had a great room on the 36th floor, with a view looking south down 7th avenue towards Time Square, and a glimpse of the Hudson River to the West also. Check in line was short when I got there, and the desk clerks were friendly, though I did notice much longer lines at other times during my stay (this hotel seems to be popular with group tours, so I guess it comes down to luck). There is a coffee shop in the lobby with reasonable (for New York) prices. There's free wifi in the lobby, though it's $15 to access from your room. The hotel has a fantastic location, half way between Time Square and Central Park. There are several famous New York deli restaurants nearby, and it's a short walk to either Central Park or most major Broadway shows. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: teedles S
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers. The service was great, rooms nicely sized as were the bathrooms. It was reasonably priced for a great locatilon close to broadway, central park and times square. The beds are super comfortable, shower pressure lousy, no free internet access, but free in the lobby. The room price was reasonable but all the extras are costly. Breakfast although delicious cost us over $100 for 3 of us. The overall service was excellent and responded to all our needs even though the hotel was incredibly busy with guests. I would reccommend this hotel for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay - central location”
Reviews.Author: Barwen
Reviews.Content: Hotel under renovation. Staff available for late check in was limited causing a queue wait of 15 minutes. Rooms good. Elevators insufficient for peak times. However would certainly stay here again for the convenience of location to Broadway, 5th Avenue etc.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel...great location!”
Reviews.Author: Debbie8888
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a 4 star hotel in a great location. We felt very safe walking anywhere at anytime. Very easy to get a Taxi. Close enough to walk to Times Square but far enough to not be in the middle of it. Very close to most Broadway shows. Great lobby! Very nice rooms...except small. Great staff...all very nice. Any requests were followed up by a phone call to make sure the request had been satisfied. The only 'con' was the $14.95/day/computer for internet service in the room. We were gone a lot during the day & could not justify paying that for one computer. We resorted to going down to the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “My best hotel experience in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: Joe W
Reviews.Content: I'm normally pretty critical when I rate hotels and/or expensive purchases, because I believe that if I'm paying for something, I deserve to get a good value for my money. I was somewhat worried after reading some reviews, but this hotel really blew me away. The location was perfect. It's directly between Columbus Circle (the tip of Central Park) and Times Square. What's great about that is that it's a short walk to either, but you don't have the extreme craziness of Times Square right out the front door to the hotel. Per all of the reviews, I knew that a renovated room was a must when staying here. The check in line was a little understaffed and people were being mean to the staff person. We were very nice to her as all people should be, and she told us that she had a nice room available for us early, at around 1:00pm. We went up to the room and it was beautiful. It really couldn't have been any better. No wireless internet, but truthfully, that kept us off our ipad and let us enjoy more of our time there. We are very concerned with cost. We have done well for ourselves, but part of this is because we pay close attention to our costs. We were able to snag this room for just over $200/night including taxes and fees. I would be willing to give the general manager of this hotel $4,000 today to reserve our room for the same two nights every year for the next 10 years, that's how much we enjoyed staying there. We highly recommend it...and to the general manager, I'm serious about that offer! :) You won't regret staying here.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, excelente location”
Reviews.Author: Geomade
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a typical Sheraton, very efficient, clean and helpfull. Near Times Square but not so close that could be noisy. Excelent beds. Bathroom could be bigger, but it was not really a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring New York”
Reviews.Author: TrishaBishop
Reviews.Content: This is a massive hotel. The lobby is enormous. Check in for us was very quick and efficient as it was ~8pm and quiet. We had room 2726 which had been refurbished and was very clean and modern. The lifts are super fast and there are plenty of them to serve this large hotel. Our room had a king size bed, large flat screen TV, great shower and a coffee maker which was much appreciated. We found all the staff to be friendly and helpful during our 2 day stay. The hotel is in a fantasticd location, very close to Times Sq and the theatre district. On our first night we had a few drinks in the hotel bar as we were tired from our journey. It was quite expensive but what I would expect in any UK hotel. The staff were again friendly offering us advice of other places near by. There are plenty of places to get food near the hotel. We went to an Irish Bar next door for lunch the next day which was good pub fare. We also had a few drinks at another Irish bar just around the corner which was again very good value and served decent food. I would probably use this hotel again if I return to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: KateParker
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel then read the reviews on here and was a little bit put off by some of the negativity but when we got there it was wonderful. It was really clean and the cleaners came in every day and did a really good job and all the hotel staff were really friendly. We didn't have any food in the restaurant but we were impressed with the starbucks that was downstairs in the hotel! (I stayed in June 2008 not 2011, it wouldn't let me go back that far but I've only just signed up and loved the hotel so much I wanted to review it) I went with my mum for my 21st and we had a double bed each that was extremely comfy, especially after a long day of shopping!

Reviews.Title: “Not really worth the $”
Reviews.Author: IndianaFSL
Reviews.Content: This would be considered a $90/night hotel anywhere but New York City,and that might be generous. I had a room with a king bed with less than an arm's length clearance on ALL sides. And doing anything more than turning around yourself in the bathroom is out of the question. Cramped spaces aside, be prepared to pay $15/day if you want Internet access in your room - and it's NOT wifi. And another tip - don't pay the expensive prices for breakfast in the hotel. Go outside and grab it for less than $5 from a cart - quick, hot, safe, and filling. Just have cash ready!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Subpar Rooms”
Reviews.Author: abby2992
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton New York Towers in June 2011 for a work event in Lincoln Center. The location was great and made it easy to get fulfill my work obligations while enjoying my downtime. The rooms, though, were disappointing. The paint was peeling and had odd stains on the ceiling of the room. The room was tiny, which is not unusual for New York, but the quality was also pretty dingy. When I was visiting, there was construction scaffolding directly outside my window, giving any construction workers passing by a great view IN TO my room. I am really hoping those windows are tinted... It was an average Sheraton with a great location. President Obama was staying there at the time, so it must be nice in the primo rooms - but you could probably do better for the price if your a regular business traveler like me.

Reviews.Title: “EXCEPTIONAL CUSTOMER SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Burnell H
Reviews.Content: I brought a tour group to this hotel. Jade, reception desk was especially helpful getting us checked in. Marcus, bellman, did a fantastic, timely job of distributing our luggage in spite of rain ....etc. Part of our group had flight delay and Urszula, hostess - Hudson dining room, did a super job of splitting service times to take care of our entire group[. BH - Holiday Vacations

Reviews.Title: “Not worth staying again”
Reviews.Author: Edward-A A
Reviews.Content: It is a disappointing stay. The hotel room is very small and I hear many noise coming from the corridor and even the adjacent rooms! To be fair - the fitness center is ok except it is not free-of-charge. It charges you about USD$10 per visit or USD$20 per your whole stay. It is also very close to the Central Park and good restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel made our NYC trip OUTSTANDING!”
Reviews.Author: Andra W
Reviews.Content: After researching numerous NYC hotels we settled on this Sheraton because of the great location and they had an excellent rate for our dates. I then checked Trip Advisor and was apprehensive to book it based on some negative comments even though there were also many positive reviews, I then called the hotel directly and spoke with Kenny, the front desk manager. He immediately put my mind at ease and assured me our stay would be outstanding - which it absolutely was!!! We arrived after a major diplomatic convention and it was very busy however, our needs were met quickly. When we arrived in our room we were so pleased with the set up, decor and especially the comfy beds and linens. I felt the room was quite spacious by NYC standards. The concierge staff was extremely knowledgable and helpful + they handed out umbrellas during the torential rains on Sept. 23. We were also so surprised when Kenny called directly to our room twice to ensure our stay was up to our expectations. I would highly recommend this Sheraton hotel as it was perfectly located, the staff were friendly, attentive and accomodating. This hotel exceeded all of our expectations and gave us the opportunity to truly experience NYC as we could walk everywhere or hop on the subways which were all very close. Thank you again to Kenny, Mark, Lucas and the others for a special trip my daughter and I will remember forever!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible nights sleep!”
Reviews.Author: JoeTolliver-McGlone
Reviews.Content: We were given a room on the eleventh floor and the room was not at all what the pictures show!The room was very small, the carpet was badly stained throughout, the toiletries were obviously of bad quality and we had no maid service! We called the front desk and requested towels, and they bought us three bath towels only. One of the beds was extremely uncomfortable and leaned to one side, the safe didn't work, and the air conditioner....well, you were either freezing or warm. The common areas were very nice to bad the room and service was so bad.

Reviews.Title: “Request an updated guest room”
Reviews.Author: watkeli
Reviews.Content: I reserved 2 rooms at this hotel through Priceline name-your-own-price and got a fairly reasonable rate (by NYC standards). The location was awesome. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Our 2 rooms were NOT four-star hotel quality as advertised. I have, in all sincerity, stayed in nicer Motel 6's. The rooms were SHABBY. The wallpaper was peeling off the walls. The (full...not queen size) mattress sagged in the middle. The paint on the room heater was chipping off. The bathroom was dingy. The carpet smelled bad. Apparently the hotel is in the process of remodeling and we were assigned to a floor that hasn't been updated yet. Be sure to insist on an remodeled guest room if you stay here. Note: The hotel charges $3.50 per bag to store your luggage with the bellstand folks. You pay when you pick up the bags. Have cash ready!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here. Not worth the price....total ripoff.”
Reviews.Author: PhillyTraveler77
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent business traveler, and longtime SPG member, and have stayed at this hotel at least 20-25 times in the past 10 years. This week, I was in NYC for business, and my how this place has gone downhill. For starters, I reserved a room with one king bed, and was given two doubles upon check-in. The room that I was given (1802) looks like a train wreck. The carpets are dirty and stained. The walls are filthy, and there are holes in the walls where the artwork should be (which is missing). The bathroom is crummy, and the sink is cracked. And the AC doesn't blow cold air (this week was quite hot and humid). Apparently the hotel is undergoing a renovation, but I haven't seen anything that looks remotely new or clean. Not worth $400 a night. Total ripoff.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place”
Reviews.Author: steve_huish
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel prior to going on a cruise from the fairly new Brooklyn terminal. As we were sailing from New York, we decided to add on the extra couple of nights stay after our flight to America to experience New York. This hotel was fantistic in location. Right in the middle of Times Square, seconds away from subway station with easy access to downtown and battery park. Our room was fairly high, which gave even better views over times square. Fantastic little coffee house almost next door and all night deli just round the corner. Lovelly on sight shop and fantastic hotel bar. All the staff bent over backwards to assist us with everything we needed. Very helpful concierge with fantastic knowledge of the areas. Very comfortable rooms, people saying they are small but hey, how long do you stay in your rooms for in this city!! Would certainly return to this amazing hotel. Certainly raises the game for other NYC hotels that I have stayed in!

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton New York”
Reviews.Author: Supriya_11
Reviews.Content: this is the best place to stay in NY...service is excellent..nice ambience ,very good restaurants available nearby...rates are little bit high but worth of it !!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, working on facelift.”
Reviews.Author: BeckyW2770
Reviews.Content: We selected this as a SPG Starwood member. Touring NYC before a cruise. The location is excellent. Midtown close enough to Times Square to walk for sure. The rooms are incredibly small, but that is probably to be expected. In comparison, our cruise stateroom was bigger if you can believe it. The door to our room also had a huge gap so it leaked light into the room from the hall, not to mention it was pretty noisy with the very early risers When we checked out, we asked if we could store our luggage for the day upon our return from our cruise while waiting for our flight. No problem. However, the front desk clerk, none of the three bellman we came across asking to store our stuff never mentioned it was going to be $3.25 per bag. In total we had six bags so it was sort of annoying nobody mentioned this. Probably would have made other arrangements. I just felt since we had just stayed there they should have waived this. To top it off, the bellmen said they had no change so we ended up tipping way more than intended cuz we needed to go. Anyway, just be aware.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but that's it”
Reviews.Author: Cambridge301
Reviews.Content: If you need to be near major attractions and don't mind a lobby full of hundreds of people and very little personal service, than this is the place for you. I was assigned a King room which was quite nice on the 24th floor. My only complaint upon arrival would be that the smell of mildew from the bathroom drove me crazy. I asked it to be cleaned but the smell remained for my entire four day stay. The housekeeping staff is in a word "awful" . I know it's a terribly hard job but when your room doesn't get cleaned when you've been out all day and then you are told that they had many departures that day? Which guest is more important the one that left or the one still in residence? Day two room not cleaned, day three one washcloth and one coffee cup for two of us, day four basic refresh of the room, did not change the sheets and did not vacuum at all. These may seem trivial but if you are paying that weekends going 460.00 rate, is it too much to ask? The A/C only goes to 65f so if you are a person that likes it chilly, you may have a problem. Also, the A/C is motion activated so if you step out of your room it will turn off. Starbucks is served at the bar until 4pm I believe, I did have coffee there once. Both of the in-house restaurants were closed a times for private functions which is fine unless it rains three inches like it did on Friday/Saturday and your forced to go out. The front desk staff that I encountered during check out and check in were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: kmr858
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great location for walking around NYC, great restaurants within walking distance..rooms very clean, comfortable mattress and pillows. Nice amenities Starbucks coffee and tea in room.Desk attendants very helpful. Got a great rate as this was a spur of the moment dash to the city for a fun.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for musical fans”
Reviews.Author: travelxiii
Reviews.Content: If you like seeing musicals or shopping for high-end fashion, this hotel is right for you. For the hotel: The room itself is good enough. comfortable bed and surprisingly quiet The only drawback is the hotel does not provide free Internet access in the room. You can either using the free wifi or the terminals in the lobby area. Phone call are expensive too. For transportation: It is only 5 minutes walk to Times Square the musical theater area. And for the shopping, there is a Subway entrance next to the hotel on 53rd street. Taking Orange line (B/D) one stop East to Rockefeller station, it takes you right on 5th Avenue. Or taking the same line (B/D) one stop north to 59th Street - Columbus Circle (Time Warner shopping center). Also from the same station, you can take Blue line (E) train to World Trade Centre. If you want to visit the 911 memorial site, you can visit the following site to reserve your pass in advance (http://www.911memorial.org/) or show up to the 911 memorial center on Vesey street (East of Church street). They are giving out free passes for same day entry. Just be there in the morning (we got there about 10am and we got the pass for 1:30 PM session to visit the site). For the location: I personally do not like the area - too touristy & few good restaurants. I prefer the Lower East side or Greenwich Village/Chelsea on the West side of the Manhattan - real New York and better shopping experience and better choice of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back for sure....”
Reviews.Author: petizamia
Reviews.Content: Our stay was totally unplanned. Our flights were cancelled due to hurricane Irene and the hotel where we were staying did not honor the original rate so we switched to this hotel. The location is great, the service was fantastic and the rate we got was superb. The room was on the smaller side but didn't spend much time there. We'll definitely, definitely stay here again if we're lucky enough to get the same special rate that we got!

Reviews.Title: “Great for business but not tourist friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Kirsty D
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I stayed at the Sheraton while we were travelling through the States on our way home. Immediately upon arrival I noticed that we were not treated the same as the other guests. While the hotel was undergoing refurbishment to the outside of the building I found it very odd that there was no one to help us with our bags. Our room had a noisy AC and the sheets are really shiny (really noisy if someone is a fidgeter!!) I spoke to the reception about changing rooms because of the AC and they helped us but weren't very polite. I noticed the staff weren't willing to spend much time helping us because their main clientelle were all the business men and women coming to the hotel for conferences. This really was a shame as the location was great, you can see Times Square from the front door and a short walk to Central Park with lots of little bars and restaurants nearby. If the staff had been more helpful I think I would come back, but at the moment...definitely not!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Flannel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night pre cruise so was choice of Princess Cruise Line. Good location, we only had a few hours but as weather was nice were able to walk to Times Square and Rockefeller Centre. Went up to Top Of the Rock, great views of Central Park etc. Nice room on 26th floor with view of 7th Ave, well furnished and comfortable bed Front desk and concierge pleasant and helpful. Had a very good burger in the hotel Hudson Market restaurant. Very busy with tourists and business people and at present covered with scaffolding but for one night perfectly OK.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with a few minor glitches”
Reviews.Author: phenom74
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights for business. My review might be a little biased since I was upgrade to a suite. The hotel is in a good location close to shows, fine restaurants, and casual dining places. If you are looking to stay near Times Square, this hotel is an easy walk away yet far enough to avoid a lot of the big Times Square crowds. The lobby was average in terms of decor, you could tell that this was an older hotel. My room must have been one of the newly renovated rooms - it had really nice and modern furnishings. It was extremely roomy and comfortable. I enjoyed the club lounge which served a good breakfast spread and decent hors d'oeuvres in the evening. The club lounge was very helpful to me because there are 3 computers you can use and also a printer which was free to use. The front desk and concierge met expectations in terms of friendliness and politeness but the other staff blew me away. The housekeeping and maintenance staff that I ran into went out of their way to greet me and made me feel at home. I really appreciated that. As for the minor glitches, there was a fire alarm and I had to walk 31 flights of stairs to the lobby. I guess it was a false alarm but it would have been nice if there was some announcement or someone went to the elevators to tell us so we wouldn't have had to walk down 31 stories. The other issue was I got a call at 5am my last night with no answer on the other end. I assumed it was a wake-up call (which i had NOT requested), unfortunately I could not go to sleep after that.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location”
Reviews.Author: AshJosephM
Reviews.Content: This Sheraton is bustling with people, but it's clientele is still more business centric vs the Mariott Marquis which is a bloody zoo. (I will review that one soon). Across the street you have the Sheraton Manhattan, which is a bit dingy. The hotel is going through a major renovation,and on my recent visit I got upgraded to the renovated floor. It is clean but the average room is still tiny and cramped. If you want a decent sized room (not counting the penthouse suite( in the starwood chain you have to stay at the Westin on 42nd or the Parker Le Meridien rooms are massive too. Both those hotels have premiere location and Fab rooms, but higher price too. Overall, for a place to rest, this place is not bad, it is a standard Sheraton. It is good value for the money. The heavenly bed is phenomenal compared to beds from other chains like the Marriott and Hilton. Last time, I was here the gym was not included in the room fee, but it might be different now, since the hotel is going through major renovation. For quick bite to eat or night out head down a block north to the Iguana bar or the bar next door for some wine flights.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and moderately priced”
Reviews.Author: naptownleader
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Towers was long ago the Hotel Americana. Where once the lobbies were full of airline pilots and stewardesses, they are now swarming with tourists and business travelers from all over the world. The rooms are a reasonable size for a New York hotel and are well appointed for a business traveler. The location is convenient to the theatre, taxis are easy to find and it is just across the street from Bobby Flay's Bar American. Perfect for a quick trip to NYC for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “If you love the noise of New York and other Guests, you've found your home”
Reviews.Author: demaionewton
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton for the Clinton Global Initiative on Poverty. Here's my run down: The great: 1. Location - right near the heart of times square. 2. The Shower - amazing water pressure. They must have bought the elephant shower heads from Kramer when Seinfeld ended. 3. They have Comedy Central on the TV. The Horrible: 1. Could hear my neighbors go in and out all night long. Wouldn't have been so bad if the girl next door didn't wake up crying every hour, all night long. 2. Could hear the traffic as if I was sleeping on the sidewalk, and I was on the 20th floor. All in all, I'd try the Four Points in Midtown next time.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: pepperfgp
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days late August. The location was convenient. The staff very accommodating. Room on the 32nd floor was clean and a good size for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “great staff”
Reviews.Author: lulu h
Reviews.Content: i just wanted to acknowledge a few staff members that helped out with a very important lost item. Anthony, the concierge, George Gamble in security, Lewis in Guest Services, Pearl the floor manager in housekeeping, and David Bascome, Bell Captain all helped out to return my out of town guest's eye glasses. I have stayed in many hotels and may times, lost items are not returned. Not only was the staff helpful and attentive they were very quick, polite, and helpful in assisting in the matter. My family had an overall enjoyable stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: baallen33
Reviews.Content: They are in the middle of renovations. I have stayed here several times. I enjoy it-- great location. In the middle of TimeSquare and Rockerfeller Center..... soo this makes me happy. This stay-- the room was clean. Not perfect. A few (extra) hairs in the bathroom that expected ... but whatever. We are easy going. We will be back! Front desk staff (at least the ONE who checked us in-- not very friendly) but what ever.

Reviews.Title: “Check Your Receipt”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: I have read reviews on this hotel before saying that they charge for items not used, sure enough they charged me for drinks out of the mini refrigerator. I went to the front desk and told them I didn't drink anything and ask when it was done since it is done by computer and he said like 9:45am on the 15th. We didn't check in until after 1:00pm. All in all it was a good room.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: smallbluedog
Reviews.Content: We had an event and a show to attend and were looking for a decent priced hotel for the weekend in the Times Square area. The Sheraton was showing the best price so we booked it. The location is great, within easy walking distance to theater, restaurants etc. The lobby is decent with lots of places to sit. Not much for dining choices within the hotel. The rooms are small and somewhat dated and worn. It was perfectly clean and functional though and that's what we were looking for this weekend. All in all we found this a very serviceable, no frills hotel with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Paying for location”
Reviews.Author: LittleButty
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a nice lobby and lounge, but otherwise you are paying for the location. Only a few blocks from Times Square it's situated on the edges of the theater district. Subway access was easy and there are plenty of good (but expensive) restaurants near by. But know you are buying nothing more than the location. The rooms are tiny and as plain as they could possibly make them. The beds are not very comfy, there is no WiFi in the room and wired internet is ~ $15 a day. $4 per bag to check them with the bell hop, and below average customer service. If you put the "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door they will call your room every hour until you leave. Don't expect much in the way of amenities either and currently the hotel is undergoing construction - however this hotel was pretty sound proof to the noises of Manhattan. I will definitely try staying somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Reno was complete”
Reviews.Author: Infrqnttraveller3
Reviews.Content: Hello everyone My wife and I stayed for 4 nights at this hotel during the 9/11 weekend and were pleasantly surprised at the comfort and convienance of the hotel. We had read negative reviews and were expecting the worse. My wife is a germaphobe and would have changed rooms, hotels or cities if there were any problems. The concierge that we spoke with was very helpful and recommended and very good restaurant that was close, affordable and the food was delicious. One of the receptionists that we spoke with seemed very disinterested in her job and was very rude but that aside that hotel was awesome. The room was clean and recently renovated, the bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom was well supplied and towels were replaced every day. The room had an LCD tv and internet connections. The location is perfect, its close to Fifth Avenue Rockefeller Center, Empire State, Central Park and Times Square and the Subway. We did the Hop on Hop Off which was really convienant and saved us a tonne in Cab fare. 2011.09.08 to 2011.09.12

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Flyr8888
Reviews.Content: Just finished a 4 day stay at Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers. Unfortunately, I'm now covered in bed bug bites. $400+ a night, $10/day for the gym, small rooms, bad service, infested. Too many other options to choose this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Spurpur
Reviews.Content: Nice looking hotel from the inside. Room was clean but a little bit on the smaller side (But this is New York City so...). Location is great because it is only about a 5 to 10 min walk to/from Time square. This is especially a plus if you don't like the noise and people that gather at Time Square in the early hours if you were actually living at Time square. Service was iffy on the other hand. One of my friends wanted to know if there is an internet terminal to check email and the front desk pointed him to the Fedex business office which causes him like 1 dollar a minute while there were several free complimentary internet terminal for guests in the main lobby (which was literally right around the corner from the front desk!). Parking was also kind of expensive but again, this is New York so...

Reviews.Title: “Good Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelladybugOntario
Reviews.Content: This is a well located hotel close to Times Square. We got this using Hotwire.com during peak season so thought the cost/day was reasonable. The service was only okay and even though my husband was a platinum member, they did not give him any privileges because we booked on Hotwire and not directly with the hotel chain. On the plus side, the room was clean and spacious and there is free wi-fi so those were benefits and of course the location. There is also a Starbucks in the hotel for those who need their morning latte fix. Would recommend only if you get a good rate as there are many boutique hotels with better ambience and rates close to Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Not service oriented, small rooms and terrible parking-terrible value!!”
Reviews.Author: BotRoad
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a terribly busy/congested area of the city. I would never stay unless it was the only convenient hotel for business. They are not service oriented in the least bit. Not rude but not helpful at all. Bathroom lighting after being renovated is so dark (assume energy saving bulbs). Hotel only suitable for business travel. Now they charge you for fitness. For the 600 room rate it was definitely NOT worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Once was enough”
Reviews.Author: NoneNamedYet
Reviews.Content: If you're on a high floor, the views are cool. If you have any kind of problem with heights, however, it's a little too intense! The lobby is huge-- the hotel is huge. There's very little about it that feels personal. The rooms are okay-- a little too dark perhaps in the colors they choose. Overall okay-- nothing really comforting about the place. Sheraton is not what it used to be however, and I don't know what the deal is anymore with Sheraton's housekeeping. On entering the room, the first thing we saw was the last guest's panty-house hanging over a piece of furniture. Not sure whether to laugh or cry.

Reviews.Title: “Average - good word for it”
Reviews.Author: jeremymmason
Reviews.Content: This is just a perfectly average, large, well-located, somewhat impersonal Times Square hotel. The staff seems overworked and not as outgoing as the average Starwood hotel (much less than the W just a few blocks away). Room is so-so. No fan in the bathroom, so it fogs up massively. Minimal character. Right closet. And the bathroom had a drain in the middle of the floor (which I think is due to the handicap shower), and it emitted a sewer smell in the mornings when showers were taken. Not great. The bed was lovely, water pressure in shower better than average for NYC; so that made it an average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...if you get a remodeled room”
Reviews.Author: RickInPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: This hotel sits in the middle of everything. Central Park is a few blocks uptown and Times Square/Broadway theater district is a few blocks down. 5th Avenue shopping is a couple of blocks over. Subway stations are all around you. The property has a ton of rooms, so the lobby always feels like Grand Central Station. It's not a quiet place to hang out. But it's big, easy to get through, and you probably don't want to hang out there, anyway. I've stayed here one other time prior to the beginning of remodeling. That room was acceptable, but somewhat dated. This time, I was upgraded to a higher floor and a remodeled room. FANTASTIC. Furnishings are sleek and modern. Bed was very comfortable. Bathroom was clean and had a very nice walk-in tiled shower. Being up high, the views can be very good. If you're having to pay top dollar for a not-remodeled room on a low floor, compare to other hotels first, because what you get otherwise will be mediocre. It seems as though only the top floors of this Sheraton have been re-modeled. Not sure if they'll keep working their way down. My only point of dissatisfaction: as I was leaving, I asked for a cab to the airport from the bellman. Before I could get the words out of my mouth, he had grabbed my bag and threw it into a town car (not a cab), saying it was $40 flat rate. Yes, that was the case and it was a smooth (not smelly), comfortable ride with a very nice driver. Since it was a Sunday morning, there was no traffic and I got to the airport in no time. The driver took neighborhood streets, thereby avoiding a tunnel/bridge toll ($6.00). So, the fare in total ended up being about $10 more than a cab, which I didn't mind all that much. But not really being given the choice (or having been forced to make a big stink), was off-putting. I think the bellmen are in cahoots with those drivers to send them business. If you want a cab, insist on a cab!

Reviews.Title: “welcoming hotel among midtown bustle”
Reviews.Author: Momvet
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two days directly after Hurrican Irene came through the city. Hotel was organized, staff were pleasant and accomodating, and overall experience was very good, mainly because the location (3-4 blocks north of Times Square) allowed easy walking to Central Park, 5th avenue shopping, Times Square/Duffy Square, Theater District and Rockefeller Center as well as St Patrick's Cathedral. Area was well-populated and well-lighted after dark and we never felt unsafe. Club lounge (we are Starwood card holders and were staying on a preferred members floor) was wonderful: spacious, with great views in three directions, complimentary breakfasts, snacks in evening, and soft drinks through the day along with free Wi-Fi. Room was small and basic, but clean and reasonable for the area. I would certainly stay here again, although having a pool would have made my children even happier.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near all of the action in Times Square!”
Reviews.Author: karentf09
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during a short trip to NYC. It was grander than I expected which was a plus. The rooms were kind of small but very clean. The staff was always very friendly (housekeeping greeting you in the hallway and the concerige always had great recommendations). The best part was definitely the location. Literally within walking distance of Times Squares, Central Park, eateries, and the best shopping!

Reviews.Title: “My New New York Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LUV2VISIT
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week with my mom on business. I got a club level room that was nicely remodeled. The location of the hotel is within walking distance of many of the major New York attractions: Times Square, Central Park, Broadway and Fifth Avenue shops. There is a very nice workout room on the lower level and of course those SPG beds are the ultimate in comfortable sleeping! The staff was always helpful and we really did enjoy access to the club lounge where we enjoyed breakfast, nightly hors d'oeuvres and coffee 24/7. This is my new place to rest my head in New York!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT, EXCELLENT, EXCELLENT!!!”
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times because of the location, the facility and the outstanding service. My last visit to the hotel was during the "hurricane Irene" weekend. Although there was chaos in the city, I was amazed at how the management and staff were able to keep up their excellent service. I have stayed at most of the larger hotels in New York and I would recommend this hotel over any other.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not worth the price or the 4-star rating”
Reviews.Author: zaxe
Reviews.Content: This property was okay in my book. The place is dated - and the updates are more of the same - old-school "luxury" with dark decor, dark woods, wallpaper and tiny spaces. While Sheraton says that the rooms have been updated, I found it hard to believe that I was staying in an "upgraded, recently renovated" room. The furniture was dated, window treatments out of style and the bathroom beyond tiny. About the nicest thing in the bathroom was the marble countertop, which had no function other than to hold the sink and toiletries. For the price of this hotel, I would expect better amenities, upgraded toiletries, larger bathrooms and fixtures, and a more open, airy feel. That said, if you prefer the heavy, dark, "old world" luxury feel, this may be the place for you, One of the best things about this location is that it is within 2-4 minutes walk of Times Square, and being on the north end and really close to the theaters themselves, you get the convenience of Times Square without the noise. I've stayed AT Times Square in multiple locations, and all but the DoubleTree, Hilton, and W suffer from the major noise issue. they charge for holding luggage, which at this price point is absurd. I've stayed at similar properties in the Financial District and on 5th Avenue who did not charge for holding luggage. Be warned, the hotel's site often shows that it has a parking package, which leads you to believe that they have a parking garage. This is NOT the case. The garage adjoining the hotel does not belong to Sheraton and you will have to end up paying $50-$60 to park your car there. This was not a nice lesson to learn, especially since their website (at the time I made the booking) did not explain this. Also, stay away from the " free upgrade" to king rooms - unless you're on the executive/Club Sheraton floor, these are beyond tiny and difficult to maneuver, and tend to be stuck in the corners of the building with 3-4 other rooms whose doors open onto each other so the noise and foot traffic are high.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Adequate Room”
Reviews.Author: bawdyjane
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location in NY - if you're a walker I completely recommend it, a couple blocks from Broadway, great eateries at your fingertips (have yet to eat at the hotel yet) Rooms were clean, bed was comfortable and bathroom nice - I had one of the renovated rooms but understanding is that all rooms are now up to date. Larger than other rooms I've had staying in NY, would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience, surpassed expectations”
Reviews.Author: Lei L
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the wonderful General Manager, Mark, who personally accommodated our requests to stay in a renovated room. We were so excited to end up on the 43rd floor with amazing views, and pleasantly surprised when we had a basket of fruit with a personalized card by Mark delivered to our room. We extended our stay because it was THAT great. Wonderful staff, lovely room, comfy bed, great views..what more could you ask for? The hotel itself is next to Times Square and close to so many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “great trip”
Reviews.Author: KAMCG
Reviews.Content: The sheraton was a great hotel very clean i got a great deal thru priceline.com and was very happy with the stay. My husband and I stayed 2 nights and were upgraded to a king bed the hotel breakfast was not great if you go around the corner they have a great deli thats better for breakfast. The staff was friendly and the concierge Anthony was the best he printed up all kinds of menus for rest we werent sure if we wanted a steakhouse mexican etc and he took the time to get them together for us. all in all it was a great stay i would def stay there again

Reviews.Title: “A Tower near the Square”
Reviews.Author: Brian1311
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for the 2011 World Police & Firefighters Games. Hotel was positioned in a busy but perfect spot for public transport, sight seeing and exercise. Hotel room was standard with a king size bed that was very comfortable. The decor was a little out dated but that was not an issue. The house keeping service was good. Free WiFi in lobby but very slow due to band width v volume of people using. WiFi is available in the rooms but at a $15 charge per day which was very disappointing. Food and drink was very expensive with much better options a 2 minute walk from hotel. Most staff were professional and nice with the occasional rude or blunt employee (I suppose you will find one almost anywhere) The hotel charges from the use of their fitness center which is also disappointing. The hotel gave good communication through Tropical Storm Irene which was a proactive move from hotel management. Overall, a solid hotel. Not sure if I would stay again but if I was not given the option I would not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it”
Reviews.Author: Paulista_1710
Reviews.Content: Disappointing. The shower water didn't heat, the room was too small, without much comfort. The location is good, but there are better options in the region.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Love2TravelFreqently
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located within walking distance of Times Square, Central Park and subways. It was very clean and had all the ammenities of a large hotel. The room was clean and large compared to the normal New York hotel room. The concierge was really helpful and recommended a great bar at the top of the Dream Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel right in the middle of it all”
Reviews.Author: kkrebsbach
Reviews.Content: Service was great, room was really nice, great bakery in the morning. Our concierge John was fantastic in recommending restaurants and making reservations for us.(even sent us a little desert at one of our favorite places) He went above and beyond. Also the front desk was great in spite of the long line. could use more people staffing it on a busy weekend like Labor Day though. Awesome door service too. People were really nice and very fun here. Beds were fantastic too, room spacious for NY. Property has obviously been renovated, there are few remnants of the old but they're trying hard to upgrade everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent rooms, shame about the terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Pabandlil
Reviews.Content: My partner and I arrived at the Sheraton New York on Wednesday 31st August, both looking forward to our stay in New York to celebrate my partner's 30th birthday. Initially upon check in, the service was good as we thought we'd been upgraded to a better room - we later discovered this wasn't the case. We should've been staying in a refurbished room, as arranged by my travel agent back in January 2011, but were swiftly 'upgraded' to the 30th floor. The beginning of our problems. While we enjoyed our first trip to New York, we came back after a trip out to find our room was open. I assumed it had been left open by a cleaner and wasn't too worried as all our things were still where we left them and nothing had been taken. However, the next night, we returned to our room to find we couldn't get in. I spoke to a rather rude woman on reception who didn't appear to understand English when I explained the situation. She re-activated our key card only on the production of my driving licence (good job I brought it!) as she wouldn't let me back in the room without any ID - even though our passports were still in the room. This was cleared up and again, we gave the hotel staff the benefit of the doubt as it is a busy hotel and mistakes will undoubtedly be made. But there's more. The next day we recieved a receipt which made absolutely no sense whatsoever, but mentioned a $213:00 bill which we could not work out what was for. Upon checking out on Sunday morning (4th) we were advised that $213:00 had been taken from my partner's account without her authorisation (she gave her card details to hold $50:00 upon checking in in case of use of room service/mini bar). We were told this $213:00 charge was for parking (no, I didn't drive all the way from England) and, would you believe, a toothbrush. This money had already been deducted from my partner's account and we had to argue our case to a rude member of staff who offered very little in the way of an apology. To make matters worse, my partner was told she would have to wait up to a week until the money was processed back into her account. We were asked to store our cases for a charge of $3:60 per case, despite their glorious incompetence, and my partner had to ask for this to be waived. My partner was also told to be quiet when she asked the memeber of staff dealing with this what was happening with her money as he 'was working'!! The level of customer service, we feel, was very poor indeed. We've stayed in many hotels all over the world and never come across such appalling service. I am not a grumbling old man, nor have we ever complained about poor service before, but we do feel we deserve at least an apology or compensation, neither of which have been offered. Despite this, we did have a fabulous time in New York. We found the rooms to be comfortable, the beds were fantastic, and our room was clean. The cleaners were by far the friendliest of staff. Overall, this didn't spoil our holiday, but we have now been inconvenienced as we are now missing £135:00 until the end of the week (provided it actually goes back into my partner's account). We won't be returning to any Sheraton hotel in the future but can't wait to return to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Always reliable property, great location and service, and newly remodeled!”
Reviews.Author: BobRen62
Reviews.Content: I've probably stayed here many dozens of times going back too many years, and always return. The hotel is in a truly great location -- close to the theater district and Times Square, without being "too close," and a very short walk to Central Park. The physical infrastructure has been recently upgraded and the improvements are very welcome -- the room was sparkling clean and nicely appointed - a far cry from the often too dark and gloomy rooms of the past. The service is as excellent as always. I'm always greeted with a nice "welcome back" by whomever checks me in.....they consistently and warmly recognize loyalty. This time there was a nice new surprise...a pre-visit call and e-mail from Lacey Lazarus, the SPG Supervisor who wanted to know if she could do anything for our arrival. As I was staying for the night with my 6-year old, she cheerfully arranged for the proper bedding and when we checked in, milk and cookies were sent up to the room -- a really nice personal touch. The Club Lounge has also been remodeled, but thankfully the one thing that has stayed the same is the spectacularly warm and generous service provided by Mohammed. Mohammed always recgognizes us and gives us his usual big greeting and welcome, and watches after us the entire time we're there in the club. Just seeing his familiar face again makes us happy. He's great.!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: AlexandraCastro613
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out, I felt like I belonged here at the Sheraton. My first trip to NYC was fantastic thanks to the staff. Christina at check-in was fabulous. Christian during the overnight shift was super friendly and personable. He recognized my platinum status and made me feel valued. Irene at check-out was super sweet. All the club lounge associates were perfect! But, my favorite employee was Tommy in the club lounge. Every day I went to the club lounge, he made me feel special. Tommy is the prime example of an outstanding employee and one who really goes above and beyond to make the guests satisfied. He knew where I liked to sit in the lounge and always asked what NYC adventures I did that day. Tommy made my stay memorable. I will definitely never forget his hospitality. As a hospitality employee also, that was super important to me. The staff definitely nailed it! The rooms & location was great too! Thank you staff & Tommy for an incredible stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Freswaterxx
Reviews.Content: Had one issue with dirty water coming from bathroom tap but had a room change without any fuss or bother ,staff were very helpful and friendly.The location was great ,close to eveything , the room was good and the bed wonderful,We will be back and we will recommend this hotel to everyone

Reviews.Title: “I would come back to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jax_krish
Reviews.Content: The biggest plus for this hotel is it's location. It is close to everything you could think of from the NY subway to everything to even the NYC info center. We got upgraded(superior) rooms which were just about ok. My friend apparently found his bathroom was kinda dirty. The people at the front desk( gave us an early checkin and late checkout) and concierge were helpful but both departments were understaffed. Same for housekeeping....the time spent waiting can get on your nerves. So bottom line is I would go back to this hotel purely for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Wait until the renovation is complete”
Reviews.Author: Victoria499
Reviews.Content: Our expectations about the hotel were dashed on arrival. The check in staff were unhelpful and hostile. When we arrived in our room the carpet was filthy, lots of stains on the floor - some of which included blood. We complained and asked for a room change immediately, the receptionist did not seem suprised and moved us straight away, room was tired but clean. When we checked that 50th floor we could see that was much newer so I'd advise to stop on the higher floors. On our final day the maids tried to enter the room @ 08:30am in the morning, this was dispite the do not disturb sign on the door. The positive was that the location was great, a 2 minute walk from Times Square. We are not serial complainers and are a really relaxed family, we were however not willing to accept such poor conditions and would not stay at the hotel until the renovation is complete.

Reviews.Title: “Great People, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OttawaNYFan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights in August, 2011. The hotel was busy, but that did not mean that the service was compromised at all. The staff were fantastic. In particular, I want to mention Adam, who walked the registration line assuring guests that they would be taken care of soon. When we encountered a slight glitch, Adam was right there to smooth out the issue and offer us an upgrade. He definitely exemplified what every hotel employee should be. In addition, the front desk manager, Kenny, was terrific. When we had to extend our stay, Kenny was accommodating and helpful. I couldn't have asked for a more attentive manager. The hotel itself is clean and situated in an ideal location - close to everything including Time Square, restaurants, landmarks, etc. I had asked for a quiet room, and while we were in the middle of the city that literally never sleeps, we heard virtually no street noise and were able to sleep in the comfortable beds that the hotel offers. All in all, this hotel is a great find and when you go, don't forget to ask for Adam and Kenny and tell them that you heard about them on tripadvisor!!

Reviews.Title: “Watch Your Reservation”
Reviews.Author: WiseTravelingGeek
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 10 AM. The receptionist said that the check-in time was at 3 PM, while we had requested an early check-in when we made our reservation. We went out and came back at 6 PM. The receptionist said that they had oversold our kind of room and we couldn't use that room anymore. We had reserved a Club Lounge room more than a month ago. We called the manager and he started arguing with us. He said that we could either wait until the next day or degrade our Club Louge room with 2 queen beds to a regular room with 1 king bed. We had 2 children with us and the manager would not understand. Finally, after 20 minutes of arguing, the manager said that we could use our original room. So, from the beginning, the manager was lying to us. He just wanted to sell our room for a higher price to somebody else. It was a horrible experience. I had been to many hotels in New York before, like Hilton and Sofitel. This was just the worst. Never going back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay, hated the luggage check”
Reviews.Author: aquagirl101
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I came back since 2004 and was so pleasantly surprised. The club level rooms and lounge are now amazing. Got upgraded to a suite on 49th floor and it almost felt like a luxury penthouse apartment. Service was also top notch - especially from Zoe. I really loved my stay. A few days later I realised that I left some items in my room. I was pretty sure it's a lost cause but called them anyway - and they had all my items and got them back to me. I was very impressed (and happy). Really wanted to give my review 5 stars, but one thing disappointed me. After checking out I needed to store my luggage for a few hours. The bell man shrugged and pointed me to the back area for storage. I was obviously struggling with 2 huge suitcases but he didn't even try to help. I went to the back area and they charged $3.50 per item. That was quite surprising - totally cheapened my great experience until then.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Jo M
Reviews.Content: Don't let the outside construction turn you off this hotel. The location is excellent, close to everything, we even could see Central Park from our hotel room. As others have mentioned there is a subway located just opposite the hotel which makes getting around easy (although you will probably opt to walk most of the time!). The lobby is always busy, but the rooms were quiet. We had a double room which was spacious, huge bathroom as well. I would definitely recommend this hotel to other travellers who are looking for a great central location.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly RUDE & un helpful”
Reviews.Author: brin710
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of June 2011. On arrival we found that the line for check in was huge. Once at the desk we were told that despite booking 1 Twin superior and 1 Double Superior room we were to be allocated 2 Standard Rooms. The receptionist said there was no way our booking could have been confirmed as the hotel had sold out of superior rooms at the time we made the booking. She flatly refused to help us despite us having booking confirmation that clearly showed the type of room we had booked. It turned out that any booking made through a 3rd party (in our case Hotels.com) was automatically allocated standard rooms. We chose to contact Hotels.com directly. I have to say they were very helpful and insisted that the hotel had broken the contact they had with them. Within 45 mins reception called our room and as if by magic they had found us superior rooms on a higher floor of the hotel. You would not believe the difference between a standard and superior room in this hotel. The hotel staff remained rude and un helpful through the duration of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not so friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: pcbbs
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ok not somewhere I would take the kids to.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel and wonderful location.”
Reviews.Author: tcrust
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very accommodating for a family or a single. The location is the best in NYC. Close to everything including subways.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back”
Reviews.Author: John L
Reviews.Content: I travel the U.S. and Canada weekly and stay at lots of three and four star hotels. Sheraton Hotel and Towers NYC is a great location in midtown...just about four blocks from Central Park and close to great shopping. Newly renovated rooms are very well appointed. New air conditioning system in rooms is very efficient and comfortable. Beds are on a par with Westin. Service here is good, especially for a hotel with so many guests. For preferred Starwood guests, the club lounge breakfast is one of the best I've experienced. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Wonderful Location!”
Reviews.Author: JGAGNON67
Reviews.Content: After booking this hotel at a fabulous rate thru priceline, I immediately went to trip advisor and read the reviews...I got scared!! There were so many negative reviews. I am so glad to say that the hotel was fabulous! We arrived with another couple and received rooms side by side. We were put on the 43rd floor and had a wonderful view of the city! The rooms were very new and nicely decorated. They may have been a tad small, but this is New York! Besides, the size was absolutely fine for the time we spent in there. I never had to wait in a long line up to speak to a staff member. We were there during Hurricane Irene and I didn't feel the least bit scared. The hotel did a good job keeping the guests informed and happy. This hotel is in a very good location - you can walk almost anywhere from here.

Reviews.Title: “best location and staff”
Reviews.Author: shelley9038
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved the hotel from the moment i checked in! Stayed in a renovated room, it was very clean and fairly spacious for manhatten. All staff were very friendly and made me feel that they appreciated our business. Sheraton staff kept us well informed during the hurricane which we very much appreciated. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC looking for a superb location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but non-existent hospitality - like a railway waiting room”
Reviews.Author: PrasannaSM
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at a fabulous location, but in terms of hospitality, it did not even have a semblance of it. It is like a big railway station with people coming and going. Service is non-existent and there is a very high probability of theft or other security problems. God forbid, if ever there was to be an emergency event, I am sure there would be total chaos in this hotel. Room was very small and had a window looking out to the backside. Bathrooms were not cleaned very well and the showers were pathetic. The hotel does not provide internet access neither any breakfast. If you are driving to the hotel, parking charges are exorbitant and stay in hotel does not give any rebates. In my last visit to Manhattan, I stayed at another hotel in 26th Street, where I got all the benefits I have referred above, with an equally comfortable and clean room, definitely much better. And at a lower price. Parking was 75% of what I paid at this hotel. The hotel is definitely over-charging its customers. Check-in and check-out process are like that of an Indian government department. I had to wait in a long queue for both the occasions. I am not sure whether this hotel has any restaurants, but that is not a problem as there is a wide variety of eating choices as you step out of the hotel on 7th avenue and in the 6th Ave as well. The cafe at intersection of 7th and 55th street was particularly good for its breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “I survived hurricane Irene at this hotel, and glad I did.”
Reviews.Author: inthevalley
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Sheraton Towers in New York City. The rooms have all been remodeled and are very nice and comfortable. I was stranded here during Hurricane Irene, and I must say the hotel did a great job of handling what could have been a disaster. We received updates, sometimes more than one a day, letting us know what we would be facing and how we could protect ourselves. I give this hotel five stars for getting their guests through this scary situation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Tazdog95
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my first trip to New York City. It was for business and pleasure. The hotel was in a great location minutes from Times Square, Central Park and Fifth Avenue. The staff and management were very accomodating during the Hurricane Irene scare.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better”
Reviews.Author: terere2
