Reviews.Content: There are so many choices in New York and this hotel does have a great location. Service feels indifferent, the hotel is being renovated and it is large and crowded. We were at the Westin the night before and there was a world of difference. The gym is spacious but there is a charge. The Club Lounge is a pleasant refuge and doesn't seem to be as frenzied following the redecoration. There is a lot of potential here but it feels like a convention hotel without much heart. Of course, having the elevator system on the fritz added to the claustrophobia. We were very concerned that we'd miss the opening of 'The Book of Mormon' due to an excessive wait for a car.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tenholder113
Reviews.Content: I was here for a 6 nights at a tradeshow that was in the hotel each day. Had it not been for such a great location to all the iconic NYC sights, I would have gone crazy. Walking distance to Times Square, Hell's Kitchen, Central Park. Plus, buy a "Hop on, Hop off" bus pass. Perfect way to see the sights. Subway line right outside as well.

Reviews.Title: “Even in hurricane conditions, the staff was top notch”
Reviews.Author: jdstein2714
Reviews.Content: I brought my daughter to NYC for a small vacation before she left the country for a year of school. I try to always stay at a Starwood facility to earn points for stays just like this one. When we got to NYC on Wedn esday,we had no idea that we would be facing Hurricane Irene! Up to and through the storm, the staff was top notch! They were so attentive and caring. A special thank you to the following: the staff at the Club Room, Amalia at the Front Desk, and to the manager Zoe. When my daughter's flight on Sunday was delayed by several days, I needed to arrange for a longer stay. I was very stressed at the time because I had not planned to stay for additional days and was concerned about the availability of the hotel and also the daily room rate. Amalia kept me calm while she helped me to extend my stay. Zoe was quite helpful, extending my stay at a reduced rate. During our stay, we were taken care of by the Club Room staff. They kept us comfortable with food and even gave us table games to play to pass the time when we were required to stay inside during the storm. I have always felt I got excellent service at Starwood properties, but with the test of the hurricane, everything could have been an ongoing disaster. The people at this hotel, especially the Club Room staff, Amalia and Zoe, worked hard to make this stay not only NOT a disaster, but actually a pleasure. I would recommend this hotel facility highly.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, crowded, generally unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: Jack_Islington
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business. Only upside: cheap for New York City, but you get what you pay for. The staff is poorly trained, and largely indifferent to guests' needs. Long lines at check in. The new lounge is a joke. Rooms are adequate but old.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the location”
Reviews.Author: Kittykat0
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all about the location, it's right in Times Square perfect for getting out and about. The hotel itself was huge people always milling aroung the foyer. Roon was fine standard size for New York, although it was fine for our stay I don't think I'd rush back there are plenty of other Hotels to try in New York!

Reviews.Title: “very good location”
Reviews.Author: jelena1803
Reviews.Content: Very good location. On the half way from Times Square and Central Park. Incredible thing is elevator. It was so fast. Halls were cold but rooms very quite good temperature. i have expected much ore noise from outside but I an say the noise isolation is good :). Large and high bed, clean sheets. All in all bedroom was o.k. Hotel personal was polite and helpful. But hotel lobby has only few computer with free internet and they were constant occupied.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, but the hotel service and cleanliness was horrible!”
Reviews.Author: Tony D
Reviews.Content: We got two rooms and asked for Queen/King beds in each. Called a week earlier to confirm. Concierge confirmed. When we get to hotel, concierge apologized and said there were only rooms with two double beds. To make up for the issue, they offered each room $50 in-room credit, which we were thankful for. However, when we got to the room, one room had a full bar of soap stuck in the toilet bowl. We called front desk to get it removed. When the serviceman came in, he viewed the soap and said "it was fine" and told us not to worry. On the second night, the hot water was shut down for over 6 hours. When I went downstairs to tell the concierge, they presented a printed letter to me informing all residents of the planned shutdown. This letter was not given to any of the tenants, as there were a fair amount of upset folks, and a huge pile of the letters next to the concierge. The final strike was when we were packing up to checkout. As we did our usual under-the-bed check, we noticed a huge mess of garbage, pills, tags, and dirt that has not been cleaned in a LONG time. We took photos and attached it to this review. However, we really did enjoy the location, but would not recommend this hotel as a 4 star to ANYONE!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, TOO MANY PEOPLE!”
Reviews.Author: Lane H
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel for cheap on our first trip to New York City, nice hotel, but we've figured it wasn't in a good location to our liking. Very close to Times Square, without being in the heart, but there was way too many people, and touristy people at that. The room itself was nice, but small. The next time we went to NYC (March 2011), we stayed at the Loews Regency, and it was a TON better. Worth the extra money and in the bottom of the Upper East Side.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: pattyvs
Reviews.Content: So I was really uncertain about this hotel when it was revealed to me through hotwire. It said 4 stars but from reading all the negative reviews I was certain that I had been had. On the contrary, I walked into a lovely, spacious, very clean lobby, and checked in within minutes. I have to mention that I did check in at 6 which is much later than most like to check in, however I found the front desk to be very pleasant. I was still nervous though about the room situation but they helped me out by changing my one queen bed into two doubles without extra charge as I has feared, and the room was really nice. Apparently from reviews I've read, the sheraton is in the middle of renovating all of its rooms so i guess some are still dated, but ours definitely was not. It was small though, but fine for the sleeping we planned on doing in it. Other than that , the room looked immaculate as did the bathroom. White, without any mold. The sheets looked crisp and clean and the room was very modern and sleek looking. I was very relieved and happily surprised. Due to the room sizes and thn walls, I still don't see this as a four star hotel but a nice 3 .3 for cleanliness, pleasant staff, room decor and overall hotel appearane. Location is great if you're a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and great service!”
Reviews.Author: DippyDan23
Reviews.Content: We were really pleased with this hotel. It was a great central location for us. All the staff that we encountered were very nice and very helpful. We loved the Club Lounge for breakfast and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “right in the middle of all the action”
Reviews.Author: JTTsports
Reviews.Content: great place to stay to see manhatten!!! you are within walking distance of all the action. Very easy to see everything...staff was good. bring extra money as place is very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Best night EVER !!!”
Reviews.Author: Bvrly90210
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for a night in Manhattan to celebrate my upcoming wedding. One of my friends took care of the hotel reservations and she booked us at the Sheraton. The location of the hotel is so perfect. We got to our suite and it was so great. Their was a lot of space, and we had a great view. The room could not have been any better. One of the managers Kenny Imafidon really helped us and went above all expectations to make our stay very memorable. The whole experience I could not have imagined any more perfect. Thank you to the staff and especially Kenny for making our stay so enjoyable. I can't wait until we can plan another night in the city -I will most defiantly stay here again !

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: sarahmltravels
Reviews.Content: This past weekend, my girlfriends and I were looking to celebrate one of their upcoming weddings. We reached out to the Sheraton and were looking for accomadations for a suite with at least one room. Not only were my requests met, but exceeded. With the help from manager Kenny Imafidon, who helped handle my stay personally, we had an extraordinary visit to Manhattan. (Thanks Kenny!!!) Not only was all staff friendly, space was accomadating and comfortable, and our view was incredible. I would definitely return to the Sheraton for future visits into the city :) (Not to mention it is in a great location in the city!!) Overall, the hotel contributed to a memorable night and was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value. Not up to par with the Sheraton brand”
Reviews.Author: Wagumbi
Reviews.Content: I stay in hotels 30 to 40 nights per year, mainly on business, however this stay was personal. The good: -Comfy beds and linen The bad: -Bathrooms very small. Barely room for 1 person. No towel rack. First hotel I have been at that the towels are on a shelf 2" off the floor -Very poor service. In the 3 days I stayed there I have 3 examples. First there was supposed to be a hairdryer in the room but there was not, after 2 calls and 25 minutes they finally brought one. Second example is for this type of price you would expect the bathroom to be cleaned properly. The bathroom countertop was not cleaned. I was able to tell as they did not move a single toiletry on the counter. The shower was also not cleaned as the piece of tape I had left in the bathtub was still there after cleaning. The third example is one of simple courtesy. Both my wife and my key did not work when we got back to the hotel after dinner. After going back downstairs and waiting in line I informed the staff that the key did not work. All he said was "what is your room number and name" when the proper response should have been more like "I am terribly sorry for the inconvenience..." He basically made you feel that he was doing you a favour by reporgramming the key. -Cheep feeling for a high price. Disposable cups rather than glass, no robes, bare bones room. -Lastly they have no security and at 5am a dozen people piled into the room next door and had a noisy party.

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVED IT AND WE'LL BE BACK”
Reviews.Author: khalid12345
Reviews.Content: i like to highlight the great friendly behaviour , kind sweet approach and outstanding performance and great maaners of three staff, i felt like home with them . please i want to say big thank you : * tomas rodriguez and barbara g ( lounge executive) and nicole from concierge desk. but the front desk staff horrible horrible big time ... very rude , unfriendly approach , just misreable .. not a minimum kindness. i hate the minute when i need something from the reception staff. they need to be monitored very closely for this hotel to grow better .

Reviews.Title: “Nickel and Dime ya!”
Reviews.Author: Juniorm009
Reviews.Content: The only unfortunate thing I remember about this hotel is that they will nickel and dime you to get an extra dollar. An attempt was made to charge $30 dollars per day for a roll-away bed that was more metal than mattress (cushion). $3.25 per luggage (or any other item) to store it for a few hours. $15 dollars per day for Internet service in the room; it was free in the lobby area but limited to 30 minutes before you had to start the process all over again. The only bright spot was Mike Pacheco, an employee at the front desk who was definitely working for the wrong organization and went out of his way to help with these issues.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the Price”
Reviews.Author: kate77Cleveland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights while at a conference on the property. Nice, clean rooms. Priced well. Great location. Friendly front desk staff. One suggestion - request a high floor. On the 27th floor street noise was still an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Lizziepvb
Reviews.Content: I will not waste any more of my time on this property, but to help those planning to stay at this Sheraton. When booking you should only request a newly renovated room. Its as if the non-renovated rooms are literally ignored. Just disgusting in every way; mold and dust on the a/c unit; mildew in the showers; beds are small and uncomfortable; and NO WIFI! in a $400 dollar room? And a 30 minute limit if you use the complimentary wifi in the lobby. I will never stay at this hotel again- even with a new room - just awful, and a rip-off.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed it and will be back”
Reviews.Author: Peter C
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers was a good one. It met our expectations and everyone was so helpful.Especially, Anthony Velasquez, the concierge, he went out of his way to answer our questions and gave us directions and all informations that we required to make our trip smooth. He is so knowledgeable and his customer service skills is excellent. I would recommend his services to anyone who stays at this hotel in the future. Thanks Anthony for making our stay confortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: bahamaladie
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a couple days in New York. My treat to my daughter for her birthday, we had a great time. I booked our hotel on line through travelivory, got such a great deal. But when I checked out the reviews on Trip Advisor, I wanted to scream. But after calling the hotel, all my fears disappeared, We were upgraded to one of the new rooms, U could still smell the newness in the halls, I've never seen doors that tall in a hotel, I loved everything about the room. The beds were so comfortable. Quiet air conditioner, Eventing was just great! Sheraton we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Location is great!”
Reviews.Author: onemoretime
Reviews.Content: Had a two night business trip for a conference here. Great conference rate and a great location for taking a walk around Times Square. Tons of shopping and great restaurants a block or two away. Rooms are newly remodeled and mine was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL”
Reviews.Author: limlira
Reviews.Content: Terrible hotel, had a reservation for 7 days and we left on the 3rd day. Three days elevators broke down , dirty sheet, towels with holes. Dirty dusty room . I would not recommend, never return. Paid full price and was told that the hotel had 2000 rooms and that they could not control everything. Buiiding under refurnishments.

Reviews.Title: “Big Brash hotel in great position”
Reviews.Author: Solihull
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the action, this is the hotel to be in. Massive, but well run with good basic facilities. It is possible to get a good deals here, but be prepared to pay over the odds, although you are in the world's greatest city (in my opinion). Food and beveridges are expensive, but good quality and nice atmosphere. Always like going to Rosie O'Grady's just over the road ( American helpings!!) Top tip ! - if you have a few dollars over at the end of the trip, arrange for limo transfer back to the airport. We paid just $8 more for a full stretch limo - nice, experience (if a bit Tacky!)

Reviews.Title: “Only one redeeming thing about this hotel and her name is "Joy"”
Reviews.Author: Tracey A
Reviews.Content: After waiting two hours for a room, only to find it was on a floor noisier than the street outside and lacking A/C, I stumbled downstairs to beg for mercy. The lobby line was at least 100 people long. The assistant who helped me, "Joy" reluctantly told me that there were no available rooms; however she looked unhappier about it than I did! She asked for my cell phone number....and within 20 minutes, not only did she find us three rooms (there were several of us traveling) but she added $75 credit to my room. The new room was just as hot (thankfully not as noisy) and they didn't deliver a fan until 2 am to cool off the room.... but being treated with such compassion was so noteworthy that I wanted to point her out specifically. This hotel is rather dumpy, the rooms are small and shabby (from the 20th floor and down) but if you find yourself needing to stay here, seek out Joy! She's that wonderful!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: wamby101
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights four days. It was great. Good location within walking distance to so many sights. Friendly staff. Was able to check in at 11 Am. Room was nice and quiet!

Reviews.Title: “We had a pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: csserious
Reviews.Content: Despite many bad reviews, we decided to give it a try and booked a room for 3 nights. We left New York with pleasant memories. Manhattan hotels do not come cheap and the room was small. We also missed a fridge. The biggest advantage is it is a short walk from all the major attractions in Manhattan. The staff was courteous and helpful. The air-conditioner worked just fine. We booked a superior room and got it on the 33rd floor. However, the view was obstructed by the tall towers across the street. There are plenty of restaurants and delis within a block, some are 24/7. I have no problem staying there again if Sheraton offer a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Filthiest hotel in NYC -- Time for a change!”
Reviews.Author: Bus_Travel_TX
Reviews.Content: A SPG Platinum member, I travel to New York almost monthly. I usually stay at the Sheraton, primarily because of it's convenient location. Service is never good, the hotel has never been anything special, but it works for business travel. I think it's now time for a change! This week I arrive at 3:00 pm (check in time) to be told that there were no king size bed rooms, even though I had reserved one. My option, I was told, was to take a king bed in the older, non-remodeled part of the hotel or take two doubles in the new section. I opted for the newly remodeled rooms. After all, the navy and emerald green theme n the older rooms is about 10 years past it's prime. When I arrived at my room, it was very dirty. It appears that the remodel crew simply grouted over mildew in the shower (see photos) and the carpets looked like tey had not been vaccumed in weeks. There was crumbs and garbage from previous guests. Clearly the housekeeping staff had not done a good job, there was even a NY Yankees baseball cap in the corder by the drapes... left by a previous guest I assume, in a location that the housekeeping staff just never looks at. Things get worse. When I return from my business day on day one, at 7:00 pm, the room had not been made up. I called service express and asked that housekeeping clean the room. At this point I was not really upset, since i was going to dinner anyway. They said "no worried." When I got back from dinner, at about 9:00 ... I returned to a dirty room still. I called again, and was told that they would be right up. 10:00pm, no housekeeping and another call to service express. By this time i was upset and asked for a confirmation of time when the housekeeping staff would be there to clean my room. No return call, and no housekeeping. Finally, I went to bed (in the other bed, good thing I had two doubles I guess.) In the morning I had to walk to the linen closet to get my own fresh towels. I was never happier to check out. The hotel renovation is well designed, for sure. But the hourecleaning staff and overall service quality has me now looking for a new place to stay when in New York. I have been told that the Westin Element hotel. just up the street at 39th and 8th is new, clean AND less expensive. I will remain true to starwood .. but give up on the Sheraton. It's the pitts!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I have EVER stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: hannah h
Reviews.Content: This hotel was by far the worst or at least in the top 2 of the worst hotels I ever stayed at and I travel a lot! First of all let me start off by saying we had to switch rooms 3 times! Our first room had NO air conditioning and no LOCK! We called up the hotel maintenance man and he told us it had been broken a while and the hotel most likely new, but just wouldnt fix it. So we asked to switch rooms that night but the hotel staff very rudely told us there was no other rooms avalable so we had to spend a night with no air conditioning and no lock. But the the next day they found a room and we switched rooms and again BOTH rooms air conditioning was broken. We called down and asked for a new room they gave us another one and also said they would give us $100 credit. Nice of them to do that. Except for the fact when we tried using the credit it wouldnt work because their computers were down. So we actualy didnt ever get to use it. Our last room was an okay room, it had air conditioning but the curtains in the bathroom were moldy and rust stains on the bathrooms floors. Oh and one of the days we were there the elevators were broken and we were on the 30th floor. We got our exercise for the day. What a nice hotel. If you are planning on staying here I wish you the best of luck but dont expect alot.

Reviews.Title: “If I was paying myself - It would not have been pretty”
Reviews.Author: Smithster100
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's 3 minutes from Times Square. Yes it's 5 minutes from Central Park. OK it's near the Rockerfeller Centre, Radio City and St Patricks. I'll agree the rooms are quite big for NYC. There, that's all the positive stuff out the way. Even checking in here is very hit and miss. Get the time wrong and there will be a massive queue. Worse still, if your room isn't ready (and before 3, it won't be) there will be an even longer queue for the bag check. Should you be checking a bag for any reason other than your room is not ready - you'll get whacked for $3.25 (helpfully the ticket reminds you this does not include the tip - though given that The Grinch would seem to deliver staff training at the bag check, I'm guessing the $3.25 is to ensure a 75 cent tip) Perhaps though this is just to warm you up for the Sheraton experience of fee for service. Wired internet (yes...wired) comes chugging in at around $14 a day. The fitness suite is $10 a day - even for guests!! At breakfast you will have no clue as there seems to be a "buffet" but look at the wrong item and you're paying $30. I am pretty sure they are thinking of a dollar to ride the elevators. In the name of fairness - I shall mention that the coffee in the room was free! Luckily this was a business trip, so my personal exposure to the cost was minimal Still, you pay your money and take your choice - if it were my money it would not be my choice

Reviews.Title: “Great Location--only stay here if you get a good deal...”
Reviews.Author: TravelingIsFun11
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here at the end of July. We got a really great deal by booking our airfare and hotel through Expedia, and unless I get a great deal again, I probably will not stay here again if I am ever back in NY. Let's start with the good: the location is nothing short of AMAZING. There are four different subway lines within a few minutes' walk of the hotel, it's only a five minute walk to Central Park in one direction and Times Square in another. There are also a lot of food places close by. The beds were very comfortable (and I was on the 7th floor, not in a renovated room, but we'll get to that later). The room seemed generally pretty clean and bed bug free. A few other reviews mention not being able to control the temperature of the room, but our room had temp controls right by the A/C, thank goodness too, because we were there during a huge heat wave. And now, the bad: our bathroom smelled like mildew. It was gross, and there was really nothing that could fix it, so we ended up keeping the door shut at all times. Service was not great, but that seems to be the norm in that general area of the city. I left a necklace in my room by accident, and realized it on my way to the airport in a shuttle. I called the hotel to ask if they could find it and was treated as though I was inconveniencing them. They found my necklace, but refused to mail it to me, and instead told me I'd have to come back and get it. Again, I was on a shuttle. On my way to the airport. Not exactly in a position to tell the van driver and everyone else to turn around so I could get my necklace. Luckily, I have a friend who lives in the city who picked it up, and if that had not been the case, I am sure I could have spoken to someone else who could arrange to have it mailed, but I still did not appreciate the (word for word) "I'm not mailing nothin' to ya," response I got. Rooms are small, but again, that seems to be the norm in NY hotels. Walls are thin, but the floor I stayed on seemed relatively quiet, so that was not an issue for us either; however, I could see how it would be an issue for those who have big groups of kids staying on their floor, or those with rooms at the end of the hall near the elevators. We requested a renovated room at check in, but were told they only gave renovated rooms at an extra $40/night. No thanks. I've seen other reviews that say the same, but other reviews where people were upgraded at no extra cost, so I suppose it just depends on who is checking you in. Our room wasn't bad, but is definitely showing wear and tear. We didn't spend that much time in the room so it worked for us. If you get a great deal--stay here, otherwise, you can probably find something better.

Reviews.Title: “Worst starwood hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: SUBMANHQ
Reviews.Content: Booked for 1st time in NYC and as a starwood rewards member I expected better, I checked into the room and the room was really shabby and the wall paper was peeling of the walls and the safe would not work. I went back down to the front desk and spoke to the very helpful women and she organized a room change to a higher floor. Moved to the new room later that day and room was a little better. The cleaning staff do not service the rooms very well and the cleaning and standard leaves a lot to be desired. If I was coming back to NYC I WOULD NOT STAY HERE AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “What a difference a few months can make!”
Reviews.Author: Katze
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on August 6, and it was amazing. We had such a terrible experience previously, but it was a different story this time. Staff: Check in was prompt and the staff were friendly (if a bit tired). The check out was even better. The guy checking us out (I think his name was Sanderer) seemed very interested in how we liked our stay and if we needed any further help. Nice job. Room: Gorgeous. We were in room 4831, which looked brand new. It rivals 5 star hotels I've stayed at. I seriously had the best night sleep I've had in a very long time. What a great bed. My only critique is the bathroom. It was very small and there seems to be a bit of a shower design flaw. It's a walk-in shower and the edge needs to be a bit higher as I found it impossible to not get water all over the floor. Regardless, this room was beautiful, comfortable, and very quiet. We didn't hear jackhammers this time. :-) Breakfast: Our room included access to the club level hospitality room where they serve a continental breakfast. I found the selection to be excellent with tons of fresh fruit, cereals, pastries, bagels and a great selection of hot and cold beverages. The views in this room are incredible. We could see central park and the river while we ate breakfast. Nice. Location: It's a super location with easy accessibility to everything Manhattan has to offer. General Manager: Mark at the Sheraton read about my previous terrible experience at the hotel and made it right this time. Finally, a company dedicated to customer service. You guys are now awesome in my book. I'm sure he was hoping I'd write a new review, but he did not ask me to do this. I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Center of it all...”
Reviews.Author: Dick J
Reviews.Content: Wife, 9 year old granddaughter and self just spent several nights at the 811 7th street Sheraton Hotel Tower. Wonderful and most comfortable. Best part was it seemed to be center of it all. Even ran into a Conciere from my home town who gave us great tips. They have a handy business center and multiple PCs off lobby with social center. Had dinner and lunch in the immediate neighborhood and did the American Girl store and FAO Schwartz with our little gal. Also got to do the Statue of Liberty trip from Battery Park. I found cabs to be fairly reasonable to get about town also. Highly recommend this Sheraton to all.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: patman45
Reviews.Content: I'm always been a fan of the Starwood and the Sheraton hotels so everytime we go on a trip we always try to stay with them. We came acorss this hotel while browsing through tripadvisor (as you do !) They have just recently renovated "some" rooms. So we thought it was quite a good deal and decided to go with it. The staff was very helpful and always readily available. We were told that our "allocated" room is on the 5th floor but they decided to bump us up to the 20th floor which was nice. This wasnt actually a renovated room but still got all the usual Sheraton features including the famoud sweet sleeper bed.Location wise this is only a super short walk to Time squares and a little longer to Central park,Radio city, 5th ave. There is also a subway right on the corner of the hotel which is a big plus ! I think this hotel is for those who want to be right in the middle of it all. So if you like somewhere peaceful this is definitely not for you. NB- Do check out the special deal on Starwood's site sometime they have got a really really good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Rose265
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights (Thursday - Monday) at the Sheraton and overall was pleased with the hotel. Thanks to TripAdvisor I knew to request a room that had been renovated. The hotel is in the process of renovating all the rooms, and you can tell which floors have been done by the color of the carpet. The old floors that we saw from the elevator had blue rugs and walls, the new floors have a tan and black theme. There is scaffolding all around the hotel as part of the renovation. The room wasn't large but fine by NYC standards - we had a room with two double beds and there was room to walk around them, a dresser was attached to the wall, and there was a small table with two chairs by the window. There was a flat screen TV, and all the lamps had outlets in their base so it was easy to set up chargers for our phones. The mattress was new in good condition. I brought a flashlight to inspect for bed bugs and am pleased to report everything was nice and clean, even in all the creases of the mattress. The look is contemporary with dark wood, silver handles and tan rug and drapes. The bathroom was small but clean with a marble counter, tub and shower with a curved bar. The amenities were a generic brand but the soap was Manderin-Lime citrus and I really liked the smell. They provided a hair dryer, but no shower cap. They did have some cotton balls, Q-tips and an emery board in a little kit. One thing I missed was they did not have a magnifying mirror. They charge for wireless internet in the room which is very annoying. But I will give them credit for trying to offer some connectivity in the lobby. They had an area set off in the lobby that had about 10- 12 computers free for hotel guests to use with one printer, and free wifi if you had your own computer. It was outside the bar which served Starbucks coffee in the mornings until 3:00 PM. That was a very popular spot and the computers were always busy whenever I passed by. In addition, there is one terminal and printer located near the Registration desk that is dedicated to printing Boarding Passes. I was very pleased to find that so I didn't have to wait for one of the other computers to be free. Some reviewers have complained about the service, but we had no problems checking in and out. The rooms have those horrible mini-bars where if you move anything you are charged. My niece made the mistake of moving a can of coke to put in her leftovers but they called downstairs and had no problem removing the charge from the bill. The location is great - right on 53rd so it was just a block away from MoMA. Close to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, etc. There was no need to use Room Service or the hotel restaurant as there are so many other choices nearby. The Sheraton has an exit on 53rd and if you turn right just past their parking garage is the 53rd Gourmet Deli open 24 hours - I thought the food was so-so but they sell drinks, etc. and you don't even have to cross a street. Across 7th Ave is the 810 Deli http://www.810deli.com Within a few blocks on 7th Ave are Lindys, Stage Deli, Carnegie Deli, Fluffys Deli, not to mention a Starbucks on every corner. Two chains which were new to me are Europa Cafe one short block away at Broadway and 53rd - great sandwiches and fresh made to order salads https://www.europacafe.com/ and Pret a Manger which is a UK chain and had wonderful oatmeal for breakfast and very good strong coffee http://www.pret.com/us/ . We also ate at Fresh and Co. at Lexington and 56th which I loved - all organic and local, and they had buckwheat pancakes and yummy fresh omelttes - http://www.freshandconyc.com/

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTE DISASTER - If you want service don't stay there!”
Reviews.Author: crash29
Reviews.Content: From the time of check in to check out this trip was a disaster. I booked a room with valet parking included. I pulled up to the front of the hotel on a Thursday at about 1;30 p.m. The doorman wanted to know what I wanted, when I explained I was checking in he told me he was too busy and that I had to pull around the corner and park the car myself. I said that was not acceptable and he told me that was the only option. I then go around the corner only to be told the lot was full and I had to go to the other side where there was another entrance. I then go around the block only to find that entrance blocked as well. I pull up to the front of the hotel oncee again and am told by another doorman that I have to take the car across the street to the Sheraton Manhatten and they will park it there. He was willing to take my bags and hold them while I did this! I then enter the hotel and am given a room. Run down, dirty, with no individual climate controls. I call down and ask about the climate controls and am told that yes I can have that but it will cost EXTRA! I then move rooms and it was like going into another world. Clean, modern. It turns out that only PART of the hotel is renovated. The floors 20 and below are NOT renovated and are dirty and very run down. On check out I have to carry my bags down the block and across the street to get my car at the Sheraton Manhatten. THey will NOT bring it over to the Sheraton NYC. I get there only to be told I have to pay. I explain that it was included in the price of my room. They then tell me I need a voucher and to go inside. I go inside to the Manhatten and am told they can't help me that I have to get the voucher from the Sheraton NYC. I then have to schlep back there to get the voucher and then go back to get the car. When I went into the Sheraton NYC it took the woman three times to understand that I had already paid the parking and that I needed a voucher. No apology and one of her colleagues sarcastically told me how impressed they were with my performance!!! Would NOT recommend this hotel in anyway shape or form. The breakfast buffet was also very expensive and not good. Better to eat at the deli's across the street and up one block. Basically it's a A LA CARTE HOTEL. If you want something it's extra and then you can be assured that they are rude. I also had colleagues who were at the same hotel and had to change rooms twice before they received something that was acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but standards are starting to slip”
Reviews.Author: BamaGreg
Reviews.Content: I stay here two ro three time per year for business. The location is great, and the hotel staff is reasonably good. Like many Midtown NYC hotels, the rooms aren't too large. The mattresses are reasonably comfortable. However, many of the rooms have somewhat thin walls, meaning that you can hear people next door. The rooms haven't been updated in a while, whereas some of the other hotels nearby have spruced up their accomodations. This Sheraton is slipping compared to other accomodations in the Times Square area. I'd stay here again, but I'm going to consider other hotels before booking here.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service!! Four star hotel with 1 star customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Wrldtraveler365
Reviews.Content: After staying in hotels up to 250 days a year, this is by far the worst customer service out of all my hotel stays! Dont judge a book by it's cover here. The only good thing about this hotel is the club lounge on the 44th floor. If you are not already a member of Starwood, make sure to upgrade to enjoy the benefits of this lounge area. Beautiful views from the 44th floor , cash bar, good food, snacks and a nice coffee selection! The first night many rooms were overbooked, leaving us with only a King option. That wasn't too bad, but the fact that our air was broken during the hottest day of the NYC heatwave and we were told we had to wait until the next day to move rooms. It was hard to sleep in 90 degrees waking up sticking to the sheets etc... My colleuges and I were here on business and our events our outside in the heat, all we wanted was a nice cool room to return to after our long hot event days! Next, the hotel staff is very unfriendly and unaware of hotel facts. At one point I stopped to ask an employee a question and she answered I'm sorry I'm not on duty and closed the door behind very rudely! It amazes me that it could be that hard to hire quality staff for a four star hotel. One outstanding gentleman Mr. Fish completed our stay by taking the time to listen to our complaints and actually allow us to vent to him. Unfortunately, he's in a managerial training program

Reviews.Title: “Great location, 3 blocks from Times Square & Theatre District”
Reviews.Author: Robbie69
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here. The location is excellent- 3-4 blocks from Times Square, the Theatre District and Central Park. The rooms are small, but clean and comfortable. The beds had silk quilts and were extremely comfortable. CitySights tour buses stopped 2 blocks away. We went to the Eugene O'Neill Theatre, 2 blocks away. They have an auction 2-1/2 hours before each performance. Orchestra seats for "Book of Mormon" are $165, but if you win the auction, you can get 2 seats for about $30 each. Some fast-food and fantastic restaurants within a few blocks. We went to Gallagher's on 52nd & Broadway for "out-of-this-world" prime rib- excellent, and we raise cattle when not in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and one exceptional front desk individual!”
Reviews.Author: GatorKnight
Reviews.Content: We visited NYC in July 2011 because our daughter was participating in the Dance Awards Convention. The location of the hotel is prime--only a few blocks from Times Square in one direction and a few blocks from Central Park in the other. The hotel is located next to several reasonably priced restaurants, including Ray's Pizza and Cafe Metro (less than 1 block away), and Fluffy's (2 blocks away). If you're looking for a convenience store, don't go to Smiley on 7th. Go to Duane Reade on Broadway. Smiley charges $13 for a case of 6 bottles of water compared to $4 at Duane Reade. In addition, the metro subway entrance is located right next to the hotel. During our stay, we had two rooms booked for one week. The hotel was under renovation, and we must have had unrenovated rooms because both were old and not the cleanest, but acceptable. The bathroom in one room had drains that were clogged and would take forever to drain when we used the shower. There is no free wireless internet access in the rooms, but there is an internet cafe near the lobby area. However, there is a very limited number of computer terminals, and you often have quite a wait before you can get on one. We would not have given this hotel an excellent rating had it not been for one stellar front desk representative named "Joy", who went out of her way to make our stay as comfortable as possible. Upon our arrival, there was a mix-up in the reservation, and we were told we had no reservation until the following day. Joy spent a countless amount of time trying to fix the situation for us. She was courteous and patient, went out of her way trying to track down upper management for us, and basically made us her priority despite the growing line of other guests in the lobby. During our stay there were a few other hiccups, where we were incorrectly charged for a number of things. We approached the front desk about this a few times. When we dealt with another person, they were not entirely friendly, but on another occasion, when we happened to encounter Joy again, not only did she remember us, but she took care of the situation immediately and with a smile. Therefore, we honestly can say that Sheraton owes this excellent rating entirely to Joy. She did a wonderful job of making our stay at Sheraton as comfortable and problem-free as possible. In future visits to NYC, we would highly consider staying at this hotel again due to its convenient location. Hopefully, all rooms would have been renovated by then.

Reviews.Title: “Location was super”
Reviews.Author: FinntravFinland
Reviews.Content: Very nice and we'll located hotel. Breakfast good Sheraton stylr, will stay again

Reviews.Title: “Will never come back”
Reviews.Author: FUNINTHESUN0203
Reviews.Content: Room was small, bathroom was old, and small and tub had mold.hotel is going through remodel but we got the oldest room in the building. Motel 6 might be better than this hotel. I thought we were getting the new and improve guess room but that was a lie, and we still payed for a 4 star hotel room. I thought sheraton was a reputable hotel but with this trip I will make sure never to stay at any Sheraton hotel again. Pay the extra money and stay at the double tree hotel or at the merrriot down the street. To top it all off all the hotel employees are rude.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: Kaeri
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two separate visits in May with my mother and found it to be a great place to stay. Yes, it is an older style Sheraton but it has been revamped and is very clean and modern. The location is the best though- you are so close to everything and really feel as if you are in the heart of New York. The staff were very friendly as well. I didn't rate the hotel breakfast very much , but found that there were a lot of alternatives nearby. I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Abysmal experience”
Reviews.Author: mrtourne
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this by saying that I wrote a long letter to Starwood regarding this property, and their central customer service has been very apologetic and tried to make it up to me via Starwood points, etc. However, i do feel I need to let others know of my experience in this hotel, since I don't think this hotel is worthy of the Sheraton name, and I wouldn't wish others to suffer through a similar experience. I understand the hotel is undergoing renovation and some issues may be fixed, but while that happens I believe there's a high likelihood of these things recurring. I stayed at the Sheraton New York two weeks ago, on an overnight business trip. Upon arriving around 11 PM - which I had specifically noted on the SPG site that I would do - I was told that they didn't have much available, and specifically no rooms with a king size bed as I requested and they were sorry they didn't have anything "nicer" as I should have called them directly to let them know of my arrival (I am Platinum with Starwood, so usually get upgrades). I didn't think this was a big deal, since it was a one night stay anyway, but I did take exception to being told that i should have contacted the property directly - I entered my information on the SPG site, so it was on their reservation, and any hotel should be looking at who they have coming in that day, their status and assign rooms accordingly without asking guests to go out of their way. But again, no big whoop as long as the room was clean and working. I was assigned room 1130, one of the ones not remodeled yet. The furniture was in my impression pretty beaten up and the walls had some scratches, plus the AC was old and rattly, but what was really appalling was the level of cleanliness of the room. I found all of the following: a couple of women's hairpins in plain sight on the floor (which leads me to believe it wasn't vacuumed that day), a used bar of soap in the shower, a crumpled rusty colored towel under one corner of the sink ledge in the bathroom (you could tell it had been there a while catching water), a speck of - um, how should I say this - 'debris" inside the toilet bowl, holes in my pillowcase, and a thick layer of dust over the TV console (you could actually write on it). All unacceptable, but as they were sold out there's not much they could do (some of these things I found immediately, and some of them after going to complain a first time, and i needed sleep...). I must say, I did not sleep very well either, concerned about the cleanliness of the overall place. I took pictures of some of the items as they starting adding up, I've added them to this review. I also called the Guest Services desk to inquire about wifi, and even adjusting for New York bluntness, the person who picked up the line was fairly rude (I was basically told "there's just a cable connection in the room... there's a charge for it too" in not a very friendly tone). When i tried to use the Wi Fi from the lobby, it was unusable as it was so slow that pages would not come up. On the bright side, when I complained to the Front Desk, the young gentleman manning it was very apologetic that night, took my name, gave me the manager's name and told me he would relay my complaint. Alas, I've never heard from the hotel manager to this day. When I left the next morning I asked for directions to a specific address, to which I received just a finger pointing to a door and the words "That way". Gee, I can find the door towards the side street thanks, I was asking for something a bit more specific. I also asked for my bill on logo paper - I was handed another copy on plain white paper. Obviously listening is not a strong suit here. Based on my experience I would never again stay in this hotel. And I would not recommend it to anyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything! good service!”
Reviews.Author: CoolNJmom
Reviews.Content: perfect location in midtown. About 1 block away from Radio City and Rockefeller Plaza. Nice restaurant downstairs and great room service experience. Parking is expensive - beware!

Reviews.Title: “Where you want to be...”
Reviews.Author: bombakid
Reviews.Content: This is my first review where the company was not with my wife. It was with my brother-in-laws. Normally my wife keeps me on my toes with detail. I hope I don't falter on this one. I haven't read any of the reviews, but the biggest plus of the Sheraton is clearly and without question, the location. I applaud location very much in my reviews, but the Sheraton actually helps to make you close to any one of the boroughs as well as steps from the middle of Times Square. The Subway entrances are right around the corner, and everyone that has been to New York knows that the subway is the best and quickest way to travel in the Big Apple. Upon arriving at the hotel, we immediately needed to find the D train to get to 161st St. I'm sure I don't need to say that this is the stop for Yankee Stadium, but if I do, well, I just did. Anyway, the D train is right around the corner from the hotel also the RNQ is just south on 49th St. and those will take you right into Queens. With the red line also just west, you can end up right at Battery Park in minutes. Or why take anything; this hotel is right by all the excitement and mere blocks away from spending the day in Central Park. This is not just a great location, but an exceptional one that will allow you to take in so many sights in a short period of time. The lobby is huge and always bustling. The reception area is convenient and the staff is very nice. The elevators are quite large and can easily accommodate a good size group with their luggage in tow. They always seem to arrive quickly as well. The room is quite compact but offers all amenities. It is probably a more ideal spot for couples, considering the small size. But, it worked for us. The room also has a wall to wall desk that hides the A/C that is just under. It is equipped with internet connection, for a fee though. Nice flat screen TV with HD channels including HBO and Showtime. Also, the closet is basic, but fully functional. The fridge can be a little annoying considering that nothing can be moved without a charge hitting your account, not very good when you are hoping to use the fridge. The room also has a basic closet and safe, nothing that we need to write about. The bathroom is of a nice size and of good water pressure. The room need some additional hooks though, we ran out of space to hang towels. But, kudos to the hotel for stocking us with many towels of various sizes, we never had to call the front desk for additional anything. The Beds are Sheraton, so you know they are comfortable and with four pillows for each bed, you will sleep like a King. Also the drapes and window coverings darkened the room beautifully. We woke up feeling great, even after a night of drinking. If you don't mind close quarters, and you want location, look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton New York Hotel...... Thank you!”
Reviews.Author: Pinsey60
Reviews.Content: My son lives in New York and brought my husband and I there on a special vacation. Our lodging was for a week at your lovely hotel. Rooms...spacious, clean QUIET ENVIRONMENT! Bed....soft and comfy Bathroom....clean and large enough. Water pressure.....GREAT for NY City! Staff... accomodating for tours and dinners, pleasant & tasteful. Restaurant.... excellent LOCATION..........THE BEST IN MANHATTAN

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service and unbelievable attitude from receptionist”
Reviews.Author: Lb503
Reviews.Content: I arrived early for a business trip and had the cab drop me off early at my hotel to check in. They had no rooms available and they told me to check back in 2 hours ( now I did have a reservation for a three night stay made with frequent traveler points). In two hours I came back and was told to check back in another half hour. I waited patiently in the lobby and came back in half an hour. Still no room available, so I asked if there was anyway I could leave my number with them and have them call me when the room was available. I was absolutely exhausted from traveling all night and had absolutely no sleep! They said no, but then went to speak with housekeeping to see if anything could be done. They said come back at a specific time and it would be ready. In the meantime, the lady I had been working with went to lunch. I came back at the specific time I was told and the new receptionist refused to help in anyway. She would not even look up my name and then told me there would be nothing until later in the afternoon. I have never been so talked down to by anyone working in customer service. I was told there were only 4 people waiting for rooms in front of me and after watching more than 30 couples check in and head up to their rooms, I went back to the front. To no avail. Then the charge a daily fee for gym use, a daily fee to get a refridgerater for my refridgerated meds (without offering any other options for my meds). I will never stay in another Sheraton for as long as I live.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for tourists, but you know you are in a tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: safaridoc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a somewhat less congested location relative to Times Square, but it is by no means in a quiet area. As you step out the door, you are in a very busy area of Manhattan, and the hustle and bustle of the big city greet you as you leave the hotel. The hotel has an in house Starbucks coffee bar, which is very helpful in the mornings, although Manhattan has Starbucks everywhere you look. The hotel restaurants are nothing special, but it doesn't much matter, as New York's best deli, Carnegie deli, is a couple of blocks north just out the front door of the hotel. Driving around Manhattan is not for the novice, as cab drivers cut you off and the traffic patterns can seem random and intimidating to the uninitiated. I would recommend walking or taxis, or subways. The hotel elevators can have a wait at peak times, which can be annoying, so allow yourself a few extra minutes for elevator waits around 8 to 9 am and 5 to 6 p.m. The fitness center located in the basement is first class, and has weights, cardio and work out machines. There is a view of the street life from the cardio room which is fun. The rooms are furnished in woods, and have a clean feel and are average size for New York. A great location, very touristy, in the heart of New York. Very convenient to New York attractions and Broadway theatres. The buffet breakfast, if part of your hotel package, is very complete. It had smoked salmon, hot and cold cereals, coffees, fruit , pastries, breads, eggs... very good. A good choice for a Manhattan stay, but not quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice lobby and deco but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: 613forlife
Reviews.Content: Very nice lobby and very spacious lobby but the rooms are small, the beds are as comfortable as they should be, old air conditioning system making a lot of noise

Reviews.Title: “Succeeds despite on-going Renovation”
Reviews.Author: fdl1
Reviews.Content: This property was going through a fairly substantial renovation during our stay. However, the service was still great, everything worked, and nothing was made awkward by the construction. Particularly pleasing was that the room was nice, comfortable, and pleasingly appointed with dark woods and subdued shades- perfect for relaxing after the madness that is Times Square (which is steps away). WiFi was free, but only in the lobby area. This wasn't too bad because it was spacious with lots of plush seating, but of course connectivity would've been more convenient in-room. The parking was extortionist, but that's to be expected in Midtown.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: kkcole
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a last minute fun trip to NY and was thrilled with how close the hotel is to everything you would want to do as a tourist in the city. If it's not walking distance then you can certainly get where you're going with the several nearby subway stations. The room was beautifully decorated. Food options in the hotel are not cheap but there are tons of great restaurants and coffee shops nearby for easy meal options.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal base for mid town meetings”
Reviews.Author: Spurssox
Reviews.Content: Given the outrageous cost of most NYC hotels these days, I thought the $280 a night at the Sheraton to be reasonable value. For a business trip, the room was ideal, plenty of comfortable available seating in the hotel's public areas to read and have a coffee from the in house starbucks. I also valeted my car which was as seamless an operation as possible with the entrance to the garage right off the hotel lobby (but subtlely so). Check-in, luggage check and public restrooms were all quick/convenient/clean etc. Again, for NYC only I thought the Sheraton was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: donnah6
Reviews.Content: Fine hotel...location is excellent. 810 Deli across the street was great for a quick bite. Asked for a renovated room at check in and was no problem. Front desk was more than willing to accomodate. Read alot of negative reviews about the staff at this hotel, but I didn't run into anyone rude that worked there. In fact, we found everyone very nice. Perhaps you get treated the way you treat others. Rooms are small, but adequate for 2 people. Needed help with the safe when checked into room and security was there in 5 minutes. Showers were great..plenty of hot water. Room was very clean and our room was done every day we came back. Location, location, location. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very busy and very dated”
Reviews.Author: baddabingtmc
Reviews.Content: Good location, but hotel is very dated and the bar is very poor - I would recommend skipping this place for the price

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: Superdupeemom
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this hotel. My husband purchased 2 rooms here on Priceline, so we weren't sure what to expect. The manager, Kenny and his staff did everything they could to make this an enjoyable stay for my family and me. Couldn't ask for a better hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel what you would expect”
Reviews.Author: jvb_7
Reviews.Content: Two of us stayed here for 3 nights for a special 50th birthday. We got a good price on priceline and knew we were going to spend time north and south in Manhattan and thought this would be a good location. The location did indeed work out perfectly. We were very close to Central Park for morning runs and our evening at Tavern on the Green (alas, it is closed now!). Evening strolls through Central Park also very enjoyable. We were a couple blocks from the 2 Broadway shows we went to (Highly recommend Book of Mormom). Lots of food options everywhere, including right across the street is a deli with options for every meal if you have been walking all day and want to just bring a snack back to the hotel with you. We were in a non-renovated room and it was small but acceptable. The hotel is busy all the time--lobby is a cafe in the morning, bar at night. I wasn't wildly impressed with anything about this hotel (especially for the price) but I know it is standard to pay outrageous prices in NYC and we were very rarely in our hotel room so it was fine. Subway stop very close by. The front desk was raving about how nice the renovated rooms would be. Had one of the trips of my lifetime and the hotel didn't particularly contribute or take away from that so I have no complaints. Well, only one. Don't have friends send birthday baskets/flowers/etc. to the room--it ends up in the "business office" in the hotel and YOU have to pay a "holding fee" even though it is a gift for you. I am not sure this is the hotel's fault, but it was an unfortunate moment.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel- Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Sparky8188
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 week day night in May. It's a huge hotel with many stories to it. We never had to wait for an elevator like you do at some Sheratons. Their Honors breakfast was lacking in both quality and service but I think that's because they are re-doing their executive lounge and so they had us in a temporary place. Their upgrade rooms for Platinum guests were not that impressive- I don't even think we were upgraded but the room we were put in was very nice and quiet- just on the smaller side. The location of the hotel was great. Easy walk to Times Square and always a Taxi available to take you anywhere. It's a very busy hotel with lots of guests but for a busy hotel it was quiet in the rooms. I would definitely stay here again in the city!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, but some minor issues excellently fixed by hotel”
Reviews.Author: alrededordelmundo11
Reviews.Content: Good but no great. Really big and busy lobby, but warm reception from concierge desk. At first we were placed at a room near the elevator. We asked for a change of room and we were given a room with a not-cleaned bathroom. We were more fortunate the third time: a regular clean room with lounge access. The hotel needs an update, specially aisle carpets. Rooms on the small side, but comfortable beds and avegage bathroom. The lounge room is great, with a fantastic Central Park view. Breakfast and afternoon snacks are great.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience at this Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: amonavis
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 3 night stay at this Sheraton. My friend and I had a horrible experience from the moment we arrived. After waiting in a 30 minute line-up to see if we could check in at around noon, we were told that our room was not available. That is understandable. I asked if we could possibly try to get a room with 2 beds for my friend and me, and the surly woman at the front desk kept repeating over and over again that because we made our reservation on hotwire, we were not guaranteed 2 beds, and that there was nothing she could do. I understood that, but it seemed as if she was making no effort to accomodate us, treating us like second class citizens compared to non-hotwire/priceline guests. I asked her if the hotel was sold out of rooms with 2 beds and she just kind of gave a blank stare. She told us to come back later because our room was not ready. She then pointed to the baggage drop off area, which also had a lengthy line-up that took around 20 minutes. We came back at 3:30 and waited in the long check-in line again. I was lucky this time and got a new person checking us in, who was more helpful, and it was not a problem to get 2 beds. We then waited again in the baggage lineup to retreive our bags, another 10 minutes, a long line-up. Once we saw our room we were pleased that it seemed comfortable. We decided to get wireless internet. However, at the end of the stay when they slid the bill under the door, we found out that they charged us each a seperate wireless fee since we had used 2 devices! This was ridiculous. They wanted us to pay $14.99 x 2 x 3 nights since we each had our own computer? I called to complain and was transferred to the front desk. The phone kept ringing but no one answered. I was determined to NOT wait in the long line-up so that is why I wanted to call. After waiting on hold for 10 minutes, I hung up and called again, was transferred, and same thing, no one answered. Third time, I told the woman on the phone that no one was answering and she said there was nothing she could do since she was in another section of the hotel. I said, can you please get someone to call my room? I dont think it's acceptable to wait over 15 minutes to speak to someone. She said the would get someone to call my room. I waited 30 minutes and no one called. Then I called again, and said its the 4th time I've tried to speak to someone, so he transferred me to someones voicemail. Unacceptable. I called a 5th time, and the lady who picked up said she would get someone to call me. 20 minutes later, someone finally called. I explained that I did not think it was fair to have to pay wireless twice. After a bit of arguing, she agreed to reverse the second charge. Time for check out. We left the hotel room at noon and saw that there was a huge line, as usual, to check out. It would have taken at least 30 minutes. I saw that there was a priority desk with a bored looking employee. She seemed annoyed that we went to her, but she did check us out there. We then went to to long lineup at baggage check to drop off our bags. We waited 30 minutes again to drop off our bags, and they charged $3.25 per bag. I was very disappointed with this hotel. They nickle and dime you for everything, staff couldn't care less about customer service, the this hotel does not live up to the Sheraton name. I don't think I saw any staff smile the whole time I was there.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: PGDM-OnTheMove
Reviews.Content: This trip was both business and leisure, and as most of the reviews point out, the location is ideal - relatively close to everything you might want to do visiting NYC and the subway is a block away for longer jaunts in Manhattan. But this is not a place that values gracious service or the customer. Front desk was, with one exception, generally unfriendly, (as was the restaurant hostess and Starbucks counter personnel), and I had to argue about things that were supposed to be included at the time I made my reservation. Our room was clean and fairly comfortable but one of the smallest I've ever experienced and had a very noisy air conditioner which made it difficult to sleep. This was also the first time my wife and I have ever been hit with a charge for each bag we checked for a couple of hours before it was time to head to the airport after we checked out. Next time we go to NYC, we will probably try one of the many other nearby hotels.

Reviews.Title: “JULY 2010 STAY - Fantastic service, wonderful rooms.”
Reviews.Author: StarbucksGuru14
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in this hotel last summer on our Canada/New York road trip. We were struggling to find a hotel once we re-entered the US (when we could use our iPhones) until we realised that we had plenty of Star points. So we eventually found this hotel. When we arrived, we were able to get a King room with a roll-away free of charge on a Club-level floor in the 60's. The room was plenty large, though the view wasn't ideal (view of a cubicle in a skyscraper). The receptionist was very kind and helpful, as well as the bellhop that brought our luggage up and insisted on helping unload it. The lounge in the lobby gave us free Internet which was fine, though free in-room WiFi would have been ideal. We did get trapped in an elevator for about 10 minutes, but we were fine. A staff member took down our room number, but never did anything that we know of. The location was great and we were about a ten-minute or less walk from most places we wanted to visit. Overall, I would highly reccommend this hotel and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Very medicore. Only stay here if you have to.”
Reviews.Author: 2Traveller2
Reviews.Content: This is a solid 3-star hotel with 5-star prices. I know it's New York, but for $400/night with taxes, I expect a lot more. I was on business and the hotel was very close to where I needed to be, so location was paramount. If I were going on vacation or paying myself, I would definitely look elsewhere. Service was okay, but incredibly slow. I arrived late at night, and it took literally 20 minutes to get a room. I was on a corporate rate for a very, very large company, and this should not have happened. The hotel was completely full of rowdy teenagers, and the lobby was an absolute zoo. Even without the kids, you get the impression that the lobby is no place to seek refuge from the madness of the city (unlike many other similarly priced hotels). All of that was before I even got to the room. Since I got one of the last rooms, it was right next to the elevator. Not good. Also, it was boiling outside, and the A/C in the room was off. It took an hour for it to get cool again (this is at midnight when I wanted to sleep) and it was off again when I returned the next afternoon. For $400 a night, they should not have been turning off the A/C. The room itself had been recently refurbished, and was comfortable. The bathroom was also fine. On a 1-10 scale, I'd give the hotel a 7 for cleanliness (something that is very important to me). To summarize, unless this hotel is close to where you need to be, or someone else is paying, do yourself a massive favor and look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and nice room”
Reviews.Author: Likes2travl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our family of five (two rooms). It's a busy hotel, but the location is hard to beat. The MoMA was two blocks away and theater was just a few blocks. The rooms were very nice and large by NY standards.

Reviews.Title: “Service is a big issue”
Reviews.Author: Roberto275
Reviews.Content: Stayed in sheraton on a business trip and expected service to be tip top perfect but boy... was i wrong... VERY wrong... Everything that can be messed up was messed up. They did not have laundry services, front desk service staff were very very very (i can't stress enough) rude and had a lackadaisical attitude, they messed up my bills etc I got my queries and requests settled only by speaking to the general manager of the hotel (general manager mind you). If not for him, i will be rating this hotel a negative!

Reviews.Title: “Won't bother again”
Reviews.Author: Dextrasol
Reviews.Content: Sheraton has a name you feel you can trust so on first trip to New York this hotel comes up and we think - yep, that's a solid brand we can rely on. Well located for Times Square, easy to navigate around NYC from this spot. However: No mention of check-in time on details, we arrive after long flight, tired, hot and need to freshen up. Reception staff scant unless you are a starwood vip - loads of staff no customers, general guests-one reception staff, long queue. Room not ready, no apology or explanation, shoved a ticket for the baggage storage and told not to return till 3pm. Noticed 3 staff on visitors ticket desk, again no customers. This hotel needs a serious check on its staffing allocations. Having said that housekeeping staff were very friendly and helpful and service in the Hudson Market restaurant was charming and restored our faith in the great institution of customer service USA style. Room was clean and adequate but have stayed in other large chains and expect water fountains, ice machines, snack/drink bars and decent toiletries not sad tiny bottles of cheap nasty gunk!. Value added extras seriously lacking in this hotel. Only bar open offers $11 glass of wine in noisy, scruffy internet area. Adequate for our needs but will not return or recommend - wise up Sheraton, your front line staff let you down badly!

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: ashsar
Reviews.Content: This hotel in most definately NOT a 4 star hotel. We stayed here for 3 nights in July 2011 and were very disappointed. At best the room we stayed in was 2 star. The first room we were put in had the most dreadful smell.....dirty and musty. The room we were changed to had torn bedding, filthy carpet and very old furniture. The staff were unhelpful and borderline rude. The only good thing about this hotel is the location. We will never stay here again, suprised at Sheraton!! Even more suprised when checking out and wanted to store luggage for a couple of hours....they charge you $3.25 per item...not what you expect from a 4 star hotel and cetainly not what we are used to.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a third class hotel!!!"”
Reviews.Author: kreme78
Reviews.Content: We've visited NYC many times and stayed in many 4 star hotels in Times Square/Midtown area. This time, we decided to give Sheraton New York Towers a shot due to its proximity to the places that we had intended to visit. The location of the hotel was good. However, everything else was just terrible. We got there around 2:30 PM, but the receptionist said that we can't get to the room until 3:00 PM because that was the check in time that the hotel had indicated. Absolutely no flexibility here!!! So we waited at the lobby along with many others who had come earlier just like us. When we got to the room, it smelled really bad. It had that sewage smell, and the smell was mainly from the bathroom. The bathroom vent was very dirty, you could see the dusts ont he vent. The room was tiny-- two people can barely get around the room. We called the guest service for extra towels. We waited 1.5 hours. During that time, we had called 2 more times and we heard women chatting and laughing in the background noise. But all they said was that she'll put that into order. So fed up with their slow response, we headed down to the concierge desk. There was only one person (understandable) at the concierge. At first we thought he was helping a lady in front of us. But as the time passed by, we could hear their conversation--- they were chatting about their life!!!! It had nothing to do with the hotel area nor was it related with hotel. The concierge didn't even acknowledge us despite the line was forming longer behind us. Finally after 20 minutes of waiting, he asked us what we needed help on. After asking for extra towels, he immediately said that that wasn't his reponsibility-- we told him that the guest service didn't respond, then he told me to call the manager. We've never called the manager at a hotel, but this time we did. After hearing our complaint, the manager was very apologetic. Nonetheless, we got our extra towels 20 minutes after I had spoken with the manager. The entire staff members were very rude and unprofessional. We were extremely dissatisfied with this hotel and would never consider coming to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, Not Great...Not for people who dont like lines.”
Reviews.Author: aevegan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton New York in July 2011. I stay in and around NYC a lot but this is the first time I tried this hotel. As a frequent business traveler I like simplicity, easy in, easy out. I'm not a fan of waiting on long lines and dealing with a lot of people on a daily basis. This hotel is massive and as such the inside is always bustling. There's a lot of noise in the lobby and even the hallways. I check in later (around 10PM) on a Sunday night. When I checked in, I waited about 10 minutes on the Gold/Plat line. When I finally checked in I couldnt get up the elevator because an event downstairs just let out. After standing in a push/shove line for the elevator for 20 minutes I finally got to the room. The room was small and basic, not very updated. It was clean, so I was happy with it, but other Sheratons in the area are much nicer. The room was also small, one of the smallest I have seen in a Starwood hotel. I dont think I received an upgrade but if I did, I would hate to see the room that I booked. I also had a snafu because after 1 night of my 5 night stay I would be hitting the SPG Platinum level which would entitle me to free lounge and gym access. In most hotels when you have a situation like this they will honor your achievement and provide you with access. But this hotel is very inflexible so dont expect them to go out of their way for you. However, with such a large staff, I noticed that some staff are happy to go out of their way for you while others could care less. Thankfully, those that were willing to help made the experience a little better for me. It's important to note that without club access breakfast will cost you $35/pp (although you can find reasonable breakfast down the street at Pret) and if youre not Platinum, the gym will cost you $10/day. The location is great and the rooms are clean although simple. The reception and elevator waits are annoying and the reason why I probably wont stay at this hotel again. But if the price is right, the location cant be beat and you shouldn't be reluctant to stay here...but mainly I would say its good for vacations, not for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel (and on its way up); great location”
Reviews.Author: wsl
Reviews.Content: I am a Platinum-level member of Starwood Preferred Guest. I have been a regular guest at this hotel for a number of years. Several years ago, I suffered through staff with bad attitudes and other problems. In the last year or so, things have changed dramatically. The renovation of the hotel has helped tremendously; beautiful job, resulting in attractive comfortable accommodations. Even more important are the staffing changes that have occurred, which have made a huge difference. I wrote to Mr. Sean Verney about this recently. Rather than trying to paraphrase, here is what I wrote: "Mr. Verney, I am compelled to write to let you know what an amazing difference Zoe Cohen and Lacey Lazarus have made at the Sheraton New York Hotel & Towers. Zoe and Lacey do an incredible job. What they do was missing previously at the Sheraton. Since Zoe came on board—and then Lacey—my experiences at the Sheraton NY have improved measurably. I hope that you are able to add more employees of this caliber. It makes a big difference. Best regards. [My name]" I will be returning to this hotel in a couple of weeks--and I look forward to it (rather than just accepting it as good value and a great location). Mr. Verney and his team are doing a great job and deserve to be commended.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 4 star hotel, but ok if you book on hotwire and save $”
Reviews.Author: jmstanl85
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the Essex House on Central Park South or at the Yale Club, but was traveling only for one night to visit family and decided that I would go on hotwire to find a room. The price was fine and I'm gad it was because I would have been really disappointed if I had paid the listed rate of $300/night. The hotel, however, was not four star quality at all and should not be listed as such. Upon checking in, the man at the desk loudly exclaimed that I had booked the room on hotwire which was rude and not relevant since I knew I had booked the room on hotwire. All he needed to say was the room is paid for, we just need a credit card for incidental charges, but it really felt as if he was attempting to embarass me. The room was fine. I will say the bed was very comfortable. However, the towels in my room were stained and dirty and there were urine stains on the toilet seat. I'm not sure how this could happen since I had to wait until 3:00 to check in so that the room could be cleaned. The minibar did not open nor did the shade on the window. From what I've read in the other reviews, I'm guessing that I received an older room because I booked on hotwire, but it looked as though the room had been recently remodled so I am not sure. Not a huge deal, but the doorman is not very attentive which could be because there is so much going on, but I asked him five times to hail a cab for me and kept being interrupted by people asking other things of him. Instead of telling the other people to wait a moment, he handled their needs and left me standing there. That should not happend at a "4 start hotel". You're better off walking across the street and hailing your own cab. All in all, it was fine because I paid a relatively reasonable price. If you book it on hotwire or priceline and get the same deal that I did it is fine, but don't book at full price.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel from Hell !!!”
Reviews.Author: Traveltotheend9
Reviews.Content: Never stay here the service and staff attitudes stinks! I have never experienced such bad service, not what I would have expected from a Sheraton!

Reviews.Title: “extremely poor shape”
Reviews.Author: usc83
