Reviews.Content: this hotel is rated a 4 star by most online providers, priceline, expedia, etc... and it is very disapointing. I will start with the only upside and that is the location. can't beat where it is located on 53rd and 7th in Manhattan. But besides that all downside. rooms are extremely worn down and old. furniture chipped, outlets barely hold a plug. bathrooms in need or repair. safe didnt work in one of our two rooms. no wi-fi! only plug in internet service. this should be no higher than a 3 rating on any service. i used priceline and named your own price and put in for a 4 star hotel and got this one. extremely unfortunate because i usually have gotten hotels on priceline that are rated correctly. and on top of that they charge you $10 to use thier average fitness center

Reviews.Title: “**Never again! Blood on Bed.......”
Reviews.Author: Duvivier805
Reviews.Content: “Hotel Factory” – Very busy lobby (Airline Crew Hotel) Long, “Airport like” lines to check in (43 minutes), friendly Front Desk Staff. Rooms are somehow updated, Bathroom Fixtures, TV, etc. Hallways are dark, 70’s look. Air Conditioning / Heating still from the 70’s and very noisy. Our Bed had “blood stains” on Duvee (see picture). Poor cleanliness in Bedroom (dusty desk and nightstand, lots of hair in Bathroom-on Sink and Tub. Overall ….”You get what you pay for” $290 per night!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: MsNikkiT
Reviews.Content: I'm currently staying at the Sheraton on 7th Ave and while it close to everything ( Times Square, theater, central park) it is not a 4 star hotel! My room is old and the bed is uncomfortable. When I requested a newly refub room I was told since I booked on priceline it would be an extra $100! The reception line is always long, there is no wi-fi in the rooms lobby only. The Holiday Inn I stayed at in Soho is better than this place. The worst part is when the maid came by my room and asked me if I needed anything a roach was on her cart. I will never stay here again. Luckily I only have a 2 night stay,

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: Liney72
Reviews.Content: We had this displeasure of staying at the Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers in early June for five nights. On our arrival we walked into the lobby to be confronted by absolute bedlam (a 10 day dance convention was underway). Our room was not ready which was no big deal, however, we had booked a twin bed room because I was traveling with my father and we were told that there were no twin rooms available. After producing our request for twin beds, the reception staff said this did not guarantee us a twin room! We disputed this as they had accepted our booking, took our money and now didn't want to give us the room we asked for. If a hotel cannot guarantee a room, then they should not accept payment. We would not have travelled all the way from Australia if our accommodation was not in order. We simply would have booked elsewhere. mind you, we had made this booking in Feb/Mar. After much persisting and asking for a refund, we were eventually given a twin room. The following morning we asked about wifi and were told it was not included and that the Sheraton had given us a better room than what we had paid for. Joy even had the cheek to say it was an extra $40 a night more. How unbelievably rude and disrespectful. I have never had to engage in arguments with hotel reception staff like I have at the Sheraton New York. They were rude, unhelpful, discourteous and should not be in the service industry. Instead of spending 160 million on renovations can I suggest they start with the front desk staff. That needs more of an overhaul. Philip Burnside, Front Office Manager, was ineffectual. I have his business card and will be sending him an email in relation to our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaViv
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton on 7th Ave. We had heard prior to the visit about how people had encountered rude people there so we were bracing ourselves for that. We were pleasantly surprised at how friendly and courteous the Sheraton personnel were. We were there for a week and never encountered any rude people. The room that we stayed in was not extra big, but we figured it is in New York so it is to be expected. Beds were so comfortable and room was clean. Service was excellent. The reason we loved staying here was how it was strategic to getting to Central Park way and also Time Square and Rockafeller Center. Subway station was right next to the hotel. To get down to Greenwich, Soho, and financial district was so easy on the E train. The most pleasant surprise was, upon checkout, the worker told me taxi and limo prices to JFK were the same. So we ended our trip with a comfortable 1 hour ride on a limo.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk is the worst”
Reviews.Author: OKHawk
Reviews.Content: I just checked in on July 20 for a three night stay with my wife and already regret it. The room with a king sized bed that I pre-paid for is not available. They offered us a room with two doubles and the hope of switching rooms tomorrow (they have no idea what time). The other option was a "parlor suite" with a queen-sized MURPHY BED!!! I cannot even imagine what that room looks like. I had called and requested hypo-allergenic bedding. The front desk acted like I was speaking a foreign language when I asked if what will be our first room has it. The front desk just could not be more dismissive, rude, unhelpful and really acts like they could care less. Because of them, avoid the hotel. The room itself is nice - a good space for New York. The location is amazing. Has potential, but the interaction with the staff is such a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: nbtravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night for a conference I was attending in New York. When I arrived at 130 am there was a line about 10 people long in the lobby. The manager came out and said that they didn't have any rooms ready and clean but that they were working on it, and would we be so kind as to go up to the lounge. Wow, not sure why the rooms werent clean at 130 in the morning but up we went. An hour later, at 230 someone came up with the key. And even as a Platinum member I was put in a cramped small double bed room. What is the most amazing that noone even attempted to do something to compensate. Of course, they had the bill with no adjustment under the door on time. Very dissapointing.

Reviews.Title: “A great location, and nice people”
Reviews.Author: ChipNewton
Reviews.Content: If you like shopping; if you like the Theater; if you like the park or museums, then the Sheration New York hotel and towers is the best place to stay; with reasonable rates, a brand new redo, and very nice and hard working staff.

Reviews.Title: “Due to construction, It's like 2 hotels in one”
Reviews.Author: dansocal
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton NYC hotel and Towers has been undergoing a rebirth, but unfortunately if you get placed in the older rooms, its gonna be painful. The older rooms seem smaller due to the older furniture and the desk that runs along the window and blocks the heating system. The new rooms do away with this and instead have central air and the tv is installed into the wall. This gives the impression of a larger room. The finishings of both rooms are comparable but the new design is definitely fresher. I would consider staying here again. The location is great and rooms are mostly quiet. Don't get a room near the elevators as people congregate there and you can hear them talking from inside your room. People do seem to come and go at all hours of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: hellokimmy08
Reviews.Content: The hotel was much nicer than some of the reviews I read. We were able to find our room at a much more reasonable price after searching through several sites. What I love most about the Sheraton is the service. Management like Mark Sanders actually takes the time to address concerns and respond back to requests. Our check-in with Rika was easy - she informed us that our room was not available yet (we were a bit early), but that she would be able to call us once it was available. We checked in our bag for no charge while we went to explore the city. We were upgraded to one of the renovated rooms. The layout of the room was nice and simple and the King bed was comfy. Our room was near the elevators and I believe the housekeeping area. I was a bit worried at first that it would be too noisy, but we never heard anything besides the occasional guest(s) walking by while talking (we might have been knocked out from eating and walking so much though). Housekeeping was very attentive - we put up the Do Not Disturb sign up every night so we wouldn't be awakened in the morning and once we left to go exploring the city, we would remove the sign, and come back to a clean room later that day. Occasionally we would see the housekeepers in the hall and they would always greet us in a friendly manner. The location of the hotel is very convenient! We were right between Central Park and Times Square and within walking distance to several subway stations. Overall, this was a great experience and we will likely return in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Far From Four Star”
Reviews.Author: lexi1026
Reviews.Content: I'm really not sure who gives star ratings, but the Sheraton on 811 7th avenue is FAR from 4 stars. To begin, it took a half hour of driving around the block several times to even come remotely close to getting to Valet. When we pulled up, the Valet attendant told us it was an hour wait, there were only two attendants and we should go across the street to a sister hotel. That was fine. So a half hour later at 5:15 we drag all of our luggage to the Sheraton and wait in line to be checked in. Mind you, we've been sitting in bumber to bumper traffic from the Bronx Zoo and running late for our dinner reservations for our 4 year old daughter's birthday dinner. A half hour after waiting in line to be checked in, there were no rooms. I had our agent call several times and the manager kept telling her 30-45 minutes. Around 7:15, we finally got a room. We completely missed our reservation with two very hungry small children. We didn't get into a restaurant until 9:30 PM and out until 11. Both children fell asleep at the dinner table and didn't eat their food. The beds that are supposed to be so comfortable had dirty lumpy "down" pillows and the bed was hard as a rock. I woke up at 6:30 am and could not go back to sleep. They only thing the hotel manager could do was give us a $50.00 credit which didn't even pay for breakfast ($81.00 for a so-so buffet). I had a bowl of fruit and I had to argue with the restuarant the hot food plate I carried to the table was for my four year old. Really? I had to argue? If there was any staff around they would have seen that I had about 4 strawberries and cantelope for $24.00, I don't think the other three dollars would have made a difference. The rooms were far from 4 star clean (hairs in the sheets, food crumbs on the carpets). The hotel exprience completely offset the mood of our family and litterally ruined our trip. We should still be in New York, but we left early because we all had such a teribble time. Thanks Sheraton, this will be my first and last time at any of your hotels. I will stick to Hiltons and Marriotts for now on. Their customer service and class exceeds my expectations. Especially for someone who has worked in the hotel business.

Reviews.Title: “NOT up to Sheraton quality”
Reviews.Author: toplesstaco
Reviews.Content: The quality that is expected from a Starwood / Sheraton is NOT here. Sadly the noise from the very young and including teenage children running up / down the hall, talking and being woken at 2:00 A.m., yes, I did call security after I spoke to the early 20 year old girls, the dog/s barking...not acceptable, the club lounge, which should be a privilege earned, not a babysitter for parent /s to relax in the room, or as a "babysitter" as parent/s continue to ready themselves in there personal room. When a child under 6 years was running and came close to tripping people, that was to much. Location the 40th floor, one of the remodeled floors..... Room yes, ETC...NO! Granted, this is the summer and people travel with children, well behaved or not. Then this Sheraton that is renovating rooms, and have downsized the club lounge in half of former times, could have a room for adults WITH CHILDREN under the age of 21 and another for ADULTS ONLY over the age of 21.....for as it is now, they shall loose the adults business. The only real shinning light was at check in, preformed by Mr. SANDEER a delight. Had another situation, spoke with him, at it was resolved better than I expected. Bravo to Sandeer. Very sad as the location was great in general to Times Square and the theater. In the hands of the Sheraton personal to try to adjust and accommodate the adults, that desire a great hotel. (keeping in mind that children need a place, also)

Reviews.Title: “Only worth it with "Name Your Own Price"”
Reviews.Author: stickan84
Reviews.Content: Positives: -Great location in the heart of Manhattan, easy walk to Times Square and the Theater District in one direction, and Central Park in the other -Beautiful but busy lobby -Great room (although a bit small) with a very comfy bed, great shower, nice TV, quite sound proof for being NYC, and of course a beautiful view (we stayed at the 49th floor) Negatives: -As with many up-scale hotels, everything costs money! We spent $50 in total for 3minutes of phone calls and a couple of minutes on the internet. -Elevators are always busy and for the lower floors its hard to even get on, especially around breakfast or before dinner -With such a large hotel there is always a line for check-in and the concierge. We arrived past midnight and still had to wait in line to check in.

Reviews.Title: “Wow. Horrible, horrible service”
Reviews.Author: SouthernBizTraveler
Reviews.Content: The room was okay, but the service is what killed this hotel. I had a shopping bag with a new purchase taken from my room. When I reported the incident to security, very few people actually cared. The housekeeper that actually cleaned my room on the day when my bag went missing showed up in my room while I was in there (alone) and confronted me and made me feel unsafe. I reported the second incident to the staff and all I got was a "we'll talk to her." Seriously? A guest feels unsafe and that's all you are willing to do? I will NEVER stay in this hotel again. I do not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “nice club lounge, but hard to get your requests met”
Reviews.Author: lilzeppelin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sheraton NYC several times recently, always in a renovated room on one of the upper floors with complimentary access to the club lounge as Starwood Platinums. Rooms are always small, but functional - plenty of electric outlets, drawers, and always some shower gel not only soap. Recently opened lounge on the 44th floor has three free computers with printer, snacks in the evening and breakfast with some fresh berries. Seems they are trying to keep attracting frequent starwood guests, especially since one never gets complimentary suite upgrade in this location (needs to be pre-arranged with VIP manager according to the front desk). Another Platinum priviledge that front-desk does not always mention is free local and toll-free calls. Still there are some negatives: 1. bed is rather uncomfortable compared to W bed. And they only use one clean sheet to put a blanket/duvet on. So that when you are covered you are under a clean sheet which is not completely enveloping the duvet. I guess they save by not using a second sheet or using sheets that you can put the duvet in. 2. unless you are very high and away from the elevators, it can be pretty noisy. 3. front desk is not well organized when it comes to separation of Diamond/Gold and general line. In fact the first time we checked in - there was a huge line of some 10 or so people for the former and no line for the latter.I have never seemed a similar line ever in any hotel and we spend probably 2/3rds of the year in hotels. 4. this is a big hotel and sometimes housekeeping seems to cut corners (see my pics). Today I moved day-bed by the window by pushing it towards the wall to create a little more spacein this small room. The floor was full of debris. Requested "guest services" send housekeeping to vacuum - nobody came after three requests. Finally, succeeded in being connected to a housekeeping manager (not after a little fight with "guest services" who would point blank refuse to do that without knowing the reason) who eventually sent housekeeper to vacuum the room. Guess you need to be a real VIP to be heard here, and Starwood Platinum does not count. 5. rooms have small mini-bar fridges with warning messages not to store your stuff in them, however, if you want to keep some water, wine, beer etc cold, you will be charged $25 per fridge that they can send for you. Bear in mind this is not very typical for NYC, with Sheraton Tribeca providing nicely sized complementary fridge, Grand Hyatt having small fridges in all of their renovated rooms, and W Time Square not minding at all if you empty their mini bar for personal use. Of course, a little dirty floor, etc, does not take away from the fact depending on where you need to be, this is still a great place for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Towers NYC”
Reviews.Author: ConnieColumbus_OH
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located and very appealing. Spotless and great place for families and business peope.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: Annie021
Reviews.Content: The check-in was excellent and the room was high over Manhattan with a terrific view. Unfortunately, on my last day there was a fire alarm at around 7AM which (shades of 9/11) was scary. I decided to dress myself--not rush out in the altogether--and go down and see what was happening. The elevators were working, which already told me that everything was probably OK. It was just construction activity that had triggered a false alarm. All hotels where I live in So FL have public address systems and I think the management should have told customers that all was OK. (There was no phone service.) Many people were frightened: I went down in the elevator with a number of scantily clad alarmed people (besides myself). Everything else about my stay was lovely, but fire alarms in the early AM are a bit of a deal-breaker for me. I will never accept another 18th floor booking in that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Terrible service. Ridiculously small rooms. Misleading breakfast rules for spg platinum”
Reviews.Author: pelachi
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations of this hotel an I was let down terribly. As a platinum spg member I have rarely dealt with such poor service (and a small room (which they told me was a deluxe room - I pity those who have a lesser room type). I would also have been entitles to breakfat is the lounge but it was closed so I had breakfast in the main area only to be charged for it. It was a rip off. I was very very upset with the whole experience. I would never stay here again. This stay was the absolute low point of my trip to new york.

Reviews.Title: “Service was excellent”
Reviews.Author: Gee101
Reviews.Content: The help and information provided before arrival, while at the hotel and after we returned home was exceptional. We enjoyed the Starbucks coffee and tea in the room. Except for the weather, our stay in NY was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK Visit”
Reviews.Author: BubbieTravel
Reviews.Content: Quick and sweet......The room was clean. They put us in a handicap room with clothes hangers 3 feet from the ground. They failed to replace used drinking cups. One of our room keys stopped working after the first night. You should expect more for a room that cost $300+ per night. I probably would not spend my money on this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Good room in great location”
Reviews.Author: LenYCherryHill_NJ
Reviews.Content: Booked through PriceLine two days before arrival. Served as headquarters for two days of theatre and touring in NYC. Asked for high floor and got 26th. Recently refurbished room. Not gigantic but more than adequate, clean, and quiet. Would stay here again if the price were right (which it was this time).

Reviews.Title: “Great location and decent rooms”
Reviews.Author: travel43_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over 4th of July after getting a good deal on Priceline. Other reviewers mentioned that they felt they were treated poorly b/c they booked through Priceline but we did not have a similar experience. The gentleman who checked us in was good natured and polite. His only comment about Priceline was that we could not get any "Starwood points' for our stay b/c we booked through Priceline. He changed our queen to a king and gave us an available room at 11:45 am. We were pleased with the room. Seemed to me like we were given an updated room. Room was a little small but similar size to other hotels we have stayed at in NYC. I agree that the lobby was a zoo but that didn't bother us and I am not sure it is something that the hotel can control. We did not hear anyone at night - seemed pretty soundproof to us. We were able to control the a/c in our room. We would have liked a fan in the bathroom. My only complaint was that none of the doormen ever opened a door for us or offered to help with luggage. They just watched us come and go. And, they were not always busy when we arrived/departed. We saw them texting/ chatting, etc instead of assisting guests. That was the one disappointment for me. The service did not wow me - no one was ever rude, just sort of uninterested. (as mentioned, the front desk was very nice) Other than that, I would recommend this hotel. And, the location was perfect - just far enough away from Times Square that it was not too crazy around you. But, close enough to walk to in about 2 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Tired Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SKAY18
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent. Location wonderful. But hotel looks tired. Rooms need refurbishing. Sign in lobby notes that all will be redone shortly

Reviews.Title: “Great Location..few blocks from Central Park”
Reviews.Author: koekabolla
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel..we spent a weekend there and although the lobby area was swamped the noise level on the floors were quiet..we stayed on the 20th floor and had a great sleep..the room temp was a challenge to maintain a balance due the the antiquated air system (on the cold side)..we were told the hotel is replacing the air system altogether..the water pressure was lame as most NY hotels are known for..but the location was AWESOME..great restaurants nearby and a quick walk from lower Central Park..would do again!

Reviews.Title: “Dance Convention”
Reviews.Author: FLfriends
Reviews.Content: One of the best things about this hotel is the club lounge. What makes the club so wonderful is Tommy! He was there everyday greating us and asking about our day. He always had a smile and made sure we had everything we needed. It was a great place to unwind after a busy day. Thanks Tommy!!!

Reviews.Title: “it was nice enough”
Reviews.Author: kaaala
Reviews.Content: we just came back from a one night - 2 day stay, room was booked on Priceline so they didn't give us a room in the newer part of the hotel, the room was basic, but good enough. We did ask for a king bed and got one. Best part is the location, and I happen to enjoy large hotels with a lot of people milling around.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service I have ever experienced!”
Reviews.Author: wademu
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 14 night and as far as I am concerned I will NEVER ever stay at a Sheraton ever again. The front desk staff redefined what rude meant for me. I have never been so offended as when I had to deal with them. My suggestion is to leave is hotel alone if you want any kind of service. And another suggestion is get a newer room. The old ones are not just terrible. We managed to get into one after a lot of asking to be moved away from the one of many kids tour groups booked into the hotel. Also the lobby pcs are so broken they aren't even worth trying to use.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, crowds galore”
Reviews.Author: teacher_md
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Sheraton for the 4th of July weekend. We were able to get a good deal on Priceline. The room was very comfortable and was decent-sized for a New York City hotel room. It was clean, well appointed and in good condition. There was very little noise from the hallway or from other rooms. The service was extremely friendly. The lobby was a zoo - beyond crowded. They have around 1700 rooms in the hotel and the lobby was constantly filled with groups of kids. It was actually bordering on ridiculously crowded! So for a reasonably priced, quality room, I recommend Sheraton NY Hotel & Towers. Although, do not expect a calm/chill atmosphere in the lobby. Just go to your room to enjoy that.

Reviews.Title: “Kids living the dream”
Reviews.Author: BuickGN
Reviews.Content: Since I spend a fair amount of time away from home and in NYC, the kids wanted to visit and spend time seeing the theater(s), shops and museums over their winter break. Upon checking in we were upgraded to a suite which more than accommodated the family. After returning from a show that first evening, the kids were treated to milk/cookies & snacks waiting for us in the room. For breakfast and evening snacks the kids enjoyed the Club Level amentities as well. While travelling/living this way may be my job, for the kids, they thought they were living the dream. Texting and Facebooking their friends with all the details of their “adventures” ! My sincere appreciation to all at the Sheraton Hotel & Towers, they are exceptional everyday, not just when my kids are in town.

Reviews.Title: “Shockingly Rude”
Reviews.Author: Coco33411
Reviews.Content: The worst experience in our lives...It started and ended with the receptionist telling us, quote: "Manager my a..!" after requesting the manager due to the fact that the person checked us in acted bizarre and so rude we could not believe our ears. We left without checking out and got the prepaid money refunded by American Express. The manager on duty offered 75$ which we politely declined. We only used the room (small and filthy) to make a reservation at another Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was an amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: montrealextra
Reviews.Content: I booked through Priceline and I have to say the location was ideal. Steps away from TImes Square, Central Park and Rockefeller Center. When we checked in they gave us a room with 2 beds even though Priceline books only one bed. There were no hassles. Huge lobby, bustling with people. Obviously a very popular hotel. The rooms were nice. The bathroom needed some updating, but it was ok. The beds were very comfortable. You cannot control the AC from your own room, at least not in ours, but the temperature was perfect. At the end of the stay, we were wrongly charged for an item from the minibar. I called the front desk and they reversed the charge immediately. I would stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Up and down service.”
Reviews.Author: OMI1234
Reviews.Content: I was approached in the concierge lounge by Stacy, the manager as she described herself and asked what I thought of the suites. I told her the design was hard to use because of the wall in the middle of the room and that the room was very dark. She asked me if I was kidding and that they were new and beautiful. I said if she did not want my feedback, than she should not ask. She walked away and made a comment to another employee in the lounge who laughed and looked over to us. To his credit he came over and apologized for her behavior. Until that time, the service had been great. Great location. Concierge staff very engaging and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Everything Done Right, Comfortable & New”
Reviews.Author: MadeInFlorida
Reviews.Content: Found this to be the perfect location, right by the metro, close enough to Times Square (without the noise) and convenient to everything. Management does everything right at this hotel. Staff all courteous and helpful. Attentive to all our needs. Enjoyed the Starbucks coffee every day and internet access on new, big-screen computers. Did not see or hear of the renovation. Our room was new with all the amenities. Comfortable, quiet, good ac and good pillows. Small-ish as are many nyc hotels, but set up nicely. No pool, but we never use anyhow. They did offer access to one across the way. Fitness center looked great.

Reviews.Title: “Only good if you got a deal”
Reviews.Author: webby_77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel this past weekend. We were celebrating our first wedding anniversary and I emailed the hotel 2 weeks prior to request a newly renovated room as I heard the hotel was under construction. The lady at the desk said that we were not getting a newly renovated room because we booked off of Priceline and she said that in order to get a newly renovated room that you would have to request it when you book it off THEIR website. Not sure if I believe that because who wouldn't want a renovated room? The staff were not very friendly to us and if they don't like guests buying off Priceline then they shouldn't even have the hotel on there. The room we got was old but clean so it wasn't that big of a deal EXCEPT in the mornings when we were woken up by the drilling OUTSIDE our window. At one point there were men working right outside our window. We had to keep the blinds closed. It was VERY loud and disruptive. I don't think that they should put ANYONE in the rooms where they are drilling regardless of whether they got it off of priceline. Also, we stayed for 3 nights and the rooms were not cleaned very well other than pulling the sheets up and putting out new towels. I wouldn't stay at this hotel again, and I'm really glad that I didn't pay full price.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: MariaD0104
Reviews.Content: Hotel is bustling with activity, I guess because it is located close to Times Square. Also not far from Central Park, so great location. Room was very clean. Service is also very good with helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Don't promise amenities and helpful staff when they are too short staffed and can't follow through for guests.”
Reviews.Author: Hotelier4life
Reviews.Content: Very unhappy, I ordered pillows and extra blanket and never received it. NEVER... They said free Internet but it's not!! And everything you ask for comes with an employee looking at you awkwardly expecting a tip, seriously it's awkward and I lost 70 dollars from that. The movie chanel is down so that new feature is worthless. And to top off my stay there were some bugs sited in the hallways, hopefully there are none in the rooms but it's very tough to keep 1800 rooms clean..

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ddndee
Reviews.Content: Me and two of my relatives stayed at the Sheraton for a girlfriends weekend. The hotel was really nice. We booked through Priceline and got a really good rate, but it was a bit of a challenge getting them to honor our request for double beds. I called the same date I made my reservations to request an early check in and double beds. The lady who took my information down told me that the request was noted. Some of the third party websites will book you for a single instead of a double bed room. When we got there, we were told no double bed rooms were available (yeah right) and they would give me a roll away at no extra charge. After several conversations with the hotel staff and the general manager, Ms. Joy at the front desk was able to resolve my issue. The hotel is centrally located near Times Square. We stayed in a renovated room with nice furnishings. The only issue is that they "ran out" of face towels on the second day. It took three calls to the front desk to get some towels. Other than that, this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Rooms, No Issues”
Reviews.Author: K82Travel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after scoring a great weekend deal on Hotwire. Basically just needed a place to crash for a weekend in the city, and wanted to stay closer to midtown. Hotwire had lots of deals for downtown, but when 4 star Midtown popped up I grabbed it. The check-in was easy, gave us a king bed. I honestly have no idea if I received an upgraded room or not, but the room I had was nice, very comfortable bed, working TV, and bathroom was a decent size when considering you're in NYC. I've been in smaller bathrooms, so I was pleasently surprised. My only complaints are they didn't replace the toiletries, but we survived, and they charged 3.25 for us to check our bags for the day. I felt the fee was a little low class as I've stayed at Westins, Marriotts, Renaissances in other big cities (Chicago, Boston, LA, San Fran), and never once had to pay a fee. We didn't eat at the hotel or take advantage of any of the amentities, but the location was great, room was comfortable, and had no real issues. I'd recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Terrifc Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TSWTraveler
Reviews.Content: We're just home from a week in Manhattan and this hotel definitely added to a great week in New York. The location can't be beat and the newly renovated room was very comfortable. Every staff member we encountered was very pleasant and helpful; the bellmen at the door, the front desk staff, the maids, the staff in the club lounge were all wonderful. We will definitely be back the next time we're in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Not helpfull at all especially when they are full”
Reviews.Author: eds15
Reviews.Content: I was staying here with my husband who was delayed at the time. Be carefull with this hotel as they would not check me into the room (I had Id and resivation details) they required my husband to check in first and said that they could check me in for the current hotel fee which was 3 times what we had payed for!! and then we could try an claim the other fee for the room my husband booked back! Can I point out that we are spg members and stay in the Westin Times Square usually and have never come accross this problem. The fact that the hotel was full and that they did not need our custom at this time, does not give them the right to price up a room that we had already paid for! Do not stay in this hotel for business - it is for tourists that they can rip off!! Really disappointing, I suggest the Westin or the Marriot for business!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: StarfallDarling
Reviews.Content: Basically, we chose this hotel for location. It's a stone's throw from Times Square, and plenty of other great locations. Service was good, housekeeping took great care of us. Front desk workers could use some training in interacting graciously with guests, as they came off a bit frosty. When someone is a paying guest, they ought to be treated with politeness and an open attitude. Price is a bit high, but really, it's on par with whatever you'll find this close to Times Square. Rooms are a little on the small side, but with great view of the city. Recommended highly!

Reviews.Title: “great location shame about the conference”
Reviews.Author: pookidoos
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights on honeymoon last year and whilst the location was perfect we barely stepped foot in the hotel. The hotel itself was very nice however Clinton was having his annual charity conference here and we felt very out of place with hundreds of delegates in suits eveywhere. could not get to the bar and computers at all during our stay think i managed 2 send 1 email at about 4am when i couldnt sleep. we were happy to be out and about 99 per cent of the time as u obviously want to make the most of this amazing city but u also want somewhere to come back to to relax possibly have a drink in hotel bar or use the restaurant which we didnt at all. also to top it all off we had show tickets the 1 night so after relaxing in central park 4 the afternoon we stroled back to the hotel only to be met by a massive queue of angry looking travellers waiting to go through security. ie searched and scanned. some of them had only just arrived so the last thing they needed was more delays. we were lucky however and clinton must have just left as they were starting to pack up however some people had been queing to get in the hotel for over an hour. Before our trip our travel agent contacted us to warn us the hotel had informed them the gym was out of order! why could they not pre warn us of the major conference taking over the place too as it is an annual 1 they obviously new. i would stay here again as rooms were fine and location excellent i would just check first and avoid september next time.

Reviews.Title: “Huge hotel, a bit frenzied in the lobby most mornings”
Reviews.Author: kjhMN
Reviews.Content: Pros: A nicer Sheraton property with recent updates, comfy beds, new fluffy towels, good shower with very hot water even on a busy morning, responsive and friendly staff. Bathrooms were very clean, a big plus from my perspective. Excellent location!!! Cons: smaller rooms, but it is NY so not unusual; the week we stayed there were tours with kids, and I mean TONS of kids. The lobby was so busy you had to squeeze your way out. I requested feather pillows which were delivered, the room was stocked with only the bouncy foam ones, and the bedding had a bit of a musty smell. The primary issue for me was noise - I could hear the neighbor due to sound leaking in where the walls meet the windows (and the fact that they were just obnoxiously loud). My misfortune was to be next to these mid-week partiers while I was there for business, so between midnight and 3AM I didn't really get to enjoy any sleep for 2 nights. Security did come up twice and the second time had a good long talk with them and it seemed to quiet down. Once they moved on, the third night was quiet and quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Bad for Business Travelers”
Reviews.Author: BFox32
Reviews.Content: This is one of those hotels where they more you pay, the less you get. EVERYTHING was an extra charge so it was a terrible place to stay for a business traveler. Here are some examples: Gym Access - $15 Internet in the Room - $10 Toothbrush (I forgot mine) - $7 from the minibar I was told! Are you kidding! As a business traveler I can't write off access to the Gym and having to go downstairs to the lobby to get access to the Internet is anything but relaxing. I won't be staying here again if I can help it. I hate getting nickled and dimed for everything and this hotel does just that.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the NY tourist! Be ready for small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Canadianstudent77
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, and of course small rooms because it is right in the heart of midtown manhattan. Great location 2 block south walk to times square and 2 north to central park, also subway system right outside that worked very conveniently for easy travel. I'm a student and went with my girlfriend and booked through expedia with zero problems and everything went great! Also got a very good bang for our buck! Would defiantly recommend this hotel and would return. Only negative is that the concierge was very short and not very helpful, but I guess I didn't have an extra 20 to slip him. But u enjoy doing my own thing, so I enjoyed the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Never stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: BBYoon
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with Sheraton chain at this moment. Location was excellent but overall it ruined our stay in New York. I was staying room next to elevator and it's sound was so noisy that we couldn't sleep all night. More furious thing is about worker's attitude. I wonder if general manager or his/her staff is managing them. I read tons of answer that GM replies to complaints about this hotel but it really looks facade to me since non of staff looks like knowing complaints of customers. I have requested to change my room but front office's attitude was extremely annoying. Instead of worrying and taking care of customers, their reaction was like "so what". Furthermore since they said that there are no rooms available, i had to pay more money for change. I just choose to stay at original room bearing out all the noises all night, which was horrible. I made complaints about these, but it looks like front desk ignored it and never went to manager level. If you are ever thinking about staying at this hotel, DO NOT, never consider about staying here. I would rather suggest some hotels at Jersey City.

Reviews.Title: “Short NYC Trip - Just Right”
Reviews.Author: busstraveler85
Reviews.Content: My family and I (Parents + 22 year old brother) came down from Boston and spent 3 nights here in May. I have to admit that I was a little nervous staying here after reading all the reviews, but I'm happy to say that we all had a great stay. We drove down from Boston in a rental, and the doorman helped give us directions to the nearest AVIS so that my father and brother could drop the car off. Very friendly guy and perfect directions. While waiting to check into our rooms, the person helping us at reception was extremely friendly and accommodating. He helped us get a renovated suite and tried to get our rooms to be on the same floor. The suite for my parents was great and that's where my brother and I hung out most of the time when we were at the hotel. Our standard room (renovated) was just right (albeit a little small). The hotel location is PERFECT. Just a couple of blocks away from times square, a couple of blocks away from 5th avenue and a couple of blocks away from central park. We would walk everywhere throughout the day and would come back to the hotel once a day just to relax for an hour before heading out on foot again for the rest of the night. Overall it's one of the SLIGHTLY less expensive NYC hotels and it's perfect location would definitely mean i'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: dreamkr
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many places throughout NYC but always find myself coming back to the Sheraton New York. You simply can't beat the location for business or pleasure as it's central to everything. I avoid traffic jams with being able to walk to the theater, Central Park, 5th Ave shopping, museums...and most of my business meetings are central to that location. I appreciate the rooms having spacious working area/desk for business and a generous daybed/couch for an extra body or shopping bags!. The New Club Lounge saves me bucks with breakfast and afternoon snacks with amazing views of the city. I appreciate it's got a huge beautiful workout / health club and not a sorry facility like many hotels. Having lived in NYC, and now traveling there few times a year, it's the best way to do the city. You get allot for the price especially now with all the new renovations, can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “You will not find WORST service anywhere else.”
Reviews.Author: roncho78
Reviews.Content: I travel weekly around the world for business and I have never encountered worse service standards than at the Sheraton New York. My first stay at a sheraton hotel was a terrible experience. Every single service staff that I talked to was rude, unhelpful and will never go the extra mile to make your stay more comfortable. The location was the only saving grace for this badly set up establishment. I will never stay in another Sheraton if you paid me to. Not recommended for business travellers. A 2 Star Hotel at best.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: ronna
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in a great location near soho and the west village with a great staff and comfortable rooms

Reviews.Title: “Even Better Than the Last Time!”
Reviews.Author: Nazy5519
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a girls trip to NYC. We stayed at the Shertaton New York Hotel and Towers for four nights (June 9-13). We were on the 35th floor in a brand new remodeled room. The room was VERY nice and decorated beautifully. As always it was a quiet and wonderful stay. The hotel is located at 7th and 53rd between Times Square and Central Park. It is also very near a subway station and the theaters. This was my fourth stay at this hotel and I cannot wait to go back for my 5th!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: AlHoos
Reviews.Content: I really don't know where to begin. I stayed here in June of 2011 for a business conference and brought my wife along as well. The problems started even before my stay, I had to change my reservation from four nights to three and needed some advice from the concierge desk. Half of these calls were never answered. As incredible as it sounds, I could not get someone to answer the phone on three ocassions. When we arrived, we were given a room in the lower level and it was in very poor shape. The TV and AC did not work. We were moved from the 5th to the 6th floor the second day and got AC but still no TV. We gave up on the TV at that point and decided to tough it out. On checkout morning, I called to get our car from valet and I was floored by the expereince. My first call to the switchboard/front desk was not answered. My second call about 5 minutes later was answered and I was tranferred ot the garage but the garage never answered. I called the switchboard a thrid time and incredibly the line opened up but the call was not picked up. I was on speaker and I heard two males talking to each other about thier frustrations that morning in dealing with upset guests. I actually heard one of them brag to the other that he told a female guest that he couldn't perform a miracle and make her air conditioner work. After about 45 seconds of this unbelievable show, one of them picked up the phone and I tried to explain that I needed to get our car from valet to catch a flight and that I called earlier and the garage wasn't answering. He did not wait to hear that and transferred me to the garage in mid sentence (a clear pass-off). After about 3 minutes the garage anwered. We checked out and will not look back. Stay somewhere else. There are too many much better values close by.

Reviews.Title: “Location and service was terrific.”
Reviews.Author: Gail258
Reviews.Content: On our first trip to New York we were fortunate to stay at the Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers. we loved the location because it is very central to many things to do. The hotel staff were all very courteous, eager to help out and welcomed us just like you see in the commercials! The accommodations were comfortable with excellent room service for assistance with getting polyester filled pillows in place of the down pillows (due to an allergy). The hotel was busy enough but rarely did we wait for the elevators or services (eg. restaurant recommendations). we were out until midnight without any concerns. The regular room was a bit small for 3 people. overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Sheraton and would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York City. Gailh

Reviews.Title: “"Great Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: aawjarerw
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. We stayed in Manhattan for 5 days and it was fine. We never ate in the hotel but the rooms were extremely clean, only thing was the TV didn't work too well but this really wasn't an issue because there's not much TV watching when you're all day sightseeing. It's in a fantastic location being next to times square and the shops on 5th avenue. I would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed ourselves tremendously and would recommend this to everyone we know.”
Reviews.Author: jacolina306
Reviews.Content: The hotel was absolutely spectacular..especially because of one of the managers there made it so wonderful. He sent fruit, dessert and champagne to our room..which was a total surprise. My boyfriend got me the room for the night for my birthday because I always wanted to stay in the city, even though I'm from here. I loved every second of it. He gave us a great room with a great view. We loved the food and especially the breakfast. The buffet was amazing - just what we needed after a night of partying. This manager was great and didn't know what to do for us. He told other staff members about us and they were amazing as well. Overall it was an amazing stay and I would definitely recommend this to everyone I know. I already have been. :) I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “We'll definitely be coming back to Sheraton New York”
Reviews.Author: qianamyburgess
Reviews.Content: My family and I were at the Sheraton new York hotel in Midtown Manhattan Memorial Day weekend this year. From the moment we got there, we were treated wonderfully. Our check-in host, Joy, immediately provided us with coloring books and crayons for our boys, 2 and 5 years old. Check-in was easy and painless, and we were able to get our mini-vacation off to a great start. The room was comfortable and clean, and the boys enjoyed thoroughly enjoyed being able to go to the pool. Joy was able to secure a refrigerator for our room, as well as providing ice cream for our boys, not to mention a beautiful cheese platter with wine for my husband and I to enjoy. Upon check-out, I mentioned that I noticed a few hairs in the backroom that had been left behind, possibly by the cleaning staff, and Joy took care of that as well and comped us with a continental breakfast. This trip was so much more than we anticipated! We will definitely be back to the Sheraton New York - Midtown!

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service at its best!”
Reviews.Author: john363785
Reviews.Content: Lacey went out of her way to help me....very professional...very impressed with her and the staff at the hotel...thanks for everything...

Reviews.Title: “better watch your appearance”
Reviews.Author: BerlinerTravel
Reviews.Content: I won’t want change the world; I simple want a decent stay for my money. Let me give you a little background. I stayed for a conference in May 2011 in the Sheraton Hotel and Towers Manhattan, NYC. If you book your room at the hotel website or over the phone you will be quoted one price for the standard room throughout whole hotel. However, you cannot pre-specify the room or the floor you will be staying. Yes, when you check in- you are assessed! The exact criteria may not be apparent to you at the beginning, but when you have a little time, spend it by the lifts and you will understand. The hotel has 3 different lifts leading to 3 separate parts of the hotel. (6-20 floor, 21-28th floor and 29-50th floor), hence the lifts do not stop at the other levels. Than look at the dress code of the people using these different lifts and you will understand. Yes, if you are assigned to 6-20th floors you didn’t make it in NYC. How are the rooms? I had the benefit to see all 3 levels. The common ones (6-20th) are old, dirty, the EC blows more dust than air, carpets stained, dust all around, bathrooms without hot air extractor, you name it. I did not have bed bugs (another reviewer mentioned) during my first night in lower section. Look at few of the other reviews and you will get a representative picture. The ‘middle level’ (21-28th) has renovated rooms in a generally better standard and the upper newly decorated rooms (29-50th floor) are really quite smart. BUT, the guests pay the same rate! Now, I tried to ask the employees about the 3 levels for the 3 different lifts and kind of people (who pay the same price!) As you would have expected, I drew a blank; at least 4 times I tried. High likely that it is management policy to keep the assignments confidential, woun't it be. Now are you up for the challenge- and believe that you can manage to get value for your money- than don’t come with shared transport which drops you at the side entrance, the limos and good taxis drive you to the front entrance where a porter greets you, be smartly dressed, have the usual gold or platinum CC for your account, you know. If you aren’t up for this challenge and you are concerned you will end up at the lower floors – I have to say you would be foolish to spend your money for an unpleasant, uncomfortable and perhaps degrading stay.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings!”
Reviews.Author: chinny188
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and the room was nice (only when we were moved to the refurbished part of the hotel otherwise the 'older rooms' were antiquated). The staff (especially the duty manager) were generally helpful although we did encounter a most unfriendly and unhelpful receptionist on the evening we checked in. However, I would definitely not reccommend the 'Fine Jewellery' boutique within the lobby area as I got 'conned' by the sales-person there!

Reviews.Title: “First class service.”
Reviews.Author: SARChicago
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a bit for business and have stayed at hotels in most of the major cities in the U.S. and around the world and the level of service I experienced at the Sheraton New York Hotel & Towers during a recent business trip gave me no choice but to write a review and share my experience. So, what words can I use to accurately describe this experience? How about, 'unexpected amazement'. Every member of the hotel staff that I interacted with made an extraordinary effort to accommodate my needs in a manner that showed genuine interest and concern. From accommodating a room request to helping me find the best price for a charger for my computer to replace the one I forgot to bring with me. Specific thanks to Nicole at the front desk, Jennifer who helped us track down our booth and the kind waiter (whose name I cannot remember) who met our breakfast needs. And David, the Bell Captain, is truly a treasure. Thanks to all for knowing how to make a guest feel special. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Sheraton I have ever stayed.”
Reviews.Author: ktscott01
Reviews.Content: The only thing that is right with this hotel is the location. The rest is just horrible. Checkin I'd like to say there was no problem but after thinking about it their service was bad. They are not thankful nor courteous. He got me out as fast as he could with little info. Club Floor You can only access the club floor as a platinum member. No gold member. They seem to forget to mention that on the website. Staff Everyone I met was just curt and rude except for the bell hops. I stood with a coworker as he checked into his room and I actually thought the clerk might start to curse at us for no reason. She had an answer for every questions and it was short and rude. Rooms If you get a new room they are nicer than the OLD rooms but they are polished turds anyway. Well I started in an old room and it smelled like like grandmothers Florida house. MOTHBALLS! So I called and was told they would give me a new room after one was cleaned. Well guess what? They never set it up so I had to go from a king to a double to get a renovated room. So I get into the new room and I can see where they spent the money. Putting in an air conditioning unit that doesn't work well, a new mirror in the bathroom and then covered up the old stuff. It looks like they polished a a turd to make it look nice. Bed So I switched from a sweet sleeper to a regular bed and it was horrible. The beds are so uncomfortable I really felt like sleeping on the floor. Bathroom Maybe this was the high point because I had hot water right away. What made it even better was the blood that was on the floor and sink when I got into the room. Yeah thats right there was dried blood on the sink and floor. Internet Its not free. Overall skip this place and book the Motel 6. I bet at least there you get nicer people.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - outdated rooms”
Reviews.Author: keb1234
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights while working in the area. Upon check-in I was given an "upgrade" to a corner room, which the desk agent informed me was a little bit bigger room. I don't know what the standard room looks like but my room was tiny! Also, judging from the pictures other people have posted, I think that I got a room that had not yet been remodeled. That said, this hotel is in a great location - close enough to times square that you can walk out the front door, look to the left and see everything, but far enough away that you don't immediately step out into a crowd of people. This hotel is good for tourists coming for a couple of days who don't plan on spending a lot of time for the room, but not the best option for business people who need space to work (desk areas was tiny). I stayed at the East Side Marriott and the Marquis after this and those were much better hotels for me.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places I have ever stayed.”
Reviews.Author: kf999medicww
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a welcomed sight after our flight had been delayed from LHR to JFK. We checked in for our tenth aniversary break without the three kids..peace at last. The check in was fast and to the point, Thats New York!, we were on the way to our room in minutes. We were given a renovated room, thanks to the heads up from a previous poster. We woke at 0645 to the sound of drilling from the next room!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! A quick call to guest services and lots of appologising later we were out in the big apple. On our return a new room was waiting and further to this complimentary breakfast for the duration of our stay. Friday night was enjoyed out in the city and on our final retreat toour room a bottle of champagne and chocolate dipped giant strwberys. Just a gift from the hotel for our tenth. The place was clean, friendly and one of the most hospitable places I have ever stayed in north america. I have travelled the world for buisness and pleasure and my standard was always measured by one of my favourite resorts the RItz Carlton in Mo Bay. For NYC it was the Michaelangelo Now I have a new standard for NYC The Sheraton New York

Reviews.Title: “Not worthy of 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: NewJGal
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in NYC a few times for our anniversary and other overnight trips and always book through Priceline. The last two hotels were 3.5 star hotels and extremely nice, friendly, clean with spacious rooms. The first problem with the Sharaton was the check-in. There were only two people at Reception other than the two who were for Preferred customers, and the line was long. The room was very clean, but it was small, and the bathroom needed serious fixing up. Wallpaper was peeling off and discolored. The hotel is being renovated, and perhaps after they are finished it will merit 4 stars, but right now the 3.5 star hotels far surpassed the Sheraton in service, appearance and size of rooms. Next time I will stick with the 3.5 stars and save myself a lot of money. It WAS clean however, and nothing about the room or hotel ruined our trip. It just wasn't up to its star level in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “MUCH better than we expected!!”
Reviews.Author: SarahTC
Reviews.Content: We had low expectations going into this hotel, and it was really terrific! I had known several people who had stayed here before the hotel was renovated, and they said it was uncomfortable, cramped and pretty unpleasant. However, things have changed. It looks as though Restoration Hardware has come through the hotel and given it an extreme makeover! The rooms are large (for NYC standards), modern and comfortable. We stayed there with our two small children and were relieved to find that the room had two queen sized beds (very comfortable, I would add, with down comforters and a multitude of pillows!). The service was pleasant and prompt. The lobby was bustling but also pleasant. Also, the neighborhood is quite nice and very convenient, just a few blocks from Times Square and a few blocks from the park. There are also a number of subway stops within a stones throw, so it is very easy to get around. I would definitely recommend this hotel. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Not very customer friendly”
Reviews.Author: maruchi911
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Hotel and Towers is a very beautiful hotel, which I have visited before. We stayed there because in December 2009 the service was terrific. This time, it seemed like every time we needed something, it was like asking for favors. Many times it would take hours to get someone to help you. Our safe was broken and when we called for the third time, the gentleman who answered simply told me that they were "too busy". I did make a complaint through Starwood and their manager called me and was very apologetic. She promised us a very nice vacation next time we visit New York. Hopefully, she's telling the truth. I will try them again in November.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfertable surroundings”
Reviews.Author: Jackster31
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights and were very pleasantly surprised with room and 'sweet sleeper' bed. Although not too big, it was very clean which I find far more important. The so called 'link' in the lobby where there was free wifi at disposal was the best. Not too impressed with the fact that the rooms didn't have the same on offer (just wired internet for laptop; which doesn't work for the ipad). Also the coffee at their 'Starbucks' cafe wasn't vintage imo (too sweet). No matter though because the balans on this trip goes way out on the positive. We would recommend this hotel to anybody visiting the big apple (leasure of business, first time or not). You're right in the centre of NY and the subway is literally outside the back entrance. ENJOY our STAY, WE DID!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pay attention before booking!”
Reviews.Author: Andrebp
Reviews.Content: I stayed one week in this hotel. Very good location, buttttt... nobody told me tha the Hotel was under construction, rebuilding a lot of roons/floors, so, it was terrible satying in a room with my wife who was pregnant and with so much noise. The whole hotel was also crowded. So, it´s not a cheap place and the service is really poor. Besides all these things, we had to stay the 1st night in a wrong room (not for a couple) and I had booked in advance. Think twice about staying in this one. If it´s your first time in NY, it´s better to stay near Macy´s store area or the Empire State.

Reviews.Title: “Joy to the world!”
Reviews.Author: sandyshDover
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to NYC for our 26th anniversary.As a Starwoods Preferred guest we were able to stay for 2 nights with points. While checking in my wife let slip that we were there celebrating our anniversary. Joy, our hostess immediately congratulated us, arranged for a complimentary cheese plate and bottle of wine be sent to our room, and upgraded our room to club level on the 45th floor allowing us to get complimentary h'orderves in the evening and continental breakfast in the morning in the club lounge. She went above and beyond to make our stay as comfortable and special as possible. The newly renovated room was fabulous. The service throughout the hotel was courteous and friendly. I would go out of my way to return. Tell Joy Hello!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with Much-Needed Improvements!”
Reviews.Author: GirlUnderPar
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at this hotel. We've always been satisfied with the accomodations in the past (because you can't beat the location) but I will admit the hotel was getting a bit tired and shabby. The renovations are quite an improvement. Yes, the hotel is still large and busy...but it's New York! Isn't that why you're there? The rooms are still small (we all agree that's par for the course in NY) but are certainly updated and have a newer feel to them. Comfy bedding, large flat screen t.v., updated bath. We were there on Memorial Weekend and while there was a "buzz" throughout the weekend, we didn't have any problem with the noise level at night. We also didn't experience any of the "rudeness" that others have complained about in earlier reviews. In fact, when we checked in, I mentioned that we were there to celebrate my mother's 60th birthday and the super-nice woman who checked us in (I'm sorry I can't remember her name), sent up a bottle of champagne. Very thoughtful and appreciated. We will definitely stay here again on future trips. I would have recommended the hotel prior to the renovation (but felt compelled to explain some of its shortcomings). Now, I would recommend it wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, suiting halmark property for chain”
Reviews.Author: yyzron
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night at the Sheraton New York Hotel & Towers. I didn't get to experience too much of the hotel ammentities over that time, but I can share my overall impression. This hotel is big, and the lobby is quite grand. Probably lost in today's hotels, but entering the lobby there is a spacious lobby bar, a large LINK lounge and a grand foyer to the check in desk. This property is recently renovated and the decor is modern, but not cold or uber urban like a W or Element property. Overall, quite nice and comfortable. This caries forward to the newly renovated room I had on the 35th floor. Spacious for New York standards. I had a nice couch by the window. Nicely appointed with a 42" set into the wall. It was mounted on an extending swival so you could access the input jacks to plug in a computer. The room was quiet and comfortable. The bathroom was also renovated, but kept the orginal tub instead of a stand up shower. The location is also very good. A few blocks north of Times Square gets the 24hr blinking lights out of your windows, but is a short walk away. A few nice Irish pubs in the area that were lively on a Wednesday night. Will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay! Excellent location!!!”
Reviews.Author: cval64
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for three nights May 22-25, 2011. This our second stay at this property & am looking forward to going back! The location is excellent for central New York City. We were two blocks from Time Square & felt very safe walking about at night. They had two NYPD officers at the door during daylight & nighttime hours which is super! We walked to Central Park everyday. Its about 4 blocks up from the hotel & there are delis along the way for pizza ir paninis to have a quick lunch. The subway is around the corner from the hotel entrance & it made it very comveniant to get around the city. We even took the E train to JFK. It was $7 dollars a person, instead of a $60 cab ride! Our room was on the 17th floor & it was quiet. The rooms have been renovated & the bed was very comfy! They provide a small coffe pot in your room, which is always nice. There is a computer in the lobby, so we could print our boarding passes. The lobby are is spacious & has big comfy chairs to sit & talk or just people watch! If you want to take a tour. They pick up just on the corner from the hotel. Its very conveniant! Overall this hotel is great! We will definetly be back!

Reviews.Title: “First Time in NY”
Reviews.Author: Joman31
Reviews.Content: For our first time in NY, we wanted a central hotel close to Times Square, reasonable in price (as we are students), and clean (given the bed bug problems plaguing large cities...). The Sheraton was all those things. Although we arrived before check-in and were informed that our request for two double-beds had not been honored (as we had booked using a service), Joy at the check-in counter accommodated us, finding another available room that suited our needs. Despite being a little tight on space, the room was very clean and comfortable, and perfect for our needs. Moreover, the staff was pleasant and very helpful. Located in the Theatre District, the hotel was right next to Times Square and within walking distance of central landmarks and shopping. Everything else is just a reasonable cab ride away. Needless to say, we had an excellent time. Just as an FYI... there is construction going on adjacent to the hotel, so if you plan to sleep beyond 9am, you may hear drilling.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near times square”
Reviews.Author: swiper4
Reviews.Content: Hotel is being renovated right now. Concierge lounge is under renovation (44th floor), so they temporarily have it right off the lobby. I stayed on 45th floor and it has new carpeting. Nice little bar area right off the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “This Just Isn't a Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: therlp
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot. I stay in a lot of hotels. It is the nature of my business. This Sheraton really stands out from the hotels I have stayed in during the past two months (and that number is disturbingly large). And not for good reasons. To start, it seems some of the rooms are renovated and others are not. I was placed in a non-renovated room because I booked my reservation on Priceline, notwithstanding my Starwood status. Fine. The renovated rooms have wireless internet. The non-renovated rooms do not. Again, fine. What was not fine was that the cable in my room did not work and that this hotel outsources all IT problems to Calgary. Yes, Canada. On deadline at work, I had to call Calgary to find out what was wrong with my Internet connection because, as the front desk clerk told me, "what do you want me to do about it?" To make a long story short, I had to spend almost an hour on the phone with Calgary to find out that the physical cable provided by the hotel did not work and that they needed to actually have maintenance come up and fix it. Only, this was 11 at night and it would take "at least an hour" to get maintenance to my room. For the second time, I was told, this time by a manager, "what do you want me to do about it?" (Their solution was that I type up a very sensitive client document on a public computer in the lobby of the hotel. Yeah, no.) Also, the room was tiny, even by New York standards, I woke early to construction either on or in the building, the check-in and check-out lines bordered on TSA long and, again, the staff was a perfect combination of indifferent, incompetent and unfriendly. And the best part is, when I went to check out, a manager gave me $30 or some absurd amount to spend in the hotel because he somehow found out what happened with my stay and, "that is not how we do business." On the contrary, that is exactly how you do business.

Reviews.Title: “Great Upgrade, very stylish”
Reviews.Author: SDBIZTraveler
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Sheraton New York Hotel and towers for the past 10 years due to it's great location and wonderful staff. I have been waiting anxiously for the new remodel to be complete, and this last stay was worth the wait. The rooms are very nice, great amenities, and a very nice work station for the busines traveler. I am platinum at Starwood, and always seem to get upgraded and/or well taken care of from the VIP manager and her staff. I adore the Club lounge folks (Barbara, Tommy, and of course Zoe). The hotel has very convenient connections to all the subway stations, close to all 3 airports, and only a 5 minute walk to the park. I run every day, and my treat is to stay at this hotel and run in Central park. Great hotel, even better staff! K. Gran

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel Right in the Heart of the Theatre District”
Reviews.Author: citytraveller14
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location; it's steps away from broadway shows, Times Square, and shopping. The hotel is large but surprisingly the rooms are quiet. If you can get a renovated room your stay will be even better because the decor is nice, there's a flat-screen TV, and renovated bathroom. The room is spacious enough for two people. The views are phenomenal. The hotel is near high-end dining but it's also adjacent to Stage Deli when you want a late-night snack. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The customer service in this hotel was phenomenal.”
Reviews.Author: longhorntex
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. There was great customer service and the rooms are spacious and clean. One of the hotel receptionists, Joy, was a great help to us. She really showed us how great the Sheraton is in terms of service and efficiency. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in New York for a long period of time (week or more).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice renovations”
Reviews.Author: dsenden
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton New York for a business meeting and was impressed with the renovations. I stayed in one of the renovated rooms and it looked great. Nice sized desk area that I used for laptop work. The bathrooms are small, but this hotel was built a long time ago and they've made the appropriate updates. The granite counters and new lighting sconces are plus. The new key system is interesting and must be the latest technology. Made me feel safe that it's been upgraded. Corriidors were nicely updated as well. I had a challenge at the front desk when checking in and it was handled quickly. A manager came out to speak with me; he was apologetic and efficient in solving the problem. Otherwise the staff did their jobs unobtrusively. They could be friendlier, but I'm from the south and I understand the northern mentality is different. It's expensive, but that's unavoidable in New York City. Great location close to the park and a myriad of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I thought”
Reviews.Author: Silvergirl818
Reviews.Content: I travel to NY several times a year for work-related conferences, etc. While I had visited the Sheraton NY for a conference or two, I had never actually stayed there before. From my prior visits, I wasn't extremely impressed by the lobby or restaurant, etc.. Well I must say that I stayed there earlier this week for one night and thought it was quite nice. The rooms are a decent size for NY, it was modern and pretty clean. I say pretty clean because someone else's hair (a couple of strands) greeted me as I entered the bathroom...lol:) Other than that, no problems. Room service guarantees delivery in 30 minutes and they were right on time. And let me say that they had some of the best buffalo wings that I have ever tasted! The bed was super comfy that evening and I have zero complaints, other than perhaps a very oddly placed flat screen tv. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and no complaints some people must complain about anything!!!”
Reviews.Author: cabbie61
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay here for 5 days. Our room was a remodelled one and although not as big as normal USA hotel ones it was more than adequate and who cares how much time u spend in your room?! The location of the hotel is excellent you are central to everything and there are a lot of restaurants close by but don't go to the lindy's it's a rip off and the waiting staff are not the most hospitable! The hotel staff however we came into contact with were fine and yes you have to pay to leave your bags after checkout but who cares it's nice to be able to do that! All in all had a great stay here and would def stay again and recommend it to family and friends and am glad I didn't go by the reviews which I normally do!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wifi is slow and expensive”
Reviews.Author: Ronbiker
Reviews.Content: If a hotel charges for WiFi, I expect it to high speed. I am writing this review using 3G because it is faster than the hotel's WiFi service. The hotel is spending millions for renovations you would think they would start with something that should be a basic service.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: MarkMor
Reviews.Content: First of all it seems people only ever seem to write bad reviews. I had read some of these reports and was worried about staying here, I had no need to be. Hotel was clean and the staff as friendly as they could be in a large busy Hotel in New York. The room was superb with big double beds and soft fluffy pillows. Bathroom was as you would expect again very clean. Location is great short walk to central park and 5th Avenue. $3.25 to store your case...? Thats cool , Better than wheeling it round with me. I was told I was a rude English man by one of the promoters in Time Square because I did not want to attend his comedy show, Seems my polite No thank you was not good enough. So differant people measure rudness at differant levels. New York - Amazing city This Hotel was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sabrina38
Reviews.Content: We came up to the city for only one night on a Saturday to see The Book of Mormon. We arrived early - about 1:00 pm - the line to check-in was fairly short, only three people in front of us, but no two-bedded rooms were available. So, we checked our totes and went out to do some shopping. When we returned at 3:00pm, the line was even shorter. We checked in and collected our totes and we were not charged for leaving them. The room on the 35th floor and was very, very nice. Newly renovated, good view of the city, plenty of room. The beds were very comfy. It was quiet and I slept very well. Bill under the door the next morning. No complaints here.

Reviews.Title: “Longest check in EVER”
Reviews.Author: leedi44
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a LOT of hotels but never written a review but this place gave me the inspiration! We arrived at the hotel at 0600 after flying from Vegas and were met by a friendly person who said that there weren't any rooms available yet but the first available would be ours. No problem I figured and totally understandable when arriving at a hotel so early. Around 9am we asked how the room availability was going and a very rude staff member scoffed and said that the cleaners didn't even start until 10am and to come back later. Thankfully we had other friends already staying at the hotel so we took our bags to their room, had a shower and went out for the day. At 1550 we arrived back at the hotel and stood in a long line, I was then greated by the worst person in service I have ever met. He told me that there was still no room available (queen) but said that we could get a room with 2 single beds, after a long heated discussion with this person explaining that I had been trying to check in for 9 hours he said there was nothing that could be done. I then explained that in 9 hours I could have bought a room and a bed and be asleep he changed his mind and found us a king room. The hotel room was just a hotel room, I see a lot of reviews on here complaining that it's small. It is but you have to remember that it is new york and it was what I was expecting and maybe even a bit better. The cleaners in the hotel are lovely and should be exchanged for their customer service staff. Then on the day we checked out we were pleased to find out that we would get charged $3.25 for each item of luggage to be stored. I have NEVER had this anywhere I have EVER stayed. Then the guy looks at you when you pick the bags up and seems to expect a tip. Here is your tip!!! Don't stay at this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot believe this is a 4 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Happytravelershj
Reviews.Content: The hotel location was good. That's the end of the praise one can have for this hotel. In every other way, it is a 2.5 star hotel that somehow has managed to get a 4 star rating.
