We don't usually write reviews, but we were so appalled we are even thinking of writing Starwoods to complain. This hotel puts shame on the entire chain. When we arrived, we noticed the newly done main lobby looked cheap but if only we'd realized that would be the highlight of the stay! We waited about 30 minutes in a long line for reception. Why on earth the hotel only had one person working the reception is beyond us. Everyone in line was complaining and getting agitated. When we finally get to the room (noticing the only other nice thing in the hotel -- the elevator) a surprise awaits us. The room is about the size of a bathroom in most 4 star hotels. The Holiday Inn has bigger rooms, better furniture, and comparable bathrooms. The lampshades were ripped in several places and showed stains. The alarm clock was covered in a dust layer. The wood was scratched everywhere. If it hadn't been for the large flat screen TV, I would have thought we were in a $50/night motel. The next day (after being woken up by housekeeping at 9am despite the fact we were checking out that day) we had a pleasant surprise when we attempted to leave our bags with the hotel for the day. The hotel charges $3.25 per piece, and there was a line. A long, long line. We learned that everything about this hotel involved waiting. If you don't mind wasting your time in NY, and happen to get a fantastic deal for this hotel, go for it. Otherwise, steer clear!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Shaba84
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to New York City after reading the reviews I was a little nervous but once there everything was put to rest. You can always find things wrong with a hotel but this one was great. It's in a great location and there is a subway stop right outside. We were on the ninth floor and yes, you could people coming and going at all hours but for the most part it was quiet. We had an issue with our shower one day and within ten minutes they had someone come and repair it. Would visit it again and recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Fabulous Room - Perfect for our stay”
Reviews.Author: snowchimp
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at the Sheraton Hotel and Towers and had a great time. The hotel is in a great location, only 5 mins from Times Square and Broadway, and a subway station right outside, and we never had any problem walking downtown for something to eat as there are restaurants and deli's right outside for all budgets. We stayed in a refurbished room on the 33rd floor which was nicely decorated and clean with LCD TV, and would recommend a high floor as noticed that the lower floors seemed to have more group bookings and so appeared to be busier, but as we didn't stay on these floors I can't confirm this. The hotel was still finalising its major refurbishment, but this never caused an issue, work was only carried out during office hours or overnight, and was not intrusive. The hotel staff were helpful and checking in was quick, we did have a couple of issues requiring staff assistance and these were attended quickly and efficiently. Overall it was a great short break, and we would certainly consider staying here again in future.

Reviews.Title: “SHERATON NYC ROCKS!!”
Reviews.Author: CORONA_BUFFETT
Reviews.Content: I just came from a 3 nite stay at the fabulous Sheraton NYC on 7th AVE. They have all updated rooms which are very business friendly. The staff welcomed me with open arms as I am a repeat customer. The front desk mgr, Kenny, greeted me as I checked in and welcomed me back as a repeat customer. I took advantage of the SPG platinum concierge breakfast and happy hr and it was fabulous. The SPG managers Lacey Lazarus and Zoe Cohen, welcomed me into the concierge lounge and treated me like royalty. Both Lacey and Zoe remembered my name when I came back on the 2nd nite. It was really an overall great experience. I will definitely go back again and stay at this property. As well it is in fabulous location for NYC tourists. Walking distance to pretty much about anything in the city you want to do.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shawk1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many five star hotels in NYC. While the sheraton is not the peninsula ,it is very nice and well worth the price. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Renovation work in adjacent room - "They will stop at midnight."”
Reviews.Author: biztravler20
Reviews.Content: I was travelling on business, but Pricelined this room and got a great price. Hotels say they don't stick Priceline customers in bad rooms, but I ended up in a room adjacent to a room that was undergoing major renovation. I didn't notice when I checked in because the door was shut, but when I got back to my room at 10:30pm, the door was wide open and I saw that there was just a bit of furniture, no bathroom fixtures, no windows and a scaffold was set up outside the building on that side (I was on the 38th floor). About 11pm or so, I was hearing a lot of noise through the wall as they were moving beds and furniture into that room. I put up with it for a while, but at 11:30pm I called the front desk to ask them to put a stop to the noise and the hotel told me "they will stop at midnight". So I told her that I had to be up and out by 5:30am and would appreciate if they could cut the noise off 30-min early, and she said the midnight stop time is the hotel's policy. I went to talk to the workers directly, but they never came to the door and just kept on making noises that easily passed through the thin walls of this hotel. They did stop at midnight. Not sure how that is an acceptable time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice renovations, overall good experience”
Reviews.Author: ziggirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel from Friday, Apr. 29 - Monday, May 2 with my husband and parents. I booked through Priceline's "name your price" bidding system and was a little nervous when I found out this was the hotel based on previous reviews. I did a little more research and concluded that negative reviews regarding college students/noise were likely due to the model UN conference. I called ahead to request two king size rooms on the newly renovated floors and hoped for the best. Check-in took five minutes which was great. We received two rooms on the 36th floor with just a room between ours and the construction zone. However, the most noise we heard was Saturday afternoon when we stopped for a rest from our busy sightseeing schedule. It couldn't have been too bad because two in our party were able to nap. We heard absolutely nothing from Saturday evening until Monday morning (paint rollers) and some talking around 8:00am. I had been up for a few hours already so it wasn't an issue. The rooms were nicely appointed although a little more dusting could be done. The free wi-fi was relatively strong and we had no complaints about the staff. Marco at the front door was great and the concierge pointed my husband in the right direction for a great slice of pizza.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, nice hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: TheBaig
Reviews.Content: The hotel is large and you may have to wait to check in - but it's worth it...the rooms are well done and the shower head is great. you do have the ability to check your bags with the coat check if you have a later flight and don't want to drag your bags around town... nice hotel...good price...glad I stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Do not use Priceline or Expedia to book this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: ConnorRyleigh
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to get a deal on this hotel, only to find out that the hotel would not grant my request for a 2 double bed room after it had been booked as a double occupancy. The hotel said that they were completely booked. After many lengthy phone conversations with Priceline and this hotel, I was continually informed that the hotel was booked and had no double beds available the nights of my stay. I would be stuck with a "one bed room". However, when I went to the hotel booking site and talked to a reservations associate, she said they had ample rooms and was more than willing to guarantee a "2 double bed room" for the going rate. Due to the Priceline reservation, I was told that NO 2 bed rooms were available to me, which was a lie!! I find it fraugulant on both companies behalf and will further spread the word that both should be avoided at all costs!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: pericomx
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very convenient to Times Square, Central Park, 5fth. Ave. The staff is not friendly. We have some difficulties for the firs 2 nights, we were 4 in a 1 king room with rollaway bed. After that they move us to a 2 queen bed room. Rooms are very small. Since I'm a gold member I receive continental breakfast for 2 for just 20.00 Usd, ask for this at VIP lounge. The hotel is very, very busy.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than the W”
Reviews.Author: rhartogs
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night after two at the nearby W on Lexington Avenue. I was more impressed with my room at the Sheraton. I stayed on floor 26, and I think it is a newly renovated room. The bed was large and comfy, the shower was great, I wish my shower head at home had that much pressure. There was also a nice loungy type of chair by the window which was cool. The TV was a nice flat screen in the wall and took up no space. I would have given this hotel five stars had it not been for the loud hallways. It seem that everyone who came off the elevator was laughing. Was there a comedian in riding the elevator for fun? Also, I am not a big fan of staying in Time Square area, but if I had to again, I would stay here. Check in was easy. I was way early, so I did a pre-check in and put my bags in bag checked and walked around the city. The free wifi was strong.

Reviews.Title: “Undergoing renovation”
Reviews.Author: drqarlington
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel the last week of April checking out May 1, 2011. The hotel rooms in the "upper" portion of the hotel are undergoing renovation and while small are very nice! The only downside is that you will not be sleeping much past 7:30 am, which is only a downside if you are traveling with a late sleeper. The hotel has a great work out facility but it is not free for all guests so you need to make sure when you book your hotel whether your stay comes with free access or not. Otherwise it is $5 per visit or $20 for your entire stay. The hotel does have a Starbucks/bar area which switches from one to another around 4:00 pm..again very nice atmosphere. There is a dining area and we had a breakfast there on Sunday of our departure, it was a little pricey and we had only 20 minutes to each because it was closing at noon ($77 with tip). Overall, the hotel is very convenient to Times Square, Central Park, and has several Delis across the street (I'd recommend a visit to the Stage Coach). Don't bother eating at Lindy's next door...way overpriced and lots of attitude.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION BUT TOO NOISY”
Reviews.Author: TRACEYCHELMSFORD
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel after travelling from London Heathrow that morning. I was travelling with my husband, son and girlfriend and 2 daughters (15 and 12). We had booked 3 rooms (for 4 nights) through Virgin Holidays and asked for 2 of the rooms to be connecting/adjoining due to not wanting our daughters somewhere else in the hotel. We checked in at around 4pm to be told that 2 of the rooms were ready but the 3rd wasn't. We didn't think this to be a problem so left all our luggage in the 2 rooms, freshened up and went out for a wander and dinner. We returned at 7.30pm (by which time we'd been up nearly 21 hours) to be told that the 3rd room still wasn't ready. We were told we could have dinner 'on the hotel' - not great when you've just eaten! Within 15 minutes the room was miraculously ready. We unpacked and settled for an 'early' night. I agree with other travellers that the hotel was extremely busy with young students. We were on the 19th floor (of 20) and was woken every night with returning guests shouting loudly at 2am in the morning. This isn't what I would have expected from a hotel of this standing and didn't make for a good night's sleep. Having said that the room was clean, the bed clean and bathroom adequate (towels were far too small though). There was plenty of hanging space but no drawers in 2 of the rooms to unpack clothing that didn't need hanging. This is the 3rd time we've been to New York and the Sheraton is by far the best location we've stayed in - it is literally a couple of minutes walk from Times Square. On checking out (which is by 12 noon) we asked where we could leave our luggage as we were flying back to the UK overnight. We were informed the hotel contracts this service out and that it would be $3.25 per item. With 10 items between us (including hand luggage)this was outrageous. I went to the front desk and eventually was given a ticket waiving the charge. The queue to check in on our departure must have been 50 people long - I'm assuming because it was Good Friday but that would have involved a very long wait. Overall the hotel was clean and a great location but the students staying there didn't make it as enjoyable a stay as it should have been. I was also overcharged on my Mastercard bill and am still waiting for a reply from the hotel 3 days after emailing them - this isn't what I would expect.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel needs work, but staff was more than helpful and courteous.”
Reviews.Author: RegularGuy27
Reviews.Content: If you stayed during April 16th through 23rd, then chances are that you did not enjoy the hotel fully. Having stayed at the hotel previously, I can tell say that the hotel is vastly underrated and that it provides a nice change of pace. Although the hotel was completely full due to there being over 2500 college students for the National Model United Nations Conference, the staff was more than responsive and flexible to the needs of many hotel guests. Some of my colleagues did not fully understand how the refrigerator/minibar worked and left some medicine and water inside of the refrigerator. We were subsequently billed for beers that we did not drink. We went downstairs to inquire about the charges and were respectfully and informatively spoken to by Joy. Joy more than went out of her way to explain the policy to us from the hotel's vantage point and we more than willing to pay for our lack of understanding. Nonetheless, Joy waived the charges for us. Thank you for your classy and professional demeanor, Joy. It was a pleasure interacting with you.

Reviews.Title: “No Rest, No Peace, No Sleep...”
Reviews.Author: CNDTraveler79
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel as a place to stay on your trip to New York. This is a very busy conference center and the priority of the hotel management and staff is to serve the interests of the agencies holding conferences at this hotel. My wife and I did not have a good experience here. Our trip unfolded like this: Night 1 - Checked in at night after a long flight from Seattle. Woke up at 7am the next morning to the loud noises of construction in the NEXT ROOM. Sheraton did not leave any buffer between our room and the area of active construction. When I called this in, the agent reluctantly agreed to move us to an unrenovated room 10 floors down as this was all that was available. She sounded annoyed that we were not already aware construction would be taking place and did not apologize for the inconvenience. Nights 2-5- A large conference of college students was staying at the hotel for the week (many were staying on our floor). This group would party until 2am in the morning every night. Not wanting to sound like a chronic complainer, we let it go the first night and just bought earplugs. On the second night of this, we called it in to security. After a while it did stop, but we were forced to call security every night after this to complain. Security would tell them to shut it down but it would take several calls until this actually happened. The walls in this hotel are so thin that we could literally hear every word somebody was saying when they were standing in the hallway (including the discussions that security had with the noisy tenants). The noisy tenants were never evicted or moved despite the complaints the we (and probably others) made. Nights 6-7 - College students leave. A group of new college students move in and the noise continues (albeit to a lesser degree) I am not one to harshly criticize others or set unrealistic expectations when I travel - but this was a bit ridiculous. As a result of the continued noise and disruption, we were tired every morning and this had a negative impact on our enjoyment of the trip. When I did finally complained to management about noise level, they offered a $100 credit to the room which we graciously accepted. Unfortunalty when we tried to use the restaurant, this too was closed for renos (as was the gift shop each time we tried to go). We complained to Expedia.ca in an attempt to be compensated through them, they told us that they are only the "middleman" and that we need to go through the hotel. They agreed to act on our behalf and actually called the hotel, but they could not get anything better than the $100 credit. Unless you are 18-25 years old and looking for a place to party without consequences in an expensive mid-town NYC hotel, I don't recommend staying at this hotel for the following reasons: - Excessive noise and poor noise buffer system (note that most of this hotels windows are single pain so you will get the added joy of hearing street noise in addition to other residents). - Rude / inconsiderate staff - Tendency for large groups of "party age" students to attend conferences here - Practice of demonstrating favoritism towards conference attendees over other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Still a Good Location- But Be Prepared”
Reviews.Author: FlyRight
Reviews.Content: This hotel could not really have a more central location. A few blocks from Times Square and Rockefeller Center. It is also close to the shopping of 5th Avenue. The hotel is certainly decent. They claim to be in the midst of a renovation, but our room was not done. This is one busy hotel. It clearly caters to conferences and tour groups. At times we saw a hundred people in line just to check-in. While we were there a huge group of college students were there. On the last two nights they partied until I had to go to security at 12:30 am, and they were at it again the next night. The rooms are small, but that is probably fairly normal for NYC. The housekeeping in the rooms was good, but I swear they never vacuumed the hallways. Overall, this hotel is certainly worth considering and will suite a family looking for decent rooms and a great location. If you want to have a fun evening with your family, go to dinner at The View in the Marriott Marquis in Times Square, and then do The Ride show. It makes for a really fun time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrible service, be warned”
Reviews.Author: Hossein_2
Reviews.Content: We made a reservation through Priceline for a two double-bed room. We called the hotel a few days ago and confirmed the reservation as well the two double beds. We also confirmed late check in, as our flight to NY was at 7PM. We put the late check in request through Priceline as well. On the day of arrival, our friend called into the hotel to double-check, and they could not find the reservation: not under my name, nor under the reservation number, nothing, no reservation she was told. Apparently the staff were not helpful at all and sent her to other hotels in the neighborhood to check. When we arrived at 7PM, they did find the reservation, but told us the room was not ready yet!! We waited and waited, checking with the reception every one hour or so, but every time we were told the room was being cleaned and we should wait some more. They also made us to wait the check in line every time we wanted to see if our room was ready. At every occasion, the staff were plain rude, with major attitude problem. Seemed they simply did not care. To cut the long story short, they finally gave us our room key at 1AM!! The room was in a low floor, despite being having paid for a high floor room. Anyway, we were just glad to go to our room and go to bed. We got to the room, the beds and bed sheets were clean, but the carpet had large, very prominent, stains... We needed a couple of blankets and pillow, so called the reception, and they said they would send them soon. Waited another whole hour and a few calls to the reception, but no sign of any blanket or pillows. Had to go down stairs and talk to the manager to get some blankets and pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: TravelTheWorld0001
Reviews.Content: After a 24 hour flight and a pre-paid booking we arrived at the hotel at 9pm. Upon arrival, we were told that we had no booking and that they were overbooked by 25 rooms. After producing the receipts, they made us wait for another 4 hours for a room to become free. They also charged us for 4 days even though they could not offer us the room before midnight on the first day. The rooms were dirty and stains all over the carpets, receptionists were rude. Never going to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “So many better options!”
Reviews.Author: Zandbandt
Reviews.Content: Nearly every interaction with staff at this hotel was horrific! These employees just seem not to care whether you have a good experience or not. They exude "I can't be bothered!" I reserved a double room only to be told upon checkin that there were none available. We (myself, sister and niece had a king size bed with an in room cot... I could have gotten that at a lot of other NYC hotels and opted for this property because of the double room. Our tub had hair from previous guest. We called twice to have it cleaned an no one ever showed up. Concierge was so rude, no help at all. I could go on and on, but bottom line, save yourself a bad experience and stay at any one of the many NYC hotels that offer better service and care about their customer's experience.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for sightseeing - busy hotel but great stay”
Reviews.Author: TruffleBrighton
Reviews.Content: Recently enjoyed a five night stay at this hotel. We were a little apprehensive about our visit as we knew that renovation works were taking place. However, we did not need to worry - our room had been renovated and was absolutely fine - nice decor, flat screen tv, air conditioning. The room overlooked a side street so there was no traffic noise. Yes, it did take around 25 minutes to check in which was a little tiresome after a long flight but there appeared to be a convention at the hotel (which is business orientated) so there was not much that could be done to avoid it. The hotel was in an ideal location for sightseeing, being five minutes walk from Times Square and ten minutes walk from Central Park and the Rockafeller Centre. I would recommend this hotel and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: kfraser_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my Mother on a 'Mother - daughter shopping and sightseeing trip' that we have had planned for years, but only finally got round to doing! We booked the Sheraton through a travel agency, got home and read reviews on here and got quite anxious about it. However....it was the best hotel I have ever stayed in. Yes, the receptionists could wear a smile more often, but everyone was generally quite helpful. Our room was bigger than I expected, having heard horror stories that NY rooms are always small, and had everything we needed - the TV was brilliant, beds were super comfy and we loved the Starbucks coffee! We had asked for a renovated room, and got one. Renovations were going on at the front of the hotel, but we never heard them. You cannot get better location wise - 5 minutes to Times Square, 5 minutes to Central Park, 5 minutes to the Rockerfeller and just a stroll from the Broadway theatres! We didn't eat in the hotel as was quite expensive, but again we found this very normal for hotels in the area! On our first night it was very hot, but we turned the air con to cool and it seemed to cool down quite quickly. I hope this would be the same in the summer months. Was easy to check out - and we even checked in online and printed our boarding passes using their free computer and printer at the Reception. Thank you for a brilliant stay. If we ever make it back to NYC we will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “recently refurbished, lovely rooms, great concierge, ultra expensive extras”
Reviews.Author: juxybabe
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 3pm and there were no rooms ready :-( They did look after our luggage on the first day free of charge but we couldn’t access our room (shower and freshen up) until 5pm We stayed in the newly refurbished wing - beautiful (neutral palate) room, huge comfy bed and whiter than white linens, big flat screen tv and a free coffee maker. Surprisingly small bathroom, the shower was over a very short "hip bath". Nice toiletries and lots of thick white towels of various sizes Left luggage with the porters after we checked out as we had 12 hours to play in the city before our flight time. There was a small charge per item but as left luggage depots are few and far between in NY we didn’t mind this at all. The concierge staff were all very helpful recommending restaurants / bars etc and phoning ahead to make reservations for us. According to the literature on the inside of the wardrobe door, standard price for our room was $1200 per night. The recommendations reflected this price banding so buyer beware that their recommendations fit your budget.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty dirty dirty -- not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: cap31
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the Christmas holiday for a "staycation" following a dinner at Eleven Madison Park and a stroll around Rockefeller Center to see the tree and lights. After an amazing night it was really disappointing to come back to this room. It was dingy, dirty and the bathroom could not have possibly been cleaned since the last guest stayed here. We complained to the management and to be fair to them they did reward me with some bonus Starwood points. However, nevertheless I will not be back here until they spruce up the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Yes it's cheap, ut is it worth it?”
Reviews.Author: LecontedeLisle
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveller - at one time both at the highest status of both Starwood and Marriott loyalty programs at the same time. In my frequent travels to NY, I often defaulted to the Sharaton New York Hotel and Towers or its sister sitting across the street, but more often the Hotel and Towers. I did it because of practicality - always had rooms available, always on the low price-end of similarly rated hotels in mid-town. Also, my status usually resulted in me being upgraded and I had access to the club lounge - by far the best asset of this hotel (that's before its renovation). But I have to say that this is the most anonymous and unfriendly service I have ever seen in hotels of that category. I have stayed there probably 30 stays and the staff never acknowledged me. Other hotels would do things for people like me, like keeping some of my clothes and have it in my room the next time I stay there. At this hotel, Iost one jacket and one pair of pants; no one seemed to care. I hate to think how they treat accosial tourists! In retrospect, I regret being too lazy to find a convenient replacement more often. At one time, I started to go more often to the esidence Inn on the other side of Time Square, which was surprinsingly good (i'll go write a nice review for that one after I'm done here) or the Ws (but that was just too expensive some times). From now-on, I'll try to stick to locations nearer down-town and boutique-ish and to hell with the loyalty programs!

Reviews.Title: “Staff generally pretty poor to rude.”
Reviews.Author: alic2
Reviews.Content: It was too much effort for the receptionist to raise her eyes to greet us as we booked in. The rooms may have had a lick of paint, but need far more done to make them bright. The heating system was very noisy - so had to be switched off. Could go on.... The general manager did recompense to a degree and apologise. But his staff let him down.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff - not such a great room.”
Reviews.Author: mazzzy
Reviews.Content: We had some problems with our room: too hot to sleep and no way to adjust the heat; a screw stuck out of the headrest (hidden behind a padded exterior until you leaned against it); there was a discarded candy wrapper and receipt left on the floor by the bed from the previous occupant; the minibar had been broken into and several items stolen. The draw was also broken; the TV didn't work properly. The good news: the Front Desk Associate, Irini Padovan, couldn't have been more helpful. She immediately sent someone from Engineering to fix the TV, and made note of the fact that we hadn't touched the minibar. We reported the other problems when we were checking out and she was kind enough to let us store our bags for free to make up a bit for the bad room. She explained that they are renovating, which may have accounted for the too hot room, but not the trash and broken minibar and TV.

Reviews.Title: “It was a disaster”
Reviews.Author: gheeta
Reviews.Content: I stayed there because of a wonderful Omega conference. The first evening, the sink was clogged. I had to go downstairs to pick up the keys to my new room. A very unpleasant experience. The hotel is under construction. So, there is lots of noise. The staff is very unfriendly.

Reviews.Title: “Four star hotel and you cannot get air conditioning?”
Reviews.Author: ATL6841
Reviews.Content: I checked into the room and noticed that the room was quite hot on a day where the outside temps were in the low 60s. I go over to the radiator - yes, this hotel that is supposedly a four star hotel does not have a thermostat to control the temperature in the room. I moved the knob to cool and an hour later the room was still quite hot. Maintenance comes and tells me that the system is not turned on to allow air conditioning since it is early April (only heat comes out) and that I need to crack open to get the room to cool down. Are you kidding me? NEVER will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect much”
Reviews.Author: donju
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for a conference. I am a frequent traveler and have stayed at a wide range of hotels including Sheratons and my entire experience at this hotel was dreadful and unacceptable in every way possible. I arrived to a 20 minute wait at the front desk to check in – then greeted by a frowning grumpy desk clerk who responded to my request for the elevator location with a wave of her hand and an “over there” pointing to who knows where. My room was cold and remained that way for the entire stay. Attempts to contact the front desk regarding this met with a recording and an endless wait. My television would not connect to the movie menu displaying a “please wait message” that never changed. I stood in line to report this and my cold room and bathroom light issue but no repairs or resolution occurred. The carpets in my room were badly stained and soiled, and the 3 light fixture over the vanity had only one functioning bulb. The $7.00 cashews from the mini bar were stale, the line for coffee in the morning was a 20 minute wait and the coffee pot in my room was not working. Last but not least the conference rooms were FREEZING and the sponsors announced their apologies telling us the hotel was having heating issues. I have never had such a dismal hotel experience

Reviews.Title: “Renovated rooms an improvement”
Reviews.Author: xbl
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton New York Towers is finally getting its rooms redone. I've long stayed here for the location, but the dingy hallways and rooms have needed updating for quite some while. The renovations are definitely an improvement, though the rooms are still constrained by the floorplan. The renovated floors have new carpeting and light fixtures in the hallway, which make arriving on those floors inviting rather than depressing. The rooms themselves have new carpeting, furniture, and fixtures, which also make them seem up to date rather than from the 80s. There is a new key card system (the magnetic stripe replaced with a smart chip perhaps with RFID), though I'm not sure there was any benefit to the guest. Little touches like having the flat screen slightly recesses in the wall add valuable inches, that (like for airplane seating) make a noticeable difference. Having said that the rooms and bathroom remain the same size as before, that is to say pretty small. At the time of this review, the new club lounge had not yet been completed. The renovation of the gym was complete, though aside from blocking the window to the street I didn't notice any major change. The lobby remains as before--typically crowded from tour groups.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated Rooms are Great, Location is Perfect”
Reviews.Author: laurengucsb
Reviews.Content: I had to be in NYC for work and invited my mom to join me so we could stay the weekend. I arrived late, perhaps 11pm or so, and they still had a great room for me which I was impressed by. I could tell the woman at checkin was getting frustrated with the person in front of me, but she was able to keep that separate and check me in, fairly friendly and confirmed I had a great renovated room with 2 beds, as requested. I was really impressed with the room, clearly it was new, it was quite spacious for NYC (big chair and little table, 2 double beds with side table, as well as small chest under the on-wall TV. The bathroom was disproportionately small, but it was okay. The bathtub was a bit odd though, it was extremely low. We only took showers, but still, I can't imagine that anyone would be able to take a bath in there. The closet was large with a big safe, and as always, the bed was very comfortable. There was a mini-bar with everything weighted so if you pick it up, you've bought it. So overall in the room, I was very impressed, especially for NYC, but I think the fact that we were in a renovated room made a difference. Since we're platinum, we got the upgrade, free internet and then we also got the club level amenities, which included afternoon hor dourves and breakfast in the morning. I was only able to go for breakfast, and while it's in a temporary location (in the lobby), for it being free, I was pretty impressed. It wasn't eggs and bacon, but instead cold cereal, oatmeal, bagels/bread/pastries, hard boiled eggs, fresh fruit, etc. Plenty of choices to fill up before the day. The melon they used wasn't quite ripe, but everything looked really fresh so that was a plus. The concierge was very helpful to my mom who was sightseeing during the day. The location really can't be beat, close to several subway stations, walking distance to central park, all the broadway shows, midtown shopping and much more. My mom and I only took the subway when we went down to soho or out to brooklyn. It really made a difference to our stay to be so central. One slight complaint was the cleaning lady for our room. The first day we got back and there was a pillow case or sheet or something that she had left on the mini-bar. Just made it seem like she hadn't finished cleaning or something. She also took my mom's unopened banana and threw it away which seemed odd. In general, I would definitely stay here again, especially if I can guarantee a renovated room. When the hotel finishes all the rooms, I expect rave reviews (unless the prices go through the roof).

Reviews.Title: “Total rip off”
Reviews.Author: Ximen
Reviews.Content: us$360 for 1 night, total rip off for a shoebox with no views. Would never stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jloa99
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton New York was the perfect spot for an overnight with friends. Check-in was a breeze with a helpful, friendly staff. The director of reservations, Sharon Gilsenan, was a visible presence in the lobby and our bags were delivered promptly by James! You can't beat the location which in within walking distance to theatre, restaurants etc. Lobby is great spot for people watching..The burgers in the hotel restaurant were great too!

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: passnthru
Reviews.Content: Stayed for anniversay weekend March25th for two nights. Booked through Priceline, then read all the horrible reviews. Contacted Aramis the front desk manager by e-mail and explained that this was a special occasion and we were concerned about some of the nightmarish reviews of construction noise and malfunctioning room amenities. When we arrived we were met by Jorge Guerrero at the front desk.He was aware of our prior contact, Aramis also came out to greet us and assured us our stay would be pleasant. They gave us a very nice room 851 that although had not been remodeled was a very nice room in a very quiet area of the hotel with a beautiful view. Contrary to other reviews this room was very clean, comfortable and everything functioned properly. Every one at the hotel from doormen to concierges went out of their way to be pleasant and tend to your needs. Jorge and Aramis even sent us a nice gift to our room for our special occasion and contacted us several times to see if everything was going well. I was amazed at the care we got while paying priceline prices. I think whatever problems this hotel might have had in the past have certainly been remedied. The location and service cannot be beat. If you have a concern contact the front desk and your problem will be solved.

Reviews.Title: “Burned all my SPG Points for This????!!!”
Reviews.Author: stuck-in-detroit
Reviews.Content: Hotel is huge and expensive. Difficult to not just feel like another tourist and a number. I had a two night award stay which burned through all of my SPG points. Hoever, room was very noisy due to ongoing construction. From my room, do not plan to sleep past 5 am!! Too much work and noise by the hotel team. This was a complete watste and unfortunate burn of my SPG points. I could not control temp in my room, on top of being noisy. They ONLY thing this hotel has going for it is Location, Locations!! I will not use more valuable SPG points on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Room Not Clean”
Reviews.Author: MNTraveler973
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, in Midtown Manhattan. One of the beds in the room had some kind of trash, under the covers. We asked to have the bed remade. The window shutters were covered with thick dust, that we asked to have removed, because we have some allergies. The cleaning staff supervisor said it was not the day to clean them. They promised it would be cleaned and it was not.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ylc25
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights. The room was clean and spacious. Generally enjoyed our stay. Concierge was helpful for our shopping excursion, but on another occasion, recommended a restaurant for brunch that wasn't open. Also had to pay to store our luggage since our room wasn't ready yet. That was annoying, but I guess you are in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff, smallest room I've ever seen”
Reviews.Author: Katze
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband on 3/19 for one night. I usually book direct using hotels' websites, but this time I booked using Priceline. I've booked using Priceline before and felt I was treated fine, but not from this hotel. Hotels should realize that they are losing potential business by treating Priceline customers so poorly. I will avoid this hotel and tell all my friends the same. We were celebrating my husband's 30th birthday. I wasn't asking for anything unreasonable - just a King bed on a high floor. The person at the front desk cut me off during my request and said the room was already assigned since I booked through Priceline. She actually interrupted me when I was talking. RUDE. She couldn't care less that we were celebrating a birthday. I hope people treat her that way on HER birthday. We were put in a TINY room with a King bed on the 6th floor. We could hear jackhammers and cars loud and clear. Fortunately they stopped by the time we went to sleep. I have stayed in tons of hotels in New York and Europe, which is famous for microscopic rooms. This one (room 653) was sad. So tiny. It was not all bad. The bed was very comfortable and the sheets/bedding were nice. We had plenty of hot water for showers. The location is great for Midtown activities. Our room got very hot in teh middel of the night and I tried to adjust the temperature, but the fan just blew hot air even when turned to the cold setting. I had to open the window, which helped, but then we had a lot of street noise since we were facing 7th Ave and only on the 6th floor. Sheraton: You've lost a potential customer. I'm so disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “The service & attention to detail is spot on.”
Reviews.Author: deirdrejorda
Reviews.Content: Sharon gilsenan took very good care of myself & my friends. The bell boy James was awesome. Service overall was exceptional. The room was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely dated”
Reviews.Author: VinceInLA
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not provide a good value for the money. I paid over $250 for a room for one night, and expected much more. But I guess that's what hotels can get away with in New York, where hotel rooms are incredibly expensive. The Sheraton is clearly an older hotel. The room was nice, but clearly showing its age. It was difficult to regulate the room temperature - there was no in-room thermostat. Surprisingly, the hotel does not offer free wifi - and paid Internet access is wired. Apparently, you can get wifi at a designated spot in the lobby, but who really wants to go down to the lobby to use the Internet? The bed was comfortable, although the pillows were a bit soft. The flat-screen TV was large. The bathroom was tiny, and the tile/wallpaper were showing their age. The best part about this hotel? Location, location, location. It's very centrally located. I would not recommend this hotel, if you can find something nicer at a comparable rate.

Reviews.Title: “surprisingly spacious comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: anonymous154972
Reviews.Content: My husband son and I spent two lovely days at this hotel in early March ...we had come to town to see some NHL games. From the moment we arrived I was quite surprised by how spacious our room was,especially after reading how rooms in NYC tend to be more on the smaller size...we had a lovely view from our windows and it was very easy to get out and about to do the "touristy" things one must do in NYC. I had the most restful sleep in the beautiful Sweet Sleeper bed...the staff was extremely helpful and the Concierge was very knowledgeable about little hidden gem restaurants that were a bit off the beaten track..(in very safe areas)..i would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone travelling with children...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: MrMuggz
Reviews.Content: I'm a frequent traveler and I'm in NYC often for business. Before the Christmas holiday I had to chance to travel with my wife and 4 year old son. Before traveling, I touched base with Zoe Cohen, one of the managers at the hotel, and she took special care to accommodate us and make the trip truly wonderful. It was my son's first time to NYC and seeing the city from our room amazed him. He can't wait to come back so he can play in Central Park when it's a little warmer. The service was exceptional and I would highly recommend the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mroberts1954
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 11 PM, I was second in line for check in...when all of a sudden, the counter girl exclaimed her shift was over and she walked off! So had to get into another line and where it took 15 more min. to check in. Was asked if I wanted a renovated room...Well, YES! That sounded great. However, in the non-renovated hallway leading to my room, the wallpaper was pealing off. The second night (and last) night we were there, we were awaken by water dripping from the ceiling in the bathroom and then again in the morning by construction overhead. BTW....NOTHING special about the "renovated" room....would have hated to have seen the old rooms. I got the room for $140 on Priceline, so its hard to complain...but if you are paying full price....Beware!! Too many other great places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “dirty and noisy”
Reviews.Author: MIKESILVESTRI
Reviews.Content: Not much to say, signed up for the star something program. Figured I could use the business points (conference) for a free night for the wife and I. (We use Mariotte all the time). I will never use the points earned. The staff was rude and indifferent and the building was dirty and noisy (half eaten dessert in the mini bar, half stick of butter also in the mini bar with a opened container of cheese?). Spend a couple of bucks extra and get a good nights sleep, well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: stumbleone
Reviews.Content: November 27, 2010 Starwood Hotels & Resorts Worldwide, Inc. Corporate Customer Service, P.O. Box 6020, Lancaster, CA 93539 Subject: Stay at Sheraton New York From Nov 24th Thru 28th Dear sir or Madam; I’m sitting here in room 2111, looking at a large black stain in the carpet at the foot of the bed and wondering what happened to Sheraton Hotels? Last Christmas our children gave us a trip to New York City to watch Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade (on my wife’s bucket list), which included 4 nights, Plane fare, limousine to/from JFK and tickets for the Rockets. We were excited. Arriving the day before, we checked in around 3PM. The staff was courteous, the lobby looked neat and clean as an upper class hotel chain should and the Bellman took our bags up to room 2103. The first thing we did was look out the window to see the vantage point we had to watch the parade, in case of inclement weather. Much to our surprise, the window was covered in translucent film. I called the front desk and expressed my displeasure with the room. Having been told that the film was there to protect the window during renovation, we requested another room and were promptly escorted to room 2111 down the hall. Obviously, we looked out the 21st floor window toward 7th Ave. and decided that inclement weather or not, it was not a good vantage point – sigh. The temperature outside was windy and in the 40’s and we could feel a slight breeze coming from the windows and attempted to adjust the room temperature. No matter what setting the thermostat was set at, the room temp remained the same – chilly. We had to keep the curtains closed all of the time to minimize the “window effect”, and let the shower run hot water to increase the humidity. We were disappointed that the room was not equipped with a small refrigerator, but had a self serve pay as you go version instead. Must be a Union requirement, since it has been hundreds of moons since I’ve seen one in any hotel in the US or anywhere else. However, we found that cans of pop, placed between the curtains and the window, was an adequate substitute. Things began to decay further. Tried the TV. For the first 20 channels all we saw was snow, which prevented us from watching the parade on TV even if we wanted to and none of the HD channels worked. But the movie selection channel worked just fine. Fancy that! I have to say that the room was anything but spacious. However, I suppose that back in the early 1900’s people were a lot smaller and didn’t require much room. The furniture, if you could call it that, was tattered and beat, with the wall paper in the bathroom falling off of the wall. However, we made the best of probably the one of the worst and definitely, most expensive hotel rooms I’ve ever stayed at, eclipsed only by the Red Bank Hotel in New Jersey and the Cadillac Hotel in Detroit, which they closed while I was staying there!!! And I paid $377.00 per night plus tax for the room, the highest rate I’ve ever had anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TimothyElliott
Reviews.Content: As a full time business traveler, I have been staying at the Sheraton New York most weeks for about the past 9 months. Clearly the hotel is in a great location for both personal and professional reasons, but what may not be apparent is how truly wonderful the management and staff treat their guests. From a management perspective, I would highlight two people – Sharon and Zoe. Sharon is the Director of Reservations and has been fundamental to helping to arrange my ever-changing travel needs. She has gone out of her way numerous times to help me. When I need something to get done last minute, I know a simple email to her will just be handled every time. The second manager is Zoe – she is by far and away the best Frequent Travel coordinator that I have met. If you are a frequent traveler to NYC, Zoe will make sure your accommodations are perfect and will also always greet you with a big smile when you see her. If you do have a problem, she gets it fixed right away. The team is also fantastic. For the most part, I want to check in and either go to work or sleep, but I would be remiss if I didn’t mention a couple of team members by name. Muhammed goes out of his way to greet me (and everyone else) at breakfast every morning. I know a bunch of people who say they stay at the Sheraton for “the location, the gym and Muhammed’s personality”. When my wife and young children were in town, he really helped them out. He still asks about them and they still can’t wait to come back to NYC to see him. The team at the Club Bar are also fantastic – after a long day, it is really nice to have a quiet drink and a pleasant chat with Barbara or the rest of the gang. I’ve never received better assistance in such a friendly manner from any team at any hotel – and I see a lot of them. If you are in NYC for business or personal reasons – stay at the Sheraton NYC and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: VanillaJemstar
Reviews.Content: After getting a great deal for this hotel off a discount site, I was thoroughly surprised by the location of our hotel. It was walking distance to almost everything in the Times Square district, the Theatre district, MOMA, and some shopping off 5th or Madison. The service was excellent, as I expect in NYC hotels. The front room staff assisted me in everything: directions, checkin, luggage, dinner & show reservations. Everyone smiled and some even remembered me. Even the night before checkout, when I was encountering airline issues, the front of house manager even invited me to use the computer in the back office to look into my flights as their business center computers were down. The room was clean, average, small for most people, but a fair size for NYC. The fan was slightly loud but tolerable, and the beds were comfortable (we had 4 girls in a 2 queen room) We didn't use any amenities or eat at the restaurants but they seemed full in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “A special hotel experience for a special birthday weekend”
Reviews.Author: nprugger15
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton with my girlfriend this past weekend for her birthday and the staff and accommodations were way above par. I normally wouldn't take the time to write a review like this, but I wanted to share my experience because it made my girlfriend's birthday weekend all that more special. Evening Manager Kenny assisted in making our stay even more special and we are both grateful. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: pocmonster
Reviews.Content: The overall experience was just fine. For its massive size, the hotel was run efficiently enough. And the location is about as good as you can ask for in New York. But there is a lot of commotion all the time, in the lobby, in the hallways. There was too much noise from the rooms, which were fine. They were spacious enough by Manhattan standards, and functional. The bathrooms were small, but elegant and the shower pressure was good. But the beds were horrendously uncomfortable. I guess our king bed must not have been a sweet slumber bed or whatever they call it, because it was rock hard. It also felt kind of scratchy. Not good. Again, given the location and the price paid through Priceline, it was perfectly adequate for a weekend trip to New York. I would not refuse to stay there again, but I also would not pay full price to stay there. There are better choices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room and Service - even under renovation conditions!”
Reviews.Author: TorontoEntre
Reviews.Content: Staff went out of their way to keep us happy providing great service... access to temporary Club Lounge on main floor was perfect. Great workout facilities!! Loved our room! Dan S.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: Samantha_UK23
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because we had previously stayed at another Shereton. The location is fabulous; we were able to use public transport from Newark to almost directly outside the hotel. Staff were friendly and helpful- especially Jill in the bar! Short walk to everywhere we wanted- we were able to walk to the Empire State, Central Park, Macys and pretty much everywhere except Liberty Park! Room could have been a little bigger, but we weren't in it much and it served the purpose for sleep/storage! Housekeeping efficient and friendly. Concierge extremely helpful! All in all, we had an amazing holiday and would recommend anyone going to New York to choose the Shereton. Only one mild criticism - not enough PCs in the lounge for everyone who wanted to use them! We did not use the food services within the hotel, because there were so many fantastic resturants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of outrageous shipping charges & shower hair”
Reviews.Author: beaachhgirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and in a great location. I unfortunately left 3 blouses in the room - my fault and I fully expected to pay for them to ship them to me. However, it took them several days to locate my cloths. I had to fax my credit card information to them. When I asked what the shipping charge would be, they said "we can't say for sure, but no more than $25USD." To my surprise, the charge was $70!!! I called the hotel and then emailed when I received no response to my 3 messages. I was told they have an on-site Federal Express office and gave me that info - it's been several weeks, and no one from that department has responded to my calls and email. So - hotel is good - if you happen to need them to ship something to you, BEWARE - you will be ripped off. Also, I spent 4 nights there - there were hairs on the shower wall from prior guests - in the days I was there, no one ever cleaned the walls.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel right in the center of the Big Apple!!”
Reviews.Author: travelchik01
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers proved to be an excellent stay while visiting New York City. The location of the hotel cannot be better. It is around the corner from NBS Studios, Museum of Modern Art and Design, Rockefeller Center, and a hop-skip-and-jump away from Times Square and Central Park. The rooms were quiet, clean, and provided all amenities. The hotel has great security, welcoming staff, internet stations free to guests, and best of all, a Starbucks right in the lobby. It is right across the street from a visitor information centre, and there are several deli restaurants and take-out places nearby. There is a fitness facility, in which guests have to pay extra for ($10 /day, I believe), but no pool. We were told guests could use the pool in the Sheraton Manhattan located across the street at no charge. The best part of The Sheraton Hotel and Towers is the Sheraton Sleeper beds...and trust me, after a day spent walking around beautiful NYC, you will be happy you stayed at a Sheraton!

Reviews.Title: “4 Star?! They must be crazy!!!”
Reviews.Author: jbrad82003
Reviews.Content: Checked into our room - so small, no dresser or extra chair. There was a lipstick stain on the comforter, the window didn't close properly so it was always cold in the room and the heater was too noisy to run at night. The cleaning staff still knocked on the door even though I had a 'do not disturb' sign on the knob and they failed to replenish the shampoo and moisturizer samples after they were finished. Needless to say, I would NEVER stay here again and to advise anyone looking for a relaxing stay, to stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Last time I use Priceline...”
Reviews.Author: ename8
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my two children on Feb. 24th-26th. The first room we tried was not ready, no problem, the second room had a pair of earrings in the bed? At 10:30 we were in our 3rd room, 2 beer caps under the desk-and a television that wasn't getting a signal. Not to mention the dust and overall condition of the rooms..ugh. Clearly we were not in a renovated room. The location was for the kids and so according to priceline this was a 4*+. Not so much. Had i been able to get a refund would have paid an extra 100 just to stay somewhere clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mchlcrw
Reviews.Content: Checked in on a Friday afternoon. Asked a hotel employee on the curb where to find help getting luggage into the hotel. Answer: 'Go find someone inside'. Got to room which was extremely hot. Call to hotel desk - "The hotel has either heat or airconditioning - it's on the website!" - NOT! They suggested opening the windows - only problem was that windows are bolted shut. They promised to send an engineer. Several hours later - no engineer. Requested another room - after much attitude from the desk, a new room was granted. This one had plastic film on the windows because the hotel "is under renovation and there may be construction noise". Supposedly on the website - NOT! As this room was just as uncomfortable as the first one, I called Sheraton Corporate since the hotel manager chose not to return my calls. The corporate customer service rep had diffuculty hearing me because of the hammering noise from the renovation! Promised to have the hotel manager get in touch with me. Never happened. Corporate promised also to have me moved to a third room. When I went to the bell captain to ask for help moving me to the room, no one was "available" to help me - are you surprised? The last room was essentially the same, however the windows did open which allow the temperature to be lower than an oven. Of all the numerous hotels enjoyed over the last year, this hotel is the ABSOLUTE WORST. The rudeness of the employees, and management is inexcusable. Starwood should close this hotel until they can retrain and make this property what it should be in the heart of New York.

Reviews.Title: “Makes me want to leave the spg program”
Reviews.Author: lkuhn
Reviews.Content: The four points is far cheaper and cleaner the staff suck at both but at least it's clean. There's no option to put on the ac when we asked we were told to open the windows.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent! I traveled with my kids and they loved it as much as I did!!!”
Reviews.Author: ILoveNYC_11
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with my kids so evenyone knows how bad things can get. When I proceeded to check in, a young lady by the name of Christina (hope I am not wrong) was at the desk. My kids were already nagging to have highest floor possible, drove me crazy however; Christina was so sweet to my kids and I, that she upgraded us to the 50th floor (top floor). Not only did we get an upgrade, she also had cookies and milk sent up to our room which my kids finished in seconds. I cannot recall ever being treated so well by a stranger. Each time we saw her she was always smiling and asking how everything was. Thank you so much Christina for the wonderful hospitality and making our stay truly special. You are a genuinely amazing hard worker!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tigerspill
Reviews.Content: Just back from three nights in NYC. Sayed at teh Sheraton Towerss (booked through Priceline so got a great deal). All in all, this hotel is great. Location is just abobe Times Square so in in the real heart of things. Checkin was the fastest I have ever experienced (less than 1 minute!!). Rooms were fine and clean so no problems there. There is a Starbucks for breakfast. The subway is just outside the hotel. We had a problem with noise from neighbouring rooms but a call to reception sorted that quickly. Nothing negative to say.

Reviews.Title: “wow much improved”
Reviews.Author: traveler1159
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights on a newly renovated floor and was amazed at the beauty of the hallways and rooms. Every thing is brand new and a great job was done in utilyzing the limited room space. If you have stayed here before you won't believe the compete 180 this property has taken for the better. The downside is the renovated floors are just becoming available so rooms are limited, however, when complete this will be a premier place to stay in midtown. The renovation has improved employee moral as there is a friendlier vibe.There have been new young energetic management hires, Zoe and Lacy who have a palpaple passion for customer customer service .Mohammed is in the club lounge and knows how to make the customer feel at home as he has done for years.The new GM is to be congratulated in his initial efforts of turning this 1700 room behemoth around to true flagship status within the Sheraton family.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic weekend!”
Reviews.Author: LiriaG03
Reviews.Content: I cringed at the thought of being on a business trip during a presidents day weekend, but this hotel is OUT OF THIS WORLD! Centrally located in the heart of times square, and just about the friendliest staff you'll ever meet. I give this hotel a two thumbs up, and cannot thank them enough. I will definitely be coming back! (for pleasure, hopefully). Our conventions manager, Shannon, was attentive, professional, and reliable. This is our second CME course at this location, and he is the reason! Thank you, Sheraton!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel desperately needs the refurb...”
Reviews.Author: GlowingG
Reviews.Content: I have stayed regularly at this hotel for some years as my company has a deal with them. The hotel heating/cooling is difficult to use. There is no wifi in the rooms so you have to use the cable. Room service menu is tedious and uninspired. I never have breakfast there, and do not consider it worth paying for an upgrade to the club floor. This may change when they have a new clubroom. The best thing about it is the location - right in the middle of Manhattan. I hope that the refurb will improve guest experience and staff service.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE - EVENING MANAGER EXTREMELY RUDE!”
Reviews.Author: SC-Consultant
Reviews.Content: Starwood should be ashamed that this is one of there properties. They have major construction that goes until midnight. Every time I contacted the front desk on the noise, they gave me a different time. The rooms are dirty, outdated, horrible HVAC. To top it all off, the employees that work there do not care and have no idea what customer service is. I am not convinvced they know what the 'hospitality business' is! DO NOT STAY HERE! Even as a Starwood Gold member, I was treated like a second class citizen. The evening property manager Mr. Burnside was less than accomodating and not a professional.

Reviews.Title: “Not awful, but little problems”
Reviews.Author: bbooooooya
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel and great location. Some issues that are preventable, though: first night elevator was broken, and had to walk up 12 floors, this was not a killer but for people less fit could be an issue. Also internet access slow, some TV stations had no volume, and tub did not drain well. Also, having staff next door cleaning rooms at 10 PM is annoying when trying to get sleep before early meeting. Also bathroom was not as clean as it could have been: there were dark hairs much longer than on my head in the tub and sink. Not a bad place, but would not enthusiastically recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff, Great Location, Needs Urgent Renovation”
Reviews.Author: iarp
Reviews.Content: Rude hotels staff is almost a NY landmark. It wouldn't be different in a huge hotel as SNYH&T. Besides the great location, tiny rooms for 3 and and no double queen beds available made our stay not exactaly the best ever in NY. We still had the "great" experience of staying in a room near of the under renovations ones, with noises from 7 AM up to 11 PM. The first and the last.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent central location, close to where you want to be”
Reviews.Author: judyisreadytogo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights for a conference held there. The location is so very central and convenient. The hotel is undergoing a major renovation -- parts of the upgrade are in place now: new bathrooms, new mattresses and linens -- all very nice. There is on-going construction -- my room was away from it, so I was not bothered by it. They are updating the Club facilities and have temporarily moved it to the main floor, which is very comfortable. Access to shared computers is easy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, conscientious service”
Reviews.Author: GoodPlanet
Reviews.Content: We got an excellent Priceline deal on this hotel, which is just a few blocks from Times Square... you couldn't ask for a better location in mid-town Manhattan. The rooms are pretty small but up-to-date and well furnished. Check-in was perfunctory, no great warmth or welcome from the clerk, but no worries, I am starting to expect that for Priceline bookings! We had only two very minor service issues to contend with... the batteries in the TV remote control were dead, and there was no decaf coffee for the in-room coffee maker. We left a note for the room attendant, and both were fixed. We even received a courtesy telephone call from the housekeeping manager later that day to ensure that everything was up to standard. Top marks for that. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and good value in NYC”
Reviews.Author: FBTreebranch
Reviews.Content: Just a one-night stay on a business trip, so I didn't experience much beyond the room. It was spotlessly clean, a good-sized space for New York, with a work desk and big flat-screen TV, and the bed was very comfortable. The broadband Internet connection was a little pricy, but for one night I decided I could do without it (or go online for free in the business center downstairs). Reasonable price for this quality in a prime midtown location. The one negative was a chambermaid who ignored my do-not-disturb tag and banged on my door in the morning while I was on the phone and trying to get some issues taken care of before an important meeting. Her excuse was "Some people forget and leave them there." Yeah, but most people put them there for a reason, and if you have to wait until check-out time to see if the room is still occupied, so be it. Maybe this one was a dope and an anomaly, or maybe Sheraton has a training problem; who knows? I didn't have time to make a fuss over it.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: caalie
Reviews.Content: Don't understand the negative reviews. Excellent midtown location, rooms size typical of NYC hotels, good staff, nice bar, free internet in the lobby. Renovations in progress weren't a problem. If you bid and end up with this hotel, its a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “No bedbugs! Slept great. Overall very good. A bit shabby.”
Reviews.Author: xlwells
Reviews.Content: First off: No bedbugs. Had read elsewhere of problems but I had NONE! I checked the room very thoroughly, including removing the headboards. Like others I'd say the room is ready for an update, it was a bit shabby / worn. Also, and part of this was because of how good I searched for potential bedbugs, it very very dustry in the areas not normally touched by clearning staff. Under the bed had TONS of dust, a bit gross. But I had a very good stay. Slept great. Staff was fine, if not overly friendly. I would certainly stay again. You can see Times Square from the front door and it took me about 20 minutes to walk to the Empire State Building. Thanks Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, small rooms, but still very nice”
Reviews.Author: Becky8908
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical coming here after reading several reviews online. I was pleasantly suprised. The lobby is beautiful and very updated. The link area has free internet access, and there's a Starbucks also. Check in was easy. I got there aroud 7pm, and the staff was friendly. The woman offered to give me a room away from the renovations, which was nice and thoughtful. She convinced me to get the hotel rewards card as it would earn me points for my stay, and give complimentary internet access in the room. The latter was not the case. I actually got complimentary internet access with my stay because I was on the corporate rate. I think she just wanted me to get the rewards card. I had a room on the 7th floor, which was good since the hotel was undergoing renovations on the upper floors. The room itself was small, pretty much enough room for a queen sized bed, small desk, and a small dresser with the TV. The bathroom was small, but clean and functional. The room did get hot, even though I kept turning down the heat. It never seemed to cool off. The hallways on my floor at least were very dark. I hope this gets upgraded soon. My biggest complaint about the rooms was that you can hear when anyone closed their door in the hallway. The door shuts very loudly. You have to be extra careful just to close the door, which most people don't do. Annoying but not a deal breaker by any means. I didn't eat at the hotel, so I can't comment. I was there for a seminar, and I can say the conference rooms were nice. The staff that took care of the refreshments were very friendly. They made sure we had everything we needed. It was very enjoyable. The location is amazing. The area has so much to offer. It's located in a busy part of town, but I didn't hear any noise from my room on the 7th floor. So many places to eat around, so I didn't think it was necessary to eat hotel food. I came in late on the first night, and got amazing take out from Angelo's on Broadway near the Dave Letterman theater. They deliver too! All in all, I would recommend this hotel. For the price, I was essentially paying for the location, but the rooms were comfortable, so what more can I ask???

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: sphelps1414
Reviews.Content: Love this place!!!! The rooms are fully equipped an dmost have amazing views of the city. The location is perfect, close to everything and how can you beat Rosie O'Gradys across the street. The staff is polite, quick to respond and attentive. This is the only place I will stay on trips to NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Mid-Winter Trip To NYC”
Reviews.Author: MAC089
Reviews.Content: Visited NYC on Martin Luther King Holiday weekend. Stayed at Sheraton NY because it is convenient to the Shows, Museums and Restaurants we were to visit. While the Club Lounge was closed it has been relocated to the first floor and you still have very friendly and attentive staff in attendance. Also the breakfast offerings remain among the best. Special thanks to Muhammad and Zoe for their warm, wonderful smiles and welcomes.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Time”
Reviews.Author: jefmar
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time we have stayed at the towers. The staff is very good , They took care of any little problem we had. answered all our questions . A pleasure to talk to all. Yes the rooms are small but its NY. They were clean and the beds VERY comfortable. There was some construction going on with some extra noise. We were not told about this at time of booking and we were told it was to take place from 930 am to 930 pm. So that was not to bad . Though some nights it went on later and some mornings earlier. Hope the new rooms will be worth it . ( If we can afford them) when they are done. All in all a very good stay Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: jetsetter6881
Reviews.Content: My play-by-play experience with this hotel. Arrived in the evening, the men outside greeted myself and my colleague very warmly...and that was the end of the good portion of the stay. Went inside where the woman at the counter was SO rude to us. I lived in NYC for 5 years before leaving and at first I just thought I had forgotten how rude people naturally are there but nope, I was wrong. This woman was horrendous from the second we began speaking to the end of our check in. I asked her a question and she rolled her eyes, raised her voice to cut me off and started yelling at me. (by the way the question was in response to her telling me they are doing renovations, I asked if my room was ok though in terms of noise, etc) Everyone in line behind me was horrified by this woman as well. The miserable people that work there is seriously something I've never seen. I go up to my room, there is about an inch of dust ALL OVER the room, broken blinds, visable mold in every portion of the room, the bathroom smelled strongly of urine, black crust all over the bed, etc. Needless to say, I left the next morning and stayed at another hotel the rest of my business trip. Stay away from here, NY hotels are expensive but given the ongoing bed bug situation and chronic filth problems, pay more.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, better than expected”
Reviews.Author: jas32
Reviews.Content: Somewhat apprehensive before getting to this property because of a wide range of reviews on this hotel. Sure there was construction going on but I did not hear any construction noise. Street noise was more apparent since the window did not seal very well (8th floor room). The room was getting a little dated with some wall paper peeling. Yes it is in need of a refurbish (and is in process) but it was clean, the carpeting was decent and the overall service was great. You cannot ask for a better location, this is right in the middle of most tourist places in NYC, walking distance to 5th Ave shopping, Rockefeller Center, Times Square, Central Park, Broadway Theatres and with very easy access to the subways. Complaints are few as follows: No control for room temperature and there was a bad draft coming from the window. Closing the curtains completely helped a bit. (I actually used it to cool my bottled soda - it was in the 20s outside). Internet access is an extra $15/day in the room. There was free wifi in the lobby if you care to lug your laptop, although a few public use computers are available in the lobby as well. Overall it was a great place to stay in mId-town Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “You couldn't pay me to stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: yohagopelo
Reviews.Content: I live in Brooklyn but had a 5am meeting in midtown on Tuesday morning and decided to stay at the Sheraton Towers in order to avoid waking up at 3am. It was the worst decision I could have made. Check-in was fine, the room was sub par (a little worn down, smelled like cigarettes, peeling wall paper, dirty/grimy remote and telephone), nothing I couldn't handle. However, upon returning from an early dinner at 7:30pm, I could hear non-stop hammering and drilling, as if it was in the room next door. I called the front desk and inquired about it. They told me they were doing construction in the hotel and that it would stop at 9pm. I wasn't excited about spending the next hour and a half listening to this, but I patiently waited. 9pm came. The drilling and hammering didn't stop. I called again at 9:15pm. This time I was told the construction would continue until 10pm. At 9:45pm, I called and asked to speak to a manager. I got the manager, Kenny, on the line and he told me it was supposed to end at 9pm and that he would personally go check on it. The drilling and hammering continues. 10:15pm, it is still going on. I call Kenny again. He tells me "the foreman is incompetent" and that they won't stop. I tell him I have a 4am wake-up call and that construction noise was not something the front desk people told me about when I checked in. He said "yeah." I inquired if other guests were complaining, he told me they were but assured me "the foreman is supposed to stop". I assured him that the drilling and hammering was still continuing. He said he would call them again. 10:45pm. Construction noise is still happening. I call Kenny. He offers to move my room. Really? At 10:45pm when I'm in bed and have been trying to sleep for almost 2 hours? (I also had costumes for 31 performers in my room, as part of my 5am meeting and did not feel like spending an hour moving them around the hotel). 11:00pm. The construction noise is still happening. Notice a pattern here? I finally was able to doze off around 11:30pm when it started to subside. Unbelievable. I received no compensation and no solution.I would never ever stay at this hotel again, they clearly do not care about their customers nor do they know how to handle their contractors. What an (expensive) mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Staff went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable admist renovation, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Runlastmile
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights over MLK weekend. We secured a good deal on a popular discount travel website. We contacted front desk manager Kenny Imafidon before we arrived and let him know we were concerned about some of the mixed reviews we had read online about the hotel service and renovations taking place at the hotel. He assured us he would handle our stay and make sure we had a good experience. He accomodated our request for an early check in. Unfortunately the room we were sent to had not yet been cleaned. When Kenny arrived he personally met us in the lobby and upgraded our room for the inconvenience. Later that evening he sent cookies and milk to our room, which the kids loved. The hotel is superbly located between Times Square and Central Park. Thank you Kenny for making our stay a good experience. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Speed up those renovations”
Reviews.Author: Duct_tape_traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply worn out. The fit and finish was probably top notch when installed - the appliances are solid; however, everything is showing its age. There are scrapes and scratches all over the furniture, the wallpaper is peeling, there are stains all over the bathroom appliances, including the marble counter tops. I hope they are also addressing the noise issues. I've heard people say "the walls were paper thin" before about a hotel or apartment, and despite my extensive travels, have never experienced this myself. However, at this Sheraton, the walls are truly paper thin. So thin, in fact, that we had to move out of our initial room because we were bombarded by noise from the occupants on either side of our room.
