Then, in our 49th floor room, the window would not close, which allowed for street noise to enter the room despite being some 500 feet above the street level. The only positive is the location; the hotel is very close to theater, and is also near numerous subway lines. We got our room for $120/night on priceline, which seemed to be a very good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in Sheraton because of the Telepresence Public Suite”
Reviews.Author: Upintheairtoomuch
Reviews.Content: Rather than trek all over the world, we held a meeting between our folks in London, Singapore, Paris, Mumbai, Pune, Frankfurt, Hong Kong and other locations. We used the Telepresence suite in the Sheraton Towers which makes you think you are sitting across the table from your colleagues! Staying in the Sheraton the night before made getting to the early morning meeting very easy!

Reviews.Title: “Lacking in Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: banker1225
Reviews.Content: Staying currently on MLK weekend. When I arrived by cab, the bellmen on duty could care less. Engrossed in conversations with each other, no help was offered as I bounced my bag up the stairs to the lobby. The room is small but well appointed. The check in was uneventful. However, like the previous reviewer, I just returned at 5:30 to find that my room had not been made up. Being tired from a busy day, I will not bother to let the desk know. However, at a Sheraton I would expect that they would know if your room had been cleaned or not. Location is great, but don't expect a high level of service at this hotel. If you want to stay in the middle of everything however, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Sliding downhill”
Reviews.Author: mothena
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel before and enjoyed my stay previously. On this trip however, the overall quality of the hotel seems to be declining. I had to call at 6:00 pm to ask why my room had not been made up. The coffee maker in the room did not work. When I turned on the shower for the first time, brownish water came out of the spout. It cleared up, but given it's New York-- nasty. And the most, comfortable beds in the world? Hard, old mattress, The Club lounge was closed on Friday at 5:00 with a sign saying it would be closed on the 16th (this was the 13th). My meeting in to hotel went until 3:00 in the afternoon (using hotel facilities) and they refused to even consider a late check out. The location is great, and near all kinds of attractions and restaurants. But this was definitely not up to the standard I have come to expect from Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Novoas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon, the location is excellent, only short walk to times square, central park, all the popular attractions. The hotel foyer is stunning, the free computer access and wifi in the foyer was great, and the bar always busy had a very nice atmosphere. Front desk staff and concierge were always very courtieus and helpful cant be faulted. The room was very nice not the most modern room we have ever stayed in but very clean, comfy bed, lcd tv plenty of tv channels, nice view from the room. The bathroom was a little dated but clenliness was fine. All in all this was a very plesent experience and we will be back on our next trip to NYC

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Service at super Mid-Town location”
Reviews.Author: misskiddie
Reviews.Content: There is no better location to stay in NYC than the "Sheraton NY Hotel & Towers": business, Broadway, Lincoln Center, Carnegie Hall and great shopping are all nearby. What makes this hotel really special, however, is attention to service, thanks to it's new VIP Manager, Zoe Cohen. She provides that personal touch that makes you feel at home away from home. This hotel is undergoing a major renovation which will totally rock.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect trip”
Reviews.Author: Sjlrn
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Wonderful service. Ideal location. Clean rooms. Upgraded us for our honeymoon. Very reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “I am surprised it's only rated 68%...”
Reviews.Author: Stinz3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not the best in the world, but it definitely is a better than it’s current Tripadvisor rating of 68%. Right on the corner of 7th and W. 53rd it offers an excellent location within walking distance of many attractions (such as MoMA and 5th Ave. Shops), and has two subway stations within one block of the hotel. The Reception and Lobby are very nice and check-in was a breeze (even though we arrived 3 hours earlier than their advertised check-in time). The room was dated and could use a refresh (particularly the bathroom), but was far from being wretched, as some reviewers have suggested. The standard room was a decent size by NYC standards, has great views (we were on the 26th floor), had a work desk, king sized bed with a comfortable mattress, LCD HD tv, mini-bar (very expensive items) and a small coffee brewer (with Stabuck’s coffee and cups). The bathroom was very small, but functional and clean…and the shower’s water pressure was awesome! The only component truly lacking in the rooms was wi-fi. Although there was free wi-fi in the lobby, the internet access in the room was wired internet and cost 15.99$ per day. There is a Starbuck’s at 7th and W. 52nd which also offers free wi-fi with a good connection. The concierges were incredibly helpful, with information, maps, directions and restaurant suggestions and reservations. There are many decent restaurants within 1 or 2 blocks, such as The Carnegie Deli and Applejack’s diner (great for breakfast). There also also plenty of souvenir shops and convenience stores. Many people tear down NYC hotels as not being good value. But as much as I don’t like it, the reality is that you cannot compare the value of the hotel you get for that price in Saskatoon or Minneapolis with what you get in NYC…it’s like comparing big apples and oranges. This hotel, by NYC standards, is good value at 250$...but even better value if you can get it on a popular travel discount website (recommended by Capt. Kirk) for 160$ a night…;-)

Reviews.Title: “Good location, okay hotel.”
Reviews.Author: tales84
Reviews.Content: In Australia the Sheraton hotels have a very reputable name and are like 5 star so this hotel was a little disappointing. The staff at check in and the tours desk were very helpful and friendly. Cleaning staff will barely smile or acknowledge you though. Rooms are fairly small and the carpet on our floor was all lump and definately needed new carpet laid! The bed however was extremely comfortable and we got great nights sleep (once we turned off the heater as it was very noisy!) The hotel is in a great location, only 10 mins walk to most attractions and close to Central Park. The hotel was extremely busy when we stayed and the foyer was packed. It was very difficult to get access to their limited computers and internet. We paid a very high price for this hotel due to the time of the year and our poor dollar at time of booking, so wasnt as fancy as we had expected, but overall it is a good hotel. Has good cable tv and a great fitness centre too. Wasnt enough places to eat (only has room service and a small cafe).

Reviews.Title: “Right on the Center”
Reviews.Author: nikhatzop
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 7 nights. The first night we were given a room that was not very clean and neat. We changed rooms the following day. The new room was clean, neat, and a little bigger. There is no free Internet in the rooms and you have to pay for wired internet, as there is no WI-FI in the rooms (really, this day and age, in New York?). Also, I was not happy with the free Wi-FI at the lobby, as I had to re-login every 30 minutes (exteremely annoying). Due to the fact that they chagre $15.99 a day for WIRED Internet access to the room (Really? what is this, 1990?), there was a huge amouth of people trying to use the WI-FI network, which made the Internet connection very slow. Aside from the Internet issues though, the hotel is great. Great location, just blocks away from stores, Time Square, and turist destinations. Plenty of Starbucks around the hotel (Always a good thing), many restaurants, elegant lobby, fair alcohol prices (unless you order a double), and a nice small souvenior store with newspapers, magazines, and plenty of "New York stuff".

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: JoeyDock
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers offers an excellent location, and thats perhaps the main reason I would recommend it. The Reception and Lobby are wonderful and give you the feel of a real luxury hotel. The Free internet in the lobby was fantastic as well. The concierge was also quite helpful interms of managing to secure free access to a number of NYC's nightclubs which was much appreciated! The rooms are of an adequate standard (certainly not the luxury one tends to associate with the brand), but do clearly have newer Sheraton Sweet Sleepers which are fantastic mattresses and LCD HD tv's. The in room Starbucks is wonderful. The real let-down were the bathrooms which are in need of some serious updating in terms of fittings and decor, although cleanliness was not an issue. My stay was predominantly on a mixture of cash+points and with this is mind, offered excellent value. The Sheraton however, is not a hotel worth 300$ plus a night which appears to be their normal rates.

Reviews.Title: “Would not pay a nickel”
Reviews.Author: callme
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with the onset of the great Christmas Blizzard of 2010 in Manhattan, we were meeting friends from Europe and stayed three nights to visit and tour. Our arrival was nothing special, there was something which preplexed our agent and the ensuing silence was ackward. Upon resolution, I tried to bantor up a bit but the response was flat and offered nothing about our upcoming experience, facility or expectations. In most cases, this would be acceptable but it being the largest Sheraton in Manhattan one would expect something. We were wished a fond farewell and good stay though. The room was small. The heat was horrible, when checking it was turned up to maximum and it was WARMER in the Guest Hallway than in our room throughout our stay. There was a lightbulb out on the work desk opening the door to contact Guest Services for both issues which we promptly did within minutes of our entry. We lingered for 45 minutes and went to dinner. The lightbulb was replaced upon our return and later upon retiring for the evening we made the foolish mistake of selecting the bed closest to the window. Needless to stay the other two nights, we selected the bed closest to the warmth of the guest hallway. This could have been overlooked but our saga continued upon return from the first day, we were greeted with a notice from hotel management indicating due to the blizzard many hotel employees could not make it into work therefore this day services were restricted to towel replenishment. Now this is all well and good, an extraordinary condition leading to a well worded communication appealing sensibility of the weather BUT there was no gesture from hotel management to compensate inconvenience. There was a Starbucks in the Main Lobby certainly they could have bought us a cup of coffee or offered a movie or knocked $25.00 off the room. Now I imagine if someone were to raise this concern over their front desk or yet to their home office a plethera of compensation and remorse would have ensued but the point is whilst the experience is ongoing accommodate and treat your guests rather than just excuse yourself. Added on to this the inroom television had its' volume capped off too low making your decision as to either watching and hearing your selection from the corner of your bed or actually laying back in a rested position but not hearing your selection. While hotel management's action may be thoughtful of the entire guest population, the volume setting never exceed 34 out of 100 which is unacceptable. Certainly, the guest did not designed the soundproofing proffered by the building. This condition just aggravated me throughout the three days. The bathroom was tiny and the amenities were nice but their packaging was this kichy no frills knock off and totally missed my target of a big city hotel experience. The guest hallway, which was earlier cited as being a source of warmth, was not cleaned either promptly or regularly throughout the three days. While it is understandable through the blizzard condition ... when I state not cleaned I mean there were shoe boxes outside doors which sat for 2 days now any hotel team member could have simply passed by picked them up and moved them into a behind the scenes area to maintain the Sheraton reputation. Only on departure day, did I notice the hallway had been vacuumed. I give them props for the Starbucks which was quick and efficient each day. The Lobby was very nice and always full. The front steps were cleared of snow promptly. I can appreciate the struggles of staffing levels and am sure there were challenges with the labor force given an obvious trade union team BUT hotel management's acknowledgement of the conditions failed to deliver any meaningful contribution to my satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: izka2011
Reviews.Content: I stay for business, convenient location and supper friendly staff. Love it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: grcboss
Reviews.Content: It was fine for the night. I didn't pick it because i got it on Priceline. I only paid $120 a night so i really cant complain at all. Its a huge old hotel with a few upgrades but basically need an overhaul. It was worth it though for the money I paid. We were supposed to have a queen for me and my daughter and I asked for a king or 2 doubles at check in and we got the king, I was very thankful for that. OK location if you want to be on the west side, we ate at the Stage Deli across the street (don't waste your money) Carnegie is much better. I would stay here again only for $120, i would never pay the $359 they were asking on the Sheraton site.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: SD_140
Reviews.Content: Spent some time in this hotel while traveling for business, and was not expecting what I saw from this hotel. The hotel staff was friendly and courteous. The rooms were nicely sized (much better than some of the small rooms I've stayed in at those boutique hotels), and they had a relaxing lobby. Nothing beat sitting in the Starbucks-infused lobby in the morning, browsing through email, while watching the traffic on 7th avenue. A gentleman in the lobby who was an SPG-platinum member told me that the club lounge was awesome, for all those that are of the same tier. Already set to head back to NY soon and definitely looking forward to my next stay here.

Reviews.Title: “SPG Frequent Travelers - Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: epg_01
Reviews.Content: If you are a frequent SPG Business Traveler, avoid this hotel for now, Sheraton has really let this property run down to the ground. The rooms are in bad condition and dirty, the hallways are dirty and the service has really slipped in the last year. And the construction disruption is huge. The internet in my room did not work and the front desk staff was less than friendly, particularly in the SPG desk. Maybe after the renovations are done it will improve. For now, stay somewhere else. This is about as bad as a Sheraton can get.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: amy1512
Reviews.Content: After reading some bad reviews of this hotel on here, we were dreading the worse but were pleasantly suprised when we turned up. We had 1 double in our room which i think was the mosty comfy bed i have ever slept in. The rooms were not filthy like other reviews suggested they were very clean and made up each day with the option of having clean sheets everyday if you wished. the carpets did not look worn at all. Also after recieving a later from virgin letting us know about the construction work going on we were expecting noise but we didnt get any at all. This hotel is in a central place, you can be in times square in about 2 mintues and central park within about 5 minutes. As we satyed over New Years eve it was quite busy but not a problem and the hotel were brilliant with letting us out onto the street at midnight. The bar is overly pricey with us paying $17 for 2 bottles of corona which is stupidy expensive. Overall we had a brilliant stay in the sheraton so i wouldnt listen to any of the other reviews. Hope this has helped.

Reviews.Title: “Better than home”
Reviews.Author: Rafi58
Reviews.Content: We were one of the lucky ones delayed three days in NYC du to the storm. The staff took care of us and ensured there was no pressure. Debbie R.welcomed us with a smile at the front desk, Tomas ensured our plate was full at the Club Lounge, our social needs were taken care of by John B. at the concierge desk and Zoe C. ensured we were always attended to as if we were VIPs. This was our 7th trip to NYC over the past 4 years and we will not look for another hotel. Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: msh59
Reviews.Content: Construction alert!! There was drilling and hammering and other LOUD construction noises going on until 10:50 p.m.!! When moved to another room, there were loud noises coming from the scaffolding outside our window at 12:30 a.m. It's a great location, but not worth the torture until the construction is finished.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas stay in snow blizzard!”
Reviews.Author: LouWilk
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at this hotel of the year, this time over the christmas period and I just can't fault the Sheraton. The room we had had 2 double beds, spacious, very clean, absolutely ideal for us. The staff were very helpful, the snow blizzard came as predicted and the only thing affected in the hotel (that we were aware of) was housekeeping staffing but they were very apologetic and still changed the towels etc which was excellent especially considering the problems the UK have with a lot less snow!! The lobby has free wi fi which is useful and kept my teenage daughter happy. The concierge were very helpful especially in the blizzard giving out information on the subway etc. The hotel is in an excellent location, Carnegie Deli is close by which is always worth a visit, all in all a fantastic stay at great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Put hold on credit card without permission”
Reviews.Author: Voyagereuse
Reviews.Content: My daughter and fiance´spent one night at the Sheraton the day after Thanksgiving. The room was prepaid through h*twire (which I booked for them using his credit card). The day after their stay he noticed a charge for $168 on his credit card by Sheraton. He called and was told a monetary hold was put on his card for that amount in case of any incidentals and that they would credit him in a few days. (Which they did.) But when he checked in he was never told there was going to be a hold put on his card. I'm sorry, this is unacceptable. 1. It is unethical and unprofessional to put a hold on someone's credit card without informing them. You want to lose customers? I am a Starwoods preferred guest and you just lost me. 2. I wonder if the Sheraton did this because the young man is 24 and clearly from out of town? I have stayed at Sheraton on h*twire and pr*celine bids before and this has never happened to me. I think the hotel targeted this young man. Too bad, it's their loss. Guess what hotel will not be considered for a reception venue?

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Location/Value”
Reviews.Author: Alex33618
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here from Christmas thru New Year's Day. The location of the hotel - 8 blocks from Time Square is great. The rooms could be a bit more up to date, but I guess that they are getting ready to remodel. The hotel provided great alternatives to the crazy atmosphere outside on New Year's Eve. Although there are less expensive alternatives for breakfast we splurged one day on the hotel's breakfast buffet - which was great. The meal cake with some fantastic tourist adivice from our waiter John. He was full of helpful hints and money saving ideas as well as "insider" info about New York. We never got that anywhere else. Thanks John!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Awesome Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: rstandly
Reviews.Content: You really can't beat the location of this hotel. Easy walking distance to Times Square, Central Park, and Rockefeller Center. The restaurant is quite expensive so you might want to try Park Cafe up the street on 7th and 56th for breakfast, Fluffy's Deli and Bakery (best black and white cookies in New York) also on 7th, and for a quick inexpensive lunch - any of the local hot dog/food carts scattered on the corners everywhere. DO NOT EAT AT LINDY'S across 53rd next to the hotel!!! This is a total ripoff tourist trap that charges extravagant prices for mediocre food ($4.79 for a cup of coffee and $9.00 for a slice of cheesecake). The rooms themselves need some upgrading (the carpets could use replacing or a really good shampooing), but overall, they were comfortable and a good value. The hotel staff is exceptional. We got stuck in NYC because of the Blizzard Of 2010 and initially booked an extra night online (for $439). When we went to the front desk to check-out/check-in, the representative at the desk was shocked at the price. She ended up giving us the same room for $199. What a wonderful surprise! It convinced us to stay at the Sheraton Hotel Towers on our next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Survived The Blizzard of 2010 At The Sheraton!”
Reviews.Author: Suzy_Shopper
Reviews.Content: Priceline offered up a great $135/night + tax deal for a nice, long Christmas weekend family getaway. We were so lucky to be stranded in NYC with the Blizzard of 2010 hitting just as we were enjoying our stay. The hotel was great -- excellent location, right in the heart of Times Square. And honestly, with all the snow, it was a perfect location for us. The subways are all right nearby - great location for that too. The room was on the small side - 2 full beds which basically took up the entire room. Nice flat panel TV and the bathroom was clear. Wasn't totally updated, but it was clean. Careful using the mini bar - - i think it's on some kind of scanner as it knew my son had moved around some things and charged us for it even though we didn't use anything. When we mentioned it to the front desk, they took it off our bill. All in all, we had a very nice stay without incidents. Parking was even on the inexpensive side for NYC. We arrived Saturday around 1pm and left Monday around 12pm and it was only $84. I consider that a bargain. Thanks Sheraton. I'd stay here again. Location location location at this hotel. It was definitely worth it! Noise level was not a problem at all even though the walls seemed pretty thin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: mwbjab
Reviews.Content: We were traveling to NY to see family and decided to spend a few days in NYC during Christmas - South Central/Midtown area is where we wanted to stay. Booked two rooms with Hotwire and got a great rate at the Sheraton New York Towers. We have stay in NYC before and the first time with this hotel. Very nice. Rooms and beds were comfortable. Nice flat screen TV. It is NYC so rooms are NYC size. No bed bugs. Check in was quick and personnel was nice. Had a check in request and a check out request and both were accomodated without issue. Hotel has a great location at 7th Ave & 53rd street. Close to a lot of popular NYC sights. I read in recent Trip Advisor reviews about room heat in this hotel. Rooms were warm. You can not control the temp, but you can turn off the fan. With turning off the fan and lifting the blinds the room cooled down fine. Recommendation to hotel management you could probably turn down the central heat at least 1 to 2 degrees and save a few operating bucks. Only complaint would be doormen at curb if you can find one or a pleasant one. Maybe they are understaffed. The hotel curbside service area is small and lack of doormen to help with luggage at curb does not help. Fitness center is state of the art. We would stayed there again.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Dirty Dirty Just like you would expect from road side Motels”
Reviews.Author: turkers
Reviews.Content: This hotel from the time we arrived first impression from the doorman to the parking attendant to receptionist rude and very much like robots. Receptionist Iverson mind as well be a robot or computer. He has no sense of humour no customer service. They gave us this room stunk cigarette smoke someone smoked in the bathroom discusting. So we complained then we had to wait until 7pm to get another room no better then the first room. This hotel needs to do lot of upgrade on their customer service and their rooms are old and very dirty. I would never stay there ever again. I suggest you do the same go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience-Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: GF5150
Reviews.Content: We are a family of with three young children and stayed for 4 nights in early December. The hotel staff was wonderful and very accommodating for our family. We arrived to milk and cookies in our room while the club level lounge was very understanding at breakfast. Hotel is convenient to all things NY so we highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: DuabiGodalming
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 7 days in December. The experience was wonderful, attentive staff, great location. We were a family of 4 and the hotel provided an excellent base to explore all that NY has to offer. We hope to be back in May, when its a little warmer!

Reviews.Title: “will stay again”
Reviews.Author: garry532
Reviews.Content: first trip to new york, enjoyed our stay at sheraton new york hotel and towers, stayed on 39th floor no noise, room spotless, bed greight. staff very freindley, will return.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing like the last time :(”
Reviews.Author: ajewel10
Reviews.Content: I brought my mom here 10 years ago for Mother's Day, and it was fabulous. This time the service was horrible. The stafff at the front desk was just rude. The concierge was little help. You couldn't get anyone at the front door to help with luggage etc. Even the waitress at the bar had little to be happy about. It seemed that all of the hotel help was just over the Christmas tourists. I will look for a different hotel in the future, for my New York vacations.

Reviews.Title: “Service above and beyond...”
Reviews.Author: smanderson
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the weekend in NY City on December 2nd - December 5th... As any college football alumni fan realizes... that when your team plays an important game... you want to see it first hand... and if you can't... in comfort in front of a TV. Kenny Imafidon (Front Desk Manager) and Zoe Cohen (VIP Manager) arranged for my wife and I to watch the Auburn vs. South Carolina Game (wife is a grad of Auburn) in the Concierge Lounge while it was officially closed. Not only did they allow this... they also sent us some complimentary beer and snacks.... WAY ABOVE THE CALL OF DUTY~ My compliments to this management staff! Scott Anderson

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: terra333
Reviews.Content: Even though the hotel is under updating and renovating, none of the activities affected our experience. The hotel is perfectly situated, the bed extremely comfortable and the service is amazing, Jorge Guerrero ensured that our stay was once again a very positive experience. Looking forward to the updates as we will once again choose this hotel for our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in the heart on NYC”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeTunny
Reviews.Content: We had a great time here, thats all there is to it! OK so maybe more detail may help. If I was being picky, room slightly small but it is a city so always expect it and sometimes the bar service was a little slow when very busy (as local business-people seem to use the bar too though all were polite). And thats it.

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: AbqPrincess
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because we got a great deal through a blind bid on hotel room, so we got a really good price($175/nt)(Manhattan is SO expensive!). It was alright. I definitely would be upset if I payed full price. This was my first trip to New York. From what I can tell the rooms were good sized for the area. Beds were very comfortable with lots of pillows. The location was excellent - blocks from times square and Rockefeller center. Other than the beds, the rooms seemed really old - peeling wallpaper in the bathroom, old heating system, and overall older decor. The heating system was old and hard to control. Even on the coldest setting the air came out very warm, and even after I turned it off the room stayed overly warm. The next night I solved this by opening the blinds, which cooled the room off quite a bit because the windows apparently don't insulate very well. Pros - Clean comfy beds, shower and location. Cons - Age of rooms, thin doors(not soundproof), old gross carpet in halls, currently undergoing construction (which really wasn't much of a problem), way too hot in room with heater on. Overall - I'd stay here if you get a good deal. Under $250 a night would seem reasonable (for the area) but paying the full $400 something a night tab would leave you very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks y'all did good.”
Reviews.Author: matthewlantzy
Reviews.Content: Nicole checked me in. Fast & friendly good job. Cory took care of my travel arrangements at the outside of the hotel doors I think he was one of the guys that helped you get in and of vehicles but I am not sure of his official title. Awesome job, thank you very much. The coffee shop and gym very clean. Great. My whole stay was pleasant and fun. Will be coming back thank you.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous customer service!”
Reviews.Author: violin101
Reviews.Content: We were 3 hours into our trip home, when our 16 year old realized he left his phone in the room. He called and spoke with Sal, a security officer. Immediate action was taken, and the phone was found by Dilan with security. The phone was shipped overnight. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “overpriced, even by ny standards”
Reviews.Author: cormac7
Reviews.Content: this hotels needs a makeover - the rooms are shabby, and the bathrooms are particularly worn, with stained tiles, peeling wallpaper, and generally seedy. To pay nearly $500 a night is highway robbery, but the least they can do is provide a well outfitted room. there are many hotels in NYC and this one is not competitive.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away if you Can!”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirl056
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in December. I will start by saying that the location of the hotel was excellent, both for our business needs, and proximity to the theater district, Times Square, etc. That's where any and all positives about this place stop. We were on the club level (41st floor). They did not have a king size room, so I ended up with 2 very small double beds in a very small room, while I do not expect large rooms in NYC, this was ridiculous. The only upgrade was the too large for the room flat screen tv. The carpet was old and stained in the hallways and the room. The bathroom was tiny and the shower curtain had ripped curtain rings. The heater did not work (and it was the coldest week I've ever experienced in NYC!). I made the mistake of letting our work travel department book the room, in the future I will do it myself. I would recommend paying the additional cost per night for another hotel, (either the Parker Meridien or the Hilton or a boutique hotel The London). This room was well over $400/night and I realize that December in NYC is a very popular time, but do yourself a favor and don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel if you can”
Reviews.Author: ToptierTraveler
Reviews.Content: This is absolutely one of the worst hotels I have stayed in. The carpet is old and stained. The rooms are tiny. The bathroom is filthy; the toiletries are minimal. The elevators are noisy and shake violently when in operation. The iron in my room does not work -- it leaks water and does not release steam. The price charged -- $459 a night -- was outrageous. Overall, the hotel is worse than an average Holiday Inn. I guess the hotel management gets away with providing such shabby service because of the hotel's excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “ANOTHER GREAT STAY AT THE SHERATON”
Reviews.Author: BakaPA
Reviews.Content: We just finished our annual Holiday trip to NYC. This is the 3rd straight year we stayed here. Great staff, great location and good pricing. Easy to get to Radio City, "The Tree", American Girl,Macys, Museum of Modern Art, Times Square........subway right there for all the other great things in NYC. Great spa/exercise area. Everything in the room worked perfectly....heat/AC, TV, bathrooms and the room and bed were very clean !!! We will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel in New York”
Reviews.Author: tegreen
Reviews.Content: This was the worst stay I have ever had! The staff was terrible, the room was horrid and smelled terrible, changed rooms and mildly better, for 530 bucks a night! Seriously I'd rather stay on the street! They had horrible room service, bars and breakfast were terrible. I can't even find one good thing about this place. There are plenty of other hotels in the area...stay somewhere else, trust me!

Reviews.Title: “Bland but ok”
Reviews.Author: wipeout75
Reviews.Content: This is fine as a chain hotel goes but is just about as impersonal as it gets. I don't think the check in staff looked at me once while checking in but rooms are ok - small but I guess this is new York where rooms are always small. Awful bar - slap bang in the middle of the lobby so zero atmosphere. Restaurant is like a motorway service station in terms of looks but to be fair breakfast was very good on our visit. Fresh fruit and buffet hot food was regularly refreshed so no congealed scrambled eggs etc. Great location. Check out the Warwick hotel round the corner by the Hilton for something a bit more individual.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent place to be in the heart of Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: ficciro
Reviews.Content: I am a crew member for Koreanair, I often stay at the hotel, I am very pleased with all the services at the hotel. my last stay was from DEC01 to DEC03, with an unfortunately event, I forgot my AC Adapter/Charger for my MacBook Pro computer as well as my celular phone, as soon as I noticed the missing items I called from Seoul to the Hotel I contacted a couple of courteous and very helpful employees:, that deserve to be recognized as great employees and very professional, (Mrs. Martha Calderon PBX Operator of the hotel and Mr. Jorge Guerrero of Guest Services,) they did all that was in their hands to locate my items, and finally the phone was found, Mr. Guerrero is sending it to my home in Dallas and we are hoping to find the AC Charger Adapter, which will be foud soon. This are the things that make you choose and stay at a hotel like this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Manager”
Reviews.Author: maddie2010
Reviews.Content: After a disappointing start to the trip the Front Desk Manager Kenny Imafidon totally took care of our needs, moved us to a new room and sent up a complementary bottle of wine plus access to the lounge. It was great. It's nice to meet a hotel manager that will go the extra distance to make a stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location Overall Fine”
Reviews.Author: luv2vacation
Reviews.Content: I am a Platinum Starwood member and had 3 rooms for Dec 4th. We arrived early around 1PM and was told no upgrades available and only one of the 3 rooms was available. No big deal we just put our luggage in the one room and left the hotel for sight seeing.Came back to the hotel at 6PM to get the other two rooms and was told only one more room was available, I said that is not acceptable check in is 3PM and we have dinner reservations at 7PM and need to shower and change. The man checking me in said he would talk with the manager and I said fine I will just wait here as I need the rooms. He left the Platinum/Gold check in area and moved to the regular check in arae while I am just waiting. So then there are no customers checking in at the Plat/Gold counter where I am standing and the one employee asks me if he can help me and I explain my situation I need my third room. He punches his computer and tells me he can get me a room right now just not next to the other two on a much lower floor. I thank him and say yes I'll take it and tiold him I appreciate his efforts as a Plat member. He then tells me he put a $50 credit on that room and apologized. I never asked for anything he totally took charge and offered. He took charge and handled the situation as far as I am concerned correctly. Cudos! The hotel is fine 2-3 elevators were out of order and it was quite a wait. Very clean rooms no issues here, the walls are paper thin not a huge issue just one group walked by and you could hear their whole conversation. Yes I would stay here again I feel employees make a hotel and they did a great job!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not a great room”
Reviews.Author: uscfan1325
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 1 PM on a Thursday and our rooms were ready. The room was very small and like other people have said, the rooms were hot and there was no thermostat. No matter what you did, the temperature stayed the same. We ended up just turning our unit off and the temperature was fine. My daughter and her husband were in the room next to us and they had the same problem. The soundproofing is poor - I could hear the phone ringing next door, babies crying, and horns blowing. Fortunately, I had brought my earplugs, so I still slept well. The beds were comfortable and there were four very nice pillows on each bed. There were robes in the closet, but one had a hole in the sleeve. We never used them. The bathroom was small, but there was a portable make-up mirror, so I put on my make-up at the desk. The shower had good pressure and the shower curtain was changed while we were there, so it was very clean. There is free wifi in the lobby and 5 or 6 computers which are hooked up to a printer. There is no charge for printing, which was nice because we printed out walking directions each day. The best thing about this hotel is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Location good, but hotel needs serious updating and repairs”
Reviews.Author: withanie
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to the Sheraton Towers Hotel and it was, by far, the strangest. Other trips have been good but it seems the hotel is either getting ready to close or embark on a major renovation (hope this is case). Our room was clean and bed very comfortable but it was impossible to control the heat - room was oven-like. Opened window which helped a bit but the heat made for bad sleeping. No washclothes in room and the very pleasant housekeepper apologized that they were in short supply. She did get us 2 on day 3 of trip. No hotel information book in the room - maybe eliminated for another source but don't know what that could be. Shower either very hot or cold - could not find that medium point. Sink drained slowly. Hair dryer old and died after 5 minutes use this morning. And could the towels please be improved? They are like sandpaper. Room layout could be improved by removing the long, long desk (which I read is going to happen), put the flat screen tv on the wall, add a comfortable chair. Elevators a major issue. On our floor, 23, at least one, usually 2 of the 3 elevators were not operating. We had a long conversation with the repair engineer this morning waiting to get on an elevator. Sounds like he is there practically 24 x 7! Got on an elevator going up so we could get to the lobby BUT the doors wouldn't open once we got there! With eight people in the elevator it got warm quickly but we could hear the (same) mechanic outside trying to get the doors open. While waiting we heard several stories about non-working toilets, cold food delivered via room service and hot hot rooms (like ours). No one seemed happy with their stay. Last year they opened their renovated bar area to include an internet / pc area. What a mess! Impossible to get seats in the bar and have a glass of wine. Place is crazy with kids and people wandering around trying to find seats. Plenty of floor space - could add more tables and chairs. The wine list has been dumbed down - very few interesting options offered by the glass. In the mornings this is a temporary Starbucks - service okay, but water never hot enough - multiple requests to get HOT water for tea. During our 4 day stay we never saw the restaurant open - same goes for something they call the Marketplace. We had a great trip in NYC but the Sheraton did nothing to add to it. Suggestion - maybe the hotel management should be "customers" for a few days and see what's up. Cannot recommend after this visit.

Reviews.Title: “exactly what we needed”
Reviews.Author: tmandgs
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed at the sheraton with friends on a very busy Dec 3 - 5th weekend. Reason for picking sheraton was primarily location - our friends had never been to NYC - but we also had a corporate rate which sealed the deal. Service was generally good. Got in early and left bags with bellman - they had a room FULL of them, which made us fearful of check-in - however, when we returned from a walk in central park and lunch in the oak bar (around 4) there was nobody at registration and the bags were brought to our rooms within 5 minutes. Rooms were small and plain but perfectly practical for our purposes - sleeping, changing, showering, and that's about it. Room was small and a bit chilly (very windy outside) but we slept well. No sign of begbugs (we lifted the sheets, took out pillows, etc) and had no bites. weird thing - there were five or six housecleaning carts left in the hall outside our room around the clock. Not pretty to look at but at least we never worried about having clean glasses. had a bit of a view but from a 7th floor in Manhattan it wasn't a priority - if you want to see the city, get out and look up. amenities - didn't use fitness room or room service but bar service was fine (albeit drafty when the wind blew through the doorways). Fantastic location for seeing midtown - within 10 minutes you can walk to columbus circle, times square, central park, rockefeller, etc. Lots of cabs available on 7th for going anywhere further, though a bit of a wait around dinnertime. Food wise - there's good street breakfast cart one block south at 52nd for coffee and egg on a bun ($5), and bistro maison had nice breakfast and great (complimentary!!) beignets (53rd and 7th, kitty corner to hotel). For a great dinner try A Voce in Time Warner center at Columbus circle. Tough to get a reservation (and you may have to wait even if you have one, as we did), but unique and fantastic italian food at a reasonable (for NY) price, and wonderful sommelier hit our wine request right on the nose. Most of the people there were local. non-lesiure travel: if you are a business traveller and have to spread out a computer and work in the room i may feel it a bit cramped, but for the price we paid (especially compared to what we have paid for previous December stays at Bryant Park, Hudson, Shoreham and Sofitel) we feel we got fair value. See if you can get a corporate rate. overall - not especially romantic and not luxurious, but clean, efficient, and practical for a busy weekend of shopping, drinking, and sightseeing in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Overall nice stay with a few exceptions”
Reviews.Author: achatey7
Reviews.Content: Last minute booking, paid a fair amount for a friday night. Staff was very nice, hotel in general was very clean and modern. As a flight attendant I stay in hotels 5x a week and would consider this hotel to be a great choice for NYC. Great location!! My two exceptions would be first that my top sheet was soiled with what I hope was food.. It was a small area but you could easily tell the linen was not laundered since its last use - I understand that was a mistake and it hardly ever happens thus I am not grading my hotel stay off of that, however the biggest problem we faced was the temp of the room, it seemed as if the heating/cooling unit was very outdated thus the room remained very very hot the entire stay which was quite uncomfortable at times. Overall the rest of the stay was nice and I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never, ever again”
Reviews.Author: sologirltraveler
Reviews.Content: OK I booked this trip last minute to do a media appearance, so that's why my crappy room was $400 or so, but the room looked like it had not been updated since 1985. And there was no thermostat! There was no way to control the heat or air in the room -minus opening the window. And the bathroom was minuscule. I know in NYC hotels can pretty much charge what they want but this was ridiculous for such a horrible room. I was so embarrassed about the room I refused to have a client meet me there, so I looked for a space in the lobby but it was jammed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel,good location”
Reviews.Author: chrism2112
Reviews.Content: Having read some reviews for this hotel our expectations were not very high ,however we were pleasantly surprised.Lobby area and reception were clean and well presented and staff very helpful. It was obvious some renovations have been made and were still taking place and to us the hotel looked very clean throughout . Our room was very clean and adequate for our stay in New York. Only gripe we have was that room was next to the elevator mechanics which meant we could hear a drone in our room.Maybe we should have asked for a change of room but to be honest it did not bother us that much. Maybe we are easily pleased compared to some reviewers but we would definately look at returning to this hotel if we visit New York again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: road-trippies
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the New York Sheraton because we were able to get a room with a view of the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade. We were very happy with the hotel. Our room was a bit small like most big city hotels, but perfectly adequate. The view was good despite a desk that could not be moved away from the window. Everything was clean and in good repair with the exception of the carpet which was stained and really should be replaced. We were especially impressed with all the friendly and helpful staff including those at the reception desk, housekeepers, doormen, and the concierge. Our many questions were handled with grace and warmth. The location of the hotel was superb. We walked to Time Square, The Radio City Music Hall, Rockefeller Center, and most every other place we wanted to go. When we didn't want to walk the concierge helped us navigate the subway system. When we are able to return to New York for another vacation, we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “clear acoustics...”
Reviews.Author: lugan11
Reviews.Content: are a good thing in a theater, but not a hotel room. Unfortunately the Sheraton is a hotel, not a theater....so being able to clearly hear every word spoken by other guests in the hall or adjoining room is not a plus. I would be suddenly awakened by the voices throughout the night, thinking they were in my room. Disconcerting. Otherwise the hotel room, while not spacious, was nicely furnished. The location was very convenient, and the staff very courteous. But there must be a way the hotel can drown out the sound, maybe play white noise?

Reviews.Title: “Average NYC hotel.....below average Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Acfisher
Reviews.Content: I'm a Gold Preferred SPG member and have stayed at MANY Sheraton hotels and this one used to be one I liked......not this trip! They gave me the wrong room (okay, mistakes happen) but it took them more than 15 minutes to correct the problem (not okay) Couple that with a fairly dirty room and paper thin walls (as exhibited by an apparent "party" in the next room until 2:00 am) and I can't call this a good value anymore

Reviews.Title: “Morning Concierge Service”
Reviews.Author: hass26
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two years ago and returned for six days last week. The AM concierge breakfast is made more impressive by associate Muhammad Ramzan, he remembered us from our previous visit and his service and conversation made our stay memorable. This Sheraton is exceptional. Barbara Hasselman

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Excellent Staff.”
Reviews.Author: orangegoat
Reviews.Content: I go to the Sheraton NY Hotel & Towers each September for business and always look forward to my stay. The rooms are nice, clean, and modern. The views are spectacular. The staff is fantastic and they go out of their way to make sure you enjoy your stay. If anything should go wrong they will be there within minutes to fix it. Great location. The Club Level is worth the extra price and includes breakfast, coffee, and other amenities. You also can't beat the view from the higher floors.

Reviews.Title: “Where does the Pink Panther take his trash???”
Reviews.Author: kingofsp8s
Reviews.Content: I get so frustrated staying here. Am an SPG Platinum for many years and this arguably is one of the most frustrating experiences. Climate control is bad, the rooms and decore are threadbare, outmoded, and even the "upgrades" are these bizarre "suites" connected by tunnels (I think I saw Cheney in one of them recently...he still thought he needed to be in hiding). Restaurant and bar also close at times different than what's listed or advertised, often at their own discretion. Not good for the late weary traveller. The staff try hard, but this is a "hotel for the masses". It's unfortunate because even if they can't make it better for all, if they could better isolate and provide the elites an experience it would be so much better. So close to the park, the theatre...so close...so close but yet so far. If you're SPG elite, go to Le Meridien. If your SPG execs, go to Tarrytown and figure out what a Sheraton should be. By the way, the answer to the question is: Dump...dump dump...dump dump..dump dum..dump dump...dump dump dump dump....

Reviews.Title: “Can't get a better location but, hotel needs update”
Reviews.Author: bcjordan
Reviews.Content: Location and staff are excellent here. For such a large hotel with tons of tourists, the front desk has a great attitude. The rooms are good size for New York, however they really need an update (I know they are about to start a big renovation project though). Beds are really comfortable and my room was really quiet. I left my toothbrush in another city the night before and I didn't like that I had to pay for one out of the mini bar...should be a basic complimentary amenity.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Service and Security”
Reviews.Author: pauditore
Reviews.Content: After several bad experiences earlier this year I had given up on this hotel, but that was before Mark Saunders and Zoe Cohen noticed my review here on this site They have improved security, the club room is awesome and you can't get a better breakfast for the value. NYC is awesome right now and the location of this property is like no other, I walked just about everywhere and everything is in easy distance. I liked the check in experience and my room was upgraded for obvious reasons and I really appreciated that. I even noticed that security had really improved since I complained about it and I loved the fact that Bernie Madoff's display of greed was auctioned off here. As a social customer I love it when a business knows my name. Kudos for Sheraton for noticing us empowered customers on Tripadvisor, that makes a difference.

Reviews.Title: “A Dump”
Reviews.Author: Kaotcgd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel two years ago, and for some reason I do not recall it being as shabby as it was this time. When we got there on this recent trip, 3 of the 6 lobby elevators were broken supposedly, so there was a line of about 40 people waiting to get to their rooms. Once up to our floor, the hallway carpet is completely disgusting and worn and dingy. The exteriors of room doors were scratched and looked like some of them had taken a beating. The room looks shabbier than I remembered and the walls are paper thin, so we could easily hear the conversation of someone in another room (below us?) through our heating vent. The room itself was clean, although the carpet could stand to be replaced and the bathrooms are ridiculously tiny. The night was the worst, however, because we could hear everything in the hall, including the group of drunk/angry/whatever women who periodically would come out into the hall, shouting at one another drunkenly, only to slam their door again....this continued until about 3 a.m. Trash had been left in the hallway (a McDonald's bag with french fries strewn about) and, seriously, with all the noise and shouting and drunkenness in the hall, I felt like I was in a ghetto. This place has gone seriously downhill in the past 2 years. Finally, leaving was a challenge because, again, the elevators were broken down, so the quickest way to go down was to go up first so you could at least get on an elevator (we were on the 35th floor). After waiting for 15 minutes for a down elevator, we gave up and went up first.

Reviews.Title: “Only average”
Reviews.Author: ttraveler401
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton New York Hotel & Towers on business and for an in-house awards dinner. The staff was attentive and responsive, the bed itself was very comfortable and bedbug free, the room was standard-size for Manhattan, clean and seemed to have been recently refurbished, but there were several negatives: - even on the 34th floor, you could here the traffic below and louder neighborhood noises through the closed and locked windows; - the bathrooms didn't have washcloths, and it took over an hour for housekeeping to deliver them; - though the room had evidently been refurbished, the carpeting was worn; - the section of the wall near the windows was paper-thin: I could easily hear conversations in the next room day or night; - even though I didn't bring my computer to my room, I received two days worth of charges for the service. To give the front desk credit, they did remove the charge when I called. There are hotels that I would recommend to my best friends, and hotels that I'd warn anyone to run screaming from. This is neither: I'd stay again for business if needed.

Reviews.Title: “excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: delavan4950
Reviews.Content: I stay at this Sheraton quite a bit during the year and have always been treated with the utmost respect. The customer service rep that I deal with the most is Sharon Gilsenan, who is the Director of Reservations. She is always very helpful and understanding to the needs of myself and fellow co-workers. I would definitely recommend the Sheraton as the hotel to stay in for business or pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way.”
Reviews.Author: runnerfamily
Reviews.Content: We were concerned with widespread news reports of Beg Bugs in New York and considered canceling our trip to run in the ING NYC Marathon. Mr. Kai Fisher (Director, Communications) personally returned my call and patiently detailed the incredible measures the Sheraton Hotel & Towers takes to keep this increasingly prevalent menace from infesting their facility. The rooms were pristine, comfortable and cozy. He and the entire staff were genuinely thoughtul and desired for this trip to memorable for us. We enjoyed every minute in NY.....and not a single stressful moment worrying about bed bugs...just the 26.2 mile run was on our minds! We will be back and will stay only at this wonderful hotel! Thank you Mr. Fisher and fabulous staff.

Reviews.Title: “THANK YOU”
Reviews.Author: teamuno
Reviews.Content: We would like to thank all the staff of this hotel for the fantastic support we had during ING NYC marathon. A very special thanks to Angelica, George and our housekeeper Lynnette who really made the difference. Thanks again Marcella, Iva, Elisa, Silvia, Marina.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service at it best.”
Reviews.Author: Sportier
Reviews.Content: I was in NYC for the marathon, really my first time to NY. The Concierge was so good about dining suggestions and reservations. They recommened and booked good seats for Broadway shows as well. Everyone at the hotel was so friendly and helpful. We had had lost luggage and the bell captain really did a great job putting us at ease and helping us get toiletries, etc. The most impressive Sheraton staff member was Naomi Chin, maid service on the 31st floor. She was delightful,friendly,, and cheerful! Everytime we met in the hall, she greeted us and made sure everything was ok. Very nice lady!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel if the price is right but it's not very clean.”
Reviews.Author: pbjol
Reviews.Content: Pros -Nice restaurant w/a hearty breakfast buffet full of options ($27+tax & tip). The wait staff is helpful and attentive. -GREAT gym on the lower level of the hotel. A ton of up-to-date cardio machines, free weight dumbells up to 100lbs, nice locker rms. If you're a fitness freak, the gym will make the hotel worth the stay. Note, there is a $10 charge/day or $21 for your stay. -FANTASTIC location with easy access to Times Sq & Ctrl Park. -Although the hotel is close to Times Sq it's not noisy in your room. The hallways on our floor (21st) were also quiet. -We stayed at the hotel for $275/nt after bidding on Priceline.com. Cons -The lobby is extremely busy at all hours. -The hotel charges for internet access. -The room, once obviously nice, is now shabby. -The cleaning staff does not do a good job at all. Our room was very dusty. The glass on top of the bedside tables had fingerprints and marks from previous occupants. There was alot of hair on the floor of the bathroom under the sink and the tub had hair in it too. It looked like someone should have wiped the white light switch b/c it had grey marks on it. -I pulled back the sheets and lifted the mattress to check for bed bugs, there were none. I did notice that the mattress was very stained and was uncomfortable with the very thin mattress cover underneath the sheet. -I could not control the heat in the room. I didn't feel this was a big problem because the weather was in the 50s during the day. **I wouldn't say you shouldn't stay at this hotel. If the price is right and you like the ammenities I mention above it might be good for you. I would warn you that when I placed my bid on Priceline.com and requested a 4 star hotel this was considered 4 stars. No way is this hotel 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly tired and dirty business dormitory...don't go.”
Reviews.Author: CBG2007
Reviews.Content: Don't go. I got a cheap deal and now I know why. The hotel is VAST and crowded with conventioneers. You can queue for hours at the lift. The rooms are grimy and as it was March they refused to turn on the aircon...because it's march and they turn in the zircon in April. Doesn't matter that the rooms were like furnaces. Staff rude...but that's NY. Inadequate catering...so eat out. I stay at Sheratons the worked over but this was below par and not deserving of the great brand name. Even redecorated and cleaned it is just Horrid. Try the Hilton on Avenue of the Americas for a better experience at the same price.

Reviews.Title: “just okay for short theater trip”
Reviews.Author: counrygal
Reviews.Content: I traveled to NYC to see a Broadway play. I bid on Priceline and got the Sheraton. Let's just say the hotel room was not the highlight of my trip. Room was small, unspectacular, though clean (and no bed bugs -- I checked!). My view on the 34th floor was of the high rise office building across the street. Bed is very comfortable but I slept poorly because (1) I couldn't lower the room temp, though they sent an engineer to try to fix it, and (2) the deadbolt on my door did not work. I'm told they're renovating in May 2011. Service is good, though the hotel is *huge*, and I don't really like the feel of taking an express elevator to get so high to my tiny room, one of many hundreds (over 1000?). Just north of Times Square it's convenient for Broadway and close to Central Park. However in the eve the streets are mobbed with (slow-walking!) tourists! I prefer staying in other areas of the city that are quieter.

Reviews.Title: “CANADA/ NEW ENGLAND CRUISE HOTEL THROUGH CRUISE LINE FOR PRE AND POST NIGHTS”
Reviews.Author: russellapotterinc
Reviews.Content: i was on a cruise with princess cruise line. this is were the cruise line put up there pre & post passangers. i loved this hotel becuase you are i walking distance to time square, broadway, and 5th ave.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: bumblebea57
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Columbus Day Weekend for a return trip to NYC. Our room was exactly what we expected; clean, comfortable, and small (which is what most rooms in this price range anywhere in NYC would be). The view from our room was pretty; we were on the 26th floor and could see Times Square in one direction and the GE building in the other. The hotel is nice; not luxurious, but perfectly fine in every way. We have stayed here four times now, and have had positive experiences each time. I have recommended it to friends, as the location is super convenient and there is parking available at the hotel (makes it easy if you're driving to NYC).

Reviews.Title: “Wife's 50 Birthday”
Reviews.Author: MConklin
Reviews.Content: great time great location best front desk in nyc very busy but smooth

Reviews.Title: “A good stay .... after room change”
Reviews.Author: MartinPh
Reviews.Content: Stayed for first time at the Sheraton NY Hotel & Towers due to conference taking place at hotel. Initially given a room on the 5th floor, which was not very impressive ... small & with some sort of film on the window that made it almost totally opaque and very dark. Back down to reception, who were very helpful, & switched to room on the 33rd floor: much, much better: quitre a bit larger, light & much better furnished. Very comfortable bed & lovely pillows. So can recommend, but care needs to be taken with the actual room. Also a plus is the location & the conference facilities were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Girls Trip at the Sheraton NY”
Reviews.Author: TTTworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: This Sheraton is a hop away from Time Square. This was our first time in NY and we were just steps away from Times Square. The hotel is very busy with lots always going on downstairs. There is a cocktail area I believe and internet area (for ridiculous fee thought....really my only pet peeve). I think when we were there it was a wedding or some type of banquet going on as well as a few conferences. Rooms are small but nothing to complain about....it's NY. We spent all of a few hours a day in there. The rooms are nicely appointed though. In addition when I was checking in, the desk clerk told me that they were in the midst of renovating floor by floor so prices would probably be increasing around December as the entire building was getting a makeover. Carpets in halls, and things like that could use updating and I guess that is why they are updating. I would stay here again in a minute. A closer hotel is Marriott NY Marquis but this is just as close to Time Square. I think 53 and 7th ave and time square is around 48th and 7th or something like that. All of it is so close. I would recommend in a heartbeat. Rates fluctuate depending on the time of year. We went in July and rates were a bit lower. You can check out and leave bags if you want to sightsee some more. We did that but they charge $3 per bag left. Worth it if you have a late flight though so you can take in a few more sights. We used the NY Sightseeing Tours and I would recommend them. Most of the tour guides were nice and knowledgable. Tour package was about 50 pp and it inlcuded Statute of Liberty cruise, night tour of brooklyn and hop on and hop off day tours for length of our trip. Well worth it. We say so much (as they take you buy various landmarks and you can hop off if you want) just using this tour bus as our transportation for the most part instead of the subway and cabs. Pool is located across street at another hotel (kind of an inconvenience). Not sure where fitness center was located.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I Stayed Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: ZonaP
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights to attend a conference held at the hotel. While my employer paid for everything, I know for the future that I wouldn't want to stay here. Rooms are small, though this is to be expected in midtown Manhattan. However, the bathroom was not well cleaned (stray hairs from previous occupants, stains, etc). Bathroom amenities are standard (shampoo, bar soaps, conditioner, lotion and small vanity kit), and towels are your typical thin, rough, white hotel towels. There is no wi-fi, only wired internet service for $14.95/24 hours. Based on the room configuration, forget working online and watching tv at the same time. I had to ask twice for a crib before one was delivered, and there's a $25 rental fee for refrigerators (for baby's milk). Parking is managed by Icon and is $42/day with NO in/out privileges. Late checkout requires manager approval, and if you need to check your bags until later in the day, there's a $3.25 fee PER BAG. On the bright side, the hotel is easy to find, and near many major attractions (Times Square, FAO Schwarz, Rockefeller Center, etc).

Reviews.Title: “Thankfully, no bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: Pushing50Ny
Reviews.Content: We were worried about the 9/30 post stating hotel had bed bugs. None to be found. Really our only complaint was that there were no drawers to put clothes in and in a cramped room you had to always have the suitcase in the way. Comfy sleep. Great location for having fun.

Reviews.Title: “Solidly average... expected more but worth it for the location”
Reviews.Author: Silverfang
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton New York Hotel & Towers last week. The location is fantastic - close to some great restaurants (right around the corner from Bar Americain) and an easy walk to Times Square, TKTS, and all the Theatre District. It was the location that made the stay fully worth it. That being said, the rooms are small and ours had some issues with temperature control. We like the room cold but there was simultaneously hot and cold air blowing into the room. We were on the sixth floor and could definitely hear all the street noise - but nothing a simple pair of ear plugs couldn't resolve. The room was clean on the surface, but when we arrived there was a dark, short, curly hair stuck onto the shower wall. It was pretty obvious and I'm surprised housekeeping missed it. Aside from that, the Internet was fast in the room but costs $15 day which is cheaper than some places I've stayed but I've also stayed at many places where Internet is free so to me $15/day is still steep.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Staff. Everything else was average.”
Reviews.Author: Carriecas
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at the Sheraton Hotel and Towers in October 2010. Right off, I was warmly greeted by the front desk, and was allowed early check in after a red-eye flight. The staff was friendly and welcoming. The room and public spaces were average. The room itself was in need of a good cleaning. There was what appeared to be cat vomit under one of the beds and housekeeping's efforts were minimal, though with that many rooms to clean, I don't blame them for their abbreviated efforts. This hotel attracts large tourist groups and conferences, so if that is not your scene, I would recommend a boutique-ier hotel. Overall, it was standard for the amount paid, and the smart location in midtown is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional hotel”
Reviews.Author: lmherrington
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Sheraton in NY and by far the most enjoyable. As a female business traveler, I found the hotel accomodating, comfortable and the staff very responsive to my requests. The hotel concierge was amazing in that they were able to point me in the right direction to a shop I wanted to visit on 52nd Street carrying a specific brand. Zoe Cohen, the Hotel's VIP Manager was especially gracious and made sure my hotel room exceeded expectations - it did! I will return to the Sheraton for business and pleasure when visiting New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, Overpriced Typical Chain Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KellyMcB
Reviews.Content: For $350 a night, this place was a bit of a dump. the location is fine, and the lobby area is attractive enough (though you can only get a cup of coffee there first thing in the a.m. and a limited window in the afternoon), the rooms are poorly maintained and downright shabby. There was no thermostat to adjust the temp and we could never get Internet access working. The bathroom was dingy and dated and there were three or four maids carts in the corridor all day long -- complete with blaring radios. Spend a little more and stay at the Muse (or any Kimpton property) or the Broadway Millennium or better yet, splurge and stay at the Standard.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent surprise! great staff”
Reviews.Author: luvtravelernamaste
Reviews.Content: Being female..I make sure that I find clean, safe hotels; esp. in NYC. This was it! Great staff that really impressed...They even helped me with a problem that required drug store run...which the bellman happily did for me...many thanks!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ilovenycalways2010
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, clean room, nice service, especially front desk. Small bathroom but nice size bedroom. Excellent location. You are in the middle and within walking distance between Central Park and Times Square. Subway in the corner that takes you straight into the Financial District or Chinatown. Very expensive restaurants around so eat someone else. Parking is in the next door garage. Expensive of course but convenient since you can literally go out the side door and get your car. Definetly would recomond staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Very small out dated rooms poor air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: davemayo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sheraton New York and Towers in Julyfor 10 days and were very disappointed in it. We had stayed in Sheratons before and had no problems in other cities. The very first night we complained about the room and were told all rooms in New York are like that, Air con was very poor which is very necessary for New York in July . Overall very disappointed with this Sheraton and would not recommend to any one.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: lovetravel057
Reviews.Content: I was in NYC for the weekend and stayed at the Sheraton and was very pleased. It has a great location and is in close proximity to the Theater District and Times Square. I chose not to eat in the hotel because of it's expense, but the adjacent neighborhood has lots to offer as far as delicatessens, diners,etc. The Sheraton does have a nice lobby area with great coffee bar in the morning and early afternoon that becomes a full bar after that. There is also internet access computers and WiFi in the lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience in April, going back in December”
Reviews.Author: TexasAMC3
Reviews.Content: After our trip to Paris was cancelled due to the volcanic erruptions in Iceland we went to NYC very last minute and snagged a great deal at the Sheraton. Upon check-in we were kindly upgraded to club level which includes afternoon snacks and a generous breakfast buffet in a room overlooking Central Park. While I really would prefer a more intimate setting we're going back to the Sheraton because the location is great for what we want to do and the staff were so kind and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Best spot in New York.”
Reviews.Author: hassan1947
Reviews.Content: I'm a business traveller and i always stay at the Sheraton New York. Wonderful staff, beds are very comfortable....specially the club lounge on the 44th floor. Muhammad always greets me with smile and is very attentive.

Reviews.Title: “More than I Expected!”
Reviews.Author: Roxy1573
Reviews.Content: This past summer, my family and I stayed at the Sheraton New York Hotel & Towers in Time Square for a week and let me just say "WOW what an experience!". After a little hiccup in booking our stay for two standard rooms, I was pleasantly surprised that I was walking into an luxurious 1 bedroom suite. This suite was amazing...I thought I was dreaming. It had a separate bedroom with a king size bed, 2 bathrooms and a large living room with a breathtaking view of downtown Time Square. Sharon Gilsenan the Director of Reservations was exceptional with her customer service. The treatment we received by Sharon and her staff was more then anyone can ask for. This is our second time staying at the Sheraton New York Hotel & Towers and each time it gets better and better, that's why we are planning to come back this summer 2011. We had such an amazing time in New York City, that we look forward to enjoying another stay. Thank you so much for making it worth our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Crisp”
Reviews.Author: BeenThere4352
Reviews.Content: Great location, just at Times Square but we didn't feel like we were in the middle of all the neon signs. We had a "top" room on the 50th floor looking over the apartment buildings and seeing the trees of Central Park, felt like being a local, not a tourist. We had Club Level rooms and the staff there was wonderful. Very helpful with ginger ale and crackers when I got sick from a street vendors hot dog (I know not a good choice for food). Beds are heavenly and sleep was great. Rooms were small but had all the space we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge works in restaurant”
Reviews.Author: THEJACKSTER13
Reviews.Content: So I have breakfast in the Hudson Market every morning. The food is great but the waiter Jon is a gem. He offered me guidance and input on things to do in NYC on the little free time I had. Each day he had another tidbit - - like on Weds take the tour of Grand Central at 1230. It is free and a great way to appreciate the beautiful station. Another fun thing was visit PopTart world, okay that was a lame visit but still a great suggestion. He knew I wanted to have fun in limited time but still offered unique suggestions that I will share with all my friends in the future. Therefore, skip the concierge desk and find Jon in the Hudson Market, He gave me the normal tour guide books but the best advice was from him directly. Better yet, Sheraton, move him to the concierge service. His ideas were more fun, unique and totally cool. Love that.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mehul11
Reviews.Content: I often stay at the New York Hotel and Towers. Not only is it well located in the heart of midtown, but it offers a practical and right blend of non-nonsense service. Being a SPG Platinum Member I am in a unique situation to compare this to other starwood properties in business locales and find this hotel to be of perfect value.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Management has made our stay worthwhile - a little "home" while on business”
Reviews.Author: ziegerma
Reviews.Content: My wife I have been Platinum preferred members in the Starwood program since 1999. Over the past decade we have gone out of our way to book the Starwood hotels for our vacations (Europe, Africa, Indian Ocean, Australia, Asia, etc) as well as for our business trips - they really have a great program. But more importantly for us, the Sheraton New York Hotel & Towers have great staff and that is why I am writing this post. On one of our New York trips I mentioned to the hotel manager Kenny Imafidon, that despite our prolonged stay in New York and the frequent visits to his managed hotel, we never receive any kind of upgrade. He has subsequently gone out of his way to make us feel comfortable and his pleasant nature has made us book the Sheraton again, despite the same price we would have received at the Westin. It is staff like Kenny that make the Starwood program worthwhile for us and to make sure that the firms we work for accept the Starwood terms of stay as opposed to all the promotions or "points" we could earn - it's a little bit of home while having the stress of travel that he makes happen. Thank you very much for having people like Kenny Imafidon on your permanent staff Sheraton!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: buttonfactory
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ideally located for a tourism weekend in New York. It is in easy walking distance of Central Park, Times Square, the Theater District, Rockafeller Centre etc. The staff were friendly and helpfully accomodated a request for a room with two beds and were happy to help with advice. It looks like renovations are underway to update the decor, but our room was comfortable and clean as it was. Room was spacious enough, with very comfortable beds. We bid on Priceline and paid around $210 per night, which seemed like a very good value for this hote.

Reviews.Title: “I will highly recommend this Hotel to anyone for the care of the guests.”
Reviews.Author: sandy8489
Reviews.Content: We would highly recommend the stay at the Sheraton New York Hotel Tower, for the care of their guest , location and spacious rooms. Aramis, at the front desk, Jorge Guerrero, guest Service Mngr and Tommy at the 44th floor lounge attendant, we would like to thank them for their hospitality during our 3 days stay at the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if you are planning on seeing the attractions and don't care about a Large room.”
Reviews.Author: rockinsammygirl
Reviews.Content: The room was a little cramped by midwestern standards. Very clean. Hotel staff was awesome and helped us get a room to suit our group. We booked with Yahoo travel and they don't confirm your room, even if you want 2 beds it is not for certain. The front desk checked us in and made sure we were not unhappy. They also helped us get to where we wanted to go without attutude. ;-) There were not a lot of computers for everyone to use in the lobby, so I recommend bringing your own if you need to look up things or to buy tickets for shows on line. Also we never used the pool but I guess the hotel shares one with hotel close by. I will stay here again for my next trip to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location but a circus in Summer time”
Reviews.Author: Rpk071
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the corner of 52nd and 7th and is a hop from Times Square and a few skips from Fifth Avenue, MOMA, and Radio City Music Hall. As location goes you cannot get any better staying at this hotel if you are on vacation. But with this location comes a troop of group vacationers. You're in New York so its unlikely that you are going to be staying in but if you do then beware the Menu. Room service is expensive but you are just a walk away from the best Kebab takeaway in Manhattan.
