The rooms are incredibly small but if you take the Club room and get access to the club house, then you get fantastic views of the city. So finally you are only left with the horribly crowded lobby that thinks you are at a fair. But once you see how much money you save by not taking taxis, it kind of disappears. This hotel is not suitable for business but for a vacation in NY, its pretty great.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Labor Day Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Helbail
Reviews.Content: My husband and I met our two college children in Manhattan for Labor Day weekend. We stayed at the Sheraton New York Hotel & Towers. Our weekend was packed full of activities. We attended the U.S. Open, saw the play, Blue Man Group and had dinner at Sardi's. We really could not have picked a better place to stay. The Sheraton is located near all the action. The staff was always extremely helpful and able to quickly answer any and all of our questions. The hotel is beautiful and our room was extremely comfortable. We will definitely stay at the Sheraton New York Hotel & Towers the next time we visit Manhattan, which I do hope is soon!

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Poesjenel
Reviews.Content: Didn't know what to expect but was surprised and happy at the outcome. The lobby isn't much to behold but the rooms were lovely, clean and quiet. Room was restful after a busy day and the service was very warm and welcoming. Ammenities were quite sufficient and the location was superb. Everything within a minutes walk. Hotel needs a little sprucing up but nothing that would dissuade me from staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location right off Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Fish7_2-3
Reviews.Content: We were three generations (2 teen girls) on a end of summer adventure. We stayed in 2 adjoining rooms that were quite comfortable and spacious, with great beds and pillows, and a large desk area. At the end of long days site seeing it would have been nice to have had a comfortable chair and occasional table in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad!”
Reviews.Author: vaselisa
Reviews.Content: The location is great as it is walking distance from Times Square and Broadway theaters. The room was small and huge desk under window was taking up more space than necessary. In addition, it was difficult to look out of the window unless you climb on that desk. We stayed on 21st floor, which wouldn've been a great view if the room wasn't facing another building. But overall, room was clean with flat screen TV, so if you don't plan on spending too much time in hotel, it is ok.

Reviews.Title: “awsome hotel”
Reviews.Author: GunnarR
Reviews.Content: Ordinary Sheraton hotel. Good service. Lovely breakfast buffe. Slow Internet access

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional experience - staff and service 5-star, rooms nicely appointed”
Reviews.Author: tzint
Reviews.Content: I recently hosted a meeting at the hotel and everything was managed seemlessly. Staff was helpful and friendly, even offered me an umbrella while i was standing there contemplating how i was going to get to my destination in the rain. Fitness Center was unbeliveable, just launched their new concept. Bar was great, good service and food, and a bit of interactive entertainment with the touch screen coffee table in the LINK wifi area. Sleeping rooms were comfortable with great views of the city. Proximity is 2 minutes from time square (walking). The meeting food was great, very creative and tasty. Would highly recommend going back. Signed - Picky Traveller!

Reviews.Title: “Dreary decor, uncomfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: SunFlight
Reviews.Content: I usually like Sheratons, but this one needs an overhaul. I stayed here recently for a long conference, and while the location is good, and right at a subway stop, the hotel is dreary in the rooms and public spaces. The beds are very uncomfortable and the sheets scratchy. The rooms seem smaller than average for other NYC hotels I've stayed in. One of my colleagues bailed and moved to another hotel after the first night. The lobby bar is tiny, the club lounge beat up. Service was very good and everyone was nice, but the one day I didn't leave a tip I received a little "sorry we missed you" note on the bed. While I appreciate the importance of leaving daily tips, I thought that was tacky. I did have a really good room service meal, probably one of the better ones I've had. Finally, there is a fair amount of chatter about bedbugs or lack thereof on other websites. I tore apart the bedding and didn't see any, but due to recent "sightings" I was jumpy about it for much of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “A+ - No BETTER NYC location and room for the first timer to NYC”
Reviews.Author: Kelton
Reviews.Content: Debra at check-in gets an A++++. Jorge and Mark ere also great! ROOMS ARE SMALL, BUT THE LOCATION IS THE BEST OF ANY I HAVE STAYED IN NYC! Just a few blocks from EVERYTHING NYC! Rooms was clean and crisp. Our room had a great view. If this is your first stay in NYC, go here! Close to everything, clean, witha a staff that gives cares! Plus, free computers in the coffee lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a weekend trip to NYC”
Reviews.Author: TravelJunkees
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights. The bed was comfortable and the room had a good view of midtown. The location was perfect for exploring Midtown and going to the theater at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service- Great Concierge-Great Stay (As Always!)”
Reviews.Author: ipantic
Reviews.Content: I go to New York at least once a year- a truly unique place- and always stay at the Sheraton Hotel & Towers. I've been twice already and am planning to go again. Personally, I always get help from the concierge service and they're more than helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Husker_Mike
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the Web 2.0 Expo last week. At the rates they charge, internet should be complimentary and unfiltered...especially when you are hosting an internet conference where people have all sorts of devices in use. The pay internet system was slow to be enabled, which made it a pain to use. Rooms were clean, albeit a little small. (I think that's true of most Manhattan hotels though...) The bed was incredibly comfortable; no bed bugs in my room. I've heard that bed bugs are a problem throughout the city at hotels of all quality and price range, so I checked things out immediately upon arrival. The fan was set to an air-conditioning mode, and the room got ridiculously cold; I couldn't adjust the thermostat upward, so I finally just shut it off. Room was fine after that. One unpleasant surprise was discovering that I was charged $2.29 for every 1-800 call I placed to the office. There was no notice in the room or on the phone that I'd be charged that kind of ridiculous fee for a call. The hotel breakfast at the "Hudson Market" is also ridiculously priced at $20 and upward. Fortunately, you can grab something outside the hotel for much less. The location is great; it's a simple walk to Broadway and Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Hudson Market...Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: mattylondonontairo
Reviews.Content: The Hudson Market experience was phenomenal! All thestaff appeared to work hard but as you may know already, Ernesto "Ernie"made our experience most memorable. His attention to detail, double andtriple checking to ensure we were comfortable and his subtle smile mademy wife and I eager to sit in his section. He appeared to 'hustle' with the everyday duties of being a server but genuinely expressed interest in our story as a couple, our experiences in New York and our breakfast experience. It was a pleasure waking up beside my wife in an amazing hotel and an electrifying city but a complete joy knowing that Ernie was there to start our day feeling optimistic about the world we live in. I believe that, although the times we live in can be very busy anddemanding; positive people, positive experiences and great atmospherec an contribute to ones personal beliefs and how they view their world.Keep up the great work with the staff.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelmnct1234
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely infested with bed bugs. I got them during my stay, and many of my colleagues also got them during their stay here over the past few months. They are crawling everywhere in this place. Stay away from this place at all costs!!!! Don't listen to them if they tell you they never had any problems becuase they have a major problem and apparantly aren't doing anything to fix it.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: theflatliner
Reviews.Content: Nice big hotel very central to Times Square if that is what you are looking for. The reception area is very nice and modern with a café and internet access. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. This is a large hotel and there is always a buzz about the place with many people coming and going. There are plenty of delis and supermarkets open 24 hours within a very short walk from the hotel which was good if you were up at 4am like me. The rooms however were a little dated and I have to say I was a little disappointed in them. For a 4 star hotel I expected it to be a bit more modern. The bathroom was tiny too and maybe we could have done with a bit more space. However it was clean enough, safe and fairly central to Times Square which was what we wanted. Not too sure if I would stay again though as the price and for what you got wasn’t really what I expected.

Reviews.Title: “$300+ a night for a room and then they charge you $15 to use the Internet.”
Reviews.Author: marklar_nz
Reviews.Content: Expensive, tiny room, unfriendly staff and then they go charge you $15 to use the internet. Came here after staying at the chambers hotel. Just round the corner but worlds apart in terms of quality.

Reviews.Title: “small, clean and very noisy”
Reviews.Author: Lisajane01
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter to New York for her 16th birthday. First of all i would like to warn any first timers ONLY GET IN YELLOW CABS AT THE AIRPORT!! we came out of JFK airport and took a few steps to take in the fact that we were actually in NEW YORK!!, a man came up to us and directed us to the carpark for a taxi... we went over to his car (as he had picked up one of our bags and put it straight into his boot) then a couple of other men got into the car with us. The driver was very friendly, chatty and helpful, (i did feel intimidated tho and very stupid for not checking him out properly) He dropped us to the side of the hotel, charging us 90 dollars plus tips! i then found out that the reason he dropped us round the side is because he is what they call a 'black cab' charging double the going rate! i felt like we had been robbed!! the two other men were also victims! the hotel rooms were very tiny, ok if you dont spend any time there, we were warned not to use anything from the fridge as it was very expensive. Our safe was broken (and not fixed), ironing board was falling apart. We barely slept due to the noise.. not from the streets below but form other rooms,teens running around, banging from the room next door and this was all hours of the morning. I think we could have saved a lot of money in hindsight.... there are two lots of tour guides outside the hotel. blue and yellow, we went witht he blues but found we spent hours waiting for buses!! and never even had our tickets checked. we got the subway one day that was cool, very cheap and friendly. food was very expensive everywhere, i took my duaghter to planet hollywoods for her birthday and found that was very impressive and reasonable. Great city, food smells everywhere Macy's was amazing, everyone said go to the outlet shop near ground zero but that was just like a TK max. Bloomingdales not as good as Macy's (the estee lauder girls were fantastic and funny, made us feel very special) Central park was good (very good chinese artists waiting to draw your portrait and very cheap)

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton - Needs some sprucing up and better air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: Im_with_Bobo
Reviews.Content: I like the Sheraton New York. Great Location--Midtown Manhattan - close to everything. Really good service. Common areas are very nice. Great for conventions. Two problems: 1) the air conditioning appears to be controlled centrally--no matter what you do with the room controls it is too weak. Needed to order a fan to my room to have some air flow. 2) The room was not as spic-n-span as I would have expected. The hallways to the rooms are getting shabby and run-down. This place needs some sprucing up. Rooms are still generally pretty good, but the bathrooms could also use some updating. Place is still a good hotel, but not great and you pay a lot for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced Not Internet Friendly-Not A Good Business Conference Location”
Reviews.Author: indyfuntraveler
Reviews.Content: I traveled here for the Web 2.0 Expo which is supposed to be a congregation of interactive technology professionals. I am surprised that they chose this hotel for this event. The cost of this hotel cost MORE than the cost of my attending the conference and my airfare COMBINED!. $2014 for a 4 night stay! In addition, they have the nerve to charge $15 per day for internet access in the hotel room/conference area/hotel lobby. That is CRAZY! Pricey hotel rooms...okay...in New York close to TImes Square...but charging that much DAILY for internet access is criminal. I am at the hotel right now as I write this review and have only spent 1 of 4 nights here. EXTREMELY disappointed. This is not the right hotel for a business event. Great location if you want to see the broadway shows. Bad location if you are here to work. I will NEVER choose to stay at this hotel or any other Starwoods property for business and/or leisure because of this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Fabulous Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: MissOrielle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location, walking distance to Times Square and Central Park. The rooms are smaller than I expected and it is an older style hotel however they were clean and comfortable and when you are in New York City who wants to stay cooped up in a hotel room anyway! There is way too much to see and do! I commend the staff at this hotel, everyone I dealth with went out of their way to assist in anything we required but I would especially like to mention a gentleman by the name of Theo Sky who absolutely saved the day when my passport slipped out of my bag unnoticed in the hotel lobby. Theo was able to locate it and was attempting to get through to Australia to have someone let me know that it had been found! Thankyou Theo for your efforts, they are so greatly appreciated. I am sure the remainder of my trip would have been an absolutely disaster had it not been for you! I will absolutely recommend this hotel to family and friends, not only for the fabulous location but the great service I received from many members of the staff here, Theo in particular :) I will definitely be back the next time I am in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience at any Starwood Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TB08
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the worst Starwood property I have ever stayed at, and the reason for this is the way I was treated by the staff. As an SPG Gold member, I have never experienced this before and I will never return to this hotel. My room was not ready at 4pm, so I dropped off my luggage (which I had to pay for) and went to dinner. After dinner I called the hotel numerous times to check on the status of my room, and the phone was never answered. Around 6pm, I went back to the hotel and told them about the issue with the phone to which the guy at the desk replied: "Sorry we were busy." I was also denied club floor priveleges, and late check out (supposedly only for platinum members at this hotel, but I have never been denied at any other Starwood hotel in NYC or any other city) After complaining to the manager of the hotel (A tall African American woman) who was friendly but only said "sorry" for everything and offered to cancel my room without charge. Sure, thats awesome. After 3 hours of waiting and paying to store my luggage, please let me cancel my reservation and haul my stuff to another part of the city. After finally getting to the room and getting my stuff situated I went to turn the heat down because it was blasting and very hot in the room. I discovered that I could not turn the heat off and tried calling the front desk. Again, no answer. Tried again....still no answer. So I walked downstairs and upon stepping off the elevator was told to go back to my room and put shoes on. Yes, I should have had shoes on but at this point I am furious and just want the heat turned off in my room. There were 3 people in line at the desk, so why is the phone not being answered?! The solution to the heat situation? "Open the window" Apparently because it is winter in NY, the heat needs to be blasting throughout the rooms so that it is around 85 degrees. So, I ended up sleeping with the heat blasting on me, a cold draft from the other end and a bunch of loud horns and traffic sounds because I had to sleep with the windows open in Midtown Manhattan. If this were my only experience at a Sheraton, I would NEVER stay at another one again, but I do understand that this is the exception and most of them are just fine. It would be in Starwood's best interest to maybe secret shop their hotels and be alittle more selective with what they stamp their badge on.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME HOTEL/BETTER EXPERIENCE!”
Reviews.Author: matty070578
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers and it was the hotel experience that we were hoping for! I had called ahead of schedule by approx. 2 weeks to explore what the hotel could offer us. Spoke with an amazing person/manager named "Kenny" and he was able to graciously provide us with an experience like no other. The club room floor (the 44th) is well worh the extra money, comfort and ammenity and should be taken into consideration of the whole experience at the Sheraton!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: SRW_TX
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in late August to attend a conference held at the hotel and in my opinion, they have very few things going for them. Highlights include the location, it’s about a block from Broadway and a few blocks from Times Square. It’s close enough to easily walk to lots of attractions, but far enough away that it’s fairly quiet. The beds at Sheraton hotels are always the high point, extremely comfortable. But that’s about where it ends. My room was extremely small, almost claustrophic, and both the main room and bathroom smelled like mold. There was literally no place to sit other than the bed. The “Motel 6” type A/C unit by the window (no central air) never worked properly and the room was extremely cold despite it being August. I asked for a space heater but was told they were unavailable. Maid service was adequate although there were hairs in the shower (before I used it) and the maid did not replenish the supplies in the room (i.e. coffee, notepads). Internet service in the room was extremely slow, and I never could get the wireless to work. My wake-up call was 15 minutes late. There was no information in the room about the hotel, map, how to get around, information about New York, room service, nothing! The staff is another story. The concierge gave me wrong directions to a store I asked about and I wandered around until I found it –about three blocks away from where he said it would be. Upon checkout, I asked the front desk attendant for some change. She needed to go to the back and was gone for some time. Upon returning, she was licking her lips and announced to her co-worker that she had been in the back having a snack. I guess taking a snack break was more important than serving a waiting customer. The luggage check attendant was very unpleasant to everyone and they charged $3.25 a bag to store your luggage. I’ve never heard of such a thing, and you can imagine how expensive this could get for a family traveling with a lot of bags. Upon the conclusion of the conference, as everyone was leaving, there was a long line and only one person working the desk to retrieve luggage. At a hotel of this size, they should be better staffed. The conference rooms, including the ballroom, are covered in bizarre dark blue striped wallpaper and the rooms were frigid cold. With the cold, the wallpaper, and no natural lighting, it was very cave-like.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for small room great location only”
Reviews.Author: Molkentin
Reviews.Content: If you stay at this hotel never use the telephone or ask for a wake up call or you will get a nasty surprise They also charge $3.25 a bag to hold bags even for a few hours Rooms very small Bathroom had mould and only 1 cake of soap not good for the price charged I did get into my room on first day very early and had a nice room this day but on return I didn't A hit and miss I expected better as I had better everwhere else Lady on reception was excellant the first day also For the price charged you can do better I will not return or recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Superb location. Excellent service. Great value.”
Reviews.Author: Ter51
Reviews.Content: This visit was a girlfriend week in New York. The hotel is busy and quite large but we always were treated well and recognized by the staff at breakfast and at the concierge desk. The service was excellent. Our view on the 49th floor was stunning. The room size was not bad at all...two double beds and a decent size renovated bright bathroom. No complaints. The bed was very comfortable. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Price, Best Location.”
Reviews.Author: bwistle
Reviews.Content: Well the best thing about the hotel is the location. It is close to everything, 2 min walk to Time Square and Central park, subway just outside, 5-10 min walk to 5th avenue, it was great. The hotel inside was also pretty good, the rooms, were small, but they are still very comfortable, and the beds were the best. Just ignore the reviews on here about the room being in a 'bad condition.' These people must try and find the dust and mould. The price at $230 was also great for a hotel in New York, just avoid the restaurant there, as its something like $23 for a porridge. The hotel is surrounded by delis and these places are really cheap.. The staff was also very nice. The biggest down side was it is a very busy hotel, but if you dont like busy you shouldn’t of come to New York. I couldn’t have had a better stay in New York, Thanks Sheraton

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel in Center of Everything - Felt Dirty”
Reviews.Author: ustehkc
Reviews.Content: Pros: Stay at this hotel when I go to NYC on business and get priced out of other SPG hotels. The location is great if you are a tourist. Walking distance to Times Square, Central Park, etc. If you are a SPG Platinum Member you get free breakfast in the am and they have a good happy hour on one of the top floors. Cons: Very busy hotel. Rooms are incredibily small and feel dirty. For example, when I arrived there was dirty toilet paper in the toilet. Similar to many NYC hotels, the walls and surfaces of the room feel greesy/dirty. Just the nature of many people using the same space over time. In general, I would recommend only because its a good location and the prices can be reasonable depending on the time of the year. This hotel is not bad but I dont look forward to staying here like I do other hotels owned by SPG in NYC. If I had my choice I would stay at the Westin in Times Square. Cleaner, newer with less crowd overrun. Also close to the Square and you can walk to Central Park as well as the Hells Kitchen area easily.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Calypso2
Reviews.Content: On our 3rd visit to new York we chose the Sheraton New York and Towers for its location and Sheraton reputation. We weren't disappointed, the proximity to Times Square, Broadway Shows, 5th Avenue, Radio City and Rockefeller Center, the Subway, numerous and varied eating places and only 10minutes walk to Central Park is perfect. The hotel is busy but rooms are quiet, though ours was a little compact with not much room between the bed and TV cabinet. Only complaints were the refrigerator is stocke so full there was no room to store medications and if any items are moved they are electronically charged to your account. When we queried this we were told another fridge could be supplied for $25! A bit unfair. The safe can also be a trap with a lip under the door where items can "disappear" as did a watch we had purchased and we are still waiting for a reply as to whether it had been found. Otherwise all good.

Reviews.Title: “Many thanks to Jorge Guerrero, Guest Services Manager, for the outstanding service!”
Reviews.Author: jdaykdicapital
Reviews.Content: While unpacking my bags in the hotel room around 10 pm, I realized I had forgotten to pack a tie for the next mornings 7:45 am business meeting. I called down to the front desk, looking for any suggestions or ideas of where I might be able to buy a tie. Jorge Guerrero, Guest Services Manager, came to the rescue, by insisting that I accept his personal tie as a gift. A runner brought the tie to my room within minutes. It was a beautiful tie. I slept well knowing I would be appropriately attired for the next day's meeting. Many, many thanks Jorge. You're the best!

Reviews.Title: “awesom”
Reviews.Author: flippertyjibbert
Reviews.Content: This was the best place to stay in new york. staff very heplful and friendly. Room very clean and the beds were to die ffor after a hard day sight seeing just to flop into a comfy bed mmmmm. We could walk to every where it is so central would recomend ti to everyone

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay.”
Reviews.Author: Rover6Glasgow
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton New York & Towers for 7 nights as part of a package booked through Virgin Holidays. The 41st floor room was very comfortable, clean and there was plenty of space. The housekeeping and reception staff were all very friendly and efficient. The hotel is ideally located close to Times Square, Central Park, Broadway, Rockefeller Center, many other tourist sites and shops. When I return to New York I would definitely consider retuning to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not a service oriented hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rajeshnaxal
Reviews.Content: We stayed this hotel April 2010.Location and brand made us choose this property.But sorry to say the staffs in this hotel are not at all polite or cooperative.You have to pay compulsory tip or your luggage are not shifted. Receptions do a big favor providing your pre booked rooms.Basically you feel low while check-in.The rooms are not up-to mark.It was not clean, we had to change the rooms before final settle down.If we had not paid in advance we would have not stayed here.Amenities in bathroom are very limited.Refrigerator in room is there but you need to call the house keeping pay extra to get it open.Whow what a five star treatment....

Reviews.Title: “Great mid town location”
Reviews.Author: Mygroup
Reviews.Content: Guest room not spacious but typical for Manhattan. Everything in working order with all expected amenities, i.e. safe, iron/iron board, hairdryer, toiletries, Internet connect, HDTV. A/C worked well, down comforters on beds. $3.25 per bag to check when leaving them at hotel on day of departure. Staff prompt, courteous and responsive.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Service, Location and Amazing Staff!”
Reviews.Author: seema40
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed at this hotel and we were celebrating our 15th wedding anniversary as well as my 40th birthday celebration. In particular, Ingrid took note of these occasions and was truly so welcoming and amazing and ensured that my stay was simply fabulous! The hotel is positioned in a great location, the breakfast was excellent, and the rooms were perfect. I wanted to thank the truly wonderful team at this hotel who really delivered world class service to us and I would definitely stay at this hotel again. A huge thank you also to the General Manager, Mark Sanders who is managing this hotel with passion and delivering outstanding service to all his guests.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time in a very nice master suite with a city view.”
Reviews.Author: joepeg
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in this midtown hotel, enjoying the comfort of a master suite, going out to dinner and shopping. This is a great location for getting around in the City, walking to Central Park. Staff are very friendly and accomodating. Check in was quick and easy.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: iloveshoes878
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for the value. It was extremely close to Time's Square, the Theatre District and many subway stations. There is also this very good 24hour French Bistro, Brasserie Maison that is worth checking out!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aviator38
Reviews.Content: Would recommend. Room was good for the price. Concierge not so helpful, but the security guard gave excellent restaurant recommendations. Situated in great spot in Midtown, easy walk to Times Square and Central Park. I DO NOT RECOMMEND GRAY LINE BUS TOUR....TOTAL RIPOFF!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Good Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: BromsgroveBlue
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location , a short walk to Central Park, Times Square & 5th Avenue with a good Irish pub next door ! The lobby was always busy & "buzzing" and the reception efficient & friendly. The rooms were a good size and the beds were comfortable , so no complaints !

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: timnkaye1998
Reviews.Content: my wife and I stayed here as part of a large group and were completely satisfied. room wasnt large but it was plenty big enough for 2. Room was very clean, bed was nice, tv was kinda old but neither of us watch alot of tv so wasnt that big of a deal. All the staff were very helpful and eager to please. Overall just a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel in nyc”
Reviews.Author: gq2env
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the hotel for the Labor Day weekend, and lets just say if I had any control over the publishers of Webster's Dictionary, I would demand that they take a picture of Jorge (Guest Service Manager) and team and place it next to the words "Customer Service". This is my second stay at the hotel and far better then my first one. Valerie, who I believe is no longer with the hotel, wasted no time accommodating all of my requests when I made my reservation and Jorge made the stay that more special. When one goes to someone's home, the host offers something to drink immediately, Jorge too welcomed my family and I into the Sheraton home with a plate of fruits, banana cakes and a bottle of water If the upgraded suite and access to the club floor didn't make us feel special, this warm gesture of hospitality definitely did! This kind of attention and follow up from Jorge is the reason why I choose this hotel out of all the many Starwood brands in NYC. It makes me proud to know I can always count on Jorge and the entire Sheraton team to make any trip I take a memorable one. It is with true loyalty I say I will always stay at the Sheraton New York Hotel & Towers.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel, small rooms, fitness center under construction, surly concierge”
Reviews.Author: richiedoc
Reviews.Content: A sorely needed renovation is planned for December, 2010. We could not easily open or close our room door. We rejected room change, the only solution available. The high point of the hotel is the comfort of the beds. TV excellent quality with mixed digital and analog channels. Convenient to Times Square and numerous restaurants. All but one of the Concierge personnel were helpful and pleasant. i asked one male concierge person to suggest a sedan vendor to transport 2 persons one-way to Montclair, New Jersey. I had just been given a quote of $63.00 plus tolls and tip. When he offered a reservation at $126.00 plus tolls and tip, one-way in a similar sedan. I informed him about the 100% price differential. He immediately accused me of shooting the messenger (him) by saying "Don't take it out on me, etc." His reaction was argumentative and defensive. Don't exactly know why but I have a few thoughts We booked with my preferred company, Carmel Limo. We were pleasantly surprised by their efficiency, price, and courtesy.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location but beware of hidden costs”
Reviews.Author: Alex2607
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel about 6pm, check-in was efficient. Room was ok size as was bathroom. In-room safe provided as well as good air-con. Concergie was excellent. Maid service was variable, found nappy under one of the beds on the second day, was removed instantly, service was good. Free internet is provided for guests without lap tops in lobby. Restuarant is expensive strongly reccommend Fluffy's Bakery and Cafe on 7th Ave/W 55th St for breakfast, excellent food, excellent value. I reccommend against patronising Rosie O'Grady's across from the hotel, expensive and service and food very variable. Hotel location is very close to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, Broadway Theatres and subway is next to hotel. Also reccommend 3 hour Circle Line Siteseeing cruise. Be aware of charge for opening fridge and of $3.25 per bag charge for bag storage, totally outrageous and even then guests baggage was stored in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: daltondhcp
Reviews.Content: Location / convenience: Covenient located at 7th av - nearby "where it happens" Check-in: No problems Room: • Size / layout: Small room (regular by NYC standard), classic decorated, recently refurbished • Cleanliness: Average, especially the bathroom was not as clean as you could wish. • Facilities: Double queen beds, LCD TV, desk • Outlook: Overlooked east 53rd street, very dirty windows so not that clear view. Internet: Didn't try that out. However free kiosk-computers in the lobby. Check-out: Swift check out with their zip-out-check-out system. Just a few "clicks" with the TV remote, leave your cards and you are ready to go. General Comments: Large chain hotel - we chosed it due to the location since it was my colleagues first time in NYC. We also got a discounted rate with breakfast included so that was part of the choice as well. The "Sweet sleeper" bed are awesome so you don't have to worry about to get a good nights sleep. Will due to the general worn-out feeling of the hotel choose another hotel next time I visit NYC. But if you get a good rate and want this location it's a ok choice.

Reviews.Title: “Club Level is Great”
Reviews.Author: MAC089
Reviews.Content: I travel to NYC frequenlly and have found a home away from home due to the services and attention of the staff in the clb level Breakfast is a buffet and Mohammed (SP?) is attentive. At night the bartender (Barbara) and Tommy make me feel like we are old friends

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for making me feel at home...”
Reviews.Author: rioplata
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel for over 6 months...week in week out. The hotel lobby is nice as it has been remodeled recently. The rooms need major upgrades, especially the AC system - which is centrally controlled. The hotel will be going through renovations in the guest rooms sometime at the end of this year. For Platinum level, guest have free internet, free access to the gym (which is been remodeled this week) and free access to Premium Club which provides continental breakfast in the morning and hors d'œuvres in the afternoon/early evening. The club is attended by an amazing crew who out do themselves in making you feel at home. Muhammad Ramzan is always ensuring that your visit is a pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Location yes, service no.”
Reviews.Author: philtodd
Reviews.Content: Yes this hotel has great location for people wanting to be close to Times Square, but it's a very busy hotel and the staff have no time for guests. Room was fine, though on the small side, and from the bathroom could hear other guests through the air vents. Wifi was $15 a day, but there was no signal in the room - this is $15 a day to use it in the lobby! Also, $3.25 per bag to leave suitcases until later in the day. I'd never come across a hotel charging for this service.

Reviews.Title: “Busy but good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Severnsider
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for Central Park/Times Sq....just a few minutes walk to both. Very busy hotel but this is matched by the super-efficient check-in staff. My request for four rooms with interconnection in two rooms was not met. Beds are supremely comfortable and rooms are good but could do with updating a little (we were upgraded to Club rooms so were pleased we didn't have the standard!). Bar prices ridiculous and poor attitude from bar staff. The Deli opposite was horrifically expensive and had no prices listed......walk towards Central Park and there is an excellent small restaurant on the left-hand side, almost at the end of 7th Ave in the centre of the block, with great breakfasts and very reasonable prices - very nice staff too ! Overall a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful return visit”
Reviews.Author: nurselawyer
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three-day business trip to NYC staying at the Sheraton--the conference host hotel. I cannot praise the hotel enough. From the ease of checking in and friendly greeting, throughout our entire stay, the Sheraton went above and beyond ordinary hospitality. We want to pay particular tribute to Sharon Gilsenen, Reservations Manager, for facilitating a warm welcome to the hotel. Our suite exceeded our expectations and we truly felt at home in NYC. The Sheraton will definitely be our first choice for future visits to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION! - Great for first timers!”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel23Wa
Reviews.Content: Our first time to New York and we LOVED our stay here! Would definitely stay here again, close to EVERYTHING...time square, food, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't special enough for a very special night.”
Reviews.Author: DocNYNY
Reviews.Content: Booked a surprise birthday night stay for the wife and I (we are in our 30s) after a 8pm showing of WICKED on Broadway. The show was great, the hotel choice, not so much. THE GOOD -great location, minutes walk from Gershwin theater. -staff (in person) were friendly. -the lobby and most general areas look amazing and great THE BAD - staff on the phone were inept (i called to book a floral arrangement, was referred to concierge, got hung up on. Called again, and again and on the 3rd call was referred from concierge to Room Service, who were very helpful, but didn't have any worthwhile options. Why wasn't i put through to Room Service right away!!!???) - mentioned at check-in i needed room service but wasn't given a menu. (Luckily they later brought it to us) - woken up by housekeeping - woken up by nearby hallway noise - dirty carpet (not exaggerating) - teenie tiny bathroom - not vent system in said bathroom - for temp control all there was was an archaic AC control system...room was too cold all night - asked TWICE for an item with our roomservice, but never got it (we were "efficiently" BILLED for it however) - if you put anything in the bar/fridge, beware! The sensors may detect activity and automatically bill you, as it did us, for a ton of drinks you never drank! Spent 5 minutes at the desk, after a 15 minute wait on line, to correct this. I am easy going/non-critical, but this REALLY was a bad choice of hotels on my part, and to do it again I would have gone somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Crowded hotel but great location”
Reviews.Author: af847
Reviews.Content: This place needs a makeover. And the staff was overwhelmed with large crowds of people so it was hard to get any kind of service. The place is so big it takes forever to get to your room. Excellent location, though; and the room wasn't that bad. Nice view out the window. When we did have a medical emergency involving an elderly relative the staff was incredible, I must say. But next time I'm in NY I'll stay at the Times Square Four Points.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful people and hotel”
Reviews.Author: apolloyyz
Reviews.Content: We arrived early, about 1145am and spoke with Ahmed at the Front Desk who told us that I and my wife would not be able to check in as no rooms were available. He asked if we wanted to 'check' our bags (for a fee) but we declined and decided to just relax in the lobby (which has free wi-fi and a cool 'iTable' which was an interactive map which displayed a map of Manhattan and the various areas and landmarks) and wait. Ahmed had asked us to check back at 1-130pm but I decided to check again at 1230. I must say, Ahmed was a very polite and informative. This trip back to the Front Desk, I met Joseph Casas, the Front Desk manager. Let me just say, he is the soul of courtesy and a class act. He immediately informed me, in his very welcoming manner, that a room was available and ready for us should we decide to do so, to which we replied in the affirmative. Upon stating that we were visiting from Toronto for our Anniversary, he so graciously offered either red wine or champagne plus cheese and crackers....how could I refuse? We immediately connected when he asked if we had any children to which I replied that we had an 18yr old entering University and a 9yr old...He stated that he had an 18month old.....a personal touch of courtesy there....most people don't care about you or your background..... The Cabernet he chose was a very subtle red and the plate of crackers included various cheeses which were very good! The plate even came with fruit! The very next day, we ventured out for a walk going east to 6th and discovered that it had been closed down for a 'bazaar', for lack of a better term. We encountered many different kinds of food and wares for sale and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves for a few hours. The next day, when venturing out for another walk, discovered it again a few blocks east....The food was great (tried the spicy italian sausage, mozzarella sticks, and fries....all good...they also had deep fried Oreos but we weren't brave enough) and the wares on sale were nice...anything from hundreds of styles of NYC baseball caps to pearl necklaces, to pashminas, to socks, to t-shirts....the list was endless. 5th ave was just 2 blocks east for your normal retail shopping...from Abercrombie to LV....all your shopping needs....Rockefeller was also just a few blocks away, along with Radio City Music Hall and Magnolia (a famous cupcake place) were also with 5-10 minutes....about 10 minutes north was Central Park.... The hotel is located just a couple of blocks from Times Square, and one block east and north of Gershwin theater (where we watched Wicked, which was stupendous by the way...). The hotel was central for all our needs. 2 blocks east and 4 blocks south, at 9th and 48th...we experienced a great little restaurant called the Delta Grill....great food...fall off the bone ribs (the best we've ever had) and great shrimp etoufee....also had very tasty jalapeno buns and fantastic corn bread... The Empire state building is about a 20-25 minute walk south....and Bryant park is about 15-20 minutes south (before Empire). I and my wife enjoyed our trip immensely...with the help of this hotel and it's staff.... Anyway, the room was clean, the hotel was clean, the people who worked there were very kind and patient. The hotel was central to everything we wanted to see and do (eating, show, shopping) and was a very classy hotel....Gary at the Front door is a great and helpful guy.....and I have to say it again, the Front Desk Manager, Joseph Casas, the soul of courtesy and class.....

Reviews.Title: “Does'nt Get Any Better Than This! Location Location Location! Especially at this price!!”
Reviews.Author: srayburn72
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I travelled to the Big Apple for few days of fun. From the moment of making the reservation to being greeted when we arrived in the Hotel. I cannot say enough about how firendly the staff was, especially Irini Padovan who works the Front Desk. She was exceptional! The location is perfect, you simply walk out the front door turn left and walk a couple of blocks and you are in the heart of Times Square! The room was immaculate and quiet. The bedding was great and comfortable. The bathroom was very clean. Size of the room was fine, we had two double/queen beds, nice flat screen TV. They even told us they are going to be renovating the hotel. I think it is fine the way it is. I had read other reviews and seen where people complained about the service. All that I can say is that our experience was truly beyond great and everyone was more than helpful. S. Rayburn, Fort Lauderdale, Florida

Reviews.Title: “A Friendly Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: m-branc
Reviews.Content: When checking in to the New York Sheraton Hotel and Towers it is always so heartwarming to be remembered and greeted by your name... Of course I have been staying at this property for a number of years and that figures into the equation… However, that equation is a two-way street and I keep returning because the employees remember me and make me feel at home. If I can name several associates it would start with two exceptional individuals who are often at the main desk at check-in… Maritza and Marsha… the M and M girls… and just like the candy, one is sweeter than the next. Another outstanding individual would also be Chris who is often on duty in the Health Club, which facility has some of the best equipment available and is one of the main reasons that I stay at this property. Also, if you book a Club Level room you be entitled to not only a fine continental breakfast, but evening hors d’oeuvres as well. For breakfast you will have the privilege of being served by Mohammad R, a very conscientious individual indeed… However, the main attraction occurs in the evening in the form of Tommy R… one of the most personable persons imaginable… first-rate service, good conversation, and more importantly a great sense of humor rolled into one amazing package. If he were not so sincere he would make a great politician… He may not be the mayor of NYC, but he certainly could be! So a friendly place to say… and convenient to Broadway shows and with the subway so close it is convenient to Yankee stadium and even Lincoln Center… More reasons that I always stay at the Sheraton when in the Big Apple!

Reviews.Title: “Great comfortable Hotel with excellent service in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: mimmiDanderyd
Reviews.Content: We were two teenagers and an adult in a twin bed room and had plenty of space. The room was always very clean and staff at our floor in partcular Mrs Chin was a true sunshine . The fitness center had plenty of threadmills wich is an advantage but did cost wich we felt was bad. we also received a lot of help and information from the concierge service. All in all a hotel to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Easily made my top 5 "worst ever stay"”
Reviews.Author: tedInSydney
Reviews.Content: I do travel a fair bit, more for leisure than for business. I have been to number of 3-5* property and have high expectation for the price I paied for. This hotel easily ranked in my top5 worst hotel stay ever, disregarding the rip-off $200buck/night I had to pay. 1) old - feels like a movie set from 1970s. The security "chain" at door could fall off easily. The doors squeaked. The airconditioning dust was filled with dust. The toilet had black markings. Just simply old and ugly. Lightings were poor and dark. 2) service - check-in staff lacked sense of humanity. I've seen better from airport check-in marchines than the mankind staffing the front desk at this property. 3) inroom dining - I ordered a "jumbo prawn" with "2 side dishes" of grilled asparagus and broccoli. What showed up was a "giant broccoli served with accompaniments of 5 prown pieces and asparagus". Not to mention it was loaded with MSG it tasted like salt paste. The having grace of the hotels are: 1) proximity to broadway and central park 2) size - do not think it was THAT small in NYC standard 3) being able to check-out and go home. In a nutshell, totally disappointed with this, what a dismise to Sheraton Brand. Mind as well rename it "sheraton motels and residences" as I've seen better from Comfort Inn. Having stayed at Sheraton, I now feel Holiday Inn Express will be a luxury treat for me.

Reviews.Title: “The Sheraton Towers is like home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: PaulLandi
Reviews.Content: The best part of the Towers experience is the club lounge. In the morning Mohammed and his crew always welcome with a smile and warm greetings for the breakfast. In the evening, Tommy always goes above and beyond to make your experience a fabulous one! I couldn't say enough nice things about Tommy. He's maybe the most friendly New Yorker I've ever met and makes sure that every guest is taken care of. I make sure to stop in if for even just a minute to say hi and see what new tasty dishes they have concocted! The gym is also second to none. After going to the Club lounge and tasting all of the great treats, the gym is a must visit! If you're a frequent traveler, the Towers is a must try. Like myself, I doubt you'll want to stay anywhere else after.

Reviews.Title: “First visit to New York”
Reviews.Author: dkthpage
Reviews.Content: Spent the last 3 nights of a multi-centre holiday; arriving at about 11pm found ourselves in Times Square just before midnight and got a table at the Hard Rock Cafe before closing at 12.30. We managed to keep this pace up for the remaining days and had a fabulous time. The location of the hotel; easy access to major landmarks and a 2 day Grayline Hop on Hop off bus ticket ensured there was plenty to do. Staff in the hotel lobby were really helpful and polite. Got a bit fed up with the EXPECTATION of tipping 15 - 20% for the most basic of services where ever we went, but hey we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “If you really want to enjoy New York,stay in Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: gabiteixeira
Reviews.Content: If you go to New York, you must stay at Sheraton hotel. It's near everything! Clothing shops,restaurants,fast foods and also, it's near the famous Time Square, so being at the Sheraton you can visit the big center of New York just walikng down the street. The hotel is amazing. The room is very big and comfortable, and it has a great view so you can see all the city just from the window. But, theres just one thing that's not so good at the Sheraton, the room service is slowly so it's better to ask for something at the reception.Besides all that, the hotel is great,so you won't regret!

Reviews.Title: “Nice to be Back!”
Reviews.Author: tmonahan
Reviews.Content: My family and I returned once again for a short stay at our home away from home in NYC. We get back to the NY area from Asia once a year and always stay at the Sheraton. The location is great and the facilities suit us well, parents and the young ones. This visit brought a nice surprise after so many visits, that I would like to highlight. Driving up to the hotel after a long drive with tired and hungry children was a doorman we had not seen on previous visits. Gary was attentive, caring, pleasant and efficient. It was hot and humid outside but the conditions did not alter his attitude at all. We encountered him a number of times during our short stay and he was always a pleasure, quick with a smile and a hello. Gary is a fine ambassaor for the hotel and the Sheraton brand and would be just one great reason to return to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ahmed in reception was great”
Reviews.Author: LisaCianci
Reviews.Content: When we go to New York, my son loves to stay at a hotel in midtown for the views from the room. When we checked in to the Sheraton Towers on Thursday, Aug. 12, Ahmed asked my son, "What floor do you want to be on?" My 13-year-old replied, "As high as possible!" Ahmed got us on the 47th floor, and my son was absolutely thrilled.

Reviews.Title: “No surprises!”
Reviews.Author: like2travel4fun2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton NY Hotel & Towers the first week of August. From the check in to check out we never had any problem. Our room was fairly clean and somewhat dated but had the basic necessities. There was a modern looking flat screen television but we didn’t really have time to turn it on during the week we were in NYC. The cleaning service was average. One thing that did surprise us a bit was during a few afternoons we had come back to prepare for the evening activities and the cleaning service knocked on the door to “check that the room had been cleaned”. Perhaps it was just our timing but this happened several times on several days and left us wondering if they went in and out of the room frequently. The bathroom seemed fine - neither outstanding or lacking and the room itself was an average guest room. The location was convenient to most of our activities. The lobby area was nice to walk through and there was a gift shop although all we bought were some postcard stamps. I think the walls were a little thin, but fortunately we did not have many noisy people around us.

Reviews.Title: “Quite average (mostly in a good way)”
Reviews.Author: MDJL81
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton NY Hotel & Towers, in one word, is very “average”. Fairly clean, decent service, modest and somewhat dated décor, moderately sized rooms… nothing to ruin your day or otherwise overly disappoint you, but nothing to really surprise you either. Having spent one long weekend here, the hotel served its purpose well and provided us with a fairly comfortable stay in a convenient location. It is worth noting that two of the more redeeming features of the hotel are its price value and location. Given the high cost of most New York hotels, we found the Sheraton offered something approaching reasonable rates. More importantly perhaps, it is situated just outside of central Manhattan, and we found that we were usually within walking distance of almost anywhere we wanted to go, be it 5th Avenue or Times Square. And of course, the subway is not far off either for more distant excursions. At the end of the day, it will do the job and give you a peaceful night’s sleep, albeit with minimal style and largely absent of anything beyond the most basic expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cindy201080
Reviews.Content: My two sisters and I stayed at the Sheraton August 6 - 10, 2010. I can't say anything negative about this hotel. It is in a great location and the staff was very helpful. When we arrived our room smelled of cigarette smoke. I placed a call to the front desk and within 45 minutes they were able to move us to a different room. We were completely satisfied with this. The rooms are a little small but then again we didn't come to NYC to stay in our room. We had a room with 2 double beds and yes the beds were small but it did accomadate 3 people. It is within walking distance to Times Square, Central Park and Rockefellar Center. There is also a subway entrance outside of the hotel. Forget about all the negative remarks. I didn't see anything wrong with this hotel. Other than the smell of smoke in the first room, which is at no fault of the hotel, the rooms were clean. We truely enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great people”
Reviews.Author: EmilQ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last week (first week of August). The location was excellent, right in midtown manhattan with easy access to transportation (several train lines were within a 2 block walk). Within a 5 minute walk, you were at Times Square with all the shopping and sightseeing that entails. Lots of local attractions were a short walk, cab or train ride away (several museums, Rockefeller Center, the Letterman Show, Empire State Building, etc.) as well as several places to eat (Applebee's was delicious!!!) Want to visit Coney Island? Just hop on the D Train (literally 20 seconds from the hotel) and take it all the way to the last stop. Easy! The staff was very courteous and helpful...from the bellhop who helped us unload at the curb, to the reception desk who got us in quickly, to the staff bringing us extra blankets or coming up to unlock a door. The concierge service was great as well. They knew their stuff and explained everything very nicely. The hotel itself was very nice. The lobby was very welcoming and luxurious and our rooms were roomy. We had 2 adults and 6 kids (teens as well as young kids) and everyone was able to get a good nights rest. We had a suite which included a "living room" with a Murphy Bed and a bed room with two double beds. The views from the hotel room were very good, looking up and down 7th Ave. towards Times Square and Central Park. A couple of opportunities were parking and a swimming pool. The parking was not at the hotel. Instead, I had to drive (only about a 30 second drive) to a parking facility around the corner. The rate is for the day and you can't take your car in & out...which was fine by me. Just being able to park somewhere and not have to worry about your vehicle is a great benefit. A pool in the hotel would've been nice as well, but you don't always get it all. I was informed there is a pool in the hotel across the street (owned by the same company), but we were usually too tired by the time we got back to the room to go over there. Overall, I'd rate this hotel a 9 out of 10. Affordable, convenient and clean with good staff and a great location. I'd definitely stay there again next time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service....was treated like family!”
Reviews.Author: sassycj21
Reviews.Content: Recently came to New York on business and the location of this hotel was amazing!!...Love the lobby at times very busy but very up to date especially with the added internet cafe aka Link at Sheraton and free wifi. The staff was sooooo friendly and helped my friends and I find a great place to go out to at night for a few drinks!...the deli across the street has great sandwiches and Ray's Pizza located right next door is open 24 hours and great for a slice of some New York pizza....When you walk out of the hotel Times Square is to your left and there is always something to do down there.....5th ave is about 3 blacks away for all your shopping needs...I just want to stress that the staff was truly amazing and was always there to help and answer any question we had....would def stay there again and again!!

Reviews.Title: “Zoe C. was very helpful”
Reviews.Author: mr_platinum
Reviews.Content: Zoe helped us get upgraded to a suite for our week long stay in the city. She was very friendly, knowledgeable and easy to work with. As a starwood platinum guest, we love this hotel due to it's friendly staff and great location. Scott Draper, UT

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: swimmomjax
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is in a great location, within walking distance to Times Square, Central Park, Rockefellar Center and the Theatre District. Close subway station gets you all over New York and there was always a taxi available. The rooms were neat and clean, and ours had a great view of Cenral Park. Did have a noisy neighbor and was surprised I could hear them as well as I could late into the night. Appreciated the white bedspreads, could see they were spotlessly clean.

Reviews.Title: “An outdated hotel that failed in EVERY discipline”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoButh
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Sheraton Towers hotel because it was close to a business function in town. I assumed because it was a Starwood brand that both quality of product and service level would be well detailed, however, neither was even arguably average. The bathroom had mold all over the ceiling, half the channels didn't work, there isn't WiFi in the rooms and a bedside light didn't work. Worse yet, the carpet wasn't clean. Also, a room attendant came to my door past midnight to ask if I had ordered coffee. There's as much as security issue as there is a service issue with having the wrong room! When I checked out in the morning (3 days ahead of schedule) the front desk clerk didn't even ask why I was leaving. The staff in general is hardly visible (except when they knock on your door past midnight) and the hotel is about as friendly as a pitbull. I would think that if Starwood expected quality assurance levels from the developers of the other 900+ hotels, that they'd lead by example and have a product that performed at every level of guest satisfaction. I wouldn't stay here again - even if the night was free.

Reviews.Title: “Location is fabulous, Housekeeping is less than desirable”
Reviews.Author: tayloryen
Reviews.Content: I would agree with some of the recent reviews - this hotel is in need of major renovations. The bedskirt on the bed had stains (from who knows when - but looked like vomit and had mold growing on it). It took several calls before we got someone to come change the skirt. We had a fridge brought in and it froze all our food and the "engineer" did not believe us, so he set the temperature control which then froze the rest of the food. I know they did not vacuum well, since the cheerios on the carpet left by previous occupants were still on the carpet when we left. I spoke to the Manager who promised to have these issues resolved and provide some "hotel" reward points as accomodations for these issues. He never did call back to ensure things were resolved. By the way, the fitness center costs money! the internet in the room costs money! the use of the fridge costs money! So be sure to ask before you do anything! HOWEVER, the location of the hotel is great! The subway was right around the corner, we could walk to Time Square, Central Park, Rockefeller Center and tons of eating options. We love New York and look forward to returning (perhaps to another hotel until this one is renovated).

Reviews.Title: “Would like to stay again”
Reviews.Author: Kayomarz
Reviews.Content: I must start by really appreciating the prompt response and help I always got from our account director Sharon Kelly Tuck (Thanks again Sharon). When you have all your queries answered before you start your vacation, really helps you start with a relaxed mind. We were upgraded to a club room as we were staying for 12 nights. The room was of a decent size (though not huge as i expected it to be in US) and very clean. The airconditioner seemed to be a pretty old model and I didnt like the automatic charging once you pick up something from the fridge. Gets very difficult when you travel with a small child. The view from my room was nice though again I expected it to be better as we were on the 48th floor. The lobby was very busy but the lifts were well divided between floors and so it was never a hassle to travel by the same. The breakfast was nice with some lovely fresh strawberries. In the evening free snacks were served to the people staying in club rooms which was very nice. Having a seperate lounge for breakfast for club members was again very good as it saved you lots of time in the morning as getting a seat is real difficult as this hotel is very busy at all times of the day. The bathroom also is of a decent size with toileteries provided and hot water at all times. The reason for it being busy at all times is its wonderful location. Just a short walk away from times square, fifth avenue and many other places worth watching, all located at a walking distance and many restaurants also close to the hotel. The things which I would like this hotel to improve are -- 1) internet must be free for all guests 2) The ac needs to be upgraded 3) Remove this system of automatic charging (though we never used the fridge) or have a lock for the fridge. My request for early checkin were considered by Sandeep as he understood we had a long flight with the child and again Sharon helped with the late checkout. Overall I had a nice stay with my wife and son and we would like to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was fabulous! Hotel facility - Not so fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: rjbrunson2
Reviews.Content: The HOTEL STAFF was very accomodating. We changed rooms 2 times to better accomodate our stay and although frustrating, the staff appeared to make all efforts to accomodate myself and disabled father. Special thanks to Margo and Maggie in housekeeping; Raimien (sp) and Rebecca at the front desk and the FedEx team downstairs. They were all very nice to us. THE ROOMS: are TOO SMALL and crowded (even for NY). Only (2) 1/2 sized drawers for (2) people staying 6 nights is a bit "minimum" while the 3rd drawer is stocked with snacks for purchase and the other 1/2 of the dresser hold the alcohol for purchase! How about a place to put one weeks worth of clothes instead. Also, the dresser top was blocked with the large (but nice)TV screen. How about mounting that so guest can the dresser top? In the HANDICAP ROOM the clothes rod was down low in the closet (yes to reach) but the clothes dragged on the floor. A "hook" or 2 higher up as an "option" to accomodate dressess, robes, etc. would be nice. Handicap doesn't necessarily mean you cant stand or that you don't wear full length clothing. THE BATHROOMS -although clean did not accomodate for toiletries in the handicap accessable room. (The standard room did) No reasonable area for sink items like toothpaste, brush, vanity items, etc. except for higher up over the toilet. We had to use the ironing board in front of the wall mirrow as a vanity area. THE BEDS provided the best sleep we'd had in a long time while traveling! We absolutely loved those beds!

Reviews.Title: “This is the place”
Reviews.Author: KIWIBrazil
Reviews.Content: Ask for Brian Coats if he is on duty. Huge help with any issue. He and his staff were great.

Reviews.Title: “wait till the renovations are done before you go here!”
Reviews.Author: theresan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a business trip at this Sheraton property and the experience was sub-par at best. The air-conditioning in the hallways and rooms was not working properly and the temperture this past weekend was between 95 and 100 degrees outside! So we were obviously looking for some relief in our rooms and did not get it. The carpets in the hallways were ripped and frayed. The dust on the mini blinds in the room was horrible, and under the bed was even worse (we dropped the clicker for the tv and had to retreive it). There is a large mirror in the room and it had the same child's fingerprints on it the entire weekend (and we had no children with us)...so obviously the housekeeping leaves a bit to be desired! When I asked about the air conditioning the front desk told me that they were in the middle of a big renovation and they could send a fan to our room. I felt bad for the staff....not their fault, but heard lots of complaints. Would have also liked more dining options since it was sooooo hot and I didn't even want to go outside. We ate in the bar (appetizers) twice and it was average and expensive. I'm a Starwood member, but would not recommend this hotel at this time....wait till the air conditioning is working or wait till the fall to go!

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: Chicagotraveler83
Reviews.Content: This hotel is decent. Rooms are decently sized and clean but walls were quite thin to the point where you can hear noise from surrounding rooms and the hallways - not such a big deal if you're a heavy sleeper. We were there on a very hot day and AC in the room wasn't the best either. Common areas are very nice and newly renovated. Location is good for a Times Square area hotel. For the cost of the room I've stayed in better places in New York City though.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty average business hotel”
Reviews.Author: MsDuneBug
Reviews.Content: Was in NY for a couple of days of business, company booked me here. Guess it was in the corporate travel pricing guidelines - at best. Location is great, everything else is at best average.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay, but a GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: TravSD
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers is in a dynamite location, just down from Times Square, and the hotel itself is just "average" - nothing really bad about the place, but then again, nothing to write home about either. The rooms are small, but that's pretty much a standard for New York City. Housekeeping seemed good, didn't see any cleanliness problems. They have a security guard located at the passage to the hotel elevators, and you are expected to show your key (meaning you're a hotel guest), but more times than not, the guard was busy talking to someone and didn't really take notice of who was walking to the guest elevators - so much for security. The club level breakfast and evening reception was considerably understated from what I have experienced at other Sheratons - and I was shocked when the bartender wanted $10 for a cocktail I ordered (which I had thought was comp as part of the club lounge). Hors d'oeuvres were basic and not all that appetizing, breakfast the next morning wasn't all that great either. Interaction with the staff was OK, everyone seemed to do their job and acknowledge you, but no one really knocked my socks off with a smile or any extra service effort. In short, the stay was just OK - would I come back? Perhaps. There was nothing BAD that would not get me to return, and as I indicated earlier, the location is fantastic. But if I was offered a choice of another place of similar quality in a similar location, I would probably try the other place out - there wasn't enough of a "I've got to go back" factor present at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Consistency and excellence you can count on”
Reviews.Author: howie1229
Reviews.Content: GM Mark Sanders continures to run a terrific property in the heart of NYC not far from Times Sq. and the theater district. Front Office Manager Zoe Cohen personally makes sure that every guest is well looked after, with representatives like Syed manning the front desk. The GM's assistant Ingrid Ordunez even gets into the act, following up on all the details. There's no better place to stay for business or pleasure, and the executive lounge is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Wow... What great service”
Reviews.Author: Bamagal092
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel last minute with my friends to enjoy a week in NYC. The hotel has a beautiful lobby which is ALWAYS active. We were a little nervous at first with all the kids in the lobby, was told there was a dance competition taking place. Check in was smooth, we did not have to wait very long. the room was a little small but clean and had a lot of what you would expect in a hotel room. Starbucks coffee in the room was definitely a bonus. We were lucky enough to meet Kenny the front desk manager on our first night when we went down to report that our AC was not working. He was a delight after chatting with him for a few minutes in the lobby he had someone look at the AC within a few minutes, we were surprised a few minutes later with 2 bottle of wine. He also called us every day of our stay to check on us and make sure that everything was going ok, always assisted us whenever we needed anything. Please ask for Kenny when you visit this hotel and tell him his Alabama gals say hi.

Reviews.Title: “Debbie at front desk was terrific”
Reviews.Author: cgonzale
Reviews.Content: Location was great. A/C in room was a little noisy but otherwise the room was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: tonysharon20
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel on 1st July 2010 for a one week stay. We checked in with Rebecca on reception who was exceptionally helpful and very efficient. Rebecca helped us get a great room on the 47th floor with a fantastic view since we were staying for a week. We were upgraded to Club Experience. This gave us access to the Club Lounge on the 44th floor. This was a brilliant way to start every day with a great breakfast and good views over the city. The staff in the Club Lounge were also extremely friendly and made our stay very welcoming both at breakfast and also in the evenings when you could get hors' douevers and drinks at the bar. No matter what you requested from hotel services, especially Rebecca on reception, the staff were very, very obliging and happy to help. The day before we were due to leave we requested a late check out, 3pm, and this was dealt with without any hassles. This is not our first trip to New York, but it was our first stay at the Sheraton and we would not hesitate in returning or recommending this hotel to anyone. A big thank you and well done to all the staff! Cheers Rebecca!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service....Location”
Reviews.Author: toplesstaco
Reviews.Content: The thrill of New York City and to be able to stay in the center of it all.........Sheraton you have done it, again, provided the consumer with great service, great location, very close to Central Park and Broadway area, Times Square and the subway. Yet we walked and walked... OUTSTANDING service given by Kenny, the front desk manager as well as John the concierge. Rooms, typical NYC, small, very clean with the amenities that you would expect from a hotel of this caliper. Come stay, play and do ENJOY.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Crossroads of the World”
Reviews.Author: impalaragtoplover
Reviews.Content: Very busy hotel, rooms are small but typical for NYC, were always clean. Stayed 5 nights. Close to Times Square, Central Park and Broadway area. We walked everywhere we needed to go, only used taxi with our luggage to and from Penn Station. Second time we have stayed here while attending the NYCDA Dance convention and is the only place I would consider. No internet in room unless you pay extra, but free in lobby. Security on duty in lobby. Lots of food choices close by.

Reviews.Title: “I was prepared to be brutal, but it all worked out”
Reviews.Author: davidmeyer
Reviews.Content: I was prepared to rip the hotel up in my review because my stay started very badly. After a day of rough flights and weather delays I FINALLY got to the hotel five hours late, and was standing in the lobby at 10:10 PM. I was a little concerned about things when it looked like a high school gathering full of screaming and running girls greeted me. But keeping an open mind I made my way to the counter to check in. I waited...and waited...and waited. When I finally got up to the counter twenty minutes later I was told there would be a wait for my room. "Excuse me...I had a reservation, and it is 10:30 PM. How can I possibly have a wait?" The girl at the desk informed me that there was a national dance competition and many of the guests checked out REALLY late, and housekeeping was still catching up. OK...I can understand that, so I let it slide. When I asked how long it would be until I could get my room the girl winced her face and said she'd ask her manager. After another ten minutes I was given a room, along with an apology. Finally in my room at 10:45 I was finally able to relax and melted into my bed...which was amazingly comfortable. OK...things were looking up. The following day I went downstairs to head off to work. The doorman greeted me very nicely and we chatted for a few minutes before I headed off to work. I really like that personal touch. I wish I had his name, but I don't...but that's OK. When I returned that afternoon there was a nice voicemail from Zoe, the Front Desk Manager who was very apologetic about the wait the night before offering to do anything to make up for the previous nights issues. Really, I can't fault the hotel for the overstay of guests, and they did everything they could to get me in to my room in a timely manner. The room itself was very clean, as was the bathroom (though dated.) The work area, TV, bed, etc. were all in excellent condition, and the ironing board and iron looked new (for me, I NEED those to be good.) The lobby, elevators, halls and everything else was quite nice, and all in all, for an older hotel I really ended up enjoying my stay. Zoe's call made the difference, because at least they cared enough to call and offer to make it right. In the past ten years I have spent MANY night away from home, so my hotel reviews tend to be a little more personal. While I normally stay at Marriott or Hilton, this Sheraton property was really quite nice, and I will come back here again. The location...superb. The rooms are comfortable and quiet with very little street noise. The ONLY thing that causes me to give the rooms a 4 out of 5 is because the bathrooms are dated. However, clean is more important to me, and in this economy, I can't expect them to spend money on something that isn't broken if I am being realistic. I would highly recommend this property to anyone, and I am looking forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely way to spend an anniversary”
Reviews.Author: sharonls57
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to spend an day and night in NYC to celebrate our 25th anniversary.The people and the amenities at the Sheraton were wonderful. Most especially Elizabeth Miller. When she found out we were celebrating, she upgraded us to s suite and sent champagne and strawberries to our room. She was friendly, helpful and courteous. Thanks for a lovely day.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay”
Reviews.Author: Bookem_8
Reviews.Content: As an SPG Gold member, I chose this hotel because of its great value and my complimentary upgrade to a Club Room. Extremely busy hotel, entering the lobby felt more like entering Penn St Station rather than a Sheraton hotel. The lobby bar/restaurant where we were hoping to grab lunch was jam packed full of businessmen/women, so that was a no go. What about paying hotel guests ? After some "discussions" with reception, I was eventually given my comp upgrade to a club room. I was very relieved to get a club room, because it was TINY ! Hate to think how big a standard room would be. The bathroom was so small, you struggled to dry yourself down after a shower without hitting the door ! Concierge closed at 10pm. Whats that all about ? I needed to find a pharmacy at 11pm because my wife had a migraine, waited at the concierge for ages, before a cleaner told me it closed at 10pm. A sign would have been helpful. I then had to queue at reception behind a 747 load of Air China cabin crew before someone could tell me where a pharmacy was. Location wise, you cannot beat it, if you want to be in the heart of Midtown. Stage Deli across the road is the best in NYC. All in all, the hotel served a purpose, of wanting to be in Midtown, and it was great value compared to other hotels in the vicinity, but the tiny rooms and overcrowded public areas would make me think twice about booking again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but needs a makeover”
Reviews.Author: alandubo
Reviews.Content: We booked a king room for a one night stay in the city. We've stayed at pretty much all the other Starwood properties in NYC, including the old Sheraton across from this one (now called something else).
