First impressions here are good - perfect location just north of Times Square. Lobby was permanently full and buzzing with activity - it did look like a lot of high school age kids, who were noisy, but not overly so. The room was just okay - starting to look dated and in need of a makeover. As with most NYC hotels it was cramped and hot. This room didn't even have a thermostat control, just an air flow on the A/C unit. It never got very cold, which for us is not a good thing since we like it cold. The blinds on the window did little to block any sunshine. Bathroom was very small, but at least clean. As always you can count on a comfortable bed and a new, flat screen TV. Overall, if you're looking for a good location, this is it. But it needs a new coat of paint, and more, to keep up.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with a bus station feeling”
Reviews.Author: grovebr
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I stayed at this hotel because I bid on Priceline for a 4 stars hotel in Manhattan for US$120 and they booked at this Sheraton. Good, but not a 4 star hotel. Busy lobby, and I mean, BUSY! Took me 45 minutes to check-in. Small room but with everything we needed. Comfortable beds and quiet. They charge US$10 per day to use the fitness center, US$15 for the internet in the room (free at the bus station, I mean, lobby). Great location for major touristic attractions in Manhattan. If you have an option, the Hilton New York, a block away, is much better for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Country mice visit the City and are treated like the big cheeses"”
Reviews.Author: lawyerpat
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out, our experience at this lovely hotel was ten stars. (Can you have that many??). From housekeepers to clerks to waitresses, and concierges, everyone was helpful, polite and very friendly. Our room was lovely and clean and comfortable and the views were spectacular. (certainly differennt than Mt. Katahdin which we see every day!!).....And we loved NYC!! We enjoyed wonderful restaurants and saw two Broadway shows and hopped on and off the $44 bus tour all day long--T his was all recommended by the Sheraton folks and all out experieces were memorable....Stay at the Sheraton and I hope your stay is as great as ours was... you won't be disappointed. We can't wait to return!! Hope to see you there!!

Reviews.Title: “Very, very poor experience”
Reviews.Author: dpremodc
Reviews.Content: Not one good thing to say - I am an SPG gold member, tried to check in an hour early, was curtly told to come back after 3, can appreciate that (although they could have been more polite). When I returned after 3 to check in they didn't have the two beds I had requested but insisted I had requested one queen bed. They do a sneaky sales job when you check in as well - trying to make it sound like breakfast is included, I wasn't the only one who got this impression. My SPG Gold upgraded room was smaller than anyone else in my group who had standard rooms - there wasn't even one drawer in the room to put things away, not even a desk drawer. The carpets must have been recently cleaned as they were still very wet. I was on a floor full of kids. The elevators didn't work properly and the selected buttons would go off part way up and all of a sudden you would be headed back to the lobby again - it would take 2 to 3 tries on very crowded elevators to get it to work. I often had to stand in lines to get up. I really can't say anything good about this hotel except for the fact I was glad to leave and head home. I visited a friend staying at the Four Points by Sheraton in Chelsea - it was much nicer, cheaper and a nicer staff.

Reviews.Title: “Best service in the City!”
Reviews.Author: gregandpatty
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at this hotel. The reason we decided to come back for this trip was the fantastic customer service that we received during our first stay back in September, 2009. Even though the city was very crowded due to the fourth of July weekend, the customer service never waivered. In Particular, our food and beverage server "Ernesto" went out of his way not once, but everytime we encountered him in the Hudson Market dining room. This kind of service should not go unrecognized. In fact we were made to feel so "at home" that my Wife just booked another stay at the Sheraton NY for the Christmas Holidays. Looking forward to it. Signed, Greg and Patty K. West Palm Beach, Florida

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: Jeterslove
Reviews.Content: For the most part, our stay was excellent. The location of the hotel is perfect-close enough to Times Square to easily walk, with a subway entrance right outside the hotel. Room was small, but all NY hotel rooms are. We had a great 42" flat screen TV, comfy bed. The bathroom smelled a little, and I think it was because the sink and tub did not drain very well at all. Staff was very helpful, and most polite. Definitely will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Time for this tired hotel to be made over”
Reviews.Author: galileocan
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the good news. The hotel's location can't be beat. Right in the heart of Manhattan, pretty much near everything you need to get to in New York City. The staff are pleasant and accommodating where they can be. There is free wireless internet that's available in the lobby. I'm afraid however, that's about where the good news ends. the hotel is very busy and crowded. Don't expect a refined clientelle here. They're usually school groups and a lot of partiers. Very noisy no matter where you are. This hotel has seen better days. I was given a club room on the 46th floor. Tired carpet, scuffs, stains, etc. The room itself is a bit cramped. I had a room with two beds. Don't think that two beds is big enough for two people in a bed. While you can do it, don't expect to get a good night's sleep. It's tight. The room itself is very small. Just not comfortable. The hotel is rated as a 4 star on most internet hotel sites. This simply is just not right. I would categorize this hotel as either a strong 3 star or 3 1/2 star. Definitely not more. Once this hotel gets a makeover, it can reclaim its 4 star ranking once again. It has potential - its just more than seen its day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: ssssfb
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while attending a conference. My husband and infant accompanied me. I was nervous due to some reviews here. We were pleasantly surprised and pleased with our stay. We checked in just before 3 and our room was ready. The room was clean, with the exception of a stained handtowel in the bathroom and it frankly wasn't a big deal. The staff was very pleasant. We used concierge services and had a good experience. This hotel does need to replace carpet as it is obviously worn, but it was clean. Our room was big by NYC standards. We were offered a crib for our baby but we had brought a Peapod travel tent so he slept in that. The bed was very comfortable and we had no problem with slamming doors or noise from the hall. Great view, fantastic location. The lobby is nice and the elevators are fast. We'd stay here again. Just a note - you can use the pool at the Manhattan across the street with your room key from the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton New York Towers- Good but not a 4*”
Reviews.Author: beach08
Reviews.Content: Let me first start by saying this hotel is not as bad as many make it to be, but in reality it most certainly is not worthy of a 4* rating, at best 3*. I travel quite often and stay at 4*'s most of the time....so I'm not sure why Priceline gives this a 4* star rating-so just be aware if your expecting all the standards of a 4* star! Ok with the good lobby very nice. staff wonderful, location great... now let's move onto to the elevators...slow...slow...slow.. Halls- carpet stained and bunch up in many spots, Now onto the rooms our room was fine and was clean but difinitely a worn and stained carpet, no real control over air...you could turn on but then it got to cold...could not control actual temp- so we would turn on when going out for the day and plenty cool when coming back to room for night, we had king bed...very comfy, small bath, walls are thin was woke each night at least 2 to 3 times just briefly though. All in all for the right price I would stay again but difinitely would be a nicer hotel.. NEEDS REHAB!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Average Hotel - Not 4 Stars”
Reviews.Author: Cwb_10
Reviews.Content: This property is all about location. Walk to Times Square, Walk to Rockefeller Center, Walk to Central Park, Walk to Fifth Avenue. That's about it on the positives. In terms of style, the rooms seem to have been renovated within the past 5-10 years. But you would guess it's been much longer based on the wear and tear. It seems that the hotel is poorly-maintained and not kept up as well as it should. The staff didn't make you feel welcome and didn't seem to care. The hotel is certainly not worthy of 4 stars. It's 3.5 stars at best and probably closer to 3. Luckily, by using priceline, I paid less than half the asking rate. I cannot imagine paying $250/night for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything!”
Reviews.Author: yogagirl
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay here because the Westin at Times Square was booked solid. Although they are owned by the same parent company, Starwood, it seems like Westin has a higher standard for everything else. My stay here was pleasant. We got there early (around 10am) and asked for an early check in. They couldn't guarantee it so my husband and I used the shower facilities at the gym to freshen up and be able to start walking around NYC. As soon as we were about to leave, I got a call that my room was ready... at noon. The beds were extremely comfortable, the elevators were fast. The free WIFI, however, works only in the lobby. If location matters to you a lot, then this hotel is it. 4blocks to Central Park, 2 to 5th Ave, 3 to Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lil_londoner88
Reviews.Content: I don't have a bad word to say about this hotel! Booked it as a package with Virgin Holidays to stay for 4 nights, so got a reasonable deal - although I thought this would mean we'd get a rather small room. Our room was on the 26th Floor and was of a reasonably large size compared to the previous hotel I stayed at in NYC. King Size bed, desk & chair, full working air con, coffee making facilities & Starbucks coffee, and plenty of room to move about (and store shopping!). Bed was extremely comfortable, shower was hot - fulfilled everything I wanted from the hotel. Brilliant location - you can see Times Square and Central Park as soon as you step out the front of the hotel. Because of the location, I barely had to get any taxi's and theres plenty of subway stations near by. Staff at the hotel were brilliant, really friendly and helpful - especially on the concierge desk. Definately recommend this hotel and would love to stay there again on my next visit to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER STAY HERE, YOU WILL NOT SLEEP!!!!”
Reviews.Author: EmilyDenver_Colorado
Reviews.Content: This our 4th night here, and haven't been able to sleep past 8am any day, or sleep before 12pm, nor have I been able to take a nap due to construction in the room next door, loud guests (on a Monday and Tuesday night around 3am high schoolers are running around the halls), and cleaning professionals screaming at each other at all times off the day and night. Have asked front desk on multiple occasions to speak to all loud persons involved, but am embarrased for my clients, and can't wait to get home to get some sleep!!

Reviews.Title: “The staff at the hotel was very polite...”
Reviews.Author: rbvny
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel was very polite and considerate, from check in to check out. The hotel was very clean. A very busy hotel that the staff made us feel at home. A perfect location to see New York.

Reviews.Title: “Oustanding Service”
Reviews.Author: andy_miles
Reviews.Content: To say I was a little worried with the earlier negative reports on here would be an understatement. Right up to a couple of days befor we left home, I was considering moving to another hotel. All the worries came to nothing as soon as we checked in. Everyone was professional and we were soon into our room. The room was very nice, clean and cool, (so the air con was working). We quickly unpacked and then my wife noticed some chewing gum on the carpet. I called the desk and she asked if we wanted to move rooms. We declined and she said someone would come and sort it for us. We went out for a walk and when we returned 3 hours later the gum was still there. I called the desk and she was shocked that no one had been. She immediately arranged for us to be moved to a Club room on the 50th floor. It was fantastic, with a view to die for , straight down into Times Square. This hotel far exceeded our expectations, it was clean, quiet and we got some of the best service that we have ever had anywhere. We know where we will be staying should we go back to New York.

Reviews.Title: “I stay at this hotel several times a year...”
Reviews.Author: RVKWestchester_NY
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel several times a year and have never had a bad experience. I recommend this hotel without reservation. The staff is helpful and friendly. I am platinum Starwood member and have stayed at many hotels and this is one of the best!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Murrayj
Reviews.Content: Walk out the front doors, look to left and see Times Square and to the right , Central Park. The theaters are all around you. Right behind the hotel is Radio City Music Hall and one more block is Rockefeller Center. Hotel is nice, understated but elegant. The rooms were clean. Not the most comfortable mattress, especially for a Sheraton. They usually have great beds. We could see the Hudson River and Radio City Music Hall from our room. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! Wonderful Experience!!! Great Hotel and great service”
Reviews.Author: kpadier
Reviews.Content: It was a blessing to actually have great customer service in the city! The staff at the Sheraton was absolutely amazing. Everyone was genuine and ready to help. We asked for a roll out bed, and they were suppose to charge $30. a night, but comped it for us, and when the guy brought the bed up, he noticed that it was hot in the room, and asked us if we wanted a fan! The fan really helped, because it was hot and stuffy, but not bad with the fan.. it's an older building so I guess the air doesn't work so well.. But I was comfortable. Everyone I had communication with at this hotel was extremely helpful. I highly reccommend it to anyone. It's very close to all the Broadway Shows, great restaurants. The Gray Line Double Decker buses are the best bet, right out the door... we paid like $109 a piece for 3 days of hop on hop off service and that included 3 attractions of our choice and free tickets to the Sky Ride at the Empire State Building (which is not worth it, thank goodness we didn't pay for that) I don't reccommend that. The lobby tends to get busy, but it's fun to sit and people watch for a little bit. But for the service alone, I would stay there in a heartbeat! Thank you to Sheraton and your staff.. you helped make our trip very enjoyable. Kris P ~ San Antonio, TX

Reviews.Title: “Four night stay--so I saw pretty much everything...”
Reviews.Author: jimmyk64
Reviews.Content: I like this Sheraton, that's the bottom line. Second stay here in two years. I'd return in a New York Minute if our travels brought us back to Manhattan. As others have posted, the public areas of this hotel are chaotic from about 7 AM to 2 AM. But that won't have an effect on your room accomodations, your privacy or your sleep. Our room, 1846, was "compact" but provided all desired amenities. And it was kept meticulously clean by the housekeeping staff. It was quiet and serene all of our times spent in it. I found the Concierge Desk very helpful. I had google directions for subway travel to many Manhattan sites, and a couple in Brooklyn. The hotel Concierge corrected every one of them with better directions. But finally...we had a telling experience with the housekeeping staff: the ice machine on our floor worked very sloooowly. This frustrated my wife. On one evening, the machine was unwilling to give up any ice cubes willingly, and she mentioned this to a passing housekeeper. He took the ice bucket from her hands and sprinted by stairway, to another floor to fill it. To us, that was service staff involvement.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location but not much else..........”
Reviews.Author: bearsden2
Reviews.Content: If being within easy walking distance of Central Park & Times Square is you priority, then this is the place for you, but beware if you are the discerning traveller or an allergy sufferer. This is a crowded often chaotic hotel who's lobby is so busy would rival a bus terminal at 5.00pm. It's main lounge is left of the main doors, with an internet area at its entrance, so no quiet drinks there. An error in room bookings for us was swiftly rectified in a plesant and professional manner. And then to the rooms........bring a torch is my advice, I'v never stayed in such a dark room, even with all the lamps on. It's dark brown woodwork only adds to this feeling of darkness. The aircon may as well have not been on it's so weak, and with 90 degrees of heat outside it made for a very stuffy room. And then there were the windows, they were filthy, hadn't been washed for some time and the wooden blinds had several months of dust on them from top to bottom as previous posters have indicated. Sheraton get your act together with this, its not acceptable. So if location is your priority and you are allergy free it might be for you, otherwise NYC has many many many better hotels

Reviews.Title: “Could be better but location helps”
Reviews.Author: SueySingapore
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Preferred Guest floor. Which was good in the sense that it gave access to the club lounge. Rooms were decent size. I had one with 2 double beds Bathrooms seem to have been done up...better than my last stay here a few years back. Room however was very dusty, very visible on table tops and the window ledges. Never wiped during my 4 night stay! Some positives large flat screen tv with many channels, there is also a cafe and free internet access on the ground floor. and location with easy access to 5th Ave, Broadway, Times Square. Overall perhaps the location and pricing helps and business is good (many big groups) so they don't bother to fix the small stuff which could boost ratings of the hotel further.

Reviews.Title: “The place was dirty and smelly.”
Reviews.Author: Alberschwende
Reviews.Content: I do not expect much for around $200.00 a night in New York but I thought that I would be getting reasonably clean rooms. I was totally embarrased when I saw the rooms. There was the bad odor, the dirty carpet and the blinds which were damaged and hanging loapsided. It felt like the rooms had been neglected for years. The lobby looked fine and the location was, of course, excellent.

Reviews.Title: “not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: cavemanlawyer
Reviews.Content: this hotel must have a lot of turnover because the room condition and cleanliness was poor, air conditioner did not work and everything costs extra.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Worst Hotels I stayed in”
Reviews.Author: NeoOne71
Reviews.Content: This is at best one of the worst hotels I have stayed in in New York. The rooms are old and are not clean, dust was everwhere, the carpets throughout the hotel is old and dingy. The rooms are smaller than rooms in Europe. You could here everything in your room from the guest next do going to the bathroom to people walking up and down the halls. Its a great location but I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Ordinary Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ozdunkeroo
Reviews.Content: This is one of the few times that I have to book a hotel without the chance to check up on review. You expect that the Sheraton especially in New York should be a decent hotel, however it is not. What is quite interesting about all the reviews for this property is that most of the better reviews are from contributors who are making their 1st or 2nd post. Whilst the more detailed negative reviews are from more regular contributors. I travel internationally 2-3 months per year, staying at all styles and levels of accommodation. I am a starwood gold member and have previous worked in the travel industry. I stayed on the Preferred Guests floor. The location of the hotel is great. The rooms are small, walls paper-thin. The front desk staff was quite rude, and then gave me the wrong room type. The room was dusty, the bathroom had hair in the tub, paper left in the basin. The airconditioning barely works. The desk lamp was broken, office chair should have been thrown out, the blinds didnt work properly, the bed head was broken. Half the minibar items with dates, were 6 months out of date. Even in the lifts there was a sign that was old and half falling off. I even rang the GM to give him the opportunity to come and see my room and however he was in a meeting and my message was never responded to. There are several other recent reviews similiar to mine. They are all accurate.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldnt stay here again, not 4 star, great location”
Reviews.Author: andeegoofy
Reviews.Content: I stayed two years ago 2 blocks away at "Hilton New York" , rated as a 3.5 star hotel, and we hoped to save a few dollars a night because this Four star Sheraton were having a deal. Itt was FAR FAR superior to this rated 4 star hotel. 4 stars for this hotel is laughable, I'd be nice to call it 3, but I've stayed in some 2 that were close. I'm fine with funky dated decor, but not old and dirty. Carpets make you trip because they're buckled, it's bad. We had a fabulous location, and were excited to get to our rooms. We had booked and prepaid for 2 rooms. Prepay, get a "special" at $240 a night, big mistake. Prepay means no refund, and no desire to give you good service should you have a concern or complaint. Our main complaint, we had 3 people staying in one of the rooms. None of which were dating or married to each other, and 2 double sized beds (hotel claimed not to have any queens available even though we booked on the Hotels own website 6 months in advanced and requested as such, and the whole hotel had no King beds at all. We couldnt even order up a roll-away bed because the room was way way too small. Upon requesting to change rooms, we were denied, with No apology. There was no accomodation for their room size being too small, no refund, tough patootie. There was merely walking space around the two double beds, and that is being gracious. The walls were super thin, and I dont mean if the neighbors got loud, I mean I could hear them having normal un-animated conversation well past midnight. I could hear their showers start, I could tell you what their conversation was about! It was shockingly bad how not-sound-proof this place was. There were no fans in the bathroom at all. So, you get in, you shower, it gets hot, too darn bad. Cant open the door to cool off cause you're in a room with non-relatives. LOL ALL of the food in the mini-bar refridgerator and food drawer were outdated by several months. Also, the fridge was completely stashed with this outdated food, there wasnt a single space for you to bring back leftovers or even stash your own water bottle. The large screen tv were nice. The gym looked nice. The location is perfectly ideal for the theater lover, couldnt be closer, Times Square is in your backyard, and nicely walking distance and centrally loacted to Central Park, 5th Avenue and great subway intersections. I'd definitely search this neighborhood again for another hotel, even the 3 star Sheraton Manhattan looked superior, and friends that stayed there liked it better. I'm heading back to the Hilton. I'd stay here if I was desperate and only had 2 people to one room. In NY though, you're never THAT desperate.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby and Unsecure”
Reviews.Author: pauditore
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel in less than a month and I have to say it needs a major overhaul all the way from the rooms down to the bell desk. What was most scary about this place was the overall lack of security especially at 1-2am when no security people were at the elevator entry areas. I did really like the club level and the breakfast is fun and coffee nice along with the overall environment. The bar at the club was missing the martini stirrer and didn't have absolute vodka, a women next to said its always like that here. But lets start at the beginning, we arrive late its 85 degrees and humid as we enter our stuffy room on the floor twenty and the air conditioner doesn't work. I call down to the desk and they say they will send up maintenance, thirty minutes pass no one arrives. We pack up our stuff and head down to the front desk this time pissed off. We ask for another room and I complain about the room assignment, the front desk attendant says "what do you expect me to check out every room to see if the air conditioner works?" I ask for a manager and he is even ruder, and guess what I am a ten year starwood member and our company recommends this hotel, I remind him of that they don't care. But they assign me a room above the club level, make sense? I don't think so the next day I ask for the day manager, Zoe Cohen and she is nice and gives me 12,000 starwood points. Two days later it is raining and we attempt to go out for dinner, the cab line is long and the bell captain is no where to be found, so I jump the line and get my own cab. The next morning we leave at 5:45 am and guess what there is no bell person to help with anything. What is up with this? Overall a great location, and it is unfortunate that all our European visitors are treated to the same level of poor service. I noticed many Italians during my two visits. The good news is our maid service was very good, but I don't think I will stay here again, because as a Starwood member I expected my room to be ready at 1AM. On my previous visit my colleagues room wasn't ready either and we checked at 6:30PM.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Jesterson24
Reviews.Content: Just come back from honeymoon where we stayed at this hotel for an entire week. The room was great, the staff were very friendly, and extremely helpful (when we had problems with tickets we booked externally through first choice). The hotel is ideally located between Central Park, Broadway and Time Square, depending where your room is. We had a superb view of time square! You don't generally hear much from inside your room, but outside the hotel front, it's absolutely mental with people and touts... After a few days we used the side entrance which is much quieter. We didn't use the hotel for food as there are plenty of restaurants in the local area, with cheaper alternatives towards 8th, 9th and 10th. Plus 5th avenue a short distance for all you shopaholics. We'd return to this hotel again definately. At a push - the only negative thing we can think of is that there is no kettle in the room, us Brits love normal tea and guest services only appear to provide Earl Grey which is well, Eurgh.. They do star bucks coffee though, so don't panic!

Reviews.Title: “Doing something a little extra!”
Reviews.Author: Karma3811
Reviews.Content: Since I have personally stayed at the Sheraton Towers before, I felt very comfortable booking a room for my daughter and friend. I wanted to make it a special evening as they were seeing a friend in a Broadway show. I contacted the Sheraton, via email, and asked if it was possible to request a room with a view? The Sheraton responded with a lovely room on the 39th floor with a great view of Manhattan. Thanks Sheraton. You've got my business the next time we're back in the city! A special thank you to Felicia at Sheraton for making it all happen and responding so quickly to my email.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel dated, but check mini-bar items - most are actually out of date!”
Reviews.Author: Chrissie93
Reviews.Content: The hotel was quite smart and ideally located for Central Park and Broadway. Our room was adequate. The tea/coffee making facilities were obviously for coffee lovers (which I don't drink) but don't expect English Breakfast Tea-bags with this as they only had Earl Grey or Wild Sweet Orange "Herbal Infusion" tea bags! I requested English Breakfast Tea-bags and they made a note of this but these never appeared. They only provided one small packet of "creamer" with each coffee or teabag, which tasted ghastly! The breakfast was expensive, but for a treat, well worth it - there was so much of everything, from fresh fruits, cereals, porridge, yoghurts, meats and cheeses, to bacon, eggs and sausages. They even had yoghurt coated raisins and mousses and smoothies that you could help yourself to. The Fitness Centre was, according to our sons, the best they'd ever been to. It cost $20 per person for the whole week, so it didn't break the bank. They used it every day. Apparently, we were allowed the use of a swimming pool at another hotel nearby. One day we started eating some dried fruit & nuts from the mini-bar and they tasted odd. On checking the pack we found it to be months out of date and we complained to the Manager. He was very apologetic and gave us a voucher for 4 free drinks at the bar. I thought this would be the end to it, but the following evening we also had some chocolate from the mini-bar and began eating it. Again it tasted funny and this also was months out of date! I couldn't believe this would happen again, as we'd only just complained the day before and I presumed someone would have checked our mini-bar to ensure this wouldn't re-occur. We checked the rest of the items in the fridge and drawer and so did our two sons who were in a different room - most of the items in both mini-bars were out of date! The Manager again apologised and stated that the stocking of the mini-bars was run by a separate company. This should not be an excuse because at the end of the day it's the responsibility of the Sheraton to see that everything is of top quality and in date. Having said all this, we loved the location of the hotel and we loved New York. I'm sure we'll go back again but I think we'll try a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Melissa_A_Davis
Reviews.Content: After staying at two other hotels for business in NYC I was so thankful I was able to arrange to stay at Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers for my remaining weeks of travel to NYC. Many people don't think the size or amentities of a New York hotel matter that much as you will be out seeing the city most of the time, but as a business traveler, they matter a great deal to me. Every room I stayed in at Sheraton New York was outstanding! From the spacious size room, super comfortable room, personal touches such as a bathrobe and vanity items. When i stayed for 4 weeks straight I was given extra hangers to accommodate all my clothes. Having a gym on site for working out stress after a long day of work and some personal sight seeing was great. Sheraton New York is very centrally located, just blocks from Central Park, Rockefeller Center and Times Square. The staff were always very helpful, courteous and took care of me very well. When my flight home after my 4 week stay was cancelled due to weather, they got me a room at a moments notice and were the only bright spot in an otherwise troublesome day. My co-worker loved her stay as well and decided that the small boutique hotels could not compare to all you get with Sheraton. Those that came a visitied me during my stay were greatly impressed and found the room to be very relaxing and welcoming after a long day of seeing the city. Sheraton New York is the only hotel I will stay in on future trips and I highly reccommend it to my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: LouWilk
Reviews.Content: We had a room on the 7th floor which was pretty big so I'm not sure if certain floors have smaller rooms but I was very pleasantly surprised how spacious our room was. It was cleaned daily and was spotless and the decor/furnishings were really nice. The bed was huge and very very comfortable. The location is really fantastic to the left Times Square to the right Central Park. Reception staff slightly abrupt but concierge/cleaners etc were very friendly. All in all great hotel and would definately stat here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, solid New York hotel”
Reviews.Author: SimLucas
Reviews.Content: The Midtown location is fantastic - really close to all the major attractions and if you are only staying in New York a few days, its definitely the best place to stay. The rooms were relatively small, but that seems to be the norm in New York. The concierge desk was the best part of this hotel - recommending and booking restaurants, recommending tickets and shows, it really made the stay stress free. We stayed 10 nights at the hotel and while its nothing too flashy its comfortable and convenient. Two slight downfalls of the hotel were the somewhat questionable bar service (and the fact you dont need to provide any identification when billing drinks to your room) and the other is mysterious costs appeared on our credit card, however while removed on enquiry, no explanation was provided.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: meerkatpr
Reviews.Content: Just got back from four nights in New York, staying at the Sheraton Towers Hotel. Was extremely worried having read reviews saying how bad the rooms were. Well, our experience was that it is a busy hotel but that gives it atmosphere and the rooms and bathrooms were clean and to the usual Sheraton standard. I dont think the bedroom floor was hoovered every day but the bathroom was a good standard , clean towels every day and the beds very comfortable. Dont worry about other reviews. We would definitely stay there again as the location was fab.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, nothing extra.”
Reviews.Author: Brian_C11111
Reviews.Content: I had a nice stay here. The room was clean, the decor was not new, but it was not run down either. The service was fine. The only issue I have is the lack of amenities that come with the room. You basically get nothing but your room.

Reviews.Title: “Positive Experience”
Reviews.Author: PossumJr
Reviews.Content: Great location, staff and room size. Book through Travelocity and you may get free breakfast thrown in.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shame about the condition of the hotel itself.”
Reviews.Author: jaynne2001
Reviews.Content: We were visiting NYC to join the a cruise to Bermuda on a Sunday. We arrived on Thursday and checked out Sunday morning. First of all, I would like to begin by saying that this hotel's location is absolutely perfect, Times Square is a couple of blocks away, 5th Avenue for shopping is only a short walk away as is Central Park. The location is perfect for first time or repeat visitors who want to be right in the middle of the action. With that said, I have stayed at many other Starwood properties, including Sheraton, and the hotel itself was a little disappointing. First of all, minus the lobby, which is quite nice and clean and spacious, the rest of the hotel is tired-looking and dated. The rooms are quite small when compared to their other Sheraton properties. The carpet certainly looked tired and worn and in need of replacing. The room and bathroom were clean and kept that way for our stay. Our first night was on the 45th floor, Club Level, and we quickly realized that the walls were paper thin. No joke. We had rambunctious neighbours, who had loud music playing to the point where I could hear the words and we could hear their (loud) conversation. After a long day of traveling, this was unacceptable. After a call to the front desk, security paid them a visit and they kept relatively quiet. Some hours later we were woken up with the loud music and loud voices once again. Another call to security, but they merely turned down the music a little and kept with their loud conversations. My dealings with security were very pleasant, they were apologetic and did show up at the room within 15 minutes. The next day we inquired and found out they weren't checking out for 3 more days, so we requested a room change. The staff was quite accommodating and apologetic and moved us to the 50th floor, still Club Level. Our room was the same, seemed to be a little smaller, but it was blissfully quiet, so we didn't mind. We ate breakfast the first morning in the Club Lounge on the 44th floor. They had an OK spread of bagels, toast, yogurt, fruit, Starbucks tea and coffee etc. It was a continental-type breakfast spread. Again, I have stayed at other Sheraton properties in the US and they have had a much larger spread, including bacon, eggs, sausage etc. It served the purpose for us that day and the staff were very friendly and helpful. We only wish that this had been open on the weekends as it would have been nice to have breakfast before leaving the hotel and it would have saved us some money. I had another room booked for Saturday night only for a guest that was joining us. I was out for the day on Saturday and got back around 4, went to check in the second room and, of course, with the hotel being booked up, there were limited King rooms avail. The first I was given on the 30th-odd floor absolutely reeked of cigarette smoke. This being a smoke-free hotel and the fact that I suffer from smoke sensitivities, made this unacceptable. I went back to the reception and requested another room, this time we were given an accessible room, therefore it was quite large and located on a quiet floor. No noise issues. Having to run around, change rooms multiple times, unpack and repack made this visit somewhat stressful and less enjoyable. With that said, every staff member I encountered at the hotel was wonderful, very apologetic and helpful. If you are looking for a hotel in the center of NYC, in the heart of the action, then this may be a choice for you.

Reviews.Title: “Never Would Stay There Again”
Reviews.Author: 2007Corvette18
Reviews.Content: I requested early checkin three times before we arrived, the latest request being the day before. When we arrived we were told that there were no rooms available until 3:00 PM. The clerk was surly and didn't give a darn that we had no place to stay. There was no manager available and was told there would not be one for a half hour to come. We waited the half hour and again asked to speak to a manager. We were told that the manager was busy and would see us later. After 45 minutes and several requests, we got to speak to an assistant manager. He said there were no rooms available and would call us if one became available. Later that day we finally got a room. The room was tiny, the carpet was dirty and two of the three window blinds did not work and two lights did not work. We were told that window blinds were on order and to leave the blinds down. The bath tub drain was clogged. The heater/air conditoner was under the window and dated back to the early 1980s. It did not keep the room cool. I would not stay at that hotel again even if it were free. If I had not paid a month in advance (no return) for the room, I would have gone to another hotel. The people and the facilities were not good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: simplyread
Reviews.Content: Really well situated for main tourist spots and the hop on hop off tour buses. Very comfortable bed and pillows. Room always clean and plenty of towels which were changed as often as we wanted. I always travel with my hair dryer but didn't need it, the hotel provided one that actually dried my hair just as well as mine. Despite it's size you don't feel it's unfriendly or unwelcoming, very happy all round..thank you.

Reviews.Title: “ok busy hotel but can be very noisy”
Reviews.Author: suz19
Reviews.Content: Hi we spent a few days at this hotel it was ok wouldnt say it was the best hotel ever stayed in. Location wise excellent between times square and central park....and not the view of central park as we were promised by our travel agent. First Choice Caerphilly but that is another matter not recommended. In the room we were in we could constantly here either lifts or subway and we were on the 14th floor! one night we had to call security because the noise from a couple of rooms woke us up early in the am. This hotel has lots of schools staying there so be prepared for no access to wifi and lots of noise!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: Leslie92708
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out and beyond, the hotel staff helped make our trip a memorable one! Although our room was not available at the time of check-in, the front desk clerk was able to reassign us to a higher-floor room (which we requested) immediately.... and it was on a Club Floor, too! The waiter in the Club Lounge for breakfast was also notably friendly and welcoming... great start to our day! On a separate occasion, another waiter noticed me having an impromptu meeting with an artist/client in a side area of the lobby and brought us a little cup of mixed nuts... a small, but thoughtful gesture! Upon check-out, we had a question on our bill and again, the front desk clerk took care of the charges without hassle....(I hate hassle!) And, lastly, but definitely not least: I realized on the way to the airport that I had left my cell phone and charger plugged into the wall in our room! Sal, from the Security Department, was really great in reassuring me that my phone would be returned to me via FedEx within the next day or so.... And sure enough, it arrived intact just today! Perhaps one could argue that none of these individual instances of customer service would be something to write home about; however, altogether, it really made us feel welcome and well taken care of! We really appreciate the service of the staff and will definitely be staying at your hotel the next time we visit NY!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: TarHeelBiggy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed a very pleasant stay here in every way. Outstanding location, clean room, very helpful and courteous staff. No disappointments in any way. Easy walking distance to all Broadway theaters, excellent restaurants and delis, and many attractions in NYC. We were very pleased in every aspect of our visit and on our next trip to New York, this is the place we'll stay

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as many are making it out to be...”
Reviews.Author: gabsma
Reviews.Content: Okay, so hotel is huge and rooms are small, but it's New York! We got an amazing deal (booked flight and hotel together and practically got the hotel for free), so we can't really complain. Plus the whole cast of Survivor were staying there the same weekend, so that was a big plus for us (haha - we're big fans)! LOCATION is great! First time we stayed so close to all the action in Times Square and we absolutely loved it! ROOMS were clean and nice. We got a double room, and it was an okay size for two people, but it would have been very tight for more than two. And maybe the double rooms are larger than the single large bed rooms, but we had nothing to complain. We had originally booked a single room, but we were told by staff that booking depends on availability... We also brought our sound machine, which was very useful! Bring it if you have one... or earplugs... it is the City! TIP : USE SAFE BOX IN ROOM!! I had left my iPod touch on the desk in our room, and came back to see it was missing. I filled out a security report just before checking out, and the hotel called me a few hours later to let me know they had found my iPod in the Lobby. Don't really believe them, but I didn't care, I just wanted my iPod back... They shipped it the next day via FedEX express. So maybe I dropped it somewhere, or maybe someone did take it from my room, but all that matters is that they were very efficient in getting me back my iPod! But just to be sure, lock everything valuable in the safe (even if you put the "do not disturb" sign on the door - which is what we did) I'd recommed this hotel to anyone who wants to be close to Times Square and shows and everything, and who doesn't expect everything to be perfect, and if you're getting a good deal... Maybe my review would have been a bit different if I would have paid 300$ per night!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: furmi
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Big Apple and stayed at the Sheraton New York and Towers in Time Square. Perfect location in the heart of Manhatten and a few minutes walk from Central Park. Rooms were clean and very comfortable. The Pillows on the bed are to die for! I'd definately stay here again, great value for money and the staff are friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Well, if you must....”
Reviews.Author: ArthurMF
Reviews.Content: Stayed here May 14 for 3 nights. Bill, as part of special rate, was $900 with no extras at all. We were part of the Survivor finale show group. They did nothing at all for us. Even though the reservation was handled by their agent as a group, we were all on vastly different floors. Check in was smooth, but no upgrades of any sort were available, even for a generous tip to front desk. Hotel has 44 floors and it was FULL. You can imagine the crowds. The rooms, as noted, are very, very small. Enough for a bed and one dresser and nightstands. That's it. Bathroom is small, but did have a tub. Rooms are cleaned, but barely. The same items of dirt were in the bathroom the entire time we were there. We requested extra towels (they give you 3 very small ones for 2 people) and these never came. We asked the maid, she said 'yes', but didn't bring any. I am a light sleeper and this was difficult, but the room was dark, which did help. We were in room 1954 and could hear the street. It wasn't terrible, just not good. It is convenient to subways. There is a B/D train on the same corner. An N/R/W/Q on 55 street 2 blocks away. The Q goes right to Chinatown as express. You can walk to Bergdorf's at 59 and 5th in about 10 minutes and MOMA in under 5. There are NO good restaurants anywhere near hotel. All the food is vastly overpriced in this area. The hotel food is outrageous. Continental breakfast as room service is $24 according to the menu. The bar charges $12 for a glass of wine. Which makes the $10 half-sandwich across the street look reasonable. LOL. They did have free computers in lobby. That was a plus. If you get a really good rate, less than $150, sure. Over $300? Never.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great customer service over and over agin!”
Reviews.Author: jed1005
Reviews.Content: This is the only hotel we stay in when traveling to New York City. If you are not a Starwood member you need to be because of the perks. We are platinum level so were upgraded to a fabulous over-the-top suite, which was huge, clean, comfortable...all of the above. We had no problems at all. Phoned for a cork screw and wine glasses - got them quickly. Then phoned for some bottled water - got it quickly. The beds are the most comfortable that I have ever slept in. Even with the noise from Times Square and sirens I still sleep fabulously. This hotel is in the best location if you are staying in mid-town. It is a very nice walk to Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and many other close by restaurants and stores. It can be a bit crowded as a lot of tour companies use it for large groups but then again NYC is already crowded so it doesn't bother us. I hope you will give it a try and have a wonderful stay. Be sure to sign up as a Starwood member and start acquiring points.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge Lazaro Hernandez treated me like family”
Reviews.Author: bethbk
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a conference at the Seventh Avenue Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers. I had a special personal request of the concierge and approached Lazaro Hernandez. He was warm and caring - listened to my special needs and went out of his way to accommodate me. I felt like a VIP at the Sheraton and Lazaro treated me like family! I was not even staying at the hotel - imagine if I were a guest! I would definitely recommend the Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers. If you are lucky enough to be a guest at this beautiful and well-located establishment, please look for Lazaro at the concierge desk and give him a hug for me!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location !!!”
Reviews.Author: Brazil1703
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the perfect location. If you're coming from JFK as we were, just take the air train (connection train between the airport and the subway and train lines) then take the E subway, in 35 min. you will reach the 7th and 53rd station, walk out of the station and you will see the hotel right in front of you. Cost of trip: US$ 7,25. Just perfect. The hotel is located at 7th Av., about three blocks from the Central Park, and five blocks from Times Square. Everything else is at a walking distance (5th av, Top of the Rock, MoMA...). The hotel itself is not a top Sheraton but is ok, is clean and has good infrastructure (safe in the room, 42" flat screen TV, coffee machine...). Enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “A very busy Hotel, but in a great location”
Reviews.Author: the_cadmans
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel for our anniversary, now it's not romantic or quiet, the weekend we were there, they had a dance competition on and it was heaving !!! But the rooms were adequate, the service and reception good, but it was the location that really made it. Walk straight outside the door and theres everything you need nearby, shopping, theatres, restaurants and central park all within just a few blocks. Although busy and noisy, our favourite, so far in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for NYC Sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: DanielAndRachel
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on Priceline for this hotel (about 50% off), and it turned out to be perfect for our long weekend sightseeing in New York City. The hotel is very well-located: about halfway between Times Square and Central Park (each about a 5-10 minute walk away). It's also on top of a Subway stop and within 10-15 minutes walking distance from the Port Authority bus terminal (airport shuttles, etc.). The lobby is very nice and inviting, with lots of seating. The staff was helpful and efficient in person, but it was difficult to reach them on the phone at times. If you're planning on leaving your luggage at the hotel, be aware that there is a fee for doing so after checkout ($3.25 per item per day). If you're arriving early and waiting to check in, they will store it for free (at least they did for us). Our room was surprisingly big for NYC, though we did have a handicapped-accessible room. The hallways and rooms could use some updating (especially the worn carpet). Everything was clean, and there was even a ~40 inch flat-screen TV in the room, but the decor and furniture were somewhat dated. If you're hoping to have views of the city and/or Central Park, you'll probably be disappointed. Even though the building is 50 stories tall, there are many other tall buildings around. Our advice: catch great views from Top of the Rock and/or the Empire State Building instead. Speaking of attractions, the admission costs can add up quickly in NYC. If you're visiting more than 3-4 major attractions, consider the New York CityPass, which offers a great value and (more importantly) the ability to bypass the long lines. Overall, this was the perfect hotel for our first sightseeing trip to NYC--great value and great location.

Reviews.Title: “OK Location, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellingbug21
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Sheraton on new years eve and were able to keep an eye on how busy 7th avenue was getting throughout the evening so we did have to go out too early. The only problem was that when we did finally go outside there was no type of screens or speakers playing out what was going on in times square. After the ball dropped it was very difficult getting back into the hotel. The hotel was about 10 mins away from times square and was close to the tour bus stop and the subway. Generally the hotel is ok but the rooms seem like they are in desparate need of redecoration and a revamp. The heating system was very old fashioned and the bathroom felt unclean. The rooms were a little small and I have no idea where you would have eaten if you got room service. However, for the amount of time you end up spending in the room it does what you want it to do and that is get a good nights sleep! The elevators are extremely slow so make sure you give yourself about 5 mins of waiting for them to turn up. After reading previous reviews I was a liitle concerned about the staff but we never experienced any rudeness especially on probably one of their busiest nights of the year. Good location but wouldn't necessarily go back to this hotel if we go back to New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Great NYC Hotel for the business traveler--especially for multiple visits”
Reviews.Author: Cali-traveler2020
Reviews.Content: I travel to NYC frequently from Calif and this is the perfect hotel for my business trips. I stay at this hotel over 50 nights a year for the last 2 years. Central location...all the staff are friendly, professional and remember me each visit.. Great health club on the lower level that opens early for those pre-dawn workouts before a busy work day. Club level has a plenty of healthy breakfast options to grab on the go. Good cappuccino machine. Room service is tasty....mini bar has the essentials when you are too tired to go out for a snack. The bellmen out front are experts in getting you a cab or a town car.....especially during the dreaded taxi shift change....when you are late for a flight out of JFK. The staff was fantastic the week I brought my family when my kids were out of school for spring break and made this family trip special.

Reviews.Title: “The Sheraton New York is beautiful and has an amazing and wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1107
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton New York was beautiful and the friendliness and hospitality of the staff was outstanding. Some people say that New York is not a friendly place, but I felt very much at home in NYC at the Sheraton New York. Fantastic location too. Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “Staff was great... hotel was lacking”
Reviews.Author: txtravelagenttx
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights May 6th. Check in was a breeze. Room was an ok size considering its NYC. We had a few problems... they were in our room within 30 min trying to fix the issues. I think this is so fast considering how many rooms there were. The issue was with the air conditioner. It ran all the time and NEVER cooled the room off. We talked to others at the hotel and they had the same problem. Also, the walls are so thin. We could hear everything that the neighbors said. They did not sleep til 5 am. We changed rooms for the next tnight because of the noise. Same problem in the next room. So dont stay here if you are coming to sleep or cool off! Maybe once summer starts in NYC, they will have the issue resolved.. but unlikely!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Sheraton...unless you like dust.”
Reviews.Author: blubs99
Reviews.Content: I have recently stayed in some excellent Sheraton properties (Hong Kong and Shanghai) and this property was very disappointing. Room was tiny but that's common in NY. What bothered me was the dust everywhere in the room. The desk, phone, coffee maker, ice chest and glasses, towel rack and vanity had a layer of dust that was shocking. The corridors were very dark and the lighting in the room was insufficient for reading.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value and service.”
Reviews.Author: Ahlohaa
Reviews.Content: Of cource good location, and also ok room. But. After paying extra for a club room our expectations where high. We looked forward to free inroom internet connection and happy hour alcoholic beverages. But not. Instead we experienced a hotel that try to milk the most out of their customer. We hoped for a later check out, since we had a late flight to Europe, but no way. They even charged per item to keep our luggage after check out. Some of the staff we met, espesially those who took care of luggage after checking out was not friendly at all. Dissapionting. Will stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience. Great location. Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: jensmith36
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton New York Hotel & Towers is not only great because of its unmatchable location, it is also warm, comfortable, clean and welcoming. Right in the center of everything that Times Square has to offer, the Sheraton also offers a great atmosphere, comfortable/clean rooms and a beautifully renovated lobby. The staff is wonderful--very helpful, accomodating and friendly. The rates are always very reasonable (for NYC!), without having to sacrifice cleanliness and a pleasant environment. The garage is attached to the hotel, so you don't need to drag your luggage all over the city, which is great! You do have to pay to park, but that is true for every hotel in NY. The rooms have new flat screen TVs, and there is a free internet cafe in the lobby. While the lobby is often crowded with groups coming and going, I found the hallways and rooms to be very private and quiet. It was a great stay, and I plan to come back very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the middle of all the action”
Reviews.Author: abbyroadie4
Reviews.Content: I traveled here with my mother who is in a wheelchair. I was worried the bathroom wouldn't be accessible. Our room was great, completely accessible bathroom with a stand up shower. The bathroom smelled a little funny but I can get over that. My only issue was we stayed on the 31st floor and the street noise was still distracting. Being so close to Times Square, there was a lot of noise outside. I had to buy ear plugs for the stay. I can get over it though. I mean, it's the CITY! Still a lovely stay. The staff I interacted with were friendly and accommodating. The guys hailing cabs outside for guests were SUPER awesome, helping be load the wheelchair in the trunk of the cabs and whatnot. I tipped them well :) Very popular hotel in a good location. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “NOT WHAT I EXPECTED”
Reviews.Author: isisj116
Reviews.Content: I have gone many times to NY, however i had never stayed at a Sheraton....hotel is big, location is excellent....however the carpets in hotel are dirty and old...stuffy you can't breathe.....air conditioner didn't work well.....good thing are the beds and tv and for the price i padid it wasn't bad.... Would have rather stayed somewhere else!!!

Reviews.Title: “No thanks, not even if it's free”
Reviews.Author: RIGuy1024
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler and primarily a purveyor of Starwood hotels I booked a stay for 1 night at this hotel and it turned out to be one of the worst decisions I ever made. The room is small, even by NYC standards. The bathroom was filthy - water and mold stains on the ceilings, the walls looked like it was a motel, grimy bathtub, etc. The temperature is controlled by an OLD system where you need to go to the "desk" by the window, lift up a screen and dial-up your desired temperature and even then it's anybodies guess since its not digital. I opened the mini bar just to take a peak and it had opened waters that were half drunk already and also had cans on top of each other - while the previous guest may be at fault, it should have been in presentable order for the next guest. To top it off - the bed was rock hard, not the usual Sheraton Sweet Sleeper! If it was, it was time to be replaced! The carpet in the hallways was beyond torn and battered. This hotel is an embarrassment to the Starwood brand and is in desperate need of a major, major, major renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Not very wonderful - big, crowded, rude staff”
Reviews.Author: ZBTUsa
Reviews.Content: The staff were extremely rude. We made a mistake about the mini-bar because you have only 30 seconds to look at items and if you don't put them back in this time, you are charged even if you haven't used them. Apparently, there is usually a piece of paper to explain this, but it was missing. I rang up to sort this out and the staff were extremely rude to me. This was not the only occasion when staff were rude. The lobby is a busy, anoymous place and the rooms and corridors are looking a bit shabby.

Reviews.Title: “Staff Will Go Out Of There To Make Your Trip Special”
Reviews.Author: jclc1213
Reviews.Content: Needed a good surprise for friend's 50th. I decided NYC and checked rates for my favorite, the Towers, and lucked out on a great rate. I always upgrade as Gold SPG member but didn't want to push my luck because it is first come first served so I emailed the Manager and got a response within 24 hrs - he more than graciously accomodated the special request. Of course, the rooms are small because it is NYC - while not as large as the Doubletree or Embassy Suites, they aren't as small as many others including Four Points Soho!! Who stays in their room? Go to the Club Room and check out the views or hit the street!! The staff, this time, (and my prior 7-10 trips) at this hotel over the last 15 years, have always amazed me with their kindness and new New York attitudes!! They will go out of their way to accomodate and please. The concierges have always been right on the money. Housekeeping will jump to right any wrong if you call! The hotel is a few blocks from everything you need to see in NYC (or subway right out the door)!!! You must take a tour if you haven't on one of the buses (owned by same company now) and tickets sold right outside the door or walk to central park, fifth ave and times square or an awesome restaurant - ALL WITHIN BLOCKS! Close to everything but quieter than Times Square and not snobby like the East Side! The best location and the best staff in NYC!! Plus if you're an SPG member, you get points!!! I have stayed in the best and worst of hotels in NYC and am very picky. I travel frequently and am very frugal but I would recommend this hotel to anyone knowing that staff will right any wrongs and make you feel special!!

Reviews.Title: “too big and charmless but staff very helpful”
Reviews.Author: brandenburg5
Reviews.Content: I had a very mixed experience here. The bed was very comfy, and the staff were very very friendly and helpful - unusually so. I did need to keep consulting the staff as there was NO information about hotel facilities in the room, which is strange. This hotel is huge and seemed to be full of school groups; the lobby felt like a bus station. I skipped breakfast which looked awful and was $24 - the same price as breakfast in the Warwick Hotel nearby, which is a wonderful buffet. The gym is nice but costs $10 for guests. All in all it wasn't much fun to be in this hotel so I moved somewhere much nicer - and actually cheaper. I wouldn't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: PAM_from_LINY
Reviews.Content: I had to go to NYC for a conference and opted to check in after the conference--Good thing, since I would have had aggravation before having to do business. When I got to the hotel at 7:30pm, the front desk told me the computers were updating and I couldn't check in. She suggested we go to the bar and have a drink and gave us a free breakfast voucher. We checked our luggage with the bellman and came back a half hour later and the next front desk clerk had us wait 20 minutes, only to return and tell us that there were no clean rooms. We had an 8:30 dinner appointment we were close to being late for and expressed that. She went in the back room again and returned with the news that a room had been located. We picked up our luggage at the bellman who told us that the delays were caused by housekeepers calling in sick. I told him mgmt is to blame and he vehemently disagreed. The room was not clean. There was trash in the wastebaskets from the prior guests, hair on the bathroom floor, used soap by the sink and towels on the rack above the toilet that had spider webs on them. We were late for dinner by 45 minutes thanks to the delays. When we returned, we turned on the a/c which rattled like a helicopter. Fortunately the windows are semi operable and the weather was cool, so we were able to shut off the a/c. The bed was comfortable and the TV fine. The next morning we went to the hotel restaurant to have breakfast. Ernesto, an employee who has worked at the hotel for some 20+ years, was wonderful. We had a pleasant conversation with him and he clearly is proud of the quality of work he does--we watched him as he zipped around the room helping other customers. His positive attitude was a sharp contrast to the surly front desk attendants and loud-mouth bellman. At the bar the night before, our waiter, Sultan, was right on the spot and also quite pleasant. It is unfortunate that the management of this hotel can't run the operation smoothly so that guests check out feeling good.

Reviews.Title: “great location, but very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: leeleebeanCt
Reviews.Content: Went to the city for a quick trip. The Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers was a great hotel for just that. The location was perfect and so close to all the action in Times Square, Radio City Music Hall, Broadway etc....Lots of restaurants and activities to choose from! A few downfalls, the double room we stayed in was EXTREMELY small. There was barely any room to walk around. I can't imagine spending much time in these rooms, but who does that anyways when they go to NYC. Bathroom was dated and could use an update. And, valet parking was very pricey too - $49 a night! It's a busy hotel, people coming and going all over, however the staff was abundant and very friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel and possibly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay there next Christmas!!”
Reviews.Author: lobster44
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton last Dec for 6 days... it was fantastic. Perfect location for Broadway, Fifth Ave, Times Square- all withint 5-10 mins walk away... couldnt get a better location whilst managing to get a decent night's sleep!! We only had to get one taxi all week which illustrates how good the location was- we could walk everywhere! Service by staff was again very very good- endless amounts of advice for best restaurants and places to go- all of which were great when we took them up on it!! Busy hotel but only as all hotels are in NYC in december before xmas... the lobby bar was always packed with people whatever the time but this wasnt a problem at all. DIdnt use the gym at all but it was always being used so looked good!! Didnt use the bars or restaurants .. werent the clearest to see where they were on and how to get in to them but we were probably being lazy!! Small but very noticeable touches which we liked- free starbucks coffees in your room (always handy when freezing outside!) free wifi and computers in the lobby to use (very useful to find out where to go if you are new to the city!) Rooms are very spacious for NYC .. (small for anywhere else!) very comfortable and just what you need. We would definitely recommend anyone to stay here whether you are travelling alone, with a family or as a couple... suits everyone as it is a busy but warm hotel. We are going back (hopefully) in Dec and would 100% stay there instead of anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong with the Sheraton NY Hotel & Towers”
Reviews.Author: upstate46
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 3 day business/leisure trip. Brought my daughter and 9 yr old granddaughter. Whenever I am in NYC (which is quite often) I always stay at the Sheraton NY Hotel & Towers. The location in Midtown is fantastic - you can walk to Broadway Shows, Time Square, Radio City Music Hall, Rockefeller Center, the Letterman show, and of course The American Girl Doll Store (when my granddaughter is with me). Also convenient and easy walk to Central Park. You can save a ton on taxi fares. The staff is always pleasant and very accommodating. Everyone has a smile on their face and is ready to assist you. If I had room in my luggage I would love to take the bed , bedding and pillows home with me! Free wi-fi in the lobby and free use of computers at the Link in the lobby too. As a priority club member I enjoy the club floor - free breakfast and evening snacks. I highly recommend this to the business traveller as well as families travelling together. Have never had a bad experience at this wonderful hotel. This time we had trouble connecting to the internet in the room and they were so sorry that they sent up a tray with drinks and sweet treats to make up for the inconvenience. Hard to find that kind of customer service these days. Make sure you give it a try - you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Was not disappointed, even when we had a big "whoops"!”
Reviews.Author: Diane503
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this Sheraton during a business trip for me and a leisure trip for him. The hotel was full for the conference but never felt crowded. Elevators were fast and we never waited longer than 30 seconds, even during the busiest times. We were on the 17th floor and the room was fairly quiet, clean and comfortable. Close to Central Park, musuems, subways, Times Square and great eating! Staff was excellent, especially when we got home to Pa and my husband discovered that he left his laptop and money in the room safe. We called the hotel and Sal in Security got the combo from my husband and said he would call back in 10 minutes which he did. He said he was securing the items in their safe. He offered to send it FedEx, but since the laptop contained all of our personal and company business he told Sal I would make the return trip the next day to personally pick it up. Fren and Kevin, who I believe was head of security were there when I arrived and were most helpful. When we initially discovered that the items were left behind we had just a moment of "OMG" but knew from our years of staying at various Sheratons as our preferred hotel that we had nothing to worry about because of the integrity and professionalism of Sheraton employees. So thank you Sal, Fren and Kevin!

Reviews.Title: “Solid”
Reviews.Author: Jenna_2000
Reviews.Content: Great location, convenient to subways, and for the most part, a solid hotel. Small room, small bathroom but that's ok. Good size flat screen TV, great views out the window. Breakfast buffet was fine; nothing spectacular but good enough to help us get started for the day. My only major complaint would be the pillows. They were huge but offered NO support, even when I piled them on top of each other...my head sank in the middle while the sides puffed up around me...but I was sooo tired from all the walking I did, I was able to fall asleep anyway but I'd prefer them to be more supportive. We stayed for 5 days during a time when there was some sort of high school competitions going on so the hotel was FULL of teenagers and for the most part, I didn't hear them but in the mornings, they were very loud in the hallway and woke us up. Hotel was very busy but was still able to get quick service and be able to use the computers. Hotel wasn't perfect but it's hard to find one that is but all in all, I felt very comfortable and I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised at the value”
Reviews.Author: Winterbourne
Reviews.Content: I got a good prepaid rate thru Priceline, and was pleased to find a rather up-to-date, clean, comfortable hotel with a welcoming, spacious lobby. The rooms (especially the bath) are compact but not cramped. Plenty of coffee, tea and toiletries, big tv, wireless, and an extremely comfortable bed. Some of the staff were a bit surly, but I can overlook that for good service and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Coming up short”
Reviews.Author: LifeInTheFastLane
Reviews.Content: The location is great and teh TV is huge. However, there are several things lacking that make the hotel a poor cousin to the Hilton just one block away. Air conditioning is poor - I have had it on "full blast" my entire stay and the room is still warm and muggy. The health center downstairs has fairly modern equipment, but the TV's get only seven channels (three ESPNs, NFL network, weather channel, and the local PBS and CW affiliates), some of them barely. This is an issue that has been going on for over a year, but there has been no effort to fix it. I compare this to the HIlton one block east because everything there works and they are of comparable price points. I would not stay here if I did not have to be here for a conference.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: obeethree
Reviews.Content: very central, friendly staff but the hotel decor was a bit tired for its rating. Rooms very small

Reviews.Title: “Excellent everything!”
Reviews.Author: gadget1285
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is the best around NYC! Every single aspect of the hotel made the weekend stay just perfect. Every single employee was so kind...all of the way up to the hotel managers walking around to their important meetings and saying 'hello' to every single guest they saw and asked them 'how they are doing today'. This hotel is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “The best NYC Hotel right in the heart of the Theatre District”
Reviews.Author: rnbsn1997
Reviews.Content: I can't rave enough about how great this hotel is. On a recent stay at the Sheraton NY Hotel and Towers to celebrate a "milestone" birthday I was pleased to find the hotel was clean, nicely decorated, and staffed with people who were courteous and knowledgeable. Whether it was directions to a theatre or a recommendation for a good restaurant the staff went above and beyond. Our room was clean, comfortable and roomy. The Sheraton Sleeper bed was probably one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. When I return to NYC the only hotel I ever want to stay in is The New York Sheraton Hotel and Towers..

Reviews.Title: “Quality Service, Hospitality and Efficiency”
Reviews.Author: HKfromMN
Reviews.Content: Sheraton New York Hotel & Towers is a top notch establishment. I've stayed at this hotel twice in the past six months so not as frequently as other business travelers might - which is why I was pleasantly suprised when the employee at the front desk remembered my name! Not only are the employees helpful, courteous and accomodating but they have gone out of their way for me on both occassions. I forgot my phone charger in my room during my first stay and they not only located it but sent the package to my office within the same week. The second stay, my hotel room phone ringer was off so I didn't answer my wake up call. They sent an employee to knock on the door - personal wake up call - thank you! At first I thought I hadn't woke up because I had slept so soundly. The bed was extremely comfortable, plush and clean. ti's right in the middle of the action so you can participate in the fun, nightlife and everything that is great about NYC or if you'd prefer quiet your room is a safe and relaxing get away from the action. Service is always with a smile, equal treatment for those who travel and stay frequently and those who only get out to NY once or twice a year. Either way, from a business perspective, check in is easy, the service is great and the employees are excellent. From a leisure perspective, its rare for people to take the time to stop and ask if they can help you locate your destination. I'd highly recommend staying at this hotel - business or Leisure. Great spot. Five Stars!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: tilleydog1
Reviews.Content: Returned today from a 4 night stay, couldn't fault a thing, from checking in to leaving, room clean comfy bed, used the computer in reception to check in for return flight, baggage storage is $3.25 per bag, staff are not pushy in carrying your bags which I find a good thing, don't get me wrong if you needed help they were their to assist, brill locaton would recomend the hotel to any one

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service by "Joy: at Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: ddbaeddbae
Reviews.Content: My family checked in at this hotel for my son's violin audition at Julliard. My son needed some space to practice his violin for the audition next day. He did not want to disturb other people staying next to our room by practicing in the room. We explained the situation to our receptionist "Joy" and asked if there is any room for him to practice. After making calls, she gave us permission to use one of the ballroom for no charge. She was fantastic to make it happen and my son was able to practice without bothering the neighbors. Yesterday, we got great news that my son got accepted to Julliard. Thank you very much, Joy! Look forward to staying at your hotel again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Well taken care of!”
Reviews.Author: Mira15
Reviews.Content: I am writing to commend Mr. Jorge Guerrero the guest service manager. He was caring from the first phone call I made and he didn't even know who I was. My mother was going to be traveling with my young son and her friend was going to be traveling with her granddaughter. I was a little concerned about sending these ladies to NYC with two small children and wanted to make sure someone looked out for them. In the end my mother was unable to go as our child became very ill with the H1N1 virus but her friend went on with her granddaughter. Mr. Guerrero took extremely good care of them. He made sure they were greatly warmly with basket of fruit. She felt extremely taken care of and felt they had a wonderful stay at the Sheraton thanks to Mr. Guerrero. We will be "making up" the trip and we will most definitely stay at the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “We were thrilled!”
Reviews.Author: jbandd
Reviews.Content: My wife and I can't praise the Sheraton and the staff as much as they deserve. Even though we made reservations at the last minute and the hotel was almost full, the reservations people found us a wonderful room at amazingly affordable rate. The process of check-in was quick and efficient, and when we got to our room, we were thrilled at how beautiful and spacious it was. We will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, walking distance to Times Square, to the subway,and to good eating places”
Reviews.Author: Joanleve
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in March 2010. Staff on check in were fast and friendly. The concierge and ticket /concert desks were great help. They helped us plan our tours and subways . You could buy your tickets with them. Rooms were clean and big enough for what you need them for. Walking distance to Times Square, great restaurants nearby. subway just around the corner. tour buses a few blocks away. Would stay here again because of it's great location to everything .Joanne

Reviews.Title: “Efficient Service. Many Smiles. Wonderful Experience.”
Reviews.Author: BleuDesigner21
