Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked into the lobby the staff was efficient and moved the welcome and registration process right along (even with the HUGE mass of teenagers around, waiting to check-in, they were friendly, patient and QUICK!) The room service staff was wonderful, from the phone call placing the order to the prompt delivery. For being in mid-town Manhattan, the Sheraton did a great job controlling the packed house they had while maintaining great, attentive Customer Service. And, the bed was comfy!

Reviews.Title: “First Class, top notch Service”
Reviews.Author: ArchieBunker12
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location with the friendliest staff around.. My room was ready early when I arrived and room service was always on time and checking on my further needs. Don't waste your time anywhere else in the city!!!

Reviews.Title: “Rudest Guest Service”
Reviews.Author: Samaan05
Reviews.Content: All I needed was a band-aid to stem the bleeding from my palm - sliced on the thermostat unit grille. The guest services woman attendant who picked up the phone after nearly 10 minutes was the rudest hotel staff I have had the misfortune to encounter. The hotel did not have a band-aid seemingly to provide me with one and she was not going to do anything about it since that was hotel policy! On a rainy day, I had to go out of the hotel to procure one.

Reviews.Title: “Not extraordinary-- but a good stay for a solo traveler”
Reviews.Author: Bthomas314
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights in March 2010 for business. For a solo traveler in the city on business, it was a pleasant stay (note: I did not attend meetings at this location). The hotel lobby is pretty much a mob scene much of the day and night. This is probably because of the location: 7th Avenue about three blocks north of Times Square and three blocks south of Central Park-- so you can't beat the location if Times Sq. and Central Park are the top two on your list of things to do. For me, it was a place to rest after meetings and dinners-- which it suited. If I'm just with my wife, however, I would not stay at this location. The room was fine, although a moldy smell from the bathroom greeted me. I had a fantastic view looking south down 7th Avenue from the 26th floor. The bed was great.-- very comfortable and although the hotel was full-- it was pretty quiet. The staff was very good-- a solid four on a five scale. No complaints. The concierge service was friendly and informative. The front desk staff was gracious and it was easy to share a laugh with most of the staff I encountered. All in all, it was a good trip and I would stay at the hotel again if I'm by myself or when I have teenagers-- but for a nice weekend of dinner, shows, and shopping with my wife, I'll stay at the Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Lobby, awful "Club" room.”
Reviews.Author: Jliles707
Reviews.Content: Has a nice appearance when you drive up to this hotel on 7th Ave. Lobby is attractive, front desk staff are pleasant, helpful and well trained. Was given a room on the 44th Floor, the Club Level - sounded nice. King bed, high enough up to actually have a sorta view of the city. I've stayed in enough higher end hotels in New York to expect small rooms, but this one was ridiculous. The room itself was 10' x 20', and barely fit the furniture. There is 9 INCH gap between the end of bed and the refrigerator cabinet that you have to squeeze by to get to anything. Absurd. The bathroom tile and fixtures are antiquated, not in a good way, and the "desk" has the stain scraped off it and will give you splinters. Not a single outlet near the desk for charging electronics. Paint on the ceiling is cracking, and the only chair is an uncomfortable office chair. And of course there is NO wireless internet access. The good - Nice flat panel tv Nice lobby Decent view on the 44th floor. Would NOT recommend.

Reviews.Title: “great location, no negative surprises!”
Reviews.Author: kurukuruLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: ideally located, everything works like clockwork here. good bar downstairs, and great restaurants at walking distance. Lounge on 44th floor for breakfast is a big plus

Reviews.Title: “Accomodating hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: btousa
Reviews.Content: This property is always my location of choice. It is a busy hotel but yet away from Time Square and thus the associated noise and congestion which Time Square brings. The staff is most accomodating. Would be great if there were a dresser which could accomodate a stay of 4 or more days for two people. The one drawer is always taken up by the in-room snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: IrishDave2005
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights during Paddys day. Hotel could not be in a more perfect location, 2 minute walk into Times square, surrounded by many bars and restuarants. We didnt really use any of the Hotels amenities. Rooms were large by NY Hotel standards, Hotel is very clean, spacious and the staff are very nice. Only negative I have is there was some internal drilling goin on which sounded like on top of our room om the 1st morning. Taxi from Newark took an hour and costs 90 dollars for 5 plus bags. Taxi to JFK costs 60 dollars and took approx 40 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: scassa
Reviews.Content: My husband & I went to the hotel to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary. GM Mark Sanders and his assistant Ingrid Ordonez went above and beyond to make our stay a memorable one. I am not a big fan of staying in Times Square or near it but I have to say I would return to this hotel because of the wonderful experience I had. Thank you to Mark & Ingrid for making this one of our best visits to NYC. We will be back to you hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: musicalsrule
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a great experience at the Sheraton NY Hotel and Towers. Our room was ready earlier than expected, which is much appreciated after being in the car for hours! The room was clean and I loved the modern look. The location was fantastic. You head out the front doors and to the left--you are in Times Square. You head to the right and you are in Central Park! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Then You see The Room :(”
Reviews.Author: namotsiB
Reviews.Content: I Stayed in the Sheraton New York Hotel And Towers with My Family for St Patrick's Week. My First Impressions ware good, Clean lobby, Friendly staff and the location is second to none, a very short walk to times square, Central park and the Rockefeller Center. Then You see the room, We ware on the 38 floor, We had Two double Beds ( My sons single bed at home was bigger) thare was barley enough room to bring in cases and a buggy ( Push Chair) and the storage was no way adequate for a Family Of Four. The Bath room was old, Moldy and the Bath was barley big enough for a seven year old to lie in it. thare was a layer of dust on the blinds that was not wiped away for the whole week We stayed thare. The room door had a gap of about 1/2 inch at the bottom, and , when a large group of teenagers ware staying on The same Floor as us, the Noise of them talking and running up the Corridor, was almost Unbearable. "Standard room One queen or two double Sheraton Sweet Sleeper Bed(s) with wood-and-leather headboards. 253 square feet. Room-width desk with leather ergonomic chair, high-speed Internet connection (surcharge), task light, and dual-line speakerphone. Complimentary USA Today newspaper. Pay movies. Video games. Marble-vanity bathroom. Shower/tub with curved shower-curtain rod. Leather dressing bench. Nonsmoking. " No way Sheraton, I was told that the In room Games was discontinued months ago, But the website still says You Have them. The Newspapers are left at the Elevators, so if you get up after Nine am, thare are None Left. The Room Featured a Large LCD HDTV, But a TV Guide would have Been helpful I have Never stayed at any Hotel Or B&B ware You don't Get Tourist Information, This Hotel had None in the Rooms. Overall, If You are travelling with one person, and don't mind the Grime, You cant get a better location in Midtown Manhattan, But If You are bringing Your Family, Look around for another Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: howie1229
Reviews.Content: This is a large, well-located NYC hotel close to the theater district, shopping and more. GM Mark Sanders heads up a terrific and well-trained staff, including Ingrid Ordonez and front office staffer Beth.

Reviews.Title: “Terribe, rude, dingy tired old hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lp6401
Reviews.Content: Just a nasty hotel (attitude and room). To start, when I first checked in the room there was hair on the toilet seat and on the bathroom floor. The rust in the bathtub also turned my stomach. 4 star hotel? Hilarious -- 2 star at best. I had a morning flight and decided to sit in the lobby for a few hours late at night (using the overpriced wifi internet access to do some work), sat in one of the couches and was later approached by a security guy who asked me to leave the lobby -- at 9 am. WTF? I asked why and he replied that I've been in the lobby for too long and that I should either go up to my room or leave. I'm on my way back home totally on disgust. By far, the worst hotel I've stayed at. Never again. Try elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TheNewMrsAW
Reviews.Content: Me and my Husband stayed here in January as part of our Honeymoon and were more than pleased with this hotel. Hotel was in a great location, only 5 mins walk to both Times Sq and Central Park. Rooms were clean, modern but compact. Service was faultless; ordered room service one night which was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly maintained rooms and indifferent, unhappy service”
Reviews.Author: mike-lcf
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently to NYC and have had stayed in a range of Manhattan hotels, mostly in midtown. I had not stayed at the Sheraton New York in about 6 years, and my recollection was that it was an average, serviceable hotel. In my opinion, this property has gone way downhill. I do not plan to return to this hotel. The late night check in staff person appeared to be upset that she was working there. Never said hello, just "next". I had specifically reserved (and paid extra for) a club floor room and was told at check in that I there were no such rooms available. No apology given or offer to try to make it right. She just said that that February was the "slow season" and so they were giving the club floor rooms a "deep clean." When I asked her why they advertised and sold club floor rooms on their reservations website if they already had planned that they would be unavailable, she just looked at me and repeated that they were getting a deep clean. She basically gave me the "ask me if I care" look. Putting aside the indifferent (and unhappy) front staff, the housekeeping and maintenance of the rooms are very, very poor. The room I was given was seriously disgusting. You can see from the attached photos I took with my camera phone the state of the room. The first thing I noticed was the partially digested candy on the floor next to the seat. Upon closer inspection it appeared to be a wintergreen certs that the prior guest had spit out on the floor (you can judge for yourself from the photo). Next to the bed nightstand was a rolled up piece of tissue on the ground (see also photo). As you can also see from the attached photo, the ceiling above the bed was cracked and peeling. Moreover the only accessible power outlet (near the bed) did not work and was pulled out about an inch from the wall. You can't see it from the photo, but there is exposed wiring on the back of the outlet plate that would be dangerous if you had a kid in the room. Numerous black scoff marks also all along the walls of the bedroom. Also, the room size itself is on the smaller size, even by NYC standards. But the bedroom was not the worst part. The bathroom was nasty and unsanitary. It had mold growing all over the shower. Don't take my word for it -- look at these photos. You can see from the attached photos that mold is growing in the tile grout, around the soap dish, and there are mold spots on the ceiling above the shower. Really, pretty gross, and I ended up not using the shower because of that. The management at this hotel is obviously dropping the ball on maintenance and housekeeping. Pretty untypical for a Starwood hotel. I don't recommend this hotel. There are many other (and better) choices in the midtown Manhattan area in the same price range. All the hotels in the area are busy and see a large volume of traffic, that is not an excuse for shoddy quality and poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: ericperera
Reviews.Content: Comfy beds, friendly staff, great location. Also wanted to make a special thanks to Concierge Michael Darr. He assisted me in finding the best solution for transportation to the airport. Thanks to his advice, I save about $40 in cab fees!! It because of efforts like Michael, and the rest of the staff that make Sheraton my company's top choice when booking hotels around the country. Keep up the great work!!

Reviews.Title: “Very hospitable and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: the_elm
Reviews.Content: Despite the very large number of rooms and the many people staying there, the staff were very personable and welcoming and attentive to requests. My room was next to the elevator shaft on a high floor, and when i requested a room change, it was taken care of immediately and graciously. The housekeeping, reception, and concierge staff were very helpful and with a smile. I generally prefer smaller hotels because of the more personalized service, but this stay surprised me very pleaasantly. One had a feeling that the staff felt a personal investment to their place of employment. The rooms were good sized, especially for NY (at least on the upper floors that i saw), very clean, although some small worn areas were apparent too. This was not as important given the service.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT STAY”
Reviews.Author: CamiloP
Reviews.Content: First of all I would like to thank everyone for the excellent service that was provided to us during our stay. Our representative Priscilla Ortiz was always ready to help us from the beginning of our business trip to the end. Our room was very clean and comfortable. The business center enabled us to be more efficient during our stay to keep in touch with our employees and clients. Priscilla Ortiz made sure we were taken care of and all of our needs were met. We will definitely return in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Simply just good location, that's all...”
Reviews.Author: FBIAgentAmerica2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I with our 12 years old son stayed for 8 nights at the Sheraton New York during our year end vacation. These are the "goods" and the "bads" of the hotel based on our recent experience. Here it is, the best thing about it was definitely its LOCATION, LOCATION and LOCATION. There's no doubt that the hotel's location was the main reason we chose to stay there. Inspite of negative reviews that we have read about this hotel but location wise it was one of the most strategic hotel located near Times Square. Now, here comes the negatives about the hotel. First, it was the smallest hotel's room size I have ever been to. Secondly, it was not properly maintained and cleaned so I could easily find imperfect spots in our room. Third, lousy service, this was probably due to high season when we were there but definitely needed more staffing during the busy period. Fourth, limited facilities for such a five star hotel in New York such as no swimming pool in the hotel. Last but not least, the hotel applied heavy charges on may things like parking, internet, etc., about 20 to 30 percent more to what other surrounding hotels would have charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value through Priceline”
Reviews.Author: chelsea108
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel for $110 a night on Priceline and was excited about the deal. However I then read multiple reviews on Trip Advisor about the hotel and got very nervous about my stay. Numerous reviews noted dirty rooms, even citing bed bugs and cockroaches. I immediately wrote the hotel to confirm that the hotel had been renovated, is smoke free, and meets the standards of the Sheraton brand. Along with confirming the quality of the hotel, I requested a king size bed and a room on a higher floor that is newly renovated floor (something that was recommended on Trip Advisor). I received an immediate response from Sharon the Director of Reservations. She assured me that I would have a great stay and confirmed a king size bed on a higher floor. I was nervous, but couldn't really do anything but wait. When we arrived in New York, I was pleasantly surprised by the hotel. Yes, the hotel is very big and busy, the room is a bit small, and the room is a bit worn because of all the people that go through. But let's be honest - it's a hotel in Manhattan! The bed was very comfortable and the room was decorated in a modern fashion. We also got complimentary breakfast on our floor which was delicious. Plus, the hotel is perfectly located in Midtown. I was nervous about the hotel but it all worked out beautifully. It's taken me a while to write this review, but I thought it important since Sharon and the Sheraton lived up to their end of the bargain. We had a fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Seventies Came and Went-Why Didn't This hotel”
Reviews.Author: ltravel
Reviews.Content: Firstly- my credentials- a starwood platinum member that stays in New York every few weeks mostly at Westin and W (wonderfukl hotels). and has amassed hundreds of thousands of points at starwood properties. This time, I needed a location a little further uptown so I decided to try this old lady. I don't know who was more worn-the hotel or the front desk receptionists who were cold and rude but both needed a makeover. Before I could evven ask for an upgrade, I was informed that all t he better rooms were sold-out. Unfortunately for them they lied- rooms were readily available online- doublechecked with housekeeping, concierge and club level (that's ascam they run so they can charge $12 dollars for a glass of wine) level personnel. all agreed hotel was slow and empty. Normally not a problem if room hadn't been as small as the inside of a cardboard box. I could even have dealt with that if it w asn't for the fact, running toilet(at least they ahd one) and broken hairdryer. Yes, i may be demanding- a bed that doesnt squeak, a room with real breathable oxygen and not hot air and a toilet that actually flushes when you pull the lever. the hotel will say itw as recently renovated ( gettinga few new sofas in the lobby really doesn't help me) and will say upgrade is based upon availabilty- yes i know-just do not lie. All these wonderful reviews are not from travelers that expect top quality. please for those int he know thatw ant a little comfort- spend the extra few dollars at the westin or W and let this old lady off life support - the hotel is horrible.

Reviews.Title: “New York here we are”
Reviews.Author: ptitenad
Reviews.Content: Times Square, Gospel office in Harlem, Central Park, Statue of Liberty, Eliss Island, Financial District, Ground 0, Shopping, Chelsea, Soho, Rockfeller building, shopping again on the fifth avenue, Hair on broadway, MOMA, Greenwich Village and a lot of FUN !!! and a very good welcome from everyone at the hotel SHERATON HOTEL TOWERS and specially from George Guerreo was very nice and available with us. a very nice guy !

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel, Brillaint Location”
Reviews.Author: dantpen
Reviews.Content: I got back yesterday from a stay in the Sheraton with a friend. Our holiday was just to see New York and get a little bit of shopping in. I had booked the holiday through Virgin holidays about 6 months ago, and about a month before i travelled i had emailed ahead to the hotel to request an early check in, as this is normally at 3pm but our flight meant we would be at the hotel for about 1pm. Got to the hotel and first impressions were great, the lobby is really big and looks very nice, there is a cafe selling starbucks coffee just to your left and also "The Link" which is free internet access for all guests. Before i had chance to get to reception the Bell cap was happy to take care of my bags until i had got checked in. Went to the front desk and advised i was checking in, i didnt mention i had emailed ahead, but it didnt matter as the lady checked me in straight away and asigned us a room on the 41st floor, i was over the moon with this as i had wanted a high room to get a good view. The bell cap took us to the elevator which was nice and fast and took less than 20 seconds to get us to our floor. The room was pretty small, but having being to New York before, i expected this, the rooms are always small unless you pay a silly amount and get a suite. The bathroom had plenty of towels and shampoo's etc, the shower was good too, nice and powerful and the heat was easy to adjust. There is an electronic safe in the closet but it needs to stay closed while not in use as if its left open for too long the code would reset it's self so you would need to keep doing this. The room had a double bed, but it was a big double and had plenty of room, mini bar and snack bar were located in the fridge and dresser and there is a nice 37" HDTV on top which is on a swivel stand so that you can see it while laid in bed. The rooms were cleaned daily and you can chose how often you want your bed linnen and towels changing by placing the towels on the floor and placing the "Time for a change" card on the bed. There is an ice machine located on each floor as well so that you can fill up on this if you need it. All in all my stay at ther sheraton was brilliant, i would 100% go back here again, and would 100% recommend this hotel to my friends and family. Also like i mentioned in the title of this review, the location is brilliant, it takes less than 10 minutes to walk to Central Park/Times Square/Rockefeller centre etc.

Reviews.Title: “Joy at the front desk!”
Reviews.Author: KLAXLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. But Joy at the front desk went way out of her way to make sure we got checked in. Once on our room she called to make sure everything was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but too hot and dirty bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: ncox10021
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at this hotel. Location is awesome. Got there, went to the bathroom and there were a couple of drops of blood on the toilet seat. They changed our room to the one next door. Bathroom had urine on the floor next to the toilet. I turned the heater off but was still sweltering - very uncomfortable. The man in the check room is a total jerk - try to avoid him. Front desk personnel were helpful with the room change - they gave us a $50 food credit for the dirty bathroom incident.

Reviews.Title: “Jericho High School, 40 year Reunion”
Reviews.Author: GaryJ8
Reviews.Content: Rooms very small, Shower terrible, service bad.. Will not stay there ever again

Reviews.Title: “NIce hotel in the middle of the City, free wifi, and nice meals.”
Reviews.Author: transferpress
Reviews.Content: When I booked this hotel I was didn't realize hot close it was to Times Square. Very central location with a subway entrance right out the side door. HAs free wifi in the Lobby and some very nice food, eben better deserts. Only thing is I wish that it had a guests laundry. Service was great, will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Hotel and Towers Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ElaineRoss
Reviews.Content: The service in this hotel was great. We had a friend who arrived in New York at the same time but the people she was staying with were delayed in London so she couldn't check into their hotel. The hotel let her stay in our room overnight with no extra charge. The hotel was really clean and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “very personable staff”
Reviews.Author: JimboBoston63
Reviews.Content: during recent stay there was terrible weather conditions in NYC .. doormen were extremely helpful and responsive in assisting guests to get transportation ... surcharge for Club level is a bargain ... includes breakfast ( good assortment of items) and very personable staff ..... open for cocktails at 5 PM with great views of the city and complimentary H / C snacks ..... health club has good selection of equiptment and access to the pool at the Sheraton Manhattan across the street

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room, great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: lilla-svenska
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel. I was a bit worried after reading some of the negative reviews. Our experience was excellent. We used Priceline to get the room and were treated as well as any other guest. We were able to check in at 2:00 p.m. (could have checked in even earlier if we were willing to take 2 beds instead of the King we requested). They did NOT charge us to keep our bags, either before we checked in or after we checked out (we left them there on checkout day for several hours before heading to the airport). Our room was clean, well decorated and comfortable. Typical sized room for NYC. Pros: All of the staff was friendly, helpful and hardworking the entire time we were there. The cleaners were prompt, friendly and restocked our room with fresh towels and toiletries every day without being asked. The room was clean & well decorated. The location is outstanding! We had tickets to Mamma Mia at the Winter Garden theater and could see the theater from the front door of the hotel. There is a subway station right outside the door, directly across the street and several within 1/2 a block. All of the "touristy" locations are very close by, a quick walk in any direction will have you either in Central Park, Columbus Circle, the heart of Times Square and the theaters, MoMA, David Letterman, Radio City, Rockefeller Plaza, etc. Just 10 blocks from Penn Station if you need to catch a train to the airports, including Newark which is where we flew in/out of this time. Check-in was fast & efficient. Though wireless internet in your room isn't available, it's free in the lobby. I used my iPod to check email, map out our destinations on the MTA, etc. There are computers available for free in the lobby, but they're usually full. You can easily sit in the number of comfortable chairs and quickly log on for free with the hotel wireless. Wired high speed internet is available in your room for $15 a day but that's an expense I refuse to pay at ANY hotel :) You can also use a computer near the front desk to print out confirmations, boarding passes, etc. for free. We even printed my husband's pay stub because he forgot his employee ID needed to get into some museums for free through his employer. The elevators were fast and never crowded. We rarely had to wait more than 5 seconds for one and rarely had anyone else in the car with us though the hotel was very busy with lots of guests. Cons: The room is very hot. You can turn the fan off to the radiator, but can't turn off the heat. We found if we didn't turn the fan on at all, it wasn't unbearable. I usually like my rooms on the warm side but this was a little too much. Would have been nice to be able to vent the window a bit for fresh air. The doors appear to not seal properly so if people are being inconsiderate and talking loudly in the hallways, you can hear it as if they are in the room with you. This wasn't much of a problem, but I can see how it could be if there was a convention or group of some sort on the same floor. All in all, I'd definitely recommend this place. We travel to NYC frequently and have stayed in hotels all over the city and this one was just fine. Remember, you're there to experience the city, not complain about the towels being too rough or the room being too small.....think of it as a place to sleep and clean up and store your stuff and don't try to crowd too many people into one room and stop looking for things to complain about and you'll have a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Very well managed property”
Reviews.Author: HI_Rich
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel very regularly. They are consistent and they do what you need witjout fail and without making a fuss. Check in is always correct with no mistakes though sometimes there can be a wait if tour is checking in and sometimes luggage has to be checked as rooms are not available until 3 pm. Bellmen and check in staff are friendly and keen to help. As a Platinum SPG I normally get an upgrade without asking. The rooms are clean, well furnished, quiet (unusual for NYC) and have comfortable beds. The new Flat screen TV's have some HDTV channels but on my last stay the local channels were still old low def. The bathrooms are clean with good products (so often in other properties you have to call down for something housekeeping forgot) Towels are plentiful and reasonable size. Downside is US bathrooms do not often have tubs just something to put shower over, still here they are bigger than some other comparable hotels in NYC. Location is fantastic for work and for pleasure clode to theater district, times square, central park and an E train stop straight to Kennedy about 5 yards form front door, also Avis office about 20yds away (useful when you have tons of shopping from outlet mall. There is parking garage at hotel. Good restuarnts and Bars are very close. 1 block from Ed Sullivan theater. Whenever you need something or there is an issue they fix it quickly when you call without fuss. Hotel is very well run. The Club lounge is pleasant to relax and unlike many is not always full of parents on poinst travel trying to feed their kids on the cheap. Nice business atmosphere (Shut at weekends - which is fine as whiney kids always wreck them at weekends). The only minus side for me is the Food and Beverage. I do not personally like the current bar and food outlets but as there is so much choice literally outside the door and it makes me leave the property, it is no issue for me. I would recommend in an instant. Never had a bad stay. I have been told guests can use the Pool at the Sheraton Manahattan across the street (Beware thiin walls at Sheraton Manhattan, very noisy).

Reviews.Title: “The trip from .... to Sheraton NY Hotel & Tower saves the day.”
Reviews.Author: owlVirginia
Reviews.Content: The original Hotel (which will remain nameless) was the hotel from ___It had not been renovated in the past 20years or more. It was the kind of place you would not sit down, least of all sleep in. In addition, the weather forecast stated snow of 12" or more. Image trying to get a hotel in Manhattan at the last minute during XMAS. The hotels were too expensive or sold out. We quickly contacted Expedia to book a hotel and was fortunate enough to book the Sheraton NY Hotel & Tower in Manhattan. Upon our arrival at the Sheraton NY Hotel & Tower, Expedia had not forwarded our confirmation. Although the hotel was extremely busy, Debbie Rodriquez, at the Front Desk saw my frustration and inquired as to how she could help. Also, she took the initiative to contact the manager, Zoe Cohen to inquire if she could hold a room for us while awaiting the confirmation from Expedia. Due to the professionalism of Debbie, Zoe and the location of the Sheraton NY Hotel and Tower (not to mention the cleanliness and comfortable beds) we were able to salvage our getaway and have a wonderful short trip. THANKS DEBBIE AND ZOE FOR A WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE!!! Would I recommend this hotel??? I ALREADY HAVE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel For a Girls Getaway”
Reviews.Author: LucitaRosa
Reviews.Content: We had a great suite with enough room to sleep 5 women! We had 2 full baths which was awesome. Everyone at the hotel was very accommodating to us. We always stay here and will continue to do so in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Craft78
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Sheraton NY Hotel and Towers was great. The staff was friendly and very accommodating to us, particularly Marisol. She was kind enough to follow up with us and check on the quality of our stay. Everything was to our preference and I do no hesitate to say that I will recommend and return to the Sheraton NY.

Reviews.Title: “A tremendous experience that exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: DAL1015
Reviews.Content: Traveling as a family of 5 is often difficult. The Sheraton staff made this trip to NYC one that our kids will never forget! From check in to check out our experience was remarkable. The room was equipped with many amenities; from the bedding to the bath everything was clean and comfortable! Our main objective was to attend a Broadway play. The location of this hotel was within walking distance of Times Square and the theater district. We look forward to returning to NYC and will definitely stay at this fine establishment again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Clean in Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Briana81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for Valentines weekend. We reserved a king room but when we got there, the rude lady at the front desk told us that there were no more king rooms available. What a bummer to find out that on V-day weekend me and my partner would have to sleep in one of two double beds. Apart from that major upset, we were pleased to find out that the rooms were really clean albeit small (what else do you expect in NY?) and the housekeeping staff kept things in tip top shape. The showers were nice and hot and towels were plentiful. The location is unbeatable to the theaters, rockafeller center, and 5th ave shopping. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend the hotel, just be prepared to deal with the curt New York attitudes and don't take it personal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Holidayaddict02
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights with my teenage son. Check in is 3pm , we arrived at 12.30 and were given a room on the 23rd floor straight away. Room was a bit dated but ideal for our needs, clean, really comfy beds and a hot shower. I would have given this hotel a 5* for sleep quality, if the door to the corridor had been insulated, I've never stayed anywhere before where you could hear , literally ,every single word from other quests walking past the rooms. Location was perfect, easy walking distance to Times Square, Central Park and Rockefeller Centre. We walked for miles and shopped until we dropped. Complimentary online check in facility and also late check out until 1pm gave us a little extra time before we headed back to JFK. Would definately stay here again for the convenience to shops and sights.

Reviews.Title: “great location, helpful staff, rooms a tight squeeze”
Reviews.Author: coletteh
Reviews.Content: We visited New York for the first time with our teenagers, aged 17 and 14. Stayed 5 nights at this hotel. Was worried because of the mixed reviews but it was great if you don't mind 2 people sharing a three quater bed! Lovely and clean rooms, near to lots of attractions. Go to The Castle on 54th and 7th for breakfast as cheaper than the hotel and good quality. Lobby bar great for people watching as always thriving.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JuddyManchester
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I have just returned from a 5 day break in New York and we loved every minute of it. With regards to The Shearton New York Hotel & Towers, it was perfect for what we wanted. eg a clean room, friendly staff and a hotel in a prime location for the main sights and things to do. Apart from originally being given a key to a room that someone was already occupying, we cannot fault the staff or hotel. They were quick to collect laundry items and bring extra coffee/milk etc and the concierge was always helpful if required. Within a short(ish) walk you also have Times Square, 5th Ave, Grand Central, Broadway, Central Park and 2 subway stops. Even for things further afield, we were perfectly placed.. we walked for miles, spent lots of money but we loved it and I would deffo stay this hotel again if we were coming back.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel was terrible.”
Reviews.Author: adaml176
Reviews.Content: My wife and I reserved a room at the Sheraton for valentines weekend. When we arrived the first thing I noticed was the place was not clean. When we checked in we were informed that our room would have two regular beds instead of the king we reserved. When we showed the staff our confirmation for a king room we were told they didn't guarantee the bed we reserved. We questioned them several more times and were given the same response each time. We decided to give the room a chance since we were already there. When we got in the room, it was very small, one of the beds was leaning, and the bathroom was dirty. We ended up going to the Marriott and getting a room there. We were required to pay for one night stay at the Sheraton even though we didn't stay there. The whole experience was a bad one, and I would not even consider staying there in the future. Don't waste your money on this place.

Reviews.Title: “High marks for my stay”
Reviews.Author: panda162
Reviews.Content: I was stuck in this hotel during the blizzard and my stay was quite enjoyable. The staff was very friendly and my room was clean. The room service food was excellent and very low cost compared to other New York hotels I have stayed in. I would definitely go back. I especially liked the fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Spot”
Reviews.Author: polor111
Reviews.Content: Starting with the speedy and friendly staff at the check-in line to the room service and service staff; this hotel is top notch. You can't beat the location or atmosphere form this classy hotel. The bar/lounge provides a great place to relax with friends and take in the sights. I have stayed twice, once in a suite and once in a regular king room, both rooms were fully loaded with everything you would need. I will be back again very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in New York City”
Reviews.Author: irishrosewy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary and we are already talking about the next trip. The location is great! We were in walking distance from Central park, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, great restaurants, bars, subways and theaters. The rooms were clean and well kept. I would have to say they need to do some repair to the hallways, at least on our floor. We asked for a refridgerator and were charged $20,00. The one we received was very old, damaged and froze our drinks. Apartment size refridgerators are not very expensive. The staff was very friendly and helpful, from the maids to the concierge. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Special Birthday trip to remember.”
Reviews.Author: adnilyesac
Reviews.Content: Great position within easy walking distance of all attractions, shops, theatres, eating places, Central Park etc. Very helpful and friendly staff, Busy but with a buzz not overcrowded. Rooms large and comfortable although could do with a freshen up, bathroom small but adequate. Loved being very high up with great view. Would use again.

Reviews.Title: “great location poor service”
Reviews.Author: kurtzl
Reviews.Content: When we originally booked our trip to New York we expected the prices to be higher than normal as we were travelling in peak holiday time. Though when we arrived at the hotel we were greeted by a less then friendly guest service agent who messed up our booking saying that the room had not been paid for when indeed it had been pre paid. After going to the business centre and printing out my credit card statement and showing the reciept of the transaction we were finally let into our room with a tiny bathroom which we barely had room to move from the door to the shower. Room service was over priced and came late (which we were still charged for even though is stated on the room service menu that if it was more than half an hour late it would be free). Location is great as it is only a short walk away from major attractions - concierge staff were less than helpful as I had to stand and wait for 10mins for the girls behind the desk to finish their conversation about what they did that weekend. Overall stay there for the location not the staff as they won't bother to help you with anything. I hope your stay is better than mine was!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great rooms but whats up with the heating!!”
Reviews.Author: MadBhoj
Reviews.Content: Pros: * Great location middle of Time Square and Central Park * Geat staff very helpful and Muhammed (works at the Club Lounge) is great * Rooms are clean and well maintained Cons: * Heating needs to be fixed, no matter what I did to the thermostat it just kept blowing hot air. I am not kidding our room was in the high 70s. * Chargning for coat checking bags. Many times the checkout times don't completely align with flight times and charging $3.25/bag is kind of steep. I used to travel a lot and I remember this being free Overall - Recommend staying here and would stay here again if travelling to NY

Reviews.Title: “Just Read a Renovation is Coming Soon”
Reviews.Author: BCtraveler44
Reviews.Content: The first room we were assigned was a great view but very very small. The next room was a little better. General housekeeping was poor. What were those drips on the mirror? How long do you not have to vacuum behind a bed before dust bunnies get 5 inches big? It took a couple of tries before housekeeping got it right. This was in a SPG Preferred guest room. The bathtub was unusable due to its size. Stay here for the location. Very expensive for the product received.

Reviews.Title: “NYC Trip”
Reviews.Author: JJH007
Reviews.Content: During our trip to NYC, we celebrated our 19th wedding anniversary. One of the things that stood out most during this trip was the staff at the Sheraton New York Hotel & Towers. The staff member that impressed us the most was Joy. She went above & beyond to make us feel welcome. Joy, and employees like her, are the reason we will return to this hotel the next time we visit New York.

Reviews.Title: “not a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: AussieExpat02
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel was in a great location, we found the hotel rooms to be dark, drab and very noisy. It didnt help matters that the President and a former President were visiting the hotel for a conference during our stay. The lobby was continually full of press and at one stage we couldn't leave the hotel at all. We were not advised of this prior to booking and no compensaton was made because of the hassle caused. Would not stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “For New York City - Wasn't Awful”
Reviews.Author: LovesThisCity
Reviews.Content: I was actually pretty impressed with this hotel. Typically when I go to NYC on business, we stay in more affordable hotels that just aren't up to par. The Sheraton was a nice surprise that came with a decent price point. Everything was very clean. The rooms were small, but so is everything in that city. The location was stellar. If you're a leisure traveler looking for a more affordable hotel, I would highly recommend. While it's set up more of a business hotel, it's within walking distance to a lot of stuff. The lobby was huge and is a great meeting-up space. It looked like they had a pretty spacious meeting/conference area, too. The downside of things were pretty minimal and were mainly a product of NYC consistently overcharging for EVERYTHING: 1. $3.50 to store your luggage? Really? That's just downright comical. 2. $10/day to use the gym? Okay, I guess I won't be using your gym anytime soon. 3. $15 to use the internet in your room? Free to use the public computers in the lobby? Hmmm...there's tough decision. 4. My toilet wouldn't stop running. I heard from others on my trip that they had the same problem. I went to the front desk who said they'd send someone up to fix it. Guess what never happened? So, I literally tried to fix this thing on my own. It wouldn't work because the toilet was broken. Had to shut the bathroom door while I slept so that the sound of the running toilet didn't keep me up. It wasn't the end of the world or anything, but just kind of annoying To be honest, I'm not a fan of this city whatsoever. You get overcharged for service and products that just don't come with quality. The Sheraton Towers Hotel was a nice change of pace. Certainly not the best, but it wasn't awful.

Reviews.Title: “Guest services were terrific.”
Reviews.Author: NashvilleMimi
Reviews.Content: Jorge Guerrero, Guest services manager, went the extra mile to retrieve a simple cell phone charger. I realized I left it as soon as I arrived at LaGuardia. Christine, who I spoke with twice, was no help and I finally asked to speak to a manager. Jorge called and emailed me regularly. When he couldn't find my charger, he sent me one of his own from a phone he no longer used. Even though it was a simple loss, I appreciate the effort he went to on my behalf. Kudos to Jorge and I hope the hotel recognizes what a special employee they have.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: icebraker12
Reviews.Content: A hotel with an exeptionnal service, will go back, everything is just perfect, reception, rooms, and roomservice, the restaurant perfect, cant recommend enough , a real gem!

Reviews.Title: “Above average”
Reviews.Author: mlhaa
Reviews.Content: The hotel was above average and functioned well for a business conference. The rate was 179 through the conference, 249 for others. It is a large hotel, centrally located in midtownn, and has a nice work out facility (10 per day or 20 for the trip). The rooms are reasonably appointed, not large, with comfortable beds. The water pressure though was not what I would expect at a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: CaritoJames
Reviews.Content: Great location, great rooms, great service... enjoyed!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location For Theatre, etc. For NY, Good Price”
Reviews.Author: phantomacct
Reviews.Content: I have been to the Sheraton Towers on a few business occasions (with leisure activities mixed in). For central location, room reliability, and decent New York City pricing, this isn't a bad option. The Towers are in the middle of the Theatre district, with major Broadway theatres within a few blocks walking distance. Times Square is about a ten minute walk for the New York tourist experience. Another option within walking distance includes the Museum of Modern Art. Restaurants (basic and top dollar) are plentiful in the area. Business offices are short cab rides (or walking distance) away. The rooms are small, but work. The bar atmosphere could be better. Decent place for families or young couples to stay (but prepare to be crowded). For location alone (in NYC), I'd rate the Towers 3 1/2 stars. Of note, the Sheraton Manhattan is across the street, so check that out as well if you can't get in the Towers.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: lizs77
Reviews.Content: Great location, however, the hotel is greatly overpriced. I found the place dirty. Our bed sheets were stained, after we had them changed the new ones had permanent stains as well. (The hotel should invest in new bed sheets). There were stains on the bathroom door, stains on the bathroom wallpaper, even brown stains on the bathroom light switch. Furniture looked old and dirty. Lastly, it took weeks for us to be reimbursed for a room charge that was taken incorrectly by the hotel. Compared to other Sheraton Hotels, this one was very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property”
Reviews.Author: ladyess
Reviews.Content: This was my family's first trip to New York. This property was in a great location. It was clean. The staff was helpful. I heard horror stories about the size of New York hotel rooms. We found our room to be comfortable for the three of us. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and rough round the edges”
Reviews.Author: CrayGirlKent_UK
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel with my husband for our first trip to NYC 23-26 November 2009. When we arrived we were impressed by the lobby and reception area which was, although very busy, clean and quite grand. Check in was speedy and we were in our 43rd floor room, (I had emailed the hotel the previous week and asked for a room on a high floor with a view) within 10 minutes of arriving in the hotel. Our room was small, although fine for what we wanted it for. The bed was huge and comfortable, TV worked fine and mini bar was fully stocked, however very expensive. If you want snacks and drinks, the deli across the road is much more reasonable. Starbucks coffee in the room was also a nice touch. Carpet could do with a deep clean. Now the best thing of all was the view...... We had a view down to times sq...... for first time visitors we were gobsmacked... if I woke in the night, I always took a qucik glance out just to stare at it! The Bathroom - this was very old and small, not what I'd expect from a Sheraton - it could really do with updating and the shower was not very powerful. The communial areas, except for reception, were dirty and shabby. Dirty Carpets, peeling wall paper and quite a lot of dust. We did not use the restaurants, choosing to eat on the go during the day in delis and diners and in nice restaurants at night. Guest services were helpful but did not need them really, as had most of our visit already planned out. Free terminal to check in to your return flight and print boarding cards was excellent! All in all, I don't think I would return here.... I think maybe I expected it to be like Sheraton Hotels in Eurpoe, which are all 5 star and amazing! It was good enough as a base as we were out by 8am everyday and not returning, unless we needed to drop off shopping, until 10pm Location was absoultely brilliant though, great for access to Times Sq, 5th Ave, Central Park, Port Authority Bus Terminal and Broadway shows.

Reviews.Title: “Mom's night out has never been so relaxing and enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: june1976
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was extremely helpful and willing to cater to our every need, no matter how big or small.

Reviews.Title: “Very tired and overused”
Reviews.Author: Fonaweb
Reviews.Content: Thank goodness I was staying here using Starwood Points and not paying cash. Rooms not very clean, lavatory didn't work and very tired,overworked hotel that was heaving with people. Not returning

Reviews.Title: “YOUR FAMILY SHOULD STAY HERE !!”
Reviews.Author: BakaPA
Reviews.Content: Great property for families (and individuals) visiting NY. We have visited NY many times and this was our first stay here. Truly, the best place we have stayed. We will be back to NY.....and will try to stay here exclusively. OK.........great location, hard working staff, clean rooms, good food, good rates, great spa/exercise facility. And as we all do, finding a place to eat outside the hotel and close by is no problem. Subway entrance right outside the door. Easy to store your bags before check-in and after check-out to maximize your sightseeing and business time.

Reviews.Title: “The essence of the holidays in New York”
Reviews.Author: Beth2170
Reviews.Content: Every time I come to the city I stay at the Sheraton Towers for a variety of reasons including location (the hotel is never further than a few blocks from everything), staff (the consierge always gives fantastic recommendations, the cab service is unbeatable and the room and dining services are so friendly and helpful), and ambience, but I had never had the privilege of being a guest during the holidays. Being my first time in NY at this time of the year in spite of a busy schedule, one always manages to take in a few of the more noteworthy sites, and the Sheraton is a lovely embodiment of the spirit of the city during this time. The lobby and bar areas are decorated and lighted for the event and the complimentary music added to the festive atmosphere. Holiday shoppers bustled through the lobby, and one could easily spot the families enjoying their vacation in the city. The lobby was warm in contrast to the cold wind outside and it was impossible for one to not feel equally as festive in these surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Can,t Wait To come Back”
Reviews.Author: jefmar
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days, Was wonderfull, Everything was as we expected, Yes the rooms are small but clean and staff was very helpfull, Right in the middle of it all. Loved it can,t wait to come back And OMG the bed , I want one at home. Thank You for another great trip We have stayed at the towers and Times square, both are equal and great .

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: mariocap
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of staying at the Sheraton Towers the weekend before Christmas. The front desk welcomed us with a smile and had our room ready around noon, which was really convenient. The location of the hotel is impeccable. Times Square is near by, the subway is one block away. The room was clean, with all the amenities. It was cleaned promptly every morning, which speaks highly of the the service they provide. The fitness room was superb, with plenty of machines available. We had some difficulty logging on to the internet, but it was quickly addressed by George, the manager on duty. We cannot say enough about our hotel stay at the Towers. Would recommend it all!!! Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel just two blocks from the center of the Universe”
Reviews.Author: Costa_Alves
Reviews.Content: This was my second time in new york in 2009. First time i stayed at the park central, just two blocks away from the Sheraton Hotels and Towers. The Hotel main lobby gives the tourists that they arrive to a luxury hotel but besides the rest of the hotel its just a normal city hotel, with medium size rooms. I stayed one night at the 7th floor, near the elevator lobby, but that area was very noisy. I asked for a room change and they gave a room at the 33th. I stayed there 4 nights. On the last night i had to change room again, due to diferent reservations and the put me on 48th floor and i had the previlege to get a room with central park view. Wonderful view. the hotel is nice, clean, and very well positioned but i think its a bit expensive. My comparison in new york is the Park Central. a bit more cheap and has the same characteristics

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, crowded foyer”
Reviews.Author: JimP5
Reviews.Content: You have to remember you are not going to NY to see the inside of a hotel room. It was quaint and satisfactory, but very small with a crowded, busy lobby, full of noisy high school band students.

Reviews.Title: “''A wonderful start to our trip of a lifetime''”
Reviews.Author: geefamilyScotland
Reviews.Content: Having planned a USA tour over Christmas and New Year this was our starting hotel having originally stayed here with my wife previously in 1990 before having family. Returning in 2009 with our son and daughter (18 & 16) and because it was such a special holiday for the family, on arrival we were absoluitely delighted to be upgraded in order that the family may share adoining rooms and a linked suite area for relaxation. The location of the hotel was superb and the staff most helpful, especially Mr Sean Verney, the Hotel Manager who had arranged some extras on arrival. It definately won't be another 20 years before we visit NYC, especially at Christmas time and I would definately return once again to the Sheraton. My son used the fitness suite each day and as a base for sightseeing it was absolutely perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton quality”
Reviews.Author: amyandandrew
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family over the Xmas holidays. First night got a standard room with club access due to platinum status. Next four nights was upgraded to a corner suite. We had a great time but was surprised the club was closed over 24, 25, 26. Location was very convenient to shows, times square, central park etc. Very clean, and concierge staff very helpful. Park your car a few blocks away and save big if there for a few nights.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton New Yorker has delivers for the multi-tasking business person”
Reviews.Author: SportsMarketingguy
Reviews.Content: Great location for multiple meetings since it is right in midtown and people can get to you easily. Easy access to subways and cabs. Consierege staff is extremely helpful in getting you around, I find them very experienced as they have been doing their jobs for a long period. They know the town. Club level for those Starwood platinum and gold members is outstanding amenity. Close to the glitter of Times Square, but not too close. Always gives me a good feel of being in New York without being overwhelmed.

Reviews.Title: “Too big and busy to live up to its price”
Reviews.Author: EdRockster
Reviews.Content: Even for NYC, I found this hotel to be pricey, but more than that, the facilities and the service were incredibly lacking. We called the night before our arrival at this hotel to see if we could get an early check-in. After waiting on hold and listening to an annoying recording over and over, we were told in no uncertain terms, we could absolutely not check-in early; but they'd be willing to check our bags while they make ready our room; I would just need to pre-register. I arrived to find the lobby filled with lines. It was difficult to tell which one to get into, so I asked a bellman. He indicated which line was for registering, and I got in line. After a short while, I was at the desk with a reasonably nice young man. He promised I would not have to wait in the other long line to check my bags, that I could just drop them off with the bellman. The bellman, on the other hand, said that the longer line was indeed the line to drop bags off. We waited and made our way through the length of the lobby, around toward the ballrooms and finally to an elevator where another bellman took us down to another level and yet another line to wait in to check our bags. Finally, we checked our bags and could head out to explore the city. We returned well after the time our room was promised and found that pre-registering didn't really save us anything. We waited in the registration line again, and then waited in the line to pick up our bags. We headed to our room. I opened the door, expecting a couch, or at least an easy chair. The room had neither. The room was hot, so we attempted to turn on the AC, but that only made it hotter, so I called Guest Services. After several minutes of the same annoying recording, a live person finally answered and promised she would send up an engineer. The engineer came in and said the AC doesn't work in NYC in the winter, which was odd because the hotel I staying in a few blocks away the night before had a perfectly working AC. He offered to open a window, and when I mentioned the noise, he said, "That's the way it is. It's New York City." Guest services called me back later to ask about the service I received from the "engineer," and I advised them of my displeasure. They indicated they would have a manager call me. The call never came through. The next morning, I figured the least they could do is let us have a late check-out. Again the extended wait for Guest Services with our old friend the annoying recording, and again, in no uncertain terms, absolutely not. I generally prefer to stay at Marriotts. The customer service there is always impeccable. I'm not sure if this is typical of the treatment at all Sheratons, but I certainly won't be back to this one! One bright spot, but this had nothing to do with the hotel, there is a lovely 24 hour deli around the corner called Duke's Cafe. Tastey food available in the middle of the night.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel with the Perfect Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: u199725u
Reviews.Content: Me and 6 other girls went to NY for a girls Vaca and we stayed at the Sheraton NY and Towers. When we entered the hotel the first word to describe it was CLASS. What a clean and nice hotel!! The check in was less than 2 minutes. The rooms were cleaned everyday and the toiletries were replenished! To our surprise we had fresh fruits, water and sodas sent to our room courtosy of Jorge Guerrero, Guest Service Manager. He even left us a voicemail asking if there was anything they could do to make our stay better. I travel a lot and never received such service from a hotel guest manager!! This is def the hotel for us next time we come to NYC!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: ejwdgw
Reviews.Content: We arrived late on the 22nd December, 2009. I was greeted by a rude doorman and it went downhill from there. My husband and I are Platnum Starwood Members and have stayed at many Sheridans, but when we got to our room we where both horrified,disgusted, speechless and could not believe this hotel had the nerve to call itself a Sheridan. It was like a prison cell, dark and dirty, the bathroom was the size of a peanut. We left within 25 minutes of arriving and spent the next 16 days in nyc at the Waldorf Astoria. I do not recommend this hotel if you are used to class...

Reviews.Title: “Successful and full of great memories!”
Reviews.Author: BTSeattle
Reviews.Content: My experience, as always, was great at the Sheraton NY. It is very convenient to all that we needed from a business and pleasure point of view. I will always return to this hotel and have referred many people there as well. The lobby is full of good energy, the Club Level cafe is a great start to my morning, and the bed is very comfortable. The only negative feedback I would give is the temperature of the room...the cool/warm controls aren't very modifiable in the room. Otherwise, excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded My Expectations”
Reviews.Author: GES132
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler so I am platinum member with Starwood. I have stayed at this hotel in the past and was somewhat disappointed with the service but this time was amazing. The Guest Service Manager, Jorge Guerrero and Agent, Vondeen Arrundell, went out of ther way to make my daugher and I comfortable. The service exceeded my expecations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor service.”
Reviews.Author: Travellinglight81
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for a week from 29th December 2009 to 5th Jan 2010. The location of the hotel is great, 5 minutes walk from Times Square, 15 mins from Central Park, loads of restaurants and bars around the hotel and easy to get a taxi outside the hotel if needs be. However, the customer service was poor, we constantly felt like we were putting staff out when we asked questions due to their dismissive, rude and unhelpful responses. The decor of the rooms didn't reflect the price we paid per night, the bathroom was small, the bath even smaller. We had to pay to leave our bags (per bag) at the hotel on the day of departure, until we left for the airport. Is this normal in the US? I've never had this situation at a hotel before and wonder if it's the norm over there. The beds are extremely comfortable though and it was nice to have Starbucks coffee in our room it just would have been nice to have milk rather then powdered "creamer," which is vile. Milk is available, at an extra charge of about $5 per glass so we ended up buying milk from a supermarket. The cost of food and drink at the hotel is beyond expensive but due to the central location there's not really any need to eat the hotel and they didn't seem to mind people buying pizza/burgers from take aways and eating them in the bar area. New York City is great however, I would certainly go back I just wouldn't stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location: Good Otherwise: Awful”
Reviews.Author: SYLVIATOPEKA
Reviews.Content: Wanted a great location for New Year's Eve and a room with a view. Got a view of the office building across the street from our dimly-lit closet (excuse me, "room"). $15 per day wired Internet, no wi-fi in the "club lounge." Wiseguy desk clerk ("close your eyes and you can see the ocean, open your eyes and you can see the city."--funny for nearly $400 a night). The double beds were the size of a small twin bed. No one could tell me how to set the clock radio. The blinds didn't work (so what did we have to look at?). Learn from our expensive mistake-----Find yourself another place to stay in midtown, this is not a value at all.

Reviews.Title: “We had a good stay”
Reviews.Author: Robert71Houston
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a nice room upgrade and welcome bottle of wine & cheese courtesy of guest services coordinator Jorge Guerrero. Being a frequent stayer has its pluses. We really like the amenities and the service quality. The one drawback of the hotel is that it gets so much traffic it is getting a "used" look; they plan to update and remodel soon we are told.

Reviews.Title: “Don't make phone calls from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: russiantwin
Reviews.Content: Went to NYC with girlfriends for christmas. We had 2 different reservations. Myself and my friend's sister were in one room and it was a surprise to my friend from England that her sister was coming. When i made the reservation I made it clear that I wanted to have this guest on the room but that it be kept secret since it was a surprise. Needless to say, the surprise was ruined by the hotel when my friend from England checked in a few hours before we arrived and the hotel asked her if it was for the surprise guest. When we checked in a few hours later we were given a room that had not been made up and it was already 9 pm. We were given a $15 coupon for the lounge downstairs which we never used and were moved to another room. The room was nice, but i did find a nut shell in my bed. The climate control sucked and the room was very warm. The concierge service was not very helpful. We made numerous attempts to book dining reservations throught the hotel concierge and we not called back. The front desk staff were very bland and my guest made 2 phone one minute calls from the hotel and was charged a riduculous $56 dollars. The rate was not posted on the phone list, only a surcharge of $2.50. We were also charged for bar items that were not taken from the fridge which we had to reconcile on checkout. The hotel has a good location, close Time Square. Was it worth $240 a night? No because the service was horrible.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to New York, this is the hotel for you.”
Reviews.Author: KJTurner
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to New York & we absolutely loved everything about it. Our travel agent recommended this hotel as its central to most things. It was. It was five minutes from Central Park, five minutes from Times Square, we could not have asked for a better hotel. The hotel was lovely, the staff were very pleasant and our room was on the 41st floor, the view was lovely. The room was clean & warm, which we needed as it was snowing outside. The towels were changed every day & the beds were made, who could want more. We did not eat at the hotel as the prices were quite high, so we ate five minutes away at Park Cafe. Would definately stay here again. 10/10

Reviews.Title: “A terrific experience with phenomenal staff”
Reviews.Author: chuckoNewPaltz_NY
Reviews.Content: I would absolutely recommend this hotel. My wife and I will come back again in a hearbeat. Sean Verney made our stay a wonderful experience, and his staff is very capable and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “As a Gold Member I am sorry to say this was the worst stay I have had in a long long time.”
Reviews.Author: TravelExec39
Reviews.Content: I really like Sheratons. I have stayed at their family of hotels all around the world, and I really hate to say this was an experience that ranked at the bottom of my list for almost any hotel. The room was actually worse than rooms I have stayed at in two-star hotels, with a pedestal sink that was cracked or broken in a number of places. There is no air conditioning in the room AT ALL, and an old old heating system. I was able to slide open the window but then it came off track and couldn't be completely closed again and even in the midst of the blizzard the room was only tolerable. I was convinced that something must have gone wrong with my reservation since I am a Gold SPG member but when I went downstairs the desk assured me the room was standard. The sheets--itchy. The towels cheap. Even if it is an ideal location I still wouldn't give it more than 2.5 stars. The Westin, W, and another Sheraton are all within a few blocks. I can't imagine any of them being worse than this place. The service? Well we left a pair of shoes in the room and didn't discover it until we were in another city. We called for three days asking if they found them. Each time someone said they would look into it an call us back. No one ever did. Finally on the fourth day we insisted on talking to a manager. She was in a meeting, and when she called back, she clearly did not want to talk to us. She was curt, almost rude, and said she would look into it and call back. No such luck. She did have someone else call back who was even more rude, whosaid they had the shoes and needed a FedEx account number or a credit card so that we could pay to have them shipped back to us. If they had asked that during the first three days when we were looking for them that would have been great, but given the previous lack of customer service they could've at least have paid to send the shoes back. So in short, if you plan to stay at a Sheraton, pick one of the other ones nearby. Personally, I may just go back to Marriott when in New York. This isn't a complaint against Sheratons as a whole--I have stayed at two others this month as well and had a great time. But don't say you weren't warned.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location!”
Reviews.Author: eliciarn
Reviews.Content: I was somewhat apprehensive about making my priceline reservation for this 4 star hotel in the heart of the things to do district of NYC but overall, the experience was better then I expected. I booked 2 rooms thru priceline and got a really good rate of $175/night each in the middle of December. At the time of booking, I requested King beds. The day before we arrived, I called the front desk @ The Sheraton to mention our request for King beds and they said they would make a notation and every attempt to accomodate. The day of arrival, after the madness of trying to get into their parking garage, we checked in @ the desk and were told we could have an early check in if we would take 2 doubles or we could wander around for a couple of hours until 3pm to get in a king room. We decided to wait for the king, since we were 2 couples in each room and this was somewhat of a romantic holiday type get a way. I was very dissappointed when we arrived back @ 2:30pm-checked in, got to our adjoining rooms on the 8th floor and sure enough.....DOUBLE BEDS!!!! I called the front desk immediately and was treated as a special priceline customer ~got the response of "Priceline does not guarantee bed availability or requests" and "we are sold out of king rooms" YEAH! I know priceline does not make guarantees however was told at check in to walk around and come back for our KING BEDS! So, my hubby slept in 1 bed and I slept in the other with our 5 month old son. The room was really not as small as I had expected based on the reviews, but I have never been to NYC to compare. The decor was friendly and the room and beds were very clean. No complaints about the entire hotel atmosphere. Also, although we would have liked to snuggle together in a king, the beds were exceptionally comfortable! Be careful not to even open the fridge in your room AKA "mini bar" my husband opened it and moved a can of pop (I said moved, not took out or consumed!) to set a jar of baby food in there and the next morning we had a bill for $27 under our door for 1 can of soda and 2 beers---none of which we consumed. I immediately called the front desk and their first response was "did you move anything in there?" LOL! They did correct this and we were not billed but this is ridiculous! The location was fantastic! We easily walked to Times Square, Rockefeller Center and Central Park with our 5 month old in tow. There were plenty of good places to eat and shop. Be prepared to PAY out the ying yang for parking.....we arrived on a Tuesday @ 11am and got our car of their garage by noon on a Thursday and had to give them $100!!!! Overall, I would say we had a nice stay and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rose1963
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews and this hotel being listed as only 3 stars, I was worried about the rooms. Immediately upon arriving at this hotel, I knew my stay would be fine. The rooms were very clean and there were only minor flaws in the room such as the wallpaper ripped a little in the bathroom, paint missing on the door etc.. However, the walls did seem very thin and conversations could be heard in the next room, but maybe they were just loud people. The hallways noise also seemed very loud when we attempted to sleep in a little in the mornings. Perfect location to Times Square, Broadways shows, Rockefeller Center.

Reviews.Title: “They ruined the lobby!”
Reviews.Author: lmay
Reviews.Content: I still recommend this hotel for the location and price but they ruined my favorite thing about the hotel. The lobby used to have a large seating area outside the bar where you could sit and drink a cocktail and people watch. They have taken over half that space away and replaced it with an empty gift shop and unused space. The rest is taken up with a few computer screens that use a ton of space and tthat he teenagers monopolize. This seems like a stupid waste of space since the teenagers stay there for hours and don't order drinks. Bad for everyone except a few teenagers.

Reviews.Title: “it's tired”
Reviews.Author: DRT1404
Reviews.Content: the hotel rooms are tired, heavy and the a/c didn't work. the staff was tolerant of the guests but not in a hurry to be of service. it needs a good renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: BarleyHops
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton was a pleasant surprise. The staff was super friendly. The hotel was perfectly located a few blocks north of the Theater District. The rooms were compact but understandable for NYC, but they were very clean and elegant. I would recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “there is a screw that is loose in the big apple”
Reviews.Author: surveysez
Reviews.Content: nice place just a bit too pricey for the average joe

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location”
Reviews.Author: boxerdog101
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on times square and is just a walk away from many shops and sites. Its about a 10 minute walk to madame tussauds and planet hollywood. There are a variety of different places to shop and eat. Its about a 20-25 mintute walk to the boat trip areas which are highly recomended. The hotel is also near top of the rock, the empire state building and Macys. (you need to go the right way for is to be a short walk) There are also many bus stops surrounding the area. The hotel is a 10-15 minute walk away from central park zoo. The Hotel is Catering and the Service is very good. (I would advise getting the New York Pass from Planet Hollywood. There are so many attractions you can visit and the hotels location can make the travelling to the places easier)

Reviews.Title: “Tourist trap”
Reviews.Author: travelgirly1
Reviews.Content: The good the bad and the ugly. The good: Decent beds and clean sheets and modern looking decor. And two phone lines, which came in handy. Relatively clean (no bed bugs, yay!) The bad: Never mind the "Starwood" label on anything associated with this hotel. These guys are here for one purpose and one purpose only - to make as much money from you as possible. Any difficulties were met with hostility from the staff starting with the fact that our entire stay was charged on the credit card when my friend placed the room on hold while we looked around about a month before our stay. When we tried to back out they said, "Too bad, we charged it. Sure you can cancel, but you'll have to pay us $1,000." The supervisor didn't care. Sheraton corporate office didn't care either. This set the tone and unfortunately, Sheraton New York Hotel & Towers never bothered to make any other impression except that they would charge the heck out of you if you let your guard down. I wanted a newspaper but was told there are no newspapers on weekends. I wanted a free breakfast. I was informed that the deal my friend booked did not include any sort of continental breakfast yet it was $257/night not including the 30% NY taxes. I wanted to print out my boarding pass in the midst of the historic snowstorm that had messed up my flight. I asked the concierge for help - just a second or two. I was told to go downstairs to the business center and pay to use the internet. There were a few free terminals in the lobby, but they were hijaked by 10-year-olds playing computer games. The 1960s looking dials to the heater were hidden under a modern heating vent and I couldn't figure out how to turn on the heat. I woke up freezing and had to call the desk to ask. I was on hold for 20 minutes at 3 a.m. That's a long time when all you want to do is get a quick answer so you can go back to sleep. Turns out the room becomes either stiffling hot or freezing as the low-medium-high and hot-cold dials seem to be for decoration only. Very strange. The ugly: The hotel was originally built in the 1960s (I think) and though it initially looks decent, as you begin to hang out for a while you realize that it needs a major overhaul. The toilet flushed UPWARDS. Meaning that the water and anything else in the toilet came cascading skyward and onto a person prior to going down the toilet. I called twice on this and they didn't fix it. A call came in to find out if I was happy with the result of the repair. No, actually, I said, I am still getting crap blown into my face and on my jeans whenever I forget to close the lid before flushing. They sent a second guy up who told me it was a "special toilet" and I needed to "flush it very, very slowly" -- yeah, it's special because it's broken, thanks. They never followed up after that. My flight was cancelled and rebooked for seven days later. I needed to make some calls to try to get out of town sooner and was on the phones for 8-10 hours. All those 1-800 numbers had a charge associated with them. Ouch! The front desk took 50% of the charges off, but not without a fight. In fact, the supervisor laughed at me when I said I would write about how uncooperative they were on Tripadvisor. Very condescending of her. 1500 flights were cancelled and it was a special circumstance. I had hoped for a little compassion, but nope. I would not ever stay here again. I've lived in New York and stayed in hotels around the city for the past 5 years. This one is 50% more than what you'd pay in other really nice places that aren't smack in the middle of midtown. Try one of the cute neighborhoods a couple subway stops away for the true New York experience. I wouldn't touch this place again and not because of the minor problems - because of the extremely unhelpful attitude of the staff.
