Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rizzomatic05
Reviews.Content: Let's first start off by thanking the guest services manager, Jorge Guerrero. He treated me and my girlfriend with respect, he gave us directions to a great cuban resturaunt, and even gave us a complimentary bottle of wine and platter of cheese...NOW...all that aside, my stay at this hotel was horrible...Lets start off with the room condition. The closet door was hanging off the hinges, so we asked for another room. The second room was even worse. Making a long story short...The blinds didn't work, we couldn't get the heat to shut off, so we tried to open the window and that didn't work, then we got it open and it wouldn't close. we we're on the 35th floor and it was snowin!!!! The sheets had a small blood stain on them, and it took them 3 hours to give us new ones at 12:00am. I paid for a romance package and got nothin...I had to call the front desk to remind them about it and it spoiled my surprise...And to top it all off, they hit me with a 117$ parking tab...Thanks alot sheraton...you almost ruined my weekend! If it wasn't for Jorge, i wouldve left the first day. I understand their in Times Square but never sacrafice location for service and cleanliness...

Reviews.Title: “Haven't had my stay yet, but service has been great already.”
Reviews.Author: kctravelerMissouri
Reviews.Content: I made reservations at this hotel through Travelocity, and was assigned to a king room, rather than the room with two beds that I requested. Travelocity refused to assist me, but when I called the hotel directly, they were very kind and accommodating. I am looking forward to my stay in January.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT SERVICE EVEN BEFORE STAY”
Reviews.Author: edeters
Reviews.Content: I was having MAJOR issues with my travel company they split my 7 days into 3 day reservations and nothing was linked together, not a good thing to have happened over New Year’s .. However, after calling and talking with JOY CLARKE she finally found all the reservations got them all linked and now we don’t have to move rooms three times during our stay.. THANKS JOY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Sucks”
Reviews.Author: aatatusko
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through a 3rd party, pl, and we knew it was not refundable, however, we had and historic 26 inches of snow that even my suv couldn't make it through. PL tried for four hours to get us a refund. Sheraton: No. Most hotels will either give you a credit for a future stay or something. Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers......nada. I called them at 9am to release the rooms to someone else....I will Never Ever Ever stay at a Sheraton again, and you know what, neither will my kids,or any of my other relatives.

Reviews.Title: “Warm hospitality and a delightful stay”
Reviews.Author: NycOnTheRoadAgain75
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for sincere hospitality, clean rooms and the perfect NYC location, I highly recommend this hotel. From the front desk to the management, the staff is helpful and always willing to help. The housekeeper even engaged in conversation when departing to ensure I enjoyed my stay and wished me safe and pleasant travels.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel In Midtown”
Reviews.Author: MikeManis
Reviews.Content: For buisness reasons you want to stay here. They have top restaurants to entertain clients and friends. I love the central midtown location for a nite at the theatre. Try this place and youll be back. Michael Manis NY

Reviews.Title: “Not what you would expect for a Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: travelingclouds
Reviews.Content: My sister, cousins, and I came to New York to celebrate our birthdays and as a short vacation to visit family and friends. When I booked this hotel, my mistake was looking only at the hotel's web-page and not looking at this site for reviews. The pictures of the rooms are very deceiving. There were 4 of us staying in a double bed room and from the picture on the web-page, it looks like there is plenty of room to walk around and store luggage. When we actually get there, there's hardly any room to even walk between the 2 beds, let a alone, on either side of the beds. (Mind you, we are in our late 20's and average or even below average for our size/build) What did this mean for us? There was absolutely no where to really store out luggage, let alone, open our bags or get ourselves ready. The website states the double bed room has a "large work desks positioned with a view of the window" but fails to mention that this desk will be the only place you will be able to store your luggage if there is more than one person in the room. Granted, were were not there for business, but if we were and wanted to use the desk, it would not have been possible; it was not even possible to move the chair around very much. Must pay for internet access. One of my pet peeves is a hotel that has a shower head that either do not have the right amount of water pressure or one that is clogged letting water come out every which way. This hotel definitely fit this bill. The good things about this hotel: the beds and pillows are nice; the lobby is beautiful; and the hotel is in a good location. If you are looking for a hotel that you do not plan to spend ANY time in or even "get ready" in, then this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Doing Business in Midtown? STAY HERE!! A++”
Reviews.Author: Renny1
Reviews.Content: I have probably logged 50 nights at this hotel in the past two years and have always found the front desk staff delightful and efficient, the rooms well kept up and fresh (they seem to rotate renovations at a good pace). The lobby has enough energy to make it a fun spot to sit and catch up on email and the business center is fully equipped to help you get those last minute Powerpoints and documents ready in color or black and white. It is easy to get to all midtown business locations (and downtown via subway) from here and a solid high service hotel in a reasonable price range.

Reviews.Title: “More like a 1 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: HonorsKing
Reviews.Content: Issue # 1: The Sheraton pre-pay policy is not what you expect. When you make a pre-paid reservation, it is NOT pre-paid. Per their policy, you have to pay around 86% of the total room rate for your stay a the time of booking. I made the silly assumption that they in fact did follow their policy, and went on to make other pre-paid reservations for other hotels, rental car, tours, etc. Come to find out, they don't get around to charging you until 2 days before you are to arrive, and for the total amount, not the 86%. This left me in NYC without a hotel and without extra money to pay for one, in December. I'm partly to blame for not checking, but my experience is not unique. The rest of my family also noted that they were charged 2 days before arrival. My "Pre-Paid" reservations were made 6 weeks in advance. Issue #2: The standard double room is so small, two suitcases is all you have room for, and the second one will have to go under the desk or in the bathtub. To contrast, the rooms at the Hilton across the street, for about the same price, could actually sleep 5-6 (if they'd let you), with luggage, and be comfortable. Issue # 3: The lobby is beautiful, however, the floor we were on was terrible. The carpet was ragged, with the seams coming apart, and bubling/uneven. The hallways were constantly littered with room service carts, often left for more than 24 hours. When we checked out, at around 10 am, there were 7 carts between us and the elevators, one cart had an open mustard bottle that had spilled all over the carpet. It had been spilled since at least 6 PM the night before, when I reported it to the front desk. We had to push trash out of the way to get our luggage through. It was a Sunday morning after a rainy Saturday, but still, it was disgusting. Reminded me of that Jack in the Box commercial with the guy eating room service cart left-overs, however, the commercial was funny, this wasn't.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Hotel & Towers - Best Ever - Room 4639”
Reviews.Author: vizionme101
Reviews.Content: As a travel agent, I've visted many hotels that I was pleased with. The Sheraton Hotel and Towers has definitely moved to the top of my list. The entire process at the hotel went smoothly. Check-in with Maritza was fabulous. After battling with the New York traffic and finally arriving at the hotel, everything was great. Jorge Guerrero - The Guest Service Manager was by far the best. I have never seen an employee at a hotel go far and beyond for their guests. He made sure that everything in our room was to our standards and likings. We were even upgraded to the Club Level room. Although the Club Level Lounge was closed for the weekend, he still made sure we received the amentities that we would have gotten if it was open. I am definitely going to recommend this hotel to friends, clients, business partners, etc. The Sheraton Hotel and Towers definitely went beyond expectations and I will be staying there again when I go to New York. Thanks Sheraton for making my stay a memorable one! By the way - the Cheese and Fruit platter and bottle of white wine was the best!

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly and Accommodating”
Reviews.Author: nurselawyer
Reviews.Content: My two sisters and I just returned from a "grandmother-grandaughter" trip to New York City. Traveling from Texas, New Mexico, Idaho, and Upstate New York, we spent 4 special days with our 6 - 8 year old grandaughters visiting NYC landmarks, museums, and enjoying the Radio City Music Hall Chrismas Spectacular. We chose this hotel because of positive previous stays and location. Our trip was made particularly memorable by Sharon Gilsenan, Director of Reservations at the Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers. From my first phone call to her 7 months ago to our arrival at the hotel, she efficiently coordinated our reservation, arranging rooms next to each other on the club floor and making every effort to ensure our comfortable stay in NYC. Imagine our surprise when one evening we had a complmentary cheese/fruit platter and wine delivered to our room with a lovely note from Sharon welcoming us to the hotel. Since our families have traveled extensively, both in the US and internationally, we commented it is rare to experience such personal attention and warmth in a large urban hotel. Thank you for making this an unforgettable trip. MKM, GBC, AMP and grandaughters

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Shooting-Star1
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough! The location was wonderful and it was so comfortable and plush! The room was a brilliant size and very clean. There was a fantastic coffee shop area downstairs where you could grab a bagel or pastry and coffee before heading out for the day. The check in staff were very efficient and friendly-and whenever we saw any staff in the hotel they always said hello and wished us a great day. If you're wondering whether to book - from my experience I would say yes!! It was expensive but after a tiring day of being a tourist it was wonderful to have somewhere so wonderful to come back to. Grade A!!

Reviews.Title: “worst Sheraton I have ever been to, steer clear, Sheraton should be ashamed!”
Reviews.Author: travelingZ
Reviews.Content: Where do i start. I checked in, asked for an upgrade (I am an SPG Gold member) but I was denied, I was told the hotel was fully booked (I checked online but they had lots of rooms available). Fine I told myself whatever...I get to my room, and honestly I am disgusted. The floor to the room is covered with dark black stains. I feel like I am staying in a motel 8. I call the front desk and ask for another room and they give me one...(the story doesn't end yet!) As i am settling into my room and getting ready for bed, i pull the sheets back and i am greeted by bloodstains on the bed. horrible! I am so tired in dealing with the front desk that i decide to sleep on the side of the bed without the bloodstains. The next morning i pull open the shower and i am greeted by the sight of someone's pubic hair on the wall! Yuk!! I look down on the floor and I see what looks to be rat droppings. This place is really a dump! The next day, I call down to ask for a late checkout since my flight leaves so late. The front desk clerk says oh I can't give you a late check out because we are sold out. I decide to call her on her lie and say "I have the sheraton website up right here and they show plenty of rooms available". As soon as I say this she puts me on hold, then she returns and says "Oh that's okay my manager okayed the late check out". This place is a pit. I would never EVER stay here again. Do yourself a favor and check into the Hilton, better service and better location.

Reviews.Title: “For value and pleasure The Sheratons a treasure.”
Reviews.Author: beauCorkIreland
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Sheraton every Thanksgiving for the past six years. All our needs are looked after by Sharon Gilsenan (reservation manager),who does an excellent job and goes above and beyond the call of duty to make our stay a pleasant one. We almost feel like one of the family at this stage and it is great to see all the the same friendly, familiar faces every year. The location of the hotel is excellent for both shopping and night life and the rooms are so comfy that it is almost impossible to drag yourself out of those cozy beds, because of the great treatment we get at the Sheraton we have never ever thought of staying any where else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and great value for the price.”
Reviews.Author: t0ne77
Reviews.Content: My wife and I frequently travel to NYC, I primarily go for business and she travels for leisure. We typically stay at the Sheraton for several reasons; it's located near Time Square, excellent restaurants in walking distance, the theater district, nightlife and most of all the Service at the hotel....its Excellent. I would like to thank Jorge Guerrero, Guest Service Manager for making our stay extremely pleasant. He genuinely cares about his guests and asked our opinion on how to improve the service at the hotel... We don't usually receive a call from Gusts Services..in many cases when we check out we are asked about our stay....I would recommend this hotel to anyone, in particular close friends and family...

Reviews.Title: “Short visit to New York”
Reviews.Author: OJK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton in New York for 4 nights at the end of Nov. We booked an extra room on arrival for our two boys - quoted $199 per night but on check out was $245 (4 diff taxes were added). Hotel is busy, has 50 floors with a separate lift to floors 21-40. Rooms are small for US standard but 42 in TV and great beds make up for this. Great location 5mins walk to times square or central park, subway 1 min away and tour buses stop outside. Breakfast best on 44th floor, need special key access and overcrowded 8-10 but ok 10-11am best for views. Tour buses are $44 for 2 hour trip but excellent value - get on/ get off for statue of liberty (go on a sunday rather than a saturday and save 1.5 hours queueing) ,Maceys, empire state attractions. Broadway shows not a patch on London west end (more like 'Fame' rehearsals! avoid. Very busy, 40% sales in large stores but meals, drinks and entertainment is very costly. A great place for a week's stay - New Yorkers all very friendly and atmosphere / experience not to be missed

Reviews.Title: “Iffy...”
Reviews.Author: bluedoor8
Reviews.Content: OK - this hotel looks great on the outside, the lobby, the entryway, etc. But the room was really yucky, really. The bathroom was definitely not cleaned properly (there were even pubic hairs on the floor next to the tub - yuck). The carpet was stained in several places... why not get that up with a steam cleaner, right? Oh well. The staff was really good, except for the parking people - wow were they disconnected and rude. The hotel is in a PERFECT location though - there's a subway station right on the corner and it's super close to Times Square and Broadway and Central Park. I mean, really a great location. We paid $307/night for our double-double room and I guess, for your NYC, that's a pretty good rate. So, the down side - the room cleanliness. The up side - the staff, nice common areas, GREAT location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlbertaCanadiangirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a Great Location, especially to watch the Macys Day Parade. We paid extra for a room with parade view and the view was great but I don't really think it was worth the price because they were charging the same price no matter if you were on the 5th floor or the 30th floor. The rooms were very small but we were in New York so I was expecting this. The hotel did have a small lounge, many nights it was full with no seats left. Some of the staff were very friendly, however others were not. This hotel is right in Times Square, close to shopping, shows, and central park. If you are planning a trip to New York I suggest staying someone in Time Square, there are many hotels along Broadway or 7th Ave this is where you want to be. Overall this hotel was a Nice hotel but not Great, when I go back I will be trying another hotel in Times square. On a side note! LOVED NYC! If you like Sex and the City make sure to book a Sex and the City tour through City Tours! It was Great!

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfactory-Excellent Location for Broadway Shows”
Reviews.Author: Ocean4Lover
Reviews.Content: It's a good hotel for a good value and a great location for seeing a broadway show. It's about an 8 block walk (which is actually short time-wise in NY). Expect crowded busy new york theater sidewalks but it is part of the experience. Parking is about $42 per night at the hotel. Front desk a little slow but accomodating. Beds and Bathroom clean and comfy. Had a room with 2 double beds and it was great for my friend and I . Got a great rate through priceline, but usually book on www.spg.com and get pretty close to $200.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Service”
Reviews.Author: Cadzilla
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton NY Hotel and Towers makes each and every stay a memorable one. It is like a home away from home except I get trated better at the Sheraton. From the minute you check in until the time you check out you are treated with superior service from all hotel staff members. There is no other place I stay at. Like they say, "you belong".

Reviews.Title: “If you need to stay in this area - try another hotel”
Reviews.Author: imari96
Reviews.Content: The last two business trips to the city this year, I stayed at the Hilton New York. I decided to try this hotel. It won't be my first (or second or third choice) going forward. The check in was average. My room, though, smelt strongly of cinnamon air freshner. The reason - the previous guest had smoked in the bathroom so housekeeping was trying to masking this smell. The receptionist was helpful and changed my room right away. The room itself is smaller than at the Hilton (same price). There isn't enough room to put the dresser right in front of the bed so it's in the corner near the closet. Therefore, the tv is in the corner as well. There is a desk the width of the room near the window. What I disliked the most was that there was no wireless internet and only a short cable to use. I wasn't able to sit on the bed to do any work. The room was HOT at night and the temperature didn't work. The bathroom decor was a bit shabby and the size was small. The bed was comfortable though. I did like the cafe in the lobby and the free interet access there too. I had to pay a handling fee to collect my package at the business center. You also have to pay to use the gym, which is annoying. In all, there was nother really wrong with the hotel - it was average. For the right price, maybe i woudl stay here again but if it's the same price as the Hilton - I would choose the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room at great location”
Reviews.Author: arblueyes
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on priceline for $170/night. We had a room on the 19th floor with 2 double beds & there was plenty of room for our luggage. The room had large windows with a great view. The beds were very comfortable & I didn't hear any noise from adjoining rooms. I could hear occasional sirens from the street but nothing that bothered us. I was happy with the cleanliness & appearance of the room & bathroom. Check-in was very efficient & although our room wasn't ready (it was only 11 am) they held our luggage until our room was ready. The only negative is that upon checking out, they charge a fee if you need them to hold your luggage. But all the staff we encountered were very friendly & helpful. This hotel is at a great location - close to the subway, Times Square, Central Park, Rockefeller Center, 5th Avenue, etc... & very safe. I would definitely stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Twain34
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on SPG points for one night to get a jump on a holiday weekend. It served its purpose of being a place to sleep and regroup. But don't expect a lot more from it. Good stuff: Registration was a snap; the room was clean and fairly updated; bed was comfortable; location was perfect and easy to get a cab, take the subway or walk around to see a show; this hotel also caters to tourists (for better or worse) so they are accustomed to dealing with all sorts of issues Bad stuff: Valet parking was difficult and no bell service to help with our bag; room was very warm -- when we asked for help with it, they said A/C was off for season and offered to open our windows (which cooled off the room, but was LOUD outside, even 30 stories up); shower was so-so; room is small (but typical for NYC); breakfast was VERY expensive for a buffet ($27 pp and not worth that much). So, would I stay here again? Maybe. It's fine for a few nights as a place to stay and nothing else. But for those looking to be "wowed" by a hotel, there are better choices (the Westin Times Square being one of them).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views high above Times Square in our Luxury Suite”
Reviews.Author: jredoct18
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ideally located near all relevant subway lines and just a block from Times Square. We had a corner suite with a view of Manhattan and the Hudson. It was breathtaking. The hotel employees were gracious and helpful. The rooms were large and clean. My only complaint is that the club room which offers complimentary breakfast and cocktails was not open Friday evening-Sunday. It would have been nice to have that amenity offered daily. Otherwise, the hotel is five-star all the way.

Reviews.Title: “First Visit and dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: shorinryu2
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to the city. This is also the first time I have ever written a review. We were dissapointed with the room for numerous reasons. Apon our arrival 5:15pm the room wasn't ready we arrived at the room the maid was still cleaning and getting the room ready, we left our bags and had to come back later. The television did'nt work, not that we were there to watch TV, but it was your in room source of info on the hotel, your billing ect. The temperature control unit heating / cooling only blew ambient air, to adjust the temp in the room I had to open a window. This wasn't the best option as this room looked out over a lower roof which supported numerous aircondioning units for the hotel, these were loud and ran constantly. The bedside lamp on the left didn't work, so if you wanted to read before bed this wasn't an option. The room was somewhat dated, carpets worn, peeling paint in the bathroom, the door had numerous areas were it was dented or scratch and they just painted over it, okay nit-picky but its what I saw. The first morning I reported these issues to the front desk, she took notes and that evening when we return nothing had been addressed. I am not a person who typically makes a big deal about things, these weren't life altering. Maybe I should have search out the front desk manager to get these issues addressed, this is a very exspensive hotel to stay at and everything should have been in order. Would I stay here again, not likely.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location”
Reviews.Author: macrules
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located between Times Square and Central Park. This is a very large hotel with a busy lobby day and night but it's not a problem at all. We were given a room with a view to Times Square which was amazing. The room was quite spacious and the bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept in. We actually ordered the bed linen on line when we got home as we wanted to re-create the cozy feeling of the Sheraton bed as best we could. As a light sleeper the only drawback was the noise, it truly is the city that never sleeps and on our first night, neither did I. However, I invested in some earplugs and it solved the problem so don't let it deter you. The subway stop is right next door and we used the subway every day and always felt quite safe, day and night. The hotel is walking distance to so many attractions and sites. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to N.Y

Reviews.Title: “Best 21st Birthday Celebration I Could Have Asked For”
Reviews.Author: alymar10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton with a group of 5 friends from November 14th through 15th. We were there to celebrate my 21st birthday and really just needed a place to crash for the night since we're all from NJ and PA and were planning to go out until the wee hours. Check-in around 7:15 was very prompt and the staff member assisting us was both friendly and efficient. We had a three room suite on the 9th floor. It was perfect for our group - clean and spacious. Times Square was just a quick walk away and after dinner there, we were heading over to Webster Hall. The concierge gave us passes for free admissions and no wait to get into the club (although most people had this form of pass so we did have to wait for 10 minutes or so). He was helpful in instructing us how to get there and how to get in, and printed off information for us as well. Given that there were 6 people in our party but taxis can only accommodate 4 people, the bellman told us to hold on while he found us transportation to the club. After about a minute, he told us a limo could take us where we needed to go for $30! Wow! It pulled up 30 seconds after that and we were on our way. We all slept well after arriving back to the hotel a little before 4am. Check out the next morning was also quick, and we were back on the bus to PA without any hassles. I had no complaints with the hotel and the location was perfect for what we needed. I'd definitely return to the Sheraton!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location close to the action with lots of dining options”
Reviews.Author: skppy1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated a few blocks from Times Square and overall is a great location and nice hotel. The hotel restaurants are pricey even for NY but there are alot of dining options for family or business nearby. Even a Tim's close-by for the Canadian travellers. My trip was both personal and business and the hotel accommodated both well. Room was clean and size was okay. It was difficult to control the temperature and I needed a fan to be brought up to my room as it was quite warm due to unseasonally warmer temperatures. Staff was friendly and helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “Basic business Hotel, ( not suitable for family or Leisure) DIRTY ,OLD, POOR SERVICE,”
Reviews.Author: Mewife2kids
Reviews.Content: Plus points of this hotel great location, However that is it, its expensive £150 plus a night for a 4 star hotel is ok I guess for New York, but this is not a 4 star hotel, more like 2 or 3 star. The service and rooms are not up to 4 star standards. Our Room was noisy, the aircon made a hell of a noise. Rooms are small. The Carpet was dirty, stained and Old, it had been hoovered it was just old carpet that should have been replaced 3 years ago. Walls have marks on them. and one of the sheets was dirty. The Window blind was falling off, Worse part of our stay was the service, they include 15% service charge on all food as standard, however the staff still expect a tip, and they have a $4 extra delivery charge for room service. Because this is a business hotel I guess they no that they are going to get a tip and the service is basic and not up to standard. Staff should earn tips and not get given tips for poor service……. The Bell captain we asked to collect our bags from our room in 10 mins, 30 mins later they still had not come and travelling with a 11 month old baby and a 3 year old son I had to drag 3 heavy suitcases downstairs myself. I think the worse part of our stay was no hot water on one night. , rooms also do not have WIFI only cable dsl internet. Most of the customers staying in this hotel were on Business, I can imagine that business get good discounted rates for using this hotel. If I was paying £80 to £100 a night I would have written a better review, but this is not a 4 star hotel and not value for money as a leisure traveler. Another plus note Breakfast was nice but expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Redefining Customer Service....Taking it to the highest level!”
Reviews.Author: janeinsyracuse
Reviews.Content: I recently arranged for my niece to stay at The Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers using my Starwood Preferred Guest Points. I was a little worried about my niece and her girlfriend staying in New York. So, after reading the reviews of the hotel on Tripadvisor, I thought it would be a good idea to Email the hotel, before she arrived, to make sure she received a nice room with a view. Well, her one night stay was amazing from start to finish thanks to Jorge Guerrero, the Guest Service Manager at The Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers! I have never known anyone so dedicated to the service of others. First, she arrived before check-in and was greeted cheerfully by the staff and was allowed to check-in early and the attendant was very gracious. She was thrilled with her room which was a corner room on the 49th floor (#4904) and had a fabulous view of Central Park. The room was beautifully decorated, very clean with 2 wonderful comfortable beds and all the amenities. She called the front desk to inquire about the Club Level Lounge which features evening hors d'oeuvres. They told her that it was closed on weekends. Then, to her amazement, shortly after her call, Jorge Guerrero, sent up a beautiful bottle of white wine as well as a fruit/cheese tray and tray of chocolate-covered strawberries! Can you imagine this. WOW! Jorge Guerrero, has completely redefined the words 'customer service'. Jorge also provided her with his personal contact information and told her to call him if she needed anything. He really bent over backwards to make them feel welcome. I really appreciated the personal attention my niece received. They loved the location of the hotel which is on 7th Ave and 53rd. They walked to Times Square in 5 minutes...Rockefeller Center 5 minutes....5th Avenues stores...St. Patrick's Cathedral. Best possible location in Manhattan. Now everyone in my family wants to sign up for a Starwood Preferred Guest Credit card so that they can accumulate enough points to stay at the Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers with the staff headed by Jorge Guerrero! This is absolutely the best place to stay in NYC. The level of customer service and personal attention and concern will exceed your expectations. I wouldn't stay anywhere else. Very HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! Thank you Jorge! You've just acquired a customer for life.

Reviews.Title: “never again....”
Reviews.Author: lareux
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the hotel through priceline and let me tell you, how disappointing it was. This "4 star" (as suggested by priceline) is nowhere near that level. Firstly, front desk was not very pleasant upon arrival. When we walked into our room, you could see right away that this was not going to be enjoyable. The room was old, dusty and falling apart. The blinds to the windows were broken, the bathroom hadn't been cleaned and to top it all off, the heater was not working and only blowing out cold air. After several complaints and 2 maintenance men later, the hotel finally switched our room. My husband and I, had to grab all of our belongings and in our pajamas, switch rooms at 2 in the morning, only to be given another room with 2 double beds. This room still had no heat and it wasn't until the 4th maintenance man, that we were told that the entire hotel had no heat. In addition, our room was not cleaned. After a long day of walking through the city, we wanted to come back to the hotel and rest and wash up, only to find that our room hadn't been cleaned and so we had to call and wait for the cleaning lady to come and clean the room at 6 o'clock in the evening. The hotel is very loud with very thin walls...I could actually hear the person next to me speaking on his cellphone and I could even hear the person he was speaking to, if you can believe it!! We were definitely disappointed by this experience and would discourage anyone considering the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay and wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: celtic3
Reviews.Content: I especially was impressed with the staff, particularly Jackie anbd Daria. I had left something in my hotel room and they were so helpful in assisting me in retrieving it. Very impressed and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: lkutschka
Reviews.Content: Great location, and beautiful Room looking down towards Times Square. Every need was met and friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: shootingstarbeauty
Reviews.Content: I used to live in Manhattan and never would've lived anywhere near Times Square. Yet, when I come back to town, I love staying a little north of Times Square at the Sheraton since its location makes it easy to get around town. This hotel is ALWAYS busy, regardless of the time of year. However, it's clean and the staff is consummately pleasant, which make me happy. If you don't want to pay for wireless in your room, which is pricey, then bring your laptop down to the lobby and use your computer there since the lobby provides free internet service. I'm not so hot about the restaurant in the hotel, which charges a lot of money for not a lot of food. You're better off hopping a subway (or into a cab if you're there for business and can expense it) and getting breakfast elsewhere! Overall, I like this hotel. I've stayed there three times since I moved out of Manhattan and will continue to stay there again. Remember: location, location, location!

Reviews.Title: “Crappy room...fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: Lorisails
Reviews.Content: This hotel was chosen because of the conference rates. When I got to my room, it was a little rough around the edges. There were even bullet holes in the shower tile! To make it even worse was the fact that the walls were paper thin and you could hear the conversations in the room next door. Its only saving grace was the location. You definitely want to spend more time enjoying New York than sit in your hotel room. Right in the heart of the Theater district.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased with stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: marathonmanPgh
Reviews.Content: Great location. Great weekend in NYC. The reason I wanted to make this post was to recognize several of the employees at the hotel. Our group actually had one problem at check in.... things happen. The impressive thing was how Jorge the Guest Service manager went above and beyond to make sure our stay was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Blessing”
Reviews.Author: DATP
Reviews.Content: Great position, extremely busy lobby, tad tired around the edges, off-hand reception staff but very helpful housekeeping staff, good bar - friendly staff. All in all a mixed blessing. The hotel was very busy as it was the three day build up to the Marathon and the start of the World Series and they had large parties for each staying. I would not recommend the breakfast in Hudson's expensive and onions and chives mixed in all hot dishes. Better to go to Lindy's diner next door for a true NY experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for business travel”
Reviews.Author: DrNik
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the location and the service. Lots to do within walking distance, and staff very friendly. Lounge area a bit too small and crowded when conferences are being held at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “brillant”
Reviews.Author: nyc46
Reviews.Content: the staff were very helpful all of the time my only complaint was the lack of computers in ratio to guests and companies using the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, brilliant location and helpfull staff.”
Reviews.Author: NewboarderEastAnglia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in october 09 with my girlfriend. Was going to be arriving in NYC late at night so emailed the hotel and asked if we could have a quiet room with good views. When we checked in the front desk confirmed this email and put us in a room away from the lifts, on the 38th floor with views down to times square, (stunning) The location is on 7th and 53rd, 10 mins walk to times square in one direction and central park in the other. With the slower pace of life another 10 mins walk into Hells kitchen. Our flights back to JFK were at 6:30pm and the hotel sugested a late checkout of 2pm at no extra cost. The doorman even hailed us a black town car to take us to the airport. Much better than a yellow cab as huge inside and the same price, although you can only pay cash $50 plus tip. Would stay in this hotel again. Some people have said that the rooms are a little small. We had a queen bed, desk and wardrobe in ours and it was plenty big enough. Dont know what people are moaning about. Dont forget to leave a tip for the house keeping each day and you will have all the towels and toiletries you could need.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: NorthLondonFoodie
Reviews.Content: Located midtown so very close to Times Square, Rockefeller Centre and Central Park. The kid's loved the complimentary use of the computers in the lobby and the large flat screen tv in the room. The cleaning of the room was a bit hit and miss ie. the room wasn't always hoovered or dusted every day during our 5 night stay and one day we were only provided with two towels for the 4 of us. Having said that, the beds were superbly comfortable and there was a nice selection of toiletries in the bathroom. Don't bother having breakfast in the coffee bar in the lobby, the coffee was awful and the pastries dry and expensive. Go to Pret a manger on 6th Avenue, much better coffee and better value! Guests at this hotel can use the pool at the Sheraton Manhattan over the road, we didn't have the time to avail ourselves of it so can't comment.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable and pleasant experience.”
Reviews.Author: linaweinstein
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a very comfortable and pleasant stay and appreciated the personal attention we received in the form of a late night snack.

Reviews.Title: “Unhappy with Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marisol1964
Reviews.Content: I was very unhappy with this hotel. When I booked online they promised me 2 beds and I only received one while I was staying there. They said that it should have been explained to me that it was not a guarantee. So one of us had to sleep on a cot for 4 days. Very uncomfortable and the room was so small there was barely any room to walk in there. The rugs were dirty and so was the tub. Also they had alot of students from somewhere there constantly on all the computers so it was hard to look anything up. They finally told me I could go to the business center but that ended up costing me amost .50 cents a minute. I will not stay at this hotel again. Better to pay a little more and be happy. Label themselves as a 4 star. Not at all more like a 2 or 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “I had a perfect weekend at the Sheraton!”
Reviews.Author: taxiGardenCity
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and spacious. We had drinks in the lobby bar and the staff was wonderful. We were greeted at the front desk by a wonderful and enthusiastic person. I had an emergency where I had left something home that I needed and she immediately referred me to a place I could go within a block of the hotel. I did and problem solved! We were treated wonderfully. The fact that the parking is within the building is extremely convenient. It was very nice to be able to check our bags on Sunday after check out. I felt that every courtesy was extended to us to make our stay as pleasant as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: meklein
Reviews.Content: If you can find a good deal on this hotel, it is a good stay. The location is great (between Times Square and Central Park), close to everything, in good condition, etc. Naturally, in Manhattan, the rooms are tiny, as are the beds. We did manage to do ok with two adults and two children though, but we were cramped, especially with the luggage and stroller. But, it seems comparable to other hotels in the area. You do have to pay $15/day for the internet connection, but that also seems to be the norm for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to usual Sheraton standards”
Reviews.Author: Lilianw6
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton New York Towers for three nights following a cruise. We are Starwood preferred guests and have stayed in many Sheraton hotels around the world. This was the worst we have stayed in. Yes, the location is excellent, but the cleanliness leaves a lot to be desired. The room we stayed in on floor 39 was well worn and, as another reviewer has said, the blinds were flithy. The room was very dark which was probably a good thing. There was no hairdryer in the room and despite four phone calls, one still hadn't arrived. Because of this we were given a compliementary breakfast, which, at a cost of over 27 dollars was a 'rip off'. On the positive side I have to say the staff on reception were extremely polite and helpful. I would not recomment this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: 8sushi
Reviews.Content: convenient transportation-subway at corner, buses across the street. Taxis everywhere! Concierge service, across the street is a NY info store. Easy walk to Lincoln Center per my elderly mother who used a front-wheeled walker! Comfortable handicap room, had a fold down bench in the walk in shower and easy to use flexi-hose shower head. Attentive floor staff, comp Starbuck coffee & packets of tea for in-room brewer.. Comfortable beds. Very nice Guest Relation staff esp Jorge Guerrero (PM shift) while we were there. Hotel has security stationed by the elevators observing and confirming registered guests. Internet available for guests in the Lobby - very busy. SMOKE-FREE! Free safe in-room . Bliss products, ample towels.- hotel has plans for 2011 renovations. Rooms are showing some wear and dated design. Our TV was a new model. Lots of daytime natural lighting. soft in room lights for PM. Happy with our stay. Would consider a Club Level.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, fantastic location, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: ToffeeGirl2
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a 4 night stay at the Sheraton, Firstly its location is great. Only a couple of mins from Central Park and you are right near Times Square and Broadway. The rooms were clean and tidy and beds changed with fresh sheets every day, the rooms are about the same size as travelodge rooms maybe a little bigger but they are more than adequate for a place to stay. We was out most of the day and night and used the hotel as a base to sleep. I would definatly return their, the service from the staff was expectional. The only thing to be careful of is the charges - the hotel is quite expensive but then so is most of New York $24 for 2 bottlesof Bud on room service and whatever you do DONT use the phones in the hotel to call home, we didnt realise how expensive the call charges were and we had a high phone bill when we left, you can buy a phone card for $2 which gives you about 10 mins. There is a nice deli right across the road that sells a good selection of sarnies and coffee etc, we used that rather than the starbucks in the hotel as it was just so dear. Tours - Everything that you really need to do and see is within walking distance but we would recommend the city limit tours, if you see a guide outside the hotel (they wear blue and yellow) they will give you the best package depending on what you want to do. One thing we did do is book the tickets for the empire state building before we went and we got the express tickets which is highly recommened, you skip all the queues and you really dont want to waste all that time in the queues especially if its busy. Woodbury common is good if you buy alot of desiger clothes you will prob find it cheaper their, its a designer retail oulet very much like bicester village. We found a few bargins there but unless you are reallly into designer stuff i wouldnt really bother we spent a whole day there which on reflection was a bit of a waste. If you are only staying for a few days and trying to fit alot in you can see the statue of liberty but unless you really want to go on the viewing tower you could just stay on the boat. You can still take some great photos and see how big she is but once you get off the boat there isnt alot to do but look at it. The night tour is good and takes you down to Broklyn Bridge and the uptown and downtown tours are also good too. At central park its worth paying for a bike guide to take you round as its massive and unless you want to spend all day there this is a quicker way of seeing it all - it was very relaxing and they give you loads of information that we wouldnt of really known what we was looking at had we of walked around. Generally New York like most of the other big world cities is expensive and the tipping thing is big there, on average we found they add 18% onto your bill and lunch / dinner for 4 was coming out at about $160. Im sure there are cheaper places but we just didnt find them. I would highly recommend Dave's Famous BBQ Ribs- excellent food, good choice of menu, and you feel like you have had your monies worth. Wouldnt recommend Ellens Stardust Diner, food very expensive and not good value for money at all. Sheraton New York gets a good thumbs up from us and will stay there again should we return to New York

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have every stayed in”
Reviews.Author: maiziedoll
Reviews.Content: This hotel was truly 1st class, we have been to New York a few times but by far this is the best place we have every stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service, warm & friendly atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: hrdadams
Reviews.Content: I travel often to New York for business. I often try to stay in a Starwood property because I am a Preferred Guest there. In fact, I traditionally stay at the Westin in Times Square. However, my last stay at the Westin was a horrible experience. This time I opted for the Sheraton New York Hotel & Towers. It's right across the street from the Sheraton Manhattan (and often confused), but this is the superior hotel. My stay was exceptional. Immediately upon my arrival I was met by a delightful and helpful front desk attendant. She upgraded my room immediately (in the spirit of full disclosure, I'm a Platinum level guest). I had a few specifics I needed help with, including a refrigerator because I'm nursing a new baby. She was happy to assist. When I entered room 4801, it exceeded all my expectations. It had views from 3 sides of the hotel, including the river. Nice decorations and included a den, dining area, office, bar, 2 bathrooms and bedroom. I was extremely pleased and surprised. During the course of my stay, I was met with stellar service from housekeeping to in-room dining. The thai soup with shrimp is very good. One thing that is worthwhile is the Club-level ammenities (whether you are a Starwood preferred guest or pay the small upgrade to use). You are able to partake in both the full continental breakfast in the morning, as well as the happy hour appetizers and treats in the afternoon. A great way to start and end your day at the hotel. On my last evening, someone from the GM's office called to inquire about my stay. and I told them about my service, experience and stay thus far. I also noted how disappointed I was in my recent Westin stay (when I treated my Mother to a trip to NYC to attend the US Open). I provided specifics on both what their hotel was doing well and what I was upset about with regard to the Westin. Within 15 minutes of that call, I received another from Jorge Guerrero, the Guest Service Center Manager. He thanked me for taking the time to complete their quick survey and asked if he could send up a treat compliments of the hotel for my time. To my delight a great bottle of red wine as well as a fruit/cheese tray and tray of chocolate-covered strawberries arrived shortly thereafter. Jorge provided me with his personal contact information and insisted that anytime I was back in the city to make him aware of my stay so that he could take good care of me I will NOT HESISTATE to return to this exceptional hotel. When you're traveling away from family and dealing with the rush of a long, crazy business day - this is absolutely the place to stay in NYC. Believe me, I frequent the city and have stayed in numerous hotels. I've already told our travel department that I don't want to stay anywhwere else. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

Reviews.Title: “My valuables were safe”
Reviews.Author: dedebutler
Reviews.Content: I checked out of the Sheraton on a Tuesday morning and got to my next hotel (in Soho) at 10:30 pm Tuesday night - only to realize that I left my Amazon Kindle and video iPod in the safe at the Sheraton. After an attempt to retrieve the goods that night (without any luck), I called back the next morning and security went in and recovered my stuff. I was thrilled (after being unhopeful) that there still are honest people and places in this world. Thanks Sheraton!

Reviews.Title: “High price... Low standards...”
Reviews.Author: nes_ottawa
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell, this is not a 4 star hotel. It's like a beautiful waxed apple that is rotten inside. Positive - Extremely helpful concierge - Free internet - Good location Negative - The room was not ready until 3:30 PM (check in 2 PM) - Climat control was broken. The engineer came to look at it. He twisted and turned the knob and said that we should wait until 8PM as the heat will be turned on centrally then. He never came back to check on it later and the heat never worked. We decided it was not worth our time dealing with it. - The shower was barely warm and the water pressure was very low. I was actually shivering after the shower. The receptionist was sympathetic and gave us $50 credit and sent an engineer to fix the shower (which was hot afterwords). - Cheap hair dryer - took forever to dry my hair... - No fridge. I actually placed some chopped vegetables over the juices in the bar fridge. The next day we came back at night and the vegetables were disrespectfully sitting on the counter with a note from the maid that we're not allowed to use this fridge but we could rent one. The vegetables were bad and I had to throw them out... - The bed was not particularly comfortable - There was mold in the bathroom in 3 places... see pictures (4 star? Maybe not...) In the course of the week I stayed at 2 different Sheratons and I was overall disappointed. My expectations were a lot higher. It seems that they cut corners and not really value their guests (especially the ones with the preferred guest card!)

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service-great location-very responsive staff!”
Reviews.Author: HerbSChicago
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent. Walking distance to so many attractions including Times Square and Central Park. Started great with very friendly staff outside and at the front desk. Housekeepers were all friendly and accomodating. When we needed housekeeping to come because we were in the room when they came by the first time, we got an amazing response from managers Jorge Guerrero and Joe Casas. They were very concerned about our complete satisfaction and bent over backwards to make our stay wonderful. The Club lounge on the 44th floor is awesome! The views are great and the breakfast buffet is first rate. For NYC this is a reasonably priced hotel and the staff and management really make a difference. I will staff here again when I return on business or pleasure. HerbS

Reviews.Title: “Very Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tonyahend
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very average all around. The room was small but that is expected in NYC. The bathroom desperatly needs updating and there was stains on the carpet. My previous trips I stayed in more luxury hotels but this time I went with a budget hotel. You get what you pay for. I did have some trouble after leaving when I saw my credit card was charged even though I paid cash. I called the hotel and left a message but noone returned my call, so I emailed Starwood and got the charge reversed. I also had the exchange fees as I am Canadian and after some very fustrating emails I got those reversed as well. All in all it was a nice trip but I will not stay at they Sheraton Towers again. I will spend a little extra and get something special.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Service, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FoodSport
Reviews.Content: Met wife, who was there for a conference at Radio City around the corner and stayed for 4 days. Nice hotel, in the middle of everything. Close to Central Park, Subway right out the front doors, close to theaters, Times Square, restaurants etc. Couple of small issues, one with a wake up call that did not happen. They upgraded our room, gave us access to club level and sent a bottle of wine up the next night. "Nice Touch". The light breakfast was nice but watch out for the 5-8pm offering. I thought it was snacks & drinks however our 3 drinks came to $45.00. Hmmmm, I must not have read the fine print. Overall however, I'd have to recommend the hotel. We've stayed at allot of hotels all over the world, A-Z, and while this is not the most elegant you'll find it's a good value with comfortable beds a nice lobby and a staff who are trying to do it right. With regards to close eating: You have to try the cart on 53rd and 6th. (Just 1 block) We got there at 1am and there were about 40 people in line. WOW. Saffron Rice, Chicken, Lamb Beef and a pita. A mix between Persian and Greek but with an American flair. What a meal for $8! And it's awesome! Try Carnigie's (7th & 55th, 1 block ) for Pastrami & Corned Beef sandwich. Best I have EVER had. Not cheap however $23 for a sandwich and expect a line. We split one between 3 of us and we were all full. They charge $3 for each person who's splitting. Sounds like allot but TOTALLY worth it. We also did Bar America, Bobby Flay's restaurant (1 block) VERY nice! Hope this helps you!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: AUST76
Reviews.Content: This was a terrible hotel that clearly survives on the strength of the Sheraton name. From unpleasant staff, to dirty - no make that filthy rooms, the entire experience was one I will avoid when I return to Manhattan in the future. The location is great and the views amazing, but the simple things were just not done right. Try the lower rated, but much nicer Hilton Garden Inn in Chelsea.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: emjayfox
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights and the highlight was the attentive customer service provided by Jorge Guerrero (the Guest Service Center Manager) and his diligent staff. A real surprise for such a big, bustling place...The hotel has a great location in mid-town, near Times Square, Central Park and Rockefeller Center.

Reviews.Title: “Location couldn't be better!”
Reviews.Author: christileah3
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect. Just a couple blocks from Central Park, Times Square, Rockefellar Center and the subway. The rooms left a little something to be desired. The hotel was full and we must have been the last people to check-in, so we ended up with a handicapped room. The shower was just a curtain across part of the bathroom and a drain in the floor. We ended up having water all over the floor everytime we showered which was kind of annoying. The bed was comfortable, but the room was not big at all. The staff was friendly and helpful, especially considering the amount of people that they always seemed to be dealing with. I would go back again as long as I got a decent price on the room, because the location was the best. However, rates can be pretty high there.

Reviews.Title: “Good ... depends how much you pay”
Reviews.Author: fasaleh
Reviews.Content: I went to NYC with 2 friends. This was my forth time going (first time at this hotel). Originally I had booked a room with 2 beds. I knew rooms were small in the city and I told my friend's this, but they insisted to keep the reservation. I wanted a suite but they didn't have any but when I arrived they did, but I didn't like the rate I received. I have an Amer. Exp. Starwood card so I had a 50% off the rack rate coupon. I used that and I would not pay anything higher than the price they gave me to stay at this hotel. The rack rate is overpriced because of how old the hotel is (building built in the 1920's?). I ended up getting my own room and they placed me on the "starwood preferred guest floor." The room was old, which is typical for nyc. The bed was good and the bathroom was in good condition, but small. The desk and AC needs improvements. The knob to adjust the AC was broken. I also would NOT touch the mini bar. My friend's moved some stuff and they charged them, but I was able to get them removed. The hotel and room was clean. Service was okay. It's a really busy hotel. From 2pm to 6 it is absolutely crazy. I arrived early to the hotel to check in and received the "typical" nyc attitude. When I arrived back I talked to a few good people. The person who put me on the spg floor was nice and courteous. I didn't eat at the hotel. There are 2 cafe's outside the hotel on 53rd st. One has outdoor seating. I don't know the name of the place, but it was a lot better than the place across the street called lindas? The location is good if you want to be a tourist. After going a few times to NYC my best suggestion is to get a room at battery park/downtown. I would have paid a little higher to stay at the Ritz-Carlton in battery park than this place. Also there regular rooms are 1.5x times the size of my basic room. Also the area appears newer than midtown. Going from midtown to downtown is pretty simple. Transportation to the airport was great. The hotel has drivers with S-Class Mercedes. Took one of those for $40. A taxi was $30. I would suggest this if you want a little comfort. When going to the hotel I took a shuttle and paid $45 for 3 people. It is best to get a taxi or get in a black lincoln cars. Don't go to ground transportation.

Reviews.Title: “This is what "customer service" should be.”
Reviews.Author: JJMonz
Reviews.Content: I recently had a weekend stay at this hotel; and was received in the usual efficient and polite manner. Upon arrival, I asked for more pillows and towels, and received them right away. I needed info on a certain type of restaurant; and I was given a menu, directions, and an opinion. I asked for a late check-out, and it was granted right away. The stay was a very good one. Then, two weeks later, I realized that I had left my robe in the room (it may sound like 'only a robe', but I had just received it as a gift at the hotel). Initially, it could not be located by "lost & found". Then, I was forwarded to the Guest Sevice-Center Manager, Jorge Guerrero, who took it upon himself to follow-up on all the possibilities, and did locate my robe. He had his assistant, Karalynn, send the robe back to me. He then invited me to contact him, if I needed anything else in this matter. As I put in the title of this review: THIS IS WHAT "CUSTOMER SERVICE" SHOULD BE !!!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms too small”
Reviews.Author: vtmominsc
Reviews.Content: On our recent stay we found this to be a nice, centrally located hotel to Times Square, but the room was so small and the bathroom very outdated. Compared to another hotel in the same location that we recently visited we were disappointed in the room for the comparable cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service, upgrade to Club Level!”
Reviews.Author: CApamma
Reviews.Content: First time taking the family to New York, This hotel was located nicely between Time Square and Central Park. Wonderful views. Nice service and room. Upgraded to the Club Level and had wonderful appetizers and drinks in the evening. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “great location for a NYC visit”
Reviews.Author: AnnaLB
Reviews.Content: My husband, 9 yo daughter and I stayed here for a weekend trip to NYC to celebrate my 40th birthday. The room rate was reasonable, and included a very nice breakfast buffet, which was a good deal. The location is perfect for sightseeing in Manhattan, and we found the room to be nice and the staff to be helpful. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “This place is horrible”
Reviews.Author: pkaboo921
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for work and have stayed in my share of good hotels and bad hotels. This was by far one of the worst places I have ever stayed. Something must have leaked in the first room they put me in because the carpet was soaked. I literally stepped in a puddle when I went to close the blinds. Because of the drenched carpet, the entire room had started to smell like mold. They put me up in a different room, and the TV never worked. You also could not control the room's temperature. Whenever I called the front desk, no assistance was provided. In addition, the rooms are very small. In addition to the rooms, the hotel was always way too busy and hectic. I was there for 3 weeks for work. The first week was a modeling and acting convention for a bunch of teenager girls. They were constantly pushing people out of the way to get on and off of elevators. The second week was a dancing convention. People were literally dancing in the hallways and lobbies, not caring that no one could walk by them without being in danger of being kicked or hit by someone flailing around. During the third week, a group of people participating in a triathalon were staying in the hotel. Again, the elevators were taken over by people with bikes. I would have to wait forever for an avaialble elevator. I understand that the hotel is right in the middle of one of the busiest sections of the city. I have stayed in other hotels in the same area, though, and never had as many problems as I had in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Combination of the best location, amenities, and service for the midtown business traveler”
Reviews.Author: mantha23
Reviews.Content: The location is convenient whether you are walking to meetings in midtown, taking the subway or taxi downtown, or looking for a close place to grab breakfast, lunch, or dinner...either for a business meeting or solo grab & go. GREAT service....people make the difference and everybody at the hotel is aware of their guests and ready to go out of their way to serve. Clean and available equipment in a gym that is easy to access. Quick room service delivery. Great internet access in the rooms and in the lobby. Recent renovations have only improved an already great situation.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Service”
Reviews.Author: chuddle
Reviews.Content: Checked in and found room A/C not working. Called down to speak to the front desk and the Manager on duty Jorge Guerrero not only responded to my call, he personally came up to the 20th floor with I believe Victor an engineer. They accessed our a/c and found it non responsive. They quickly moved all of our luggage into a larger room and also credited our account for the trouble. I was so impressed with this service I booked two more nights with Sheraton. He made what could have been a dissaster a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL WITH EXCELLENT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: RHONDAGeorgia
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel. And Joy at the front desk has excellent customer service. She went beyond her job to help us. This was our second visit to this Hotel we would highly recommend it. Location is great, staff is wonderful, very clean & comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “How Many Bedside Tables In A Double Room?”
Reviews.Author: The_Gruesome_Twosome
Reviews.Content: Usually you would find two bedside tables in a double room, but in our room in there was only one, which made me think that this was a single room! The bed was rather small for a double, infact it was smaller than the beds you get in UK hotel rooms! We were only in New York for three nights, but any longer and we would have had to move rooms because it was so uncomfortable! Truth be told this was a single room, see attached photos!

Reviews.Title: “Sheridan New York Hotel and Towers”
Reviews.Author: JayBellevue
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate to be in New York last week during the United Nations Security Council meetings. The Clinton Global Initiative was also headquartered at the New York Sheridan, and it was all very exciting. The down side was that we were not able to check into our Concierge level room, because the events, I assume overbooked those floors. I spoke to the desk, they accommodated us a room upgrade, and a nice bottle of wine as an apology. It was handled very well. We were given the choice to stay or move to the upper levels, and we chose to stay. I wrote the hotel, and expressed our disappointment for the initial check-in and in addition to there great gestures while there, worked quickly and professionally to reach out to us and make it right. We were so impressed, I've posted my first review of any kind, to express our appreciation for their customer care. Looking back, I hardly think we were ready to room next to Mr. Clinton or his staff, and we had a great experience in the best possible location in Manhattan. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “The Best experience I've had and I'm a hotel owner.”
Reviews.Author: pjlama
Reviews.Content: The best way to describe my experience is to say that everything was perfect. I'm a hotel owner and very critical about the guest experience. The entire process was great from the time I checked in till I checked out. I asked to up grade my accommodations and it was done at no charge, went to the room and ordered room service, the food arrived quickly and it was wonderful. The daily Internet connection charge was waived when I inquired about wireless and even offered to send up a bottle of wine, which I declined. The staff was friendly, knowledgeable and always willing togo out of there way to help. Keep up the good work, I'll be back..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Rates and Very Friendly reservations staff”
Reviews.Author: MT2032
Reviews.Content: I had to come to NYC for work. I made my reservation with in house reservations. Sharon was extremely helpful and was able to accomodate my traveling budget. She had immediate response anytime I got in touch with her and the rate was great. The property is in great shape. Great location and easy to get anywhere when needed. I would bring my family back since so it's close to theaters as well.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and Dumpy”
Reviews.Author: Roadrunner55
Reviews.Content: It has taken me two months to calm down enough to comment on this hotel. I am not sure if there are different rooms available to different people... I can't imagine how this hotel boasts decent reviews. Our room was filthy, small and bug infested. I was very uncomfortable here and would never ever return. We were also double billed and have yet to resolve the issue with management. Stay there if you like, but dont say I didnt warn you.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, awesome location”
Reviews.Author: Herk_Driver
Reviews.Content: Incredible location, right near the theater district and south of Central Park. Lobby leads you to believe it might be a 5 star, but more of a 4 star in the rooms. A great hotel, you can tell that it is an older hotel that has been nicely renovated. Flat screens in bedroom, down pillows. No problems at all. I would highly recommend this hotel, we got an incredible rate on Hotwire. Beacon Restaurant 3 blocks north.

Reviews.Title: “A great central hotel to stay in.”
Reviews.Author: quiltlady2
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay, staff was very helpful when asked about subway trains to local attractions. We had 3 people staying in the room and had to request more coffee twice and the housekeeping staff sent it up right away. Jorge Guerra's team are very good, get to the problem immediately. The maid on the 22nd floor was always very pleasant, sorry did not get her name but made sure that we had all that we required.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience, great location, even better service.”
Reviews.Author: impsnipe
Reviews.Content: My kids and I had the good fortune to have the Sheraton New York Hotel & Towers recommended to us by a friend. The location was perfect for the kids' first experience in New York and seeing Broadway shows. The service, however, blew me away, especially the Guest Service Center Manager, Jorge Guerrero. He was what I consider "old school" in that he could anticipate our needs before we even asked, and delivered that service with respect and dignity. Everyone on the staff was thoroughly committed to providing the best service and making sure our family had the perfect "New York Experience." Looking forward to staying at the Sheraton New York on our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “the friendliest treat ever in a hotel of these dimensions”
Reviews.Author: aniosuna
Reviews.Content: from the very moment we arrived, a charm doorman welcomed us. the reception inside was very warm, which we apreciated so much as I was travelling whith my 81-year-old mother and her 73-year-old sister. I can not say anything but wonders about this very well situated hotel as it is people who make things nice and people here are 100% top.

Reviews.Title: “I hit the jackpot!”
Reviews.Author: ugacrew
Reviews.Content: On my first trip to NYC I looked for a hotel with a central location that would keep everything in walking distance. I was pleased that it met that expectation without an issue. I was also pleased that the hotel room wasn't as cramped as others have stated. Given that it's New York City, I felt that I was spoiled in terms of size and how clean it was. I was also happy with the beds. I've never slept better at a hotel than I did whilst I was there. The room was never too hot or too cold. I also give a thumbs up for the shower. Most hotels that I've been to have had weak water pressure which made it an ordeal to rinse the shampoo and conditioner out of my hair. Not with this one. It was nice and strong. The one thing that made me happy was that I was meeting friends, who chose this hotel on my recommendation, say that they were pleased as well. The only drawback was paying $14.95 for internet service. I would have gone into the lobby to access the wireless but was too lazy to and prefer surfing in privacy. They do offer complimentary computers as well but there may be a line of people waiting for them depending on what time of day you want to use it. When I come back to NYC, I will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good and confortable”
Reviews.Author: paperita
Reviews.Content: We have been in the hotel 5 days long in August and we have found a good accomodation, polite service and reception. Being preferred guest we have also access to a suitable "club" al 44th floor. Interesting as a snack between afternoon walk and dinner

Reviews.Title: “A fine stay in Midtown”
Reviews.Author: megsmith
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Sheraton with a bachelorette party. Overall, our experience was fine, but I certainly wouldn't pay full price if I were to ever stay again. (And I do visit NYC every couple of months.) We were a group of 7 looking for a convenience midtown location. Booked through hotwire and got a good deal for two rooms ($525 for both). The hotel is a bit of a zoo. It's huge and there are people everywhere in the lobby at all hours. For that reason, I wouldn't suggest the hotel for business travelers. The rooms weren't ready when we arrived at the hotel at about 11 a.m. So, we left our bags with the hotel. Bell hop who took the bags was very friendly. (Note: leaving bags prior to check in is free, but $3.25 per back after check out.) And off we went to the first leg of the party. When we returned, the rooms were ready. They were small by national standards, but normal for NYC. We were a bit tight at four people in the room, but we knew that would be the case. The beds were quite comfortable and the bathroom adequate, though small. My only true complaint was that the maids opened our door at 9 a.m. on Sunday morning. I didn't hear a knock prior to noticing the door open, though one of my friends said there was a slight knock. I understand they have lots of rooms to turn over, but I can't imagine that most people are up and out on a Sunday morning prior to 9 a.m. Seems to me that it can't be that hard for the front desk to communicate check outs so that the maids aren't bothering guests. Useful things to know -- the hotel is easily walkable to Times Square and a lot of the Midtown sites (the Rock, Central Park, etc.). Be aware that everything will be priced accordingly. (I bought a bottle of water and one of gatorade at the deli across the streed for $8 and breakfast at Lindy's next door was about $25/person for luke warm diner eggs.) Also, don't confuse the hotel with the Sheraton Manhattan across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Coco911
Reviews.Content: Pro: -great location Cons: -small room -dirty room -dirty room -dirty. I have never stayed in a hotel so disgusting! Actually, the hotel was ok, but the room they gave me was terrible. I attached pictures to this review. You can see dust on the blinds, old and dirty heating system and a shower curtain full of mould. The staff was ok. Uninspired and bored, but fine. I don't know if I got the "Priceline Special Treatment", but that hotel was such a disappointment. Make yourself a favor: stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Try to find something better!”
Reviews.Author: stamping1
Reviews.Content: Our room was tiny. Smallest hotel room I've ever stayed in and for $468 PER NIGHT. (and they told us ours was the biggest because it was on the corner. Said the other rooms were even smaller!) It also was musty smelling. The air just worked on one setting--would go no cooler or warmer. Two DOUBLE beds (they only have Queens/Kings in their suites) The pillows were the flattest ever and whatever it was made with made this terrible noise whenever you moved around. Like a plastic sheet sound. The room was Filthy! The carpet was absolutely disgustingly dirty and there was mold on the shower walls. When we complained about it to the front desk all she said was "sorry about that sir" Our tub drain was plugged--did eventually drain after several hours. We called and told them about that but it wasn't fixed until 2 days later. When we checked in we asked for more pillows and blankets and were told they would be there shortly. 4 hours later they were still not there so we called again. Did get them at that time. No fridge. Felt the desk staff was abrupt and cold. The conceirge just never knew anything! Not friendly staff at all. I would never stay in this hotel again and will tell anyone I know going to NY NOT to!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Steveℜen
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to New York City. The hotel is situated only a short walk to either Times Square or Central Park. You can not beat the location. We found the rooms really small, especially when you have two small children but this is to be expected for New York City. We did upgrade to a Club Level floor. We used the Club Lounge almost every day for a quick breakfast or snack. We stopped in one evening around 4pm, there was one lady working at the bar by herself. She was probably the most ignorant and rude women that I have ever experienced working in any hotel. When we asked for glass of water, she proceeded to hand us an empty cut and told us the water cooler was around the corner. This was our only negative experience during our four day stay at the Sheraton New York Towers. If I return to NYC again, we will definately give this hotel consideration.

Reviews.Title: “My wife and I had a great time at this Sheration, service was excellent.”
Reviews.Author: TexasGettingthere
Reviews.Content: Gorge Guerrero and his service staff wrere excellent and freindky. His advise on evewrythig made my first say in New Youk much easier. Everyones advise was helpful. Donald R Hons

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Price on Priceline, Small Room but wonderful beds and service”
Reviews.Author: schmelke1
Reviews.Content: While the room was indeed not large -- and the bathroom was not very modern, it was clean and for the priceline bid price of $120 night -- well worth it! The beds are heavenly. The room is compact but not crowded with all the amenities. The service at check in was excellent and unlike other hotels, I rec'd good service despite the fact that I used priceline for reservations. Great location. I would stay there again for a higher rate as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good, comfortable and well located.”
Reviews.Author: towelobsessive
Reviews.Content: Very good location and nice hotel. What you would expect in a city hotel. Rooms quite small but comfortable, with coffee maker. Had the best night sleep ever, bed really cosy. Room was cleaned well, they even put out the correct number of towels each day, which is a rarity. Found some of the waitresses in the lobby bar a bit like pirhana's, latching on to you and never letting go, trying to get every last cent out of you, so didn't go there much. Would definitely stay there again. Free computer access in the lobby was very popular but usually managed to use it if needed.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was in a great location and the service was excellent.”
Reviews.Author: ajs6152
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was in a great location with wonderful views of central park. The staff headed by Jorge Guerrero treated us with incredible care and consideration, I would definitely recommend staying at the Sheraton NY Hotel & Towers.

Reviews.Title: “Not much to complain about... SOLID place to stay in NYC.”
Reviews.Author: OneTravelAddict
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a trip to New York City with my two other friends. All three of us are guys in our early 30s who travelled to NYC just to check out the city. I used Hotwire to book our NYC accommodations and was assigned this hotel. I subsequently checked out the reviews and became concerned after reading the negative comments. Having stayed at the hotel, I now know that my concerns (and the negative reviews) were quite misplaced.
