As the other reviews indicate, this hotel is located just a few blocks from Times Square and is very close to the subway lines. Great location. The hotel was busy at times (my friends and I stayed during the Labour Day weekend), but the service was efficient, friendly and quick. Our room was clean and comfortable, even if it was slightly dated. Although it was slightly small, the size of the room was nothing to complain of for me and two other guys. As I've indicated above, I read the negative reviews of this hotel. I have no idea where many of the comments are coming from. There is definite value in this hotel. That there were no mints on our pillows does not take away from that fact. My ONLY real complaint is that there was not free wireless and there was always a line at the computers set aside for guests. Nevertheless, I would easily recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel, good location, customer service below par.”
Reviews.Author: Pieter25
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 4 night stay in New York. Through Tripadvisor I booked this hotel for 105 pounds per night. My room was larger than expected. I had room 3920 with a nice Kingbed and a large lcd televison. The room was quite clean, except from the instrumentation of the airco and the airvent in the bathroom, which had a lot of dust on it. Also the reception told me my room had a bad. I honoustly have to say this bad must feel ashamed to call itself a bad. You have to imagine a bad being 1.20 m long and about 50 cm deep. Sitting in it is already a big task. One night I went to the the customer service desk to enquire for broadway tickets to the Lion King. The women behind the desk said a ticket would cost me $ 165,- . When I said this was to expensive for me she suddenly did not look me anymore. I must admit that this unpleasant behavior might just be the way a lot of New Yorkers are, but in a 4 star hotel you should expect differently. A nice thing is that they offer free internet in the lobby. Overall I would say this hotel is a good one if you are going for location in the hart of the city, but if you want good and friendly service and nice details in hotel and room, you might want to look for another hotel. I would rate this hotel 3,5 star at the most and certainly not 4 stars as Priceline is suggesting. Although not a bad hotel I think for my next visit to New York I would chose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location, great service, would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: CanadianGirl99
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a one week trip, stayed here the whole time. We got a crazy deal here through a family member but i would stay here again for full price. The location is great, just minutes from times square, fifth avenue, letterman, nbc, train station. it was really clean, the housekeeping lady was really nice, we bumped into her twice and was just delightful. the only thing is that we could hear people, i think they might have been the people staying upstairs but we could hear them talking. but it's not like they kept it up for the whole night or anything. would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location not very clean though”
Reviews.Author: deebarry
Reviews.Content: As long as you are out and about the Sheraton is perfect. Its a big busy hotel with average sized rooms. We were travelling with our 2 daughters and had a 2 double beds in one room - this meant there was not much space. The bathroom was basic but not spotlessly clean. It was obvious that this was a family room - wall paper had kids scribbles on it and carpet was very stained and sticky. However, we only slept there and showered - we were out and about enjoying NYC. Good conceriege recommended nice restaurants and got us reservations. Used their ticketing service to get sold out Broadway show tickets - parking efficient but expensive at $40 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Askell
Reviews.Content: This hotel is bang in the centre of everything, we stayed as part of our honeymoon and couldn't have asked for a better location, on entering the hotel its very impressive and the lifts to the floors are amazingly quick, we were on floor 42 so the view was amazing too. the rooms and coridore could do with a freshen in places but no more than a bit of wear and tear. If your in new york and spend time in your room your crazy. Within a few blacks is everything you have seen on tv, walking distance to most other things, and you can get a bus from down the street. Perfect for the tourist

Reviews.Title: “THE PERFECT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: kd125
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Hotel and Towers is an honest no frills hotel, the room and bathroom are fine if a little small for a family of 4. Reception staff and concierge team were excellent, great knowledge and always helpful and cheerful. What clinches it for this hotel is location. It is fantastically sited within a short stroll of Times Square, Broadway and the Central Park. Just a great place to stay if all you need is a place to rest.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Traveller13Calgary
Reviews.Content: I was apprehensive after reading some mixed reviews regarding the cleanliness and service at the Sheraton towers, but that was quickly dismissed during the first days of our week long stay. A great location, minutes from Times Square and a subway station just around the corner. We never experienced any long line ups at front desk and found all the staff to be very accomadating and helpful.Yes the rooms are small, but hey, this is New York! There were 3 of us,2 adults and our 13 year old daughter and stayed in a King room, apparently best if you need a cot in the room,(additional $28/night charge for cot). Not much for drawer space in the room but we made it work. I would say the best thing about the Sheraton aside from it's location was booking a room that had access to Club lounge on 44th floor which has an awesome breakfast selection as well as being open for nightly snacks/appetizers. We didn't fully appreciate until we ate breakfast out one morning,(lounge is closed sat/sun mornings), and cost us about $60-70 bucks! The hotel also has a free computer/internet lounge in lobby and Club lounge which came in handy, sometimes tough finding an empty terminal, but never had to wait too long for one to open up. You also have guest privallages at Sheraton Manhatten across the street which has a pool. We would definitely stay here again when we return to NY.

Reviews.Title: “Here is a Real Review of This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MemberDetroit
Reviews.Content: Over the years I have stayed at this hotel on 4 occasions, including trips for both business and pleasure. The reviews I recently read give a cross section between great and poor. A few were so ridiculous I could not believe we were speaking of the same property. Please be aware this is a fine hotel at a great location and anyone booking should feel most comfortable and satisfied. On this trip, check in took approximately 5-6 minutes (I requested a room with a view and got assigned a room on the 43rd floor with a fine view). Lobby, halls, corridor lighting, carpeting, elevators and public areas were updated and clean. The room, beds, sheets, television, blinds and bathroom were clean and in updated condition. No problems with housekeeping. Experienced travelers understand that standard hotel rooms in New York, or Tokyo, or Paris or London are relatively small when compared to typical beach or ocean side resorts or Las Vegas rooms, so room size should be a non-issue, as the rooms are typical for New York City. If you are not familiar with the Sheraton NY location, it is a 50 story hotel on Seventh Avenue at 53rd Street, which is 4 blocks from Times Square; 4 blocks from Carnegie Hall; 5 blocks from Central Park; 3 blocks from Rockefeller Center; 2 blocks from the Broadway Theater; and 1 block from the best deli sandwiches in New York (Stage Deli). There is a contemporary internet lounge/bar/coffee and seating area in the lobby as well as additional seating/lounge areas. The staff behind the reception and tour desks were helpful, knowledgeable and friendly. I contacted the assistant manager and informed him I would write a review to describe my experiences at the NY Sheraton in order for others to share with others. I can recommend this hotel without hesitation or problems. A Trip Advisor Member from Detroit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, free internet and close to subways”
Reviews.Author: jaql33
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through priceline, was a bit shakey on my winning due to all the tripadvisor reviews but I everything was fine. We didnt get to the hotel until 7pm, but check in was smooth got a room on the 42nd level... room was clean and aircon worked! Was given information about free internet down at the lobby (this was a big plus because I had gone to another hotel after this stay and was paying .69cents per minute to use the internet). My friend had blocked up the toilet.. we called guest services and they were up in less than 5 minutes to fix the problem. The location was perfect walking distance to Times Square as well as 5th Avenue shopping and the subway is just around the corner for any other destination. Delis is also next door. Great experience and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great location!”
Reviews.Author: jaipurple
Reviews.Content: I have to admit I was a little skeptical after reading reviews.. First of all, I booked my room through Priceline and got a really great price. I was traveling with another adult and needed 2 double beds. Once we arrived and were able to check in early, our needs were met in needing 2 double beds with no problem. I also asked for a room on a high floor, they were able to accommodate this request as well. The room is what we expected, not great (the room is only so big) but good enough and clean. Our room was also incredibly quiet. The air conditioner didn't work great. On the check out day I requested a late check out, the also were able to accommodate this request as well. This hotel is in a great location and I would go back and recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: shivaniii
Reviews.Content: the best location in Manhattan for a reasonable price.The room was good,no problems! definitely recommended..

Reviews.Title: “Really good exeperience”
Reviews.Author: SummerFun11173
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a visit to the Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers. I was very pleasantly surprised by how nice it was. The location was very central and the room was fine. We had a large flat panel TV, Starbucks coffee, and a nice room. The evening we went to a Broadway play it was an easy walk to the play and back. The hotel even let us check in early the first day. Great shopping nearby and many attractions including the David Letterman Show. The only drawback to the hotel was that the refrigerator in the room could not be used for our own stuff - it was filled with mini-bar items for sale. However, from what I understand the hotel would have provided a fridge if we requested one. We also got a very good rate for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: CoolTraveler63
Reviews.Content: Upon check in the front staff was very nice and willing to help in anyway they could. We had problems with the air but with a quick response from the the maintenance staff we were told they would have it fixed or we would have a new room.. My husband and I were on our way for the day. When we arrived back that afternoon the air was still messed up but had a message on the phone for us to call Joan Torres, stating the air was unable to be fixed and they were giving us a different room. We moved and sure enough that air was messed up. No panic as we spoke to the Manager Jorge Guerrero he made sure we were placed in a room that the air was working. He had a maintance guy to go check the air before we moved and then he met us in the room to verify the air was working. Mr. Guerrero was very kind and went out of his way to make sure our stay was comfortable from then out. He even left a message letting us know his schedule incase we needed anything. The morning of our departure I asked to see him just to let him know how much we appreciated everything he did to make our accomdations comfortable. If more managers were like him with handling situations then it would be a better place for travelers. I look forward to coming back to New York and staying at the Sheraton New York City and towers and most of all seeing Mr. Guerrero. The location is within walking distance to Time Square subway. Be prepared to walk and ride the subway, that was the coolest.

Reviews.Title: “If we visit New York again, this hotel is our choice”
Reviews.Author: viper1979
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed here. We liked everything about this place.

Reviews.Title: “I cannot say enough positive things about this hotel-very affordable, clean, great location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: petstone
Reviews.Content: My husband, two younger children (ages 5 and 6) and I traveled to NYC for a short 3-days, 2-nights trip. Our travel agent reccomended the Sheraton New York Hotel & Towers, and, never having been to New York, I was nervous that our room would be cramped, dirty and surrounded by constant noise. But to my surprise it was none of those things. The room was modern/updated, spacious, clean, quiet....there is nothing negative I can say about it! All of the staff - from the front desk to the concierge to the cleaning staff were all very friendly and accomodating. The hotel is extremely close to Times Square, Rockefellar Ctr., Central Park, Museum of Nat'l History, among other places. There is no pool on premises (you do have pool priveliges at the hotel across the street, however), but - as we found, who has time to swim while you're visiting NYC??!! BOOK THIS HOTEL - you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service by Joy Clark at the Front Desk!! I LOVE this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: DeanFan199
Reviews.Content: I love the Sheraton Hotel and Towers! It is my favorite place to stay and I am never disappointed. The location is perfect if you want to be in the center of everything. You can walk down the street to Times Square and walk right back to your hotel and feel like you've escaped the madness. You are pretty much two or three blocks from everything. Fifth Avenue, Rockefeller Center, FAO Schwartz, etc! The hotel room sizes are the best, considering how small other ones are. Big thank you to Joy Clark at the Front Desk! She was very warm, polite, accomodating....just what I needed to see after a hectic arrival into the city! I really can't thank you enough for your amazing customer service and I look forward to your hospitatlity when I arrive again this week! Thanks again! Evelyn

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: mystic827
Reviews.Content: Checked in on July 30 for a four night stay, to a very pleasant front desk clerk named Carlos. He said that there was no two double bed room available and gave us a $50 credit.(we booked a room with two double room) and said there should be one tomorrow. The next day, before we left for the day, we went to the front desk to ask for a room with two double beds. The front desk clerk, Joy, was very rude in saying that since I booked through Priceline there are no guarantees that you will get a room with two double beds. I responded back saying I understand that but I e-mailed your hotel and requested a room with two double beds. The e-mail response stated that my booking was for two double beds. She responded back by saying that unless I have the e-mail printout on hand they will not change the room and still stated the Priceline response from earlier. It was a good thing that the hotel had their computers hooked up to a printer. I went back and showed her my e-mails to the hotel. She took it to her supervisor and came back saying that I would get the room I requested. For a hotel with a four star rating, I did not feel like I was treated fairly. Especially since it was a birthday weekend for the friend that I was celebrating with. The room was nothing special. The hotel is definitely not worth the price I spent on Priceline. ($110/night). Will not go back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: dennieok
Reviews.Content: We stayed in New York for 3 days and this hotel was great.Just down the road was Times Square and just around the cornor was a subway.It was a small enough room but it came with complimentry starbucks coffee sachets.Altough the brekfast was dere enough for $25, there was plenty of breckfast cafes along the street.The lobby reminded me of Grand Central Station!!Overall it was great

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Bren71
Reviews.Content: The stay at your hotel was magnificient! Very special thanks to Jorge Guerrero for his careful attention!

Reviews.Title: “Accomadating, helpful, clean and convienient!”
Reviews.Author: njonesAlbany_NY
Reviews.Content: Thank you for such excellent care while I was in New York. The staff and accommodations were wonderful! I see there are quite a few changes going on at the Towers! Also when my daughter left her cell phone everyone was so helpful and she was extremely happy when she got it back so soon. Thank you again for everything!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, crampy room”
Reviews.Author: MichelF007
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location, close to time square and Central Park. This hotel is a very busy one, always crouded in the lobby. Rooms are a bit small, no place for a rollaway bed. A/C is very noisy. Bathroom is very small, and mildew was all over in the shower. Needs a good refurbishment. No wireless internet access in the room, this is not acceptable from a 4* hotel. Parking is also very expensive, $42 per 24 hours. Staff is OK, but we had a very good service from one of the bell boy, named Eddy, an italian-american guy, which helped us a lot (it was our first time in NYC). Also, the concierge service is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Fine - not great, but fine”
Reviews.Author: amdura
Reviews.Content: Check-in kiosk was broken, so had to wait in line to check in. Unusual, but OK. Was prepared for a small room, and it was, but it wasn't smaller than most in this price range in midtown. Four of us managed just fine. Room was clean, bathroom clearly has aged, but it didn't make us crazy. Beds were comfortable. Only real problem was the inability to modify the room temp. It was muggy and warm when we were there, and we couldn't cool the room. Even with the fan on High and the setting on Coolest, the room never changed temperature. Difficult for some to sleep because of that. Also, wireless internet is only free in the lobby, and that was spotty ($15/day to connect in room). You could see people wandering around with their laptops in hand, trying to get connected. There is a spot in the front with available computers, but they were almost always in use. I can't understand how more expensive hotels can insist on charging for internet access when small motels (Comfort Inn, Hampton Inn etc.) don't charge a penny. It's this way in many cities. Nice location - subway right outside the door. Handy. $42 per day to park in the garage, but we were able to leave our luggage for free on the day of check-out for 4 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms a little small”
Reviews.Author: KathyMD
Reviews.Content: Great location, can walk to Time Square ,Central Park and Fifth Avenue. Also close to the subway. Service was not great and the rooms seemed a little cramped (we did have 2 adults and 2 children in the room). Never ate in the hotel but many good restaurants surround the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: 20854Epicurean
Reviews.Content: My company booked a block of rooms for a conference in August. One of our meetings was moved up a day but still within the time frame reserved by my company. Each and every person except for the front desk manager (Joseph) was RUDE as dirt when I called. From saying the hotel was booked (it as not); to saying my company didn't book the date (it did); to just overall cutting me off when I was speaking the overall customer service was AWFUL. They really need a primer on customer service and to hire more professionals since this is essentially the face of Sheraton to the masses. In this economy people should really vote with their feet and only frequent establishments with a "can-do" attitude or an at least "I'm sorry I can't accommodate your request" attitude.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: mazdasign
Reviews.Content: Before our departure I decided to read some of the reviews on this hotel. We had our reservation and some of the reviews did not look good. We took our chances and went. We were greeted at the desk by a front desk clerk named Griffin. What a great guy. We stayed there for 3 days and 2 nights. It was fantastic. The room was great and super clean. I never care about the size. I just sleep there. It was clean and full of all your needs for a hotel room. The staff were extremely gracious and friendly. The location is perfect. When we go back, we will stay at the your hotel. Don't read the negative reviews. It sounds like they were written by bunch of never pleased people. I thought as a middle eastern man I should expect the worst treatment and the staff proofed me wrong. Thanks for a great service and a great place. Thry made our trip more memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding front desk and guest services”
Reviews.Author: miamilaker
Reviews.Content: I had a very pleasant stay the front desk was very friendly and courteous, specially George Guerrero's assistance to getting my internet up and running. Very clean hotel I will defenitely come back when visiting the Big Apple from Miami Lisa Perez

Reviews.Title: “Sarwood Platinum guests should avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lew21
Reviews.Content: I stay at Sheraton hotels and other starwood properties over 100 nights each year. without a doubt this is the worst Sheraton I have ever stayed at. The lounge for breakfast is crowded and nothing short of a pushing match. When I explained the issue to the manager on duty he dismissed my complaint as the hotel was full. As if I have never stayed a Sheraton that has been full. Seems that they have done there best to attract every possible traveller with the promise of free breakfast. The hotel is crowded and it takes forever to get anything you need. The check in took forever as the people behind the front desks were simply bad at thier jobs. If you are used to good service at Sheraton hotels I suggest you avoid this hotel

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is fine, the rooms are fine, the location is awesome”
Reviews.Author: PhilCedarRapids
Reviews.Content: I had read some negitive reviews about the hotel before we left for NY. I was alittle worried about the rooms being clean and mold in the bathroom & shower. Our room was clean and fresh. The staff was very helpful, requested room with a view of Times Square and we got it. We hardly ever waited for the elevator. The hallways were not filled with kids. We never heard the people in the next room. If I was returning to NY next month, I would stay again at this hotel. On a 1 to 10 (10 being the best) we would rate it a 7. Great place for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay; Hotel Guest Services Manager Looked After Us Like No Other!”
Reviews.Author: O2BCool
Reviews.Content: I don't mind saying that I have been to this property many times in the past, both on business and pleasure, and most times the experience has been less than stellar. On our past visit however, things have changed greatly for the better! Although we weren't able to check-in until later in the day (rooms with 2 double beds are in high demand), the manager and staff at the hotel did everything to make our stay an enjoyable one! The concierge was both a pleasure to speak to, and a huge help everytime we asked him for help and/or his advice. Jorge Guerrero, the Guest Service Center Manager, went out of his way to make our stay an enjoyable one. From responding personally to an in-room survey, to following up personally after our stay, it is obvious to me that the culture at the Sheraton New York Hotel & Towers has drastically changed for the better under his watch! Location is A-1; everything is within easy reach. Thanks Jorge, and thanks to his staff! We certainly look forward to our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “This place was awesome!! Great Service Too!!”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel626
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Sheraton New Yorker for night in the city with a bachelorette party. I had booked the hotel for the group and all of the girls couldn't believe what a great place I had chosen for us to stay. We were right in the middle of everything, so the location was perfect, and the hotel was very nice, and classy. The hotel was very modern, it looked as though it had been updated recently, and our rooms were spacious and comfortable. I'd also like to give credit to one special employee of the hotel, Kenny Imafian. He service was impecable, and really made us feel like special guests.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for - and that's not a bad thing!”
Reviews.Author: wannawazoo
Reviews.Content: I'm just back from a 4 night stay at the Sheraton NY. We had a fabulous experience. EVERYONE we interacted with at the hotel was fabulous. The location is perfect! The rooms were small but not horrible (have you been to London?!). The beds were fabulous. I understand now why they are called "heavenly".. I would absolutely stay here again. I was traveling with my two boys (10 & 7) and it was exactly what we needed...

Reviews.Title: “Overall good hotel, great location close to Central Park and Times Square, worst housekeeping I have ever experienced.”
Reviews.Author: FITMUM61
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for us being runners we were a few blocks from Central Park, it also has a very good gym with everything you would need. Very central to everything and not to expensive, but the housekeeping was terrible, not once in 8 nights was the room dusted the dust on the side table and tv table was thick enough to write my name in. I spilt museli on the floor on arrival and it was never vacumed up, toilets rolls were just put on top of toilet not onto holders, same with tissues, box put on top of empty box. didn't get soap or shampoo for 2 days. Beware of mini bar, and mini bar drawer it is on a sensor system and if you take their stuff out to put your stuff in you get charged I had several hundred dollars of mini bar expenses on my bill despite not consuming anything. I was even charged 3 times for an international adapter that I had just taken out to look at.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Soccerdad2
Reviews.Content: Bid on Priceline for a 4 Star in midtown and ended up here. They did not have the requested king room on check in but did upgrade us the following day. To compensate for the room, they gave us access to the club floor where there was a decent breakfast spread and happy hour snacks. Free breakfast in NYC ended up being a good deal. The rooms were ok but somewhat old and run down looking. The staff was friendly and with the great midtown location, we had a great time. I would not give the hotel 4 stars but we did not pay a 4 star price so we were satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Time and hope it's my last”
Reviews.Author: travelmommaryland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last weekend, because the Westin was booked. This was our second time at this hotel and I really hope to never stay here again. We arrived early so we knew our rooms weren't going to be ready. They told us they would be ready no later than 3 pm. We went shopping and returned well after 3 pm to find only one of our rooms was ready. The other connecting room was not ready until after 5 pm. The bathroom in that room was completely disgusting. Hair everywhere, shower not completely cleaned. Stains on the door and walls. I think if you go to NYC you are only in the room to sleep at night so I tried to overlook it, but that was hard. I'm a bit of clean freak when it comes to bathrooms and that is the reason why I can't give this hotel anything higher than a 3 star. Great location though! When we go to NYC next time I would go back to the Westin or try another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Vacation”
Reviews.Author: housewife_superstar
Reviews.Content: A large busy hotel but run efficiently. When an hotel is as large as this one it must be very difficult to keep everyone happy at all times. I found this hotel to be very clean, well run and all that one could ask for in a 5 day stay. Although there was quite a line for check-in everyone was dealt with quickly and efficiently and although we were early for checking in rooms were found for our party without any problems. My daughter and I had a problem with the delivery of a parcel using Fedex as a company which by the way was a problem with the retailer nothing to do with Fedex. They could not have done any more for us the staff were superb, thank you Alan, what a company. All but one section excelled themselves with smiles and helpfulness concern . On checking out the staff were sullen and quite rude trying to charge me for items that I had not consumed but overall I will return and use Sheraton once again not allowing just one person out of many staff spoil it for the company. The location of this hotel was great e.g. Metro just outside a few yards from the hotel and very convenient for all the sights. I would definately recommend this hotel to all types of traveller!

Reviews.Title: “puzzled by reviews”
Reviews.Author: billmil
Reviews.Content: My wifes idea of camping is downgrading to a Holiday inn, therefore I was quite concerned about staying here after reading some reviews. To add a little more pressure this was my wifes first visit to New York. She did not want to visit New York because of the "BAD PERCEPTION" she had of the city. My wife overcame her fear of New York and was impressed with the hotel. The satff were pleasant and efficient. The rooms were spacious for a large city. The room was clean and well equipped. Bravo to the Sheraton on being able to please my wife's high standards.

Reviews.Title: “Everything said about the Sheraton is true- not a 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: LairBear
Reviews.Content: Don't expect more than a large hotel in need of a sprucing-up. We had unpleasant odors in our room, as others on this site have discussed. It was not inhabitable, but even at the bargain price we got through Priceline, I didn't feel it was worth it. (Later learned that Sheraton was accepting offers of $115 a night, so we didn't get the bargain basement!) Whether the management deliberately places Priceline folks in the worst rooms or whether it was a coincidence, my confidence in Sheraton plummented. I would rather pay more and get a hotel that is decent. On the up side, the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “A weekend getaway without breaking the bank”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl96
Reviews.Content: Great location, really comfortable beds. Not the best in the city, but certainly above average - clean, moderately spacious (at least you can get around the beds, etc. - in NYC, that's no small feat). Concierge and reception staff are extremely slow at noticing you exist.

Reviews.Title: “I would go with another hotel...service very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Canadiangirltraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really meant for those who are attending a conference or are part of a big group. The hotel is massive and does not have an intimate atmosphere (taking into account the fact that it's NYC). The lobby was always crowded with masses of people at all hours of the day, but the elevators were surprisingly quick. The Sheraton Manhattan across the street is much better if you want a big hotel with a more quiet, intimate surrounding. Now for the most disappointing part of our stay...Service. Service at the reception is incredibly slow. They have 4 people working at 8am when there is no crowd but 1 person working at 6pm which is prime check-in time. There were 5 of us in line and we waited about 15 minutes to get served! Concierge - both times that I spoke with them, I encountered rudeness! The first lady was too busy cleaning her counter to answer my question properly- didn't even look at me. The guy on the second day was too busy talking and laughing with his colleagues- he was able to pull away from his conversation for a second to rudely answer my question. Luggage Room - We checked out early on our last day and wanted to drop off our luggage for storage. The line went all through the lobby and we waited in line for almost 30 minutes to drop off our luggage!! Maybe think about expanding your space and staff to accommodate your 1000 guests!!! For a hotel chain that prides itself on excellent service, I was very disappointed. The room itself was okay. The beds were really comfortable and the long desk under the window was handy. The room is quite small, which is expected for a NYC hotel, so no surprise there. The bathroom is small as well and definitely not fitting of a "4 star" hotel. To be honest, the size didn't bother us as much, rather it was the black moldy stuff in the cracks of the shower tiles... disgusting. Nothing bad can be said about the location of this hotel. If you want to stay in midtown, it really is perfect. Close to the subway, times square, central park, rockefeller, etc.. Overall, unless this is the best deal you get for midtown, I would try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: stevoCardiff
Reviews.Content: very big hotel(quite small rooms)NYC style-Location fab for Times Sq. or Cental Park. Easy and cheap (2 dollars) for bus access to downtown and seaport. Free internet in lobby to check in online before return flight. good lobby bar with plenty of atmosphere. Loads of conferences going on. Taxi ride back to Newark Airport by limo(Evan De La Pena) great guy.45mins -60mins , approx 70 dollars incl toll/tips. Recomend Rockerfeller (top of the rock) , better view the Empire state.make sure you do Staten Island ferry(free and fantastic views of Liberty and Manhattan Skyline). Also did Heli trip(never forget it). The Big Apple is the most exciting city I have ever been(twice)-felt very safe and secure , even after dark ,Go and explore , Times sq after dark is buzzing.Hard Rock and Planet Hollywood good for food and cocktails. NYC not the place for stags or getting drunk but WOW!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Jessie584
Reviews.Content: As one who has done her fair share of traveling, the Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers is by far a place that holds my fondest memories. From being greeted at the door with a friendly, helpful smile to checkout, every need or want was quickly met. The room was very spacious with a great view of midtown New York. For once, everything that I needed was just a walk away. Fresh coffee, clean linens, helpful staff and great food are just some, in a long list of this hotels wonderful amenities. I will stay here again and have already booked my second stay. I will be a sheraton customer everywhere I travel!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not four stars”
Reviews.Author: raku8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one Tuesday night in July 2009 after booking on Priceline. it wasn't bad, especially for the price, but not four stars. THE GOOD The price was great, but I'll credit Priceline for that, more than the Sheraton. Likewise, the location was superb. Close to all midtown attractions, Central Park, Times Square, Fifth Square, etc. Can't think of a better Manhattan location. The hotel is huge but the elevator service was fast and efficient. Check-in line was fairly long but efficient once I got the front desk. Staff was very professional and courteous. I parked my car in the attached garage for $42 a day. Dropping it off was quick and efficient (picking it up another matter -- see below). My room was spacious. I was on the 10th floor so the room was of office buildings and the street below. Not bad, but nothing special. Beautiful flat screen LG television. Of course I wasn't in my room enough to watch much. The bed and linens were clean and the Sheraton bed, like all Sheraton beds I've slept in was very comfortable. A large desk in front of the window was provided. This was one of the best hotel desks I've ever seen. Internet service provided (wired, not free -- again, see below). I used the concierge on to ask for directions to a specific popular museum uptown. She was very helpful. There is not a real restaurant in the hotel, but I went to the bar for a late night meal and drink. The food was fine. The service, not so great. Bathroom was clean enough. There was a little black in the grout lines but this did not bother me. I checked my luggage during the day after I checked out. The checkroom was fast and efficient, which is more than I can say for the last hotel I stayed in in New York. They do charge $3.25 a bag, but I'd rather have that than free with an optional tip. I think you get better service this way. THE BAD The room was very warm, bordering on hot. I could not find any way to adjust the AC. Remember this was July. There was a vent on the top of the desk that was literally encrusted with dust. It was disgusting. It was blowing slightly cool air. Every time I went into the hall, it was a relief to be able to breathe! If I'd stayed more than one night, I would have asked the front desk for another room,though reading here it seem this is a chronic problem. internet service in the room is wired and $15 a day. For four stars, i expected wireless and free. Come on! Much, much cheaper hotels have this. It was fast enough though. There was supposedly free Wireless in the lobby, but who wants to schlep to the lobby just to check email? No refrigerator in the room. There was a coffee maker that I didn't use. There should have been a refrigerator. The bathroom, while clean enough, lacked amenities found in three star hotels. There were tiny bottles of shampoo and conditioner. No lotion. Not high quality brands. The hairdryer was tiny and low powered and not attached to the wall. Again, very poor quality. As I mentioned, dropping off my car was smooth, but I had to wait at last 20 minutes to pick it up. This seemed excessive. I went to the bar for a late night drink and dinner. The drink and food was fine but the service was poor. The bartender was completely preoccupied with a personal call on his cell phone. I repeatedly had to practically yell at him to get his attention. It was like he could not be bothered to do his job. Then, I asked for the left over that from my meal to be packed up to take up to my room. They did this without complaint, but when i got to my room, the silverware was filthy -- caked with food. Utterly gross. BOTTOM LINE Great location, mass market hotel. Room has some nice amenities but climate control and dust is a serious issue. Does not deserve four star rating. You should not pay full price here.

Reviews.Title: “The best bang for your buck you can get in NY”
Reviews.Author: TomasBillik
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 2 nights at the end of June 2009. The location is the best you can imagine - just a short walk from Times Square, and a few blocks from Central Park. So after a day full of wondering around Manhattan, we could just come back to the hotel, get some rest and head to Times Square for a night walk, without worrying too much how to get back. In the morning, I went to Central Park for my everyday run, without having to take subway - it's just a short walk. Subway is also easily accesible, and you can get anywhere in Manhattan. The hotel was very busy (it was Friday afternoon, with many tourists checking in), however the people at the check-in deck were very quick, while maintaining friendly and proffesional attitude. I asked if they could give us a room as high as possible, and we got a room on 49th floor. The rooms are not big, but why should I care - we came there to see New York, and not to stay in the room. It looked like the rooms were recently renovated, and the housekeeping staff made pretty good job in making sure that the rooms stay clean. I am booking another weekend at this hotel as I type this review - the stay was very enjoyable, and well worth the money I paid.

Reviews.Title: “A very special birthday, thanks to the Felicia and the Sheraton staff”
Reviews.Author: AskingForHelp
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights over the Memorial Day weekend at the Sheraton. I made our reservation through Priceline for a very reasonable rate ($118) but, after reading some of the very negative TA reviews, I had concerns about the quality and cleanliness of the rooms. (I knew that the location was absolutely perfect for us, given the immediate proximity to the subway.) I emailed the Sheraton to tell them that this was a very special surprise birthday trip, and to ask if it was possible to request a recently renovated room on a high floor with a view. I received an immediate email reply, thanking me for my email and advising that our request would be noted in our reservation. I crossed my fingers. We arrived at approx. 8:00 p.m. Friday evening and checked in with no difficulty. Although we were advised that there was no room with a view available, we were given a room on the 44th floor. The gentleman at check-in advised that this was a club floor with complimentary breakfast Monday through Friday. We were surprised and grateful. When we reached our room, we found that there was a nice view of the surrounding Midtown area, rather than an obstructed view or a view of another building directly across the street, and we were pleased. The furnishings were slightly worn, but the room was very clean, including the bathroom, which was large and included a nice selection of amenities. As we were unpacking, there was a knock on our door, and a waiter came in and surprised us with a small cheese and fruit plate, a bottle of imported mineral water, and a lovely note with birthday greetings from Felicia Carrington-Nelson, who had corresponded with me via email about the special nature of this trip. I can't begin to express how much this very kind and generous gesture meant to both of us, particularly the birthday celebrant. We have stayed in some very, very nice hotels and B&Bs over the years, but we have never had a hotel respond in such a generous and personal manner, particularly given that we had made our reservation on Priceline. What a wonderful start to a wonderful weekend. The hotel's location made it very easy for us to do everything on our itinerary, including visits to the Cloisters, the Metropolitan Museum of Art, the New York Botanical Garden in the Bronx, a Broadway show, a lovely dinner uptown, and the Staten island ferry. The kindness and generosity shown to us at the Sheraton made our entire weekend extra special. Monday breakfast in the club room was absolutely terrific, with a large selection of cereals,bagels, pastries, fruit, oatmeal, boiled eggs, yogurt, juices, and coffee. The club room was lovely, and the breakfast was a fabulous start to the last day of our weekend. As others have noted, the hotel provides a very organized left-luggage service so that guests can leave their luggage for the day after checking out. We knew that there was a small charge for this, and we were very pleased with the efficiency and security of this service. And because this is such a large hotel, taxis are always available to take guests to the airport or train station. Our entire experience at the hotel was extremely positive and enjoyable, and we would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to others. After returning, I emailed Felicia to thank her for her thoughtfulness in making this birthday trip to New York so special for us, and I wanted to let other TA members know about the wonderful service that we received, both before and during our stay. Thank you, Felicia, for everything you did to make this a birthday to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: kjohn_9
Reviews.Content: After reading several average to not so good reviews on this hotel - we were very apprehensive about staying at the The Sheraton Hotel & Towers. We just returned home after a 4 night/5 day stay in NYC at this hotel. Our hotel stay was great! We had a corner room on the 38th floor. The rooms are of average size but the beds were very comfortable and our room was clean. The service was excellent and the location was also excellent - we were only a few blocks from Time Square and shopping/restaurant venues were very close by. We received a great rate thru employee discount. I have been to NYC several times and this hotel does rank high on my list of nice affordable places to stay - I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: kbanthony
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through priceline at $120/night. After reading the other reviews on tripadvisor, I was extremely nervous! I remembered that most of the "good" reviews said that they had asked for a room on a higher floor, so I did the same. As soon as we got to the room, I carefully inspected the bed for bedbugs and the bathroom for roaches. All of my worry was in vain, because the hotel was absolutely fine. Would I pay $340/night to stay here? No way. But for the price I paid, it was great. Good location, great service, fantastic views, clean rooms, and a plasma TV (this was what my fiance was MOST excited about). Overall, it was a great bargain, and I'm happy with our stay. If you pay the full price to stay here, I understand the disappointment - but if you book at the priceline rate (and make sure to ask for an upper-level room), you should have no worries!

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Towers~trust me...I wouldn't stay there”
Reviews.Author: partyvegas
Reviews.Content: My husband decided to take me on a whirlwind trip to NY again so I was so excited. He booked the trip before I had a chance to help him. Bless his heart. I always come to Tripadvisor to check out reviews...too late! When I read the reviews I was quite concerned because the bad outweighed the good from most people. SoI called ahead and told them that I would like a "renovated room." She said "Ma'm they are all renovated." so I relaxed and decided what will be will be. When we got there we saw that the lobby was beautiful~like a Vegas hotel, so we were happy. The front desk people were EXTREMELY polite...in fact everyone right down to the bell hop were great! They even gave us an early check in which we were grateful for since we were tired. We got up to the room and it wasn't too bad...small, the furniture is on the older side, something I could deal with, but when I went into the bathroom it smelled like old dishrag smell. Very musty and they had covered the odors with a spray that was horrific. So, we called downstairs and they sent the bellhop up to take us to another room. It was on the lower floor. I walked in...it was somewhat clean, I went into the bathroom and smelled the same smell! (I just wish I didnt have such a good nose at times). The bellhop was so nice that I just grinned and said "This is much better " and we stayed. As I was getting in the shower later that day I smelled the wall and that's what it was! The rags that they used to wipe down the walls and floors was the old musty dishrag smell. Soo...I had some body spray with me! Every day for 4 days I sprayed down the walls with Vanilla Spray and it seemed to cover the smell. The maid service did leave the room neat and went beyond the call of duty, but I just couldn't get past the smell. The air conditioning unit is a unit on the floor which has the air shooting right onto the bed. The first night I froze. You can't change the vent direction it only blows one way, so I took the phonebook propped the whole metal cover that covers it, and stood the air vent straight up.,,,,,it worked...problem was solved. To be a new room, the carpeting smelled musty, very musty. Trust me, I would never steer anyone wrong....but for the money that you pay it is not worth it. Last time we went to NY we stayed at the Mariott Marquis on Times Square, and that is where we will stay again. Sure, its even more, but MUCH CLEANER, and updated. Also we called downstairs to the concierge to ask them about a restaurant and hubby put the call on speaker phone. After 45 minutes of holding, he went downstairs. They said if they are "with someone that they are not allowed to answer the phone." The good thing about the Sheraton is, that the location is wonderful. It is right in the middle of the theatre district and 2 blocks from the Observatory and where they film the Today Show. Also if you walk straight down the street about 5 blocks which isn't bad at night, you are in Times Square. Everyone at the Sheraton was very nice, that is the good thing that I have to say about it....it would be much better if HOUSEKEEPING would get their act together. They need to use clean cloths to wash the showers and clean mops. I would rate this as a 2 1/2 star hotel...NOT A 4 . I was very disappointed as it was not a Mariott! However, in Fl we have stayed at Embassy Suites and loved it...it just doesn't have to be a Mariott...but in NY I would only stay at a Mariott or a Hilton. I can handle a room being small or whatever but cleanliness is a must. We took the Red Bus tour. It is well worth it if you want to see the city. We bought a 2 day ticket since we wanted to sightsee and get off and on at our leasure.( the 2 days starts from the time that is posted on the pass when you buy it, so best to start the time right when you will use it) We went to the Statue of Liberty, which is a must do trip. It was so exciting. Two days after we got back they opened the crown to the public. However, I think you have to have 2 wks notice before you can go into it. They said it is very high and people couldn't make it all the way up and they got out of breath....so you must be in good shape to attempt it. When we got off the boat, we walked to the World Trade Center and took pictures. We ate at a little sandwich shop which was delish. The last day we were there we only had til noon to shop, so we took a taxi which was about $15.00 one way to the Chinatown district. It is quite aways, but it was worth it, we had fun and bought some neat jewelry from the shops. REMEMBER*** if you head to the airport in a shuttle that is a complimentary shuttle from the hotel to the airport....you need to leave 4 hrs ahead of time. We left 3 hrs and barely made it there. It took our shuttle driver an hour and a half.... after stopping everywhere under the sun and taking back roads so he wouldn't have to pay the toll at rush hour. We had it figured if we left 3 hrs ahead of time we had plenty of time. We had 15 min to spare. We also will not travel on Travelocity again because, we wanted to change the hotel after we had the tickets and they said $600 to change it or something ridiculous. Much better to take a taxi to the airport. I think it's $40 but well worth it. We loved NY and will go back again, but have learned some lessons. Book your flight and your hotel separately. I refused to let the room ruin my trip...thank God for the body spray! ha Enjoy your trip and I hope if you stay here that your stay is better and that someone from the hotel has read this review.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: disneyjean
Reviews.Content: We were only staying one night and arrived to check in very early. The room was not ready but we were told it would be available about noon. We check our bags (no charge)and went sight seeing. We returned late in the afternoon and were given a room on the 42nd floor. We found the air conditioner torn apart and laying in the floor - the workmen returned a few mintues later. I called the front desk and they apologized and immediatly upgraded us to the club level. Someone brought us our new room key within 5 mintues. Our room was mid-sized, very clean and the bed was wonderful. The bathroom was clean and the shower was great. We had total quiet and slept great! Would definitetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Sheraton Experience ever !”
Reviews.Author: jBigoo
Reviews.Content: Just back from NYC where I was in transit. The hotel is perfectly located. Check in and out staff was professional. However, I have never seen a Sheraton like this. It is not like the room or the bathroom is small. The room was over aged and dirty. So far away from any Sheraton standard. So disapointing. Everything inside this room seemed to be broken or nearly. At the end, I have been woken up by the housekeeping that entered into my room at 7 am !!! Many options exists for a smooth and comfortable stay in new York city. Thus pass your way.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: patbiswanger
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers exceeded my expectations. It is a big, busy hotel, but the staff was very professional, so the fact that there were several groups in the hotel, including, most conspicuously, a dance competition for adolescent girls, did not affect our stay. The room was small but well-appointed (and of course it's small: this is prime real estate!), and the bathroom was small but clean and functional. Housekeeping was excellent. Best of all was the location: a block off Broadway, in the heart of the theater district. I would defintely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: dancer97
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Towers from June 24th to July 2nd 2009. We had a red eye flight coming in to JFK and arrived at the hotel at about 6am. They told us our room wouldn't be ready until around 10am ( which wasn't a big suprise) so we just left our bags with the doorman and left for breakfast. We came back around 10ish and were delighted when we were told that they would let us check in early since our room was ready ( I believe check in is around 3pm). The room was clean and very comfortable. Yes, the room is a bit small but it worked great for the three of us. The beds and pillows were very soft. Our room was on the 41st floor and we could hear no street noise. The bathroom did have a little bit of mold in the shower and one of the air vents in the shower had dust clogging up, but that was our only real issue with the room. Other than that, everything was great. All the staff we encountered was friendly and helpful. The lobby is always bustling with people during all hours of the day. A major plus were the computers you could use in the lobby ( Good luck finding an computer, they're always being used.) The location was good. You're right there in Times Square and Central Park is about 4 or 5 blocks away. All of the subway stations are within walking distance.I was very nervous about staying here after reading all the bad reviews on TripAdvisor but we had a great stay and recommend it to anyone staying in NYC. If you're nervous about staying here, RELAX because it's a great hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel needs serious updating”
Reviews.Author: Dockworker
Reviews.Content: We visited New York on 6/26/09 and stayed 5 nights at Sheraton New York Hotel & Towers 7th avenue. Having been to New York on previous occasions and stayed at other hotels we experienced 1st class service and accommodation. On this visit we were again looking forward to a similar experience and a rewarding holiday but were sadly let down however by the standard of bedroom accommodation or cleaned. Without doubt in the past this hotel has been a fantastic and top class hotel but not today as it requires serious updating especially in the bedrooms. Our room on 43rd floor in size and general layout was more than satisfactory but the general conditions were not worthy of an international hotel chain. The dark brown coloured carpet was old, frayed and unclean and looked as if it had not been changed for years. The bed linen also left a lot to be desired and wasn't ever changed during the period of our stay. The bathroom although very small but adequate had black moulding stains around the bath and wall areas and suggested total neglect. The daily attendance by staff was simply to change bathroom towels and rearrange bedclothes as no hovering, dusting or polishing took place during our stay. We never made a complaint to reception as I had ignored other comments and reviews that warned readers of problems at this hotel. The hotel is in a fantastic part of New York only a 5 minute stroll to central park and Times Square but readers should be aware and seriously consider this hotel as a holiday option until its bedrooms and hygiene are serious addressed and immediately improved. .

Reviews.Title: “Killed a cockroach recently? I did at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: eurojunk
Reviews.Content: Hotel was listed as a 4 star and just didn't live up to it. Starwood usually has very nice properties and this was the worst one I have stayed in awhile. I understand its NYC and the rooms can be small, but don't have them dirty. Their was hair in the tub, moldy soap dish in shower and a cockroach on the floor we had to kill. The windows were very dirty, shades caked with dust. Just disappointing. Can you believe this is a starwood hotel?? I couldn't. 4 star too! The area of town is great - you can't beat it, but this hotel can be better if it wanted to be. The concierge is rude as well - I asked about a tour from one of those double decker buses and she said "I can only tell you about the one company we support." Really? Just the one you have a deal with? It's all about the money - not about the service with this management. Bring a can of raid when you stay here next too.

Reviews.Title: “The Sheraton was great!”
Reviews.Author: LLH58
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton with a friend to celebrate our milestone birthday! After reading the reviews on here, I was a little nervous. Well I had nothing to worry about it. Checkin was quick and easy. We got a room on the 48th floor with a view of Central Park. They also gave us club room advantgages which means Mon thru Fri you get a free breakfast and happy hour in the evening. Check out was a breeze. Instead of checking your bags at $3.25 each just heave the bell captain hold them and all you have to do is give him a tip when you pick up your bags. The staff here was all friendly even though it was very busy. Room was clean, beds were AMAZING.....dont hesitate to stay here, its a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “great location ,great service”
Reviews.Author: QCP
Reviews.Content: we had a wonderful stay at the sheraton , it is easy to get to centrlal park and go for a stroll,the staff were all very welcoming and professional, the room was very comfortable , the lobby is very nice and we like the bar. thanks to Tim Keating uniform services and Sean Verney Hotel Manager for a great stay for our mini vacation in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “right in the center of it all”
Reviews.Author: marywOntariocanada
Reviews.Content: The only negative about the hotel is that the rooms are as hot as an oven. The employees are great.

Reviews.Title: “It's like being in my own bed...”
Reviews.Author: Erma2
Reviews.Content: I just l-o-v-e the beds and (especially) the pillows at the Sheraton Hotels! Being in the heart of Manhatten is really nice too, but when it comes time to rest these tired bones, I need the comfort of a Sheraton bed! Thanks for making the important things special, Sheraton!

Reviews.Title: “This is the perfect place to stay in Manhattan.”
Reviews.Author: joepeg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 nights and 3 days in NYC for our anniversary. We traveled with another couple and stayed at the Sheraton New York. The location was perfect for getting around to restaurants, Central Park and shopping. We had excellent service and the rooms were clean and comfortable. We would stay here anytime we are going to the City and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class Manager”
Reviews.Author: FridayRoi
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay in this hotel but some misinformation given to me by a lady on reception led me to make a phonecall to Ireland which cost $121. Reading the name of the manager on Tripadvisor I wrote to him explaining the situation. In return i received a full return and a most apologetic letter. Many problems can be assuaged by a sincere apology and a small token of kindness. So Mr Sean Verney take a bow, many others could learn a lesson from you. Your response has ensured that we are recommending your hotel again and again. Tired decor may be common but excellent customer relations are a rarity!

Reviews.Title: “Definately worth far more than the reviews give- great experience”
Reviews.Author: dadrummerpimp
Reviews.Content: After having booked our trip for $120/night on Priceline, we read dozens of unfavourable reviews for this hotel. I was quite skepitcal, but figured, at the very least, the location would be great. It took no more than 2 minutes to check in and we were given a room with a Queen size bed on the 43rd floor. The room was larger than an average New York hotel, and while our view was of neighbouring buildings, our friends' room had a nice view of Central Park. The sheets and pillows were amazingly comfortable, and the bathrooms were extremely clean. The location could not be beat. Outside of the entrance of the hotel was a subway entrance, and we were within a minute walk to Times Square, Radio City Music Hall and Rockfeller Plaza. The staff was friendly, and the concierge sent us to amazing and inexpensive Mom and Pop places. Some people might have had bad experiences, but overall, the hotel is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, lobby renovation looks great”
Reviews.Author: lionsnwings
Reviews.Content: Great location between Times Square and Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you have access to club level”
Reviews.Author: Solange72
Reviews.Content: A vast well located hotel. Check in efficient if factory processing like. Rooms somewhat small, depressing and entirely forgettable without any substantial character or joy. Nevertheless, access to club lounge (if included with your reservation) is a definite advantage with excellent evening antipasti (frankly enough for a light meal) and excellent breakfast buffet as well. There is easy and free internet access in the lobby for registered guests.

Reviews.Title: “Glitzy foyer, not much else”
Reviews.Author: AndPancho
Reviews.Content: Fancy foyer. Efficient front counter staff. Small rooms. Everything at a cost. Maids do only the minimum. Very central location. Don't put anything in the fridge / minibar because the staff will remove it for you. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Location, three star room”
Reviews.Author: Prachi04
Reviews.Content: Go to this property for the location and not a luxurious room or the Sheraton service. This hotel is right next to Time Square, a two-minute walk and hence is in the midst of the hustle bustle that’s the heart of the city. The location is very convenient as you can easily walk to some of the attractions, also the city tours and the subway are available right outside the door. There are plenty of eateries around for practically any kind of cuisine you may want. The hotel has a busy lobby which is humming with energy till wee hours. There’s also a 24-hour bar and café at the lobby level, though with a limited menu, it’s a nice place for sitting with family and friends for a drink or two at the end of a long day. In the café there’s provision for a few computers with internet access. The rooms are small but I don’t think you will find better sized rooms for this price range at such a prime location. The décor could be less dated though. We had a room with two queen-sized beds and they certainly were more like two singles. The room was clean but basic, even the bathroom and the toiletries etc. were very basic. There’s no service to speak of, if you call them for tea/ coffee bags which should have been in the room anyway, they take a good 50-60 mins. to arrive. Sometimes even later, in which case the room service sends you a tray of hot tea as an apology. The location is five-star, the rooms barely meet the standard you would expect from a three star, but then New York was our first stop and having stayed at Sherton group hotels in India, Egypt etc. we were expecting a completely different class of rooms, service etc. Given that we wanted to be where the action is and would come back to the room only to crash and be off early the next day, I think we chose well.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the Heart of Times Square...”
Reviews.Author: albert82bob87
Reviews.Content: Unlike other reviews on here, this hotel is definitely right in the middle of Times Square. When we arrived at the hotel we were amazed at how close to everything we actually were, because of some of the reviews we'd read on here. Do not be mistaken, it is literally only 2 mins to the middle of Times Square from the front doors of this hotel. The hotel itself is very stylish and when we arrived we were warmly welcomed by the staff and check in was a breeze. We had requested an upper floor room and were pleased when we found out we were staying on the 42nd floor. However, if you don't like heights, probably best to request a lower floor as 42 floors from the ground is quite scary, when you're looking down... The room was very nice, and very clean. It had a little mini bar which was handy and the view from the window was superb. Hotel was very busy, but the staff were always very friendly and very helpful. The only problem we found was that there are a distinct lack of computers for use by hotel guests (probably only 4/5 max). We were over for 3 weeks on holiday in US we decided not to bring our laptops, so accessing a computer was quite difficult when there literally hundreds of guests staying in the hotel. Wireless was available in the lobby but I guess not all phones are wifi enabled which meant we had to wait for a computer. Overall though our stay was great, and the hotel is convenient to literally everything in Times Square and Central Park is only 5 mins walking north of the hotel, and this again was somewhere we wanted to go. All in all, from the hotel we were able to visit lots of different sights and all on foot, so meant we weren't paying out too much on transport. Would definitely recommend this hotel to others and would use again if ever visiting New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: TKK4759
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 days on business/leisure. Rooms were very small, especially a 2 bed room, but they were clean. The location is great, basically a block to Times Square. I did not have much interaction with staff (only at check in). If you can get a deal on some other sight you can come out ok on price, I basically paid 180 per night and their rate online was 259 per night. Overall it was a good experience and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay very much.”
Reviews.Author: 54Hank
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is excellent. It's like the New York attitude has had a transformation, in that the entire staff cannot do enough for you. I cannot say one negative thing about the staff. The location is great. You can go any direction from the Hotel, and your headed for shows, shopping, and prominent locations. The rooms are clean, the lobby is bustling but the staff is only to pleased to step in and ask if the can help you. Room is clean and just what you need for a 3-4 day stay in NYC. One of the best hotel fitness centers I've seen is in the basement. I was pleased with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: znetbabe
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal via Priceline, can't complain, but if i had to pay their regular price rather than Priceline, would be really upset. The room absolutely needs updating as the rest of the building. For NYC, all hotels rooms are small size! Great location, next to subway and within blocks from Times Square, museums, 5th ave, Central Park, all kind of eateries around. If you go to Chinatown, try any eateries on Mott Street, more local tasting. Pop Burger across from FAO Shwartz really good fast-food. Only recommend if you 're getting a good rate, not over $180, not worth it until they're updating the hotel and room.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the name of the game”
Reviews.Author: Sandy0202
Reviews.Content: If you are in New York City, then what better place than Manhattan to experience the city! And in Manhattan, this Sheraton property is one of the best locations to park yourself. Besides being conveniently located near the Times Square, the hotel is close to most of the action in NYC. The amenities are pretty standard with a fitness room et al but what stands out is the location. The check-in is quite smooth and the staff courteous. The rooms though, leave a lot to be desired. The queen sized beds are slightly smaller than usual, the bathroom without a bathtub and the room service a bit tardy. The bar at the ground floor is good, but lacks variety in terms of beverages. On an average day the lobby looks more like a railway platform with people buzzing all over the place. The food places are all around it and you can sample a host of cuisine types around the place. But if you overlook the minor glitches, it's a very decent place to set yourself for 5-7 days and explore NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Good rooms but not for whingers & moaners”
Reviews.Author: RonaldoC
Reviews.Content: Booked this through Hotwire for four days in June for $150 per night. Saw some mixed reviews for this hotel but I have to say I was pretty happy with it. We took the E subway all the way from Jamaica and there is a stop at 7th Avenue right under the hotel. The hotel is huge and very busy but we were checked in pretty quickly and given a room in the tower which houses floors 21 to 29. I have heard people complaining that they have had to wait for ages for the elevators in the other section of the hotel but here we never waited more than a few seconds. Our rooms were on floor 21. We had a couple of initial problems as the floor in the room next to the airco was soaking wet and it smelled slightly of damp. However a quick call to reception and they sent someone up with keys for another slightly larger room along the corridor. I was sharing with a friend so we had a double double. The room was large enough for both of us and had a really large LG LCD HD tv. Décor I thought was really nice and the beds were super comfortable. None of the back ache I normally have after sleeping in a strange bed. Coffee maker in the room was handy for a pre breakfast coffee in the morning. We also had a small problem with the room safe which had been locked by the previous occupant. Again this was efficiently dealt with by the front desk and they sent someone up within a few minutes to open it. It amazes me that some people give this hotel a 1 star rating. Honestly what is it that they are expecting for the price? If they have paid like $300 plus per night then it’s their own fault for not researching cheaper rates. With the cost of real estate in Midtown Manhattan why do they expect palacial enormous rooms? None of the staff were ever rude to me, perhaps that’s because I treat people with the respect that I expect myself. If there are long queues for check in then that probably because a bus load of people have just turned up. The staff only have one pair of hands. Anyway I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone especially if you can get it on Priceline or Hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location, Great Value, but not 4 Stars”
Reviews.Author: Newlywed_7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a prime location, just a few blocks south of Central Park and a few north of Times Square. Easy walking distance to St. Patrick's, Rockefeller Center, and Broadway and only about a mile to Penn Station & the Empire State Building. The hotel has a nice, fancy lobby. We didn't try any of the hotel restaurants, but there is a nice bar in the lobby. There are plenty of quick elevators, which we took to our small, king bed room on the 42 floor. We had a great view of the city from our room. The room was somewhat updated with a modern feel: a nice LCD TV, comfortable king bed, desk, and nice marble bathroom counter. The room had the usual amenities: iron, hairdryer, and a coffee maker with single serve Starbucks coffee. It was a small room, however, and although it was updated some, it seemed a bit old. The bathroom and linens were clean, but the walls and carpet were older. Basically, it was a nice, small, clean room with a great view. My problem with this hotel is that it is rated at 4 stars, and our room was not a four star room. There was nothing exceptional about it. It was a great bargain though - we got it by naming our own price of $117 a night. At that price, this is a tremendous value for such a good location. We just were not wowed by the hotel. From our experience here and at the Sheraton Baltimore, it seems that Sheratons are nice, clean, comfortable hotels at good rates. Baggage check was $3.25 a bag, if you want to leave your bags for a few hours after you check out. The front desk staff was helpful but not overly friendly. The concierge was knowledgeable and kind. We also highly recommend the nearby Oak & Steel Wine Shop, which we discovered at 11pm one night, if you are looking for a bottle of wine at any price point.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Sharaton with great value and quality in every way”
Reviews.Author: grrink
Reviews.Content: Since all I do is travel I appreciate when things go well. This location is the most consistent hotel I've ever stayed Its in a great midtown location I can get anywhere in the city within a few minutes The staff goes over board to make sure everything I need is available to me. This is a larger Sheraton with flawless service, absolute consistency and attention to detail rarely seen. Everything is always just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but not all that great.”
Reviews.Author: jpr78
Reviews.Content: This hotel all about the location. Very good location for sighseeing and good connection to JFK/Airtrain with the E subwayline. Checkin staff was very friendly, but thats where the good things ended. The rooms in this hotel seemed very old and the room we stayed in was smaller than expected. And wow, they still have hotels without wifi in the rooms? The wifi in the lobby was okayish, but you have to go thru a loginpage which is impossible to navigate with some handheld devices. This hotel would have been a big dissapointment if we didnt get a really great rate for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.....Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: pattipl
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent a week here and found the room small but we had 2 double beds, a desk, nightstand and dresser. What more did we need.....we didn't spend much time in the room. The air conditioning did not put out as much cool air as we wanted so we called down and promptly received a fan that took care of the problem. Everyone from check in to check out was great. Hotel bar was a bit expensive but it was nice to have there for a quick breakfast muffin, lunch salad to a glass of wine in the evening. We would go back again......the location was fantastic! Walked almost everywhere (we saw 3 shows). Subway was right next to the hotel, Central Park, Times Square, etc .all within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “great location, everything else average”
Reviews.Author: medicmom
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and our two sons the weekend of June 6 &7. Check in was inefficient, as we waited in line for 20 minutes to check in. We were told that our bags, which had been dropped off earlier in the day, would be waiting for us in our room, but they were not. I called the desk, which said that there was some "confusion" with our bags, but that they were on their way up now. After waiting over an hour, I went back to the lobby to speak with the front desk. They said that I could go and retreive the bags myself if I wanted to, and directed me to the floor where they were. So we went in search of the bellcap on the fifth floor, found our bags, and took them up to our room on the 11th floor. Our room was pretty small, but overall clean and the beds were comfortable. There was no fan in the bathroom, which probably accounted for the peeling paint around the door and ceiling! The previous guest's receipt/bill copy was left on the dresser in the room, which made me slightly suspicious about how thoroughly the room had been cleaned! The in room coffee was very good. Probably would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, terrible rooms”
Reviews.Author: jatpa4087
Reviews.Content: I reserved two rooms (one for my parents and one for me). Rooms are extremely uncomfortable. I have travel to Europe many times and although rooms are small they are not so tied. The Sheraton's room have no space to move around. Everthing is so tied that it is impossible for two adults to comfortable walk around. There are no chairs in the rooms, except a desk chair (but no desk). Both rooms' air conditioning were not working properly. We called the front desk and they were not able to change our rooms because the hotel was booked. The night was hot and uncomfortable. No wifi in the rooms and there is a charge for regular Internet use. I will never stay there again...ever! With all the hotels in that area, if you have other options, stay away from the Sheraton Hotel and Towers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: rigbyrider
Reviews.Content: Despite a very busy lobby, check in was fast and easy. My room was ready early so I didn't have to leave my bags with the bellman for a lunch date. All went well with my stay, but my great experience happened after I checked out. I realized that I had left a very expensive personal item behind, and the staff went out of their way to search the room and find it for me. Now it is winging its way back to me via Fedex. I am very grateful to the people who went above and beyond to make sure my belongings were returned. Thank you so much to the staff of the Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers, especially Ingrid, Joan and Jorge!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, will definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: jujubean758
Reviews.Content: Bidding $110/night on Priceline for a 4-star hotel, I wasn't very skeptical I'd get any takers, but after Sheraton NY accepted, I quickly ran here to check reviews. Then I was scared. We checked in, and I couldn't have been more pleasantly surprised! The front desk was extremely friendly, got us into 2 double-beds vs. the 1 king we got with no problem. The room was clean enough (altough it was no Plaza Hotel!), the beds were super-comfy, the shower water pressure/temperature was perfect. We had a great view (to me, anything without a view of a brick wall in NYC is a good view). The housekeepers did a great job and were courteous, and the concierge was extremely friendly and helpful - he recommended a great Italian retaurant called Tramonti on 46th & 8th.
