Location was so convenient - short walk to Times Square, Central Park, 5th Ave, Theater District, and many of the major subway lines to get anywhere in the city. The only downside was that Wi-Fi in the room was $9.95/day, but access was free downstairs in the Link Lounge, and computers were available to check email and browse the internet on. Another downside was that Room Service was ridiculously expensive. But what hotel's room service isn't? Besides, why would you stay in the hotel room while you're in NYC? So many eating choices just outside your door. Overall, great stay. I would definitely stay here again (at the Priceline price) or for anything below $200/night, and I would definitely recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelieveable view and convenient too!”
Reviews.Author: jmoore2
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled with our stay at this hotel! We were very lucky and obtained a king bedroom with an amazing view of Times Square! The hotel is situated just a few blocks north of Times Square which is wonderful because it is not as loud, bright, or crowded. Yet, it is still super convenient to Times Square and sits directly above a metro station. The room itself was much larger than I had anticipated for NYC. It had a very comfortable king-size bed and a huge flatscreen tv (lots of channels) and a good workspace if you needed to use your laptop, etc. The room also had a coffee maker with complementary Starbucks coffee which was nice as most luxury hotels force you to order room service or buy Starbucks coffee in the lobby. The bathroom was small, but not uncomfortably small. There was plenty of room to store your toiletries, had extremely good lighting, and a magnifying mirror. Housekeeping was average, but did a decent job of cleaning. I will most definitely try to obtain this hotel again in the future on my trips to NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Tons of hotel in the area- stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: lifeisbetteronvaca
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently (May 2009) stayed at the Sheraton with his two elderly aunts. The front desk people were rude, although we did get to check in early- and refused to honor our request for a single queen bed. When we went up to our rooms the aunts room would not unlock. The cleaning person let them in to change. The left the room to check in with us in our room and were again locked out. The security people came up to check on the situation and said that the lock needed a new battery- and that this would happen as we went to get lunch. We returned 3 hours later to find that nothing had been done and upon another call to the front desk we found that they supposedly had no recollection of our issue. Then the gem came from them- "Can't you just stay in the other room you reserved?"... Ummm... excuse me? So this meant that we paid for two rooms and only got one? Not to mention also that the aunt's belongings were in the room and how would we get them out? We said no- fix it. The finally fixed the lock 12 hours after we first reported the issue and we received new keys- but not even an apology. In addition, the rooms were dirty- coffee stains all over the wall. I DO NOT recommend this hotel. The only good thing was the coffee barista was the best I have ever had- and he was ridiculously nice! (and worked for Starbucks...) The location is amazing, but choose somewhere else where they value your business and clean the rooms properly.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Nazy5519
Reviews.Content: I went to NYC for a girl's trip on May 23 through May 27. We stayed at the Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers. This was my third stay at this hotel. First stay was in August 2007, second stay was December 2008 and then again in May 2009. As usual, we had a wonderful stay! We arrived at the hotel about 1:15 p.m. Check-in was a breeze! Employees were hospitable and kind. Our room was ready when we arrived. We were put on the 47th floor with a view of Central Park and the river. BEAUTIFUL!! We were also given access to the Club Level where we enjoyed a delicious breakfast and a very friendly and helpful staff. Our room was clean when we arrived. The housekeeping staff cleaned daily and our room was always neat and tidy when we returned daily. The beds are extremely comfy after a day of walking and shopping! The hallways were quiet and allowed for a good night's sleep. The concierge at the hotel was helpful too. We were looking for a restaurant near our theater for a pre-theater dinner. Reservations were made for us by the concierge. The food was delicious!! This hotel is centrally located to many sites within walking distance. Central Park and Times Square are nearby. Fifth Avenue is two streets over from the hotel. You can walk to Carnegie Hall, Rockefeller Center, Empire State Building, and Radio City Music Hall. I can't wait for my fourth trip to New York City! I WILL be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional. Friendly and accomodating...”
Reviews.Author: graciesmom4
Reviews.Content: Excellent accomodations. The staff was welcoming, courteous and helpful. We had a great experience. It was the perfect location for a girls night out. The room was clean and comfortable. We had a great time. Thank you Sheraton...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!!”
Reviews.Author: kalinap13
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed here from May 23 to May 30. The room was small but we realized that in the heart of Manhattan it really wasn't that small. There was enough room for the two of us. We were on the 16th floor and we couldn't hear any street noise. We were within walking distance of the three musicals that we saw. There was even a street fair on Sunday right outside the hotel. I would say stay at this location but don't expect too much. Come on people...you are in New York City....how much time to do expect to be relaxing in your room? If you want a nice quiet vacation....go to Maui!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: Jason H
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, incredibly friendly and helpful staff, very clean rooms, and $110 a night using "name your own price" on Priceline.com! Just a $35 taxi ride from La Guardia (tell the cabbie to take you to 53rd and 7th). Our bellman on arrival (James) informed us that the Clintons have stayed here several times, and whether or not you like the Clinton's, the fact the the hotel is good enough for a President and a Senator means it is good enough for you :-) Seriously though, the rooms were very clean and modern. All the major channels on a flat screen LCD TV including Showtime, plus a large selection of pay-per-view movies. A mini-bar is in each room also. Room Service is also available. It is almost 24/7. High-Speed Internet is available for $14.95 per day. The room had very good A/C, although it was a little tricky to find the controls for. I had to call the front desk and ask where the controls were, as they are hidden inside a box which is below a grill in the back of the desk area! I have seen reviews saying the rooms were warm, but I think those travelers probably didn't go to the trouble to find the A/C controls and just assumed the rooms didn't have A/C. Don't worry you will be very comfortable in these rooms. Best shower I've had in months! The staff helped us even when our flights were cancelled and we had to arrive a day late. They held our room for us and gave us the exact room we requested: King Bed, Non-Smoking. There was no line at check in ("reception") and we had our room keys within just a minute or two. The room didn't have a refrigerator so we asked if one was available. They said "sure, no problem" and they had one plugged up in our room within 10 minutes. The normally charge $25 for the fridge but if you need it to keep medicine cold or to keep baby items in (baby food, milk, etc.) then there is no charge. From the front door of the hotel you can see the lights of Times Square and the trees of Central Park; the location is just that great. The Broadway theaters, Rockefeller Plaza and much more was all within a couple of blocks. This hotel is in the "theatre distract" and there is literally hundreds of restaurants in this area, as well as unlimited shopping. Several of the diners/delis on the same street as the hotel are 24/7, as are the convenience stores. Don't worry if you forgot something as there are drug stores within walking distance of this hotel. The Met and most NYC museums are close to. Buy an unlimited Metro Card and you can ride the subway and busses all you want. There is a subway stop just a few blocks south (49th street and 7th) and from there you can get anywhere in Manhattan, Brooklyn, Queens, etc. This hotel was wonderful in every way. I hope to stay there again soon!

Reviews.Title: “an extraordinary place”
Reviews.Author: kverney
Reviews.Content: staying at the hotel was a pleasure from the time we checked in to the time we left. The staff at the sheraton were nice and pleasant. The room was spacious and clean. There were no problems ever. The location of the hotel was perfect to go sight seeing. We just had a great time all around.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jcracco
Reviews.Content: it was a pleasure staying at the Sheraton New York Hotel & Towers. The reservation process was easy and painless. The staff when we arrived was professional, pleasant, and courteous. We didn't have to wait before we could check in the room was ready and clean. Our stay was great, this hotel has a great and convenient location. The different options to check out made life easy once we were ready to leave. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in NYC. The fact that there is a parking garage right there made it easy, no need to carry our bags around the city. The one downfall, parking was pricey and be ready to wait a little while before your car is brought up to you, but this has nothing to do with the hotel, as I said, I was willing to pay the price and wait to have my car right there.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton met our expectations...”
Reviews.Author: Brian P
Reviews.Content: We stay in NYC frequently, so our expectations are reduced by the knowledge that many hotel rooms in the city are tiny, outdated, and overpriced. Fortunately, we walked away happy with our stay at the Sheraton. Location The Sheraton's location is excellent for exploring NYC. The hotel is steps away from Times Square, Central Park, and all of the major subway lines. Room The king room itself was very comfortable. Additionally, it was larger than most of the rooms we have had in NYC. The decor was OK, nothing to write home about, but nothing really to complain about. Cleanliness: Everything was relatively clean. The only issue we had was that one of our towels had a hair in it. Misc: As far as we could tell, there was no valet parking. There is a garage under the building and the overnight fee is in the $40-45 range with no in and out privileges. High speed internet was pricey at around $14. All in all, we had a comfortable stay and would return if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: spoonygee
Reviews.Content: Staff was nice and helpful. We were able to check-in early (1:30 pm). We got a handicapped-accessible room which was GREAT! The bathroom was giant... almost bigger than the rest of the room! Steps from the theatre district and all sorts of sight-seeing hotspots. Room was VERY clean! We got a great deal on the room and would DEFINITELY book there again, if staying only for a few days. Anything longer than a few days, I would recommend finding an apt to sublet, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at ALL COSTS--HORRIBLE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: KLDESQ
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this dump on Tuesday night and can honestly say this is the worst Sheraton in the chain. I am a SPG Platinum member and stay at SPG properties all over the world. I was on a Club level, 46th floor and my room was TINY--even by NYC standards. The A/C blew luke warm air and is the type that you really can't adjust. The bathroom also was a joke in size and you have to open the door part way to be able to get in. What blows me away though is their Club Lounge. They don't have bottled water.. no bottled water? give me a break. Overall this is a dirty flea bag hotel that I would avoid like the plague. Don't stay here. Period. The ONLY good thing I can say is that they have a good location but so does the Sheraton across the street and it isn't dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Dust? Tick. Dirty carpet? Tick. Old socks? Tick.”
Reviews.Author: LondonTealady
Reviews.Content: This was our first hotel stay booked via Priceline (I'm mentioning that because I feel it has something to do with the room we were given). Things didn't get off to a great start - on checking in we were given a little (or not so little) lecture about customer loyalty and how we shouldn't use Priceline but book direct with Sheraton. Then up to our room... well, when we stepped out of the lift, the whole floor was GRUBBY, no other word for it - my heart sank. Then the room. The dust! The unhoovered floor! The old socks! (yes, really, look at the photos!). Anyway, after complaining we were transferred to a lovely room on the 6th floor. It seemed like two different hotels. My suggestion would be, if you get a room you're not happy with complain. 2 stars for the first room, 4/5 for the second (but only when you take into consideration we paid £75 a night).

Reviews.Title: “Expected the worst. Received a little better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: GetawayFromWork12
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Priceline for $120 per night over the Memorial Day weekend. After reading the negative reviews on TripAdvisor, I got a little nervous that the 4 star hotel I was hoping for would be a disappointment. I sent an email to the hotel stating my concerns and requesting a room with 2 double beds on a high floor. I sent an email twice asking for a response confirming our requests and never received a response. I then called the hotel and they took our requests. We checked in at 11pm and waited in line for approx. 2 minutes. At first, the gentleman checking us in was not able to fuffill our request for a room with 2 double beds and didn't even acknowlege that we even made this request in advance. Then after looking a second time (I am assuming because of the very disappointed looks on our faces) he was able to get us a handicap room with 2 double beds on the 24th floor. Our room and bathroom were larger than I was expecting after reading reviews, but this could have been because it was a handicap room. The carpet was pretty old and had some stains. The bathroom was fairly clean, but the toilet still had residue on the bowl. Some of the furniture was scratched and one of the lamp shades was cracked. The beds and linen were clean, which I felt was the most important part! We had 2 safes in the closet; one didn't work at all and the other was locked already. We called the front desk to have someone take a look at the locked safe and someone was in our room fixing it in 30 min. After the maids cleaned the room the first morning, they left us with no additional coffee and only gave us 2 large towels, compared to getting 4 large towels we had in the room when we checked in. We called the front desk requesting more coffee and they brought us more within 30 min. We requested late checkout at 2pm on our last day and they fuffilled this request after a little coaxing. Overall, we weren't disappointed with the hotel, but I would not rate it any higher than a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great priceline pick again”
Reviews.Author: johnnieb
Reviews.Content: I have been booking Priceline on my recent NYC visits, and am specific about location in NYC..I only want to be in Midtown to Central Park. Bid 90 dollars, and got 2 great rooms at the Sheraton New York and Towers...I paid for on my Starwoods AMEX card, and presented my Starwoods prefered card at check in..renovated rooms, high floors, clean, but small (This was the old Americana Hotel built in the 1960's) and the best thing about Sheraton (and Hilton) are their patented beds..very comfy. If I paid rack rate, I would be dissappointed..for under a 100 bucks a night?...I am thrilled...best all round location in NYC...

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected it to be after reading reviews”
Reviews.Author: NateandJustinsmom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. The beds were a bit soft for my taste, and the air conditioning could have worked better (it was in the 80s outside and would have liked it a bit cooler in the room than we were able to get it). The rooms could have been cleaned a bit better, but the linens and bath were clean. The size of the room and bath was fine for NYC. Although I would not rate this more than 3 stars. The staff were courteous and the hallways quiet at night, making it easy to get a good night's sleep. We booked through Hotwire and checking in and out was easy (although it was a bit crowded at check-in). We got there at 11 AM, and our bags were checked for free while we went over to the Top of the Rock (Rockefeller Center) and then to lunch at a nearby deli. There are lots of great delis nearby! We traveled to NYC by Amtrak, which was about a $6.00 plus tip taxi ride away. We also made frequent use of the nearby MTA (NYC subway system), and did lots of walking. The hotel is close to all Broadway theaters, Rockefeller Center, Times Square, and Central Park. SoHo and Battery Park were easy and convenient subway rides. The trip was a birthday present for our 14 year-old son. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Tale of two hotels...”
Reviews.Author: Prez8983
Reviews.Content: It truly seems that when it comes to the Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers, it truly depends on what room you get. I, like many other reviewers on tripadvisor, booked the Sheraton through Priceline for $100 a night and ran right to this site to read the reviews. I was quickly made nervous by what I read! I realize that when you book on Priceline you aren't guaranteed a specific room or bed type. So the first thing I did was email the reservation staff at the hotel and requested a king size bed and a room on a newly renovated floor. I got an email back in less than 24 hours stating that my requests had been noted. When I arrived at 2:30 PM, we only had to wait roughly 3 minutes for the small line to work it's way to the reception desk. The gentleman at the desk mentioned that we had requested a king bed on a high floor (the renovated ones) and we were off to our room #3433. The elevators quickly arrived and we walked to our room, fully anticipating a negative experience like many other reviewers had. We walked through the door and started to inspect the room. Yes, the room was small, but it is NYC. We were not bothered by the size, although we did experience what many others have experienced on this site. The room was HOT! Not like warm, but HOT!! Granted it was roughly 68 degrees outside when we checked in, but there was no reason for the warmth in the room. Actually there is, read some other reviewers below who explain the situation. Anyway, I opened the windows and called down for a fan which arrived in less than 15 minutes. The room itself was relatively clean,although we did find an old sock in the closet and what appeared to be a small patch of mold on the ceiling in the bathroom. The carpets were clean and the room appeared to be renovated with a large flat screen, comfy bed, and restoration hardware pieces in the bathroom. For $100 I was impressed with what we received. The hotel staff was informative, got free wifi in the lobby, room was more than I expected from reading the reviews. Many have mentioned bugs, mice, or paper thin walls on this site. I did not see or hear anything out of the ordinary in our room. The location is FANTASTIC!!! The subway is basically 15 steps from the door. We walked to Central Park, Times Square, etc. The staff recommended some great places to eat and even helped us find a place to buy socks for my wife who packed in terms of fashion, not comfort...a big mistake! All in all, for what I paid it was FANTASTIC. If I had paid full price, I may have been disappointed. Pros: Location, great staff, fast elevators and check in/out process Cons: Could have been a little cleaner in both the room and hotel itself. Also, there isn't much to do about this, but the hotel always seemed to be packed as it is a convention hotel.

Reviews.Title: “There Are Worse, But Be Ready For The Worst”
Reviews.Author: DoctorRetired
Reviews.Content: This hotel gets away with anything. Nobody at the desk cares about problems in the rooms. The rooms are mixed. Some are decent, but I've never had a room, even when paying top rack rates, that didn't show wear and tear - defective plugs, Internet, missing hair dryer, chipped furniture and the very, very, worst: age-old, archaic crappy box heater and air conditioners. Only go if you are getting a deal. The location is all this hotel has. AND their drink prices are TWICE as high as the Irish Pub a half a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay - Would Definately Return!”
Reviews.Author: canadian_adventure22
Reviews.Content: My friends and I had planned a 'girls long weekend getaway' to NYC and ended up with this hotel on Priceline ($120/night) and couldn't have been more happy with our stay! We had an early flight in and were at the hotel at 8am - no room available (didn't expect one anyways) so we left our bags for the day. From reading others reviews we had expected $3.25-$3.50 per bag but were pleasantly surprised to not have to pay! At checkin we were given an upgrade to a junior suite (with 4 girls the extra room was definately appreciated!). Our housekeeper left us extra soaps/shampoos - I'd love to know where to buy their shampoo/conditioner! It's fantastic! The conceirge was very knowledgeable and had recommendations for all our questions - we went to Azalea's for dinner which was a quick walk away. Free internet in the lobby was great. Reasonable breakfast - great to grab a muffin/juice and go! Overall our stay was excellent - all the staff we encountered were pleasant and helpful. We would absolutely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Rooom, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: traveller933
Reviews.Content: I booked through Priceline for $120.00, which is a great price! Pretty much everyone we enountered was wonderful, especially the Concierge, they went above and beyond! Also the front desk was extrememly accommodating, we arrived fairly early in the morning and though we weren't able to check in, they stored our bags for free ( usually 3.50 a bad and we had 6 bags) We had been given a complimentary upgarde into a Junior Suite on the 30th floor. The room was fantastic, lots of room, nicely decorated and amazing spa products. My only issue was the bathroom was quite small. Breakfast at the hotel isn't cheap, but it was very good! If you only have time to grab a pastry..do it! They're amazing!The location coudn't be better! On Broadway and only 2 blocks to the centre of Times Square and 5th avenue. By the end of our 3 night stay I was reluctant to leave and go home.

Reviews.Title: “Not even worthy of a 2 Star! Mold & Prostitues....”
Reviews.Author: chowster
Reviews.Content: We bid on the hotel on Priceline which has it listed as a four star. NOT EVEN CLOSE. We requested a king size bed but upon check in, they only had rooms with Queen. After informing the check in agent our relunctancy, since the reviews were terrible on Tripadvisor, he promised to put us in their better room. Our "better room" had not one, but TWO adjoining doors. We could hear our neighbors both on the phone and watching Law & Order. The room had a foul stench, which most likely aired from the bathroom. Hard to describe, but a sour, vinegarish odor stemmed from the shower courtain. There was NO FAN in the bathroom, and everytime you flushed the toilet, there clanked for about 30 seconds!! Upon complaining, the front desk offered to move us the following day, which meant we had to breakup our day, to return to the hotel for the room switch. What a waste of time - we were only in the city for 3.5 days! Here's a short list of the rest of the problems we encountered: - MOLD in the bathroom (major health concern!) - filthy blinds and air vents - filthy stained carpets and wallpaper - not enough lighting in the room - thin walls and poor window insulation - OLD complimentary coffee and tea/ cream which did not dissolve and festered on top - incorrect time set in room clock - Dirty and tatooed PROSTITUTES loitering in the lobby lounge - almost got stuck in the elevator - POOR customer service from HOTEL MANAGER The hotel manager offered us $100 credit upon checking OUT. What good is that? We had a flight to catch! As I shared my list of concerns, she rolled her eyes and CUT me off mid sentence, and blamed housekeeping. AT that point, she clarified that Sheraton Hotel was NOT a FOUR STAR, but ONLY a THREE STAR. She needs to back to training - this is not how Starwood members are treated, and her behaviour was opposite to the values of Starwoods. I would have never bid on a three star hotel - Priceline has misrepresented this hotel. A motel in Harlem would have been a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable, convenient mid-town location with all the amenities I expect when I'm traveling.”
Reviews.Author: going1000
Reviews.Content: We spent only one night, but our room was more spacious than many I've had in other Manhattan hotels, was well appointed, and comfortable. All in all, a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkiegirl
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Priceline. I named my own price for a Midtown East hotel that was 4 stars. I got the Sheraton New York with a price of $111 a night. I immediately went to tripadvisor and was very concern by the reviews. But since it was a non-refundable reservation, I hope for a better experience than some on tripadvisor users noted. Check in was easy and I had no line. I informed them I was a Starwood rewards member and asked for a high floor and was given the 39th floor, which is a Starwood Preferred Guest floor. Our room had a king size bed, 42 flat HDTV panel, and looked to have been updated in the last few years. There was some wear and tear in the room, but all minor. Room was clean. It was an extra plus to have a coffee maker with starbuck coffee and Taso teas. We asked for a late check out and was told that was no problem. Check out was easy, again no line. Service was good, nice doormen and concierge staff. AC worked fine. No problems with elevators. Comfy beds with nice linens. Nice to have free wifi and computers in the lobby. Location is unbeatable! I would recommend, especially if you get a good deal. I think an issue with this hotel could be they seem understaffed when a major conference is going on and all rooms are filled. Clearly when I went the hotel seemed empty, so some the problems other users have mentioned were not an issue at all during my stay. If you get a good deal, I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “The people have spoken, and they are right”
Reviews.Author: blkjck5697
Reviews.Content: I came into this hotel for a 9 night stay not expecting too much, especially after reading the reviews here. Can't say that the majority opinion of this place either just being adequate or worse are completely off base. The hotel lobby and the hallways made this place look like it was a 4 star hotel, and was optimistic that the reviews were wrong. I was disappointed once I entered our room. Found the 9th floor room we were assigned extremely tiny, even by Manhattan standards. Same with the bathroom. The $14.95 daily rate for in-room internet seems a little stiff as well. While they offer free internet access in the lobby, that is not always the most convenient way. The hotel was in the process of installing the mini-bar sensor system, so we would have to ask for and pay extra for an in-room fridge. Seems this hotel is a favourite of school groups, as our floor was overrun for a few nights by rooms filled with teenage girls. Things were out of hand on those nights enough that we complained by calling the front desk, and the same thing happened the next night. The best feature of this place was the location. You're right between Times Square and Central Park. You have 3 different sets of subway lines to choose from that are within very short walking distance, and several restaurants (some overpriced) are nearby. We found being here a little quieter for being in midtown New York, especially compared to Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Only Satisfactory - could do with a bit more Pzazz”
Reviews.Author: trevorandfiona
Reviews.Content: We had read a lot of bad reviews about this place and, since we didn't actually choose it (it was a gift from someone) we were a bit worried but it wasn't actually all that bad. We had made a mistake when booking and we didn't have enough nights - the staff at reception sorted this and were very accommodating - even giving the extra room at the cheaper rate. We also asked for a room on a higher floor and a room with a good view and we were given both with no trouble. The room / bathroom was spacious enough and there were two double beds (one bed and a couch would have been better perhaps) and it was clean. It was a little tatty in places but I don't expect a busy hotel room to be pristine! The view was excellent - we were north-facing on the 7th Avenue side on the 28th floor and could see a glimpse of Central Park and the river from where we were - great! You could hear a bit of traffic noise but hey - you are in a busy city! There is free wi-fi in the lobby area and we never had any trouble accessing this. We had a laptop and could take a seat and check emails as much as we wanted but there are a also a few free workstations dotted around and these are also connected to a printer. They were very busy at breakfast / dinner time but if you are up before 7am you will have no trouble. The location is excellent - 7th Avenue subway is literally right at the door and this gives you easy quick access to the rest of the city. If you fly into JFK take the air train to Sutphin Blvd (near Jamaica Street) and the jump onto the 'E' line - you should be at the hotel in about 1 hour with no hassle and it only costs $7 each. A few people on this site have complained about the 'left-luggage' charge but I didn't have a problem with this. Unlike other hotels this place we more professional. The bags were labelled and we were given receipts. There was an attendant there all day to serve you and I felt it was quite secue. $3.25 per bag per day wasn't unreasonable. One good tip - if, like us, you check out early in the day and then fly the same evening you can go for a last day in the city and then come back tot eh hotel and have a shower (completely free) in the leisure club downstairs. They'll even give you a towel and soap! However, I have stayed at a number of higher-end hotels before and most of them have just had a bit more of the 'wow' factor. This hotel wasn't particularly bad but it was just bland and unremarkable. For the cost I would have hoped for a bit more but then I know the person who booked the hotel probably didn't get the best rate!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is class”
Reviews.Author: anne060
Reviews.Content: From the moment you enter you get the feeling of welcome and at the front desk a young lady called Helen made check-in so simple. Her friendly smile and attitude made it the perfect start. The accomodation was excellent and very clean. For a few extra dollars the Club lounge with superb breakfast and evening snacks is very good value. In terms of location this Sheraton couldn't be better. Five minutes to the left is Times Square and Theatreland and five mins to to the right is central park ... a great place to stroll of a Sunday - or any - afternoon. Just about everything is within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel gives the Sheraton line a bad name.”
Reviews.Author: GMLJ
Reviews.Content: The only thing worse than the condition of the rooms which included: *saggy beds *mold in bathroom *dirty carpet *poorly functioning ac was how rude and uncaring the staff was. It seemed that they had heard all these complaints before and were definitely immune to them. I should have know that we were in for trouble when, at the time of check in, I witnessed an argument between a guest and a front desk attendant about unresolved issues in her room. At first I felt that guest was being very rude but then I understood just how frustrated she must have been. Save yourselves, don't stay at the Sheraton Hotel and Towers in NY. PS Just posted the review because I just discovered the site.

Reviews.Title: “much better than expected...”
Reviews.Author: octobersue
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Sheraton NY Hotel & Towers from May 3 - 8th. We got a really good price from Priceline's Name Your Price feature -- $115US / night. Of course after reading all the bad reviews here at Tripadvisor, I was very worried. So I emailed Sheraton one week before our arrival to request for a room on a higher floor & told them about my concerns regarding the poor reviews I've read. We had a very early arrival (8:30am), they did not have a room ready for us, which was expected and they told us they won't have one until 12noon. The receptionist was very nice & they offered to store our luggage while we went for breakfast & stroll Times Square until our room was ready. We came back at 12:30pm & the room was ready, we got room # 3606 with 2 double beds. The room was a good size, not big but certainly enough room for 2 adults. Bathroom was small but clean. I really liked the complimentary toiletries, which was made by Bliss. We didn't hear much traffic noise due to the fact that we were on the 36th floor but do bring ear plugs just in case, 'cause you know it is NYC, the city that never sleeps! We could hear housekeeping in the morning but it wasn't so early that it bothered us. The safe in our room did not work, we called for maintenance & someone came up right away but they couldn't fix it. We ended up using the safety deposit box in the lobby to store our passports and extra cash. Not too inconvenient since we would go down to the lobby anyways, get the cash from the safe box before heading out. Check-out was easy and convenient using their video check-out. Overall, we had a really pleasant stay. None of the complaints we read about were there. I would definitely recommend the Sheraton NY Towers especially if you can get a good price for it like we did.

Reviews.Title: “good value on priceline prices”
Reviews.Author: Jenny33_9
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel through the priceline blind bidding process and at the price we paid it was definitely worth it - the location is right in the middle of midtown and is convenient for central park, broadway shows (Mamma Mia was showing in the theatre across the road, with Shrek The Musical & the Letterman/Late Show studio just one block over) and there are various subway stops within 0-4 mins walk of the hotel. The room was spacious and comfortable with a huge bed, flat screen TV and a good view of 7 th avenue towards Times Square. Bathroom was nice and fairly clean with selection of nice toiletries, although the water pressure in shower wasn't great (we were on 24th floor and have stayed previously in a lower room where pressure was fine so possibly just related to this). One gripe is we were charged for leaving our bags with the bag storage for only a few hours on our last day although we are Sheraton preferred members - the website indicated this service was free at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Frilo68
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights. The hotel room was adequately appointed. Comfortable king size bed and enough space to store our things. However, the bathroom was very small, there was barely enough room to keep our toiletries handy. It was clean, but not spotless. The inner shower curtain could use a change. The central location was ideal for walking to several major attractions. The area felt very safe during the day and night. This hotel turned out to suit our needs especially because we got a good price with Priceline. If we had to book a room at their advertised rates, it would have been too pricey for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, no surprises”
Reviews.Author: decane
Reviews.Content: Stayed from Apr 25-28 Room #1005 After winning a bid in this hotel from Priceline for $110 (a great bargain), I quickly started to read the numerous review on the hotel here @ tripadvisor. After worrying about all the reports about pests, I sent the hotel an email outlining the concern. I got a replied assuring me that those comments are not true. Check-in: arrived @ about 5-6pm ish, only 1 person in front of us in the lineup. Check-in was fast. Room: No pests, yes the carpet is old and definitely need a replacement. Room is smaller than you would expect from other cities (hey but this is Manhattan). Things are clean. I do not see any of the mentioned wood curtain blinds. Yes, you would hear people opening/closing the door or talking right outside of the room but I didn't really hear anything during sleep time/early in the morning. Maids are cleaning the room early in the morning around 9am but we never hear them shout. There's also a Sheraton Time Squared right across the street (and seems like construction is going on there). I would definitely recommend this Sheraton over the other one since it is exactly the same location. Transportation: Walking about 5-10min would get you to time square or Take the subway (hotel is on top of a station) Overall a nice hotel

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: SK04
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had read the TripAdvisor reviews of the Sheraton after booking it on Priceline and were expecting the worst, so we were pleasantly surprised when we walked in. The room was clean and modern, albeit a little small. The location was terrific - just outside of Times Square, which spared us the crowds, but close enough to walk to Times Square, Central Park, and tons of other attractions. There is a subway stop right next to the hotel, which is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Stay ever!!!!!!! 4/30 - 5/3”
Reviews.Author: TERESAERICK
Reviews.Content: The hotel was the best ever and i have stayed in plenty. The staff was respectful and pleasent. I didnt want for nothing. Anything i needed i got. It was very very clean and the food was GREAT!!!!! wHEN I RETURN IT WILL BE WITH THEM.. THANKS FOR THE BEST TIME EVER!!!!!! Teresa

Reviews.Title: “We should have trusted the other Trip Advisor reviews before booking!”
Reviews.Author: special_cay
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip using the name your own price feature on Priceline, with confidence that a 4-star hotel would be more than adequate. After being told that this was the hotel that priceline gave us, we came on to trip advisor and read some very disappointing reviews. We were a little apprehensive and so we called the hotel ahead to make sure that we were getting a "renovated room"- hotel staff were not too friendly over the phone and that should have been our first clue that we should have stayed elsewhere. We got to a very, VERY rainy New York City only to find out that we were too early to check in. The hotel did nothing to make us feel at home. Once we checked in, we received a room on the preferred floor that was small, and very dusty. We called down to the front desk to see if there was anything they could do (especially since the dust was starting to become a problem for my allergies and asthma), and they told us they couldn't move us but they would send up housekeeping. Housekeeping didn't come until Day 3 of our stay, when we finally went down to complain. On top of this, as visitors to the city, we expected that the concierge would be helpful in planning our activities in the city, especially considering the horrible weather we were experiencing. We were DEAD wrong. The first woman who "helped" us was not only rude but also unhelpful when we asked about buying tickets to a show. We ended up going to the box office ourselves, without any advice to do so from her. Our second experience was with another member of the concierge team, who told us to go 1 hour early to the lower east side area where we had made a dinner reservation because there was so much to do. We got there and EVERYTHING was closed, not to mention it was mainly residential. We were thoroughly unimpressed, and wet since we had to wait in the rain until we could go to the restaurant. The next morning, we were lucky enough to have to deal with the same woman from Day 1 again at concierge, who told us at 9:30am to go to Soho to go shopping, but neglected to mention that absolutely everything was closed until noon. By the time things opened, we were soaking wet and very much not in the mood to shop anymore. After all this, we complained to the manager, who was very nice and gave us a $100 food credit to our room- this was very nice but certainly didn't go very far! We tried to go for breakfast but for 2 people it would have been at least $80 (for a basic buffet)!! Needless to say, we won't be staying at the Sheraton New York ever again, and will only be booking on priceline if we know we can get something worth our money.

Reviews.Title: “Not that nice, great location”
Reviews.Author: ClevelandBeachBoy
Reviews.Content: This Sheraton was not that great by Sheraton standards. The bathrooms were really small and a little dingy. The room had some issues. The refrigerator did not work, the outlet in the bathroom did not work, and the water pressure on the shower was not great. You can open the windows which is nice. This hotel is busy. There are crowds in the lobby and in front of it 24/7. The location is amazing. It is in Times Square and is a quick walk to the center of the Square. They N-R-Q-W subway line is also just a few blocks away. They have free wifi if you bring your laptop down to the lobby or you can use a lobby computer but those can be hard to get at times. You have to pay $14.95 for internet otherwise. Parking at the hotel is $42/day. I drove in and parked a few blocks away for half of the price. This is right next to Bar Americain which is Bobby Flay's restaurant and Le Bernardin and the Palm are also pretty close, so there are some nice restaurants around. I wouldn't recommend going to Lindy's which is next door but the place called La Maison is good for drinking and cheaper eats. The Carnegie Deli is also close.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location!”
Reviews.Author: luv2vacayPa
Reviews.Content: I was so nervous about staying at this hotel after having a terrible experience at the Chicago Sheraton Hotel and Towers. I pricelined a 4-star hotel in NYC for $100 and this one accepted my bid. Because it's non-refundable, I had to take it, but after reading some of the reviews, tried to prepare myself for the worst. My husband and I were very pleasantly surprised. First, for that price, this hotel can't be beat. Not sure that I'd pay full price, but for $100, we could walk to almost any attraction you'd want to see in NYC, terrific restaurants, and famous spots like the Carnegie deli or just down the street. The hotel staff were very, very nice and when I wrote to one of the managers in advance, telling him of my previous bad experience at another Sheraton, Jorge Guerrero the Guest Services Center Manager, responded immediately, assured me he would personally see that our stay was a great one, and we did. The room was a little bit dusty and the bathroom could have used a little bit more attention, but nothing that would deter me from staying again. Rooms are small and the bed took up most of the space, but if you are not planning to be in your room for any length of time, it doesn't matter. I would definitely recommend this hotel. Don't get this hotel confused with the Sheraton Manhattan across the street, which does look a bit dingy and run down, be sure you book with Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers. All in all, a very good place to hang your hat while you explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling Treatment of Disabled Guests - Disgrace to Starwood Hotels!”
Reviews.Author: SweetLollipopShop
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel! Never have I been shouted at before by a "supervisor" at a hotel! Visited NYC with 9 year old daughter, I have a progressive medical condition and requested a disabled access room. A/C would not work the first night, couldn't sleep as temp in room above 80 degrees, did not want to wake daughter however so went down next morning to request assistance. Was yelled at by front desk supervisor who demanded to know what was wrong with me and why I needed a disabled room as he saw no wheelchair! His intimidating manner was so bad both my daughter and I were left in tears. I have stayed in Starwood properties before and this hotel was definitely not up to their usual standards. The fact it has a 4 star rating amazes me, you don't even get the usual amenities information package in your room so you have no idea what amenities the hotel has to offer even down to the simplest things such as where the ice machine is, the rooms themselves are not very clean, the carpets are stained, the rooms smell terrible and the second room we were placed in had these little bugs all over the place. It's only saving grace is the concierge, very polite and professional.

Reviews.Title: “expected better from the sheraton”
Reviews.Author: sarahjoshua
Reviews.Content: very happy with the location of this hotel, dont eat breakfast across the road as its a rip off, we ate at the street vendors every morning once realized. we were traveling with a 16 month old, so we had a stroller with us, at the time we were there they were re doing the ramp... over four days we were not offered help to get the stroller down the stairs by the door man... not even once!! Location here is very good, right between centrel park and times square. Expected better from the sheraton as the one here in sydney is awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Pen10poppy
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 5 night stay at the Sheraton Hotel which i enjoyed. The location is very convenient for all the sights of New York and is just a few blocks up from Times and Square and the centre of Broadway. I had a flight from Newark and then took the bus to Port Authority Bus Station (8th Av 41st Street) and found it an easy walk to the Hotel even with my heavy suitcase! Checking in went smoothly and was in room number 2052 (20th floor) which was at the back of the hotel looking out at 53rd Street and 7th Av. The room was small but clean and comfortable especially the bed. There was a good bathroom and a large widescreen TV with at least 40 channels. Having an in-room safe was a real bonus. There was some noise both from the corridor but nothing that really distrubed youfrom sleeping. The hotel was very busy throughout my stay. I never used any of the facilities (gym etc) and didnt eat breakfast or any evening meal in the hotel. There are a number of goof cafes ect around the hotel for breakfast and are much cheaper. Two favourites were Le Pain Quoiten (at the top of 7th Av near Central park only a few minutes up from the hotel) and Alice's Tea House (Lexington Av 64th St over on the east of central park which is a bit of a walk away but a real gem of a place ) I enjoyed my stay in New York especially for the location of this hotel as i was able to walk everywhere in New York that i wanted to go to see. It was quite expensive but due to the prime location i can understand. It is a simple hotel with no frills and the staff seemed to be helpful. I was able to leav my luggage after i checked out for a small fee of $3.25.

Reviews.Title: “DIRTY-POOR SERVICE-GROSS BATHROOMS-DISGUSTING-BAD MANAGMENT”
Reviews.Author: miamiskyboy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before and its always the same thing. Unfortunately I book through priceline and don't have a choice in the matter. Priceline rates this place a 4 star hotel. But Hotwire list is at a 31/2 star. It not a 4 star hotel by any means. This hotel has small rooms that are dirty. Very dirty. My carpet was frayed and torn (#3905) old wooden blinds that have been around forever and don't work anymore. They where dusty and broken. The bathroom has mildewed growing on the shower curtain. After I made a big deal about it. They sent a housekeeping supervisor to my room. She saw it - promised to correct it - but they never did anything about it. This hotel is mismanaged and just plain disgusting. Anyone giving this hotel a good review is either not to concerned with cleanliness or not a frequent traveler. I travel every other week for business. I am a Starwood Gold Member. They hotel does not upgrade members and does not even give you the SPG Gold key card holder. There is no recognition here for being an elite member whatsoever. They just don't care. Only stay here if you get stuck on priceline or hotwire. But don't pay more then $150 a night. Because its just not worth it. Even the phones in the room are old and full of previous guest ear wax. This place is gross. The bathroom was full of previous guest hairs. Its terrible here. The only plus here is that the hotel is in an excellent location. It also has free wifi in the lobby and public areas. The lobby (unlike the rooms) has been recently remolded and is very nice. Its very busy and people are all over the place. But its nice and a good place to people watch. The food at this hotel is also very good. Its a shame that the customer service is not as good as the food. Phone operators are rude and don't answer the phone sometimes. There is no commitment to guest service here whatsoever. STAY AWAY !!!

Reviews.Title: “Hated the hotel”
Reviews.Author: isabelwolf
Reviews.Content: I have been a loyal Sheraton client for many years, but this hotel was a great shock. The rooms were tiny and filthy.

Reviews.Title: “Eh......”
Reviews.Author: MadTownTraveler
Reviews.Content: Fairly mediocre Sheraton. All rooms supposedly are smoke-free, but my room smelled like they'd instituted that policy the night before. The rooms are tiny, wiht a goofy set-up that has the desk facing the window away from the TV and light. The bathroom is adequate, but, again, small. The beds are fairly comfortable. The staff was helpful. I agree that $15 per day for interent is ridiculous. For some reason, thought (jamming?) I couldn't get my cell card to work well. Also annoying was $4 per bag to check bags while attending a conference but before my flight. The conference was well done but the rooms were cramped. Location is an advantage -- near Broadway and Times Square. On balance, though, merely adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: trump21
Reviews.Content: One of the big pluses of this place is its location. It is very close to Broadway theaters, Times Square, and MOMA. Also, they have free internet access computers in the lobby and free wireless in the lobby. The lobby was very crowded all three days we stayed there. It is pretty much a convention hotel. The hotel is quite dated and so are the rooms. When we entered our room it was stinking of smoke, and since you cannot open the windows it stayed like that throughout our stay. It is nowhere close to a 4-star hotel. If I had not booked this though priceline I would say it is definitely not worth it. A friend stayed at the INtercontinental which was also a 4-star, and I would say it was much better than the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “I couldn't complain, even if I'd paid 3 times as much”
Reviews.Author: Louise1072
Reviews.Content: I needed a NYC hotel room for one night, and Priceline found one for me at the Sheraton: $110 for 2 adults. Our plane arrived quite early, and we had planned to store our luggage for the day, but a very gracious gentleman at the registration desk announced that a suitable room was available. Check in at 10:00am! The room was a fantastic bargain - clean and attractive, with comfortable beds, nice linens, large flat-screen TV, and the all-important in-room coffeemaker with packets of my favorite brand of coffee. The rooms weren't huge, but two of us didn't feel crowded at all. The elevators were readily available, and if you've ever had to play Elevator Roulette at the nearby Marriott Marquis, you'll understand what a convenience that is. We could hear a few noises from the hallway, but nothing that interfered with a good night's sleep. The only disappointment was the cost of a visit to the on-site gym. My daughter decided that $10 was too much to pay for one visit and 45 minutes on a treadmill, so she skipped her workout and suggested a brisk morning walk - to a restaurant. A much better plan, I thought... It was a very pleasant, too-short stay at a hotel I would happily return to.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: txtraveller12
Reviews.Content: Great location, attentive staff, larger than expected rooms. Check the website for special rates - we received a free night after staying two. Wonderful cafe across the street for a quick and inexpensive breakfast. Provided us adjoining rooms to accommodate an aging parent. Would not stay anywhere else in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid This Place”
Reviews.Author: yellowrose13
Reviews.Content: Booked here since listed as 4 star and a Sheraton. It is 2 start at best and sullies Sheraton name. Rooms are tiny but that isn't the issue. They are filthy dirty. Had no hot water...just lukewarm. Paid daily rate $14.95 + tax for internet access in room but it only worked for a couple of hours and never again. Had to wait 1 1/2 hours to check in due to system being down. Next day tried to charge a gfit shop item to room but could not because system was down. Noisy with thin walls and loud water pipes. Horrendously priced breakfast -- 2 people was $68 and we had fruit and oatmeal. AVOID THIS HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Adequate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NottinghamBob
Reviews.Content: Visited from UK for 5 days. Never been to US never mind NYC. Never Again. Hotel was in a great location, decent room, bit old fashioned and tired but didn't go to inspect room, only was in room for showering and sleeping, beds comfortable and plenty of hot water, hotel restaurant and bars very expensive. £50 for 2 x cheeseburger & fries with coke each. Had a great time visiting usual tourist places, highlights was dinner dance on a hudson river cruise, carriage ride in central park, meal at rosie o'grady's across the road, sex and the city tour and grayline bus tour. Shopping was fun. Be prepared to spend alot of money, constant sneezing and coughing from the fumes in the city, dealing with rude reception staff, taxi drivers, sales assistants, tour guides, etc. I have never been so poorly treated on holiday in my life, not made to feel welcome. Will never visit USA again much prefer Europe such as Paris, Rome, Barcelona London etc.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Stay, Great Locatin, Right Price”
Reviews.Author: Solidfellow
Reviews.Content: This was the third time staying at this hotel. They vary the price to what the market conditions are. If you can catch this hotel with the right price, jump on it. The rooms are New York small, but certainly work out fine. The service is good and friendly. This trip we were checking out colleges for our teen ager. There are several subway stops in the area of about two blocks of the hotel giving you a choice of subway lines. You are a couple of blocks from Times Square. It is only a six dollar cab ride to Lincoln Center. The MoMA is three blocks away. You are a short six blocks from Central Park. Great restaurants in the area. BTW, the beds are fabulous!! FYI, we paid $200/night over a week end, plus all of those taxes and fees that New York does so well!!

Reviews.Title: “Service and Attention”
Reviews.Author: FreqTraveler08
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the reviews for this hotel I was a bit scared to book my stay here. I contacted the hotel and spoke with someone about the reviews I ad read. She confirmed that many upgrades had been made and that the hotel would be at the level of quality that I expected. She even took time to send me pictures of the new rooms. My stay was for 11days. I am an SPG Gold member (Soon to be Platinum). This may have effected my treatment. However, I do recommend you become a frequent traveler with one brand; it will always raise your level of service. The hotel had confirmed that a lot of upgrades had recently happened at this location. 1) All new mattresses within the past month. I have to have a good sleep while on the road and this mattress was great. 2) Flat screen TVs in the room. Not that I need a flat screen, but I do like to have the screen be large enough to watch TV and enjoy it. This TV was perfect. 3) The room size was no smaller than any other room I had stayed at in NYC. In fact it was a bit bigger. Usually I can't even roll my luggage into the room. This room had enough room. I did stay on one of the club level floors (47th Floor). This may have increased my pleasure. When I stay at a hotel my schedule is different everyday. The cleaning staff was pretty quick about getting into my room on my schedule and getting it cleaned. Occassionally, they would forget to stock my room with some item, but one call to the front desk and it would be delivered to my room. This hotel is constantly busy and is located just off Broadway. You are in the heart of the tourist area, so if you want a less busy location this would not be your choice. The lobby is always full of people, but if you are SPG Preferred, you will be able to check in Quickly and Easily. Not sure about non-SPG check in. This location has a great fitness center. If you are Gold or Platinum, the gym is free, if you are not you will pay $10 a day or $20 for your entire stay (no matter how long it is). Overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “A bit too expensive”
Reviews.Author: newtor33
Reviews.Content: Once we arrived, it was a bit busy and the line was not moving at all. We got our room and the view was pretty amazing. I can't say the same for the room. It wasn't what I expected for that price. The washroom was a bit worn out and the beds were not that confy.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs...”
Reviews.Author: mbenham2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for five nights. We were moved after the third night as my daughter got 15 bed bug bites. Rooms and halls are not kept up. We were not impressed. Great location though.

Reviews.Title: “Four-Star? More Like A Two-Star...”
Reviews.Author: fwcmcse
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small and beds are not comfortable, and the bedding is poor quality. AC and heat controls are buried under a grate that must be lifted on the faux desk, which was dirty inside and the controls were loose and barely worked. Four elevators service each group of floors, and on checkout, only three worked, which made for unbelievable crowds when trying to get out of the hotel. Cleaning staff was loud and rude outside of rooms, shouting to one another from one end of the floor's corridor to the other at early morning hours. Speaking of corridors, there were many places where the wall coverings were torn, worn off, or dirty. This is by no means a four-star hotel, as I have stayed many times at other four-star locations in NYC. At best, temper your expectations to a two-star stay and you get the idea. This hotel is VERY worn down at the heels.

Reviews.Title: “Even my 8-year-old was disappointed"”
Reviews.Author: mamabel
Reviews.Content: I don't usually write reviews, but since I've used TripAdvisor to such great benefit for my family vacations, I feel that I should also contribute. I have to agree with the bulk of the reviews posted on TripAdvisor about this hotel. I got a great price through PriceLine ($110/night for April break), otherwise I would never have chosen this hotel. It is barely a three-star hotel in my opinion, and definitely far from a four-star hotel. The lobby is depressing. Even though I tried to build it up a bit, when my 8-year-old daughter walked in, she said, "This is it?" Check-in was quick, and I took Priceline's advice to call and request a higher room with two beds, which we got. We arrived early, and were able to store our bags for the day at no charge (on the day of check-in). They must charge only on day of check-out I guess. We walked the two blocks to MOMA and spent a few hours there waiting for the room to be ready. The room really was as filthy as everyone said. The venetian blinds were dusty, cobwebs in the windows, the bathroom mirror was all smeared, and there were crusty white spots on the carpet. Blech. Makes you wonder what you're not seeing. Housekeeping during our five-day stay was abyssmal, and basically consisted of emptying the trash and new towels. Our beds were never made, just the covers pulled up, and the bathroom mirror was never washed. The room wasn't vacuumed during our five days. We did have two glass glasses when we arrived, but they disappeared the first day, and after that, it was just plastic cups. Four stars? Whatever. As for location, it is ideal. The staff were pleasant enough and the beds were very, very comfortable! Even for NYC though, dining in the area was exceptionally pricey. We stuck to the street vendors and deli/buffets as much as possible. Lindy's diner across the street charges $16 for a basic 3-egg breakfast! In viewing the local menus in restaurant windows, that seemed pretty standard. The Metro diner across the street charged $18 for a basic hamburger. I can say that as compared to other parts of NYC, these prices are way high. I imagine it must be because only tourists eat in the Times Square area? Maybe the locals know to eat in other neighborhoods.... So, pack some granola bars and your own sanitizing wipes, go to Priceline, and take a chance. Happy traveling! Thanks again to all the others who have posted on TripAdvisor. It really helped me to be prepared, and since I knew what to expect, I wasn't too disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy2stiks
Reviews.Content: After the initial excitement of winning a very reasonable bid on Priceline, 6 nights from 7th – 13th April, our hearts sank when we began reading the reviews. The weeks of prior anxiety quickly disappeared upon our arrival at 3pm to discover one person in the queue for check in. The receptionist seemed pleasant enough and when we requested a room high up, gave us one on the 37th floor. We then took an empty, very fast elevator to our floor and were in our room by 3.10pm. The room itself, although not freshly decorated with brand new furniture was kept very clean daily. We had not visited NY to inspect the hotel room or indeed spend a great deal of time in watching TV, so were more than happy. The large bed was very comfortable and had more than enough space to move around. There is a large flat screen TV and bathroom with small bath and shower, again kept very clean with fresh towels daily. You can hear some noise from the corridor and doors closing but we didn’t experience much sound after midnight, by which time we were generally asleep from exhaustion from the day’s activities. The noise was no worse than any other hotel we have stayed in. We didn’t eat at all in the hotel but why would you when there are thousands of places to eat on your doorstep. Check out again took minutes and we stowed our two bags all day for $3.25 each. If you want a good hotel that is in a superb location, only two minutes walk from Times Square, then we would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great price and location....had a few problems though!”
Reviews.Author: superxfans
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 nights at the Sheraton NY Hotel and Towers which we got (for a great price) by bidding on Priceline...we arrived early (1pm) and were allowed to check into one of our rooms, which was great. We were told our second room was not ready yet (were told room #)..not a major problem since we were able to unload into one room and get started sightseeing! We came back to the hotel at 6:30 pm and were told that our second room was still not available. After further inquiry, I was told that our second room was occupied by an airline attendant and would not be available until about 9 pm after he/she departed...not sure why I wasn't told this in the first place. (We were traveling with children and needed rooms that were at least next door to each other.) At 8:10, the attendant checked out; I was in the hallway when she walked out of the room with her luggae. No one from housekeeping came to clean the room. At 9pm, I called downstairs again to see if the room was available. The front desk told me that the room would be ready in 30 minutes b/c housekeeping was in the room cleaning it right then...I knew this was not true because you can hear everything that goes on in the room next door! At 9:50 pm, I called and spoke with the manager on duty (Zoe) and she got the ball rolling and gave each room a $50 dining credit (Thanks, Zoe!); a housekeeping attendant came and stripped the bed, then at 10:30 another staff member finally came to clean the room. Finally, at 10:50, I went into the hall and spoke with the housekeeping attendant (who was finished with the room and already working on another down the hall); she let me into the room. The front desk never called to say that the room was ready and never sent up a set of keys. About 45 minutes later, the bellman knocked on our door with another family checking in! The next morning, I stopped at the front desk to make sure we were even checked in to the room and to receive a set of keys. The front desk personnel and housekeeping (that morning and the previous night) were always friendly and considerate; we were also given a complimentary late checkout on the day of our departure by Maddie (Thanks, Maddie!) due to the problems. We had no additional problems during our stay; however, it was a very rough beginning and sort of got our trip off to a very bad start! Always an optimist, this could be a one-time experience; however it makes me uncertain about staying here again. The hotel did have a complimentary internet cafe in the lobby with computers and printers free of charge for the guests in addition to the business center...I thought this was a plus. Overall, I think the location and price (as well as the dining credit and complimentary late checkout) outweighed the initial trouble. Definitely try Remi's next door if you like Italian!

Reviews.Title: “Cockroach towers!!”
Reviews.Author: del8395
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in what we thought was going a better than average hotel. Our horror was having stayed in a room with Cockroaches and mice running around. I woke in the middle of the night to have a roach on my throat. My wife was greeeted by two others later that night as she got uo tpo use the toilet. After advising the hotel reception team of the infestation in our room, we were moved to another room and offered $150 to spend in the hotel. We were told by the hotel staff that the hotel was infested with Cockroaches and mice and they were constantly having to move guests to other rooms. Needless to say we were reluctant to eat in the hotel after this and did not want to use the $150 compensation. When asking the hotel management to refund this money back to us as we had pain in advance of our stay they became very hostile and initally refused. after some argument, they agreed to refund the amount to my credit card. after returning to the UK I found despite their agreement to do thiis they have not. I am now taking steps to sue them. What a shame, great location shoddy hotel and poor managment.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel needs to shape up its cleaning staff!”
Reviews.Author: tipperella
Reviews.Content: I stay in NYC about every other month. I always stay in a 4 star hotel in Midtown. This hotel should not be ranked as a 4*. The building is old and you can see this even in walking down the hallways. While the rooms were of standard size for NY and have the same basic amenities, my main complaint was with the cleanliness of the room. When I got ready to get into bed, I noticed a jelly bean and wrapper right under the night stand in plain view. When I got out of bed, I noticed that either someone else's socks were in the bed and fell out or they were just right outside the bed on the floor! Seeing these things made me feel uncomfortable about what else they didn't clean thoroughly. In terms of location, it's great for being near the theaters and Time Square without being in the middle of it. There is some construction going on outside though which makes the air dusty. I will stay elsewhere next time as I was not at all thrilled with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “More basic than one might expect”
Reviews.Author: Montreal_Paulb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on holidays in March: it was a bit of a let down. It is a much older hotel than we expected. The heating is central, not individually controlled: they turned off our radiators completely, and opened our windows and the room was still way too warm. I was quite surprised that was the only solution. We were on quite a high floor and the street noise was still very bad. The wooden blinds in the room were filthy: every time we moved them we had a dust storm. Rooms are quite small.We tried to go for breakfast on the weekend: it was only a buffet at some ridiculous price, and only until 11:00 AM! Staff was friendly, location is good if you want mid town. We still haven't decided if we would return: we would be very concerned about staying here in the winter for fear the rooms would be way too hot.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, smallish rooms, v. busy and a bit impersonable.”
Reviews.Author: jannjann61
Reviews.Content: We are a family of five (two parents, three teenagers aged 18,16 and 12). in New York on a sightseeing visit - first time in New York. This hotel is in a fantastic location within a few minutes walking distance of Central Park, Times Square, 5th Avenue and Broadway. Would definatly recommend it as far as location goes. Bedrooms were quite small and we were upgraded. We booked two rooms- one had a queen sized bed, the other had two small doubles. Not really large enough to share. The space in the rooms was poor especially once your suitcases were in, but we managed. There was a United Nations conference in whilst we were there so the hotel , which apparently is a conference hotel, was very busy in the lobby at peak times. This meant the lift seemed to stop on every floor and as we were on the 48th floor it took a while to get down. We had booked bed and breakfast. You are issued with passes for breakfast, but we were only given enough for half our stay and had to negotiate with them when they tried to charge us for breakfat. Breakfast is expensive if you are paying for a one off. The early morning call we booked for both rooms only happened in one. The staff were efficient, but distant, which is to be expected i suppose in such a big hotel. Overall the hotel was Ok - everything you would expect in such a large facility. The best bit was definatly location.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I only paid $125”
Reviews.Author: krcitli
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Sheraton Towers. The hotel was ok. I had a few problems with it. Check-in was crazy busy but the girl that checked me in was super nice and friendly so that helped. I think the hotel was fully booked so a long line was understandable, however my room was not ready at 3:30 so they found me another-right next to the elevator, lol. I was worried that it would be really loud but I have to say it was fine. The room was ok-certainly not what I would consider 4 stars but it was ok. Seemed clean but noticed some sand in the bed(yikes). There was nothing in the room that explained room service or the fitness area or the hotel restaurant-that was annoying. I also called the front desk to inquire about a soda/water machine and was informed that they have no vending machines in the hotel. To get a bottle of water I would have to call room service or go out to the corner market, difficult with 2 young kids. I have seen other reviews mentioning the temperature of the rooms. Whew! it was stifling in there! Finally figured out how to turn off the hot air and it got a bit better. All in all, it was a decent hotel with a great location but I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best value and location”
Reviews.Author: makwakwa
Reviews.Content: The central location and easy access to public transportation makes this my first choice for New York City. Furthermore the additonal $30 to $40 for a club level room is the best value for your money. The complimentary breakfast includes healthy options and very comprehensive, free all-day freshly brewed starbucks coffee/lattes, etc., makes this totally worth it. Not to mention the free printing and evening happy hour with complimentary hors d'oeuvres and desert.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok--not in a rush to go back”
Reviews.Author: mizlori
Reviews.Content: The good: excellent location, comfy bed, windows that open for fresh air. The rest: windows very dirty, rooms small with very outdated bathrooms. Doors slam very loudly. Every time someone near you opens their door and closes it, you will know it. Very slow check-in; peak times they need more people working at check-in. Many groups staying at this hotel so lobby was usually very crowded (at one point probably 100 people there!). And we had the pleasure (not) of a group of youths staying near us who were up all hours of the night noisily going from room to room. They charge you $3.25 per bag per day to hold any bag for you. Ridiculous. You will get a recording the night before check-out saying if the bill they leave under your door is accurate, use the check-out kiosk. Well the check-out kiosk has been removed and therefore you cannot use it! Instead of waiting in the long line that was already there at 11am, I handed the key to the concierge who noted my room number. AND the message left also threatens you with $150 charge if you're in the room after 12 noon! Nice. Didn't eat there. Would I go back? I'd check out other hotels in the area first.

Reviews.Title: “Security and Heating/Cooling Issues”
Reviews.Author: cynderemy
Reviews.Content: The good - location. It is in the center of things with lots of restaurants and activities around so you don't have to go far to be entertained. The bad - First - we checked in at 3pm. At 330pm someone else tried to enter our room. Seems that this traverler was also checked into the same room. Very bad from a security standpoint. Second - our safe did not work properly. Brought this to the hotel's attention twice - nothing was done. Third - the room's heating and cooling unit did not work properly. The room was a sauna most of the time - very uncomfortable. We won't be back. There are much better hotels to stay at near Times Square. If you are a SPG member, choose the W or the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel. Great Location. Kids loved the Concierge Lounge”
Reviews.Author: swiper4
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights with the family (3 kids). I called ahead of time and was able to get an upgrade to a junior suite, and access to the concierge lounge. Jennifer was very helpful in setting this up. My kids loved the concierge lounge on the 44th floor. Great breakfast, okay appetizers at night (free soft drinks, but cash bar for everything else). Very cool touch screen tabletop computer that my kids loved playing with while in the lounge. We went to the pool across the street at the other Sheraton hotel. Nice big pool, harder for the kids to play around when people are swimming laps. No pool toys allowed. Highly recommend staying on floor 30 or above. There are three different sets of elevators in the hotel. The 6 elevators for floors 30 and above were never very crowded. One thing I learned about this hotel is it is a one pipe heating/cooling system. This means the whole hotel either has hot or cold air (not both). In our case the weather was a little warm, but the hotel was still on hot air (all air would come out hot). I did get a large fan for the room on the third night that helped cool it down. Walking distance to Time Square, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, subway right on the corner outside the hotel (E line). We took the subway to goto World Trade Center, also took the subway back from Battery Park.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LisaFromNJ
Reviews.Content: booked for Sat 4/4 to Sun 4/5 on priceline. Got the room for $110. Was only guaranteed a king size bed but called Sheraton directly three weeks before our trip and requested two doubles. Was surprised to get them. We asked for a high floor and got 42nd. Elevators were fast and available. Everyone was accomodating and pleasant. We did pay $45 for 24 hrs. parking, but would have anywhere. There is also a fee to have them hold your bags after checkout , which is at noon ($3.50 per bag). But you cannot beat the value of the room itself. The room was very clean except for some leftover smudges on the window and a mirror. Big flat screen TV. Alarm clock with ipod connection. We easily walked to times Square then to Madison Square Garden. Cab back from MSG was $10 including tip. Even ordered room service which was delicious at 11pm, and got it quickly. Could not have been happier with the whole experience!

Reviews.Title: “Skip the Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers”
Reviews.Author: TravelNephron
Reviews.Content: Three things annoyed me about this hotel ... 1) the walls and doors were transparent to sound, and at night there was lots and lots of noise (and I mean all night ... they might as well have been in the room with us), 2) they charged me $30 to check our bags for 1 hour, even though we hadn’t reached the hour that we had to check out, and 3) the room cleaning staff progressively removed our glasses until we had to call room service on the last night to ask them for some. Too bad, as the location, room size were right. The price was OK for the suite that we booked, but I think for the $, I would definitely look elsewhere (this is coming from a Starwood member). Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Tropicalfun101
Reviews.Content: We were a bit worried from reading previous reviews, but for us everything went well! Check-in was quick and the women who checked us in was nice. Our room had 2 double beds and was located on the 18th floor. The beds were comfortable and the pillows were very soft, the pillows were actually too soft and the bathroom was small but clean. For New York City the room was a good size. The room was clean and we were given fresh towels each day. The Conceirge, John, was very helpful. The hotell is conveniently located near everything. Across the street from the hotel is NYC which has coupons and discounts for the area attractions, make sure you stop by here first!
