Ellen's Stardust Diner is just down the street and is a must for anyone visiting the city, the staff sings the whole time you are there and are very entertaining, we really enjoyed our breakfast and would definitely go back the next time we are in town. The only downfall of the hotel is the parking garage, which is not really owned by the hotel. It is expensive and we had to wait 50 minutes for our car, it was check out time on a Sunday morning and there were a lot of unhappy people wating the same amount of time for their car. The parking garage charges $42.00 per 24 hours so you need to keep track of the time you check in. We arrived at 11:45 am and check out around 12:25 and had to pay another $10 for the convenience of waiting another 50 minutes for our car. All in all we enjoyed our stay and would come back to this hotel in the future. Some of the shops we went to included Build-A-Bear, Nintendo World, the NBC store, and M&M World. Some of the attractions we went to included the American Museum of Natural History where the movie Night at the Museum was filmed, the Statue of Liberty - make sure you order your ferry tickets online to get the monument pass which allows you entry into the base of the statue, Rockefeller Center and Times Square and all the shops in between. We went to Serendipity 3 for ice-cream one night which we enjoyed, it is pricey but worth the experience. Restaurant Mars 2112 is fun for kids but for my husband and myself could of done without but again my 11 year old daughter enjoyed it. Just remember you are in New York City which is fast paced, pricey and crowded.

Reviews.Title: “The Sheraton Management Cares”
Reviews.Author: DianeMR
Reviews.Content: During my recent stay at the Sheraton we received a phone call from the hotel staff specifically asking for feedback about the cleanliness of our room and the hotel in general. They also wanted to know any suggestions we had for improvement (I requested that they include printed material in the room with information about the gym and internet). There are so many positive things about this hotel (nice beds, good elevators, friendly staff, and of course location) that it makes me sad to read such negative reviews.

Reviews.Title: “No problem at all. Brilliant location.”
Reviews.Author: bgchayward
Reviews.Content: Really don't know why people are getting so worked up about this place. It's great value (book through Hotwire) the rooms are good, the staff are friendly and it's literally on Time Square. Great if you're going to New York to go out at night and stagger home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Beautiful Accomodations! Stay again in a Heartbeat.”
Reviews.Author: vintage1990
Reviews.Content: I reserved this hotel through priceline. I placed a bid of $111 and it was accepted on the first try! Once I realized what hotel I got, I began to get a little worried after reading all the negative reviews. I cannot voice too many accolades for this hotel. It was beautiful. I called the day before I arrived and requested a "renovated room on a high floor." They told me that my request was noted. Check-in took a total of 2 minutes (no exaggeration). The room was small which is to be expected given the location. We were on the 15th floor. Our room was the first one in the hallway so it was close to the elevator but noise was not an issue. The bed was VERY comfortable. The shower is technically a tub/shower combo but it is really just an oversize stand up shower. My girlfriend is 5"4" and could not take a bath comfortably. We had a 36" LCD television which was nice to wind down to at the end of the day. Checkout took a minute (again, no exaggeration.) I asked for a receipt and they told me that I would have to get it from priceline because I got the hotel from them and that Sheraton didn't know how much I paid. I was very happy to hear this. Overall, I was very pleased with both priceline and the hotel. I will certainly be using priceline again to book a hotel. I will be crossing my fingers that it is this one.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel room for the price”
Reviews.Author: Nancy2005
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two night on business trip. Bought hotel on Priceline for about $110. When I landed this property, I was sorry given bad experiences reported. However, I had a renovated room: good decor, beautiful linens, very clean, size ok, quiet, and reasonable amenities. Happy to return anytime. Traveler from Boston

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton New York is a good value for its location”
Reviews.Author: chaucerquest
Reviews.Content: Anyone reading the reviews for this hotel would have a right to be confused! Some people find it very pleasant, others were hugely disappointed and seem almost angry about their stay. Surely the hotel is the same for all, so perhaps the reviews say more about the reviewers? I have stayed at the Sheraton New York three times over the past few years, always when I could get a good deal (under $250 a night, sometimes as low as $179 plus taxes). I get these rates through the hotel website, not Priceline or Hotwire. I recommend that visitors to New York do the same--comparison shop through the websites and book directly. There are usually discounts for pre-paying. I agree with others who complain that the Sheraton is not a true luxury hotel. But you do not need to pay a luxury price here. Posh hotels in NYC can easily cost $600 a night. The more upscale Westin and W hotels are always at least $50 a night more than the Sheraton. People need to be savvy when booking and realistic in their expectations. If a carpet is slightly worn, that does not make the hotel "dirty." If you have to wait ten minutes to check in, that is not a tragedy at a huge New York hotel. Even if you are a Starwood Preferred Member. In my opinion, here are some of the positives about the Sheraton New York: the elevators are fast and readily available. Security guards monitor who goes up in the elevators, all night long. The beds are comfortable, with multiple pillows and crisp linens. Each room has a desk with internet access (not free in the room, alas, but that is typical in NY). You have a coffee maker and Starbucks coffee to brew. The window treatments are very functional, with a perforated shade you can lower during the day that allows some light to come in, and blackout curtains for night. The rooms are surprisingly quiet given the hotel location. The gym is very nice, one of the largest I've seen in a hotel. The lobby bar is attractive and becomes a Starbucks in the morning. The lobby itself is huge and a great place for people watching. I've never had any service issues here. I've been greeted by the doormen and helped with my luggage, and helped to get a taxi if needed. If you need special help, for example for an elderly traveller, ask for it! True, there is no minibar, but I never liked them anyway. There are dozens of nearby shops where you can pick up some drinks and snacks. The negatives: Parking is pricey (as it would be at any hotel in NY). It can also be a hassle waiting for your car at the end of a stay. This is a big hotel, and at times you will encounter other people wanting to do the same thing as you. So lines can form, at check in or at luggage retreival, etc. I try to be realistic about this and not get annoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Bad decor and poor staff attitude”
Reviews.Author: supernurse10
Reviews.Content: My recently widowed mother and I booked a long weekend to visit relatives. We chose the Sheraton based on reputation and also for the location. It was one of the hotels on offer from our travel agent (Trailfinders). When we pulled up at the door, the concierge staff showed no interest in coming to help us with suitcases or even to open the door. It was pouring with rain, and we struggled up the main entrance staircase - at least we saved on giving a tip! The main lobby area was in a good state of repair, but as we walked along the corridoor to our allocated room, the carpet was worn and frayed (and verging on dangerous in places) and the walls were in need of re-decorating. It seemed grubby and tired looking. We had paid for a "deluxe" room and the room we booked into was small (which we anticipated) but the furniture was damaged (by water and general wear) there was a large hole where the mini-bar should have been and the room looked like it needed re-decorating. We went back to reception and asked if we had indeed been given the Deluxe room , which we had, and then asked if we could upgrade to a suite. The receptionist was extremely disinterested (almost bordering on rude) and stated that all rooms were the same and no suites were available. We were told that all mini-bars had been removed from all rooms. but no explanation was given about the reasons for that decision. This wasn't a cheap option and it appears that the staff had no interest in being of any help. Even when we checked out at the end of our stay, no- one helped us with our luggage (my mother is in her 60's). I really wished we had booked at a smaller boutique hotel, but thought the Sheraton reputation would give us a reasonable standard. I would never stay here again. We wrote and complained to Trailfinders (our travel agent) and apparently no-one else has complained about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in all ways”
Reviews.Author: lukel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton from March 15-20. My wife and I were traveling with our granddaughter, 16, who loves theater (as do we). We promised her we would take her to NYC a number of years ago and we were fulfilling that promise. I booked online through "Hotwire" so did not know what hotel I would be getting until I had committed myself. However, I did know the hotel would be in downtown Manhatten in the theater district. My wife and I had been to NYC a few years ago and had stayed at the Novotel which is a few blocks away from the Sheraton. When I received the news from "Hotwire" as to the name of the hotel I immediately looked up the reviews on Tripadvisor and was scared out of my mind by all of the negative comments. So it was with lots of apprehension that we entered the lobby to register on Sunday. Here is what we found: only a short wait to register and we were assigned room 1030 on the 10th floor. The lift was fast and we were swiftly at our room. The room was like the picture and had two full size beds. Everything was clean to our satisfaction. The coffee maker was such that it made individual cups which we liked. Our window was one we could open and we did so the first night but it was a bit noisy so we closed it and put a towel over the register because the room was a bit too warm. This was the only criticism that I had read that was justified: the temperature of the room was not controlable. However, the towel helped and we slept very comfortably. I believe we had a 42" LCD TV. Especially nice was an extra mirror in the bathroom that my wife and granddaughter appreciated for doing their faces. In summary, the room was great and the location even greater. Sunday night we met a relative to eat with at Patsy's Pizzeria on about 84th west of Central Park. We walked since we all wanted some excercise. The salad I had was excellent and we heard it was one of the best Italian Pizzerias around. Monday we took the subway to the Staten Island Ferry to see the Statue of Liberty. When we came back we stood in line at TKTS and found someone who had a coupon to see Altar Boyz which we went to that night. It was excellent; 90 minutes of energy. Tuesday we went to the St. Pats parade for awhile. What I didn't realize is the local flavor of the paraders. Tons of pipe bands and it seemed like a mile of NYFire Department personnel (who was manning the stations?) That night we went to Chicago using a coupon we got from a girl walking near TKTS. It was great and we had great seats. Wednesday we went to a matinee off Broadway of "The Fantastiks." It was great also. Thursday night we went to "The Little Mermaid." It was also wonderful. All the shows we went to were tremendously entertaining and difficult to compare with each other. Chicago and Mermaid were in larger venues and each had their own character. Altar Boyz and The Fantastiks were off broadway and we liked them both. We also took advantage of the Times Square webcam (camera 4) to wave at friends and family back home. It was a kick. Enough said. We had a wonderful time and will definitely go back to the Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “Inferior by Sheraton standards, especially for Starwood members”
Reviews.Author: globetraipser
Reviews.Content: Checked in, expecting to get automatic room upgrade as a Starwood Preferred Gold member, only to be told all rooms in the hotel are identical, even on the so-called Club Level. So the only perk you get as a Starwood member is separate line at check-in. Whoop-de-doo. Then when I got to the room, I was really ticked. No mini-bar. No safe. No wireless internet. Rock-hard mattress. Controls on the the ancient wall-mounted heater/cooler didn't work, only spewed hot air. Only one free outlet socket in the entire room, at the desk. Don't waste your Starwood points on this place. The only upside was the extremely impressive fitness center, one of the best American, non-resort, on-premises fiteness centers I've seen, and reasonably priced at $20 for entire stay (or $10 per day.). If you want to print your boarding pass in the business center, it will cost you $8.75, the price for half an hour of access. Overall, a very disappointing Sheraton property, in terms of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and a good value”
Reviews.Author: AVPNorfolk
Reviews.Content: I thought the staff and service were excellent. The hotel is located conveniently to many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: 4fromNJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton on March 14 for my husband's birthday. After reading the mixed reviews, I was a bit nervous. However, I was pleasantly surprised. Check in was fast and friendly. Our room on the 46th floor was very nice. It was on the small side - but clean and neat. Also, at check-in, I casually mentioned that it was my husband's birthday - And they sent up 2 pieces of cake for us! Location was great ... we saw Shrek the Musical, did some shopping, and went to the Top of the Rock. Only complaint, $42 for parking!

Reviews.Title: “Stuck in the elevator for 30 minutes...”
Reviews.Author: CharAva23
Reviews.Content: Overall I have to give this hotel a poor rating, and its not just because we spent 30 minutes in an elevator. 1. When we arrived the staff was friendly, we checked into our room - it was okay, very tired - especially the bathroom. 2. About ten minutes after we arrived we tried to leave for our lunch reservation at Craft Bar (Which ended up being AMAZING) - We got onto the elevator on the 23rd floor, when we got to the lobby the doors wouldn't open. I am terribly claustrophobic, so I immediately panicked. The elevator service repairman doesnt work on the weekends, so we had to wait over 30 minutes for him to arrive. Luckily my husband is a composed person and was able to keep me calm. Now I know this is not a regular occurance, but you would think a 50 floor building with about 10 elevators would be able to react a bit more quickly. We had purchased the hotel on hotwire.com and had paid for it already so they couldn't comp our room - but they "upgraded" (it was the same room on a higher floor) our room and they gave us $100 to spond in the hotel. This wasnt ideal seeing that we were not planning on spending time/money inside the hotel The room they upgraded us to was tired as well - the bathroom smelled like mildew and the comforter had a unidentifiable stain on it (YUCK!!) - The staff was friendly and definitely understanding of our frustration with the elevator - despite that I wouldn't go there again because of the dirtiness really

Reviews.Title: “Not that Bad”
Reviews.Author: Leighlinbridge
Reviews.Content: Yes the rooms are small and the bathrooms are dated but they were clean. I judge how nice a hotel is on how clean the bathrooms are so I was happy enough with our en suite, but the bathrooms off the lobby were very old, quite cheap and not that clean. Some parts of the lobby were under construction but the only off putting aspect of that was the strong paint smell. The corridors were grubby and room service trays seemed to left out all day. Our room was well cleaned every day as was our bathroom. All the staff that we dealt with were friendly and helpful but some looked bored and uninterested. Over all I enjoyed our stay and would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good price and location, dreadful service.”
Reviews.Author: travelerexpert
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sheraton Towers Times Square for 2 nights. It was Valentine's Weekend and fashion week, so it was difficult to find rooms in NY for a reasonable price. While I am accustomed to staying at higher rated hotels, I assumed that the brand name of Sheraton would provide a decent room at a decent price, which it did. The room was pretty clean (though I agree with the comment posted earlier about tired carpet.) There is a flat screen tv, but no dvd player or vcr. I never turned the tv on and spent very little time in my room. However, the service at the hotel was dreadful. The front desk check-in process was rushed, as if they couldn't wait to shuffle me out and get through the line of a few people checked in. The following morning, I asked the the customer service line for a comb to be sent to my room (the hotel does provide several conveniences, such as toothpaste, razor and so forth if you need it). After three calls over the course of 45 minutes, I gave up on the comb and made due. I stopped at the front desk on my way out the door and let them know the problem with the comb and asked if they would have it delivered while I was gone. It did arrive some time during the day. One night of our stay, we stopped in the restaurant to have a late night (10:15 pm) dessert. (We were well dressed and polite.) I asked if they were still serving and they said yes and seated us at a dirty table. I asked them to wipe it, which they did. We looked for a waitress and she kept avoiding our table. I finally went up the the host and asked politely if he would send a waitress over. She finally came to our table at 10:40 pm and said she would be glad to help us, if we wanted a cocktail, but wouldn't serve us food because the kitchen closed at 10:30. Clearly, she had pulled a stunt. They were obviously tired and wanted to go home without having to serve another customer. We left and reported this to the front desk, who nodded and made a gesture that told me she had heard this one before. She didn't really want to do anything for me, but when I made no move from the desk, she offered us a fifty dollar credit toward any restaurant in the hotel. I accepted this even though I had no desire to have a meal in the hotel. We decided on breakfast on our last day. No wonder she offered us fifty dollars! The breakfast was 34.95 per person for buffet! Period! NO choice... no cold menu, no a la carte, nothing. Normally, in NY, we just grab a quick bite at Dean and Delucca or Au Bon Pain for breakfast, but to use our credit, we had the breakfast there. It was actually fresh and delicious, although we ate light and moved on. I used the concierge service as well. The first gentleman was rude and couldn't wait to get us to move on so he could keep the line short. The next female concierge was very friendly and tried to be helpful, but she kept giving us the wrong directions. I know NY well, and kept saying, "Would you show me on a map?" When we would get the map out, she would show me the wrong way and then I would say, "Isn't it this way?" and she would look at it and say, "Oh, yes, you are right, I am sorry". At least she was polite and tried to be helpful. I asked her for a suggestion for a restaurant for dinner and told her we wanted something hip and trendy. She really could only come up with an ordinary Italian Restaurant (something like Patsy's, which my New York friends said was fine, but nothing great), so we went to Budokan instead. (I had been to the one in Philadelphia and new that it would be fabulous.) Great! This is where the rehearsal dinner scene in Sex and the City Movie was filmed. Food was incredible, service -- the best, but that is another review. Back at the hotel one morning, there was a huge group of teenagers in jeans and t-shirts (50 or so of them) with adults all sitting on the floor in the middle of the lobby with all their luggage strewn about, while they waited to check out. I have no idea why the hotel didn't escort them all to a less obtrusive (perhaps more comfortable) place to wait or at least move them off to the side. It looked like a sit-in or something. Ridiculous! On our last day, the hotel was less busy and checkout was smooth. I was also able to get a late checkout for 1:30, which was a very nice accommodation. I probably wouldn't stay there again if I had a choice. My trip was last minute and I wanted a good price, which I did get.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tired-looking rooms and hallways”
Reviews.Author: Orb
Reviews.Content: The Good: Sheraton Towers is in a great location (53rd and 7th) above Times Square. Check-in as a Starwood Preferred guest was quick and efficient. Toiletries are nice (mandarin mint). Large flat-screen TV's and free WiFi in lobby The Mediocre: It could use a spruce-up. The carpet in the hallways and rooms are frayed; there was a layer of dust on the radio, trays with food stayed in the hallway. Recommendation: If you can get a great deal or use points, this is a good choice for the location alone. Otherwise, find something spiffier.

Reviews.Title: “2-star Experience - terrible!”
Reviews.Author: wowsite
Reviews.Content: What a BAD experience in a 4-star hotel. They have to be stripped of at least 1 star. I always stay at 4- or 5-star hotel, since 4-star hotel can feel like 5-stars or 3-stars. This was supposed to be a romantic Valentine getaway. I was coming by car. There was nobody at the front or sides door to help me with my car or luggage. I called the hotel and they said that parking is full and that I have go and find parking myself - outrageous for 4-stars - no mallet parking. I finally connected with front desk and demanded someone next to my car until I register, thinking it will take 5 minutes. There was no concierge, no manager, only 2 receptionists, many people in line and terribly slow assistance. Took me 25 minutes to check in. Now - the room.. What kind of 4-star hotel room has: NO robes, NO water, NO fridge or mini-bar, NO menu. The room was freezing and I couldn't find the control - had to call front desk, it was hidden. Did I mention, waiting for 20 minutes for 1 pitcher of $30 juice? Room and bath was very outdated, especially bathroom - very 80s. Next morning - NO final bill in a room. Went downstairs to check out - was outraged with over 30 people standing to check-in. No way I would be standing that line! I called in front desk (phone) and after 5 attempts and 20 minutes nobody picking up/dropping off phone - I got through and checked out over the phone. TERRIBLE 4-star experience. Holiday-inn is 10 times better. You should expect a lot when staying at 4-stars - strip off 1 star and you can pass with all those issues.

Reviews.Title: “1 hour+ wait for car after check out!”
Reviews.Author: touristo80
Reviews.Content: Our room was on the 43rd floor which was nice except for the room temperature that I assume the maid left on... It was like walking into a sauna when we first stepped foot into the room. Good luck with getting your car back after a weekend holiday check out. This hotel should have been better prepared in the parking garage in anticipation for a crowd. I only saw 2 attendants moving cars on Valentines day Weekend. I long with many others waited in the garage approx. an hour on 2/15/09 to get my car brought up. I could have been home in that time! God forbid someone had a flight to catch in 2-3 hours! I would expect better and faster service from a NYC hotel, unless of course they laid people off at this hotel to aid in NYC budget crisis.

Reviews.Title: “Gross!”
Reviews.Author: kidCar
Reviews.Content: I planned on staying here for three nights. However when I first entered the room my plan changed. The room was so small. Two double beds, no room for my luggage, small bathroom with no fan. Stained rug, head board, bed spreads. Stinky smell and no A/C!! I used the gym before going out for the night, huge, lots of equipment and helpful staff. The change rooms were filthy, used towels everywhere, dirty foot prints everywhere. Hair in the showers, sauna and steam room. Needed to be cleaned. I left the hotel for a night out on the town and eventually returned the next morning to check out and check into the W Times Square. When checking out of the Sheraton NY Hotel and Towers I told the clerk about the room. And moved on and quickly forgot about this horrible experience. I am a gold SPG member and expected more from the Sheraton. I received luxury and cleanliness from the W 4 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “It really isn't the staff's fault”
Reviews.Author: ottawacitizen
Reviews.Content: The staff tried hard, but they don't have a lot to work with -- the corporation is too busy trying to cut corners and this was especially evident during XMAS -- in the first room we were given, there was some sort of motor noise above us and the tv did not work. In the second room, the second night, the blinds would not close, and we were told that it would take a week to find a new set. For the third night, the hammering was only during the day. Although we were not feeling well and wanted to rest during the day, we did not change rooms again because we were told the hotel was overbooked anyway. As well, the wait to check in was 45 minutes or more for some, the lounge was so crowded one had often to wait for a seat. The elevators were so full in the morning, that people often could not get on. All in all, things had a faded look to them -- some of the elevator doors took forever to close for example. And as an example of how cheap the hotel is to its guests, it rented out its bellman baggage service to a company that charges $3.25 for each bag left by a departing guest per day!

Reviews.Title: “What a treat!”
Reviews.Author: bett6827
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton on Saturday Jan. 31st. We were in town to enjoy the excitement of the city and to visit with our recent college grad daughter whose first job is in the Big Apple. We arrived in the city early on Saturday in order to make the most of our weekend. Couldn't believe it! We were able to check into our gorgeous Sheraton Suite at 9:00 a.m.! Our suite was on the 34th floor. The view was spectacular. From one window we could see boats on the Hudson River and from another window we could see the all the activity of downtown. The generous living room of our suite featured a beautiful and comfortable blue velvet sofa, 2 arm chairs, nice chrome lamps, a coffee table, a desk and a flat screen t.v . The coffee table was great for spreading out maps and guidebooks. Did I mention that there was a powder room off the side of the front entry? Our bedroom featured a comfy king bed, another t.v., a generous clothes closet and a huge and terrific over-sized full length mirror that was great for giving yourself that last minute once-over before you head for a night on the town. The Sheraton at 811 7th Avenue is in the perfect location for every where you want to go. My husband and I took a 3 minute walk to the subway to get to Greenwich Village. Later, we hiked down toward Macy's at Herald Square. For dinner we walked in a whole new direction to find a great Italian restaurant in Hell's Kitchen. In the morning it was a snap to get to our daughter's apartment in Queens for Sunday Brunch. Choosing to stay at this outstanding Sheraton was super smart . We'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Sherton or is it a Holiday Inn?”
Reviews.Author: eightwednesday
Reviews.Content: When I first arrived at this hotel I was immediately impressed. The lobby is maintained beautifully and the staff down there were friendly. Furthermore, the location is absolutely ideal. These are the only aspects of the hotel that I consider noteworthy. The room I stayed in with one other person was rather spartan. I could venture a guess that the bedding was expensive, but it didn't make up for the room not being notably nicer than a Holiday Inn. Furthermore, there were just as few towels as I've encountered at a Motel 6 and it was just as difficult to acquire more. There was also a lot of noise from people even just walking past the room in the hallway. At one point I found a cockroach in the bathtub which really turned me off. If they can keep the cockroaches at bay in a Super 8 Motel in Tucumcari, NM (an entire city seemingly inundated with cockroaches) I have certain expectations for a luxury hotel in New York City. Essentially, the Sheraton, NY is a competent hotel with friendly staff. If someone else were paying for it (as the case was with my stay), I'd stay there again. However, I wouldn't spend my own money on a room here. I just don't feel that you get enough value from the hotel itself for what they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Room (Over-Priced), Under-staffed”
Reviews.Author: MontyLWill
Reviews.Content: My wife and two older daughters( mid 20's) stayed at the Sheraton for 4 nights between Christmas and New Years Eve. The Sheraton location was excellent within walking distance of almost everything that we wanted to do. The crowds were huge but we expected crowds because of the holidays and above normal temperatures. We had very good flights from Dallas to NY and Laquardia Airport was busy but easy to move around with no luggage problems. Super Shuttle was a great way to get from the airport to the Hotel (45 min ride). We checked in on Dec 26 about 6 PM, the lines were long but moved fairly quickly with no problems. Only 3 people worked the check-in lines; the lines could have moved much faster with more staff. We did see huge lines and very upset people at the check-in counter several times as we went through the lobby during our stay. The lobby was packed with people and luggage which was expected. The staff was courteous and answered all of our questions we had during check-in. We asked about an upgrade on the room but none was avaliable because the Hotel was sold out. When we opened the door to our room (30th floor) the first thing that we saw was a partially made bed and one with the covers off and on the floor. I had read this problem in other earlier reviews and had hoped that this was isolated but evidently it is very common. I talked with other guests and many had the same problem. Hotel is under-staffed and this should not be a problem with the amount of money that we paid for this room. The handicapped room (which we did not ask for) was clean but had a musty odor and was in need of an upgrade. The bathroom was large, television great, and comfortable beds. However, the room temperature stayed hot because the thermostat did not work. Room was definitely not worth the price that we paid. The hotel staff was friendly, the concierge and bell captains were great and handled all our requests and questions. The restaurant was convenient but very expensive. We had only one meal there and it was nothing exceptional. The Starbucks in the Hotel was small with only limited options therefore we went to one of the two other Starbuck nearby locations. The Sheraton has a great and convenient location: 10-20 minutes from Rockfeller Center, Radio City, NBC show, Saks Fifth Ave, Central Park, FAO Scwhartz toy store) Walking distance to almost all the shows (Wicked, Lion King, Phantom of the Opera, Mamma Mia, David Lettermen) Subway stops were very close and easy to use (Metro Card sold at each stop if needed) Just pay close attention to which line you get on (uptown, downtown, etc...) Carnegie Deli is just down the street and was busy but we got in and out quickly. The sandwiches are huge (fair prices) which we shared. Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island are a must see for everyone. Plan on 3-5 hours total based on crowds. Long security lines with airport type screening at several locations. World Trade Center Site is very moving and worth seeing. Empire State building lines were very, very long therefore we decided to see NYC skyline from the Top of the Rock at Rockfeller Center. Great view and marvelous spot for photos/videos. You can reserve time slots on line for the Top of the Rock -- no lines and no restrictions on how long you can stay on the observation deck. If possible reserve show tickets and tours in advance. Print out your e-tickets and take with you. This saved us long waits in ticket lines and made the trip much easier with less worries about arrving at the shows/tours late with long lines. We had a great time in New York City and we plan on returning. We will probably stay some where else because of the prices and continuing problems that we have read and seen first hand at the Sheraton Towers location. Fabulous location, several minor problems --- but for the high prices and Sheraton name we expected much more !!!

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the prupose”
Reviews.Author: team_winks
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked this hotel through Expedia and stayed there over Xmas 2008 for 7 nights. We were reluctant to book after we read most of the reviews but thought, what the hell, its a Sheraton. Overall, the service was average, not the usual over the top level that you receive when you stay with a Sheraton, but we kept in mind that it was probably there busiest time of year. Room was fine, amazing bed and had all that was necessary.We had a problem with a leaking tap but it was sorted within 30 mins. The walls are very thin, you could hear everyone in the hallway which was probably the worst thing about the room. One piece of advice is about there luggage storage. We had to line up for 25 mins to drop off one suitcase on the morning that we were leaving and then we had to wait 90 mins to pick it up !!! Lucky we had left enough time to get to the airport, but there were alot of people in line who had to just push to the front of the line as they were going to miss their plane. Location is AMAZING. You couldn't really ask for more. Overall, if you go expecting the worse you come out smiling!

Reviews.Title: “pre xmas new york sheraton tower”
Reviews.Author: redtraveller_8
Reviews.Content: Thought we would treat our selves to a nice luxary hotel this yr. Well this one was not it, VERY DISSAPOINTED. The only good thing about staying here, was the location. There was no room temperature gauge, so it was constantly changing frm extremly hot to cold, gusting draft fom under the front door. All fixtures were wonkey, eletrical plugs were a bit suspect (not sure if safe). Did not clean room on first day, no hoovering throughout the whole week there. Saw the deal that they had stay one night, nxt night free..... Well it did not work out like that and their room rates vary frm wk to wk. And prices do not have taxes included so beware read the small print. For the price you pay ......go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for 2 not for 3”
Reviews.Author: AlannShaz
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms, one for my wife and myself, and another for our 3 teenage children. The booking form clearly stated 2 rooms; one for us , and another room for 3 adults , but for our kids, we were given two "double" beds which were barely larger than a single bed. Staff at the hotel stated it was the fault of the booking agent, but they could not respond the booking forms we had, and then stated it was a common problem, so why take the booking? They moved the children to a room with 3 single beds but no space to walk around the room. But we eventually were given an acceptable partial refund All the rooms were rundown, but we found staff very helpful. Great location though very impersonal. Next time we'll try and found somewhere near Soho or Greenwhich Vill

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel! Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: borstalboy
Reviews.Content: I had a great time at the Sheraton! I arrived about 9AM and didn't wait at all. I was upgraded to a club level floor for free without even asking and I got a great deal on Priceline. The room was clean and the bed was super comfortable. The carpet could be replaced but that was my only real complaint. I asked for a refrigerator at check in and it was at my room within 20 minutes. Everyone was very nice and I had a great Christmas vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: NJtraveller77
Reviews.Content: The hotel is okay as long as you are not paying full price or at least over $150 in New York. Was able to get a decent price at priceline. Hotel is huge. The television and its digital channels was nice. Noise from the hallways was very annoying though as passersby sound like they are inside your room. No sound proofing. There was only one working elevator for floors 21-28 and no notice or information that the other elevators are not working. With so many guests, you had to wait 15 minutes to get down and even more to go up. This was especially a problem when we tried to go to our room to freshen up prior to a show and there was a long line of people for the lone elevator. The bag storage fee is also annoying since this is the first hotel I've stayed in to charge that. Location is very convenient though, right next to the subway. As long as you're not expecting a 4 star hotel but a 2 star and did not pay too much for your room, the sheraton is an ok hotel.

Reviews.Title: “shabby hotel, indifferent service”
Reviews.Author: jengaworld
Reviews.Content: Stayed here b/c this was the official hotel for a conference. Even with the discounted rate and sharing a room with a colleague, I didn't feel we received value for our dollar. Room carpet was old and shabby, furniture was a bit beat-up, bathroom floor dirty in corners and under vanity (and really needed a good mopping), shower curtain's cloth liner had red mold all along the bottom. The shower handle also fell off one morning. Hallways were dark and worn, front desk staff indifferent -- the overall sense here was a poor quality 2-star hotel, and certainly not a 4-star in any meaningful sense. The only positives were the Sheraton "Sweet Sleeper" beds, which were indeed very comfortable, although our sheets had small tears in them on a couple nights. I just don't understand how Sheraton can spend so much money on promotional campaigns and on widescreen TVs in rooms yet not attend to basic cleanliness and maintenance. And I really think there are better options in NYC -- this was my least favorite hotel stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: kes0573
Reviews.Content: hotel is in a good location, you must eat at Rosie O'Grady's across the road - the food is lovely, we ate there twice and spent New Year's Eve there. The sheraton upgraded us on arrival which was nice. Rooms are okay could be a bit better but for the time spent in them they were fine. Staff were friendly who we came across. Gym is good and well facilitated. we would stay there again due to location. 5 mins from central park & times square.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location- good stay”
Reviews.Author: NYWinesRoc
Reviews.Content: Booked through Priceline ($120/night for 2 nights for 2 rooms); was scared by the previous reviews, so I expected the worst. We had an oversized van and had to park right next door at $70/24 hrs., but had an easy in and out. Maybe a better option than the hotel lot. A short line for check in moved fairly quickly- clerk (Molly) was VERY friendly!! Room was nice, adequate for NYC, bathroom was a bit tight, but clean. Could have used a hotel directory and maybe more NYC info in the rooms. Elevators weren't working well and were overburdened for the busy time of year, but we survived it. Found the rooms to be very quiet- sort of a "white noise" from the heating system that seemed to run constantly, but not annoying. Temp. seemed ok, we didn't even try to adjust it. No wait for me with the concierge desk. Fitness center looked good, but didn't want to pay the $10/day; $20/visit- a little too tired to put in a good workout after all day of walking. Location was fantastic for theaters and Broadway. Would have been moderately disappointed had we paid full price, but were very happy with our stay at a bargain price!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible stay:the worst in New york!!!!”
Reviews.Author: floor49
Reviews.Content: 7 times in new york and this is of course the worst hotel ever been.The best thing???Just the location!!!1hour line for check in and the same for check out.Poor and unfriendly staff.We call 5 times for a request and they provided only 24 hours later to answer to our request.The concierge seemed to be bored behind the desk and on christmas day there was only one concierge with dozens of ours in line waiting to be helped.When my turn arrived he answered to phone and I waited 10 minutes.Then,while i started my answer the phone ring again and 15 minute more been waiting.It seemed to be on candid camera!!!!He answered disinterested to my request and was unhelpful. The heating system is very old and doesn't function properly.It is so noisy!!!!!!!You better sleep with heating system off but the room will be very cold because window doesn’t close completely.The carpet was dirty and dusty.Unbeliveble:a four star hotel without wardrobe and frigo bar.Ok,I don’t care about frigo-bar ,but where I store my dress???I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.I had better stay at Hilton,affinia manhattan and marriot marquis.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience at the Sheraton New York Hotel & Towers”
Reviews.Author: Ilene
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel from Dec. 24 - 27, 2008 and had a good experience -- better than we expected, though not perfect. We picked the hotel for its prime location for a family trip to NYC. We are Sheraton Gold members and I think we benefitted in the level of service we received. In fact, we mistakenly walked into the Sheraton across the street when we first arrived. The Bellman could not have been nicer and walked us over with all of our luggage to the New York Hotel and Towers right across the street. The lobby was nice and very busy. But, check in was quick for us in the express line for Gold members. We were on the top floor (50), as I had requested a higher floor with a quiet location. This was Club Level, but we were not charged extra. The only benefit was the use of the lounge for breakfast, but the lounge was only open one morning during our stay because of the holidays. My husband and our children enjoyed the breakfast, but I stick to coffee which I made in our room. The room was NYC small, but in good shape. The beds and pillows were very comfortable and we could hardly hear any street noise. There was an HDTV in the room. The bathroom was also small, but clean, with white tile and marble. The towels were basic hotel quality. We had a very nice view being so high up. The walls were thin though, and we could hear our neighbors. It also took 3 requests before we received the refrigerator for the room. But, the hotel did not charge us the daily fee. We were hardly in the hotel and room, so I cannot really comment on much else. Housekeeping was friendly and did a nice job. There was some dust on the nightstand, but I think that had to do with the heating vents, which seemed to run non-stop, with no controls in the room. It was hot at night, but I find most NYC apartments and hotels are very warm. Parking at the hotel totalled $120, which isn't bad for NYC. But, it took forever for us to get our car back. We would stay here again -- it was covenient, within walking distance, to everything we wanted to do. The price was right and for a family trip, it more than met our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money, The staff are uselless”
Reviews.Author: trainaholic
Reviews.Content: Other than its close, there is anything special about this hotel. Its not cheap, always crowded and you will only get club lounge access if you're a platinum member, I'm gold. Every time I requested the lounge access, I got a different answer. It would have been ok if they all told me the same thing. The rooms are much smaller than typical hotels but its in Manhattan after all. A guy came to bring us water, knocked on the door once and then just went in, WTH!!. At check out, the lady just wanted to get rid of me and gave me "sorry I don't know" answer on everything, we're a nice couple, its not my fault she deals with a lot of people. I do not recommend this hotel, take the subway out of Manhattan, much cheaper and much nicer. The subway is really easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “a fairly good hotel undermined by shortage of staff”
Reviews.Author: Dutch Brother
Reviews.Content: While the Sheraton is not the horror show some reviewers would lead you to believe, the service is not up to the quality of the rooms. The problem is that the hotel seems to have insufficient numbers of staff, especially in the lobby and garage. We had to wait 30 minutes to park our car even though there were only 10 cars in line in front of us. The parking attendant said we could have just given him the key and checked in, but we needed to pull the car into the garage to unload it. The driveway to the garage is too narrow to walk around cars with luggage in tow. The garage can accommodate only a dozen cars at a time, as cars are sent by elevator to other floors. The entire parking system was not designed to handle the number of cars that can be expected at a hotel with 1750 rooms. Once we had finally gotten our car into the garage, another line awaited us to check-in. There were about 20 people in line, but only three receptionists on duty even though the reception desk could have accommodated probably three times that many. We were lucky. The next day I saw 50 people in line to check in, again with only three receptionists on duty. When I finally got to a receptionist, she told me that all the rooms with two beds were gone and we were given a room with a king size bed, not adequate for two adults and a six year old. Furthermore, the hotel did not have any roll away beds left. The receptionist had an uppity attitude just like the parking attendant. I think they were just overwhelmed by the amount of people they had to handle and were doing their best to deal with many irate guests. I wanted to ask the concierge a question, but the line of at least a dozen people for just one concierge discouraged me from a third line. I just gave up and went to my room, which was good, but not great enough to compensate for all the long lines and unfriendly staff. The room was reasonable size. The built-in desk along the entire length of the window was great as it was twice the size of a regular desk and provided lots of space to set things on. The room had a flat screen TV, a long padded bench but no sitting chair, a safe, and a fairly well appointed bathroom. The towels were small and scratchy. The bed was reasonably comfortable. The pillows were very squishy and there were no extra pillows in the room. The temperature control worked fine. We often had long waits for elevators and sometimes the elevators were too full to accommodate any more passengers. This hotel is simply overwhelmed by the number of guests. The facilities and staff are simply insufficient to handle the huge numbers of people. If you can get a great price on this hotel (we did), and can put up with the lines, then the rooms are sufficiently good quality that it is worth it. And the location is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Great Place”
Reviews.Author: peaches0528
Reviews.Content: We were excited to win a bid on priceline.com of $130/night +taxes, and really thought we were in for a great weekend getaway. Unfortunately, the other reviews regarding the check-in process were on-the-money!! We waited in line for about 20 minutes in a SWAMPED lobby (I've never seen a lobby that crowded--it looked like a refugee camp). While we were in line, I witnessed some of the worst customer service I have ever seen as a reception worker yelled at a customer that he was wrong several times and basically told him to shove-it. We were told our room was not yet ready, but we could check our bags and check back after an hour. We joined the line to check our bags which was a nasty experience (25 min. line and very little organization). After an hour, we came back and were able to check in. We waited again in both lines--check-in and baggage check (another 30-35 min. easily). We got up to our room only to find that the toilet was broken. I called down to the front to see if we could change rooms, but they said they were booked solid and instead sent someone up to fix the toilet, which they did. The hotel room itself was decent--small, but that's to be expected in NYC. The room showed definite signs of wear, and could do with a revamp (i.e. stained carpets, worn bed frame, etc.). I'm not normally concerned with the little things--like towels being arranged the right way, etc., but on the last day, the bathroom looked a little messy even after it was cleaned, and our towels were just thrown up on the rack without being folded. I read someone else's review regarding this, and thought "Come ON, you are really stretching on this one. Big deal." Just thought it was funny that apparently it is a trend. If you are looking for a no-frills hotel, the location of the hotel is fantastic--about 1 block from Times Square and located near the subway and lots of cafes/restaurants on 9th. If the little things put you off, like long lines, rude customer service, no remote controls, etc., this is not the place for you. Since we only paid $130/night, it was a steal. I would NOT pay full price to stay at this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “ok room”
Reviews.Author: kaykow
Reviews.Content: For some strange reason we were given a handicapped room even though neither of us is handicapped. Room was a bit run down. The blinds went up & down by a flick of a switch. However, you had to put the switch in the middle setting or they would keep going up & down. Since It was a handicapped room, there was no tub/shower in the bathroom. Bathroom floor had 2 drains. A small part of the room was partitioned off via shower curtain. The partitioned portion had a hand held shower which could cause flooding if one is not careful. Very busy hotel. There were crowds in the lobby. The Avenue Restaurant was too expensive. The staff was friendly and helpful. There was to be a hairdryer included in the room, however, we could not find it. I called the front desk and one was brought to our room. Room had a nice view. There was an in room coffee maker but the coffee was terrible. They had flavored tea which I don't like. I would have preferred Lipton tea. Bed was comfortable. The safe was great. The room was hot and it was difficult to adjust the temperature. Toilet flushed weird and always had to be flushed more than once to get the toilet paper down.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible doesn't begin to describe my experience!”
Reviews.Author: Luv_Moonstruck
Reviews.Content: I always had a sneaking suspicion that customer service was on the decline, but my fears were not fully realized until my stay at the Sheraton Towers in NYC. Let me explain… My husband and I came to NYC to celebrate my birthday and visit some friends for a short weekend getaway. We had a nice walk from Penn Station to the hotel, where we waited in the check-in line for a good half hour. We were told the room was not ready yet, which we expected since we were early, and that we could check our bags. We waited another half hour on the bag check line; finally we were free to do our thing. We had a GREAT day and came back to the hotel around 11:30 pm. I went on the check-in line, which was even longer than before and NOT moving, while my husband went to retrieve our suitcase. About 20 minutes later my husband meets me in line, but without our suitcase. Apparently someone else had it! As disconcerting as that was, the treatment and lack of care the staff showed on our behalf was even worse. The line was still not moving and my husband tracked down a night manager who came over and finally got things moving again. When it was our turn we told the front desk receptionist our situation. He told us that we needed to speak with the baggage handlers and that there was nothing he could do. We informed him that they told us to speak with him; he adamantly disagreed and walked us over to the baggage area. Needless to say, he and the other gentleman got into an argument over who was responsible for this situation. When we asked to speak with the manager on duty he would not even come over and speak with us (he just kept checking people in) and told the front desk person to have the security office deal with it. So, the security office comes and informs us that they cannot call anyone about our bag until the morning. I, with clenched teeth, ask what they will do for us in the meantime. We had nothing, it was all given away. He was totally clueless. I suggested toothbrushes and toothpaste and at least robes to change into. Grudgingly he says OK, someone will bring them to our room. Now, on to the room… We get to the room, which was small (I’m pretty sure the room at the Microtel I stayed at in Watertown, NY was bigger than this) and DIRTY. The carpet was stained and had definitely seen better days and the dust on the furniture was very visible. We called down to see if we could change rooms and were told that none were available. So, then we pull down the covers and sheets were FILTHY, makeup and other stains (only God knows what!) were on them. So, we call down a second time and ask for clean sheets. About one hour goes by and nothing. I call the security office again, the only competent person in the place, and ask when we will be getting our things. About another 20 minutes go by and finally someone brings us robes and toothbrushes, etc. We asked him for sheets and he seemed a bit putout since he was the only one on duty that night. Finally he comes back and changes the sheets for us; meanwhile his BO is stinking up the room. Around 1:45 am we crawl into be only to get up a few hours later and put on the same clothes and trudge down stairs. The manager on duty that morning was apologetic and did comp the room (but only after I told her I refused to pay). I have never in my life experienced such abdominal service. It wasn’t even about the missing luggage, it was about the total lack of respect and seeming ignorance of everyone we encountered at the hotel. The Sheraton will never see another dime of my money!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: mtl-ny-paris
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel for christmas week through priceline. It was under the 4 star hotel category. Other than the helpful concierge service and the staff, there isn't much that was good about the place. The hotel is in desperate need of some renovations. The heating system is very old and doesn't function properly. No pool, no mini-bar and no water pressure. Overall the hotel is okay (at least it was clean) but definitely not a 4 star hotel. It should be categorized as a 3 star and they should charge the same rates as hotels in that category.

Reviews.Title: “Can not beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: carneasadaburrito
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton Dec. 22-Dec.26th and was more than pleased. The location is unbeatable. You are virtually in the middle of Times Square! Clerk at check in was great (Christian I believe his name was) was fast and professional. My room on the 27th floor was about average size for New York city. My only issue was my view consisted of looking at another building so you may want to ask for a view of times square as I am certain they have those type of rooms. Housekeeping was sufficient and I really loved the lobby. Did not try the restaurnats so I can not comment but they seemed extremely expensive (welcome to nyc). In closing the best thing about this hotel is the location. We visited almost all of NYC and I think I would rather stay where we were than any other hotel I saw. We seemed to be in the perfect location. In closing I would definitely return to this hotel but would give my best effort to get a room facing Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “mobbed, no heat, noisy, low class”
Reviews.Author: Iluvhhi
Reviews.Content: This should NOT be a four star hotel. Our room had no heat, and the noise from the hallways was very disturbing. Elevator waits at checkouts were more than half hour. The lobby was mobbed and there didn't seem to be any security checking to see that only guests went up in the elevators, very disconcerting with such crowds around. Rude housekeeping staff yelling in hallways.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Novicecruiser1
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews about this hotel, I was very apprehensive about staying at the Sheraton Towers. I crossed my fingers and made the Club Level reservation using my Sheraton points. If I were pessimistic, this is how I would describe our stay. We arrived at 9:00 a.m. and checked in, but a room was not available yet. Came back around 12:30, picked up our keys and headed to the room. The lobby area was being renovated and at times, you could hear loud drills and hammering while in the lobby area. Our room was fairly small, but mostly clean. The wooden blinds definitely needed to be dusted and our view consisted mainly of the building across the street. The bathroom ceiling had a few paint peels and the shower/tub was very small. There was no way to control the temperature of the room. It is what it is! We visited the Club Lounge in the evening for free snacks and each morning for breakfast. There was no charge to store our bags on the day of arrival, but they did charge $3.25 per bag to store them the day we checked out. I am optimistic and here's how I really feel about our stay. When we arrived at 9:00 a.m., we did not expect a room to be ready - it wasn't - no big deal. We stored our bags with the bell captain. We were told that more than 1000 rooms were checking out that day (it was a Sunday) and to check back around noon. Returned at 12:30 and was able to pick up our key and head to our room on the 45th floor. Both trips to the front desk (original check-in and to pick up key) were very pleasant with friendly clerks. We headed to our room and was very pleased with the condition of our room - bigger than expected (for NY), very clean with what appeared to be a recently renovated bathroom, although there were 3 small penny-sized areas on the ceiling that appeared to be peeling (probably from the steamy showers and no fans in the bathroom). From our window we could see the water in the distance and watch the tour boats. While there was no way to control the temperature in the room – other than speed of the fan – we were mostly comfortable with the temperature of the room. Complimentary bottled water and 2 daily newspapers delivered to our room were a plus. Lots and lots of storage space in the room. The complimentary evening snacks and morning breakfast in the Club Lounge were more than I expected - both mornings, we ate a late breakfast and did not eat again until we had dinner in the evening. The Club Lounge had a great TV with comfortable sofas/chairs/tables and 2 computers that you could use free of charge. I used the computer to do on-line check in for our departing flight. At times, the lobby area was loud from the renovations, but we didn't spend any time hanging out in the lobby so that didn't bother us. We checked out via our TV (great TV!) and checked our bags into storage for the day - we knew ahead of time about the $3.25 per bag storage fee so that was no surprise. One of the best things about this hotel – location, location, location! Overall, we are very pleased with our stay and would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service at the Sheraton in NYC”
Reviews.Author: cwd1952
Reviews.Content: I always stay at the Sheraton Towers or the Sheraton Manhattan. The staff is always great and the accommodations are very comfortable. These hotels are right in the theatre district; location couldn't be better! In my opinion the staff makes this hotel worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently bad”
Reviews.Author: GoGreenMSU
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel numerous times for multiple days each stay over the last six months or so. It is consistently one of the worst hotels i've stayed in. The very dated building's flaws are faintly hidden by the paint and wallpaper, but not enough. HVAC consistently has mind of its own and often nonresponsive (and ancient). Maintenance requests go unanswered - i've given up asking. Primarily, the housekeeping and maintenance staff are consistently subpar. Rooms are consistently dirty (food remnants, paper in toilet, blue spew on bath wall, etc., etc.) or have maintenance issues (could i pleeeeeeaassse get a room with a drain or toilet that does not back up.....) upon check in and throughout stay, dishes etc. stay in halls or room for too long. Staff mostly unhelpful or clueless and a bit on the attitude side for being in the "hospitality" business. It seems to be an "inmates running the asylum" situation. For comparable money or less, take your business elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Solid upper-tier hotel witl great access to Times Square”
Reviews.Author: garfodie
Reviews.Content: Used some Starwood points for a one-night stay at the Sheraton New York. Make sure that you choose the right Sheraton -- the Sheraton Manhattan is right across the street! Check-in was straightforward enough, and the location of the hotel is exceptional -- one block away from Broadway, and near lots of services and the red subway line. Stayed in the small tower, on a medium-level floor. Lobby renovations were in progress, and floor lobbies, though small and well-used, were clean enough. Elevators were not card-swiped, but there was a security guard on the main level. The room itself was modest (1 queen bed), but not tiny. You could control the heater by a dial on the fan itself. The room included a safe and a (large) LCD TV. In-room Internet access was an expensive $15 per night. The bed was a standard Sheraton bed, and was comfortable. The desk chair was also nice, and better than some other Sheratons that I've visited. The bathroom was older, but all plumbing was functional. The coffee maker was broken, though. As a NY hotel, the Sheraton met all my minimum thresholds. I don't have any clue about value, since I used points, and since everything in NYC is ridiculously expensive. That said, with the exception of a broken coffee maker and no refrigerator, the simple Sheraton room met all my needs and was completely sufficient for my visit. That, in addition to the exceptional location, makes this a solid choice.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Snittster
Reviews.Content: Bad experience from start to finish. We planned to stay there 5 nights and ended up only staying one and moving to a much better hotel (for less if you can believe it) the next day. Checked into a lobby under construction, filthy room (and we were on the Club level), loud noises from the heating system. The Club Lounge was over run with unsupervised children and was also filthy. The only positive is the location. Horrific customer service, they didn't even care that we were not happy with our room, the condition we found it in when we arrived or that we were leaving early. Couldn't have been more disappointed. We'll never stay at a Sheraton again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Chelsm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 1 night on Thanksgiving Eve. We needed a hotel that was convienent for us to watch the Macy's parade and this hotel was in a prime location! We had a room on the 48th floor, spectacular views and the room was nice and clean. The bed was very comfy too!

Reviews.Title: “Most Things Great...Except One”
Reviews.Author: jman20
Reviews.Content: Location, great. Rooms, clean. Check-in, smooth. Requests, responded to fairly quickly. One problem, and this is huge for me - NO THERMOSTAT CONTROL in rooms! This is fairly common in NYC, so, if this is important to you, look elsewhere. We were able to open our window about five inches (the other was "stuck", we reported it, but it was never opened). Fortunately, it was sub-freezing at night, and the hotel provided a fan, which amazingly only cooled our room to about 70 degrees (per our travel alarm). Comfortable enough for sleeping but I prefer it a little cooler. If it became unseaonably warm or humid, which it can do it NYC, it would have been miserable! This is average hotel for the price you pay for the room. I probably would not stay here again, unless it is a great deal around $250.

Reviews.Title: “Right on Times Square!”
Reviews.Author: Marviic
Reviews.Content: Came to New York for the first time and have no regrets choosing this hotel! Its nice on the outside, inside and the rooms are awesome too! We asked for a room as high up as we could get and she got us up to the last floor! We didn't know if breakfast was included so we asked, but unfortunately it wasn't, she gave us free access to the breakfast buffet anyway! Great service! They even have postcards that you can post internationally for free. The breakfast buffet was wonderful with a large variety of food and desserts. Juice, milk and a lot more! It is right on 52nd street on Times Square and a three minute walk from central park. Across the street you have a bus and subway stop so you can easy go all over the city. Awesome location! At departure the hotel has its own taxi stop and a guy that helps you put the baggage in the trunk. The hotel can store your baggage for you in the hotel if you want to. Rooms are nice, not very big, but with big windows, a desk, fast internet and a nice bathroom. Really fast elevators and has a nice interior. Some parts of it could maybe need some cleaning. A lot of value here I would say! This is a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: TK421TK
Reviews.Content: First time to New York for a conference. The location is great, close to Time Squares and the Metro. The room is exceptionally small, the bed is at most a double size bed. Not impressed at all with the high price. Talk to the front desk the next morning and they were able to switch me to a slightly bigger room with a king size bed. The bathroom though is still as small and can definitely use an upgrade. Overall, an average stay. Would have expect a bit more from a big hotel chain in a city such as New York.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasantly surprised... great room, awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: djrichards
Reviews.Content: I must say that after reading reviews of this hotel prior to our arrival, I was very worried! After booking through Hotwire and finding out that we had booked with Sheraton Hotel and Towers, I began investigating the hotel with Tripadvisor.com. Some of the reviews and pictures were horrible! I even warned my friend whom I was traveling with about the possibility of having a horrible room. However, upon arriving and checking into our room, we were very pleasantly surprised! Check-in was a breeze and the attendant was very pleasant. Our room was very nice with two double beds... very comfortable beds with 4 pillows per bed! We thought the room was very clean and well-appointed. It had a very nice flat screen tv, built in desk, coffee maker with Starbucks coffee and nice bathroom. I must say we went in with very low expectations but were very surprised and pleased! I would stay at this hotel again in a heart beat! Location was also fantastic being just a few blocks from Times Square and a few blocks from Rockefeller Center. I hope that the Sheraton has taken the comments of previous guests who had very less than desireable stays and remedied those rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay - Friendly Staff and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sophiegirl04
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a boutique type hotel with personalized service and superior amenities - and are willing to spend major dollars to have it - do not stay here. If you do not mind a chain hotel that offers excellent value - you will be happy with this choice. Rooms are small, but most are in NYC. Super clean room and I am picky in that regard. 2 bed rooms are not Queens, but are Doubles instead - be aware. Several special requests were handled quickly and professionally. Food in restaurant was good - but pricey - try to book a breakfast package if you can. Service throughout hotel - bellman-front desk-housekeeping-restaurant was excellent. Coffeemaker w/Starbucks coffee in room. Subway is directly across the street; cabs are always available in the area - and best of all - you can EASILY walk to Rock Center, Radio City, MOMA, and almost all theatres. A huge saving in transpo costs! I am in NYC often, and this hotel is great for the touristy stuff. I spend 100+ nights a year in a hotel. Is this one the nicest? No - but the location and price make it one of the best values around. I highly recommend it and will definitely stay here again myself. ONE NOTE: Do not get this hotel confused with the Sheraton Manhattan which is directly across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Very small room could have been cleaner but great location :)”
Reviews.Author: quincytoo
Reviews.Content: We were here Oct 25 for one night. We booked on Starwood preferred guest site and used points for this stay. If I had actually paid $400 plus and taxes for this room I might have been displeased. Checked in at 11 Am and the room wasn't ready (nor were we expecting it to be) as a gold SPG member the hotel held our bags for free. We walked around Central Park and then went to the Musuem of Natural History. WOW does not begin to cover it. I truly believe that New York City needs a week at best to explore. We were enchanted with the city and how friendly the people are :) Everytime we pulled out a map to get our bearings we had a native NYER stoppping to ask if they could help us :) Came back to the room at 5 to find the room ready. We were on the 17th floor and the room had two very small double beds, a built in desk beside the window (which faced an office building.) The smallest bathroom imaginable on earth. Truly it had to be laughed at. The wall paper was peeling and tiles needed to be redone. The room could have done with some heavy cleaning also. We wondered if the room was given to point users?? But when we checked in we were told we were being up-graded due to my status with SPG. I couldn't imagine being in a downsized room a linen closet would have been slightly bigger LOL. The location of this hotel was incredible and as we were not there to stay in the hotel room the room was alright for our needs. The next day we awoke to a street market right outside :) We were expecting the room to be small and it was so much smaller then what we thought it was going to be. The service was alright we were not demanding and we felt our needs were met.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: mplsguy40
Reviews.Content: Hotels in NY are crazy expensive and after an extensive search, decided to "go for a 4 star" hotel via priceline just to get a decent rate. Ended up at the Sheraton NY Hotel & Towers - and was pleasantly surprised. We were only staying one night and were able to check in early (around 1pm) without a problem. The room was decent size for what I heard about NY hotels - and was clean with 2 full beds, nice desk, coffee/tea; nice flat panel TV, iron, hair dryer, that were all used. The room was on the 8th floor and was relatively quiet - no street noise. The hotel had a nice gym and restaurants (but we didn't dine there since there are a ton of restaurants within a few minutes walk from the hotel). The hotel lobby was always busy, so if you wanted a little more intimate lobby space/experience, this hotel is not that since it is very large. However, we didn't need any help from the lobby personal or concierge, so the size of the lobby and the crowds were not a problem. In sum, great location close to Times Square, Central Park, and Rockefeller Center, etc. all within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: xstaylor
Reviews.Content: The overall experience was just ok. The rooms need to be refurbished (rugs were beyond description with stains, etc) and the temperature in the room was not easy to regulate. The first 2 nights of my stay were too warm (windows wouldn't open/air conditioning mediocore) and the second 2 nights were too cold (no heat/drafty windows). Housekeeping was average - one day the dirty glasses and ice bucket were not cleaned or replaced. On the plus side, the bed was comfortable although an extra blanket besides the bedspread cover would have been nice. The tv was above average - flat screen with HD channels and wide variety of cable stations to watch. Checkin & checkout were easy. Door service/cab pickup was also easy. Great location -- close to Broadway and Times Square. Easy access to the subway. For $455 a night, I was expecting alot more than I got. I guess the high rates are due to the location. Thankfully, I was there on business and did not have to pay for the room.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: nigelCoDownNi
Reviews.Content: booked this through starwood points, as a family of 2 adults and 2 children we stayed 5nts, great location to walk to lots of attractions bedroom had 2 queen sized beds, flat screen tv, coffee making facilities, bathroom was very small but sufficient and stock with the usual shampoos etc., great deli close to hotel for breakfast buying food near this location of times sq was more expensive than other areas, we did have a problem in the hotel that 3 items where taken from our room during our stay, which we reported to hotel security but they where not patricularly interested which was a bit annoying, advise do put any more expensive items bought in safe, we lost 3 nintendo games.good street market on a saturday morning at top of madison ave. would recommend hop on off buses great way to get about and the manhatten helicopter flight with liberty helicopters worth every $. hotel close to broadway to see any show and bryant park or rockfeller for iceskatin, bryant park cheap at $12 incl hire of skate and as long as you like on the ice

Reviews.Title: “New York First-Timers”
Reviews.Author: Carlislepeople
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights prior to taking a cruise. I found hotel staff very helpful and ,contrary to reading previous reviews, found the room size and bed size very good. One complaint would be the lack of normal tea in the bedroom, lots of flavoured teas and coffee but unable to get a normal english breakfast tea, even from housekeeping. Location ideal, 5 mins from Times Square and Central park. Lots of restaurants nearby. I would recommend this hotel to friends visiting New York and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “So central”
Reviews.Author: barbaraann1
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights there on a short break.The hotel is so central you couldn't have wished for better.The rooms were clean & well looked after not a bad size.The hotel is extremely busy with a very quick turnover although we still found the staff polite & helpful. We didn't eat in the hotel so can't comment on that but we used the bar and found the staff very pleasant.We would use this hotel again on position alone.

Reviews.Title: “horrid experience”
Reviews.Author: travelkaLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel has a problem understanding the word hospitality. Everyone is so rude, unhelpful and lazy. From not refilling out coffee and tea supplies, fixing the beds only half way, to not being able to buy a muffin in the lobby without waiting for 15 minutes in line. We couldn't get directions to the metro and they also couldn't give us a decent restaurant recommendation. The staff is snappy and irresponsive and they messed up the charge at the end. If you want to feel abused and like to be scorned feel free to go ahead and book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: beekvig
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located within a five minute walk to Times Square or a five minute walk to Central Park. The subway stop is a half block away. Our welcome to the hotel was far above average. The personal attention to our requests was far exceeded by the reception staff. The rooms are modern and clean. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GeraldineSpain
Reviews.Content: We stayed this summer at this hotel. It was ok. The beds were a bit small. I don´t even think they were queen size, but instead full size. Nevertheless, it was on a great location, very close to 5th avenue, rockerfeller center, central park, time square, etc. I recommend it if you´re staying a few days in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good for the Money”
Reviews.Author: ybry21
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights midweek and paid $220/night through Priceline. For that price and location in NYC this hotel can't be beat. 7th Ave subway entrance was right around the corner providing easy access to Central Park/Museum of Natural History as well as downtown access. Times square was a 5 minute walk south. Room was pretty small as are most in NYC but was quiet and had a nice flat screen TV. Concierge was very helpful on multiple occasions. The maid for that floor, Paulina, was the friendliest person we met in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and great location”
Reviews.Author: Clauds
Reviews.Content: We had never been to New York before so I hadn't got a clue where to book a hotel for our three nights. The NYC TA forum was quite helpful (thank you!) but I ended up booking the Sheraton through the Aer Lingus website since our flights had been booked with this airline. The first impression was very good - a lovely, luxurious lobby. Next impression wasn't so great since we had to queue up at reception just to be told by a surly receptionist that our room wouldn't be ready until 3 o'clock. Fair enough, the reservation does state that check-in is 3 pm. We waited for about 20 minutes, queued up again and got our key cards. Our room was on the 26th floor which I didn't like at first because I am afraid of heights but the elevator only took seconds to take us to our floor. The room was very clean, spacious enough for the two of us and the bathroom was equally adequate. The view down Times Square was wonderful. Everything was provided: toiletries, lots of towels, hairdryer, trouser press (never used one in my life!), an ironing board and iron, hospitality tray and internet connection. The bed was extremely comfortable. The safe is free of charge, unfortunately hubby put in the wrong combination one night and we couldn't open the safe the next morning. Absolutely no problem! Security took care of it in no time (this probably happens all the time). I needed to get some stamps for postcards and found reception to be very polite and helpful.
