We enjoyed our stay at the Sheraton very much. The location is just wonderful, Central Park and Times Square and everything else is within easy walking distance. We will be staying at the Sheraton again in December.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better...”
Reviews.Author: loch24
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days - great central location close to Central Park and a short walk from Times Square, across the road from the subway. Hotel itself could be much better. Check in staff was slightly rude and the check in kiosks didn't work. Despite paying extra for a deluxe room, my room was in desperate need of refurbishment - the wallpaper was peeling off in the bathroom and the decor was generally tired, plus the room was very dark. To be fair, room was kept clean, the cleaning staff was always very friendly and the bed was comfortable. Free tea and coffee was provided in the room and the television was good quality, plus you get a free USA Today every morning. I ate in the hotel the first night I was there as I was too tired to go elsewhere - big mistake. Food was terrible and I saw a mouse in the restaurant. Breakfast in the on-site Starbucks didn't look great either so I went to Le Pain Quotidien just up the road (towards Central Park) which was lovely. There are some nice restaurants in Columbus Circle mall for dinner too (59th St), and reasonable takeaway pizza from the Cafe Metro close by. I wouldn't stay here again unless they totally refurbished the place. If you get a cheap deal and don't want to spend much time in the room, go for it, but otherwise there are much nicer central hotels for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, descnet rooms, bad food”
Reviews.Author: blackrose77
Reviews.Content: The location is amazing! walking distance to the Times Square. I went for business but that was a nice perk. I didn't appreciate the rooms, they were clean but there was no climate control besides an old AC with a knob that was stuck on heat (it was February), the room looked like it needs some renovation. Stay away from their restaurant/bar. I ordered a spaghetti Alfredo and it was served with this white translucent sauce. This was a major disappointment since after a long day of work this is the last thing one expects to find in a 4 start hotel in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Factory Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Horizon360
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton NY Hotel & Towers for a couple of nights earlier this month adn the reason of my visit was leisure. The overall expereince was very average and actually disapointing for a Sheraton property. The service was tasteless. Upon arrival, my wife and I struggled carrying our heavy suitcases while climbing the steps leading to the revolving door... the doorman looked at us without offeringg assistance. Our room was ok from a decor point of view. The bathroom was however very small. Cleanliness was an issue... black grouting in the bathroom, dirt on the floor... rubbish left by guests on the lift landing for which it took probably 10 hours before someone from the hotel collected it. The hotel is very big and you can certainly feel it everywhere, especially in the lobby... forget about attention to details or customised service. Last but not least, I was surprised to be charged more than USD 3 per luggage pieces left in the luggage room for a couple of hours!

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice”
Reviews.Author: MissSydney
Reviews.Content: A big busy hotel with no regard for the personal traveller. The staff just aren't interested in making you happy! I was checked into a disabled room, and am not disabled! The concierge couldn't care less, no mini bar in the room, the bathrooms were beautiful, but you can hear everything from all around when in your room. Way too busy location, New York City can be done in a much better way!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Thierry_Paris14
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at Sheraton last year with two of my children. Hotel staff was very nice, check in was fast and we get expected room upon arrival. Rooms space was ok. View was great, partly overlooking central park. You cannot expect better location, 20 meters from subway station, walking distance from time square, central park, MOMA, .... A great stay in NY a great stay at Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: nd007
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a long weekend at the Sheraton New York. The hotel is very large with plenty of staff on hand at all times. There were 3 of us during this stay and I had asked for 2 double beds on a high floor. The room was a decent size, but they weren't really double beds, more like large twin sized beds. But we were comfortable none the less. Its in a great location and we were able to walk to many sites, such as times square, central park, radio city music hall, 5th ave, broadway, grand central station, and the subway was very easily accessible as well. The free wifi in the lobby was great as well. The only drawback of the hotel was the housekeeping in our room. The empty shampoo bottles were left in the shower and not replaced, empty sugar and cream packets were placed back into the box and not replaced, just small annoying things like that which were corrected after calling guest services. Parking was $42 for 24 hours which was fine by NY standards. The Sheraton NY is across the street from the Sheraton Times Square, but it is the bigger of the two and in my opinion, much nicer, and they're both the same price. There were plenty of restaurants and street vendors close by with lots of great food. Overall, a great stay, would definitely stay there again, especially for the $240 a night i paid :)

Reviews.Title: “Big and Impersonal, but a great hotel facility and location”
Reviews.Author: Tykerb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the flagship Sheratons in NYC, and as such, it is a real diamond for the group. The lobby is well maintained for the gushing crowds of guests that pass through every minute of every day. Our deluxe double king room was on the 40th floor, so apart from the odd siren was completely silent. It was smaller than one would expect, but fairly typical for a big city room. The room was well appointed and had every facility required. The only issue was the impersonal nature of such a large hotel. If you want to have the time to chat to the staff, or to enquire about local things to do, this is not the hotel for you. Infact, you have the option to bypass staff altogether through automated check-in and check-out machines in the lobby. Having said that, the barman was well up for liquoring us up on the last night, with some excellent Manhattans!!!

Reviews.Title: “Way below expectations...”
Reviews.Author: 1MoreTrip
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton has always been synonymous with quality and luxury. Alas the this particular branch has disappointed us. We asked for a double double room that would sleep four. And whilst we were given a double room... unfortunately, the beds were so small that they were really king singles. The air-conditioning 'coughed and spluttered' all night keeping us awake. And the room itself was really small. To be honest, we got bigger and better rooms for half the price at the Belvedere Hotel just two blocks away. (We would've gone back but they were fully booked!) Additionally, the hotel charged us $3.25 per bag to hold our bags after we checked out! Atrocious! Most hotels will store the bags for free! I would've preferred giving the hard working bell-men the tip! Sigh... I wouldve expected better from such a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Sherry08
Reviews.Content: We had a very bad experience at another hotel and ended up here and had a lovely stay. Our rooms were great...spacious and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight Stay in July”
Reviews.Author: Ariel.T.
Reviews.Content: We had 4 rooms booked here in July 2008. We were in town to see "The Lion King" and stayed the night so we could spend the next day in the city as well.. They allowed us to check our bags & waived the fee when we arrived, as the rooms were not ready. We walked the streets for awhile before coming back to check-in.. As mentioned in other posts, check-in was nuts. The line was almost out the door, but it did move quickly. The lobby was packed, and the line to get our luggage was insane.. I do have to say this: I was traveling alone with my daughter, and when we checked-in, my family member asked if there was any way they could get our rooms as close together as possible (this was not guaranteed when we made our reservations but it never hurts to ask).. The woman behind the desk did everything she could to get us on the same floor.. The hotel was packed that weekend! Not only did she get both our rooms on the 28th floor, but we were only 4 doors apart.. The room was small, but fine for just the two of us. I don't think we would have been comfortable with a family of 4.. The beds take up most of the room, but it was clean and the beds were very comfortable. I am a light sleeper and I was not bothered by the noise outside.. A few horns, a few sirens, cars driving by - all add to the experience of sleeping in NY City, right? The bathroom was nice and very clean.. I can not believe some of the photos on this site of the mold & mildew and poor conditions of some of the rooms! I feel bad for those customers, as this was not our experience at all.. Our air conditioner was exceptionally cold (and we needed it that weekend as that was when the heat wave struck and it was a heat index of 108').. My sister's room was a different story.. Although her room was clean and looked just like mine, her air conditioning and internet did not work our entire stay).. She mentioned this when we checked-out and they took $100 off her room.. The bar in the lobby is pricey (but then so is NY).. One drink was $10 before tax & tip... My daughter's small soda was $5.00... The location is good.. We walked to Broadway, Times Square, the subway, to breakfast & lunch etc.. As several reviewers commented, the Door Man was excellent.. We can not remember his name, but we think it was something like "Ricky" or "Randy" ?? He was a man of color, on the shorter side, dressed in full uniform (had no hair under his hat) and we loved him! He was dripping sweat, and never complained, always greeted us with a smile, and worked hard at hailing cabs, opening doors, bringing luggage up the steps for the elderly, etc.. He remembered us each time we came outside, and he went above & beyond to get us into a limo one night and an SUV the next day, rather than hailing us 3 cabs (there were 11 of us and it was my sister's birthday) and he really made her feel special... When we checked-out we did have to pay the $3.25 per bag to check our luggage.. I didn't have a problem with this.. They do not have to allow you to leave your luggage there at all, so it's an extra convenience in my mind.. Would I stay here again? Probably - because our room was clean, the location was great, they gave my sister a discount for her AC and internet "problems", and because the doormen are helpful, kind and friendly! I would not want to pay $369 a night for the small room we had as others stated they paid. We paid $259 a night for each of the 4 rooms.. Not sure why...??

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: bcyankee24
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 6 nights at the Sheraton. Upon checking into our room there were a couple of minor problems, but for a hotel of this size it is very understandable as I say they were minor. After telling the front desk they were taken care of right away and in a very proffesional manner. The rooms were clean the bed was comfortable and the location fantastic. Thanks Sheraton for making a trip to New York and Yankee Stadium very memorable. P.S. try the Olympic Diner on 8th ave in between 48th and 49th for a good and fast breakfast you won't be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Bait and Switch”
Reviews.Author: Boogief
Reviews.Content: I booked a trip for 2 room for 2 night. I found the priced that i like , but after i entered my account info and all the other stuff they want i clicked submit and was greeted with an extra $500 add to the bill. I called the reservation line and was told that they would cancel the reservation, but low and behold they charge me anyway. I an in the process of disputing the charge. It is shame that a major hotel chain must resort to such tactics.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: TonbridgeLass
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked 2 nights at the Sheraton Towers based on a recommendation from a friend so when I got on Trip Advisor to provide feedback to others I was shocked at some of the negative reviews this hotel received. Our experience was exceptional. As most everyone has mentioned, the location is perfect. We were only there for two days so we wanted to be in the heart of the action and this hotel certainly can guarantee this convenience. A few blocks away from Times Square and Central Park – it just doesn’t get any better. Checking in was a breeze and Reception continued to be extremely helpful when we broke our key and then needed to mail some letters. We didn’t have anything really planned for our visit and thought we would just ‘wing it’. We were bombarded with options so we took these suggestions to the Concierge and he narrowed down the selection based on some questions he asked us to evaluate the types of activities that would appeal to us personally. He was bang on everything, including recommendations on where to eat and the best modes of transportation to our desired destinations. We stayed in a suite room on the 35th floor and the views were simply stunning. We could see Times Square from one window, the Hudson River from another and Central Park from the third. Superb! The weather was very warm and the Sheraton provided us with a perfect get-away from the streets during the mid afternoon heat. To retreat into our clean, air conditioned room in the sky was exactly what we needed after a big shopping spree. And the bottle water delivered to our room everyday came in very handy. Even though it is a large hotel, we found the service very personal. We encountered staff from Security to maids to bell-hops and everyone was helpful, polite and welcoming. As far as the rooms looking like the ones from the website – I could swear they used the room we stayed in! It was exactly as advertised on their website. We had two bathrooms, a living area and the bedroom, resulting in loads of space. The room was spotlessly clean and everything in working order. The maid stopped in the evening to pull down our bed and leave us chocolates. I know it may seem a small luxury but that’s what I mean about the personal service from a large hotel. I’m not a big city person but my husband really wanted to see New York so we went – I can confidently say that the Sheraton was both of our favorite part! If anyone I know is planning a trip to New York, I will enthusiastically recommend the Sheraton. I couldn’t have been more pleased with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “its an OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: BellaMami
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ok if you plan to spend few days in New york. we had a standard room...it was very small so as the bathroom. Nothing really special...this hotel is so busy that i didnt feel a personal service i had a better service at the Wellington up the street when i stayed there 2 years ago. 54$ for parking per day and self service at the starbucks inside the hotel. Also if you want to check inn your bags while you wait for the room theres a $3.50 charge per bag.But the Location is very gooddd....so cant complain about that...

Reviews.Title: “Great location; would go elsewhere next time in NYC”
Reviews.Author: teach62
Reviews.Content: Great location; was disappointed with the size of the room. I was with my two teenage daughters and the two double beds were too small. The room was very tight; I felt somewhat claustrophobic. Amenities were nice; check-in was quick. You can't beat the location but next time I will book a room with two queen size beds. I called to inquire about a room change and was pretty much blown off. They were eager to please.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star all the way”
Reviews.Author: loadedbases
Reviews.Content: I was so very pleased with the Sheratons staff from the minute we walked in we felt like royalty. The nice lady at the front desk upgraded us to a club room which came with breakfast and horderves which was fabulous and came with an outstanding view. The staff everywhere were friendly and smiled and they were a true genuine family. The room was very elegant, plush and roomy for New York City. You couldn't beat the location. I did call the day before to confirm my room status and input my upgrade request to another helpful gentleman whom I'm sure was the one who granted my upgrade wishes upon check in to a full booked hotel. Kudo's to you sir! I too originally booked with Hotwire. The Sheraton is in the heart of the excitement. It's five minutes walking distance to St. Patricks Cathederal, Rockefeller Center, Time Square, Central Park and next door to the subway. I felt very comfortable walking alone in this exciting area. My teenagers were thrilled and thoroughly entertained. I was so happy I picked the perfect hotel in a perfect location. We were also lucky to share this hotel with a few of the Yankee Oldtimers. It was so nice to come back to the Sheraton after a long day of site seeing and feel welcome in this modern and luxurious Hotel. The gym was fantastic also and love the newspaper by my door every morning. Four of us came in from JFK and we were well pleased with Tel Aviv towncar service. They cost as much as a taxi but you have the luxury of not waiting in line for a cab. The best part of our trip was staying at the Sheraton New York Towers. Thank you! J. Hodges

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location but cold and unwelcoming”
Reviews.Author: Katyk44
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in mid July for two nights before our two week trip to the Grand Canyon and west coast. We spent three more nights at the hotel at the end of our trip. The hotel location is just perfect making easy access to all the sights and to theatres and good restaurants. Our room was adequate but quite small compared to every other hotel that we stayed in during our visit. The TV was old fashioned and small and the bathroom was below the standard that one would expect in a four star hotel. Indeed there was nothing about the room that would suggest a 4 star rating. As mentioned in another review, the hotel lobby was like a train station with long lines at checkin which made it appear like trying to but a train ticket. The lobby was large and generally crowded. The staff were cold and detached...just going through the motions and doing what they were paid to do. No personal touch or warmth. The hotel had not pool or fitness room but we were told that we could use the facilitiies of the Manahatten Sheraton a small distance away. We felt this to be very inconvenient. Overall, the hotel served our purpose this time but we would certainly look for something better next time. We have stayed in other Sheraton hotels and this is certainly not the best.

Reviews.Title: “I loved my stay at this Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: gopatriots
Reviews.Content: My room was fantastic! It was on the 30th floor and it was roomy and the bed was really comfortable. I didn't hear a sound and never waited for the elevator for more than a minute. I was able to check in at noon, which was fantastic. The check-in was easy with no wait and Jenny B. was really nice and helpful. It turns out she was working as an intern from Boston University. Every employee I encountered was friendly. I loved being there. They held my suitcase till 6pm for a a charge of $3.25. My experience was really positive and I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “NYC Sheraton Towers”
Reviews.Author: bailz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Towers for one night, as we were going to a concert at MSG. The check in was quick and painless, the hotel lobby was quite nice but quite busy as others have noted. We were on the 36th floor. The rooms on this floor were very small. I can't complain about the room, just very, very small. It had all amenities, though. The check out the next morning was easy, there was a coffee/breakfast spot in the lobby which was perfect as we had to catch a train out of the city the next morning. All in all, I recommend this hotel for location and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: BILLG3505
Reviews.Content: Myself, wife and 2 teenage kids stayed there Aug. 2 and Aug 3. Although we don't live all that far away we wanted to play NYC toursit for a couple of days before a cruise. For the particular weekend it was at least $100 a night less then any decent midtown hotel. The hotel is in the middle of everything, which is nice, but the room was typical NYC "small". Although we didn't try to use it, I believe to use a pool you have to go across the street to the "other" Sheraton. The place is huge and there wasn't any real personal service. We did however get a voice mail on the last night there with no "thanks for staying" or anything like that but just a reminder that checkout was at noon and if we were late there was a $150 charge.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: wallace63
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton NY Towers for three nights in early August, 2008. The hotel is in a great location relative to Times Square, Central Park, MoMA, Madison Ave. and multiple subway stations. The concierge and front desk staff were extremely polite and helpful, and the room was comfortable. On the down side, the walls were so thin we could clearly hear conversations from adjacent rooms, the bathroom showed some age and was in need of updating, and the room television had a very limited channel selection. I would stay at this hotel again, but think we could find a better option for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton New York Towers”
Reviews.Author: WestWinter
Reviews.Content: Large clean hotel centrally located in New York. Rooms are pretty much bog standard hotel rooms although the bath is probably the smallest I have ever seen. Rooms were clean and décor was fine if a little tired. Stayed a few nights in July 2008. We had asked for adjoining rooms but found on arrival that we had been put on two different floors! Reception staff sorted this so we were within half a dozen rooms of one another – not perfect but OK. The hotel is very large and the reception area was constantly busy. I would advise against buying drinks at the hotel’s Hudson Bar (the one with the ubiquitous Starbucks sign) – they are very expensive, but there are plenty of alternatives in the immediate vicinity. The Deli across the road from the front entrance is recommended. Not the best hotel I’ve stayed in, but far from the worst as well and the location, within walking distance of Times Square and next to a Metro station is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Does not live up to the Sheraton name or 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: yayum
Reviews.Content: When I realized we booked Sheraton New York Towers, on Hotwire for $229, I was elated, having stayed @ Starwood hotels all over and knew they were so "service oriented". Sorry to report, this Sheraton does not represent the name well. We booked a room for 3, we arrived @ the hotel early am checked in at the front desk, asking for a room for 3. We were told to check our bags and return after 3p. We returned @4:30p to be told there were no rooms left for 3. After much discussion, the receptionist checked with her manager and they found one with 2 double beds. We were grateful, until we saw the room, the beds were closer to twinsize. We proceeded back to the lobby, with much argument from the front desk( another clerk who was not so accomadating), manager stated that was all they could offer or a king and a cot. Room was so small, that we had to crawl over the bed, which seemed like a fire safety issue to me. I thought it was just Hotwire customers that were given substandard rooms..but from reading other reviews, we were not singled out. Positives: Great location, near to everything. Bell Captain was extremely helpful. Negatives: rooms are too small even for NYC standards, and in need of updating. Cheaper brand Toiletries and coffee, barely working hairdryer...not of 4 star quality or Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Worked for us”
Reviews.Author: digiac4
Reviews.Content: I was the trip planner for a big family trip to NY and I booked four rooms at this hotel, including one for me, my husband and 6mo old infant. Overall, things were clean and nice. The rooms were larger than I expected, knowing that many hotels in NYC are more like closets. Good space, especially with an infant! It was bigger than the room at the Sheraton we stayed in Boston last summer. The bathrooms were a bit small, but we were not expecting anything huge. LOVED the little bar downstairs, the bartender was great. The lobby was huge and had plenty of space when waiting for friends or family. Perfect location for us. Subway stop was steps away. In between theater district, Central Park and Times Square. TONS of delis right around the hotel for breakfast and lunch. Housekeeping was wonderful. We seemed to always be in the room when they came around to clean it but they were super nice about coming back later to fix up our room. The guys at the Bell Hop desk were really nice as well. Guest services over the phone were incredibly rude though and I was pretty disappointed. I cut my finger and called to ask if they had Band-Aids, she said no and hung up. We also requested a crib three times and never got one. Luckily we had a king and our son just slept in bed with us. When we got there, the lobby was jam packed but I wasn't expecting a quant little boutique hotel. But again, it was fine for us and the type of travelers we are. We got the hotel at a GREAT price too, so a good value for us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tim_H_from_Lincs_UK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for sightseeing in Manhattan. The location is perfect, just 5 minutes from Times Square and close to subway stations. The hotel itself is of a good quality. Rooms are clean and well decorated with comfortable beds and the bathroom was also good, although beginning to look a little tired. The Lobby does get very crowded and there seemed to many school parties staying when we were there. Luckily we were on the 29th (I think) floor and the higher rooms have a seperate lift. The school parties all seemed to be on lower floors, so we never had to wait for lifts. The staff were all very helpful. Best of all we got the room at a great rate through hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you get the Priceline price”
Reviews.Author: saphfirebluez
Reviews.Content: There were a few great things about this hotel. #1- Location was wonderful to the subway system #2 The bed had down pillows and comforter and was very comfortable #3- The price of $150 on priceline was incredible for the location. I got this hotel by doing the name your price. I am told that this is the hotel that will come up everytime. #4 - The staff were helpful, patient, and accomodating #5 Check in went quick and easy The worst thing was the outdated bathroom, the rooms were small but there was just me. If I had two or more-I would have felt cramped.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - good hotel”
Reviews.Author: MadMax1971
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton New York Hotel & Towers is in a perfect spot, far enough away from Times Square to avoid the bigger crowds but close enough to walk (5 minutes). It's also 5 minutes from Central Park in the other direction. In this area of Manhattan, everything is within walking distance anyway and the subway is right there too (we took it back to JFK - E Train to Jamaica then onto the Air Train to JFK - $14 total for the two of us). The Sheraton Manhattan is directly across the street interestingly enough. The room was good but a bit small - fantastic view overlooking Times Square from 38th floor (I asked for an upgrade when I checked in and got a deluxe room). Customer service was good from most employees (tickets and events, conceirge, maid service) and not so much from others (one women at the check-in in particular). Getting to the hotel via SuperShuttle was another story altogether- avoid at all costs! Taxi's cost $45 + tolls and tip from JFK - this is mandated flat rate. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, loved the location”
Reviews.Author: helenma63
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in the Sheraton for 5 nights I can honestly say it was absolutley ideal for what we wanted. Location was ideal right on 7th ave within minutes walking distance of times square and central park. The hotel lobby was constantly busy, what can you expect for prime location in NYC! Unless you expect to spend your holiday in the hotel lobby I cant see whay this would effect your stay. The hotel bar was always full but you could always find a seat for a nice cold beer after a busy day seeing the sights. I would def agree that it is an average 4 star hotel but I can honestly say I would def return to the hotel and would def recommend it to anyone. Go to Ellens stardust diner great food, great entertainment, great all round american fun.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dave/Kim
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the beginning of June and were very disappointed. We had stayed down the street at the Hilton 2 years ago and should have stayed there again. We reserved this hotel 4 months before the trip and called the week before to let them know that we would be arriving after midnight. When we arrived, they stated that they only had a "handicapped" room available. I refused, as we are not handicapped, and they "found" another room for us. It was disgustingly filthy and I don't think that the blinds had been dusted for a year. The next morning, I requested a room change and we were moved to an equally disgusting room. Very dusty blinds, black mold on the bathroom tiles and hair on the bathroom floor from the previous guest. Yuck!! The only good thing about this hotel was the air conditioning and the gym , even though they charged an arm and a leg for it. Stay somewhere else like the Hilton up the street!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: ChattanoogaMcmom
Reviews.Content: Positives - hotel location was great, the porter was very helpful and courteous, the room size was ample for the 4 of us, the concierge was helpful in finding good restaurants, the beds were very comfortable, the doorman got cabs immediately when we needed them, adequate security on the premises, overall clean room with nice linens Negatives - always hectic, loud, and crowded in the lobby, the door to our room was paper thin (we heard everything in the hall), our bathtub didn't drain properly, the bathroom was clean but needed an update, the air conditioner could have been colder, the computer in the lobby to obtain our airline boarding passes wasn't working but the staff was helpful in printing it for us This hotel was booked for us as part of a travel package. Although I am sure many other hotels in the area are nicer, the convenience of this location makes it attractive for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby rooms for the price”
Reviews.Author: Antwerp
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Sheraton New York on business. I had a standard, unrefurbished room on the 14th Floor. Pluses: Public areas give the impression of a classy hotel. Service at breakfast was exceptional - friendly and nothing was too much bother. Check-in through the kiosk was efficient and quick after a long day and a long flight in. Good to be able to make a cup of tea in the room. Location is good - handy for Central Park, Times Square, Broadway etc. Minuses: Room was shabby and small, the sort of quality I pay $60 while on vacation in France - room rate here was $345 a night. Room hadn't been updated in many years and felt very basic and with a musty smell. Air conditioning was efficient but of the 1970's variety. Overall it felt extremely ordinary. Overall I think Sheraton are taking advantage of high demands for rooms in NYC to deliver a very substandard product here. Having stayed in many Starwood properties this was by some stretch the worst and has affected my view of the way they value their customers. Although it's only fair to say that colleagues on the same trip who stayed at the nearby Hilton had similar comments to make about their property.

Reviews.Title: “High On Price & Extras - Low on Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: DougMCincinnati
Reviews.Content: I travel to NYC twice a year and try to stay at this hotel when I can. I checked into the hotel and was given a standard room. I asked if I could be upgraded to a Club Floor room as I had been in the past being a Starwoods Reward member. The clerk told me I was not qualified. I challenged him with no change. I checked into my room, logged onto my computer paying the $14.95/day access fee and called Starwoods Rewards. They assured me I did qualify and should have been given a room. They then called the hotel for me and was told there were no rooms available. The bed was great but as has been in the past a light was unplugged and the bulb burned out of another. I had the AC on high and it was barely tolerable. When I went to checked out after a couple of days I asked for a 4PM check-out offered to Starwoods Rewards members and again told I did not qualify. I decided it wasn't worth the phone call or time. I asked to check my bag and was told there would be a $3.95 per bag per day fee. What a rip-off!! No other hotel dares charge for this!!! When paying $329/night I do not expect to be nickeled and dimed to death. The internet fee is bad enough. This will be my last stay at a Sheraton. I've encountered too many problems. It's been my preferred chain for the past few years but almost everytime I visit there is something wrong. They may have great beds but if you are ticked off at the service and lack of then what good is it.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kevinp63
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 23rd June for one week. On arrival the doorman was the first and only smiling face we saw. At reception we were treat to some of the rudest shambolic choas I have ever come across. The guy who checked us in treat us like we were doing him a favour staying there. Up in the room things didnt get any better, the carpet was filthy, with two very large dark brown stains, it looked like the place hadnt seen a duster for weeks and it didnt see one while we were there either. The bathroom, a room where you really want hygiene was a disgrace, filthy to the extent there was mould on the shower wall. We thought we would have a drink in "The Hudosn Bar" before going out, described as a sports bar, it looked more like a truck stop cafe, and "The Library Bar" was no better, with a surly old bar man snapping at both customers and the staff. I would not stay here again if I was paid to, Im not sure if The Sheraton people actually read these posts, perhaps they should. If I pay for 5 star I expect 5 star and what I got that week was no where near. Im back in New York in October and I will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “So enjoyed the staff at the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: quailrun5531
Reviews.Content: I and a friend stayed at the Sheraton Towers, NY for a few days before a Cruise to New Brunswick and had a beautiful suite. The staff could not do enough for us. The beds were wonderfully comfortable and the concierge service was so helpful when we wanted to site-see. We ate at the restaurants in the hotel several times and the food was superb. The location of the hotel was so convenient for all the events we participated in. We also stayed a few days after out Cruise and experience the same helpful staff and comfortable surroundings. We recommend this hotel to all our friends. We had a wonderful experience. Patti LaBurn, South Lyon, MI

Reviews.Title: “This is a wonderful! hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kingfranjack
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to many theatres, MOMA, Carnegi Hall, and shopping and lots of great restaurants. Staff courteous and helpful. Bed was wonderful! Restaurant especially good for buffet breakfast. Loved the location and the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Intrepid123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 days and really enjoyed the entire experience. The location of this hotel is very convenient to both Central Park and the theater district. The hotel staff is outstanding--very helpful and always with a smile. The food in the restaurant is excellent and plentiful. A very comfortable place to stay--firm beds and well appointed. I would recommend the hotel without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: travelwithstyle1
Reviews.Content: PERFECT EVERYTHING! Great location, great rooms and great service! The hotel with a bonus! Short walking distance to times square, Central Park, 5th Ave, Rockefeller and the famous street "kebab" in 6th ave!!! We will DEFINITELY be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our weekend getaway!”
Reviews.Author: lauradeanp
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weekend in NYC. We stayed at the Sheraton and had a wonderful experience. Our suite overlooked Times Square and had very comfortable beds. The lobby has a Starbucks, which is perfect for those of us that need a kick in the morning. The hotel has a great location, and we were able to walk to the MOMA. We used the ticket service in the lobby to book a Broadway play for the same day, and were shocked at their ability to get us tickets to a sold out show. The concergie service was great, and made us a reservation at a cute sushi place within walking distance. Overall, we had a great experience at the Sheraton New York Hotel & Towers.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel experience for some time”
Reviews.Author: Edward0608
Reviews.Content: Wrong rooms for me and my wife and family but they were not sympathetic and blamed Expedia. Room 552 door lock is not working - we needed Security every time we wanted in. Bathroom door does not shut or lock. The toilet has a bowl that can blow its contents onto the floor. Not Nice! The staff did move us to a satisfactory room but warned us to leave luggage in the room because they intended to let the room again. They also made my wife move the luggage to the other room herself It was very difficult to get satisfaction from Reception staff. I think all the faults of that room will still be there - the main issue for the staff was to get the room let again Good location Good breakfast restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: GordonandMichael
Reviews.Content: My company booked the Sheraton Towers as it is close to the office in Times Square. Check in was speedy but that is where the pleasantries ended. My room was on the 32nd floor, but had no double glazing and ill-fitting windows so was still noisy. (Ok, this is New York so you kind of expect the noise). Room was dark and dingy and very dirty. I could write my name in the dust on the blinds (and I did)! Windows were fitted with blinds, so let in lots of light. 3 days out of 4, the small breakfast room was so busy that we couldn’t get a table and had to use a local Starbucks. At over $400.00 per night, the Sheraton was very disappointing and did not represent good value for money at all. I have to make frequent trips to New York for the remainder of this year and will not be staying at The Sheraton again. Michael

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: PeteB107
Reviews.Content: I had read various reviews of this hotel, but found it to be a better than expected. The room was clean and had 2 double beds, it was an ideal sized room for a 5 day stay. The hotel is ideally situated for a visit to Manhattan, New York. All the main tourist places are within easy walking distance. There are some great places to eat and drink within a short walk of the hotel. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, adequate rooms, lobby atmosphere hectic”
Reviews.Author: HudsonValleyNewYork
Reviews.Content: Was here at the Sheraton for a conference. Room was small, but adequate for business standards and the price (conference rate). I never had problems with the staff or cleanliness of the room. The lobby is a zoo, teeming with school groups and noise...not the best place to unwind, but the location of the hotel is so ideal it cannot be beat. Would consider staying again, but perhaps the club floor would be more ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Uk travel agent says...........Good base!”
Reviews.Author: uktravelagent1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here over xmas in 2004 after getting a very good deal. We where on the 28th floor looking down to Times Sq. The room its self was as it is on the web site. I have seen many reviews and pics on here with very different rooms, but thankfully ours was as good as the web site. The bathroom was a good size and very clean as was the room itself. The only bad thing really was the bed was very soft, but with beds you cant please everyone. We where Room Only, as its close to Times Sq we didnt see the point in B&B. Across the road was a very good dinner, cant remember the name but they do a wicked burger and shakes. There is also a very good and cheap pizza place across the road where many hotel guests where getting pizzas, and they where very cheap. Directly across the road is another Sheraton, where you can use the pool etc, but we didnt do this. Location size its only a few hundard yards to Time Sq and about a 5-10 walk to Central Park. 2 block behind the hotel is where you can find Gucci, Prada etc etc. Over all it was ok I wouldnt stay at the hotel again if I had the choice, unless it was a bargain price.

Reviews.Title: “Pay to store luggage? For real!!”
Reviews.Author: ewatts74
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton the last weekend of May and were upgraded to a club room which was good. Our room was clean and roomy for a NY hotel and we had access to the club floor for free appetizers. We also had free water in our room. Unusual for NY. Nothing is free which brings me to my next topic. We were charged $3.50 a bag to check our luggage on check out day. Considering all the other hotels in town that don't charge for this service, I will try another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “It's pretty hopeless - saved only by its location”
Reviews.Author: mrcox79
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton has a great location between Carnegie Hall and Times Square, but that's about the only good thing I can say about it. It's huge, impersonal, filled with school trips and desperately in need of refurbishment. My room cost almost $600 incl taxes and was not much better than a motel. Everything is extra - gym, breakfast, internet etc (Note - I doubt the hundreds of school kids are paying this much.) Moreover, the hotel charged a $3,000 deposit to my card on check-in, plus the full amount for the stay on departure. I didn't find out about the former until I got home and had my credit card refused for another transaction as I was overdrawn. Thanks, guys! And all this despite being on a corporate rate and as a Sheraton frequent visitor! So, if you're in NY on business, please do yourself a favour and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Dumpy, Dirty and Old”
Reviews.Author: johnjr411
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awful. I am not a pre-madonna, but expect a clean room. The hotel room carpet is filthy. The room was dirty. The decor is about 15-20 years old. The bedspreads are ancient. The AC does NOT work and is old. I had to request a fan. Everything about the place is old, dingy and in need of a SERIOUS rennovation. Worse than a CHEAP motel. Maid service is slow and did not clean my room until 10pm. After asking the front desk twice!!! I would NEVER recommend this property. The service was terrible. This place is an embarrasment to Starwood hotels.

Reviews.Title: “St.Paddy's Day trip, Freezing but excellent”
Reviews.Author: PADMIESTA
Reviews.Content: If you are Looking for a top place to stay to discover New York City, then trust me and look no further cos here it is… Excellent is the word I’m looking for..... I have stayed in many hotels and guesthouses all over the world, I am quite well traveled, but this place is ace, and is in the ideal location to allow you to see all the sights on foot or maybe a taxi every now and then.. I stayed here with my girlfriend and we had a huge room as per the piccies and video I have put on trip advisor... Prior to going to this hotel, I read all the reviews on trip advisor and I was a little worried to say the least… I therefore contacted SHERATON direct and made them aware of my fears and they told me that these reviews were from the minority and that we had nothing to worry about… When we got there they were exactly right as the room that we had was outstanding… I can see why Americans complain often when they go to Europe etc about the size of the rooms as if this is what they are used to… this room was massive.. From our room you could see out towards Broadway and Times Square and if you opened the window you could see and hear the hustle and bustle of the street below, but as soon as the window was closed it was silence… I am led to believe that the part of the hotel that we stayed in has recently undergone a series of restoration, I cannot comment on the rest of the hotel as I didn’t see any other rooms but ours was lush.. All the staff of ‘THE SHERATON NEW YORK AND TOWERS’ make you feel really welcome and can’t do enough for you, thus ensuring that your stay with them is a pleasurable one... ‘THE SHERATON NEW YORK AND TOWERS’ is ideally located as it is about a 2 minute walk from Times Square. If there is anything else you want to know about ‘THE SHERATON NEW YORK AND TOWERS’ then please ask and I will try my utmost to assist.. If you are planning a trip to New York and you can get into ‘THE SHERATON NEW YORK AND TOWERS’ then book it you will NOT be disappointed I assure you... Paddy :-)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter25
Reviews.Content: As a very frequent traveller I have to stay in many different establishments and I learned to read the postings on tripadvisor for what they are. There are always people that just shouldn't travel. The Sheraton was your average hotel and a very decent price in an excellent location. If you wish to have luxury you will have to pay the $500 and more that other hotels in New York are charging. Everybody that is looking for a low price hotel needs to deal with certain shortcomings. I just finished a stay at the Sheraton and it was a good place to be. the location is fantastic and the service we had was good. The rooms are smaller but manageable. The only bad thing I believe the hotel staff is understaffed and overworked, but this is something that could be fixed easily if Management wanted to. I do recommend the Sheraton to everybody that needs a good location and a clean room and that's what you get.

Reviews.Title: “The Sheraton - Rude Staff, Roaches, Broken A/C OH MY!!”
Reviews.Author: claszyldy26
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to begin!! I just got back yesterday from a trip to New York with my cousin and grandmother. I read the reviews on this hotel before I left, but there were equal amounts of good and bad reviews, so we figured we'd give it a shot! For the amount we paid (almost $3000.00!!) for 2 rooms for 2 nights, it is definitely not worth it! We were traveling to NY to see the Belmont Races but wanted to stay in the city where all the aciton is. We decided on this hotel because of it's great location and the amenities its website boasted about it. Not to mention the pictures looked awesome! But looks are definitely deceiving! I arrived a day after my cousin and grandmother and my cousin already had to be moved once to a different room because the air conditioner in her room broke! It was 95 degrees with 70% humidity so A/C was a must! Not to mention the broken light bulbs she found as well. The second room which I stayed in with her one night was down a long hallway with 4 rooms at the end. We shared a door with our neighbors who clearly did not know how to use their inside voices. They yelled at each other in Spanish at 12:30 in the morning and when we called to complain no one answered so I had to go downstairs myself. On the way down I got stuck in the elevator!! It just stopped and wouldn't budge! It was only stuck for a few minutes, but that was more than enough for me! Once the elevator finally let us out the front desk said I had to dial a number to file a complaint about noisy neighbors. All that for nothing!! So, by that point my grandmother had compiled a list of complaints to go talk to the front desk about. No A/C, no bathrobes, no newspaper as promised, etc. That's when we were moved again! And because we were on a time schedule every time we moved made us late to get somewhere, dinner, the theatre, etc. The new room seemed fine when we got there but we had to rush off to a play so we didn't get to spend much time in it. When we returned from the play to get ready for dinner my cousin spotted a LIVE ROACH running across the floor!!! She immediately killed it and once again we demanded to be moved....again! When a bell hop came up to give us our new room keys we asked if he was going to help us move, in which he replied, "I wasn't told to but I can go get a cart and be back in 10 min." We said forget it because we were already late for dinner as it was. Upset, my grandmother asked him if he would like to take the roach with him and he snared at us and said,"No, you can keep it." We all looked at each other in shock! He was so rude! Once we made it to the elevator lugging our belongings we saw the bell man standing there with the empty luggage cart!! He had it waiting down the hall the whole time, but refused to help us!! We couldn't believe it! Our last and final room was just like the rest, nothing special. Luckily it was our last night so we just grinned and bared it. Besides the snotty bell hop the other staff members were very polite and courteous to us. The lobby of the hotel is very pretty but other than that the rooms are small and cramped and the bathrooms are even worse! Having 2 girls in one room made it very difficult to get comfortable but we did what we could!

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring new york”
Reviews.Author: goverton
Reviews.Content: As with most city hotels the rooms were small, but comfortable and clean. The bathroom could have done with an update but the best bit about the hotel was the location. Fantastic for exploring New York, very close to Times Square and Central Park. The Sports bar in the lobby was a nice place to visit after a day exploring. Overall, a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Leaves a lot to be desired”
Reviews.Author: VeryFrequentTrav69
Reviews.Content: I'm a long time Platinum with Sheraton/Starwood and a very frequent traveler. I know it is NY and that you only get so much for your money, but the Sheraton NY Hotel & Towers is filled with easily correctable issues of mismanagement, that make stays there very frustrating. My advice: if you are on business, stay somewhere else; if you are staying for pleasure, consider another property, but don't completely rule this hotel out because it is such a great location for tourists. As a Platinum frequent guest I'm accustomed to being upgraded, but received a standard room (I have no issue with this...it is a perk based on availability). I do have a problem with poor housekeeping (prior guest's hair all over bathroom), rude housekeeping (maid knocks on and quickly opens door to room despite presence of do not disturb sign), toilet that is difficult to flush, toilet seat that will not stay up for a gentleman, broken lamp fixture next to bed, and a broken chain on a window blind (could not role the blind up or down) and for the 3 days of my stay maintenance did not even attempt to repair the blind despite my requests. Other problems include a very rude staff, especially on the phone when calling to "guest services." Trying to get a supervisor on the phone at this property is a complete embarrassment to the Starwood chain as rude operators routinely forward you to voicemails in housekeeping and other unrelated departments rather than making any attempt to track-down a supervisor. My wrap-up: rude, unnecessary, easily fixable if the management of this hotel really cared...which they certainly do not seem to. I felt so strongly about my experiences that I have been trying to talk to the General Manager, Dan King, for over a week now just to alert the staff to some of the more egregious issues I had encountered so that they could better the guest experience. So far not so much as 1 returned call from anyone. OK, on the upside, just a few blocks north of Times Square the location is ideal for tourists. Further, nearly every subway line in Manhattan is a short walk from the front door. For breakfast skip the hotel and walk two blocks west to 9th Ave and find a good diner. I can't remember the name, but there is a good diner at the corner of 58th and 9th Ave, that is 1 block north and 2 blocks west. Enjoy your trip, hopefully from a different hotel with a better hotel experience!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing end to an amazing honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: happyhubby
Reviews.Content: Having spent a lavish week in Mexico in one of the nicest hotels imaginable and 4 nights in the amazing and brand new planet hollywood resort in vegas prior to arriving at the sheraton you could say we were a little spoilt....but some of the issues we encountered are unforgivable. First impression was great,we were upgraded as honeymooners to a junior suite on the 49th(of 50)floor. On arriving in the room it seemed ok plenty of space which is rare for nyc hotel rooms but on closer inspection the furniture was old and worn the heating didn't work and the tiny bathroom had a musty smell,trying to make the best of it and knowing we wouldn't be there much we went out for the evening but on return when getting ready for bed my wife was shocked to see a rodent (hopefully a mouse but who knows?) other issues included extortionate rates for calls from rooms and being laughed at when i questioned it (the bill was eventually reduced) and generally being charged to breath in this place ie gym not included in price?? additional charge to leave bags after check out??? if you stay here you are paying for name and location and nothing more....manhattan boasts too many other reasonably priced,nice hotels to waste even a night here

Reviews.Title: “Probably won't go back”
Reviews.Author: nhlar
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel before in 2001 and remembered it positively so decided to book here again for a return visit, this time with small children. We specifically requested adjoining rooms because of the children and were told if we requested a king for one room and 2 doubles for the other then the higher floors would accomodate that. I called back the day before to confirm we needed adjoining rooms but when we arrived they said that the rooms that were reserved said "adjoining " but they really weren't. So she changed us to another room and said they might be adjoining but she wasn't sure. She said there was nothing else they could do, unless we tried again for the next day. The room we got was a very small handicapped room with peeling paint on the outside wall and the desk light didn't work. We also couldn't get the window drapes to close for my 2 yr old to take a nap (and they had previously been pulled partly off the track) and finally found - much later - a switch to automatically close them that the bell hop didn't tell us about. They were NOT adjoining rooms, nor were they on a high floor like the reservationist said. My husband complained to someone else at the desk a while later and they said they had adjoining rooms available to move to right away, so we moved all our luggage to the new rooms. The new rooms were much better - at least they did adjoin - but only with 2 double beds, no king as we were told. The wallpaper was peeling in the bathroom and some of the tiles were broken. with holes. The room appeared pretty old but the bed and sheets were nice and the shower was OK. The curtains did pull close. Obviously the location is great with the subway right around the corner and Times Square an easy walk - but for about $465 per night (with tax ) per room it was a very shoddy old small room with very impersonal service. It was just OK but I think I'll be looking elsewhere for the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Have no doubts, just book it !!”
Reviews.Author: SiameseKitten
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is ideally situated as a base from wherever you want to go in Manhattan. Central Park is "just up the road", there are numerous bars and restaurants to choose from. Times Square is just "down the road" and it is an easy stroll to Empire and all the shops etc on 5th Avenue. You are also close to all the main Theatres that have top Broadway musicals etc,we saw "Phantom of the Opera"...amazing!! As for the Hotel itself: My lovely Husband, by himself(!), booked this whole trip for our 20th Wedding Anniversary . He was close to not booking this particular hotel due to other reviews he had read. I don't know where some people got their negative comments from! We found the hotel clean, well managed, and the staff extremely pleasant and helpful. Our check-in was quick and easy.Our room, on the 5th floor, was well maintained....nothing broken or torn! Plenty room, and king-size bed SO comfy.Room was cleaned and towels etc replaced regularly. I also spent time at the gym which is well equipped and supervised. We booked the bus tour through the staff at the hotel, who were very informative and recommended certain trips and things to do. They also have an extensive list of recommended eateries, though we enjoyed "Rosie O'Gradys" (opposite) and "Maxies" (same side heading towards Times Square). The bar staff at night were fun and also recommend things to see and do.Our departure was also eased by the staff organising our shuttle bus to the airport and also, with help,...that was offered,you can check-in and progress your flights from the computers available at reception. Yes it was a very busy and vibrant hotel, but standards were to a high value. And,lets face it, when you're visiting New York who is going to spend heaps of time at an hotel when there is so much to do in the city?! We walked a great deal (best way to experience New York life), though bus tour was great to find where everything was located.... and the guides are fun and informative. Looking for something thrilling and different? Go on one of the helicopter rides (we went by Liberty on 30th) ....what an amazing experience!! Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our first visit to New York and would certainly highly recommend the whole trip and this hotel in particular to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended when you're Staying in New York City!”
Reviews.Author: thetripchick
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Sheraton New York Hotel & Towers several times now, and each time we are more than happy with the service we receive. The first time, we read the mixed reviews and reserved a room with some trepidation. When we found our room on the 46th floor, we were pleasantly surprised. Yes, the room was a little small but most hotel rooms are in the city - that's normal. Service was fantastic, the room was clean, and we enjoyed a great stay. Most recently, we stayed on the club-level floor and not only enjoyed the same stellar service, we also enjoyed a complimentary breakfast each morning over a relaxing morning paper. What a terrific way to start each day! I would highly recommend this hotel anytime you need a room in the city.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine”
Reviews.Author: Joanie881
Reviews.Content: My stay was fine, esp. since I pricelined it for $120. But I got the Hilton Times Sq. for that price 2 years ago and that was much nicer. They didn't do anything to accommodate my higher floor request but for one nite, I didn't care too much. King size bed was nice, bathroom was decent altho the shower pressure wasn't great. Bar area was fun. They did allow me to check out an hour late which was nice. Personally, I pick that area to be close to the bus station but it's a complete zoo around there. I'd go elsewhere for more than one nite since that's not really my scene. And try your luck bidding, esp. if you're coming on a Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: kasey363
Reviews.Content: I'm a frequent New York City visitor (like a second home). I've stayed in this Sheraton numerous times over many years. Overall understand it's a massive hotel - thousands of rooms - thus it is frequented by conventions, class trips, tour groups etc. The large lobby can be chaos or very quiet - you never know what you'll get at any given time due to the size of this hotel. It's location also factors in to crowds due to it's location in mid-town/Times Square/theatre district. That being said - this is a plus if these area's are what you are seeking. No doubt, location is a short walk to the Great White Way, more restaurants than you can count (both fast food/deli's and local places, as well as restaurant row). Central park is within blocks, as is Rockefeller Center amd Fifth Ave shopping. With this central mid-town location all subway lines are also within blocks (with C, E, N, R) right outside the hotel. Over the last five years this hotel underwent renovations, mainly to the lobby/convention areas - but also throughout the rooms on numerous floors. Ask when you book or check in...certainly some rooms have not be updated other than new carpeting etc and bedding, and a cosmetic do-over in the bath. Some floors are completely upgraded. I am a Starwood member and have been given all types, it works to ask if your room is updated - and they usually accomodate if space allows. Just this last weekend I was in a queen room on the 12th floor, about average size in NYC for a queen room - and it had a upgraded bed, it was clean, but certainly had dated furniture (all perfectly functional). Some towels were a bit on the thin side where others were thick and fluffy. Bath was updated - but as expected workmanship on these massive renovations can be average at best if you expect all the tiles to line up perfectly, and the grout to be perfect. Bath was very clean and shower pressure and shower head were excellent. Amenities were fine ( I like the mint & tangerine products). I have been lucky(?) I guess in not getting the moldy or chipped doors shown in some pics on previous reviewers - and quite honestly for the price of these rooms in NYC there is no way I'd settle for that. I'm reasonable - but some of those pics are beyond what you should ever expect from a Sheraton - so don't. There are millions of rooms in this city and this mid-town location gets it's price - even for preferred members on special member discount offerings. If all else fails - head one block down to the massive Hilton on 6th; it's never booked to capacity and I've never, ever seen rooms that looked like that there - and the pricing is comparible even less so, on rack rate even. Of the numerous times I have stayed at this Sheraton, the accomodations have been clean and respectable - even sometimes, - very nice (for a newer updated king room). Felt for the location and price it was as usual in NYC. You can also check out the usually lower (a bit) price and smaller Sheraton Manhattan next door which is still undergoing updating - that's another option - pretty much the same quality. Eat out - don't go to the hotel restaurants (if you do expect nothing better than less than average at best), especially in this area there are 24 hour choices that abound within walking distance in all directions. Few added info: Self checkin-check out avaiable Good workout facility, more machines than the average Luggage storage is up to $3.50/per bag Parking garage next to hotel and has direct entrance to hotel Not all rooms have new widescreen TV's (if that's important) Safe in room (not big enough for laptops) If you don't do the subway (it's fine, really...) taxi's in this area abound out front. P.S. The staff here seem perfectly fine - remember this is NYC and support staff aren't always tourist ambassadors, some are more welcoming or attentive than others. Believe me, a smile works in this city, and most locals or those of us who know the city usually will always help you out.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: KitKat2006
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel last month. The location can't be beat and I found the staff to be very nice and accommodating. The only exception to an otherwise perfect stay was the restaurant/bar Hudson's. It could use a little updating and needs to offer some heathier menu options. We stayed in the Tower section and it was definitely worth the price difference. They offered a complimentary breakfast every morning that was very good. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous”
Reviews.Author: pineappleeurope
Reviews.Content: This is a 'grand central station' hotel full of Spring Break students and other noicy tourist on a budget. A tourist hotel so if you are used to a little class and good service please stay at another hotel when in NYC. The rooms are minute and there is no minibar. Service is below standard and there is no valet parking - WHAT NO VALET PARKING IN NYC!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away! Hotel Is Bad! Rats!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: stein2012
Reviews.Content: this is one of the worst hotels i have ever seen. Beds were like a board. Lobby looks nice until you see a RAT. it was the first thing i saw when i was waiting for the elavator. check in was easy except that the room keys only worked one day then you had to get a new one. also rooms where small and out of date. shower head was prehistoric.

Reviews.Title: “Don't know where the negative reviewers are staying.”
Reviews.Author: chickzilla
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the hotel WELL before check-in and even though I have never had another hotel charge me to check my bags... in such a tourist area where anyone could be using the service, I can understand. When it was time to check in they had granted our request of the highest room possible and we went to our 30th floor room. The room was spacious for a New York hotel room, considering there was about a two-foot space at the end of the bed before the wall, a foyer area to get to the bathroom, and space on either sid eof the bed to walk and to have a bench on one and a desk on the other side. The bed was a usual high quality Sheraton bed, the bathroom was clean and the shower (while not very wide) definitely had a high enough showerhead. We didn't require maid service as we prefer to just dirty up a room, reuse the towels once and get out without having to "clean up" for house keeping. We did not eat in the hotel, but the common areas, bar and restaurant also looked fairly pristine and lavish. This was your average Sheraton hotel rooms and hallways, with much nicer lobby and other public areas to match the part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Choice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TerriFlorida
Reviews.Content: We had 2 rooms at Sheraton Hotel and Toweres - NYC this month. We paid $388 a night for each room. Found the hotel a poor value for the price. Rooms very small and dreary, several things broken, lights didn't work, no way to control Air Conditioner.. We had requested adjoining rooms or at least rooms close to each other.We were in seperate rooms 5 floors apart each room using a different elevator bank, which meant we had to go to the lobby each time and transfer to different elevators. The rooms were booked and paid for in Febuary. The real 'kicker' came when we had to store our luggage for a few hours before our flight and we were charged $ 3.25 for every article stored. We had several shopping bags and were charged for them also. So the price to retreive the bags was $38. I would definitely never stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Filthy, Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Jane104
Reviews.Content: After travelling over 6000 miles for our first trip to New York & to celebrate my 50th birthday, we did not expect to stay in the tattiest, dirty hotel we have ever stayed in. Receptionist on arrival was sullen & moody. This hotel looks great from the outside & very impressive in the huge lobby, but believe us, what lies behind the bedroom door is not pleasant. We were greeted with unemptied bins, dirty towels, broken hair dryer, torn valance, no tv remote & a safe that did not lock & so we had to carry everything around with us for 4 days! Hotel said we could leave valuables in the lobby safe ~ 30 floors down ~ I do not think so! Only saving grace was that we did not spent much time in the room, too busy sight seeing & shopping! And at least the beds were comfortable. To add insult to injury, we were charged $18 for less than a 2 min call to a friend in New Jersey (15 miles away)!!! Loved New York & would return, but definitely NOT to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK --- but thats it”
Reviews.Author: dwe
Reviews.Content: Good location ... but there are a lot of hotels in the area. Its functional at best. Check in can be a nightmare if you hit the crowds. Also, baggage check can take forever. Rooms are ok ... lots of things were broken, but they were promptly taken care of. Don't expect a warm and helpful staff .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: rock1
Reviews.Content: I went with my teenage son for a 1 night stay to see a college in the area. We arrived Saturday and left Sunday. This was a perfect hotel for us. We saw Spamalot at the Shubert and easily walked back to the hotel. The room was clean, check in was very fast, no elevator lines for the very fast elevators, free access to print boarding passes in the lobby, again, no line! The beds were very comfortable, and the location can't be beat. I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “wow!”
Reviews.Author: tregwood
Reviews.Content: We arrived in New York and were blown away by the sights! The hotel itself is well situated for times square ( just a 2 min walk down 7th Ave) We were greated by a busy lobby but staff were quickly on hand and a smooth booking in was over in a flash. Our room was up on 12 th floor and from our room we could see down part of 7th Ave. The room was clean and well looked after, although it could have done with a little extra attention. We ate out for most meals, you really are that close to good restaurants! there is a fantastic chinese across the road and up towards central park. Service in the hotels restaurant was spot on, the staff couldnt do enough to help you.

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: Philch1
Reviews.Content: I tried using the self-service check-in machines in the lobby, but they were so slow it would have been quicker to wait in line for reception. The room was a good size and the beds were comfortable. Generally, the room was clean but one thing I did notice was a thick layer of dust on the wooden blinds by the window. The bathroom was small, but not enough to cause a problem. We had a good view from the room and the lifts were very quick. The lobby area was very busy, but on my floor it was quiet. Wireless internet is very expensive, however I picked up several unsecured networks from my room. Room service charge you a delivery charge and an automatic tip is also added - this makes even a light snack very expensive. There are plenty of eating places near the hotel which are cheaper. Location is great for tourists - easy walking distance to Times Square, Empire State building and Rockefeller. Also, right next to a subway (underground) station. One thing to beware of though - they charge you $3.25 per bag if you want to store luggage for a few hours once you have checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Small but Clean Rooms, Croded Lobby”
Reviews.Author: mahme
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival on a Saturday (around 1pm), the lobby was crowded with travellers (mostly large families) unpacking and repacking their luggage. This was mostly due to people arriving before check-in time and their rooms not being available yet. Apparently, the hotel is often full so be prepared to leave you luggage at the cloak-room if you plan on arriving early. The staff was friendly (as friendly as one could expect from people having to deal with several guests at a time). The room was clean and very comfortable. Albeit, my standard room was small, but my plans did not include walking around the anyways. The standard room came with all amenities one would expect: large TV, comfortable bedding, desk+working chair. The bathroom was clean as well. Overall, I got what I expected. This was a much MORE pleasant stay than the one time I had stayed at the Sheraton Manhattan Times Square (one block away - to be avoided at all cost).

Reviews.Title: “Okey Stay at the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: wallyQ
Reviews.Content: - Small sized rooms, but comfortable - Interiors are okey, can use a renovation - Lobby is very busy, lots of people everytime - Nice Bathroom, bright and comfortable - Bed okey, but can be cleaner - Hotel seems to need cleaning and upgrade - Poor sound proofing, you can hear people walk by your room - Nice location, minutes away from Times Square Had an Okey stay at the Sheraton, but I enjoyed the Loews Regency hotel much better. This is an okey place to stay in Times Square, but its just over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: aussie21Rockhampton
Reviews.Content: Ok so it's not the Waldorf but for the location and the price you can't go wrong with this hotel. This was my first visit to New York so I spent most of my time out exploring the city, but it was nice to come back to a large comfy bed and warm room. We were on the 23rd floor so we had a great view and it was always very easy to get a taxi from out the front of the Sheraton. I found the room quite spacious, even when filled with all our ski gear and the shower pressure was good. Watch out if calling international on the hotel phones though, no prices are listed and it was very expensive as we found out when we got our bill. There are lots of deli's and cafes nearby for breakfast and lunch and you're close enough to Times Square and Broadway but also within walking distance of Central Park and Fifth Ave. Great Place for tourists who want somewhere clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “acceptable”
Reviews.Author: hoyagator
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Sheraton on a Monday night when I had to go to NYC for a medical appointment. Starwood offered a decent rate considering the cost of most hotels in NYC. I drove myself to the hotel in a rental car, and I would not attempt this feat again. While driving in Manhattan was fairly easy, once I arrived at the hotel things took a turn for the worse. I sat in my car for an eternity waiting for a bellman. When one finally appeared, he told me I would have to park myself in the hotel garage located off one of the side streets. Both garages were completely full, with cars parked out to the side walk. The bellman then told me I would have to park at a public garage across the street. The cost of that parking was 51 dollars, while hotel parking would have been considerably less. Once inside, I found the hotel to be quite busy. Despite the fact that the lobby was buzzing with people, the check in was accomplished quickly. The ease of check in helped to balance out my frustration at the lack of Valet service or any kind of parking. The room was standard Sheraton fare built with the business traveller in mind. The decor was pleasant enough and beds were comfortable, but there were numerous carpet stains and scuffs on the walls. The bathroom had a nice marble vanity and lacked any visible molds or mildew. However, the bathroom and tub were small and the tub lacked a stopper to fill it. I ordered room service and found the service was quick and of good quality. Overall, if I can put my valet experience behind me, I might consider staying here again because of the decent rate.

Reviews.Title: “Thin Wall, lobby a zoo!”
Reviews.Author: dhartogs
Reviews.Content: Overall the room was very nice and the view was great, but other than that I had some problems with this place and if I had a choice, wouldn't stay there again. The public spaces were like a zoo, way too many people, though the staff kept the check in line orderly. The walls were paper thin, our neighbors got in late, and while not screaming, when they were talking at normal levels, they were crystal clear. We checked in our room at 4:30PM, in the hallway there were dirty room service trays. When we checked out at 9:00am the next day they were still there. Nasty!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, superb location, but don't go in Winter!”
Reviews.Author: Abbye
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to New York for 5 nights on Valentine's Day 2007 and were greeted with tonnes of snow and absolutely bitter cold air! But as soon as we arrived at the Sheraton, we felt all cosy and looked after! The entrance or 'lobby' is really amazing - you feel like royalty as you step in, I don't know if I just haven't stayed in many hotels so don't know what to expect, but it really was impressive. When we checked in, we requested a room that was high up so we could have a good view of New York, and no problem, this was granted. Our room was absolutely fantastic, with a great big window overlooking Times Square : ) It really was amazing to look out and to open the window and hear the sound of New York city, then close it and have complete silence. We had a great big bed and it was the comfiest bed we have ever slept in, we had to force ourselves to get out of it! There was also a lovely bathroom, a desk with tea, etc, (and Sheraton pens and notepads!) and lots of space. The maid service was brilliant and we had New York papers left outside our door every morning free of charge. Unfortunately, we really chose the wrong time to go to New York, as it was absolutely freezing, and there is honestly no way I can communicate to you how cold it was - I was crying one day because it was so painful! Everyone had warned us but you think 'yeah, yeah, it's only a bit of cold' but seriously it was excrutiatingly cold! New York is absolutely amazing, it really is - there's so much to see and do, and Times Square is alive all the time, but I would recommend to anyone that is visiting to go at a warmer time of year, when you can really take it all in and not have to keep running inside away from the cold! On a plus note to the weather, the cold really made us appreciate the hotel. When we went back after a long day in the snow, nothing felt better than entering the warm reception area and retiring to our room and the comfy bed.
