Although TImes Square is noisy, you cannot hear it at all with the window shut, so nothing kept us from sleeping soundly in our queen size bed : ) What makes this hotel so brilliant is the location - you are right slap bang in the middle of the action, you can never get bored in Times Square, and everything you want to see is just a walk or bus ride away. It is truly fantastic. Also, this hotel has a real sense of luxury, there's nothing cheap and nasty, just pure bliss. Well I think you can clearly see that I adored this hotel, so what were the bad points? Well there's often a queue for one of the many lifts (or should I say 'elevators')... but really you can't moan about that, just go up the stairs or wait 2 minutes for it to come! I can't fault this hotel at all. I have never been to America before so I didn't know what to expect, and I am never usually the sort to go back to places because I like to try new places and hotels - but if I were to go back to New York (which I most certainly plan to - I fell in love with the city, but my boyfriend says we can't go back for a few years else we won't appreciate it!) I would definitely stay in the Sheraton Hotel and Towers. I would recommend it to anyone. Also, if you have not been to New York, you will find the people charming - really polite : )

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: bethel66
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to get away for a night for our anniversary. I paid 257 for this room through hotels.com and boy what a mistake. The room was very small, the carpet was stained horribly and was just plain filthy. The bathroom was not the cleanest either, I wouldn't go near the shower. The hallways were extremely dark and dingy. I was very upset that we spent that much money and had this kind of room. The parking situation was a disaster as well. There was a line outside the sheraton parking for over 45 minutes, we wound up parking at the hilton and paid so much more money. The lobby was insanely packed. The only good thing is that the hotel was centrally located. Personally, I think you could do much better for the money in NYC. I am so glad we only had to stay one night.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Average NYC hotel”
Reviews.Author: kellyonthego905
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Sheraton NY Hotel on 7th Ave in NYC and the hotel is average. Not fabulous, not excellent. We chose this hotel for the location and because the place we normally stay across the street from it has raised their prices and offers only a slightly better room. The hotel location is great because we could walk to Central Park, 5th Avenue for shopping, Rockefeller Center, Times Square and the Theatre District. Check-in was fast and friendly. The valet parking experience was a little scary because they were totally overwhelmed and we had to leave our car sitting in the driveway leading up to the main area. At check- out, it took a half hour for our car to be brought around and I heard others in the valet waiting area complaining about waiting 35 or 40 minutes. Our room was OK. The bed and pillows were comfortable. There was an uncovered electrical socket and someone travelling with a child would probably want to call the front desk, but we weren't concerned. The room was plain, and the carpets need a good cleaning. The desk area was nice and if we were traveling on business we would appreciate it. The toilet made some crazy noises after it was flushed, kind of loud, but eventually calmed down after giggling the handle a bit. The public hallways also need a good vacuuming. I saw the vacuums being used by housekeeping and they looked very old and suitable for a household, not a busy hotel. The hotel has a bar called The Library and we stopped in after a show for a drink and the bartender was just plain rude. We were at a small table and no one came over to wait on us so we went to the bar with our request and he refused to help us and told us to wait for our server at our table. He was quite rude in his tone and demeanor. Overall, for the price, it was a decent place to stay. The location makes it worth putting up with a couple of the quirky things I mentioned.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: MSydney07
Reviews.Content: My check in experience was good as I arrived at 11pm. However the next day a huge tour party checked in and people were queued down the lobby. The room on the 15th floor had very tired decor but everything was clean and tidy. The air conditioning unit looks like it has been there since the hotel was first built and it wasn't working. I called down the next morning and the Sheraton had sorted it out by the time I came back to the room, along with a follow up courtesy call. The corridor noise comes right through the door and at 2am I really didn't appreciate some extra loud hotel patrons screaming down to their friends. The lifts can take awhile on the lower floors. My colleagues on the floors above 30th had a better experience in terms of corridor noise and lift frequency. We usually had breakfast across the road in a little Italian deli which was efficient and friendly. We also ate in the following local places: Topaz Thai - 56th Street. Very small and intimate. Good service. Very busy. Russian Tea Rooms - pricey. We ordered tea and an excellent dessert. Friendly service. Stange ambience. Trattoria Dell'arte - 7th Ave and 57th St. The pizzas are great. However service is a little sloppy. They seem a little thin on the ground with staff. Hilton/Etrusca - 53rd Street. This was actually OK considering we got caught in a torrential downpour as we left the Sheraton on the way to another restaurant so ended up running into Etrusca. They were accomodating and sorted out some nice wine and food for us. This is a great location if you want to do touristy stuff as you are only 10 blocks from Times Square and 8 or so blocks from Central Park. In terms of business trips the 'executive lounge' is closed at the weekends which was difficult . I was there on a business trip with a group so had to decamp to each other's hotel rooms at the weekend to have work discussions. All in all not a terrible stay as New York is always great to visit whether it is for work or pleasure. And you don't spend a lot of time in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: jcairney
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews on this hotel i was a bit nervous on my arrival. We had a smooth check in within 5 minutes and they even upgraded us, we didnt get our luggage at JFK so left a message with the bellboys and they said they would contact us if and when it arrived. When you walk out of this hotel and look down to your left is times square, 2 seconds walk and your right in the heart of it and all broadway shows. Bus tour buses leave and drop you off directly oppostie this hotel. Central park and 5th avenue are about a 5 min walk. The rooms we fine 2 double beds which were comfy and a reasonable sized bathroom, for all the time you spend in your room i thought this hotel was great, we werent looking for anything fancy just somewhere to sleep and get washed and changed so this hotel was perfect for us. Cant wait to return, you'll love the big apple.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth 189 USD per nigth”
Reviews.Author: skrosvik
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for one nigth in February and two nights in March 2008. Booked through Starwood, which gave me a special rate of USD 189 per night. Centrally located hotel, but in need of total renovation. I find the Sheraton portfolio highly mixed regarding standards, and this would be rated as one of the low ends. Room were very comfortable however. Staff not very interested in helping you, only standing around looking at the guests. No minibar in the room. The hotel is better than some of the reviews here, and I would not hesitate to book it again if I got the same, low rate:)

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at Best”
Reviews.Author: geri_gal
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on Priceline for $185 on a Saturday night. While we checked in, the lobby was a zoo with a long line to the counter. Automated kiosks helped us check in earlier and an attendant was present to assist. Because I booked on Priceline, our room was downgraded to a single Queen sized bed due to room demand. :( (First time that this has happened when using Priceline but this was understandable in the Times Square area of NYC.) The lobby looked posh, but the halls/rooms of our mid-level floor were shabby and small. The air conditioner/heater in our room was rather old and didn't seem to work. The room was clean, overall, with no minibar or $5 bottles of water sitting on the desk (a positive point). We weren't in the city to spend time in a hotel room, so size/amenities didn't matter. We had expected a bit more for a "4 star" hotel, though. Very glad to not have paid full room price.

Reviews.Title: “Serviceable but a bit shabby”
Reviews.Author: CatViccer
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is OK if you don't look too carefully at the details. We paid around $200 for a Saturday night stay, which is a nice price for NYC. However, we arrived at 1:30, waited at check-in for about 20 minutes to find rooms weren't available until after 3pm. Lobby was a zoo with groups of kids, completely overflowing and chaotic, folks sitting on floor, etc. Checked our bags, changed and went for run in Central Park. On return, we got room 3324 - hallways are a disaster - shabby, worn rugs, scratched, stained walls, very narrow hallways filled with bags of garbage and room service trays. Room was OK though. Bed was newer and comfortable, desk was nice, room small but serviceable. Bathroom small, but still usable. Nice Bliss amenities. Old hairdryers - may want to bring your own - ours didn't work and had to call Guest Svcs 3 times to get a new one - arrived in about 30 minutes. Generally clean, but carpet was dingy. Very noisy hallway noise. Also, on return that night, our key didn't work and had to get a new one which is kinda of a hassle. For the price it was OK, but I'll stay elsewhere on my next stay unless this is all I can find for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Gloucestercouple
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights prior to our Q.M.2 Cruise, this was our first trip to America so somewhat unsure of how it would be. The Hotel was welcoming, our room was ready ,at about 1300 hours and everything went very smoothly. Our room 1405 we found to be comfortable, clean, quiet and of a good size. The bathroom was clean, lots of Towels and worked well all in all everything you could want of a City centre Hotel. Staff were friendly and helpful and well what a position, walked to Times Square, Central Park, a Broadway Show etc all very easily and quickly. All in all as stated a great location at a value for money price. Did not eat in the Hotel but did have drinks and again a very pleasant experience. We would use this Hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: missyfoo2127
Reviews.Content: After my boyfriend booked this hotel for our 4 year anniversary, (he let me know only a week and a half before we left) I was so nervous about this hotel after reading so many bad reviews on this website. I am happy to say that we had a fantastic stay! We were given a room on the 49th floor with a beautiful view of Times Square. We are SPG Gold members so I know this was an upgrade. Our room was spotless--bathroom as well. Nice king size bed. Hotel lobby was great--nice bar area. Since our room was considered club level we had a daily complimentary breakfast between 8am & 11am on the 44th floor which was great (bagels, pastries, coffee, juices, fruits etc.) and at night there were complimentary snacks & desserts (potstickers, dumplings, cakes, cookies etc) The club room was very nice with oversized chairs, a bar area and many tables with a view of the city. The staff was very nice and extremely helpful with our requests. We even got a bottle of red wine and some bon bons in our room upon arrival. Honestly, we are so picky about hotels--I can't find anything negative to say about this one. It was great and the location was fabulous! Don't listen to those negative reviews--stay! It is well worth it. We used our Starwood points for this so I don't know what the room rate is for a club level room is. I don't know if all floors are as nice as the 49th --- when my boyfriend booked he asked for a high floor and an updated room. I can't complain!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend the Sheraton New York Hotel & Towers”
Reviews.Author: joolybee
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a very enjoyable second stay at this hotel. It is a great place. The location is superb. Room perfectly adequate in size, very clean bathroom. Didn't eat in the restaurants but used the Starbucks frequently (although there is an great deli just across the street). The hotel staff were extremly helpful, courteous and friendly. The Concierge is a fountain of all knowledge as are the staff at the "tickets and tours" desk and the Doormen were amazing especially on one very very wet friday night - how they organised all those taxi etc is beyond me! I flew from the UK and landed at JFK and used the Airtrain to Jamaica Station, then took the E subway to 7th Avenue, 53rd Street and you pop right up outside the hotel. It cost just $7 and takes about 1 hour. All in all ignore negative reviews this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, disappointing service”
Reviews.Author: hanbo21
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the venue for our international company conference and was in a fantastic location, walking distance from Times Square. I have to say the hotel beds are the comfiest I have ever stayed in but the bathroom was a little grubby and could do with a facelift. We got a room on the inside so didnt have a great view, only of the opposite tower block. This was my first trip to New York and was expecting great service however it may have something to do with us wearing our delegate badges inside the hotel which made it clear to the staff we were part of the conference but the service was really bad and on many occasions the staff were very rude. If we had been independent travellers this may have been different but even asking directions and information about where our meetings etc were taking place within the hotel we were met with one word answers snapped at us. Overall, a little disappointing, if I was paying myself, I dont think I would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “It's Okay”
Reviews.Author: lolola8604
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed at a Sheraton property until I went to NYC. It is listed as a three and half star on its hotel website. The hotel is okay. It is small, which is to be expected by New York Standards. There is very little room to move around the hotel room if you have a double room. The bathroom is average. No frills. There is a gym and and several restaraunt and bars in the lobby. The lobby is nicely appointed and the staff was relatively friendly. Directly above the E subway line and is in Times Square. So all in all the hotel is relatively good.

Reviews.Title: “staff good, room not up to par”
Reviews.Author: lien157
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights for a conference. Positives: Great location, good view from my window. Elevators fast and quiet. Hotel staff courteous and helpful. Room basically clean. Good attention to security. Can open windows in room. Negatives: Given a handicapped room with an enormous old bathroom and small living space. No counter space in bathroom, no bureau/drawers, heater knobs broken so heater had to be off or full blast, would not shut off by itself, poor quality TV, very few channels. Wallpaper in bathroom needs replacing. No chair in the room besides the desk chair, just a bench. $15/day fee for Internet in room. Bed larger than platform it sits on, mattress sags over edge. Dark, dreary hallways. $3 fee for checking bags. North exit door out of service for two days, had to exit through garage. Fitness Center, extra $10 day or $20 for stay. I did not ask to have room changed. I knew the hotel was sold out and I wasn't planning to spend much time in the room anyway. Not traveling on my dime, but even so this was not a $300/night room in any way shape or form. Would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: bjca
Reviews.Content: Having read the mixed reviews didn't know what to expect but we were pleasantly surprised. Myself, husband and son went over for my birthday and it was a great hotel with staff being nothing but helpful. The waiting on staff were great in both the bar area and at breakfast and nothing was too much trouble. Our room was quite large (by NYC standards) and very clean. The location was perfect - I would say half way between Times Square and Central Park! We have stayed in numerous hotels around the world and although it does cater for business, this was not felt in any public areas. I would like to add that during our visit, they experienced one of the worst snow storms in history and think of the New York Library in the Day After Tomorrow and that is the picture that will stay with us forever - the best way round was on skis.

Reviews.Title: “Well worn hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hawaiiantraveler66
Reviews.Content: Nice lobby, great staff, very friendly but you can tell this hotel has been used a lot. It is like that sweatshirt you got for christmas last year and wore it every day for three months straight and washed and dried it every day. Still the current style but washed out. Good beds but not the Sheraton Sweet Sleepers. Don't get me wrong, it is a nice hotel but if you are expecting the Ritz Carlton or the Westin.... think again. This appears to be a good business class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Convention Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TPXB
Reviews.Content: At the risk of repeating “Megatraveler’s" review, the bottom line is that this is a good hotel in a great location that could use some updating. The common areas were great and the staff was very helpful, the check in was very quick and efficient. The elevators were quick and never had a long wait. The rooms were clean and were just a little worn around the edges. The heating and ventilation unit really needs to be changed and I also liked being able to open the window. My wife and I are in NYC about every other month and it is the first time we stayed at this hotel, we usually stay on Lexington Avenue, but this location was excellent for going to the shows and to Lincoln Center. I wouldn’t pay the $369 that is being advertised now, but for the $189 I paid it was an excellent value. I would particularly recommend this hotel to first time visitors to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MEGATRAVELER
Reviews.Content: Bottom line - it's a large convention hotel with fairly small rooms which could probably use a make over. That said, the beds were very comfortable, housekeeping was great, the windows open (a big plus in my book) and despite being on a high floor, never had to wait long for an elevator. Good exercise facility and very helpful front desk staff. Didn't use the restaurants. I'd stay here again if I got a good rate - but it's on the lower end of the 4 star spectrum and probably should be switched to the higher end of the 3 star world for accuracy. But a fantastic location for getting around Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Location & Service Tops”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler2350
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend 40th anniversary trip to New York City and can't wait to go back again. I picked the Sheraton NY because of the location and it proved to be even better than I was hoping it would be. We took in a Broadway show and it was within easy walking distance. Restuarants were abundant, Times Square, 5th Avenue and Central Park were within easy walking distance. If you don't care to take a tour, the subway is near by and easy to get around on. Hotel check-in was easy and the staff friendly. We asked advice from the concierge on several occasions and their recommendations were always good, if not excellent. They were always friendly and helpful. The hotel was fine, although the room itself had nothing distinguishing to rave about. It was small and pretty clean, except for some corners and the TV reception was horrible. We were on the 6th floor, with a view of the top of some air conditioning units, but we weren't in there enough for this to be a big detrement. Overall, I would say this hotel is one definitely to be considered. Things to see: Breakfast at the Stardust Diner - 1650 Broadway. Wait-staff consisting of aspiring Broadway singers - good food, great entertainment. Also a must see is Tavern on the Green in Central Park. Great food, beautiful surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Gem”
Reviews.Author: Dublingirl18
Reviews.Content: From Dublin, Ireland: 9th Feb 2008 We have just returned from a 6 day trip to NYC, our stay in the Sheraton Hotel & Towers was fantastic, upon arrival our first impression of the Hotel was fantastic, it has a very impressive Lobby, huge in fact, great bar, restaurant and boutiques. Check -in was great, no delays, staff were very formal, I would have liked a more friendly/easy going welcome but thats just me. We requested a higher floor at the time of booking and we were not dissappointed, the view from our 41st floor lovely room was incredible. The room was spacious enough, clean and warm. The little touches like bottled water and a newspaper delivered each day was nice. We didnt eat in the hotel restaurant as it was a bit pricey but we found we were out most of the day anyway. The location of the Hotel was second to none, right in the heart of midtown a stones throw from Times Square, Central Park, 5th Ave shops, Radio City, I couldnt have booked a better hotel, I will most certainly be staying at this hotel when I return to this beautiful city again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: brooklyndiner
Reviews.Content: The location was fantastic, the staff extremely helpful, although the room could have done with decorating and the blinds needed attention, very clean and comfortable bed, would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “mixed”
Reviews.Author: racb
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for one night. Great location and I was impressed with the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. What surprised me was the quality of the room. Small, comfortable and clean, but lots of scuff marks on the furniture--and this in an upgraded club level room. Bottom line. a perfectly okay hotel in a great location...but be careful not to overpay.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ITREATBACKPAIN
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked our NYC stay through Priceline and were a bit disappointed by the Sheraton win after having read some of the reviews here on TripAdvisor and observing the miserable ranking it receives. We proceeded with some trepidation, but were actually pleasantly surprised by the hotel in general. There is certainly nothing spectacular about this property, but we found the service to be sufficient, the location wonderful, the amenities fair, and the romm itself average. I was displeased with the bathroom in our room. It suited a 2.5 or 3 star hotel, not a 4 star hotel room. The windows in our room we very dirty upon check-in and the nect morning on our way out of the hotel we asked the staff to clean it. When we returned several hours later, it had in fact been celaned well and was spotless. The conierge was generally pleasant and knowledgeable as was the front desk staff. One thing we liked very much about this hotel is that each room has a good view of the city, whereas other hotels we've stayed at, like thw Grand Hyatt, most rooms overlook nothing at all. This was indeed refreshing. The T.V. in our room was a bit small and was not an LCD monitor, but rather the "old fashioned" kind that weigh like 100 pounds and are close to 2 feet deep. Overall a pleasant experience. I would stay here again at the right price.

Reviews.Title: “A poor relation Sheraton.”
Reviews.Author: scrapyardnow
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel purely on the fact that we had stayed in Sheraton Hotels before and that they had been fantastic. This hotel is obviously the missing link as it was a bit on the tatty side! It really does put a blot on the Sheraton name. Okay, its got a fantastic location, the staff are soooo polite, but unfortunatley its scruffy, dirty and im need of a serious revamp, it was like taking a time machine to the 1980s! The lobby bar gets packed and is like a train station, the sports bar is dark, damp and grotty. The rooms are dark and very dirty, you can write your name in the dust, not very nice at all and as for the stains on the bedding..........yuk! this hotel could be fantastic, but obviously its been allowed to go to the dogs, a shame really.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, will recommend it to friends”
Reviews.Author: SouthAfricaCharley
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fantastic location-- you can easily walk to MoMa, Rockefeller Center, Times Square, Central Park. Subway stop literally touching the hotel. Friendly and helpful staff, concierge, and the lobby is clean and quite large. Lots of delis and little restaurants all around the hotel. Check out the cheese cake across the street at Stage Deli. Walk one block to the right of the hotel and try the heaping portions of famous deli food at Carnegie Deli. The train that borders the hotel can take you anywhere you want to go, and it's FAST. Don't waste money on cabs-- they just get stuck in traffic and you end up overpaying. The hotel itself: We stayed on the 23rd floor, and our room had everything we needed. Big bed, new furniture, and it was clean. Now, this is NYC, so the room is on the smaller side, but then again-- this is NYC-- you'll spend minimal time in your room anyway. If you are coming to NYC for a sprawling hotel room, turn around and go home. The room was prefectly sized for the two of us, so no complaints. It has everything you need-- closet, clean bathroom, great views! To top it all off, they let us check in early. They also have a bag check where you can drop off your luggage when you check out if you still want to do some sight-seeing. And really, the concerige answers any questions with a smile, even my "What time does Magnolia Bakery close today?" So... enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Great view!”
Reviews.Author: Gondolier
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to NY and what a great choice of hotel. We arrived early and requested the highest room possible and we weren't dissapointed. Great view down 7th Avenue towards Times Square. Our room was comfortable and spacious with tasteful decor. How windy were the lifts! Can't comment on tha food or any other facilitys as we spent most of our time in this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “There are better choices”
Reviews.Author: Merion
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference on January 30. The good part about the hotel is that the staff is efficient and friendly. Everyone I dealt with, from the front desk to the room service server, seemed well-trained. The food, while not great, was perfectly fine. My real problem with this hotel is that the room in which I stayed was small, dark, depressing, old and musty. If all the rooms are like this, then the hotel really needs a renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Everything is 4-star except the 3-star room and view”
Reviews.Author: AHKTraveler
Reviews.Content: I got a fairly good price staying at Sheraton NY, considering it was in late Jan 2008, so rooms were not fully booked I guess. For other travelers. Upside: Really great location, around the corner is the subway station and it is not noisy on the 7th Av comparing to the walking distance of other hotels at Times Square so that you can have a much better sleep at night. If you're time lacking in NY and want to sight see a lot of places, Sheraton NY is a great choice (based on just location-wise rather than rooms/ view). I was glad in last minute I chose Sheraton but not Millennium basically because of the location. Millennium is great but you have to walk a few blocks from subway if you're not planning to take a cab. Beautiful lobby and great staff at the reception. Helen and Ahmed I met there were very professional and helpful, warm and very polite. They tried to accommodate my need as much as possible and Helen provided me immediate check-in when I reached the hotel that day just before noon. If you don't want to pay for your internet access in your room, go down to the lobby and it has free WiFi there available. View is not great but just okay (at least there is a city view, I wonder if there is any below 25th floor). Staying at 3408 I can only see the top of radiocity music hall but I can't see rockefeller centre or other landmarks. Downside: Room is NOT impressive at all when Sheraton should be considered somehow as a 4-star hotel. Those really simple decorations and furnitures reveal their time. They shouldn't use dark brown furnitures which give an impression of being outdated. Don't expect large room (I think it's general in NY) and it's indeed a bit squeeze for 2 persons in the room. Toilet is small as well. No free internet access in your room. No fridge and slipper available in your room. Probably one of the very few 4-star hotels that don't accommodate with these basic things. Sheraton hotels in Asia are much better. TV is kinda horrible. Looks like 80s and screen quality is bad with 'snow flakes'. Anyway as I don't come to NY to watch TV so that didn't bother me much. In general it's a good place to stay (just slightly less than US$200 per night including tax). I definitely don't mind staying there again (especially seeing the nice and helpful staff) but if there are better rooms/ view at similar price I might try out the others as well.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: mikerealst
Reviews.Content: After reviewing several ratings - after booking through Priceline - I was surprised at my feelings toward the hotel. It is not a 4 or 5 Star hotel as Priceline has it rated. I would rate it 3 Star. Our complaints were that the room we were put in had only one chair. The room and bath room were clean. The room had work space and the beds were very comfortable. On the minus side other than just the one desk chair, the TV could be updated, the corridor was very dirty when we arrived on Friday and wasn't cleaned until Saturday AM when I saw someone sweeping it with a broom and dust pan. Where are the vacuums?? The corridor walls(26) showed blemishes and markings which could only have come from the service carts. That's a real shame as it leads to a poor first impression. The service staff on the floor was also pretty noisy. On the whole we enjoyed our stay. The location was terrific for what we were doing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: MaximusMom
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews here, I was pleasantly surprised by the Sheraton New York towers. You really can't beat this hotel in terms of location. Every staff member I encountered was friendly and helpful. My room was nice and appeared to be updated recently. It was very clean, but the sheets had a few tears. The hallways are a little worse for the wear, but really--I don't care what the hallway looks like, as long as my room is okay. Exercise facilities were very good, as was the 24 hour room service. Love the toiletries from Bliss, and very much appreciated the loofa they provide! I was able to get an excellent price through priceline.com for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Save your POINTS”
Reviews.Author: ncwannabe
Reviews.Content: Wow what a disappointment! They make it look to great on the SPG website but the room was so disappointing. They told us that since we were SPG customers that they were going to upgrade us so we could go to the private club on the special floor. Come to find out the Club was closed for the weekend and had been closed for 2 days allready. What was that ??? There is nothing there to do if you take kids and it is bad weather which it was, so it made it very boring. The only nice part was when they let us check out at 4pm. Once bitten.....

Reviews.Title: “Moldy Oldy”
Reviews.Author: Brentlyfll
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a terrific location too bad the rooms are so awful. One word. MOLD. I hade mold all over in my bathroom. When I arrived Ihad to call housekeeping to come and change the duvet covers. They were disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: slick_traveller
Reviews.Content: Being our first trip to New York we decided to stay somewhere central and this hotel is in an excellent location for going out and exploring New York. The hotel is totally catered to business clientele so it means that all the staff are really efficient and all our queries were answered quickly and it allowed us to get the most out of our trip. Gym was really good as well and it was only $20 for our entire trip (There is a Sheraton across the street which gives you complimentary access to their pool too) Never used the f&b outlets but they seemed busy and well run. Taxi rank right outside the hotel as well as a tube line so getting around was always easy. But we were only like a 10 minute walk from Times Square and 5th Avenue that there was not much need for them. Great hotel for location and wouldn't hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Towers not so bad”
Reviews.Author: BethA114
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel at the last minute (actually the day of our stay) through the Starwood website using points. My husband and I were going into the city to have dinner and see a show for my birthday, so we decided that day that we'd rather just spend the night than worry about the return train schedule. We were given a non-smoking, king room on the 37th floor, a Starwood Preferred Guests floor. The room was on the small side, which was to be expected in New York City, but clean and in relatively good repair. We found the sheets to be a bit scratchy, but the bedding was otherwise okay. The windows were obviously not very thick or soundproofed because we heard a suprising amount of noise despite our location on the 37th floor, so I would bet that the lower floors are even noisier. However, the noise wasn't so loud that we weren't able to sleep (or we were just so tired that we didn't care). I'm not sure I'd pay the $300+ that this hotel often goes for, but it was a decent value based upon the points that we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Attitude problems”
Reviews.Author: Barbados0108
Reviews.Content: There is not much to say about the hotel in general, good location in Manhattan, nice lobby, slightly run down rooms and hallways. Nevertheless, what happened to me and my partner on a recent stay there was unacceptable: we decided to make a short (9 minutes) International phone call to the UK shortly after our check-in at 3pm, then left the hotel for sightseeing. When we returned at 8pm, the phone indicated three new messages, all from the reception staff politely asking to come down to reception to pay the phone charges, either cash or by credit cards. This came quite as a suprise as we did not plan to check out until the following day. So we decided to ignore the request for the moment and to enjoy our stay in NYC. Two minutes later the phone rang and an angry receptionist shouted in the phone that we have to pay the phone charges straight away. She requested our credit card details. We enquired the balance and refused to provide any details after hearing the ridiculous amoung of US $ 111 for a 9-minute phone call to a landline in the UK. The woman on the phone was rude, claimed that we made two phone calls (we only just entered the room) and probably assumed that we suffered from disabled hearing as she nearly screamed in the phone. We couldn't believe to be treated with such disrespect as paying customers and just disembarking from a Cunard cruise with QM2. I requested to speak to her manager, who displayed not only rudeness but also arrogance and attitude problems. I told her that we only made one phone call and that the amount can not be correct. After a few minutes of discussion she suddenly claimed that we have to pay 82$. I said that this is not the correct amount and that we only made one short phone call. She waffled and talked nonsense about charges for International calls, raising her voice until she finally reduced the balance to 51US$. Nevertheless, she demanded that I went down to reception straight away to settle the room bill (it was after 8pm). I refused to do so as I am not accustomed to being treated like a criminal. We stayed in the 33rd floor. At this point I gave her a lecture on respect for hotel guests, her attitude problems and her general lack of suitable training for this job. She responded by shouting something about "I note the feedback but I am the front desk manager and you to come down now" into the phone and hung up. Five minutes later a man from the hotel phoned and stated that his front desk manager told him we refuse to pay our phone charges, a statement which was far away from the truth. We simply don't tolerate attitude problems of hotel staff and I told him that. He seemed to co-operate and agreed that we can settle our bill the next day whilst checking out. Would we stay again in this hotel? Most certainly not. Perhaps it is NYC but perhaps rudeness should not be tolerated in any location in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Lost its Luster”
Reviews.Author: ginnyb83
Reviews.Content: December 30,2007 As a Starwood preferred guest, we enjoy staying at many of the Sheraton properties and when in NYC always have enjoyed the New York Hotel & Towers. Their fitness Center is still one of the best, however we found the hotel itself to be lacking in many different ways. For the most part the staff was enthusiastic and was very prompt to fulfill our requests. Execpt for the man who checked us in and made it rather clear to me that he was extending to me a great favor. Rude & Arrogant! Upon arrival, a doorman named Marcus rushed to our car and as my driver had already popped the trunk he lifted a suitcase out and slammed it shut, put it on his dolly and started walking away leaving my driver in the street holding my husbands belongings. We called him back and the driver said we had more and he said "no...trunk is empty". We found out an hour later he was wrong and my suitcase with all my medicines was back in NJ. Was this an isolated incident? perhaps...but the inconvenience of having our driver return to the city with my things was very upsetting to me. Guest services was upset as well and said they would look into this and give me a $50 credit on our bill for our inconvenience. By the end of our stay I stopped calling guest services b/c I felt I would be deemed "a pest". We were traveling with friends and had 3 rooms in the hotel. Ours was #2720. Next to the electrical closet and various houskeeping rooms. I think my biggest complaint was that for 3 nights I had to walk past dirty dishes, rollaways and houskeeping carts to get to my room. It seems that they store things in that corridor. Our main light was out in our room upon arrival, but was fixed within 30 minutes of the bellman notifying housekeeping. There were 2 of us staying in the room and we had 3 towels, 1 washcloth and 2 smaller towels. The eletrical outlet in the bathroom did not work. The room was adequate but dowdy and had the room for but no chair to sit in other than a rickety desk chair. At least our room did not have holes in the wall as did our friends. We did not ask to be moved because our friends who did ask were given quite a runaround and ended up staying in the hotel one whole day waiting for it to happen...which it never did. The restaurants/bars closed at what we felt were early by NYC standards. We were looking forward to a nitecap and a pizza in the sports bar but it was after midnight and they said they were closed and it was last call!! We were there on Dec 27, 28, 29 which was a thurs, fri and sat night. So...we had to leave the hotel to go find food and drink someplace else. Not the relaxing end to our evening we were looking forward to. I understand that the concierge level is open only during the week for breakfast and we enjoyed a lovely breakfast friday morning, however in lieu of that, I think coupons for breakfast downstairs should be offered on the weekend. Why be a starwood preferred guest member when you are not made to feel preferred or in some cases even welcome! The wonderful feelings we have enjoyed over the years of staying here have been tarnished and I doubt I will choose this property again for a very long time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, close to Times Square”
Reviews.Author: WeeLuv2Travel2
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location. Rooms were really nice and a good size. We had to leave our baggage with the valet as we were too early to check in but we didn't have to pay for it. However, the day we checked out we had to do the same and this time were charged. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Oh kay hotel”
Reviews.Author: GlendaleCA
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here many times. It is a premier location, central to all. The lobby is a bit small for such a large hotel, maybe the biggest sheraton hotel in the chain. Generally a helpful staff. Clearly in need of renovation, but not a dirty hotel. Way too much heat in the rooms during winter months. The premier Club Room of all US Sheratons. Great views from all over at this location. When they do update this giant hotel, the prices the command will be well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; terrific views”
Reviews.Author: valdy
Reviews.Content: As stated in other reviews, the location of this hotel could hardly be bettered; it is yards from Times Square and a short walk to Central Park. It is especially convenient for MoMA and for Fifth Avenue shops. The hotel is very pleasant, but is looking rather shabby and tired in places. My room on 22nd floor was comfortable and clean, but was definitiely showing signs of wear. The bathroom was small but well equipped. Hotel staff were helpful and polite at all times. I would certainly recommend the coffee shop in the lobby for a "take-out" breakfast. All in all, a pleasant stay for the price ($154 per night) but I'd hesitate to pay more than this at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it only if you go through priceline.com”
Reviews.Author: glazen
Reviews.Content: I stay in very fine hotels, often paying 700-900 a night, but I was in a cheap mood for some reason, so I booked through Priceline. I got this hotel for $150, and I feel it is priced right. Anyone who pays more really doesn't know hotels. This place is very basic, old, cheap furnishings, can't imagine anyone being satisfied unless Ramada and Best Western is your usual taste level. There's an old Zenith tv with a ridiculous game controller instead of a real remote. The hotel rooms look like circa 1970. But mine was clean, and the service was fine. There is precious little ventilation in the room, a decrepit old heater, no a/c in operation. For the dirt cheap price, I guess it's nothing to complain about, but please don't be suckered in to paying 300-400 for this place. It is absolutely not worth it, i guarantee you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but needing some renovating”
Reviews.Author: kinnoull
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for New Year. On arrival it is a fantastic location, very central for everything. Lobby was very busy for the full duration of stay. Hallways very dull and grubby. Bedroom was basic and quite dull, but clean and tidy. Most of the staff were friendly and courteous apart from a few, which was typical of New York. If returning to New York I probably wouldn't book this hotel again, but the location is great. Banchory Scotland

Reviews.Title: “Getty Shabby”
Reviews.Author: fosco
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times because the location is excellent for Times Square, theatre district, restaurants, and an easy walk to 5th Ave. This past weekend (Jan 5) was about the 20th time we have used this hotel and I must say that it really needs some cosmetic fixup in the hallways and the rooms. It is an extremely busy place and it seems that the wear and tear due to the number of guests is overwhelming. We were on the 29th floor and the wallpaper was coming off the walls, carpeting was buckled, along with a lot of scrapes and 'bruises'. The room was ok and comfortable but the bathroom needed some upgrading. The staff is always pleasant and helpful. I think it is time that we moved on to the W or Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay!”
Reviews.Author: LouWales
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews after I booked the hotel and was worried afer reading a couple as the hotel was not rated highly. However, we arrived at the hotel late at night and was seen to straight away. There was not a queue for the reception area as was previosuly stated in the reviews. However, we did arrive at midnight. We were upgraded on arrival as it was our honeymoon which was lovely. We were upgraded to a king room from a queen room. The room was not big but we only planned to sleep there and the space was ample. The room was cleaned daily with fresh towells and bedding which was great. The bathroom was small but again, not a problem and we found it ok. The staff at thet heater desk were helpful however, there was always a queue but it was a busy time of the year. We had breakfast at the hotel on our first day which was over priced, this was the first and the last time we ate at the hotel. The staff in the bar were friendly, particularly Warren who was extremely helpful. I would definitely stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Texas17
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Shreaton New York Hotel and Towers and absolutely loved it. I had read some bad reviews about rude staff, run down hallways, filthy rooms..etc etc. We experienced none of this. Check in was a little crowded, but it was very busy and i could tell that the staff was working as quickly as possible and still being respectful to those the customers were currently waiting on. When we got to the room it was a little warm for me and the air conditioning was not in use (not permitted during winter months) I called the front desk and asked for a fan, they immediately sent an engineer down and he adjusted the thermostat to a much cooler temperature. We left, went to dinner and when we returned later that night I had a messdage from the front desk asking if the room temperature was better. Only problem I had with the Hotel was the way we were forced to enter through the side entrance on 53rd street after Midnight New Years Eve. However, given the amount of people trying to enter the hotel that didnt stay there I was fairly understanding of the situation. The location could not have been better..we walked almost everywhere..Times Square, Broadway Show, Dinners, Late Show..only had to take the Subway to lower Manhattan. This is a great Hotel and a wonderful staff. Do not let any negative reviews scare you away.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok - with potential to be great”
Reviews.Author: DACWDC
Reviews.Content: The drama free report is - Lobby - nice, busy, festive, happy, high energy. If you're looking to melt into a calm scene when you step into your hotel, this isn't the place for you. Staff - nice enough ... they try hard and do well considering how hard it must be to be in such a busy spot w/ so many different types of visitors. Food - great breakfast, the bar room needs more staff and better food. Location - awesome. Rooms - small (as most are in NYC) and in various states of repair. Our two rooms were nice but showed the signs of wear and tear. Halls - beat up like the circus comes to town through them. Overall - averages out to average.. some stuff was excellent, and some was OK but some problems...

Reviews.Title: “Lights shine bright at the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Bobte2
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Sheraton New York for a combination business and pleasure trip. My stay lasted for 3 days but made me feel like staying for another week. The Sheraton knows how to treat its guests. From the moment the cab dropped me off in front of the hotel I was met with a courteous and respectful greeting. As a seasoned traveller I can tell when a employee is going thru the motions. This was not the case at the Sheraton. The doorman set the tone for the rest of my stay. The lobby is alive but not overbearing. The reception desk personnel were prompt and courteous. They answered my questions about internet service and even offered me a special deal. You hear about the negatives but I was impressed with the staff's positive and professional attitude. They respect the business traveller and are willing to go the extra step to help the pleasure traveller. I had an opportunity to interact with the concierge. He was extremely helpful. The most important thing to me was that he listened to me. I explained the type of restauraunt I was looking for and he gave me options and to my surprise had menus available. Directions were clear and it never seemed a bother for any of the staff. The seemed ready and willing to make my stay comfortable and hassle free. The room was great. Large Flat screen TV's in bedroom, small TV in bathroom,heater & air conditioner that does its job, what more can a traveller need. Restauraunt and bar for every price range. Remember this is NYC. The Sheraton NY is situated perfectly. Easy access to Broadway, Rockefeller center, St Pats. A staff that makes you feel at home. All the perks that you would expect from a hotel that is aware of the wants and needs of their guests. Would I stay at the Sheraton NY again? I would not stay any other place. The Sheraton New York is the place to be if you plan either a business or pleasure venture to NYC. I felt safe, comfortable and most importanly respected. The Sheraton staff earned my business and will continue to get more. I love NY (especially the Sheraton NY)

Reviews.Title: “A Tale of Two Rooms”
Reviews.Author: jadePhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the holiday season, and booked two rooms for our party. The first room (with two beds) was not as impressive. The room seemed cramped, there was peeling leather on the bedside lamps, and the heating system was obviously an old fixture placed under a desk (to cover the dusty and non-working dials). The bathroom shower had a mildew/mold problem on the tile wall. The second room (one queen) appeared to be in better condition. The bathroom was cleaner and the heating system was functional. The location was great, the lobby was clean and impressive. We booked the hotel room based on a free stay and on points, so we didn't have too many complaints. However, if we had paid for our rooms (particularly the first one), we would have been more disappointed. Parking was $37 for 24 hours. We had to wait for over a half hour to actually retrieve our car (secondary to a low parking attendant/customer ratio).

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Towers Grin and Bear it”
Reviews.Author: FroggySmith
Reviews.Content: I read a variety of reviews on this site about cleanliness at this hotel. Well, I will say the rooms can stand to be refurbished. The carpet was stained even in club level room. The good news is that the staff at the front and theater desks were very friendly and helpful. The same is true of the staff in the Club Lounge. Food there was very good for both cocktail and breakfast service. The breakfast bar had something for everyone from Zone diet to high carbs. The team bustled to keep up with every changing crowds. Location is fabulous. So, bear with some peeling paint and stains for good service and a location that can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, never again”
Reviews.Author: Kristiina
Reviews.Content: Surely the location is great, but after having paid huge sums for 4 nights, the expectations were also high. The service at the front desk was terrible. The room was dirty (especially the windows), small and somewhat outworn. When leaving the hotel there were problems with the invoice (extra costs added for services we had not used) and we encountered extremely unfriendly service. There seems to be a huge gap between the promises created by the Sheraton Marketing Dpt and the reality on the spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: Papai
Reviews.Content: This was our 1st time to NYC, and I was getting nervous about this hotel after reading all of the negative reviews. Fortunately, when we arrived, I was pleasantly surprised. I was expecting the worst. The hotel itself sits in a great location, close to Times Square, Central Park, Radio City, and Rockefellar center. The lobby was very nice, in my opinion. We had a king bed, and the room was actually bigger than what was described in previous reviews. It's certainly not your typical sized hotel room, but we didn't feel cramped at all. The bathroom was small and not much room to store your toiletries, etc. There was a little dust on the wood blinds, as previously reported - I didn't think that was a big deal. We were on the 37th floor and had views of other tower buildings which was not bad. As reported, the beds at the Sheraton are very comfortable and the linens were placed on the bed correctly. The only problem we had was the heater. When it was on, it really pumped out the heat to the point where we had to just turn it off. The hotel sent someone up to fix it, but he stated he couldn't because all of the heaters run that way, even on low. The hallways, in my opinion, didn't appear dark and dingy as previously reported. There were some scuff marks on the walls, but I might not have noticed them had I not read those reviews. Overall, this is a nice hotel in an old building that requires some updating on air conditioning/heating system and the hallways. I would stay here again, but will probably check out other hotels in the same price range for comparison. We paid $250/night which is a good deal in NYC. Unsure if you can get better than that at that price.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised.”
Reviews.Author: lucida509
Reviews.Content: We booked our reservation at the Sheraton through Hotwire so we were unaware of the name of the hotel prior to being committed. Once I knew the name, I came to Traveladvisor to see the reviews. Needless to say, I was a bit apprehensive about our stay after reading the negative reviews. However, we were pleased with our room and the service received at the Sheraton. I gave our room the "white glove" check as soon as we arrived. I was prepared to find dirt, hair, mold, etc. However, the room was clean. It smelled nicely. There was no dust, no hair, no dirt. It was clean. The decor was nice. The TV is a bit outdated but you don't come to NYC to sit in your hotel room and watch TV! The check-in staff and concierge were very pleasant and helpful. The doorman plesantly and successfully got us a cab each time we left the building. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mmrMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: The staff was incredibly helpful, especially with a snowstorm headed toward the city. You can't beat the location, and the concierge and bellmen were more than helpful in helping us further plan the logistics of our trip, including what to wear to dinner at a certain restaurant and how to get there. I do agree with other reviewers that the rooms weren't perfect. The carpet was worn and stained in our room. Otherwise, it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great beds, pricey but you're paying for the location!”
Reviews.Author: Juneblossom16
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed here for 1 night while we were in New York for a girls weekend. The hotel staff were very kind and the hotel is a block away from Times Square. The rooms were average but the beds were soooooo soft - after an exhausting day we slept like babies!! My friend cashed in points to stay here but I hear the hotel rate is a little pricey - but remember, you're paying for the location so if you want a place near the hussle and bussle of Times Square, this is a great choice. If you'd prefer a more laid back location, I'd try a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: Michael210675
Reviews.Content: Stopped here for 4 nights in November 2007 during a shopping trip to New York - Big Mistake! I have stopped in European Sheratons before and was extremely disappointed with this hotel. Check in staff were extremely rude. Had requested a room on a high floor but this was not granted. Decor in corridors and the rooms were dull and aged, the room was small but adequate (apart from the fact the heating was not working so we had to change rooms) Overall, I would not recommend as I found it overpriced and desperately needing a refurb. Location good though.

Reviews.Title: “very very average!”
Reviews.Author: liz66mint
Reviews.Content: Having read negative & positive reveiws about this hotel, I still decided to go ahead & book. Whilst we were checking in, I was told by another guest that her standard room was small, dirty & pretty shaby for a 4*- she had upgraded & was told that no room was available! We were also then told in a very cold manner that they did no have the club room that we had booked either! - (a deluxe room on 44th floor) which had been paid for! After 15 mins we were then told they did have it after all!- no apologies for the wait just incredibly rude, off hand check -in staff. This was a really bad start to the holiday. Having siad that when we got to our room I was pleasantly suprised. The view of Central Park was wonderful. The room was small but modern & ours was fairly clean. The bathroom was a real shock - this was not as clean - hair on the floor - dusty glasses & no sign of any complimentary bath robe in sight! The bath was not a bath - more like a very big sink! Not the sort of thing you expect from a 4* hotel - so if you like your baths after a long day of shopping & sightseeing this is not for you. There is no atmosphere at all in this hotel - the bar's & restaurants are very expensive & the food is very average. We had a steak which cost $37.00 & although it was a good size, not at all nice! - top resturants like Tribeca Grill owned by Robert De Niro charge around $32.00 for a fillet steak & it is worth it. Great place indeed!! You are NOT an individual at this hotel you are a room number. When we checked out the check out staff on our club level where again off hand & rude. No thank you for coming or hope to see you again soon... I was fed by now & replied in the exact same tone that was given to me - I only hope she learns from it! I

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service - very - pleased with my stay.”
Reviews.Author: marg1974
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through a priceline bid of $250/night. When compared with other NYC hotels, this is an excellent price. Especially for a hotel with such an amazing location. My sister and me brought my Mom there to celebrate her birthday. Check-in was great - they gave us free slips to store our luggage since our room was not ready (it was 10am and check-in time is 3pm) - normally it costs $3.50 per bag. The front desk, concierge and phone staff were also extremely friendly and helpful, especially when they knew we were there to celebrate my Mom's bday. The lobby is lovely. The lobby bar is overpriced with poor service - I would avoid it. As previous reviews suggested, the corridors were very old and the walls showed signs of wear. The room was small, but not for NYC. There was trouble with the window shades (2 of 3) - they would open, but not lift. The radio with ipod connection would not work with the ipod and the tv was fuzzy - I calle dfthe front desk and they sent someone up to take care of these issues. The ipod radio could not be fixed and when I expressed to reception that I was disappointed and was hoping to have a nice stay with my Mom, the assistant manager gave us a $75 credit to use in the hotel/bar/ etc. Much to our delight, when we arrived in the room later that night, there was champagne and 2 delicious chocolate cakes waiting - much to my Mom's delight! They also gave us free passes to the hotel spa to use the steamroom and sauna throughout our stay, which was great. Overall, our stay was phenomenal. The temperature in the room was fine. There were no robes in the room, but when we requested them , they were there in a snap. I guess this is a hotel where you have to speak up to get what you want. But once we did, we were very pleased!

Reviews.Title: “Good location- not a good hotel though!”
Reviews.Author: ilovesa
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here after a 10 day cruise to the Carribean on the QM2- part of a Cunard package! This Hotel was a big disappointment. It is a very impersonal hotel - reception is more like a station concourse than a hotel.If you sit in the comfy seats by the entrance you have to buy a drink or you will be asked to move ! It is very dark and dingey- the decoration has seen better days. The dark blue wallpaper and the dark carpets and low wattage lightbulbs make it very dark. Our room had seen better days- there were holes in the sheets and the temperature control was hit and miss. Tea bags were provided but we had to heat the water in the coffee maker - which meant it wasn't hot enough. No spoons or fresh milk at the Sheraton- only little plastic stirrers and powdered creamer- YUK! The bath was tiny- really tiny- my 4 year old grandaughter would have been able to lie down in it but definitely not an average adult! I used the restroom on the ground floor before leaving the hotel. 2 staff members were having a real humdinger of a row here and never even stopped for breath when I entered. (I presume they were rowing - they weren't speaking in English ) The staff in the gift shop were really surly- especially when I asked the price of something ! How dare I ? The one and only thing this hotel has got going for it is its position - fantastic--- so handy for everything!

Reviews.Title: “Short sheeted at the Sheraton...”
Reviews.Author: sthomasa
Reviews.Content: Okay, so I got a deal. 129.00 first night and 156.00 the next. For NYC, that is really a deal! The upgraded room on the 40th floor had a view down 7th and was modern and fairly clean. Great location. My only problem was being short sheeted. When I climbed into bed, my feet hit the mattress. The sheet they had used was about 18 inches to short for the bed. They came quickly and remade the bed for me. All in all, I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I thought it was fine”
Reviews.Author: nycgurl
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed May 07, rooms and hallways were dark and dim - but check in was easy - room was ready - staff was friendly, room was small BUT not as small as some rooms I have heard described in NYC. Elevator man, baggage and everyone was friendly. Gift shop was pricey. Beds were comfy - I didn't find any mouse traps under my bed - but I did find someone's sneakers they had left there. Had a safe in room - nice -- I will say that in Oct 06 I stayed at th Roosevelt on 44th and Madison Ave (I think) and it seemed cleaner, but staff was not as friendly - seemed to have an *attitude* - but they had Bath and Body shampoo, soap, etc. which was a nice touch - Sheraton had Pantene and Sheraton soap. Overall - I thought it was fine - would stay there again if it weren't for wanting to try a new hotel !! I love NYC !

Reviews.Title: “Run down and shabby”
Reviews.Author: mattlanna
Reviews.Content: First impressions of this hotel are excellent but when you get past Reception then the lustre fades. The corridors were badly maintained, dirty and resembled an obstacle course due to the Housekeeping trollies dotted along it. This might have been acceptable but when you are paying full rate and the bedroom is even worse then there is no way back. The bedrooms seem stuck in the 1970's which was probably the last time they were substantially renovated. The bathroom looked even older and grottier. There is no air con so definitely dont stay in the summer, This hotel is a serious letdown once you get in the elevators. To be avoided at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: DrBAW
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel through Hotwire - it was rated as being a four star hotel and was not. The lobby was attractive and decorated for the holidays - but that cheery space was quite misleading. The upstairs, as others have noted, is very different. The halls all need a good vacuuming and the walls are very dinged up and scratched. I had occasion to be on three different floors and they were all the same. My first room was okay and appeared to be clean, until I noticed the roach crawling across the wall. I called downstairs and asked for them to change my room. In the next room there was a dirty sock in plain view under the window. This room had obviously not been vacuumed as the sock would have been noticed. I then called downstairs again and they sent up housekeeping. The head of housekeeping came up and was very nice and accomodating and gave me yet another room and a comp for breakfast. Unfortunately, the other staff that worked there was very impersonal. Don't think I saw any of the desk staff crack a smile. Many reviewers of this hotel say "what do you expect of New York?" I travel to NYC often and have stayed at a number of hotels - you should, and can, expect much more. There are some wonderful hotels in NYC that will meet these expectations - they are reasonably priced, clean, pest-free, comfortable and with friendly staff. The Sheraton is not one of these hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Three-Diamond Property”
Reviews.Author: gbtrotter
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton will definitely not pop into your head when you think of a hotel in New York but it's a solid three-diamond property with a great location which is the main reason why people overlook its shortcomings. The rooms are small but nicely appointed. The hallways are dark and dinged-up from luggage carts but the other public spaces are nicely appointed. The televisions are old as is the heat and air system but the bed is great. The lobby is a zoo at nearly all hours of the day but the majority of the staff is genuinely friendly and helpful. I'll admit I used an obscene amount of Starwoods points to stay here and upgrade my room. The room I occupied was going for around $450 per night and I would never pay this amount anywhere but New York. That said, even the Courtyard By Marriotts were going for $350 during the time I was in the city. But location proved the most important consideration in my selection of this property. Overlook the negatives and concentrate on the positives - get out of your cramped room, away from the expensive restaurants on property and be anywhere in the theatre district within a ten minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Drab, Drab, Drab!”
Reviews.Author: Welltravelled28
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fantastic voyage on the QM2. Prior to our cruise we stayed for 2 nights at the Sheraton New York & Towers which has a great location but the bedroom was more in keeping with a tired 2 star hotel. At £250.00 per night this hotel was expensive, over-rated and in need of a major refurbish. Definitely one to avoid!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a correct hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sylvainautourdumonde
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect: just a few blocks from Times Square, Broadway Theatre and Rockfeller Center. The lobby seems a little bit tired and not that clean (nothing terrible, though). Reception was only ok (not especially warm). Concierge was helpful, but not too friendly. The room was small but well furnished. TV is outdated. Sweet Sleeper Beds are very comfortable. The room is clean and ok, but seem a bit tired. Prices are really reasonnable for Times Square. This hotel is probably not a 4 stars though: a good 3 stars. In this area it probably is one of the best choice.

Reviews.Title: “Mice traps under beds!”
Reviews.Author: Nicki61
Reviews.Content: Well the title says it all. Rather dingy hallways, lighting was poor. 25th floor. Our room was uninspiring. I think the rooms got cleaned. But that only meant, making the bed and giving us new towels. I don't think they changed the sheets. Dusting is not a priority. And then the MICE TRAPS. Yup right under the beds...not very comforting. The location is to die for. Over looking the above and you might enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “OK for Times Square hotels”
Reviews.Author: blackjack72
Reviews.Content: Overall, the hotel was average. Having stayed at another hotel in Times Square, I understand that rooms are smaller in this part of town and the prices are much higher. Our room was no different with regards to size, but we got the room for $215 including tax on a Saturday night. At that price, it's hard to beat in this particular area. The room was clean and the hotel is in a good location. We didn't have much trouble with the elevators, but we did see several people waiting to go up on our way out of the hotel for dinner. I'd stay there again if I could get the same deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room ok”
Reviews.Author: Melfyn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in October '07 for 2 nights with my wife. Room 1435. A busy, busy hotel! Arrived at around 2pm and check-in was quick and efficient. As expected from other reviews, the corridor to the room was a bit dark and uninspiring but the room itself was fine (although hardly blow-your-socks-off stuff!). We were given a room with two standard double beds and they were very comfy! The location is the main plus for the Sheraton. Just a couple of mins from Broadway and the Letterman theatre, Color Purple, etc. Five mins walk to both Times Square and Central Park. We tried the Stage Deli both mornings for breakfast, which was great. The pizza restaurant one door up from Letterman was very very good. We tried room service for dinner one evening and that was really great! Ordered a burger for me, soup and a salad for my wife, and a bottle of wine. It was with us in less than 20 minutes and was brought on a fold-up table with white table cloth, which was really great and quite good value, considering. The food was really tasty! Had a few drinks in the Library Bar in the lobby and that was a great chance to do some people-watching. Service was friendly and efficient. So, I have no problems recommending this to other first-time visitors to NYC. There may well be better hotels with nicer rooms but all in all the Sheraton was fine by us.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: phillyrx
Reviews.Content: As I start all my reviews, a 5 is hard to get. It's reserved for those that exceed expectations. With that said, this Sheraton was average. I've stayed at a lot better Sheratons, but with that, this is New York City... what else can you expect? The location: You can't beat the location. It's located near basically everything. If that's not enough, it's just a few blocks from the subway to get wherever you need to go. The service: I booked the hotel with my starwood points so that helped. Overall, the front desk and concierge were helpful in assisting us. I asked for a room on a higher floor to avoid the outside noise, and they put us on the 27th floor... not shabby. The room: After reading a lot of the other reviews, I feel like people are expecting a lot when paying such outrageous prices for these hotel rooms in NYC. Being that I've stayed in many NY hotels, I've come to accept the fact that they are probably the smallest hotel rooms in the world. If you're looking for a big room, don't stay in NY, unless you're willing to shell out a lot of $$$$. With that to preface, the room was a decent size. The only thing on the small side was the bathroom, but as before, this should be expected. The decor was worn and a little outdated, but overall not bad. Personally, I think it was an average hotel room for a NYC hotel. Besides, when going to NY, who spends all their time in the room? Overall: I'd stay here again, but only because of Starwood points. I would not recommend shelling out $500ish to stay here for a night. There are better alternatives at that price range. If you can get it on priceline or hotwire for $250 or so, it's an okay deal. All in all, it's not a bad hotel, but it isn't spectacular either... thus, the average review.

Reviews.Title: “A pethetic hotel at best”
Reviews.Author: shadytawfik
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an absolute dump at best, i mean i can't describe how shabby and dirty the rooms even though the location is good. There was a fire INSIDE the hotel at 4 am, I can't describe how poorly handled this was and of course we got almost no sleep. I really don't recommend staying there at all since it is also so overpriced, I don't think they have considered cleaning this place up because they are simply don't rely on return customers at all.

Reviews.Title: “An Aging Relic”
Reviews.Author: matrac
Reviews.Content: I was there for a conference in late October, 2007. The location is central to tourist sites. Was disappointed to find the shabby conditions of every aspect of the hotel experience. The room, common spaces and staff were non descript, leaving one feeling like they are in a vacuum. No hot water in shower; was advised by staff that it "messes up in the winter and let it run for ten minutes". This was on an unseasonably warm weekend, not a frigid midwinters day. I was delayed in getting to a meeting as a result. The room was freezing and we couldn't locate the thermostat/ controls. After calling the front desk, we still had to search for it. Marking it clearly would help the guest get comfortable. The heater control couldn't be moved to warm up the Arctic tempertures, thus leading to an "engineer" coming to adjust the simple, ancient controls. The noisy heater unit was filthy inside. We had to wash our hands after ten minutes of fiddling with the broken controls. I would pass on this impersonal hotel, and find one with more character and heart, and definately one with a better physical plant.

Reviews.Title: “So noisy and burnt curtains”
Reviews.Author: Oliver90
Reviews.Content: I agree with the comment from Redditch. The corridors were dingy. There was a constant smell of cooking on the 16th floor! The curtains in the room had been burnt. Not a small burn but at least 12 inches circle over several folds in the curtain. Looked like some one had lit candles. Toilet seat broken. Room and bathroom clean towels very good. Door to room did not fit so heard all the noise from the corridor. Lifts were a trial constant gueues. Lobby area was a nightmare with very few seats. The Library bar and Sports bar were not big enough to cope with people again queueing. In the brochure it said the Sheraton was a calm quiet haven. I think they must have stayed at a different hotel I will never stay their again and will think twice about other Sheraton Hotels

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and Dingy”
Reviews.Author: Mixtures
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed in this hotel. Curtains in room hanging off pole, Don't stay here if you suffer from dust allergies!!! - could write your name in the dust on the room furniture, blinds and mirrors. Carpets in room and corridors did not appear to be hoovered throughout our 4 night stay - Asked Reception to speak to Housekeeping about state of room but nothing was done! Lighting in room was dingy. If we had planned to spend any length of time other than to use it to sleep in we would have checked out after the first night! On the plus side, the Concierge staff were very helpful and the hotel was situated in an excellent position.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, high price, good location”
Reviews.Author: Sutter
Reviews.Content: Room seemed exceptionally small for the price, even at a reduce conference rate of under $300 (regular seems seemed to be $400 and up). Room was clean, buit the hotel is definitely showing its age. Location is very good. Not sure how other hotels in the area compare in price, but it is definitely worth checking. Would not have stayed here if it had not been the site of a conference, and would certainly hesitate to return in any circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, but small”
Reviews.Author: robeamer
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I stayed here for three nights on a business trip. The hotel was excellent although the room was quite small. It was clean and had an excellent view down 7th Avenue. The decor in the room was luxurious with leather chairs and headboards, and an over-sized work desk. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Rooms”
Reviews.Author: KimPNewJersey
Reviews.Content: I have used Priceline for many years. After requesting a 4 star hotel in Manhattan the hotel we recived this year was the Sheraton. It was not a 4 star hotel. We had to switch rooms 3 times, once for a broken heater, and once because the heater was so nasty someone had stuffed a blanket inside it to keep it from shaking. The hallways where beyond gross, and the room wasn't much better. Everything was old and dirty. I would never stay in this hotel again, and will not use the "name your own price" on Priceline for fear of getting this hotel. The Hilton was much much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but not one of Sheraton's best”
Reviews.Author: joiabella
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton New York for one night. We are from NJ and husband works in NYC so we know the area and just wanted a place to stay after going to dinner. Husband is a Platinum Starwood Member and the room was paid with points. This Sheraton is classified as a Category 5 and other than the location, the property does not live up to other Category 5's we have stayed at. The front desk was accomodating when we asked for a room upgrade and we were moved from the 7th floor to the 41st which is a huge advantage when you stay in NYC. The street noise in the Times Square area will keep you up all night if your room is not up high. Other reviews report the room being dated and needing upgrade. Our room was nice, wood blinds, bathroom clean and everything worked. City hotels are often small, and we were not surprised by that. The Concierge was excellent and was a huge help in getting our dinner reservations. We were given special treatment at the restaurant on the Concierge's request. Also, the parking attendant was friendly and our car was delivered to us promptly when requested. Overall, this Sheraton is in a great location and the property is ordinary; if you are looking for "over the top", there are so many other places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bcheley
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to New York and being in the travel industry I know that the hotels are very pricey and the rooms are small so I knew what to expect. TRNSPORTATION: The hotel was about a 40 minute drive from La Guardia airport at 5pm and the taxi cost us $45 including the toll. It was only $30 to go back to the airport at 530 am so the traffic can make a huge difference in your fares. They also advised us we could take the train or a hotel shuttle bus but a taxis was more convenient for us. It was very easy to get a taxi from this hotel and many times they were linedup right outside so that was a benefit.
