LOCATION: The Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers has a great location at 7th Ave and 53rd Street and is directly across the street from the Sheraton Manhattan. You are a short walk to central park one direction and time square in the other direction. We did a lot of walking from this hotel as the area was safe and very convenient. CHECK IN: staff was excellent and very quick. I had 2 reservations 1 for the 1st 3 nights and another for the last 2 nights and they were able to accomodate us by keeping us in the same room and we did not have to check out and back in. That was great and very helpful. All of the staff was friendly and always there to help. ROOMS: we had a traditional room with 2 double beds on a "high floor" which they say costs more money but I could not see a price difference between the rates when I booked. The room was very small (typical for New York) but not very well lit or overly clean for a Sheraton. The coffee cups were dirty and we had to call for new clean ones, which were very prompt. We wanted to rent a movie one night but the movie guide was not available and it took 3 calls and 2 days to get a guide (the guide in the TV did not list the times so we needed a seperate guide). One morning one of our towels, that had been replaced the day before as a clean one, was dirty when we took it off the shelf. The room temperature was also hard to control as it was either really really hot or very cold not really a happy medium especially during the night when trying to sleep. The room cost us about $600 per night including the taxes so I expected the size of the room to be small but I also did expect it to be clean. We were on the 34th floor and it was very noisey, you could hear the doors of other rooms sqeaky open and closed and slam. We had about a 1/4 inch gap all the way around the door in our room so we could always make our way to the bathroom in the dark as it lit up the whole room. The walls are very thin so you can hear all the noise from outside and one night we listened to the guest next door on a conference call and we could make out the whole call very clearly. FACILITIES: The gym at the hotel was very nice with lots of up to date equiptment and never seemed really busy so that was a bonus. Room service was very quick and efficient and the food was good. Tickets fopr a variety of attractions could also be purchased from this hotel as well. They do have an ATM machine on the main floor but it is down a hallway and around a corner and a little hard to find but it is there. FOOD: There are lots of great restaurants in the area so the hotel pricing is not too bad due to the abundance of competition. Basically walk out the front door and look in any direction to find tons od bistros, fine dining, diners, sandwichs shops etc. Some of the best are within a few blocks of this hotel. Ask the concierge or front desk what they recommend as there is something for every palate. Overall we were happy with the hotel I just think they could try to have cleaner & quieter rooms for the money that you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location but a dull, old, rundown room”
Reviews.Author: doake
Reviews.Content: I decided to take my other half to New York for her 40th birthday, this would be our 1st time in New York and i'd been warned that the room would be small even if i had paid 2.5k GBP. I emailed ahead requesting a room with a view and some champagne on arrival, (expecting to pay for the champagne of course). I arrived to hear that no-one had got my email, no champagne and a room on the 6th floor overlooking a steam vent, 2 rooms down from the elevator. The room was vacuumed once during our stay, handles were missing from the dresser, the sink plug wouldn't stay down and it took 7 minutes to drain the water from the shower. I could hear everything from the rooms next door. I've read reviews here from other Brits who think some have been overcritical - i disagree! When you pay between £250 and £300 per night (500 to 600 dollars) I expect cleanliness and efficient service, not the ill maintained box that i was put in. This place is busy - corporate as it gets, yes the location can't be faulted but Manhattan isn't big and for the price of a bus or train or for that matter a taxi, i advise you to take your business elsewhere. I asked for a late checkout - $150! For 3 hours past the check out time of 12pm, that's just ridiculous. New York was great to visit and i had a wonderful time with good food and friendly people - I will certainly be back, but i won't grace the sheraton.......In fact i've experienced the Sheraton in New Delhi - a vastly different experience. Ed - Belfast

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Frances235
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and used Starwood points. While the location of this hotel is excellent (close to central park and in the heart of the theater district), we were a bit disappointed. First of all, as others have mentioned, this hotel is extremely busy and unfortunately, the Clinton Global Summit was being held, during our stay which made it worse. We arrived at around 1pm so our room was not ready. Our luggage was routed to be held on the 5th floor instead of with the bell hop, which was inconvenient, as well as the elevators being held by security for priorty for the heads of state. We almost always get an upgrade at Weston properties, as we are Starwood Elite members, but this was not the case with this particular stay. We received a standard room (not even on the preferred Starwood floor). We had also requested a "high floor" when we made our reservation (about 6 months in advance) and only got the 21st floor (this hotel has greater than 40 floors). The TV in the room had terrible reception, the drain in the bathtub/shower was very slow and always had standing water when we were done with our shower. Also, the electrical plug in the bathroom didn't work and when I called maintenance, the maintenance man told me to use one of the other plugs outside the bathroom. Having said all that, the bed was "heavenly" and again the location was great, but I think the next time I come to New York, I will try the Sheraton across the street (Sheraton Manhatten).

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: keora
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sheraton for three nights in August. This hotel is in a great location, everything is within walking distance. We were on 47 flour in a smoking room, very quiet and clean with a wonderful view. The size of the room wasn’t bad, the bathroom was clean, the king-size bed very comfortable. The staff was very friendly and they helped us with anything we needed. Breakfast was not included in the prise we have paid and they offered us breakfast for free. Was really good. We have no complains .I recommend this hotel. We

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: tsgc2008
Reviews.Content: I read lots of negative reviews before staying for a couple days at Sheraton New York for some combined business/pleasure. I thought the room was great, it was clean, bed was really comfortable and yes it was a little small but it's NYC and a great location so you don't spend much time in the room anyway. My expectations may have been a little lower than other travelers, but I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: JasonPortland_Maine
Reviews.Content: Stayed during Clinton Initiative. Very busy place. Valet service was suspended during this time. Check-in pleasant. Room small. Noticible wear on decor in the hallway.

Reviews.Title: “what a dump”
Reviews.Author: meatslinger
Reviews.Content: If the walls were any thinner, we would have been in the adjacent rooms, where the LOUD family seemed to be split into rooms on EITHER side. I know NYC rooms are small, but I think we were taller and slimmer by checkout time. There's small and there's small. If you have the chance, and the price is similar, stay at the Hilton around the corner. Rooms are much bigger there.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!..coming from a clean freak”
Reviews.Author: sabini29
Reviews.Content: I am the worst person when it comes to hotels I am a clean freak,,,Im so bad i think i need help......when it comes to cleanliness i will complain about anything i feel is not germ free! Sheraton New York and Towers is amazing! I was a bit worried after reading reviews but once i got there worrys went out the door fast! Also I only book hotels that have a reputation to keep up to certian standards I travel with my kids wich makes me more concerned about cleanliness and I have to say it was immaculate. Everything was fresh and clean ! the sheets were immaculate the tables were dust free bathroom was mold free! Furniture was not worn at all nice size room for New york also We did stay on the club level housekeeping was good over all it was a great room Right in the heart of Manhattan......... times square 3 blocks away!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay Marred by Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: chubbylim
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers for two nights in September 2007. I had booked a room on the Club Floor and paid USD509 per night. When I checked in, I asked for un upgrade as I am a Gold member of the chains frequent stay program. The Front Desk Clerk told me that I was upgraded to the Club Floor. I explained that I had BOOKED a room on the Club Floor and was paying the rate for a room on the Club Floor and by putting me in a room on the Club Floor was NOT upgrading me. All she could do was repeat, "You have been upgraded to the Club Floor." Hmmm.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: floymat
Reviews.Content: Convenient location for first time visitors to NYC. Very short walking distance to Times Square, Broadway, and Rockefeller Center. Hotel staff was courteous and helpful. Rooms were more than adequate. Hotel is has subway stop right beside it, so you don't have to search far for cheap transportation options. Again, very well located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “location a plus??”
Reviews.Author: prashpai
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business in sept 2007. The lobby in the hotel seems to be extremely busy, and the baggage storing service is $3.25/bag, ridiculous. The hotel is very conveniently located to the subway, theaters, right next to times sq and central park. However, being in the middle of everything comes with a lot of noise , even floating right up to the 34th floor where our room was. The room itself was nice but small with a leather upholstered bed and a nice desk. The desk hides an old rusting heater, but thats alright. The bathroom was clean. I would stay at this place for around $200 a night, but given that I paid $450 a night, it wasnt up to that level.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and Worn Out. Location is good, but little else is.”
Reviews.Author: ReynaSF
Reviews.Content: I travel a bit for work and since my company's east coast offices are in Times Square, I've stayed at a number of different hotels in this class range in the area. This Sheraton is by far the dirtiest and most run down of them all. Don't get me wrong, there are cheaper places to stay that are far worse, but you deserve a lot better for the price being charged even with the Times Square location. The rooms are small with aging beds and low ceilings. There's no in-room fridge (not that unusual) or mini-bar, though there's an empty space for one. Much better rooms for the same price can be found at the Millennium or the Westin right in Times Square. And honestly, two stars is probably more appropriate since the lobby and gym are nice, but not at this price. Specific examples from different rooms in a couple of two-night stays: - Shower curtain so moldy, we had to call to have it replaced - The AC/heating unit pumped out hot air even after two calls to engineering - Shower plugged up and required a call to have someone come unplug it - My room was super dusty and there was debris on the floor when i checked in and it remained there for two nights - The carpets were buckled and torn in the hallways - The bed I slept in was saggy and was very ready to be replaced - My sink faucet wasn't made for the sink so there were visible holes in the sink surface - The toilet paper roll holder was holding on for dear life by one of three screws

Reviews.Title: “Well located”
Reviews.Author: ScubyDoo
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with good location Had great room with spectacular view Didn't eat in as so many restaurants in the area

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: HilGray
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 26th Floor of the Sheraton for four nights and found it to be fine. The room had two good sized beds which were extremely comfortable (possibly the most comfortable bed I have ever experienced in a hotel) and had the most pillows I have ever seen in a hotel room (five on each bed no less). The room was of a good size and was very clean. It was very quiet at night being so high up and the air conditioning was not too noisy either. We were not disturbed by any other guests either in the corridors or in neighbouring rooms. The lobby area is impressive and reception checked us in efficiently. We did not make that much use of the hotel facilities as it was just a base but the location is really second to none being on 7th Avenue right by Times Square. We had a nightcap (or two!) in the Hudson Bar and found the prices to be comparable with those paid in the UK. A great stay in a great hotel in an unbeatable location.

Reviews.Title: “Short New York Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tgmg00a
Reviews.Content: My 19 year old daughter and I visited New York for the her first trip this September from the 1st to the 5th. After looking at hotels on all the various sites I used the Hotels.com and this websites reviews to select the Sheraton. We arrived on Sunday afternoon after a two hour trip from JFK. This was over a holiday weekend and our shuttle driver said it was a bit busier than normal. There was no line at check in and the desk personal were very friendly and helpful. I had called the night before just to be sure that our reservation was in place. We were given a room on the 36th floor and directed to the elevators. Total check in time was less than 5 minutes. As we made our way to the room I remembered some of the other reviews about the elevators. We waited about 30 seconds for an elevator and were taken right up to our floor. Over our entire stay I would say our longest elevator wait was Monday morning during Labor day check out. We must have waited about 5 minutes. All the other times we had elevators either waiting in the lobby or arriving within a minute or two. The hallways on our floor were were never vacuumed during our stay. Lots of small bits of paper and trash, nothing large or obnoixious. The room was a bit larger than I expected given all the reviews I had read and the complaints about size. We had two queen beds. The bathroom was small but not to0 tight. The room was clean but this hotel is showing it's age. It's been a while since it was updated and it's getting a bit long in the tooth. The beds were great! Really liked them. Being up high reduce outside noise considerably. Neighbor noise was not to bad. My only gripe, and this applies to all hotels, is the people who come it at 2:00AM in the morning and shout to each other down the hall. It sure wakes you up if you are a light sleeper. We never ate in the hotel so I can't say what the food or it's costs would have been. We had two issues with the room all were addressed one was not fixed. The tube/show faucet had a very steady leak. More than just a drip. We called the front desk on Monday and a repair person came up within an hour. He must have spent an hour working on the problem, he got the flow reduced but not fixed. He said he would have to come back the following morning and ask when we would be out. We said after 9:00AM. When we returned on Tuesday we still had the drip so I don't know if they came back or not. Also on Tuesday morning the lamp between our beds stopped working. I called the front desk and a repair person was up within 10 minutes. He thought all we needed was a bulb. He took the lamp off the wall and said he we have it fixed before we returned for the day. Which he did and we had no more issues with the lamp. Interesting thing was Wednesday when we returned we still had the drip but we had a new shower head. Could never quite figure that out. At checkout I told the desk clerk at checkout our issue sbut he did not seem to be writing anything down. He did offer us a free breakfast but we had already eaten. Again checkout was quick. Only one person in line ahead of us and two people working the counter. We did use the concierge once for a dinner reservation. Wait to talk with her was about 2 minutes. Very friendly and helpful. She recommended a resturant near by. Service was great, food was OK. It was Azelas right next to the Gershwin theater where Wicked was playing. Not a bad place but my first stay in downtown New York in over 20 years. I will consider this again if/when I return but they do need to remodel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly good & well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adamos
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights in mid August and found the place to be quite acceptable. It has a very busy reception so one has a bit of a wait before getting to the Reception desk, but therafter all is fine. The room is fine although if you have a preference to bath instead of showering you will need to think again...the 'tub' as such might be big enough for a child only. The one disadvantage i experienced which curtailed my ablilty to sleep was the most excellent sound transmission between rooms. My neighbour, without a doubt, had a very passionate night and I can say with complete assurance that his partner was much pleasured..bless her.! As one commentator has mentioned ,there is a very nice Diner across the street from the hotel with outdoor tables. They do a very pleasant lunch and should the weather become radically inclement a very large umbrella is opened to shelter one from the rain ! If you want an evening venue for Dinner with an exciting atmosphere try The Buddha Bar-fantastic place especially if you book for eating around 9.00 and then stay at your table for the evening and enjoy the seriously cool music- it gets increasingly loud as the night goes on.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't love the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: CHAVA_SUMMER
Reviews.Content: This Sheraton failed to live up to nearly all of our expectations (to the hotel's credit, it did deliver on the room and a bed that we expected). First, the housekeeping staff was unresponsive---we requested a blanket for our child at 8 p.m., made a follow-up call at 10 p.m. (only to be told that there was no record of the earlier call), made another follow-up call at 11 p.m., and finally received a blanket at 12:30 a.m. after another follow-up call at midnight. Second, the hotel is in serious need of a makeover. The halls are dark brown, the walls and carpets in the hallways are in poor shape, and the hallways are dimly lit (the overall effect is reminiscent of a turn-of-the century tenement). Third, the font desk couldn't deliver on a couple of routine requests to handle our bill for our expense reports. If I had it to do over again, I would not have stayed at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “New York is Fab”
Reviews.Author: mollyHayle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fabulous location, close to the theatres and 5th Avenue and all the shops. Our room was surprisingly spacious although the bathroom was small but adequate. We were on the 7th Floor which was very noisy with the outside traffic but we had a wonderful view so decided to just put up with it as New York is the city that never sleeps anyway! The room was fairly clean could have done with a good hoover and dust but really we speant very little time in it. I can recommend the restaurant opposite the hotel with outside seating for breakfast very reasonable and good quality food, reception staff were very friendly and helpful bar staff were not! We would stay in this hotel again but probably ask for a room higher up.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location for Explorers”
Reviews.Author: Henfield31
Reviews.Content: We booked our hotel through Expedia and booked a deluxe room. This meant that we had a slightly larger room than a standard and more amenities. The hotel itself was very busy at the time we were there and this was shown by the amount of people always around the lobby, which was a nice area to be. It also offered complimentary wireless internet access, which is good for business travellers. The location of our room made the hotel seem as if we were the only people staying there, as it was so quiet. The room itself was adequate for our needs as we were only popping in and out. The beds were very comfortable which does help after a day of travelling around New York. The bathroom was ok, though minor setbacks originally there were dealt with by staff. The only drawback of the room was the lack of T.V channels and the dated T.V set. The location of the hotel was fantastic. It was within walking distance of lots of major tourist attractions such as Times Square, Central Park and 5th Avenue. The subway was also a minute away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Comfortable Bed”
Reviews.Author: jjb415
Reviews.Content: My stay at the New York Sheraton and Towers was on August 24, 2007, and was in room 3035 for one night before a cruise leaving from Port Liberty, Bayonne, New Jersey. I arrived at about 4pm by subway and was assigned a room right away by a very friendly and effecient Front Desk clerk. The feel of the busy lobby is that of one of those hotels that caters to groups from other countries and airline crews. Many different languages are being spoken and there is a lot of hustle and bustle. The room was exactly as depicted on the hotels websight. It was clean and equipped with the usual basics (soap, shampoo, moisturizer, ice bucket, glasses, etc.) and little more. The carpet and bathroom were clean with plenty of towels. My room was quiet the entire night and the elevators were fast and usually empty on this Friday evening (I made several trips out of the hotel for food, cruise supplies, etc.). Security officers were on duty to check room key at the elevator lobby. The bed was among the best of any hotel and the bottom sheet fit and went all of the way to the bottom of the mattress. The comforter was nice and fluffy. The air conditioner was adequate and kept the room cool. The ice machine worked and was behind a big thick door. The gym was well-equipped. Check-out was just as friendly and effecient as check-in. My rating of above average is due to the very friendly staff, great comfortable bed, and gym. In addition my e-mails to the hotel with advance special requests were answered immediately and acted upon when I arrived at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Stay”
Reviews.Author: emilius77
Reviews.Content: We had an okay (read: acceptable) stay at this hotel during a conference last month. We arrived one-hour prior to check-in and opted to take a queen room (rather than the booked king) in order to avoid waiting another hour. The rooms were small but clean, and the housekeeping staff was very friendly. Do know, however, that wireless connectivity in your room is NOT free, but they have free wireless in the lobby. This wasn't too inconvenient, but sometimes it was hard to find a place to sit in the lobby due to everyone else hanging out with their laptops! Probably the biggest problem we had was checking out- they were unable to give us even an hour extension on check-out time, so we were forced to check our luggage with the bell-hop. Be forewarned that this service is NOT free, as it is in most other hotels of this caliber (and even other Sheratons I've stayed at)- you have to pay $3 per bag. It's not too much money, but we still felt it was unacceptable given our situation. We spoke with someone at the front desk and he gave us a comp voucher to pay for our stored luggage (after just a little bit of cajoling). So it all worked out in the end, but was a little frustrating at the time. Overall, the hotel itself was nice and the staff did at least try to help us with any issues that arose. The location is in the middle of Midtown, literally right beside the E train (very convenient!), and in a safe area to walk.

Reviews.Title: “Blocks from Times Square”
Reviews.Author: sweetmc
Reviews.Content: We booked one night here as we couldn't check into our timeshare until the following morning. The location was perfect! Only a few blocks from Times Square,Central Park., NY Tourism Office and the Broadway Theatre. The room was small but well furnished-except for the old tv---flat screens would make it feel bigger and modern. Beds were comfortable-so comfortable we almost missed check-out! The front desk person who helped us forgot to place our wake-up call! We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, disappointing rooms”
Reviews.Author: rachel1982
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the other TA reviews prior to travelling I had lowered my expectations greatly and was pleasantly surprised by the layout and decor Just like the pictures shown on the website the lobby is bright, clean and modern Sadly, this is about the best bit! We arrived at the hotel approx 8pm and found it to be fairly quiet. Check in was quick and the staff were welcoming. We took the lift up to the room on the 14th floor and as soon as we got there, the standards nose dived...the corridors were dark and dingy and appeared not to have been hoovered for sometime-possibly months! The room itself was no better, dark and very dated in style. The carpets were dirty with the odd black sticky patch and the retro striped wall paper actually peeling places. The bathroom wasn't a bad size but sadly laden with other peoples body hair! The Air conditioning unit was so old that at one point I was so convinced i'd die of carbon monoxide poisoning I actually switched it off! Having travelled for approx 20 hours to get there we really didn't have the energy to complain and so just accepted it and went to bed (The bed was actually very comfortable!) The following day we took breakfast at the hotel ($25pp-slightly on the steep side) The selection of food was good and the staff were extremely helpful with tips and directions on sightseeing. However, we later found that there were a number of good cafes within seconds of the hotel and that most other guests at the hotel had opted to eat there instead. The only reedeeming feature that this hotel has to offer is its central loction which in fairness is excellent. This was my first trip to NY and the hotel was booked in conjunction with a cruise company as part of a package at a cost of £250 per room per night. I like many others thought that the reviews on TA were just isolated incidents but unfortunately this was not the case. I would strongly deter anyone from staying here unless you are paying next to nothing and are prepared to be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: clhimes
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Sheraton while I attended a professional conference. The room was just marginal. They are smaller than Sheraton rooms in other places, but about average size for NYC. The room was not very clean. There was some kind of wax or other material spilled on the TV and table. In the halls the carts used to clean rooms are pushed against the walls so often that the wallpaper is torn all the way down the hall, and there must have been 5 or 6 carts in the halls at all times. It was pretty much impossible to control the temperature of the room. The only good thing about the hotel is the location--near Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and Central Park. There is a convenient 24 hour deli around the corner. Other than the location, there is not much to recommend it. I stayed at the Marriott Marquis earlier in the year and found it to be much much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Find Something Better”
Reviews.Author: Lauri101
Reviews.Content: As a part of a convention, I stayed for 5 days at the Sheraton NY Hotel and Towers the first week in August. I had read reviews on TA, so my expectations were low. Right off, they messed up at the front desk by not having a smoking room reserved. I called the hotel twice over a six month period to make sure of a smoking room, plus I had an email confirming that reservation. Finally, I was offered an accessible smoking room. This was a wheelchair accessible room with no bathtub - just a curtain across half the large bathroom and shower fixtures and bench at that end. No counter in bathroom, just a tiny glass shelf above toilet. But the bathroom was large. The room had the usual - coffee pot, iron and board, etc. The closet was short (as part of accessibility) If you want extra walking around space, ask for one of these rooms! In comparison to the other rooms I saw, this was, well, roomy. The hotel was packed and the elevators in the middle section were taking 20 minutes. I was in the front bank of elevators and they were faster. Security was alert but friendly. Housekeeping in the room was fairly good, but the hotel common areas looked dirty and in need of repair. The escalators to the convention floors kept breaking down and only one elevator was even functional. Other problems we had were with banquet food and banquet service (both awful!), plus temperature of convention rooms varied from freeze zone to barbeque delegate. For the price we paid, I think our organization could have done better. I would not go back to this hotel or recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: bubbafb
Reviews.Content: Used my Starwood points for a free night (Monday in August) for a quick getaway with wife while visiting family on Long Island. As a former New Yorker, this was only my second time staying in Manhattan despite numerous nights in the city (my other experience was very positive at the New York Helmsey). The hotel - located at 7th Avenue & 52nd / 53rd street in Manhattan (right in Times Square and near Broadway). This is the perfect location for a midtown NYC experience. The lobby was fairly average for a big city hotel and you are not blown away upon entering. Parking - Parking was next door and the staff there was horrible. It costs $67 to park a full-size SUV for 24 hours & 7 minutes...ridiculous. Welcome to Manhattan. The rooms - fairly small but what you would expect in NYC. Bathroom was not big at all. Comfortable bedding as the Sheraton is known for. Older TV. But the room was clean despite showing some age. The bars - lobby bar looked nice. There is also a sports bar. Did not eat in the restaurant. If you are looking for a midtown location, this is a decent choice. Nothing to get too excited about but it is convenient to plenty of restaurants, attractions and a subway station. As for quality, I preferred the New York Helmsley. But for 12,000 Starwood points for a midweek stay in midtown Manhattan, can't really complain.

Reviews.Title: “Deterioratring toward the Sheraton Manhattan level”
Reviews.Author: mlasser
Reviews.Content: I'm a Platinum member and have stayed at this property numerous times. Something is going very wrong at the Sheraton NY H&T. The first time I reviewed the hotel I gave great reviews and recommended it. This time is an entirely different story. Not only did I not get an upgrade, I think I may have revceived a downgrade! Maybe I didn't tip enough last time? The first room I was assigned to was musty and damp like the Sheraton Manhattan. Deodorizer had been used heavily to mask the smell but the industrial odor was pervasive to the point it irritated my lungs. Second room (3833) had banged up desks, coffee tables and windows. Tears in the wallpaper. Missing glasses. No free water for platinums. Reduced amenities (no scope or bath gel this time). A piece from the broken shower drain was in the soap dish. The attached pictures are all from this room. Third room they moved me to is a club room. When I asked for an upgrade at check in and after the first room vchange I was told they weren't available. Not sure how that changed? This room is an improvement. Still would like to know how housekeeping didn't notice the extra ice bucket lid under the desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Can only rate it as a 3 star hotel at best!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: EastmeetsWestAB
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in numerous sheraton hotels. This one definitely is not up to standard. Housekeeping is sketchy at best. I have to request the room to be tidy up at around 4pm after the 1st night. Although they did provide complementary bottles of water, they have decided to leave this outside my door. So when I come back from dinner, I was shocked and have to call guest services to confirm what is this really for. Guest services have to transfer me to room services to find out what is actually happening!!!! Strange practise it seems!!! One thing that upset me most, I have never found (at least based on my experience) any hotels would charge people for leaving luggage after check out!!! Although it is only US 3.25 per piece, however I disagree with what they are doing. Are we supposed to all check out at 12:00pm and then catch a flight straight away!!!! What a policy!!!! It is a shame that this hotel cannot do a bit more to raise the standard. Location is fantastic. A Tip: go to 9th Avenue (Hell's kitchen area), fantastic restaurants. Would definitely recommend Baan (Korean) at 50th and 9th Avenue, Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Revolting”
Reviews.Author: backontheroad
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively for work, including monthly visits to NYC. My company booked three dates for me in NY at the Sheraton. I have completed 2 of the 3 stays and I am dreading the third one - tried to cancel but it was too expensive. The first stay was in March and I had a group of 20 people with me. My experience (shared by all in group, without exception) was as follows: 1. Lobby is a zoo (I think someone likened it to flop house - very accurate) 2. The room was filthy - the thick layer of dust and general stickiness of all the surfaces was gruesome! Two people in my group had to seek medical attention the next day - one for a severe asthma attack and other with allergies. 3. The noise is unbearable. Construction and other street noise is amplified here. I felt like the walls were made of paper. 4. The carpet was a science experiment. 5. Overall, the property is tired, dirty, loud and unpleasant. My second stay in July was just as bad - just add the drunk vomiting in the hallway at 2am for added effect! I'm booked at the Hilton Times Square and the Hudson for future dates - can only be better! So far I have had good luck at the Embassy Suites, the Ritz Carlton in Battery Park, the Hilton on 6th and the Hilton Millenium. The Marriott Financial used to be favorite but the last stay I was very disappointed by the cleanliness of the room and responsiveness of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “horrible hotel :-(”
Reviews.Author: shahlasworld1
Reviews.Content: We are frequent visitors to NYC and have stayed at a few different hotels. We stayed at this hotel from August 6th-9th, hoping the bad reviews we read about this hotel were isolated incidents (but they weren't). Check in took about 45 minutes plus another 20 to check luggage while waiting for a room (which was not ready on time). Finally we did get our room and as expected it was small but cozy. The bathroom was very small and smelled of urine. When we asked housekeeping about it we were told that it was the smell of the NYC water in the toilet. The bathroom also has no exhaust fan so when you are done showering the steam is soaking the toilet paper and accumulating on the ceiling only to drip on you a few minutes later. All these are things I'm willing to overlook, but I could not overlook all the little hairs on the comforter and bathroom floor. There are also no beverage vending machines in the hotel so either you have to call for pricey room service or go to the near by deli. The overall hotel experience was bad but as always NYC was great.

Reviews.Title: “What a broken down flop hotel that borders on needing a building teardown”
Reviews.Author: SFjoe
Reviews.Content: One of Starwood nastiest properties that I have ever had the misfortune to stay in while visiting NYC. The rooms smell and look like some sort of 1 star flop hotel that really belongs in the worst section of town. The AC does NOT work and the rooms have zero soundproofing. As a Platinum member I can tell you the value of staying here is a waste of dollars and or points. The hallways are dirty, the lobby is packed with 2 star tourists who really belong in a youth hostel or at an ex-parolee convention. The staff were unresponsive and when I had issues with a non working safe or AC that was not working, I was told after a long period of waiting there was nothing they could no. Amazing poor service for a platinum member. I wrote the general manager and was blown off by some offer for points. Frankly they do not care because they get a packed house anyway due to the location. Very poor value for money. Finally, If you are in NY and want to stay at a starwood property, stay at the Westin or hotel W for not much more money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location....”
Reviews.Author: brokecheerdad
Reviews.Content: We just got home after spending four nights at the Sheraton New York. I just wanted to say on the positive side, this hotel has a great location and the staff were very helpful and friendly. I understood going in that rooms in New York are generally smaller than what we are used to out here in the west, so I was not surprised by the lack of space ( but who goes to New York to spend time in their room?). On the downside, we had some elevator trouble (not stopping on our floor) and the hall on the 48th floor could have used a good vacumning. A word of advice, join the Starwood perfered guest club. You will get a club level room, a tasty breakfast, and access to a private bar on the 44th floor (the free breakfast saved us over a hundred dollars).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: KcBeachgirl
Reviews.Content: I was leary of the this hotel after reading some of the reviews but we were more than happy with this hotel. Like everyone says location, location, location. It is in the heart of it all. Great for walking and catching the subways. The rooms were clean and made up early everyday. The staff was always very friendly. We have no complaints, would recommend this hotel to anyone and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: freetoflyNewYork
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Hotels are always a reliable place to stay and this hotel was no exception. Staff was helpful and room was clean. We stayed on preferred guest floor. As usual in New York, rooms were small but adequate. Plenty of restaurants around the neighborhood and very close to the the theatre district. I would stay again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy! Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: abed845
Reviews.Content: This was by far the filthiest hotel we have ever stayed in. After many many complaints we were given some of our Starwood points back but not one single issue was ever taken care of, including the filthy tub, or the fact we had only one towel and after 4 requests still never recieved any more. I actually took pictures of the filth, stains, broken lights, thick dust ect and wrote to the VP's (with no reply's of course). I actually walked to 6 other floors, including the club level, but every room they showed us was the same. We tried our best to get another room but were unable to book at last minute. We ended up cutting our trip short becasue the bathroom was too dirty to even take a bath in and with no extra towels to cover the filthy floor we had no other options. Don't stay here even if you are offered it for FREE.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely ridiculous!!”
Reviews.Author: prattbratt777
Reviews.Content: If fist impressions are everything then the Sheraton Towers New York would impress you. The lobby is bright and alive and clean. Navigating to the elevators from the check-in desk is simple, but once you reach the hallway of the floor that leads to your room the impression takes a cliff dive! The hallway on the 39th floor had not been vacuumed in weeks. here were cigar ashes and butts lining the hallway (on a non-smoking floor) and dirt was everywhere. Unfortunately the room was no different. There was a heavy layer of dust on everything. The wall next to the non-working A/C unit was covered with mold to the point that the wallpaper was peeling away from the wall. The carpet was old and dirty. The bathroom was sparse and moldy. The gaps in the room door allowed plenty of light in and the locks were falling off the door. The beds, though small, were very comfortable. The staff was very helpful and polite. For the price we paid for this room ($369) this room was a complete rip-off. If you're looking for luxury, don't stay here. If you're looking for value, don't stay here...as a matter of fact, I can't think of a good reason why ayone would choose to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: travelluvr
Reviews.Content: I am going to preface this review by saying we didn't pay for our stay here. We used Starwood Preferred guest points and it was totally free- they didn't charge us any room tax or rollaway fee. It truly is the best reward system going. We booked this on 7/22. On to the stay... My son (19) and I arrived on Friday moorning 7/27 at 10:30 am. There had to have been 300 teenage girls in the lobby for the International Modeling and Talet competition that the hotel was hosting. From reading previous reviews it seems like this is a weekly occurance for this Sheraton. My advice is to ask before booking and if they are having it..RUN!! This was the most obnoxious, loud, group of people I have ever run into.There was also a dance competition going on..they weren't as bad. The beauty queens monopolized the lobby day and night. Plopping on the floor wherever they wanted too-bringing in takeout food to eat in the lobby, running(I mean actually RUNNING) through the lobby barefoot. If you have seen the movie Little Miss Sunshine, you'll know what I mean. They hotel staff was very friendly to us and there was alot of "eye-rolling" going on- they couldn't be;ieve it either. I did hear one front desk clerk scold a teenager who was loud and obnoxious- I wanted to applaud! We were able to get into our rooms at about 11:00 when my husband arrived. It was very smooth. The room was small for 3 but we didn't care- the rollaway was full size and delivered immediately. Bathroom as stated was very small. We'd leave the hotel at 9 am back at 5 leave again at 7 and come back for bed. Forget the Starbucks int he lobby- again monopolized by the kids. Like I said - for a freebie it was awesome- if I had to pay $350/night- I wouldn't be happy. Our room was clean and quiet- on the 37th floor-a little noise from next door but nothing that bothered us and we slept fine. I would only stay again if the Little Miss Sunshine pagent wasn't going on.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: deniseddavis
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton New York is a splendid place to stay. Location is great, rooms are nice, beds awsome, and staff most helpful and friendly. Checking in and out was a breeze, and the handling of our baggage was most efficient, even though they had to hold bags before we could check in (we arrived very early) and before we left. There is a charge for holding baggage after check-out, but that was not unexpected. The lobby is spacious and quite bustling, with many folks enjoying the lobby internet connections for their laptops. We never had to wait more than a few second for an elevator, which is nice when there are so many things to be off to see and do. We especially appreciated the extra staff security posted at the elevator entrances. All of the lobby staff were pleasant and willing to answer our various logistics questions. And of course, the location of the property is excellent, being just a short walk uptown to central park, and a slightly longer walk downtown to Times Square and the theatre district. This is an excellent choice if you want a comfortable, clean, friendly, safe and convenient place to stay in mid-town.

Reviews.Title: “Harry Potter and more in NYC”
Reviews.Author: NYMotherFussers
Reviews.Content: This was a last-minute trip we booked using Starwood points. We drove from DC to NY, which takes about 5 hours max. It doesn't make sense to take the Amtrak trains anymore because the prices have become prohibitive (~$300 round trip vs. $50 for gas). We checked in around 9 p.m. When we entered the room, we noticed that the bath products were used plus there was a razor in the tub. The staff sent someone to clean the bathroom but then we noticed that the bed looked lumpy and that there were some wire hangers teetering from a lamp. We had a couple of theories about how it got that way (some not so appropriate for this board), so we just asked for a new room. The new room was on the 9th floor. It was clean and the bathroom was fine. Everybody talks about tiny NYC rooms but we think nothing of it. Nearly all rooms in NYC are tiny, it's just the way it is. Anyway, the hotel is really close to Times Square so we headed out for a walk and the city streets were packed. The queue for the Harry Potter book at Toys r Us was amusing, there was literally a big swell that rushed in when the clock struck midnight. We also picked up a snack at one of the delis nearby. Delis close to Time Square and the hotel were pricey, so go off a few blocks. Saturday morning breakfast was a couple blocks over at Metro Cafe, same stuff as Lindy's but less expensive. We walked around the city, had high tea at Cafe Pierre (very pricey--expect to pay $50++ per person), looked at the new fall bags on Fifth Ave., heard Mass at St. Paddy's, and had dinner at Oh! Taisho in the East Village. (Super excellent if you like Japanese food. Inexpensive too.) On Sunday, a couple of blocks on 7th Ave. were closed for a street fair, which was lots of fun. According to the vendors, they had to jack up their prices a bit for that one because of the higher rent for the location, but there is generally a street fair every Sunday somewhere in the city. We had a late checkout, so our bags stayed in our room until 3 p.m. We tried to put or bags in storage, but because this was a pre- and post-cruise hotel, their storage area was packed and they had to use one of the ballrooms for the baggage. The queue was pretty long. So be prepared to wait for your baggage getting in and out. Overall, a great NYC trip. We try to visit the city about three times a year, mainly because we have city envy (the 24 hour bodegas, cheap mani-pedis, and great restos are nowhere to be found in DC). The other part is, of course, we're DINKS. We like to travel.

Reviews.Title: “Location Great; Sheraton so-so”
Reviews.Author: Bosman
Reviews.Content: If it wasn't so close to Times Square and other midtown attractions, I wouldn't recommend it. Rooms were small and felt cramped; bathroom was oddly dark. Seemed clean. Staff was pretty good. Check-in was very quick and smooth. Valet parking was extremely slow, like 30+ minutes. At almost $400/night, including parking and taxes, doesn't seem worth it. NYC hotels seemed a bargain two years ago, but have gone way up in price. NY Hilton has nicer rooms, although a few blocks further from Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and room”
Reviews.Author: simonharris
Reviews.Content: This is a busy corporate style hotel situated about 10 minutes walk north of Time Square and 10 minutes south of Central Park. Check in was quick and efficient for a friday afternoon and my request for a quiet room lead me to a room on the 32nd floor.. The room was an average size New York, which are small by US standards.The bathroon is small but functional The room was clean and the bed was very comfy. Being on a high floor the noise from the street was hardly noticed which made a good and uninterupted nights sleep easy - that is not possible in many Hotels in The City that Never Sleeps! All in all a nice place to say and a great base from which to explore the many and varied sights the city has to offer

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location-Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: DocSavage19
Reviews.Content: On our last trip to New York city we stayed at the Waldorf Astoria. The hotel was beautiful, rooms large, but the location was a long ways from Times Square and Central Park. We might have stayed there again just to be safe but the cost went up to close to $500 per night after taxes. That was out of our budget. After reading many reviews online we decided to try the Sheretan New York Hotel and Towers. What a good choice! The location is about 2 short blocks from Times Square. Perfect. You wouldn't want to be in Times Square. Way to busy. But to see it from the front door of your hotel is the way to go. "Maison" french restaurant across the street is too good to describe in words. Open air dining with ambiance galore and food that makes me salivate just thinking about it. I like healthy food and there is an organic food market very close to the hotel. Delis nearby made me custom salads every day with organic avocados and fruit from the market. David Letterman Show (FREE tickets to show M-F) one block away. Broadway Theatre with "The Color Purple" starring Fantasia one block away. Many theatres within 2-3 short blocks. Subway to Penn station less than one block. GORGEOUS lobby, fast elevators and friendly staff. What more can I say? The rooms were clean as a whistle, the gym stocked with (I counted) 16 brand new Life Fitness machines plus free weights. Best gym I've ever seen in a Hotel. Business center FED Ex'd and custom wrapped a piece of art I purchased. Would I stay at the Shereton again? You betcha!! Hint: Come to NYC via Newark airport. Take the Airtrain to the New Jersey Transit (FREE) then take the New Jersey Transit to Penn Station ($15). It's relaxing and takes less than 30 minutes. (Cab is at least $60 and an hour and a half commute to the city near rush hour). I've done both and the train is the way to go. From Penn Station take the uptown subway to the hotel. Ask an attendant or anyone nearby (most are very helpful with travelers) which train and stop to get off at. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and below par”
Reviews.Author: yadidim
Reviews.Content: First of all I want to say that I’ve stayed in several Sheraton chain hotels around the world as well as booking many 4-5 star hotels on hotwire/Priceline and this turn out to be the most disappointing hotel booking. Last time I booked a hotel in NYC on Priceline I paid $120/night and got the Hilton next door which was excellent (considering I was upgraded to a club level room) This time, for some reason, the prices in NYC where extremely high and the best deal I got was $250/night on hotwire.com. My flight arrived at 8 a.m on a Saturday and I headed straight to the hotel. Once at the hotel I was informed that they are completely booked and can’t check me in until the rooms become available. I returned at 2 pm and was checked in and given a room on the 38th floor. The floor was apparently designated for Starwood Preferred guests (or at least that’s what the sign said). The room was very disappointing: Dusty blinds!!!! Just like on one of the candid photos on the earlier reviews, small bathroom with really lousy plumbing system, old low quality TV, no mini bar and overall old rooms….. I didn’t need any special service so I can’t comment about that, however I excepted to at least get a renovated room with a 4 star quality and the appropriate amenities…I will Definitely look to stay elsewhere on my next trip unless I get another Price line/Hotwire purchase.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience, Overall”
Reviews.Author: gercara
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the New York Sheraton in mid June and I can't say enough great things about this hotel . Every person associated with this hotel was curteous, polite and professionally capable. At my check-in I was welcomed by Marcello Khatar, who is the VIP/Club manager and he was very attentive, friendly and helpful. My room was located in the 50th floor and I considered this a big advantage in such a noisy city like New York. The room was well-appointed, very clean and the bed was fantastic for a good night rest. The bathroom size was adequate for NYC standards, with abundance of towels and fine bathroom products. Every morning I went to the excellent fitiing room located on the basement level and there I was able to get at least 30 minutes of cardio exercise . I am very fussy about this type of amenity when I select a hotel, and if you are also fitness minded you won't be disppointed. . There are very good restaurants in the vicinity. I highly recommend an Italian restaurant named REMI's which is located just across the street facing the 53rd Street hotel entrance. There is also a McCormicks&Shmick's not far away from the hotel. The location can't be beat. Close enough to cental park, times square, Columbus Circle, 5th avenue shopping, Broadway theaters, several subway lines and everything else I did need. . The lobby area is impressive and security at the entrance of the elevators make one feel safe. I would absolutely stay at this property again. I am already planning my nex trip.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton New York- Beware!”
Reviews.Author: Texgirls
Reviews.Content: Very Dissapointing Hotel. Don't be deceived by the Sheraton's web site photos of the lobby. We checked in and went to our room only to be very dissatisfied. The bathrooms are dirty and dingy. The rooms are dusty and dirty!!!! We checked in, stayed one night and checked out the next morning. For $200 dollars more a night we moved to another hotel that was fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Neighbors or room mates?”
Reviews.Author: medis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this location for a dance intensive workshop for my 3 daughters. Let me first say that I stay in hotels almost every month and sometimes more than once. My frame of reference is diverse. This hotel is in a great location and they take advantage of that by screwing every nickle out of you for the privilege of being so close to Broadway. Although we got the "group rate" we still paid a breathtaking amount of money to stay here. Considering the huge bill, I expected decent rooms and queen sized beds. Here is a list of my dislikes: We could clearly hear every conversation in the rooms on both sides of us. I think the voices were carried by the ancient heating/cooling system. We could also hear the people across the hall. Some of our neighbors were early risers and chatted in another language while we tried to sleep. (6 am) We thought they had moved in with us! The room was tiny. The beds looked lumpy (although they were fairly comfy) The blinds did not work properly The a/c did not really cool the room much and made it stuffy and clammy. No storage to speak of. There was dirt in the corners of the miniscule bathroom with ablsolutely no ventilation. The employees put in their time without smiling or friendliness, they were simply as courtious as they must be to keep their job, but nothing more. NO pool Internet access only in the lobby unless you pay $15 per day. Hot, stuffy stinky halls and elevators. The positive parts were that we did not have to travel to get to our classes, Broadway and Time Square were very close and the kids loved the m&m store. I would not choose this location again. It is not a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel @ a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: feistygirl_23
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. Clean, good service. The rooms were large and inviting. The only thing that I didn't like were the small showers. I felt like I was in the movie Elf, mind you I am 5'3" But the bathroom itself was not small. I don't know know what happened there.

Reviews.Title: “Location is ideal”
Reviews.Author: rmc2005
Reviews.Content: We wanted 2 rooms for 5 nights in a fairly central location at an affordable price. This hotel was ideal. I will admit I was apprehensive about this hotel because of some of the reviews. Glad to say we had a good experience. The check-in was fast, friendly and efficient. Noone was over the top but the staff were courteous and professional and very helpful. We just used the room to shower and sleep. The beds were comfortable. The rooms were clean and there was plenty of hot water. One thing I would say is that if you plan to use the telephone in the room, which one of our party did, expect the cost to be ridiculous. But he went to the desk and explained he was happy with everything so far but a vitually local telephone call for a few minutes shouldn't cost the price they were charging. They agreed they would reduce the charge and although he paid more than the call was worth they did reduce the charge. Some hotels will charge reasonble rates for the use of telephones but it makes me wonder if they are making up the loss other ways. All I would say is don't let this color your decision to stay here. Just be aware of it and if you do decide to stay either use you mobile or else bring the telephone charge to their attention. If enough people question it they'll have to stop doing that. And yes I would stay there again and I very much recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: colemanv
Reviews.Content: We stayed here June 22nd-24th. This hotel has onsite parking that cost $74 during our stay, which may sound pricey (but this is NYC)and very conveinant. Check in was seamless and the room was more than adequate and clean. This view of times square was awesome. This hotel is a very short walk to braodway shows and many resturants nearby. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “stay at the Sheraton Manhattan across the street”
Reviews.Author: SaminDC
Reviews.Content: I recommend the Manhattan across the street for the same price. It is more recently renovated, and they offer free internet access in the lobby (no laptop required). They charge for the gym, which is very annoying. The room was ok with a large desk but not as nice as the more recently renovated one across the street. They did give me a room on a high floor, which was nice for reducing noise.

Reviews.Title: “Just awful”
Reviews.Author: mrsje
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a holiday in which we travelled to NY on the Queen Mary2 with two nights in NY and two nights in Toronto - the hotels were part of a package. Perhaps it was after experiencing the wonderful accommodation and excellent service on the Queen Mary that the hotel seemed extra awful, I just found it a ghastly experience. The hotel is so dark and shabby that it is depressing. The room overlooked offices and was small and shabby, although the bed was wonderfully comfortable. The corridors have scrape marks everywhere and the whole place is extremely tired looking and could do with a good overhaul. We went into the bar and could not believe the barmen could see what they were doing, even in daytime it was pitch black in their area and the rest of the bar area was not much better. We did not go in the restaurant at all, and didn't feel we wanted to spend any more time in the hotel than was necessary. We travel a lot and usually if we don't care much for a hotel there are some redeeming features, the only ones here were the beds.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected”
Reviews.Author: benne30
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel as part of a Cunard package and were really concerned before arriving having read the many negative reviews. First impressions were OK - it is a great location and the lobby area is impressive. It is a very big, very busy hotel but there were plenty of staff around to help and Cunard had a welcome desk set up. We'd requested (several times) to have interconnecting rooms because we were travelling with 3 small children, but this hadn't been actioned. The first set of rooms were opposite each other (9th floor) but the receptionist was helpful enough and organised interconnecting rooms on the 23rd floor when asked. I think that both these floors are "preferred guest" floors and the facilities, cleanliness in the rooms were fine. The bags were lost between rooms but were eventually found and were delivered OK. We didn't eat in the hotel because there are so many restaurants nearby, but the in-room menu for the kids looked really good value. The in-room breakfast was horribly expensive but I imagine it is in every 4* NY hotel. The sports bar was good fun and there were other bars and meeting places in the lobby. One aspect we really disliked was the dim, dingy corridors to the rooms which were quite unpleasant, but I think it was just a feature of the decor rather than anything sinister. So, overall, a good base to explore NY (especially central NY) and our rooms were clean and well appointed. I'm sure that booking through Cunard helped us to get decent rooms and better service when we needed it, but overall I wouldn't be put off by the negative reviews - if your particular room is poor, ask for a better one, because they do exist.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: DenverTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton while on a business trip to NYC for a convention. The room is nice, beds are comfortable, and the location is perfect. I understand the negative reviews if the people writing them have never been to NYC before. The rooms here are very expensive and for the same price, I could be at the Four Seasons in other parts of the world. But, I'm in New York, and the Sheraton is a good hotel for the price. The food in the hotel is ok but there are so many wonderful places to eat within walking distance, I would recommend going out to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...another good Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Walsh_UK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel and as my first time in New York you seriously couldn't be in a better location. We was central to everything and the hotel was really decent 4 star! I must just mention previous reviews couldn't have been more wrong!!! The rooms were comfortable, a fair size with just all what you need in and they are interconnecting, if you want them to be. Maids were in the room every day! The door staff were very helpful in calling taxis and helping with luggage, the reception staff were helpful and friendly and the theatre and transport staff were by far the nicest. The hotel is constantly swarming with people but this is New York!!! Recommend the $22 breakfast buffet - so much choice and you can eat as much as you like. Very helpful staff in there too. Overall if location is what you want...you cannot beat this! I would return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Eh, it is OK...”
Reviews.Author: nicebizguy
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 nights there for a conference. Upon arrival was upgraded to their 'club' floor as I am a Starwood Premier member. Having been on many club floors from Ritz, Fairmont.. even Hyatt... this one was pretty disappointing. The staff their seemed COMPLETELY uninterested in anything aside from what was going on in their private lives. The food service was OK, absolutely nothing special. Very disappointed. The room was adequate. Typical small NY conference hotel room. Nice amenities, sucky towels, comfortable bed. My BIGGEST issue was...what the heck were they thinking when they designed the workspace in the rooms at this hotel? The electrical plugs, which I assume all computers need, were in the most incredibly inconvenient place. I literally had to crawl on the floor under the desk to use it! Insane. So, it was, eh, ok, nothing special. If you have a conference there, go ahead and stay. If you are going to NY for any other reason, pick a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stop all the whining!”
Reviews.Author: TorontoShopoholic
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel and few years ago, and was very happy with everything on that trip - so I was a little concerned when (after booking) I saw so many conflicting reviews about the state of this hotel. We booked two rooms, as half of us wanted a smoking room and half, a non-smoking. As soon as we arrived, I saw that the lobby was as nicely decorated as I remembered it to be. Check in was a breeze - very friendly guy, told us that the one room was ready, but we'd have to wait until 3 pm for the other. No problem, Jimmy, the bellhop took all our bags to the one room, and stayed with us for a few minutes to tell us which bars and restaurants in the area had the best prices and terrific food. The one thing I will say, is that the bathrooms (both of them) had very "tired" wallpaper, the hallways could use new wallpaper - looks like luggage had been bounced off them on many occasions. Otherwise the rooms were fine. Not as small as many people had complained, water pressure was great, beds were extremely comfortable and a fantastic view from the 28th floor - all the way up to central park! The staff was always friendly and very helpful - printing out copies of directions for us to give to the taxis drivers, looking up informtion on particular stores we wanted to check out, and helping answer questions about the costs of cab rides from point A to B. Starbucks in the lobby was a lifesaver. Drinks at the hotel bar at the end of the night, were fantastic. Everything was great - and I wouldn't hesitate for a minute to stay there again. Maybe all the people that whined haven't travelled enough to really know what a small room is (we stayed in Little Korea last year, and there was barely enough room to walk around the ONE bed in the room). Clean room, awesome location, friendly/helpful staff - what else can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Charges”
Reviews.Author: Oldnogg
Reviews.Content: Sheraton New York Hotel & Towers; Neutral/Average; Visited New York Mid May 2007 with my wife. Whilst the hotel was clean and the breakfast food adequate, we found that the rooms were on the small side (for a deluxe) particularly the bathroom. Furthermore we noticed that the hotel was in dire need of refurbishment particularly the corridoors and some of the room furnishings. However what did really did annoy us was all of the hidden tax charges on our Bill such as room occupancy/tourism tax, room sales tax, City/local tax and to cap it all NYS Javits Ctr Tax. None of these things were explained to us at the time. Whist we can understand some of them just what does the Javits Centre have to do with us? We checked out at mid-day and asked if we could store our cases (2) at the hotel prior to being picked up at 1430hrs that day. When we collected our cases they charged us 14 dollars for a 2.5 hour storage. I just could not believe it. We had just spent two thousand dollars staying in the hotel and they had the audacity to ask for 14 dollars for a two hour storage, which I would point out was not explained to us at the time. Overall we enjoyed New York but we would say to anyone wishing to stay there, check out fully ALL of the things you are likely to pay for as you may find your Dollars disappearing faster than you think. Ian Whale Shotley Bridge, Durham.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to tour NYC from”
Reviews.Author: bracoman
Reviews.Content: Spent the first week of May there with my family. I am a Platinum Starwood Member and we were upgraded to a small suite on arrival. Room was comfortable with 2 doubles. The room was well cleaned on a daily basis. The AC could have been cooler but it was OK. Staff at the hotel were more than accomadating. One suggestion would be to spruce up the Club Lounge on the 44th. Looks a little dated. Overall it was good and the location was great

Reviews.Title: “The Filthiest Hotel in New York”
Reviews.Author: ManfromZurich
Reviews.Content: As a seasoned world traveler, I've seen my share of dirty, run down hotels. I prefer them however to be in far flung exotic destinations. I have never seen a four-star hotel in a major metropolitan center in such lamentable and downright GROSS condition as my room on the 41st floor (Starwood Preferred Floor) of the Sheraton New York. Here are the highlights: One lamp fixture ripped off the wall with exposed wiring. A carpet that looked as if it had been vomited on repeatedly. And worst, a desk area that was covered with sticky circles of goop and gunk where the previous guest had left either a bottle of makeup or God knows what. I'm no neat freak, but I literally did not want to take my shoes off in this room. The piece de resistance is that I paid over $400 a night for this fleabag joint! Never again. Shame on you, Sheraton!

Reviews.Title: “filthy! not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: minneapolis7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a conference, and we were extremely disappointed. The location is desirable---close to restaurants and to Central Park, but the hotel itself was definitely a disappointment for the money. Our room on the 22nd floor was filthy. When we arrived, we found trash in the room, several pills on the floor, and plastic chards in various places. We complained right away, but I don't think that the room was ever vacuumed. We had a child with us, so we were particularly upset. The dirt on the bathroom floor was about 1/2 an inch thick, and you could see dust elsewhere in the room. Because the hotel was so busy on the day we departed, we asked if we could check out 45 minutes after the noon deadline. Surprisingly, we were told "no". Hard to imagine why, since they obviously weren't going to clean and since lines to check out were backed up such that it would take at least 1/2 an hour to stand there. I heard several other attendees at the conference express similar concerns, so I don't think our experience was unique. The Marriott in the same area is much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Cincinnatistacie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton for 5 nights in late March/early April for a conference. We were checked in promptly and received a room on the 45th floor. We had a nice, clean room with views of Times Square. The location is extremely convenient to shopping and Broadway. We were running late for our flight when checking out. We were able to check out at the kiosk and the doorman was very kind. He got us a taxi right away and shared we needed to get to LaGuardia asap. Overall, we had a great experience in NYC and at the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with the Sheraton Hotel and Towers New York”
Reviews.Author: JadeIreland
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 9 nights, 3 people ina family room, two double beds. Nice clean room plenty of space. Checkin fast and efficient. We found staff helpfull. No complaints. I was pleasently susprised after reading other reviews. The location in midtown manhattan was excellent. outside front door to the right is central park and to the left is time square and broadway is one street away so you can walk back to the hotel after shows in a few minutes.The hotel and surrounding area is very safe and clean. The tour buses leave from across the street and subway nearby. We will certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: danwhy
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the various W's in NYC but with prices so high these days I decided to try the Sheraton NY Hotel and Towers out. I booked a traditional room and as an SPG platinum member I was upgraded to the club level and placed on the 46th floor. Check in was very quick (they do have a separate line for SPG members) and so were the express elevators. The room was about 300 sq feet and had the sweet sleeper bed (which is very comfortable) as well as a large washroom, coffee maker, free bottled water and a very large desk. I believe the free water is for club level only. A great perk of club level is access to the club lounge on the 44th floor. It was easy to get a great free breakfast there every morning as well as snacks late afternoon. The view is also amazing (as it was from my room as well). I didn't hear any noise from my neighbors during my 4 night stay and also had no problems with room temperate (I set the thermostat to 19.5C and the room stayed at that temperature consistently). The windows do also open. Overall I have come away from my visit with a very positive impression and will certainly stay here again. All staff I encountered were helpful and my stay was a comfortable one.

Reviews.Title: “Could you haul me a taxi PLEASE?!!”
Reviews.Author: charmelly
Reviews.Content: Getting a taxi right outside of the hotel was seemingly impossible. The guys out front will only help you if they are in the mood. The taxi situation was only a small part of my issue with this place. The rooms are WAY TOO SMALL!! No countertops. Not a long term stay hotel. I was there for 6 days and although I was in a very convenient location, the hotel was the pits. The room was dirty, the carpet was stained, the sheets were worn and the tile in the bathroom was disgusting. The lobby was filled with tourist at ALL times of the day and night so there was never a peaceful moment. If you are looking to relax while in your hotel room, don't stay here. My heat was not working and although I advised maintenance, it was never fixed so I used my hair dryer to warm my sheets at night. I stayed on the 22nd floor and on one occasion, the fire alarm sounded. I called security to see if all was okay and was very rudely told that they are checking on the situation and then hung up on. I have never stayed in a 5 star hotel and so my expectations were not high so for me to say it's not a nice hotel must mean something. If you are looking for nice go elsewhere, If you're just looking for a place to rest your head at night without any luxuries, you can stay here. It's Motel 6 at a three star price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: nhunixguy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton for 4 nights & it was a good choice. The room was small but clean and was all that I had expected. Checkin and out was efficient, there were some rooms being renovated on the floor but they were doing it during the day so there was no noise problem. The lobby was frequently crowded with a variety of tour groups but who would expect any different? I was there for a conference and the rate was 269 plus tax, I think. The hotel is in a good central location in midtown ideal for tourists. Broadway, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, restaurants, etc. are all nearby. Nothing went wrong and nothing was so surprisingly good that it stands out. It was just a good and hassle-free hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good but very busy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amanita
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a conference and received an excellent rate. Great, central location. Subway stop practically right outside the hotel doors. Efficient and friendly service at the front and at the concierge desks. The lobby is spacious. The room was quite small. The bathroom was old and somewhat dingy and dirty. Wasn't too happy with paying the bell desk to keep our luggage for the day ($5) and for receiving something that a friend dropped off for me at the hotel ($5). These services would normally be complimentary at other hotels. The hotel lobby can get extremely busy during the day and turns into a giant obstacle course with having to dodge people as you try to make your way in and out of the hotel. Overall, great for convenience, but somewhat impersonal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay - Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: bripilot34
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days at the Shearton NY Hotel & Towers, while attending a conference across the street. Arrived in NYC very early in the morning, much before check-in time. I was able to check-in to my room, despite my room not being ready yet. I was told I could come back for the key within a few hours. I was given a voucher for free bag storage. The folks at the desk were very friendly and accomodating. Lots of bus groups which scared me at first (high school kids), but luckly there weren't any disturbances during my stay. I was able to get into my room by 11:30 am, given a king bed on the 35th floor. Partial view of Times Square was nice. Quick express elevators to upper floors as well. Room was reasonable size for NYC - nothing spectacular, but clean and comfortable for sure. I was given one of the handicapped accessible rooms, so my bathroom was larger, but closet super small and had wierd configuration to accomodate someone in a wheel chair. No complaints though!. Sheraton beds are the BEST in the industry. Slept like a champ every night. Had a drink in the sports bar in the lobby, lots of tv's. and a decent crowd. In the a.m. they serve Starbucks coffee. Gift shop was convenient, as one of the days was like a monsoon - needed an umbrella (as did everyone else, and they easily accomodated the demand). Hotel location was EXCELLENT. Easily accessible to multiple subway lines (B,D,E right below and 1, N,R,W within 2 blocks). Short walk to times square, central park, rock center, and columbus circle. Location is phenominal. Overall, I enjoyed my stay at the property. As most NY hotels are, it was a little pricey, but for my business trip it met my needs. Few improvements - free internet access would be nice. $14.95 per day is a little much to ask. Also, not that I had much time to watch tv, but a few local sports networks would've been nice - like YES or MSG. Other NY Hotels I've stayed at provide them. Small potatoes though - again, an excellent choice of hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Location and SPG Points”
Reviews.Author: SNMK
Reviews.Content: The location and the ability to earn starwood preferred guest (SPG) points are the only positives with this hotel. Wear and tear was quite visible: The room was quite small, the linens were worn, bathroom was quite dated and dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: SarasotaPapmom
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is just great. Very close to Times Square, Broadway, shopping on Fifth and Madison Avenue. Lot's of places to eat nearby and there must be a bazillion Starbucks on every corner. Just two blocks away from the Carnegie Deli as well. It's close to many attractions but just far enough so it's quiet (for New York). The hotel staff was very courteous and always very helpful. The downside of the hotel is that it's used a lot for large groups. We had a large school group and several other conventions going on so the elevators were like a crowded subway during peak hours. The rooms were spacious (we had a double) and quiet. They could upgrade the amenities a little. Very basic and no mini bar! If you want a fridge, you have to ask and they will charge you. The hallways were a bit shabby and you can tell the hotel is aging but for the amount of use it gets with the large groups, the wear and tear is understandable. I would definitely stay here again if I can get a better price next time. You really can't beat the location on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Great Location will Cost You a Pretty Penny”
Reviews.Author: SarahChaudhary
