Reviews.Content: This hotel has an amazing location, right in the heart of Manhattan. It is walking distance to lots of great sights, including Times Square and the Theater District. But the cost of all this walking-distance convenience will set you back over FOUR BENJAMINS a night!!! The actual rooms are pretty small and somewhat outdated, and they definitely don't live up to the glamor of the beautiful lobby that greets you when you first arrive. Nevertheless, this is a decent hotel overall if location is your priority. -Leroy & Sarah Chaudhary, CA

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sheraton Towers of New York”
Reviews.Author: janeLongBeach
Reviews.Content: I just returned from New York and my second stay at the Sheraton Towers of New York. It's a terrific hotel. The staff is always courteous and helpful. The rooms are very good (and quiet) and always exceptionally clean, with all the basics needed, such as a coffee maker, lotions, shampoo, shower cap, hair dryer, a sewing kit (which, as it turns out, I did need on this trip!), etc. The lobby is especially inviting, always quite active with alot of people. There is a visitors' counter, which I have found to be very helpful when I want to plan an activity. There are two bars off of the lobby - I have only frequented one because it always seems to have the t.v.'s turned to something I want to watch, and food can be ordered, as well as drinks. After a busy day or evening, we always seem to end up there unwinding with a cocktail and appetizer. The location of the hotel is perfect. Easy walking distance to Times Square, all the Broadway shows, Rockefeller Center, Carnegie Hall, Central Park, St. Patrick's Cathedral and shops on Madison Avenue. The subway is easily accessible and cabs are always available, of course. For me, it is the perfect place to stay while I am getting to know New York. I can go equal distances and reach the East Village, where my son lives, Upper Manhattan, where a friend lives, and all the tourist spots, such as Grenwich Village, SoHo, Ground Zero, Wall Street, etc. I highly recommend the Sheraton Towers of New York. I look forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Service was awful, acommodations poor”
Reviews.Author: jburke33
Reviews.Content: When we arrived by car, the doorman told us to park ourselves in the hotel garage around the corner; after driving around the corner to find cars already spilling out of the garage door with no drivers and no staff, I drove back around to the front where he told me to park the car across the street at a sister hotel (Sheraton Manhattan). When I went over there, they told me it was also full and when I asked where I should park the car, they responded with "I don't know, good luck" and walked away. After finding a space several blocks away in an open lot, I returned to check into our rooms only to find they were not ready even though it was after 3, with the excuse that they were busy and to come back after 4. At 4:30 one of the rooms was available, but the other wasn't ready until 5 and the staff really didn't care. In fact, every opprtunity dealing with the hotel staff was terrible with a clear attitude of not-my-problem. The room quality was poor, with malfunctioning air conditioners, poor lighting & plumbing, and an overall grungy feel. I was relieved when we checked out, and if it weren't impossible to find rooms at the last minute in NYC would not have checked in.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, don't believe all the bad press”
Reviews.Author: Emmie-14
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in March and have to say we were very pleasently suprised and relieved!! After reading so many really bad reviews we were really worried before we got there. Check-in was no problem, staff were helpful and polite. We were on the 17th floor with a great view of the MOMA. Really don't understand all the people that complain about the small rooms as we found ours to be a totally adequate size. Room was clean as was the bathroom with good quality furniture/fittings. The heating in our room worked fine so temperature control wasn't a problem and the safe was very easy to use. We found leaving the maid a couple of dollars tips each morning helped to get all the extra touches! Hallways were in good condition and we heard no noise at all from our neighbours. Access to our floor was no problem and we did not have to wait long for a lift. Concierge service was very helpful, especially arranging transport to JFK, they asked our budget and arranged a shuttle bus at $17 each. Location of the hotel is excellent with Times square and central park only 10mins walk away. Hudson's bar at the hotel was resonably priced and great to have an evening drink/meal in. We had room service breakfast once which was great but a little pricey. Although this is quite an expensive hotel to stay in we would throughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay-You will NOT go wrong!”
Reviews.Author: A794135
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this propery in Mid March and was some what skeptical because of all the bad write ups on here and other sites. DON'T let this stop you, it's an excellent hotel and location. The rooms are updated and very comfortable. Theaters are all walking distance and there is also a great little NY style deli (Gourmet deli) around the corner that is reasonably priced. I had tickets to the Late Show with David Letterman and this theather is right around the corner. Museum of Modern Art is also just a couple of blocks away. I felt very safe in this location and it's easy to walk around all over the area. This location in Midtown is excellent for finding great restaurants and many other sights too. The rooms are very clean and all the staff is very helpful and friendly. Being a Preferred Starwood member, I would stay at this property again and highly recommend it!! One tip, if possible, try to pre-pay your stay when booking through Starwood, you will save up to 20% by doing this and every little bit of savings helps! Beware of the New York State/Tourist Tax as it is VERY high. Enjoy your trip in NYC--plan well as there is so much to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mbarrett83
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in October. It was clean & we had no problems. The locationis great bc youre in Times Square on 7th . Yet theres not any loud or crazy places directly near hotel. Also 5th ave shopping, rockafeller center, united nations, part of central park, empire state building & so much is close enough to walk. It wasnt a budget hotel but was the best deal I could find for a 3 or 4 star hotel. Rooms are small, but above average for nyc hotel rooms. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Does not compare to other NYC hotels in its class”
Reviews.Author: moomooWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in NYC on at least twenty trips, almost always via priceline, I would recommend just about any three or four star hotel I have won over this one. The location is great, but so is the location of just about any hotel you select and win in this part of Manhattan. If you are not using Priceline and have an actual choice, then stay at the Times Square Hilton, OMNI, the Millenium Broadway, the Roosevelt - really anywhere but this one. This had to be the worst NYC room I had stayed in. Nothing worked, the room was filthy - no coffee, no hair dryer, no iron, no alarm clock! Checking in took an hour the first time around only to find out rooms were not clean hours after the official check in time of 3 pm. Even after we went out to dinner and came back, there wasn't a room ready. The floor we were originally on had walls so damaged and dirty and scratched, I dare anyone to find a one star establishment that has that look. True Ghetto. We then got moved to another floor, and it was slightly better, but the room was still a dismay. At that point I'd given up - after all one doesn't spend time in a room in NYC - but the idea of people actually selecting this hotel to stay at (rather than accidentally ending up with it via priceline) is just silly. Later that night the paper thin walls (and I mean the THINNEST I have experienced in NYC) and the room accross us with 20 kids throwing a party kept us up all night. We made repeated attempts to get security to do something about it... of course noone came up for a while and they didn't manage to control anything in the end - despite the fact that the kids were either drunk or on drugs and beyond loud, running up and down the halls. All very disturbing and upsetting to anyone trying to get a few hours of sleep. Even the lobby, during Christmas had nothing to look at. Simply no effort is made. Avoid ANY food in this hotel. The only plus side to our experience was a voucher a very nice manager gave us to spend at the hotel (since no adjustments can be made to priceline reservations). We made the huge mistake of spending it for breakfast at the hotel- our $26 a person buffet was the worst I've had in my life. Still, cheers to the nice manager, the only person who tried to make things a bit better for us after many a mishap. I would not stay here unless I got it on Priceline for under 100. There are too many better choices around, with the Times Square Hilton and the Omni topping that list (and often available on Priceline too!)

Reviews.Title: “lovely!”
Reviews.Author: lexusboo
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel great location, great price (we booked online the morning of our stay) would recommend to all

Reviews.Title: “Nice, convenient location for tourists but needs some lipstick”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: It was a girls weekend for us, and the hotel worked out well. The rooms are big enough for four ladies to cram into and the location was good for tourism activities. We were out shopping and more than once realized we were back in the area of the hotel. It's not far from the lights and action of Times Square, and a short walk from Central Park. The rooms themselves are ok, but the age of everything gives the sense of uncleanliness. Several of the girls complained about the beds and the pillows. They felt the beds weren't very comfortable and the pillows were too thick. I didn't mind either, but I did feel like the room was dirty. There was dirt and makeup caked around the light switch. The carpet was badly stained and the walls were marked up and covered with dirt or grease. While the sheets, sink, tub etc. seemed clean you felt like it was dirty because of the other details. There are minimal extra's in the rooms. There are no bathrobes for example. They do use Pantene Pro V shampoo and conditioner if you don't want to bring your own from home. The service was good and the price was reasonable so overall I can't complain. I don't think I would rush back though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LouisianaTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from Feb. 21-26, 2007. Nothing negative to say at all. Very pleased with this hotel. Location a huge plus! Doormen, bellhops, and concierge were all very helpful. We stayed on the 30th floor...elevator was always working. I personally thought the rooms were huge despite what some reviews say. We did tons of shopping and had lots of luggage and everything fit well into the two double beds room. I will definately stay here again! I absolutely loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Sheraton New York Hotel and towers”
Reviews.Author: Alabama_dude
Reviews.Content: Visited New York Last week on personal business and had the chance to stay at a great hotel. This hotel was purchased via priceline and got the rate of about 170$ a night.. not bad considering the suggested rates were around 240$. The good: The location is very near times square and cannot be beaten... Lobby is gorgeous and check-in is a breeze if your a Sheraton preferred member or Starwood member..they have a special line for check-in for you.. The other people took about 10 min to check in. The room was suprisingly cozy and bigger than i thought it was going to be... Had enough room for king size bed, place to put 2 large suitcases...came with closet space and a table that ran the length of the window... Not the ritz, but it was very pleasing to the eye. Room was clean... bedding was very good!! The Hotel staff was asked for extra pillows and when we returned we had 4 extra and a voicemail asking if there was any extra items we needed..very accomodating! The so -so The room doesn't seem to be able to regulate heat/cold very well... they have a airvent HIDDEN inside the desk...but sometimes the room got a tad stuffy.. overall it wasn't bad.. stayed 3 nights and enjoyed it immensely! The ugly: NOTHING... only ugly part is trying to catch a cab outside the hotel.. HINT.. walk a couple blocks and you can grab a cab almost as quick as waiting in the bell line to grab u a cab!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Small Room”
Reviews.Author: kbvmcrae
Reviews.Content: This is a great location especially if you are in town to see some Broadway shows. We stayed on the 25th floor, and the rooms were small and the bathroom is even smaller. We also had a hard time regulating the room temperature it always too hot. There were several room service trays that were placed in the hall (from other rooms) and they were there for 12+ hours before being removed. However the bed was very comfortable and to us that is the most important part.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: DublinAnts
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sheraton towers for 5 nights and after reading some of the reviews posted we were terrified our trip would be a nightmare. Rather than cancel for a different hotel, we also read reviews about hotels we had previously stayed in and loved. There were very mixed reviews for these too so we said we would give this hotel a try, and we are so glad we did. We had a wonderful time in New York. We found the hotel staff to be very friendly and obliging. Check in was a breeze and we were given a room on the 21st floor. The room was clean and adequate in size. Bathroom is small and probably could do with a facelift. Plenty of fresh towels and toiletries every day, and room was cleaned every day too. Bed is the best ever! We had no problems with blocked toilets or the room thermostat Everything worked fine. We did have trouble with the safe (we loaded contents to the front instead of back) but a call to the front desk had it sorted in 10 minutes. We found the night staff were not as well informed as the day staff. We asked night staff how to get to Woodbury Common. 3 staff members had no idea how to get there other than an expensive taxi ride but did suggest we asked the day staff the following morning which we did and were given directions to bus station, time it takes to get there, cost of bus tickets etc. The hotel is in a fantastic location and is within walking distance of everything. We didnt eat here but did use the bar which was great. We would stay here again if we are in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: stuie1
Reviews.Content: We cannot understand why so many bad write ups about this place, we only experienced good. We booked through Expedia and had a great deal for 3 nights, we were given a room on the Sheraton Prefered Floor ( which I can only assume is an up grade ) the room was warm when we arrived so we just turned the radiator OFF simple, the room was great no problems at all, the bathroom was small but come on your only there to sleep in the room not to spend all your time in it. the bed was hugh and clean / comfortable, we had great views looking toward Times Square. The position of the hotel is EXCELLENT accessable to all things, the Subway is next door, the bus stop outside, there are many cafes breakfast and diners close by. The lobby area is hustle and bustle but that only adds to the atmosphere, it is a great hotel we are seasoned travellers and have high expectations ourselves, if you need any more info please give me a shout stuart62@tiscali.co.uk.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay!”
Reviews.Author: dlmyvette
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers, February 23-25. We arrived later than expected about 6pm and checked-in quickly. The attendant checking us in was very nice and although our room was supposed to be 2 double beds, he was gracious enough to find us a King room with no extra charge. We ended up on the 23rd floor. We did not spend much time at the hotel so I cannot really describe the gym or restaurants, besides the fact that there are so many other restaurants to choose from in NYC, why eat at the hotel? For breakfast, I definitely recommend a restaurant not too far, near the theatres called Juniors. The room, was small, but expected it due to many other reviews as well as advice given to me by others regarding New York hotels. The room was clean, smelled a little like a smoking room (it was non-smoking), but wasn't unbearable. The closet door was coming off the hinge, didn't care about that. Honestly we only slept there. The elevators were in good working order, didn't have problems with that at all as described in other reviews. We were close to Time Square, the theatre district, Rockafellar Center, and restaurants of all sorts. Overall, I would definitely stay there again! Had a fabulous time!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again at the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: DCGirl924
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton for one night with my boyfriend on the government rate of $214 a night. I'm not sure if we got a crappy room because we had the government rate or not, but it was REALLY bad. Our TV had like 4 channels that worked and somebody had keyed the glass so there were these really deep scratches in it which made it really hard to watch. The room itself was TINY (and I've stayed in other hotels in NYC and this was small even for NYC hotel standards) and was pretty clear that it hadn't been cleaned properly in a long time. Also, our thermostat was broken so it was either off or really really hot. You have to pay $10 a day to use the gym facilities which are TINY. I used a treadmill but had to stop because the thing was unbalanced and was rocking back and forth as I ran. Not safe at all. I would definitely not recommend staying here to anyone, nor will I stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Where Sheraton does not mean quality”
Reviews.Author: ChuckMichaels
Reviews.Content: When you hear the name "Sheraton" you THINK you're going to be staying at a quality hotel. This Sheraton was THOROUGHLY DISAPPOINTING! The supposedly "recently redecorated" room and corridor sported a monocolor, gravy-yellow paint job, an ill-fitting bathroom counter, and drafty windows that could not be adjusted. The first room I got had broken controls for the temperature, and the desk clerk was indignant and obviously disgusted by my coming back back and asking nicely for a different room. The rooms are extraordinarily cramped and jarringly narrow, such that the TV had to be placed on an angle on a side dresser in order to fit at all (crowding out access to the cheezy coffee service) and from that weird angle it nicely reflected the bedside lamp into the middle of the screen, spoiling the picture. The "desk" was merely a ledge next to the window, also embedding the heating unit! The desk lamp was positioned to shine directly on the face on my computer, and Internet access was $15/day -- this is $5 more than many other hotels with delusions of high style, and $15 more than many hotels that nowadays provide Internet at no extra charge. But while I was catching up on work at my "shelf", at least I had a wonderful view of the formless office building and steaming hotel service plant looming over me. IF IT WEREN'T FOR THE "SHERATON" NAME OVER THE DOOR, THERE IS NO WAY THAT THIS DUMP WOULD BE TAKEN SERIOUSLY BY HONEST JUDGES OF HOTEL QUALITY.

Reviews.Title: “Why all the negative comments?”
Reviews.Author: RevLou
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed four nights here over the President's Day weekend. We got a very nice deal from Priceline, but had some concerns based on some of the negative reviews we had read. It's possible that the hotel is aware of the critical feedback it has received, because we encountered none of the problems reported in other reviews. All of the staff we encountered were helpful and courteous. Check-in was a breeze - a delightful woman named Joy processed us efficiently and quickly. We had requested and received a "deluxe non-smoking king" on a high floor. Having stayed in midtown Manhattan before, we had no illusions about getting a large room, but we felt that the deluxe was comfortable enough to suit our needs. Yes, the bathroom was on the smaller side and some of the room's decor could be updated, but everything was clean and well-maintained - no problems with faulty lights or inappropriate stains anywhere. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom towels were "thick and thirsty"! (The toilet tissue, however, should be upgraded to a softer variety!) Housekeeping services were wonderful - our room was cleaned regularly and completed by early afternoon. And the location cannot be beat if you want to be within a few blocks of everything the Times Square/Theatre District has to offer. The only caveat we had was the rating of this hotel on various travel sites as a 4-star level. Based on our previous travel experience, the decor, amenities, etc, of this hotel rate, at best, a 3 to 3-1/2 star level. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “High Price but Poor Facility”
Reviews.Author: Davelw
Reviews.Content: Service was fine and the location, right between Times Square and Central Park, is great. However, this place is in serious need of refurbishment. It looks like they made an attempt at repainting and recarpeting recently, but it is already scratched and stained and many places. The housekeeping staff leaves big rolling carts in the very narrow hallways and the whole place just has a dumpy, dark and depressing atmpsphere. There are plenty of better places to stay in NY for similar money, so don't waste yours here!

Reviews.Title: “Yech”
Reviews.Author: Kati
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs a serious upgrade. I was there for business and was very disappointed. The room needed cleaning and modernizing. The bathroom was very rough. Stay at the Sheraton across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Believe They Can Operate a Hotel Like This....”
Reviews.Author: ChiTown2
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly staff, but.... Stayed at the Sheraton for work. Corporate rate was *very reasonable* for Manhattan and check-in was efficient. However, the elevators serving the high tier floors were SO inefficient that it literally required a 4-7 minute wait each time I ascended/descended to my room on the 34th floor. Even with six elevators serving the high floors I was forced to wait for the "next one" at least once during my stay. The 34th floor hallway was "beat up" with scuff marks on the walls and bumpy carpet. The room was clean but the shades did not cover the windows enough to block out all light and there were no curtains. Furniture was old and scuffed. Bathroom was clean but very small with mold clearly visible on the ceiling. Ear plugs a *must* given the thin walls....

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: ceejay69
Reviews.Content: loved this hotel. as a previous traveller has already posted, we were also here when we were woken by fire alarms and smoke in the corridor - the staff were so proffessinal they all deserve a medal. great hotel, clean, comfy great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ashleezmom
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Sheraton from Thurs. Feb. 8 - Sun. Feb. 11. We were originally booked at the Sofittel for $385 per night but a friend told us to try priceline which we did and got Sheraton (which is a 4 star hotel on Priceline) for $150 per night for the weekend. We figured saving $800 we could do much more shopping than we planned. The hotel is perfect for walking, everything is just blocks away. Central park - 3 blocks, Times Square 4 blocks...etc. Just wonderful and i always felt safe in the area. Upon arrival we were greeted by very nice, helpful staff, and this was the norm throughout our trip. We never encountered anyone who would not help us. Our room was ready, we were in a double on the 8th floor. Yes the rooms are small but we didnt plan to be in our room very often anyways so it was fine. Our room was very clean, the carpet was a little worn and i am picky about hotel carpets and never let my feet touch ANY hotel carpet. I just bring my socks or slippers. We had room service for breakfast everyday, a bit pricy but for us it was convenience. We like to shower and get ready with coffee and juice and when they tell you the food will be there in under 30 minutes, it WAS. My daughter ordered fries one night and they were hot and crispy. Our only negative - the hotel gym was closed until Sat. We wanted to use the facilities and have a massage while we were there, but we were told we could go across the street to the other Sheraton and use theirs. (Maybe this was due to the fire earlier in the week) The hotel has high speed internet for $14.95 per day in the room which we took advantage of, finding places to shop and eat everyday. On Sunday morning went down to the hotel lobby where i printed our boarding passes and checked out. Very convenient. Truthfully, If I had to pay the going rate for this hotel which during our weekend was $275. per night I would say I would probably not do it. I would pay the extra and stay at the Mariott or the Soffitel but for this price....WELL worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “A disappointing rip off”
Reviews.Author: LastMinuteMaggie
Reviews.Content: This is very late but I just had to sit down and send a warning out to other travellers. The Sheraton New York and Towers is a horrible place. We booked there expecting a luxury hotel, as are Sheratons in Australia. Nothing of the sort. Our room was small and shabby, which we could of handled except there were brown marks over the wall paper beside the toilet. I tried to have this cleaned but it seemed too difficult a task as did most things for most of the staff there. ..I'm afraid I could go on and on, about the queues to speak to anyone, .the king single beds being touted as doubles,the lying receptionist,.the rude concierge, the out of order room phone, the lack of any sort of personal care...the story only gets worse. New York was such an amazing experience experience that it overshadowed this awful hotel. But I will stop and just say, whatever you do, don't stay there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Professional in a Crisis”
Reviews.Author: Stoneharbor
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the night of 6 Feb. Unfortunately their was a minor fire in the middle of the night. As I descended the stairs I was met by New York's finest...going up. It brought back sad memories of 9/11 and reminded me how fortunate we are to have men like this. As they ascended they were unaware of what they would encounter. Fortunately it was minor. However any hotel fire is treated as a potential nightmare and the lobby was filled with firemen. That is when the Sheraton employees took over. Water, fresh baked cookies, and later comp breakfast. It was not just the management but every employee that I encountered."What Can I do for you", was the constant refrain that day. The hotel is dated but it has a GREAT location. Saw "Jersey Boys" ...Well deserving of the Tony. I will come back for the staff alone.

Reviews.Title: “find another hotel”
Reviews.Author: dinibell
Reviews.Content: 1) non-smoking room smelled of smoke in hall and in room at times. 2) walls are paper thin - had to sleep with ear plugs every night 3) don't expect starwood point upgrades or any special ammenities 4) while there had to request that dead bulbs be replaced, mattress exchanged (they were horribly soft and lumpy), hand mirror fixed and sink stopped up. Carpet stained, wallpaper stained, mildew around bath and sink. Customer service and housekeepers good. Room service not good. If you get it in the $150 range okay but not worth it at any higher price than that.

Reviews.Title: “Overall pretty happy”
Reviews.Author: whiskeylad
Reviews.Content: Booked through the Sheraton web site for $179/nt + tax (prepaid rate). On the negative side, the rooms were small (but, not small for mid-town Manhattan) and the carpeting in the room was a bit worn and dated. On the plus side; excellent bed, very quiet room, great location, and staff was helpful and professional. Very happy with the value and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: miami_dolphin_girl
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of bad reviews about his hotel before my trip. The biggest problem people had with this hotel was the size of the rooms. I had a room with two double beds and thought that it was great. I have stayed at hotels in New York before and you could barely open the door without hitting the bed. I thought the size of this place was perfect! Very spacious. Another problem people had was the supposed "rickity" elevators. We stayed on the 29th floo so we had to take the express elevator each time. The express elevator goes up pretty fast so when all the air moves through the doors, it sounds "rickity." There were also six elevators, so I rarely had to wait very long for one. I had no problem with the elavators at all. Another probelm I read about was the view. Aparently someone had a view of another building and was upset about that. Uh, you're in New York people! This city has lots of buildings and some of them are very close together. That is unavoidable unless you want to pay a fortune and stay at The Plaza! One thing you have to watch out for is the phone in the room. The front desk warned up when we checked in that is was pretty expensive. Even to make a local call it's a ripoff. No big deal, we all have cell phones and didn't need the room phone anyways. But it was nice of the front desk to tell us up front of the cost. All in all, the place was great. The entire time I was there I was thinking "what are all these people complaining about?" I would definitely stay here again. It's centrally located. Walking distance to so many things! I highly recomend this place.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, fab location”
Reviews.Author: megclio1
Reviews.Content: stayed at the sheraton for 4 nights with my parents and cousin in sept 06, first of all check in was a breeze we even got upgraded to the club level which was excellent, rooms were great, beds were extra comfy but the very best thing bout the hotel has to be its location, as first timers in ny this hotel is a must as you seem to be able to walk anywhere from the hotel, o and having a view of time square from our bedroom didnt hurt either, when i go back to ny which i intend to do i will not hesitate in booking this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “No personal service, no room guarantee, broken room thermostat”
Reviews.Author: Liz_the_canuck
Reviews.Content: I booked my room through the Starwood Preferred Guest website. The reservation was at a special internet rate which required upfront payment of the room charge for a non-smoking, queen bed. When I arrived at the hotel I tried the automatic check-in to avoid the long line only to be told my room was not available. I waited in the queue in order to speak with the check-in staff and was then told that I was now booked into a room next to the elevator with 2 double beds. OK so what happened to my queen room that I had pre-paid for? I was told that a bunch of Starwood VIPs were in the hotel and that is why guests were bumped. Shame on you Starwwod. That is the last time I guarantee my room with a full payment as it obviously means you actually get no guarantee. My room is very small and very hot. The thermostat doesn't work . Next time I will stay at the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Not again”
Reviews.Author: tollu
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel at all. I paid a very high price (more than I'd paid last time when I staid at On The Ave, which was excellent). The check in staff was rude and unhelpful - they were more or less barking at me about arranging a late check out. Then I went up to my room which was dingy, dated, smelled and was freezing cold. I went back down to reception to get a new room, explaining the heating was broken. After more barking, I finally got a new room, which was just as dated and aged and smelly. There were even some white stains on the bed covers. I asked the maid to change these. 4 nights later, the bed sheets were still there and not being replaced. I was really disgusted. The room also for some reason began to smell horridly during the night - the fumes would wake me up. It was mainly food smells probably coming up through the air con pipes. Really horrid. The decor in the hotel is aged and the rooms are small and offer no luxury at all. I really felt I was being overcharged - they charge extra for the gym, too. Finally, the staff are SO rude. Except for the guys at the door who get you cabs etc, the check in staff and everyone else was being absolutely rude and unfriendly and made me feel unwelcome. Worst customer service I've experienced in a hotel - by far. I recommend staying at On The Ave, a fab boutique hotel in a much better location.

Reviews.Title: “Better off at HoJo; Will stick to Ritz Carlton”
Reviews.Author: fatefullotus
Reviews.Content: Our problems, in short: 1-- check-in kiosk ate credit card. Waited 30 minutes and asked THREE separate ppl for help -- everyone was simply too busy. 2-- assigned room that had not been cleaned, dirty tissues all over bed and personal belongings on floor. Asked for another room. 3-- waited 10 minutes for someone to bring up new room key. Said person argued with us about the technicalities of it being a "room change" and then stood in our doorway and obstructed us from closing door after our almost hour-long check-in ordeal thus far. 4-- called management up to tell our ordeal. After I finished, she says, "That's it?" to marginalize the events. She proceeds to say it's the kiosk's fault, not the hotel's. Thanked her and hung up. To add insult to injury, management sees fit to send $10 bottle of wine, no corkscrew, no glasses with which to drink said $10 bottle of wine. 5-- Club room bartender embarrassed us by repeatedly coming over to our table and loudly proclaiming "There's a problem with your bill. You have not paid." Apparently, she couldn't charge anything to us because we did not exist in the system yet, in old or new room. 6-- Came back from our appointments at 1:30am and tried to shower. NO HOT WATER. We attempted multiple times over half an hour, to no avail. All in all, a TERRIBLE stay. At $400 a night, I should have just checked into the HoJo and saved myself the $250 and would have probably gotten better service. AVOID AT ALL COST.

Reviews.Title: “I Love New York”
Reviews.Author: AndyLLondon
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 1.30am to be greeted by a very helpful young lady who took my card details and then we was shown to our room... Allocated a room on 47th floor backing directly on to a office block !! Left the room at 8.00 am the following morning to hit the shops and returned at 6.30pm to find our room had not been cleaned. After two phone calls I was told the houskeeping manager would call me back ...... I gave up waiting and went to the desk and was informed that it would be done ASAP. Room was cleaned but delayed me getting ready to go out for dinner. Overall rooms were alot bigger than other NYhotels but walls are very thin and noise travels. Just need mini bar and robes and it would have been perfect for the money ......

Reviews.Title: “Good other than check-in...”
Reviews.Author: JoeyG
Reviews.Content: This was a good hotel for the price and could have been a good stay except for... We had a bad experience at check-in. Dropped off our bags at 1:00, told our room would be ready at 3:00. Using Sheraton points, I had booked a club level room, 11,500 pts per night instead of 10,000. We returned at 5:15, had bought half-off tickets for Altar Boyz that night. Times Square, tixs booth, do it. Our room wasn't ready, they bought us a drink and said to wait a half hour. We waited 45 mins and were checked into a room that hadn't been touched. Beds unmade, bathroom dirty, cash tip still sitting on the table. Remember, we had tickets for a 8Pm show and had to shower, etc. It was now 6:15. Took the staff 45-60 minutes more to get us keys to a room, then sent 3 different people with keys to 3 rooms in the span of 5 minutes. One of the rooms was on the same floor, 5-6 rooms down from ours. No housekeeping had been on the floor whilw we were there, it had to have been clean the whole time. We went to the show in the same clothes we flew in and walked around the city in all day. Thankfully, the show was off-Broadway and casual. Hilarious too. They refunded our points for that night. Now for the good. The rest of the stay was fine, better than fine. Our room was very clean, small, but hey, it's NYC. Yes, the heat was on, it's December! We opened the windows, turned the heat off, bought cheap foam earplugs and slept great. The club level was killer, huge bowls of raspberries, blackberries, tons of other fresh fruit and pastries, cheese, cereal, juices, way too much to eat for breakfast. Snacks were excellent at 5Pm also. No noise in hallways and the hotel was sold out, it's Dec 27-30th, very busy. Hallways were clean, no smoke smell, staff was courteous. Perfect location, I'd stay here again. I travel a lot, business and personal, and if it wsn't for the snafu at check-in, this would have been rated a lot higher.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kelley7
Reviews.Content: Myself and my friend have just returned from New York (Jan 9th). We stayed at the Sheraton for 4 nights and i have to say we had a very pleasant experience. The rooms were of adequate size compared to what you get across the road at the Sheraton Manhattan, staff friendly bars were good and its location was great. Only a 5 - 10 minute walk from all the designer shops and easy access to the subway. A fine bar across the road named Rosie O'Grady's, well worth a visit. All in all i would definitely stay at this hotel again. We got a great deal from [----].

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place to Stay for The Deal We Got”
Reviews.Author: Jenaggie
Reviews.Content: We (2 couples) visited New York and stayed at the Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers for the dates of Dec. 20 through Dec. 24th 2006. I did probably 3 months of reading these online reviews and researching all the discount package sites (we needed air + hotel) and with a lump in my throat, pushed the "purchase vacation package" button on the hotels.com site. Basically I feel pretty safe in saying that if you averaged all the reviews of this hotel, you will find the truth. It wasn't spectacular but it wasn't horrible either. However, I would be much more upset with my experience had I payed more than we did for the hotel. We ended up paying about $120/night (maybe a little more). Here's the rundown: 39th Floor -- rooms 3915 and 3928 (opposite sides of the hall from one another) 1. It's true -- DON'T EAT NEAR THE HOTEL!!!!! Coming from Texas where the cost of living is SIGNIFICANTLY lower than that of Manhatten, we were expecting the worst...however, prices are not bad if you venture 1 to 2 streets over (in any direction) from the hotel. We made the mistake of eating at the Friday's located on the corner near the hotel and my husband and I split a $17 hamburger and fries. Considering that a few streets over we ate a DELICIOUS gourmet Italian dinner later that night for around $20 to $22 / person at Cara Mia, it seems to be a bit of a rip off. 2. Don't expect a mysterious upgrade to the "Club Level." Didn't happen for us. I don't know what the other travelers (so many it seemed) did to receive this mysterious upgrade, but it wasn't in the cards for us. 3. The people are plenty nice at the hotel. I didn't encounter one rude person and in fact, they were quite accommodating (except for not upgrading us to Club Level). We left the maid $2 every day and always had AMPLE amounts of towels and fresh toilettries. Our room was kept up neatly and I didn't notice dust on anything (but then again, I don't even dust my own house!) 4. We arrived and were told (when we asked if there was any way we could upgrade to Club Level) that not only could we not upgrade but that we were in 2 "very smally rooms." The check-in Lady told us that she suggested we come back after 2:00 pm to see if they had any other rooms available. They tood our luggage to the luggage room and stored them for $3/bag (that's a flat fee per day). That's when we encountered the $17 hamburger. Upon our return they had 2 "Deluxe" rooms available for us on the 39th floor. All I have to say is that if our rooms were "Deluxe" I would hate to see what they were going to put us in! They weren't bad but I definitely wouldn't describe them as "Deluxe." They were smaller but not terrible. My husband is a Large man -- 6'5'' and about 300 lbs and we had plenty of room for us and our things. The bathroom IS tiny. There's no getting around that. And if you are sitting on the potty and forgot to shut the door -- forget about it...that puppy's staying open for the duration. Some tiles in the tub were a little yucky -- grout missing, some discoloration in grout -- stuff you would think they would take the 10 minutes that it would take to repair it. BUT the nastiest thing we encountered the whole time was a splattering of dried bloody snot on the shower curtain. YIKES! Our potty starting going out (as I have read in many reviews) around the 2nd day of our stay. They were always prompt in responding to our calls, but we did have to call on three separate occasions. That was a TAD annoying. It is true -- there is no way to switch from AC to Heat. If they hotel is set on Heat, that's what you get. We are warm natured and so opened the window and slept nicely until around 6:00 am the following morning. Street noise became too much at that point and we had to close it. The next night we requested a fan and one was promptly brought up to us, no charge. ALL CALLS are charged to your room -- local or toll free. I thought I was playing it safe by using my toll free calling card but got stuck with a $24 bill at the end of our stay. Oh well. Shouldn't forgotten the cell in Texas! The beds are comfortable. They also give you 4 pillows, 2 each of different firmnesses. They were sleepable (I am a pillow snob and I handled it). There was wear on the room I couldn't remember seeing in other hotels back in Texas that are supposedly on the same star rating -- paint was chipped and missing on the closet doors in lots of places as well as the bathroom door and door jam. The wallpaper was beginning to creep up at the seams in many spots. BUT all in all, we were gone everyday from 8:00 am until past midnight so it was fine for our purposes. There weren't any foul smells...carpet wasn't torn. Didn't try to use our safe so I can't speak to that issue. LOCATION: This hotel is GREAT for location!!! It truly is centrally located and we found it very easy to get to all the attractions we visited and utilized the subway quite a lot. TRANSPORATION: We bought a $24 unlimited Subway Metro Card each that would have lasted 7 days. The subways are pretty easy to navigate and we got the hang of it pretty quickly. We flew in from LaGuardia and the Taxi ride from the Airport to the hotel was like $36 dollars (and vice versa). Tips for your travel: be nice to others and they will be nice to you. Not everyone is always nice when you are nice however as we found a couple of times from people serving us. But all in all, most everyone we encountered was very amiable. Especially a man working in a Bari's Pizza ( I believe on West 72nd street -- we were looking for the Seinfeld apartment facade)...he treated us like we were ROYALTY...which was ironic as it was one of the least expensive meals we ate while there! Would I stay at this hotel again if I went to NYC again? I don't think so. I would give another establishment a whirl. It wasn't that impressive keeping in mind that there are so many options. Howevery, for the price and for the money and for the location, this was a winner for our 1st trip to the Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of doormen suggesting gypsy cabs”
Reviews.Author: CoastGuy65
Reviews.Content: Overall, the hotel was okay--great location and the staff was helpful, though the rooms were stifling hot (ask to have the window unlocked). Beware, however, of the doormen out front who are actually encouraging and suggesting that guests take gypsy cabs parked near the hotel entrance. We did it once at the doorman's suggestion (that it'd be cheaper and more convenient), only to have the driver try to gouge us, then proceed to come perilously close to running two different pedestrians over. Despite being raised in New York and quite aware of the gypsy cab situation, when a hotel employee encouraged us to use one, we fell for it. (He was getting a "kickback" I'm sure.) Never, ever, again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location.. Horrible Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Marte8580
Reviews.Content: I stopped off in New York for 4 Nights and after searching through loads of Hotels I eventually settled for Sheraton New York for $400 a night. To me this was quite a lot to pay, but I wanted to have a good time in New York and come back in the evening and relax in a nice room. The photos on the web-site looked quite nice, I thought that I couldn’t go wrong. The first room I checked into was really small, so they kindly changed it to another room that was slightly larger but still extremely small. The rooms were filthy, the carpet was brown and really worn, and it had gone shiny in places. The carpets where not vacuumed properly there was an inch of dirt along the skirting board, looked like they just vacuumed where the vacuum cleaner could reach without taking of the brush attachment. The duvet on the bed was lumpy. The air-con was noisy. The bathroom was dirty, wallpaper was peeling off and there was mould growing on the wall below the sink. Unfortunately, I have to say, this is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in and it really ruined my stay in New York, this hotel is 2* at best!! On the plus side, the hotel has a good location, just up from times square and there is a subway stop at the side of the building and the lobby is nice but it is so dilapidated this does not compensate.. I complained when I checked out and I was assured that this would be looked into.. Didn't hear anything. I wish I'd taken photo's so I could show you how bad this hotel was..

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: SCBlu
Reviews.Content: This was a great price for the location and quality of the room. Of course all rooms in NYC are expensive but this was excellent and I would pay it all over again. The metro station is conveniently located directly outside the hotel. The customer service was very good and the room was in great condition. It is a tight space, but everything in New York seems to be that way. The beds are comfortable and there is a safe box and a workstation in the room which is very nice. Internet access is available for a small fee. There is also a Starbucks on the ground floor to help you wake up should you need it. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: anycurrentsea
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Towers for 4 nights 12/12-12/16. Hotel and staff was excellent. We experienced none of the problems of the previous posts (5 in a double room???). Rode all of the elevators without a problem. Rooms were adequately soundproofed. Great location for the theater district-all within easy walking distance of all the theaters. The hotel was full but easily negotiable-staff was very helpful. Woud stay there again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Amost Nothing Good To Say”
Reviews.Author: Hesitant-Traveler
Reviews.Content: Preface - I'm not a big complainer when it comes to hotels, and am pretty good at rolling with the punches. That said, I thought this place was really bad and actually sort of gross. I stayed here last weekend because it was the site of a conference I was attending. I'd stayed the year before and had not been impressed then, and so did not have high expectations. (Last year, I had a room at the end of the hall, so it only connected on one side, and there was little traffic going by the room as a result, the point of which will be explained below) But the hotel was even worse than I remembered this go around. I had a room with two double beds, which the front desk said was larger than the rooms with Queen beds. But the room was very small with the two beds, a night table and built in desk literally squeezed into the small space available. That was no big deal, but the room was just run down - stained carpet; beat up walls; black mildew stains in the shower (that's gross). I assumed the bedspreads were no better (dirty), but the bedspread is the only blanket on the bed, and to dispense with it, you'd be left with just a sheet. Even all this I could have overlooked, but the unbelievable noise couldn't be. This is the loudest hotel I've ever stayed in. The walls between the rooms were paper thin and the conversations in the rooms next door were audible in my room. Worse than that though, the sound of doors closing in the hallway outside; the sound of doors closing in adjacent rooms (bathroom door; closet door) was unbelieveably loud, and really irritating. Although it was wicked cold out at night, I left the window open so the sound of the street outside to block out the noise of people and closing doors. The lobby is really nice and the lobby bar (the Library, I think it was called) was a very comfortable and relaxing place to have a drink. But none of that comfort and relaxation extended to the room. Even if the seminar I go to each year is here again, I'm staying somewhere else. This is not a nice place to stay at all and wouldn't stay here by choice.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: debra0907
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here once before, and we were not real happy, but thought we'd give it a second chance. Mistake!! The room is so small and the bathroom has a 4 foot long tub. Couldn't even take a bath it's so small. It has to be this size because the bathroom is so small you can't sit on the toilet with the door open, because the door hits the toilet! The room is filthy, and the heat and air didn't work. We had to call guest relations because the blow dryer didn't work, and never saw them. We also had to call them for something else, and once again, they never showed up with the item we needed. The ceiling had black mold on it and there were holes in the baseboard by the carpeting. I don't even want to know what lives behind the walls!! For all of this mess we paid $500 a night. We called to complain and nothing was done. Finally we left and went to Crowne Plaza which wasn't much better. Next year we'll definitely be looking at a different hotel, and will stay away from the Sheraton and Crowne Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & service, but a small room”
Reviews.Author: daveAZBC
Reviews.Content: The wife and I stayed here for four nights last week and were quite pleased. The pros: We were upgraded to Club level (44th floor and above) for unknown reasons, which gave us access to a lovely free breakfast and afternoon appetizers every day - this saved us lots of money as everything nearby was pricey. The room was one of the recently renovated ones and was finished nicely and was very clean. The staff were uniformly pleasant and gracious at all times. The king-sized bed was amazingly comfortable. We were allowed to carry our own luggage and hail our own cabs (no tips!) although there were bellmen and doormen available if we needed them. The hotel is very conveniently located in the Theatre district - we were able to walk most everywhere. The cons: Heater in the room wouldn't turn off, but at least the window opened, so we had cool outside air (and noise) mixed with heated air - we were able to sleep soundly nevertheless (see comfy bed, above). Room safe could not be opened, in spite of multiple visits by staff to try to open it - at least our valuables had not yet been locked inside! The toilet malfunctioned twice during our stay, but the staff quickly and pleasantly responded and fixed it each time. The room was on the small side, but I guess that's the norm for NYC. Wireless internet access from the room was an extra charge - unbelievable, considering the price of these rooms, when every $59 motel on every highway gives it away! Summary: great location, nice staff, welcome upgrade, clean room. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Wongbe
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I stayed at the Sheraton for 10 days and it was great for a New York hotel. The great thing about the Sheraton was the location- it was so central to everything! Times Sq just down the road, fifth Ave a couple of streets down and the subway was right behind us. We couldn't ask for anymore in location-wise but as for the room itself- that's a different story! The room was an ok size, nice and comfy kingsize bed but the pillows were too soft for my liking. The room itself was out-dated, old fashioned and dark. We were told it was a newly refurbished room but i think he lying because i saw nothing NEW in that room. The bathroom was small- shower was rubbish (too weak and couldn't adjust it). The coffee making machine was not very good, when we were just boiling water, the water still had the coffee taste which it was not clean from the previous person. However apart from the size of the bathroom and the coffee making facilities- we DID have a great view of Times Sq. We even caught bits of the Macy's parade from out 39th floor window. Also, i can see where people were complaining how hot the rooms were and how thin the walls and windows were. We could here everything from people talking to people going to the toilet. All in all- people at the hotel was nice, very helptful to help but word of advice don't eat at Avenue (restaurant in the hotel) not very nice and too expensive. If i do go back to New York- i won't be staying here, i'll probably stay at the Marriot.

Reviews.Title: “This place is just fine with a great location.”
Reviews.Author: copperpot
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at this hotel in mid November 2006. We booked directly through the hotel website for $200. This is a good value at this price. The reservation came with restrictions at that price but no big deal. This hotel is close to Times Square, one block from Broadway. Very easy walking distance to Rockefeller Plaza, Radio City Music Hall, 5th Avenue shopping, and Central Park. Our room was small but nicely appointed with modern looking furniture. Small bathroom. It is what I have come to expect in NYC at this price, plus we got the comfort of booking with a big chain. Sometimes you never know what you will get with the no name small hotels in this price range. Wired internet access for $15 per 24 hours. I would definitely stay again at this price.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: T2ERL
Reviews.Content: One of the most comfortable beds ever! The room was clean and had everything we needed. Great location just minutes from Times Square, Fifth Avenue, Central Park etc. Would not hesitate to use this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “A One to avoid”
Reviews.Author: Lawndancer1
Reviews.Content: We arrived via the QM2 on November 5th 2006. The room wasnt ready absolute chaos in the hotel lobby. When we eventually gained access to our room we found it shabby and dirty, the bedcover was grubby the furniture chipped the carpet didnt look as if it had been vacumed, the hand basin in the bathroom was cracked and the taps loose. The corridoor was just as bad it was grubby and drab. If this is a four star rated hotel I dred to think what a three star would be like. Would not recomend this hotel and if we visit New York again will definitely give it a wide berth. County Durham England

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel, had an awesome time!”
Reviews.Author: Pinsky
Reviews.Content: My wife, my 2 daughters (7 & 9), and myself stayed at the Sheraton New York for the weekend of November 10 - 12, 2006. We have stayed in Midtown Manhattan once a year for the past 5 years or so. We are always last minute travelers. We found a great deal on tickets to the Radio City Christmas Spectacular so we book the show. This was on November 7th. I then looked for a hotel on the 8th. We found quite a few locations with the least expensive around $329 per night. We wanted to stay in midtown within walking distance to everything. I have to say when we arrived at the hotel, we were quite surprised. The lobby was beautiful. Everyone we talked to working there was pleasant and helpful. We were given a 2 double beed room on the 21st floor. The room was a little small, but for NYC, I was happy with the size. Plenty of room for the 4 of us to sleep and move around and get ready to go out. The room was very clean, well decorated, and in overall very good shape. I did notice a couple of spots in the hall that had some worn wallpaper but everything was clean and comfortable. The location of the hotel is priceless in my opinion. We were about 5 blocks from central park, 2 block from rockefeller center, 7 blocks from times square, 6 blocks from restraunt row... We paid around $360 per night for the weekend. I felt we did really good for the price. We did have some issues finding a good place to eat for the money. I was a little surprised at the simple breakfast for $15 per person. We did not find lunch at any deli for less than $25 per person. Dinner cost us $150 both nights... I think these prices have gone up from our trip last year...

Reviews.Title: “Better than your basic Sheraton- excellent gym”
Reviews.Author: gymtraveler
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Sheraton New York often for business and pleasure. Over the years they have renovated this property. It is a very large hotel and feels large so be prepared. The newly renovated gym is excellent. I believe it is now managed by a separate company and has outside hotel members but it is never too crowded. Almost each piece of cardio equipment has its own TV built into the machine (but they don't carry CNBC for the business gym- rat). No time limits are enforced on the cardio machines. There is also a very large weight room section and decent size changing room area. Most guests will be charged a separate fee for the gym beyond the rooom rate but it is worth it and the fee goes down per stay if you are a guest for more than a few days. You also are entitled to a piece of fruit after your work out. As for the rest of the hotel, the rooms are your basic Sheraton rooms. Most are small (like all NYC hotel rooms) but all have a decent desk to work at. The club level rooms are not that much different but the club lounge at this hotel is definitely above average for a Sheraton and has a really nice view. The hours at the lounge are good. If you care about a gym during your stay than this hotel is worth a look. Location of this hotel is also very good- not too far from Central Park and the Theatre District.

Reviews.Title: “Ripoff”
Reviews.Author: poolbard1
Reviews.Content: Stayed this week on a business trip, for one night. This is what to expect for your 400 dollars: -The hallway leading to my room had stained and ripped carpet, aging wallpaper, and an odor that made me think the floor was until recently a smoking floor. -My room was so small that the room service cart could not fit beyond the bathroom and the waiter needed to hand me my dinner one items at a time so that I could move them to the desk. -I easily heard the TV coming from the adjacent room. -My room service bill, including tax and tip, was a whopping $40. For this I received a very basic hamburger (no cheese), a small salad, a small order of french fries and a 12 ounce bottle of water. On the plus side, the bed was comfortable, the room clean, and bath small but upgraded. However, the shower handle did come off in my hand. This hotel might be a reasonable value at say $150 per night, inclusive. At $400 (room, 1 meal, taxes), it's a complete and total ripoff.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Fault It!”
Reviews.Author: DragonJack
Reviews.Content: LOVED this hotel! We stayed 3 nights end Sept. I was far more impressed than I expected. The lobby is really beautiful and staff on check-in extremely helpful (free upgrade to club lounge level included breakfast-fantastic!!). The room fittings were also lovely and the four of us fit just fine. Small but nice bathroom. Fabulous,safe location-you can walk to Times Square, Broadway etc. Lots of great deli's in the neighbourhood too. Booked on Starwood website and got excellent deal-pay 2 nights get extra night for free. Very good value for New York City. You should stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved IT!!”
Reviews.Author: kings4m3
Reviews.Content: I waited too long to write this review! We stayed at this hotel in April of 05. It was wonderful. We are from California and did not know what to expect! Learned first hand on the power of tipping too! Anyway we stayed in the Club Level Rooms...These are not just for business people! We enjoyed all the perks of this! Great Breakfasts we were able to enjoy and if we needed anything extra we got it! Everyone was very nice!! Clean and comfy! The beds were GREAT! So nice! April was cold and it was a welcome to come back after a long day to it! If I may take a greyline tour bus for 3 days,see Tavern on The Green and have lunch,Go to Serendipity and have the frozen hot chocolate, and see a broadway show. We were lucky enough to see Regis and Kelly taping too. I have to say After I left the hotel I left my cell phone in a taxi cab on the way to Serendipity...I called my cell phone and the cabbie answered. It gets better: He bought it back!! New York was full of surprises and this was the best trip I have taken. We are going back again next April 07 and we are staying at the Sheraton again. I am sure we will have a great time and since we know a bit more now we have more new things scheduled! If your looking for a hotel this is the place to be...Close to Times Square and Central Park! Bring your workout clothes and take a walk in Central Park in the AM. Have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a legendary view”
Reviews.Author: JamesG_uk
Reviews.Content: Overall this was a good visit. We were given a great room overlooking Times Square up on the 48th floor. I was told that apparently these rooms are reserved for Platinum preferred guests. I found the staff at the hotel to be polite, warm and accomodating. The bedroom was exceptionally clean and the hotel passed its tests with flying colors scoring highly in most catagories. I think perhaps the only thing that would have improved things would have been the welcoming and checkout at reception.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Romantic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Valkiry
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beatiful, the staff is friendly, the room is beautiful in the level 42 you see all Times Square. Very Clean, the bathroom super clean, you loved stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ibeplato
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in mid-September, unfortunately at the same time as the Clinton global initiative meetings so security (and police) were everywhere. Overall it is a nice hotel, rates were very good for mid-town, and it is in a great location, just a short walk to central park, carnegie hall, or broadway. The room was very clean, but fairly small (though "quite normal" by NYC hotel standards). About my only complaint was that I had a 7th floor room so road noise was pretty bad. Also, the heat wasn't turned on yet and the room was made up without a blanket (it was in the closet). Otherwise it was fine, decent TV choices, good dining options (though with so many places within walking distance, including the stage deli across the street, there really was no point to eating in the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Alldun
Reviews.Content: We had a great time here. When we go back to NYC we will definitely try to use the Sheraton again. We found the room very comfortable and the staff was extremely helpful. It was awsome to get to our Broadway show in just a matter of minutes with a short walk. Allen Atlanta, GA

Reviews.Title: “Nice convenient stay”
Reviews.Author: pow32
Reviews.Content: This hotel did the job with no complaints from me. I got a government rate standard room, so the price was definitely right. Rooms were normal for NYC standards, and for one guest, the king bed was heaven. Like clockwork the rooms were cleaned by friendly staff. And the location?? Fantastic! 5th Ave. shopping is only 2 blocks away, Central Park is only a walk away. One perk was that it was located right across the street from the NYC and Citysight Bus Tour offices. And Times Square is a ridiculously short walk away. There is a 24 hour deli next door on 53rd that has good breakfast sandwiches, and anything else you can think of, so feel free to stop by for a cheap meal whenever you want. My group rarely had to fork out money for transportation. Head's up: they charge a small fee per hour if you want them to hold your luggage...so strict budget travelers take note and plan accordingly. Also, unless you tell them at least 3 hours in advance that you request a late check-out...they will be counting the seconds until you walk out your room to do so. I was about 10 minutes late from checking out and as I was walking out with my luggage, a staff member was outside my door about to ask me how much longer I would be. The woman was friendly though, so I didn't mind the sense of urgency. : )

Reviews.Title: “So Much Fun We Didn't Want To Leave”
Reviews.Author: tenismom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this same hotel just before Christmas and had a wonderful time. After reading the reviews before this trip we had concerns and wondered if it could even be the same hotel. I was traveling this time with 10 women on my tennis team to see the US Open and was a little nervous. Needless to say, this was a wonderful experience. The hotel was fantastic. Service could not have been better. Rooms very clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We were upgraded to the Club Level and had the use of the continental breakfast and evening appetizers. The only downside is that the rooms are small but I think that is to be expected in New York. Myself and the women traveling with me have had the experience of staying at 5 star resorts and hotels on most occasions and felt our stay was exceptional. I would highly recommend this hotel. Location is perfect for enjoying all New York has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice But”
Reviews.Author: Teresa704
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a good location next to all the subways, broadway shows, and restaurants. Room was just ok, if you going to spend the money stay and the HITLON which is a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great deal on Priceline”
Reviews.Author: SaraPA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers for four days on a vacation to attend the US Open tennis tournament. We won this hotel on Priceline for $130/night, far below the asking price of $279. We were a little nervous after reading a few reviews, but have NOTHING but good things to say about our stay. We arrived 3 hours early, but were checked in quickly and early. Staff was courteous and polite (really our only interaction with the front desk). We were placed in the requested non-smoking room with King bed. The room was neat and clean. Small, nothing fancy, but comfortable. The bathroom is very small, but functional. A little loud on the weekend, as partiers arrived back at the hotel in the wee hours. The hallway is a little loud in the AM, but no louder than any other hotel I have stayed in. Room service in horribly overpriced. Internet is not free! 14.95 per 24 hours, which is my only complaint. You can't beat the location! Metro subway station just outside of the doors. A short walk to Times Square or Rockefeller Center. Tour busses stop right outside the front door. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “good for the hotwire price”
Reviews.Author: eac353
Reviews.Content: It was a great room for the discount rate, but if I had paid full price I would not be impressed. The lobby is nice, location is terrific and the staff is generally helpful. The bathroom was not sparkling clean, but the rest of the room was clean and decently-sized for Manhattan. One note- look out for ridiculous extra fees. We booked rooms for 3 people and were given king beds- we had couples and did not want to sleep 3 to a bed. They offered cots at check-in, but then charged us 30/cot/night upon check-out for what was really their mistake (I did book through hotwire so could not do much arguing about it) Also, I would recommend NOT parking your car! We hadn't and I was thankful- Sunday morning there was a line of at least 50 hotel guests waiting to retrieve their vehicles from the garage- looked like at least 1.5 hr wait since we went to brunch, came past and the line hadn't moved much. The parking fees are also steep. For the low rate, it was clean and comfortable with a great location. If I was paying full price, I would have been very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Peter M
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location. The rooms were typically small for a large city hotel. It may have been a little too big, as there were times when the lobby was packed. We did not use any of the food or drink service, as there were hundreds of options on the street, at a fraction of the price. The room was clean, including the bathroom. Maid service was excellent. The location is great 7th and 52nd/53rd. There is a subway station right outside the hotel. Walk to the park, Times Square in about 5 minutes. Fifth Ave and Madison shopping were only 10 minutes walk away. We enjoy walking, so we walked everywhere, Guggenheim and Natural History each about 30 minutes. Empire State about the same. Very safe during the day, We were in Times Square at all hours of the day and did not feel intimidated. The only drawback is that it does not have a pool, you need to use the one across the street at the Sheraton Manhattan. It is very old and tired. Stay at the Sheraton New York, it is great.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, hotel needs some TLC.”
Reviews.Author: grram1
Reviews.Content: This property has some great assets, but also is in need of some TLC (especially the rooms). First the positives: - Location is perfect... inbetween Times Square and central park. Bus tours pick-up and drop-off directly across the street. - Lobby and common areas are impressive. - Got a great rate through Hotwire ($143/night before fees, about $165/night with fees and taxes). - Staff was very efficient and helpful (especially the bell hops... very quick and friendly). Now the Negatives: - Room was small (though not by NY standards). - Room wasn't very clean (some mold in shower and a lot of mold on cieling where the A/C unit sits on the unit above us). - A/C struggled to keep room at 80 degrees on full blast. - Furniture was showing age (peeling, etc.). - The wooden blinds were beautiful, but let tons of light in, in-between them. - Lots of street noise heard from the 39'th floor. - Valet parking for SUV very high at $47/night with no in/out privledges. Would stay again given the same rate based mostly on the location.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time, hotel was wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: devil1dog
Reviews.Content: This hotel has by far one of the best locations in NYC. VERY close to everything, we walked to Times Square-Rockefellar Center-Broadway shows-U.N.-The Met- EVERYTHING!! Subway is one block away. The Rooms were very good, the beds were great! The hotel could use a little touch up to the decor (some wear spots on carpet, scratches on walls, very minor things), but we were overall very pleased. The only thing I really had a problem with was the minor mildew stains in the bathroom. Our housekeeper did a wonderful job keeping up our room. The hotel staff was pleasant the entire trip, we were there for a week. We booked our room- name your own price on Priceline for $147 per night. You should try this, 4 star, midtown, $147 per night, you'll be very pleased! I can't believe some of the rates I've read people paid to stay here, I would probably pay up to $200, but not over that. Make sure you ask for a room on the highest floor possible, away from the elevator, you will find a great room, and lots of silence. Somehow by asking for a high up room we ended up on a preferred guest floor, even booking through Priceline which was awesome. Anyway, overall we were very impressed, and would definitely stay here again. They were very accomidating.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good”
Reviews.Author: HappyHawaiiKaian
Reviews.Content: Amazing to see the diversity in comments - wonder if we all stayed at the same hotel? Although New York is very pricey - our rate seemed to be fair for a 3 to 4 star property in early July. It was a non-refundable, prepaid $250ish++ (plus taxes) per night. for double bed room. Also ended up payiing $30 ++ per night for a roll-away. Ends up this is a 4 star hotel on Tripadvisor (is that correct?) and for the price it was a terrible value. Especially compared to Boston or Washington D.C. 's where lower per night rates provide a HUGE step up in accomodations and experience and no one charges for roll-aways. Of course, this is the Big Apple, so lesson learned is to pay more to get more. Although we found the housekeeping staff to be friendly, the rooms are not clean. The carpet looks scary to walk on. The bathrooms were very small and there was rust visible in many locations. Public areas appear gritty (trash not picked up, room service trays fin hallways rom Friday night still not picked up by Saturday evening, carpets dirty). Check in was the most impersonal experience - virtually free of any interaction other than me having to follow up on a roll-away request I had noted on the on-line reservation form. No eye contact, no asking if I needed anything. Then, for check out , as is the case in many hotels, they slipped the bill under the door giving you the option of having an auto checkout - basically if it is okay, then you are good to go. The note that accompanied the draft bill was worded kind of funny - something that gave you the impression that they preferred for you not to have any interaction with the front desk, just leave. So for me it was like... okay .. .no room for redemption if a guest has a poor check in experience. It's too bad. The property needs a major renovation and perhaps is reflected in the front office team. I usually find Sheraton's to be friendly and clean, but this one needs some attention. Maybe we just caught the Front Desk on a bad day and/or the hotel is understaffed? Bottomline is we're planning on going to NY in September and needless to say, we will not give them another chance. Great location however. Sorry I hate to be a Debbie Downer (wah, wah). P.S. to Hawaiian Travellers: 2 of 10 shakas on the aloha scale. Hard to believe it is a Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “The staff were great”
Reviews.Author: simon210210
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel early and I discovered that I had left my hotel voucher at home! I had nothing but the lady I was speaking with was saying "it's ok, we'll figure it out! Don't worry, you will definately have a room" . So, while we went out the lady had gotten ahold of the broadway (we booked the hotel with the hotel and show package from them). Sure enough, when we dragged back in we had a room and not only that, she got me the highest floor which I had wanted but didn't think I'd get since I left the voucher at home.. The room was bigger than I expected! I loved it and the bed and pillows are to die for. After days of going non stop those beds felt like clouds - I swear! The only thing I had a little problem was I couldn't get the air conditioning to cool the room enough but it was almost 100 degrees every day we were there. When I called the fist night for a fan they brought it up immediately and left it until we checked out. We had a wonderful view! The staff were incredible - they really went out of their way to help us in any way possible. It's in a perfect location too! We were close enough to walk to Times Square and Rockefeller Ctr as well as walking to the theater. I'm not exaggerating, this is one of the best hotels I've ever stayed at anywhere! The lobby is very grand too - lots of marble, dark wood , very elegent! It's great, give it a try - you will be glad you did!

Reviews.Title: “Ambivalent”
Reviews.Author: abcdefghi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for almost a week. We booked it through Hotwire, but later discovered that we would have gotten a better deal by booking directly through the hotel web site. There are both some good and some bad things about this hotel. First the good: - The location is perfect. Very central, the sightseeing buses stop right outside and there'a a metro close by. - The rooms are tastefully decorated in a contemporary style (as is the recpetion area), and I loved that the windows had wooden shutters instead of curtains. - The concierge was very knowledgeable and helpful. - The building has many floors, which means that you can get a room high up so you won't hear any traffic noise. So what's not so good: - With the exception of one person, the rest of the reception staff was unhelpful, difficult and downright bitchy. We were appalled! - We arrived before our room was ready, and had to pay $3 per piece of baggage we had to store in the meantime. - The room was not properly cleaned. It didn't look as if anyone had ever dusted there. - The room was small. - We wish breakfast had been included in the rate. - There was a charge for using the internet (and it wasn't small). It should really have been included in a four star hotel catering to business travellers. - You had to buy at least two drinks to be allowed to sit down in a chair in the lounge area next to the reception.

Reviews.Title: “switched rooms twice”
Reviews.Author: kzct
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Sheraton over Memorial day weekend. The first room we had, the ac was not working. A mechanic came up and said because the building was old, they can't keep up with everything.... he said he fixed it, and left. When we got back from our night out, it was hot in the room. So, at midnight we changed rooms. The floor in this room was soaked when we woke up the next morning from the ac leaking. So- we moved again. Not even an apology. Over all the rooms were very nice, but the staff was not that attentive with our problems. We paid a lot of money to have a nice relaxing 2 night stay for the holiday!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lliissaa
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a 7 night stay at this Hotel! We were there from 7/13-7/20 and could not have been happier!
