Based on the terrible reviews on this site I almost cancelled our reservation and booked elsewhere! I am so glad I didn't! We booked a club level room and were on the 46th floor at the end of the hall! We were there during a huge dance competition but never heard ANYONE in the halls or adjoining rooms! Our room was small but layed out nicely and it was CLEAN! The long desk provided some counter space and the open area underneath was a perfect spot to store suitcases, shopping bags, etc. There were 3 drawers in the piece of furniture the tv sat on and a roomy closet AND a large bench - we basically set out suitcases up and lived out of them - not inconvenient at all! We were comfortable with 2 adults and 2 teenage children in the room. The hotel staff was absolutely wonderful! They stored our luggage for free (it was posted that the cost would be $3 per bag) since our room wasn't ready when we arrived at 9:00 a.m. The club floor lounge was AWESOME! We ate breakfast every morning which consisted of fresh fruit, cereal, toast, pastries, juice, coffee, etc. This saved us a ton of money! We were also provided with water bottles in our room daily and extras available in the lounge as needed. The lounge also had a computer and printer with free internet access. We came back to the room one afternoon and discovered they had not left any packets of coffee - within 5 minutes of our phone call they brought us a big bucket of ice full of water bottles and a HUGE bag of coffee! We then received a phone call asking if we received everything we needed. I cannot say enough good things about this Hotel. This is Sheraton quality all the way. It is a busy hotel but they elevators are split by upper and lower floors - we never waited more than a few minutes. All of the staff members were courteous and helpful. We were there right in the middle of the heatwave and our room stayed cool and comfortable. A+++++ in my book - cannot imagine what so many people are complaining about!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: mrbusiness76
Reviews.Content: We stayed there three nights. We were quoted a price of over $300 per night. We stayed in the same place a few years ago and knew it was very convenient to Times Square, Broadway, etc. I looked at other places but came back to this one. The rooms were fine and the service was excellent though things were somewhat dirty. When I arrived by car, I stopped out front and they directed me to the garage (I did not have to pay them a tip to park it). The cost per day in the garage is $37 and there is no in and outs. We checked in at the kiosk and that worked great. we also handled our own bags which, again, saved us a tip. The room was decent sized for NY though it was not real clean. I visited with the desk and they gave us excellent advice on theater tickets. Also, when I needed a taxi, the people outside were excellent. All of that said, I thought I got a good price over the phone until my last morning when I got my bill. It was what I had agreed, but I found out others were paying a lot less than I was. In fact, the closest I heard of was $50 a night less. It would be a decent value at $250. But, not at close to $375.

Reviews.Title: “This was the longest 3 nights of my life”
Reviews.Author: lovenewengland
Reviews.Content: I was put in this hotel while in New York for work for 3 days. I was tempted to pack up and stay with my parents and commute into the city for those 3 days. I would have NEVER stayed here if I had had a choice. First the pros, because I am really not an unfair complainer at all! The front desk staff is so nice. The man who helped me check in seemed genuinely happy to talk with me, and everyone I dealt with was great. Also, the location is wonderful with cabs aplenty. Last, I did contact the hotel after my visit and they were quick to give me Starwood points to make up for my terrible experience. The lobby of this hotel is a complete zoo, and don't expect to get to/from the lobby easily at any time of day or night because the elevators are slow, too few, and packed. It's a very very tourist-heavy hotel. My room was just plain hideous. The only decoration was a map of Queens on the wall. No joke. There were scuff marks all over the wall, stains and sticky things (like 40yr old dried gum) on the carpet, NO storage space to speak of. None. The television was on a folding table. The Bible had no drawer to live in because there are no drawers for your little things, so it was easily accessible next to the television. On the folding table. The room was freezing, but the air conditioner unit, which was ancient, would not turn off. So I asked maintenance to come and lower it, show me how to put on heat. Their solution? To turn it all off, so I have NO air circulation (windows don't open) and they left me 4 blankets. Um, it's June. I don't need all that, I just don't need frostbite. The stagnant air was SO bad, that on my third day, it had rained all night, there was so much moisture in the room, my clothes, everything was damp. I can't imagine how much mold there must be in that place. I thought that maybe a workout would be beneficial to my mood/sanity. I go down and am told I need to pay $10. I am staying in the hotel and still need to pay- for a planned 20-minute run. This would've been forgivable but I had actuallly called to inquire about the gym, amenities, etc- TWICE. Never a mention of having to pay. Honestly, for a more comfortable stay, with an equally convenient location and about $300 cheaper- try the Intercontinental Barclay.

Reviews.Title: “Reports Accurate”
Reviews.Author: KPatt
Reviews.Content: I would like to say that the reviews I have read here, both good and bad, are accurate. It really comes down to what the purpose of your visit to NYC is. If you are looking for a hotel which is within walking distance of Central Park, Times Square and Broadway this is the spot. Directly accross the street from the double decker bus stop, close to restaurants, although pricey, and with easy access to all of the other tourist attractions of the Big Apple, you cannot ask for a better spot. The hotel lobby was teaming with a thousand adolescent girls in town for a dance compettion, however, my wife and I did not hear them at night because we were too exhausted from sightseeing. As a result, this hotel was great for us for the five nights we spent there. On the other hand, if you are interested in a sophisticated NY experience where you are treated like royalty, the lobby is quiet and elegant and you will dress up for dinner and/or the show you may wish to look elsewhere. You need to define the purpose of your visit and then look for the hotel that matches that purpose. For my purposes, the Sheraton was just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied with the Sheraton!”
Reviews.Author: sunloving-mama
Reviews.Content: We just got back on a big dance company trip with 140 people. We took 3 busses from Indiana over night and arrived around 2pm, toured Radio City Music Hall, then checked at 4. I was prepared to go to dinner and our musical without getting into our room, being there were so many of us to check in, but to my pleasant surprise, our rooms were ready. That gave us 2 hours for a nice shower and quick nap. I found the hotel better than expected. The beds were very comfortable. We were on the 19th floor with an average view of a building next to us. The room was clean and there was a large desk top that ran the length of the window to put stuff on. The bathroom was small and older, but clean. Our bed was made each day when we returned and we always had fresh towels and new coffee. There was some noise from people in the hallways, etc..but we were so exhausted each night, it didn't really matter. We didn't have to wait long for an elevator and the lobby is big, a nice place for our group to meet. The best part is the location. We could walk to Times Square, the 5th Avenue shops, NBC and CBS Studios, and to the Neil Simon Theatre to see Hairspray easily. We even walked to the Empire State Building, but that was a stretch. The pool access was across the street at the Sheraton Manhattan, as well as the gym, but with our busy schedule, we didn't even bring swimsuits. If you're looking for a clean, nice, fairly priced hotel in a good location for walking to many attractions, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two weeks and we would well recommend it, staff were really friendly, courteous and helpful. The location was excellent and we couldn't have chosen better if we had tried. This was our 2nd visit to this great city and would recommend the Sheraton New York Towers to anyone. We would certainly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased!”
Reviews.Author: texasgal123
Reviews.Content: Despite the negative reviews posted, we had a wonderful stay. My 15 year old daughter and I were visiting New York for a July 4 getaway. I was VERY apprehensive about the hotel because I did not read reviews like I normally do until after I made the reservation. The hotel lobby and entrance was much more upscale than I had imagined. All of the staff were very accommodating from check in to check out. The hair dryer in the bathroom was not working and they sent someone up about 30 minutes after we called, but beside the fact that our hair had air dryed by then, the second one did not work either. Even though my hair straightner worked using that outlet, they followed up with engineering to make sure nothing was wrong with the outlet. We did not expect the complimentary "club lounge" to be on a different floor than ours. However, it was no inconvenience to us. The hotel was VERY busy with several events going on. I did not realize the hotel had 50 floors, so the elevator was a little slow. Our room was clean on arrival and housekeeping was efficient in cleaning well. Our room must have been one of the complete rennovated ones, because it was nice and looked exactly like the photo online. My daughter and I had plenty of room with one king bed. No complaints. The bathroom was nice too. It sounds like some floors are cleaned and maintained better than others. Ours was great - floor 49. I would definintely stay there again!!! GREAT LOCATION!!!! Be sure to take a stroll down 6th Avenue. It is a residential area with reasonably priced restaraunts, produce store, etc. -- a scene straight from Seinfeld. The concierge recommended 6th avenue as well as a nice restaraunt in Little Italy. Great reference. Hotel is close to Central Park and Broadway. Stages deli was just up the block.

Reviews.Title: “Good in Parts.....”
Reviews.Author: Frequent_Flyer431
Reviews.Content: Arrived late after flight from Europe, checked in for the Club Floor room reserved, all details confirmed using my SPG profile. I was offered a smoking room, which my profile states I will not accept. Compromise was non-smoking with two doubles rather than a king, which I was happy to accept as I was travelling alone. However on reaching the room it became clear that it was far from being a Club room, and was frankly tired and shabby as well as being cramped. On calling the front desk, it became apparent that this should have been made clear at check-in, and the Club Floors were all "oversold". I had to prompt to be told that a rate reduction would be applied. The room itself was OK, but less than spotless and must be due for refurbishment soon. The rest of the hotel though was quite good for a large NYC establishment, friendly staff and a really good breakfast offering. No lines for anything I wanted to do. Maybe the Club Floor and rooms would have turned this review to a four or five star one: I'll never know as I won't be going back. I do understand that hotels get oversold on occasions, what makes me tolerate it is an upfront explanation which is exactly what I didn't get here. Staff at the front desk have to be trained to be honest and not just pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: rushmore
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Towers only after a great deal of anxiety due to the very negative reviews we read prior to our departure for New York. From the time we entered the lobby until the end of our stay, we were very pleasantly surprised. The room was clean and comfortable - great beds and pillows!!! The staff was very friendly and helpful - especially the concierge. I will definately stay at the Sheraton on our return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fair hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Oceanlvr97
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival-check in was 3 pm, there was one woman running the front desk (for the regular guests). I booked the room through hotels[""]. There were multiple people standing in line with problems about their rooms. I have stayed at the Sheraton Manhattan (twice) and had nothing but good things to say. I waited 45 min. (I was the 4th in line) to get checked in. The woman was polite and friendly, the staff in general, was friendly. The room was small as everyone describes. I really didn't mind as I was there to entertain family from out of state and we just wanted comfortable beds to sleep. The room was clean with the exception of the comforter-it had stains of unknown origion (I can only venture to guess what it was). There was a problem with the safe in the room. Security was quick to respond and acted as if this was a common problem. I have a phone call in to the hotel as I received a $50 charge to my credit card that wasn't there at the time of check out. I will have a fit if it was for the security to open the safe the morning of our departure. If you are in town and need a quiet, comfortable place to sleep-this is it. If you are looking for a large room, 4 or more stars, a pool (on site), up to date furniture, etc. this isn't for you. I guess I find out tomorrow why I was charged the extra $50.

Reviews.Title: “greedy greedy bellmen!”
Reviews.Author: qprjames
Reviews.Content: had a brief one night stay here thanks to priceline (100 dollars a night) i've stayed in much better hotels. i had to wait a long time to check into my room even though the staff cud obviously see me falling alseep in the waiting area. the room was pleasant. the location maybe a touch too far away from times sq but still not too bad. right next to a subway which has useful airport links to jkf airport. the worst part of my stay was on departure when i asked for the bellman to collect my bags from the room. now i know the english dont tip as much as the americans, but he just held out his hand in expectance. i did not feel his service was worthy of a tip and therefore sent him downstairs. when i went to pick my bags up from concerige i was greated with a forsty reception from his fellow bellmen, along with amazed stares as i left the building.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: Sc0tt
Reviews.Content: I would rate this property as fair. It is not really a four star hotel - more like three. The common areas are nice and the location is great - right in the heart of midtown. The room itself was not the best. It was very small and the carpet was extremely dirt and worn. The bathroom was also very small. I booked the hotel on Hotwire for a great price, so we did not complain at all. However, because I booked it through Hotwire, the hotel refused to honor my Starwood Gold benefits, which I found inappropriate and rude. The staff was friendly though and did give me a late check out anyway. The lines for check-in were long and moved slow. Overall, for the price I paid it, was a great deal, but don't pay a lot of money to stay here. The Westin Time Square is much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers at the start of June for 3 nights,I have been to nyc a few times and this was by far the best hotel that i have stayed in. The hotel lobby is big and very busy but alot of staff were on standby to help out, very fastcheck which was good as the cab ride from jfk was a knightmare as the a/c didnt work! We got a bell hop to take our bags up to the room for us we were on the 35th floor, our room was the furthest away from the lifts so it was a bit of a walk but it was ok. we opted for a twin room so the room was big good views too! room had a modern decor and the main thing it was nice and clean. The location of the hotel is great too, about a 5 minute walk to time square, around a 10 minute walk to rockefella centre and 5th ave. I will be returning to nyc again and definetly the Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers!

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: FirmFairandFriendly
Reviews.Content: Despit the warnings on these boards, we decided to burn some points this week at the Sheraton New York and Towers. I would not have thought that a company like Starwood, could allow a hotel to operate in the condition that this one is in. The only way that I can describe the attitude of the management, housekeeping and engineering departments is "complacency, and low regard for themselves and their guests." The Agent who checked us in was a delightful young lady. She was the highlight of our stay. As a Platinum SPG member, the hotel was kind enough to upgrade us to a suite. It was a bedroom with an adjoining door to a living area. Unless we have reached new levels of stupidity, we could not find a way to leave the doors between the two rooms open, so that we could enter and exit, without using the front doors. The bedroom was functional. Its state of repair was poor. Housekeeping was awful. The used condom floating around in the toilet bowl reminded me of the route that dead goldfish took as a kid. There were M & M's scattered on the floor, electric appliances unplugged (alarm clock and lamp), scotch tape still hanging on the walls from the "Happy Birthday" streamer that may have once hung on the walls, and more. The living area was also in poor repair and upkeep. It looks like the engineering department has put about ten layers of paint on the trim over the years, and in the course of doing so, had a hard time aiming at their target. The furniture was really tacky; my favorite was a blue velvet (where's Elvis?) couch. As was the case in the bedroom, M & M's were scattered on the floor, appliances (stereo) were unplugged, and the 1/2 filled bottle of mouthwash casused me to wonder if the previous user took a swig from the bottle. The common areas were equally disgusting. On our floor, the "Exit" sign was half-hanging from the wall. Walls and doors were in very poor repair. Speaking of doors, the sound heard from our neighbors were priceless, and alternated between excitement and pressure relief. The doors are paper thin. Access to the Club Lounge was a nice gesture, but on the early evening of our visit, there was little in terms of food to be had, and I guess I do not remember having to pay for soft drinks (two cokes, $7.50 plus tip). Not one staff member ever greeted us with as much as a hello, or good evening. Breakfast, on the other hand, included an excellent array of items, and we did not get hosed for juice or coffee, as we had anticipated. Again, not one hello or good morning from a staff member. Would we ever return to this hotel? absolutely not. It is an embaressment to Starwood. The "consitency" that we have come to expect of a major U.S. hotel brand is non-existent. My wife placed our clothes in a plastic garbage liner, and intends to boil them this evening; fearful that we may have picked up who know's what. If I were to bet, I would bet that this hotel is a "profit machine" for Starwood, and that it is dramatically undercapitalized. The complacency of the staff are tell-tale signs of poor management and oversight by Starwood. I suspect that this is a unionized hotel, and that organized labor is strangling poor management. To those who might think this hotel can't be that bad, trust me!

Reviews.Title: “Great location/value/touristy”
Reviews.Author: ABonVoyage
Reviews.Content: Small room, but nice city view. Remodeled. Room seemed dusty, but looked sparkling. Great location, but feels touristy. No gym in the hotel itself. Best thing: extremely quiet!

Reviews.Title: “Busy convention hotel but great service and good room”
Reviews.Author: babygoon
Reviews.Content: I was worried about staying here based on many reviews but we were pleasantly surprised. We did experience a similar problem as another reviewer had but we had a totally different outcome. Check in was quick and smooth (Starwood Preferred Guest line but the main check-in area wasn't crowded when we arrived in early evening). We did see long lines in the daytime so I'm sure it can be a problem. The bellman took us to our standard, no view room on the 27th floor only to find that it had not been completely cleaned. Bed was made but there was still trash on the desk area and the bathroom wasn't cleaned. At first the bellman asked if we wanted him to call the maid but then he thought better of it and asked us if we wanted a different room. We waited in the room with our luggage still on the trolley while he went back to the front desk. He came back shortly and told us he had us upgraded to one of the club floors (43rd) with a view of Times Square and entry into the Club Lounge (which included free breakfast and afternoon hors d’ oeuvres) during our stay. The room itself was exactly the same as our first room but the view was very nice and the perks in the club lounge were great. We saw a several other rooms of our business associates and they were all exactly the same, it seems only the view differs. We also spent some time in one of the suites which had the same exact bedroom as our room but opened onto a huge living room, dining room and wet bar area. We had no problems with the room or bathroom being clean. Our room looked newly renovated and everything was in good working condition. Although the room was small it was not cramped and had good closet and drawer space. A coffee pot with free coffee and tea was provided and replenished daily. There was a hair dryer, iron and ironing board and small safe. We didn't watch the TV but it seemed to have all the usual cable channels. There were two phones, one on the desk and one on the bedside table. Since my husband was working he thought the desk area was fine with easily accessible power outlets. The AC worked well and we liked the fact that the windows opened so we could get fresh air also. Of course it is in the middle of a big city so there is lots of traffic noise no matter what floor your room is on the sound carries. I think the Sheraton beds and bedding are probably the most comfortable of any of the hotel chains (we recently stayed at a Hyatt Resort and thought the Sheraton bed was better). Sheraton does not offer as nice bathroom amenities (soaps, shampoo, etc.) as some other resorts but ours were replenished daily. Only once did the maid come at a rather late time, around 5 p.m., to make up the room. She told my husband it had taken quite some time to clean a room that had been "trashed". We did notice when we were waiting on the 27th floor that there was at least one group of teenage kids staying there and they were quite noisy. We didn't have this problem on the 43rd floor so perhaps if you are visiting in the summer the upgrade to club level would be worth it. Only once did we briefly hear people talking loudly in the hall. The breakfast in the club lounge was great, bagels and all sorts of pastries, half a dozen cereals, hard boiled eggs, cheeses, yogurt, lots of fresh fruits and juices and a cappuccino machine. We only had time to stop in once in the early evening hours but there were a nice selection of cheeses, olives and other antipasti type appetizers. The bar is open in the evening but wine was expensive at $9 per glass. All the hotel employees we came in contact with were friendly and helpful. The concierge recommend a couple of good restaurants nearby. The hotel staff assisting with the convention were very helpful also. I'm not sure I would return to this hotel if I were going on a vacation since it is quite busy with convention groups and I usually prefer something more sedate for a personal trip. But we were completely satisfied with the Sheraton Towers. And as everyone has already said, the location is great if you want to be in Times Square, near Central Park, Rockefeller Center and 5th Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Not that good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on the last two days of our holiday in New York. Would only stay here because of the location. The room itself was small in comparison to another hotel we stayed in for seven days prior. First issue we encountered was the aircondioning. New York has experienced unstable weather and it was particularly cool the day we checked in. The room was freezing and I rang the desk for some assistance in turning the heat up. Well, the arrogance of the woman was inexcusable. She stated that there is nothing that can be done because the aircon was set for summer and that was that. Even after some arguing they could only offer extra blankets. The other issue was the wall lamp. When trying to switch it on or off there were sparks coming out of it. I called again and they sent someone up to see the problem and all we got was that "just pull the plug out of the wall and nothing will happen" They then promised they will fix the switch while we were out the next day. We came back at 5pm and nothing had been done. By this stage we gave up as we were not staying that long. Then there was the noise issue. By this stage I was ropable with everything else happening that I lost it. Early in the morning the next day there were obnoxious people yelling and laughing outside in the hallway. After having to get up and tell them to shut up and people are trying to sleep did they stop. Could not wait to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: damfino79
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a total of three times; in 2001, 2002, 2005 and I never know why. It was okay in 2001, that's why we went back in 2002. In 2002, they didn't have the room we reserved, (two double beds) so they gave us a room with one bed. After three nights, they had a room ready for us, but we only had one more night to go, so there was no point to switch by then. Plus, we saw a rather large rat running room to room. Of course it is NYC. Then last year, our rooms weren't cleaned very well, though we tip well everyday. After seeing Spamalot once through the cancellation line, we decided to try through the concierge. Without looking at a computer, the guy tells us that he has no tickets for the show. We were rather shocked that he knew this without even checking, so we came back later when he was gone. Here a nicer lady looked it up for us, and low and behold, tickets! The rooms aren't very quiet, and so we heard our neighbor's noisy children running up and down the halls, screaming and slamming doors until the wee hours. We could have jumped for joy when we saw them with their luggage. Security is okay on the weekend, but nonexistent during the week... well, they are standing there, but are only good for asking where to find a good breakfast. Which, by the way, a good place to go while in the City is Applejacks, just up Broadway from David Letterman's studio. We found that place our first trip to the city. Overall, the dirty rooms, the rude employees, not having the room we reserved, oh and the rat, I wouldn't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: Willow30
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for 5 nights in March this year and had no complaints. Found the staft fo be helpful on arrival - we asked for a high room with a view and got a room overlooking Times Square on the 23rd floor. The room was a good size for the two of us, it was quiet, kept clean and we had a huge comfy bed! The location was perfect. When we were last in New York we stayed at the Edison and had a horrendous room so by comparison we thought we hit the jackpot this time!! Would definitely return to the Sheraton again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Room Had Issues”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My two adult children and I stayed in the Sheraton Towers for six days in March, 2006. The room was small and when a roll-a-way bed was added to the mix, it was very uncomfortable and lacked sufficient floor space. I called maintenance twice to unplug the tub and he did the best he could but the drainage in that tub had some undesireable issues. The staff was friendly and very accomodating. I found that the Internet service, although it is advertised as "free," they had managed to charged me $8.00 for 15 minutes of time on their computers. I will not stay at the Sheraton Towers the next time I visit N.Y.C.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the money, problems with bathroom”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the hotel 4 nights in late May/early June 2006. The room was bigger than I expected, and reasonably clean. Unfortunately, we had lots of problems with the toilet flushing, and after calling maintenance twice to repair it, we gave up. Every time maintenance came up, it worked the next couple of flushes, but then stopped working. I tried to explain this to them, but it was never repaired. Also, there was always a line at reception, and when I tried to check out at the kiosks, I completed the transaction, and the machine told me that I STILL had to wait in the line and speak with a representative, which was ridiculous, since I did not have a balance. The personnel at reception could not tell me why that was necessary. It was a COMPLETE WASTE of time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for Times Square”
Reviews.Author: occupier
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel toward the end of May - I selected it because, in my opinion, this hotel is better than the Manhattan Sheraton across the street. I enjoy the fitness center - one of the best in a hotel with all new machines with tvs built into them. The fee is $10 per day, $20 per visit, or free if you are a platinum member. I thought the service was fine considering there were many different conventions. Club level was great - never ate the breakfast, but the apps for dinner were great! Drinks are expensive though - $9.00 for a glass of wine. My room was okay - two double beds looking directly at a large building. Not sure if I got a refurbished room (gee...I hope not since it wasn't that great!) The BIGGEST problem I have is the lack of sound-proofing. I could hear every conversation in great detail in the halls and in other rooms. Part of this is there is about an inch gap around the door! Otherwise, I would stay here again. The price is right for a Sheraton in NYC - and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “No Faults”
Reviews.Author: Toffeegirl68
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers for 2 nights: May 23rd & 24th following our voyage to NY on the QM2. The hotel was clean, comfortable and in a great location. We were part of Cunard's block-booking so had not chosen the hotel ourselves - I would not have been disappointed if I had! Would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Dogbox”
Reviews.Author: Saffy2
Reviews.Content: Three women stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. It was safe, clean and comfortable but certainly nothing more. The room was very small and once the rollaway bed was set up there was no room to move. The windows would only open a short distance and that was enough to fill the room with street noise. The airconditioning was barely effective. The beds (including the rollaway) were quite comfortable even though they were only full size not queen. The bathroom was also very small and there was no fan to get rid of the steam. The shower head, hot water and water pressure worked fine. The sink faucet however was not even secured so it easily moved about and it looked dreadful. The cupboard was huge so thankfully we could put our cases in there to create more floor room. The hotel charge a $1 surcharge for 1800 phone numbers and the internet was $15 for the first 24hrs despite the Sheraton advertising free internet access. There was no business center for regular hotel guests to use. The lobby was always noisey and crowded. The hotel is well located right beside a subway stop and down the road from Times Square. Be warned that the cafes, deli and restaurants surrounding the place are expensive but the food quality was good. This hotel was ok, but I don't think it was a fantastic choice for first time tourists to NY, its functionally efficiency didn't exactly reek "welcome".

Reviews.Title: “The latest word on the Sheraton ...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here today. Many of the reviews that I read on the site were I think pretty harsh regarding this place. Here's my take on the Sheraton: First of all, the front desk clerk told me that going forward they were only giving guests the new "remodeled" rooms. The location was great. The lobby was very nice with lots of activity and many helpful staff people. The room was nice. Some areas of the room were dusty (not dirty), especially the edges of the carpet but fine ( more dust under my bed at home ;). Beds comfortable, clean bathroom ( there was a bit of mold on the ceiling but the rest of thebath room was spotless), A/C worked fine. Got a deal on Priceline for only $149.00. I would certainly stay here again. (Note: Concierge directed me to Cafe Duke, a brand new deli a couple of blocks away, for a sandwich and snacks. What a nice place. Only 1 week old.)

Reviews.Title: “Expect a typical business-class hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: jsterben
Reviews.Content: Stayed here (21st floor) for 2 nights in April 2006 while visiting relatives. I've stayed in a number of midtown properties for both business and pleasure since 1996, and this one happens to be no better and no worse than any of the others. In New York City, it's all about location, and this hotel has a good one. In terms of the hotel itself, the sleeping area was nicely appointed (I'm guessing it had been recently redone), but small--something to expect from a property that was likely built in the 50's or 60's. Interestingly, even though the sleeping area was completely redone, the bathroom wasn't touched at all during the remodel and truly revealed how old the hotel was (not in terms of its condition or cleanliness, which were fine, but in terms of the tile used, its size, etc.) Staff were courteous and pleasant. Did not use or experience any of the hotel's facilities (many of which there is an extra charge for). Common areas were well maintained and nicely appointed. If I got another decent weekend rate, I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “staff helpful rooms need work”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the May long weekend (Canadian holiday). The staff were friendly and most helpful. A suitcase needed the lock broken (lost key) A most delightful woman from engineering came within 20 minutes of our call. She was pleasant and efficient. Could not get room safe to work. Security staff came within 15 minutes. Toilet was plugged. Again, within 20 minutes same woman from engineering came. All staff, including housekeeping were pleasant. The rooms were small which was alright. However, they were stuffy and the beds were not double sized but rather 3/4. This made for uncomfortable sleeping for two teenagers and their parents. As well, the halls and rooms were not vacumned sufficiently. Case in point, we found a folder for room keys under our bed from May 12th, and this find was made on May 22nd! As well, a top for a pen remained on the floor in the hall the entire three days that we were there. The location is great as most attractions are very close. DO NOT eat at Lindys across the street. The food was horrible and the prices, even by New York standards, were ridiculous. Ellens Stardust Diner, which is down from the hotel about three blocks heading to Times Square is a great place with great food and very fast service. As an added bonus, the waiters and waitresses all take turns singing songs. The Art Deli has fast service but the food was bland. Ellens is the best bet for breakfast, and apparently dinner is good there, although we did not try it.

Reviews.Title: “Could Be Better”
Reviews.Author: wigsy
Reviews.Content: The location is great close to theater, Central Park, Times Square. However it is not the cleanest Hotel. The rooms weren't properly cleaned ie vacumed, and the doors SLAM shut creating a noise that echos down the hallway. The bathroom could be bigger and the bathtub is too small.The staff however are friendly and helpful and eager to assist. Another note it costs $3 to check a bag per day.I have never paid for a checked bag in any hotel that I was staying at. In any other large city. Is this a Manhatten thing or a Sheraton thing?This is just nickel and diming people to death. There were 3 people in the baggage check, only one person was needed. The service wasn't any faster with 3 people. . In conclusion the room rate was too expensive for what you received.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: NorthShoreAustralian
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel was its location! Hotel staff were rude, it is overpriced, the rooms are stuffy. Parts of the hotel flooded and there was a blackout, whereby I rode the elevator in the dark!! I even booked a Club room and they put me on the wrong floor!!! They promised me 5000 Starwood points as an apology, and as on May 6, nearly a year later, I still don't have them!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: sunny-singh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for 3 nights, we had a room on the 40th floor. Though not a great view outside we were happy with our room. Room was a nice size and had a large desk area as well. The lifts were super fast and we really had no complaints at all. Room was air conditioned and room service was done well everyday. Sheraton is on 53rd street so is about a 5 minute walk to the main attractions. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was fine!”
Reviews.Author: jandamd
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I recently stayed here for one night while visiting NY. First, the positives: the hotel is located in a great area within walking distance to most city attractions. The lobby and rooms were nice, though it's always surprising to me how small NYC hotel rooms are in comparison to other large cities. The bathroom was clean but also very small. Upon checking in, they upgraded us to the Club level floor. Though I didn't visit the complementary Club room, my fiance stopped by in the morning and was impressed with the food options. The staff was very friendly and the valet parking was quick and very convenient. As for the cons: the hotel was incredibly packed and it took almost 15 mins to get an elevator. The walls seemed very thin and you could clearly hear your neighbors. However, we only heard them during the day and it was very quiet in the evening. Again, the rooms were very small but I expected that in NY. I would probably stay here again because of the location but I'd recommend the Doubletree Hotel first. On a side note, AVOID Lindy's restaurant which is next door to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A disgrace”
Reviews.Author: King Coal
Reviews.Content: A complete disgrace and one to be avoided at all costs. Small and stuffy rooms. Can't get a room service cart into the room and nowhere to eat in the room anyway except sitting on the bed. Terrible for families. Bathroom was verrrry small. Toilet broke the second day. Had to use toilets in the functions area but the first 4 cubicles I tried in the mens were unflushed. Reported this to staff. Next day, all 4 were still unflushed. No refrigerator in the room. We asked about this and were simply and unsympathetically told by the Duty Manager that we could hire one from them (apparently Sheraton is a equipment hire company) and that anyway we should have read about room facilities or lack of them from the website beforehand. The fact that we booked through an agent was apparently our problem. We were also told that the hotel is designed for business travellers. Apparently businessmen no longer want bar fridges! Mind you there were plenty of families there when we went. No airconditioning in the room and it was very hot and very stuffy. Windows did not open. Very noisy with paper thin walls. Cleaning staff banging doors and dropping vacuum cleaners. Surly cleaners knocked on our door on subsequent mornings to ask when we would be leaving so they could clean! (Apparently the hotel would run much better if only for the guests trying to have holidays.) Admittedly one morning we slept a little late but the second morning they started knocking at 10am! Our children even complained they couldn't sleep from the noise of the people having sex next door. Construction work also going on at the time. Despite the enthusiasm of the cleaning staff to get us out of our room, the room wasn't clean when we arrived (nose bits on a pillow) and wasn't cleaned very well during our stay (half empty glasses left). No baggage check facility run by the hotel. This is contracted out to another company and they charge $3 per item per day to hold. We had to pay $12 to leave our bags for two hours while we had a last look around Manhattan. Sheraton should be ashamed of this hotel and travellers should avoid it all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay at the Sheraton again”
Reviews.Author: coloradowahine
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton New york for only one night and I was thankful for that. I will start with the posituve. The staff was polite, nothing special. The lobby was attractive enough. I had read bad reviews after I made the reservation so I was hopeful when I saw the lobby. The location is good too. Easy walking distance to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Central Park. Okay time for the bad. When we came out of the elevator there was an odd smell on the floor. The hallways were bad. The wallpaper was scratched, and marked up everywhere. The carpet looked like it hadn't been vacuumed for a few days. The lighting was dim. It just had an old run down feeling. Badly in need of a remodeling. The room was small. We had 2 double beds and there was little room for the luggage. The beds were okay, not as comfy as other Sheraton beds. The bathroom was okay, small but clean. The soundproofing was not good. I heard doors banging and noise in the hall all night. I also heard cars honking outside even though we were on the 22nd floor. I would not stay there again. It just had a run down feeling. The Hilton New York in the same area is a hundred times better.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DiBA
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I stayed here on March 27/06 on our way home from a cruise. Check-in was fast and friendly and I was accommodated on my request for a lower floor. We stayed on the 17th floor in what I imagine to be the older section of the hotel. The corridors were very dark with worn carpets. The room was OK - nothing special. Beds were very comfortable and the hotel was quiet. We had problems with the excessive heat. We were told there was no air conditioning at this time of year and to open the window. Staff did promptly deliver a fan. The best thing about this hotel is the location. We walked everywhere we wanted to go. I would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE OF THE PHONE”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Reading other complaints I remembered an incident I had in this property. As my mobile phone didn't work at the higher floors I decided to make 2 quick calls to Europe only giving my number so I could be phoned back. There was nothing in the hotel brochures to give any indication of the price but it’s usually 10 times the usual (= appr 25-30 cents/min). Imagine my shock when I had to pay $ 82 for both calls (45 secs and 1 min). At the check-out I was told that it was due to AT&T. Guess my surprise that at Newark Airport large advertisings showed the following text: AT&T NOW overseas calls 10 cents/min!!! Fortunately, after I complained the Sheraton gave me a full refund plus extra Star points. The explanation for the outrageous prices was never given. The lesson to be learned: DO NOT ACCEPT THIS SORT OF RIP-OFF ANYWHERE!!

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the scary reviews - it wasnt bad!!”
Reviews.Author: TravellerKent_UK
Reviews.Content: Having read reviews on the Sheraton I had my reservations but to be honest it wasnt as bad as I was expecting. We were on 30th floor which was very high, this didnt make any difference to us apart from having to get the lift which was the sort of feeling you get on a roller coaster - fun the first time you are in it but not once you experience a nose bleed! Anyway, the hotel alone was clean, we did have some American school girls that decided to have a "slumber party" next door to us and even when asked to keep the noise down they still carried on - not the fault of the hotel of course!!! Did have a few drinks in the hotel but was very expensive compared to other hotels and didnt really have the atomosphere of other hotels we visited. I wouldnt rate this as a 4*, defintely a 3*.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Central Park View”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because of it's location - 7th Ave. & 51st St. Short walk to subways and most attractions. We had room 3842 and were surprised to find that we had a great view of Central Park. The hotel was gorgeous & super clean. The staff was extremely friendly. We highly recommend the Sheraton Towers. There are 2 other Sheratons within a block, but I don't know if they are comparable.

Reviews.Title: “Good option and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mtymd
Reviews.Content: The hotel has good service, rooms are small but confortable, forniture in perfect conditions, and Excellent Bed, maybe the best of all. the room heatear is so old as the hotel building, that was built in the 60's or 70's. Service is maybe not state of the art but is acceptable, the location is the best, near from Times square and also near from Central Park. Highly recommended the Libary Bar at the Looby is truly exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have traveled several cities and countries, staying at small hotels and big ones, modest and luxury. By all standards, this is the worst hotel experience I have had. The room was tiny and cramped like old NY hotels are (with the TV facing the bed, but off to the side so that no one could look straight at it while lying on the bed). But this is explicitly not what was promised at reservation, and at these prices, this is way sub-par. The internet service in the room didn't work, and the phone system hung up calls at random during the call (yet still billed me for it). The room was dirty and smelled, and as it was the winter the a/c did not work; however, because of the sun shining directly into the room all afternoon, it was inordinately warm and stuffy, and we had to open the window at night to cool it down, ultimately getting a cold while falling asleep in a bed with frigid weather coming into the room. Worst is that the front desk service and bellmen were completely unresponsive, saying they're on their way up (right at this minute? yes, at this minute!), only 20 minutes later, when they had not yet come, to then give some excuse. Finally, they moved me to a room that was to be a "bit better" and "larger," and after waiting and waiting for the bellman who never showed (he was on his way up for a half hour), I moved on my own... only to find that the room was exactly the same, except for the absence of stationery and a phone book. Needless to say, I moved out early.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but piping hot with paper walls”
Reviews.Author: Debmich1323
Reviews.Content: The hotel has many plus's: absolutely excellent location, very friendly and helpful staff, and clean rooms. We stayed in a newly-renovated room, and found the room to be clean and nicely decorated, and the bathroom clean with a good strong shower. The minuses however, would keep us from ever staying at this hotel again: the walls must be made of cardboard - we were woken up at 7:00AM by the guest in the next room coughing and speaking - and we could not sleep well due to the heat being permanently on in the room. In order to cool down the room, we had to open the window, which let in the very loud noise from the street (even on the 35th floor). Overall: nice hotel, but the thin walls and lack of climate-control are major problems.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: 1spartan1
Reviews.Content: As a Starwood Preferred Guest, I always seek SPG properties when traveling. Let's face it, this Hotel has and shows it's age. My experience at this property was fine. Upon check-in, I was upgraded to the 49th floor to a King bedroom overlooking Central Park South. The room itself is small, the bathroom even smaller. Not much of an upgrade, but considering my original reservation, it was a great deal for me. Things to consider: 1. PARKING.....super expensive! 2. HOTEL BARS....expensive drinks for a place that has no ambiance and no good looking people. 3. RESTAURANTS IN TIME SQUARE.....tourist traps. Weekend and special room rates are the way to go.... Anything more expensive will surely be disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Loud and Hot”
Reviews.Author: easton1
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with our stay. We had three significant problems. 1) When we arrived our room was over 80 degrees. The hotel told us that we should just turn off the heat that it would cool down on its own. It didn't. The window didn't open. 2) Around 4:30am, our alarm clock went off (we didn't set it), then the occupant in the room next door took a shower and it sounded like it was going on in our room. Finally construction started outside that was unbearable. (The walls must be very thin because I've lived in appartment buildings and the noise was never like this.) 3) Finally, the bathtub wasn't clean. There were a few hairs in it. Really, we should have complained. However, when I was waiting in line to check out, so many other people were complaining about the construction and the noise. The staff could only just apologize. They looked as if they had heard the complaints many times before.

Reviews.Title: “Ok When On Sale”
Reviews.Author: TouringLawyer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton because of a special weekend reate emailed to Starwood members. Unlike some othe reviewers, I found the hotel clean although the rooms are a little worn. Like many NYC hotels, the standard rooms are very small--they do have the Sheraton's deluxe beds and expected amenities. The hotel is clearly pitched at conventioneers--there is no quality restaurant at the property. The bar is pricy and also worn. The hotel is in need of a rehab. Front desk check-in (in the preferred line) was efficient and friendly. At a weekend deal price, it is acceptable--at the regular price, I'd look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with my stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 4 days for a business trip and quite frankly disappointed with the service and the rooms. The only positive I can say about this hotel is location, Everything else about the hotel is second rate. The sound insulation is not poor, constant noise from outside as well as people in the next room. The hotel is currently doing construction work on some floors, if you intend to sleep past 9AM forgot it as there are constant noise from the drills. I had to change floors due to the noise. Stained carpets, missing phone instructions (rates, instructions etc), no mini bar or small fridge, outdated bathrooms. Digital lock boxes doesn't work per instruction. Staff service needs improvement as they don't seem to care about their guests. If you have a choice stay away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: arsenaus
Reviews.Content: The room we had was on the 50th floor and while it wasn't an absolute dream room, we didn't plan on being in the hotel besides sleeping so it was good for us. We even had a semi-good view of Times Square. There was some construction going on and we were woken up at 7am one of the 4 days. The heat that some people have mentioned didn't seem to be a problem because if you turn it off it was neither hot nor cold in our room. We did have a problem with a door to an adjoining room and the hotel promptly fixed it while we were out for the day. Everyone seemed nice and helpful. The elevators were suprisingly fast - even up to the 50th floor and we never waited long for one. It is in an awesome location, especially if you don't know the city well.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: stonefree
Reviews.Content: The New York Shewraton is a large convention hotel that does not cater to leisure travellers. The rooms, particularly the bathrooms are in need of renovations, the service is poor (I could not get a NY times delivered), and the elevators are packed with convention attendees. At least the bed was comfortable. The club floor lounge was so crowded, that I had to wait on line to enter. Parking is a rip off at $37.00/day, and it took 45 minutes to retrieve my car. The front desk staff was completely unhelpful stating that they contract out the garage and have no control. Unless you have to stay here for a convention, I would avoid it at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Accomadations”
Reviews.Author: inlovewithnapa
Reviews.Content: The ONLY positive I can give about the hotel is the location. Upon checkin we were given a room on the 32nd floor. After our flight I wanted to take a nice shower to relax. The bathroom ceiling was covered in mold and the little paint that was there was peeling. The bathroom has a vent but no switch to turn it on, however it was caked with dust. The shower curtain was covered in body hair (someone had shaved their head or something) as well as the floor. Every wallplate was dirty, the entry door and every wall had black scuff marks. The carpet had more stains than good spots. I asked the front desk for a room change which they provided promptly. Upon the room change we noticed that the plug for the bathroom drain was hanging out and the tub was clogged, we were told engineering would take care of it which they never did. The rooms have no air conditioning during the winter, and the noise coming from the streets easily penetrated the single pane windows. Not to mention the hotel is currently under renovation and from 9:00AM-5:00PM there was a constant banging noise. The room was reserved through Priceline at a rate of $150/night. I could not imagine how mad I would be if I had paid the going rate of $250. Horrible, horrible room.

Reviews.Title: “aweful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights on level 26 - Starwood Preferred Floor. The room was poorly lit and noisy. They have installed wooden blinds which do nothing to prevent street noise from entering the 30 year old windows which have not been upgrades to double glazing since the hotel was built. The decor! I was in a refurbished room - it was tatty, badly worn and with yellow walls, dark blue carpet, red bed covers....go figure. Great after a 21 hour flight. I would never stay in this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again-very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: LynninCT
Reviews.Content: Feb. 2-4, 2006. Room had stained carpets, marked up walls, dirty wall plates. More than one corridorhas plastic and flourescent tape over 6-8 sections of wall and floor (not from renovation purposes) There was no air conditioning and the fan that was delivered to the room had a missing knob to adjust fan speed. It is frightening the bedroom windows open to about 3 ft with no safety stops. Not a good place for young children. Of my last five stays in New York City this is the worst accomodations I have expereinced for the price. Location is great and the comfort of the bed was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Small Room Too Hot; Self-Check-in Kiosk Too Cool”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If good sleep is important to you, stay somewhere where you can regulate the room temperature. Like a lot of the midtown hotels, the building is old and the heating/cooling system primitive. Only heat is available during winter and only air conditioning in summer. My room was a broiler. You can crack the windows and cool the room but you'll be listening to street noise, garbage trucks, and sirens all night. I slept poorly as a result. The room was pretty small, too. No big deal for one person, but might be cramped for two. They do have self-check in kiosks so you don't have to go to the counter, which is pretty nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay at this hotel at the end of November 2005. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Got upgraded to a nicer room for free even though it was very busy (Thanksgiving). Very clean & comfy room - not huge rooms (overheard many Americans commenting on how small their rooms were) but spacious enough. Don't think people from the U.K. expect huge rooms. (Bigger than a Premier Lodge/ Travellodge room) Anyway - why spend time in your room when you've got a HUGE city to explore !!! Breakfast/ Food expensive in hotel. Head across to Seattle Cafe (West 50 Street) for lovely bagels/panckakes and coffee ! Times Square & Central Park in walking distance. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i have just returned from a stay at the above hotel. check in very quick and rooms were clean and spacious. breakfast was a but pricey so i would suggest eating out. $40 per person for the buffet!! location great come out chuck a left you have times square chuck a right you have central park. 5th avenue and rockafeller also very close. visit woodbury common for cheapish clothes 5th avenue no cheaper than home probably more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: miss_blonde
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from a new year trip to New York where I stayed at the Sheraton Hotel and Towers on 7th Ave. The hotel was great, rooms very spacious, comfortable and clean, I was on the 18th floor which has recently been refurbished and some lower floors looked a bit worse for wear so try to get an upper floor if you can. All staff very helpful and the hotel is in a great location, only a 2 minute walk from Times Square and only about 10 minutes from 5th Ave shops, Central Park and Rockefellar Centre. You also have use of the pool and gym at the Sheraton Manhattan free which is just accross the road. Fab hotel, I would definately stay here again when returning to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Touch of class”
Reviews.Author: rothick
Reviews.Content: My family spent new year here and loved this hotel. There were four of us so we booked two rooms. When we arrived one room was not ready. We informed the management and they promptly put$100 credit on our account. The location is excellent the rooms quite luxurious. We were allowed 4pm check out on one room. The whole place has a touch of class about it. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “second and last stay”
Reviews.Author: ohiocouple
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton was ok, but has some problems that a New York name brand hotel shouldn't have. This was my second stay at the Sheraton on 53rd . I arrived to front desk clerk who acted like she didn't want to be there helping guest. I waited in the starwood preferred line for 10 minutes (only one person was ahead of me) and the other desk clerks were taking the general line ahead of me. I booked a room with $25 food credit, but wasn't found on my reservation. I got the impression she thought I was lying. My room was nice size, on the 41st floor and a view of the office clerks in the next building (not a big deal). The bed was very uncomfortable and not very inviting. I went to the preferred member floor to find that it had been flooded and no breakfast or dinner appitizers were being served. The gym was closed and clerks were sending guest across the street to the Sheraton Manhatten. Overall, the hotel my needs of having a place to crash, but with all the competition near by I am going to look for another starwood hotel to visit. If you are a business person who is on a business trip I do not recommend this hotel. If you are young and adventurous I'd recommend trying it out and then coming back to this website and reviewing it here.

Reviews.Title: “Busy lobby but great value”
Reviews.Author: orion_8
Reviews.Content: In comparison with other NY hotels we've stayed at, the Sheraton was clean and features spacious rooms. The value was good as well. The only thing I would knock about this hotel is how busy it is. There were waiting lines at the front desk no matter what time of the day or evening it was. Also, some rooms are nicer than other. We were lucky and got a spacious room on floor 7. Overall, though, it's a good deal in expensive New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, Nice hotel, good location...”
Reviews.Author: love-vacations17
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home from a 4 night stay in NYC. We arrived New Years Eve, and thanks to the NYPD who were very organized and pleasant, it was not too difficult to navigate, with our 2 children & luggage through jam packed streets that had been barricaded due to the New Years Eve's crowds that had been waiting for the view at midnight of the ball in Times Square. Our room was situated on the 43rd floor. It took exactly 27 seconds in the elevator from the lobby level to 43. The room was spacious enough for the 4 of us. We had 2 double beds, and we rented a cot as well, which the hotel only charged us a flat rate of $30, for our whole stay, which I thought was a great deal, as many other hotels charge that rate PER night. The bathroom was a bit small, but really the whole room served our purpose, as we really only slept in the room, we were out all day and evening. The soundproofing is good, we did not have any noise disturbances at all. The beds are VERY comfortable. We ordered room service, and the portions were great and reasonable. The housekeeping service was good too, our room was always made up well, and if we needed more towels, or in our case a toothbrush, these things were brought to us quickly, and telephone calls were made to us, making sure we got what we had requested. Everyone working in this hotel was very curteous and friendly!! The location was superb, within walking distance to many great areas, shopping on 5th Avenue, Central PArk, Broadway, Times Square, Rockefeller Plaza, MOMA, etc... Loved it so much!! Can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, "cold" room, pricey.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This Sheraton is like any other Sheraton - the kind of quality you expect from the name brand. I stayed for one night during the NYC Transit Strike. My company had decided to put us up so that we didn't have to travel so far. This location was great because it is right across the street from my work building... it is also extremely well situated for Broadway, Radio City Music Hall, Rockefeller Center, NBC studios, 5th Avenue, etc. The room is "cold" - dark browns and navy blues adorn the upholstery and linens. There aren't any bright lights, just dim yellow lights. It had a very business atmosphere, which I suspect is what they are going for, being in that area. It is definitely not a hotel aimed at tourists or out of town visitors. The room is a nice size, although I have to say that the bathroom was a bit small. The usual amenities (shampoo, conditioner, lotion, etc) were provided. There is a TV with basic as well as cable channels. There is nothing really special to say about this Sheraton, except that I believe the prices are incredible. Me, being someone who lives in NYC, doesn't do much research on the hotels here, but for $275/night (and that is a corporate rate!) this was one hell of a price! On company money, I'd definitely stay here. But spending your own? I'd suggest somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location - Some Reservations”
Reviews.Author: romana
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from a 3 night stay at the Sheraton & Towers in New York over New Year with my husband and 2 teenagers and I have to say I was nervous as I had read many bad reports on this hotel over the past few months. I am extremely well travelled being a Travel Agent and have stayed in many hotels all over the world so I will try to give the positive and negatives on this hotel. First of all the main positive is the location. It is approximately 7 minutes walk from the middle of Times Square and so is really central and ideal if you like to be in the middle of everything. Initial impressions of the reception area were good as it is pretty impressive and when we checked in at approximately 2000 hrs there was no queue. We were given a room on the 20th floor and I had requested a high floor after reading various reports on Trip Adviser re this. Our room had 2 double beds which were extremely comfortable and the room was not big but this is something that you expect in New York but I would have to say the bathroom was extremely small and I got a shock when I saw it. The carpet in our room had a few marks on it but for our needs I felt it was adequate. I did go to reception to try and get a bigger room and I got to check another on the 30th floor but it was identical although they have a club lounge and must have bigger/better rooms which will carry a supplement. The corridors appeared to have been refurbished as the carpet seemed new but already there were scuff marks on paper which is a pity but people obviously bash cases against the walls etc. I found the reception staff pretty unhelpful apart from the gentleman who checked us in and other than that they werent at all helpful. The doormen particularly Ralph and Martin the Concierge were really helpful and friendly so its a pity the reception staff dont follow their colleagues example especially as they are the first point of contact. We did not eat in the hotel but there is a great Deli just over the road so I can't comment on the food. I would recommend the Sheraton & Towers if you want a good central location with clean rooms and a comfortable bed and if you are getting a fairly good rate but do not go expecting it to be amazing and you wont be disappointed. In my experience and I have been to New York a few times you do not get a lot for your money unlike Las Vegas for example where you tend to get a lot for your money but then again there are hotels with 5000 rooms there so there is a lot of competition and you get 5 star for 4 star prices there. I would not rule out a return visit to the Sheraton if I got a decent rate and I think that it's best selling point is its central location.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Sniper33
Reviews.Content: I write a review for each hotel I stay in, not just when I have a bad experience -- so don't believe the over-the-top "worst hotel ever" reviews here. This is a nice, large, clean, full service, New York hotel. The price might be high but I found a good deal on Priceline. Pros: perfect location (4 blocks or less to Time Square, Fifth Avenue, Central Park, Rockafeller Center, MoMA, etc.) and on two subway lines; comfortable small but chic rooms, great views, good beds, nice bathroom; full service hotel in case you want to exercise, get a drink, need dinner late, want to park your car, etc.; safe hotel and safe location. Cons: some floors are undergoing renovation (newspaper says $50 million renovation in progress) so perhaps some of the older rooms are still being rented (renovations did not affect the public areas or our floor; abrupt but competent staff; $10 charge to use the fitness facilities. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone unfamiliar with N.Y. who wants a good room at a premium address.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kookiekirsty
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the start of December with my partner for a week. Check in was fine - we arrived about 2pm and we got served immediately. We were a little worried about arriving at first because of some of the bad reviews - but we informed the hotel prior to arrival to request a high floor and renovated room - which is what we got. We are on the 43rd floor and had a view of Times Square - the room was average size with a small bathroom. Everything was up to scratch in the room - new furnishings, comfy bed but above all - everything was clean (bedding and bathroom)- which the maids changed and cleaned every day. The only flaw I found with the room was with the doors - our room door did not fit the door frame properly (I don't know whther this was to do with the bitter cold weather?! or even when they refurnished the room) and also there was also a draft in the bathroom from under the bathroom door. We didn't have much contact with the staff - spent most of the days out and only came back to sleep or get ready for dinner. But, the staff we did talk to were very polite. The hotel is in a GREAT location - 5 mins walk from Times Square - 5 mins walk from Central Park. There's a subway staion right on the side of the hotel or you can take a taxi from the front (Surprisingly I found the taxis to be very cheap!) - the doorman hails one down for you. However, we walked pretty much EVERYWHERE!! Bring some comfy shoes! I had to buy some! I thought it'll be all SATC heels but it isn't!!! Great places to eat as well near by - Delicious delis (Carnergie deli is a 2 min walk away!) and found a great breakfast place called Burger Heaven (just out the hotel door, go right and straight down that street and it's between 5th and 6th!) - amazing pancakes!! ESB is great at night too! Can't wait to go back to New York again! Hope you have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Positives outweigh negatives if the Price is Right.”
Reviews.Author: paluvsnyc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton the night of 12/19. We had 3 adults and a 12 year old. We had stayed at the Sheraton Manhattan on an earlier visit to NYC and found it to be satisfactory with above average staff. But wanted to stay at a different hotel so we chose the other property across the street. So we kinda knew what to expect from the room/bathroom. Like everyone says the rooms are small but I have yet to find a spacious NYC hotel room. The bathroom was very small but big enough for what we needed it for. Both were clean. All I really want from a room is cleanliness. We were only in the room for about 8 hours and that was for sleeping. The best part of the hotel is the location. Close to everything in midtown! My husband and I walked 2 blocks to the David Letterman Show and my mom and daughter walked approx. 3 blocks to Radio City Music Hall. We also walked to Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and St. Patrick's. For downtown locations, we took the subway right outside the hotel on the corner. We waited for the prices to go down before booking our trip and that made the hotel worth the price. I don't know if my review would be as complimenting if I would have paid more than $199. But for the price it was well worth the location and the clean room. The hallways were a little scrungy and dark. This could be improved. The desk staff were not impolite but they weren't great either. We tried to check in early @ 12N but they said they didn't have any rooms but we could check our luggage free of charge. which was fine except I saw them passing out keys to others that checked-in before and after me. I guess my preferred status wasn't high enough to get a room at that point. So they said they would call when our room was available. We never received a call. I finally got a hold of the front desk around 6p and they said everything was taken care of. We finally checked-in at 7p. Hotel was always busy, a lot of people around the lobby, but check-in was fast and elevators were always available without a wait. At check out I was inquiring how I was to receive my $25 food/beverage credit(part of the special room rate) and the woman at the desk just credited my account. I thought this was a very nice gesture!

Reviews.Title: “the furniture is very old and the price is very high”
Reviews.Author: MonicaMaria_10
Reviews.Content: the location is great, but the furnitures are old. it is very expensive. i don´t pretend to come back to this hotel. I´ve already stayed at Double Tree (ex.Metropolitan), and it is much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: ach0717
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers December 22-23rd. This is our second time at this hotel and we'll choose to stay there again next time as well! The hotel is in a great location close to everything. We were there during the transit strike and didnt have any difficulty getting around. It's very helpful having the bellmen out front to get a cab for you. The lobby is large and accomodates all of the foot traffic. We arrived to check and see if our rooms were ready at noon and they were which was great. The rooms were clean and the perfect size. The beds very comfortable, and everything you needed in a hotel room. They have a great lobby bar with a large selection of drinks. We had no problem getting a seat and relaxing. We will most definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Even with the flaws, best Sheraton in NYC...better than the other one.”
Reviews.Author: jad376
Reviews.Content: Forget the overblown bad reviews. The old Americana is improving; this is a good tourist bet if you pay under $200. But it's still one notch above ordinary. I stayed one night during the transit strike, and was satisfied. Of course, it didn't hurt that I got a rate of $159 and earned triple points on my starwood preferred guest account. I booked at the last minute because I knew I wouldn't be able to get back into the city the next morning due to the transit strike. I don't know if this was due to the strike, but I had to make ressies online because no matter how hard I tried, I couldn't get a hold of the hotel on the phone after 40 minutes of calling. The Sheraton New York (formerly the Loews Americana Hotel, a gleaming 1950s jewel) has always struck me as a tired, cliched relic of the 80s with no character and fake, tip-oriented service standards. The location, however, is perfect, on Seventh Avenue between 53rd and 52nd. You can walk to the MoMa, Central Park, Times Square, Fifth Avenue shopping, St. Patrick's Cathedral, Macy's, the Public Library, or practically any central Midtown tourist attraction. First of all, this is a tourist oriented hotel that caters to people who don't really know New York. As such, the first people you meet when you check in don't actually work for the hotel - they're an outside company that handles your luggage, takes your money and t h e n hands you off to the Sheraton Bell Staff, which I consider to be an inconvenience. A consequence of this is that they can't send your luggage up to your room without you in it - something I've routinely had done at numerous New York hotels, most recently the Westin Essex House. At check-in, expect to wait in line. I checked in at 7 pm, so my wait was less than 5 minutes. From what I've seen in the past at this hotel, check-in can take up to an hour at peak times. It's not that they're slow or understaffed, it's just that a lot of people check in and out at the same time. Again, tourists. My standard king room, 3403, was on the 24th floor and faced directly down 7th avenue toward Times Square. This is the view to request. If I were a couple rooms over, I would've been looking into an office building across 52nd street. The beds, which feel exactly like the 5-pillow down comforter-bespoke Westin heavenly bed, are great, possibly the saving grace of these rooms. The rest of the decor is relievingly simple and tasteful, with wooden blinds, a leather ergonomic chair and everything else done in black & chrome. There is no mini-bar, which was good considering my impulsiveness but I wonder how many tourists they could fleece if they provided this, uh, amenity. There's $15 high-speed internet access, both wireless and ethernet, but they had to send an engineer up to tinker with my nonfunctioning pay-per-view movies. Yes, bathrooms are your basic 5'x7'6" hotel small, but mine was very clean. The moral of the story is the better the bargain, the more you'll warm up to the Sheraton New York. If by some terrible act of fate you find yourself paying more than $200 per night, run the other way to a different hotel like the Doubletree Guest Suites (same class, more space in the epicenter of Times Square), the Omni Berkshire Place (trying to be 4 star around the corner from Fifth Ave), or even the Waldorf-Astoria, possibly the best tourist pick in the Big Apple. However, this Sheraton isn't as tired as I thought, and my stay deserved a five-dot review.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: sazzle9876
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay there last week.. yes the rooms are on the small size but what can you expect in New York! The location is amazing- you can walk to Times Square, Central Park and 5th Ave. The subway is like 2 blocks away. We found the staff extremely helpful and polite, especially as this was our first visit to New York. Our rooms were always clean everyday, and the beds are the best beds I have ever slept in!!! Worth staying just for them!! I'll definatly stay again in the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the $$$”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from this hotel after a two night stay. The rate was $500 a night and was NO WHERE NEAR worth that amount. I have stayed in $500 hotels before and this IS NOT one of the, . The rooms were quite small, had mold on the bathroom ceilings and were not "plush" in my opinion. There is a hotel bar and restaurant downstairs and a GREAT, AFFORDABLE deli directly across the street for breakfast. I cannot remember the name, but it is not Lendi's. Lendi's is NOT affordable or reasonable. Two people had purses stolen from the hotel lobby the two nights that i was there, BE CAREFUL! The hotel is not a dump, just not worth the money, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: although very good location, extremely bad hotel. very small rooms and bathrooms. no or in another room very little hot water! impolite staff. bad sevice. worst price/quality ratio ever.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Towers Undergoing facelift”
Reviews.Author: evandbob
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here after Thanksgiving and scaffolding encircles most of the building. Some rooms with southern exposure towards Times Square are not available due to renovations.
