As an SPG Platinum Preferred, I am used to getting non smoking king on a top floor, so I guess I'm spoiled. Checkin/out is a breeze with self service kiosk, no line to wait on. Close to B'way & theaters. I'll stay here again when I hear construction is done.

Reviews.Title: “Awful and disappointing experience in my hometown”
Reviews.Author: tthlady
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for three nights and should have checked out after seeing the first room. It was room number 2133 and there was blood on the walls! Next they moved me to a room right by the elevator bay so I didn't like that (too noisy). The final room I stayed in was 3533 and it was philthy!! Someone elses hair band sat on the floor for all three days. The rooms are to hot and no way to set the temperature as the hotel actually turns off cool air in the winter months. In the morning as i was in the bathroom i saw an actual cocaroach on the floor. The head of housekeeping Aeisha (very nice young lady) knocked on my door after my complaint and and tried to sort out the problem and arranged for one nights charge be taken off the bill. Aeisha said she was going to supervise the cleaning of my room and yet again the hair band sat on the floor. The supposedly new renovated hotel rooms have awful furnishings with crappy blinds that don't block the sun or work poperly. The lamp shade on the right side of the bed was broken and they had to know about it because it was taped. All and all for the money they charge PLEASE GO SOMEWHERE ELSE. Have a nice experience in the best city in the world. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: ptrcvd
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location. Unfortunatly the rest of it does not match up. We direct from a cruise ship with a group of around 20. We were told the rooms would be available on arrival at 11.30am They were not and we were told to comeback at 2.30pm. Most of our luggage we were told would be stored and be in our rooms when we came back. Smaller items however had to be put in the check area at a cost of 3 dollars per item. When we camback at 3pm the room was ready and the reception staff helpful. However the room was awful and the luggage missing. The room was dark and smelly. It did not look as if it had been cleaned for sometime. In the corridor ourtside a lampshade was broken and hanging from the wall. Atelphone call to reception led toa new room being allocated but gave little assistance re the luggage. After a visit to the porters desk Iwas taken toaroomon the44th floor with a very surly porter. Indide were around 30 cases and we were left tomanhandle our cases downstairs. The 'porter 'refused to help! Our new roomon the 38th floor was much cleaner with a great view. It had been refurbished but with very dark materials. Everything was brown , back or blue except the beeding which was a dark red. The overall impression was of an office. The bathroomwas small but clean though there was a cracked tile. Severalothers who arrived at the same time had their luggage missing until past 4.30 and a number had tochanmge rooms for a variety of reasons. No heating was the mosy common... not good when the temperature outside was only just above freezing The whole hotel looked grubby and was not like any Sheraton I have ever stayed in. Despite the location I could not recommend it toanyone.There are better , cheaper hotels with an equally good location. Use them instead.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: BuffaloNYTraveler
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was completely renovated within the last year. They must have used the cheapest materials on the market as it already shows severe signs of wear and tear. The wallpaper was ripped and badly marred where the laundry carts hit the wall, the trim work badly chpped and the carpet worn in heavily traffic areas. We reserved a room with 2 double beds, but it was only large lenght-wise; we still had to move for either of us to get around the foot of the beds. They call their decor "modern", I call it stark, dark and cold. It was like sleeping in my office. A Courtyard, which is geared to the business traveler, has more warmth. The bathroom was very small, as is typical of older NYC hotels. The TV didn't work well. We stayed here about 10 years ago, and it was much nicer in its older form. On the upside, the lobby area is lovely, the location is great, and the staff was friendly. Although we don't spend much time in the room it is still not the type of hotel we would stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Problems”
Reviews.Author: drtwnbys
Reviews.Content: We had planned a trip to NYC for Thanksgiving and made a reservation at this notel in April. The rate was 319 per nite. It was expensive but they allowed me to book a non smoking double room. Well a month before the trip the non-smoking part vanished and then the double room vanished and finally a day before we were to arrive - I was finally able to speak to someone who said I had a smoking room period! Nothing could be done. I spoke to the hotel, the 800 people, supervisors etc. All were inept. I was also told the hotel was completely renovated. Well it's not! "Most rooms" were renovated. So good luck. I cancelled and stayed at the Westin. I saw the Sheraton while in New York and there are still scafolds and covered walkways outside, so the renovations aren't completed. With my trouble dealing with this hotel I would never recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Sheraton for nine days during the week of Thanksgiving. The hotel was packed with parade participants and as other reviews have stated the lobby was packed nearly 24 hours a day. Despite the holiday crowds the hotel staff was excellent in attending to our needs and dealing with the conditions. Everyone from the front desk to the staff at Streeters were very friendly and helpful. We were traveling with an infant so this was very much appreciated. The bellmen were outstanding, flagging taxis when needed and moving luggage into and out of the hotel quickly and efficiently. We asked for and received a renovated room and although it was small...as everyone says...it's New York...what'd you expect. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable, and there was a place for a mini-fridge (20$ for the length of your stay). However... and I think this was really the only bad thing about the room... the temperature control on the airconditioning/heater didn't work. In terms of location the hotel is a block west of broadway and very near to Times Square, Central Park, Shopping on 5th Ave, the Theatre District and Rockefeller Center. There is a subway station right around the corner (literally!) from the front door of the hotel as well as one on the corner of 51st and Broadway. These two stops will get you just about anywhere you need to go. For those of you who might be concerned about taking the subway, keep in mind a few pointers... Not all the subway stations are handicap or small child friendly...be prepared to climb a LOT of stairs. At times the trains were crowded but they were clean and everyone was friendly (especially if you get lost) You can spend a fortune on food if you're not careful. Two of the best and most reasonable places we found near the hotel were the Allstar Cafe/Deli on Broadway and 52st (for an inexpensive, quick meal they can't be beat especially for breakfast) and Bubba Gump's in Times Square...the wait staff there were THE BEST and portion sizes were more than plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Distinctly Average”
Reviews.Author: Pap
Reviews.Content: Great location but rooms are cramped and poorly furnished. Also, the cleaning left something to be desired. The lobby was like something out of rush hour at Grand Central Station and it was impossible to get a seat for breakfast without a 40 minute wait. The sports bar was excellent with friendly service and reasonably-priced drinks - in contrast to the food price. At $500 a night, you should be able to do better.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: SJE1000
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at the beginning of November 2005. The hotel itself is huge, and very, very busy. The staff aren't particularly helpful or friendly, but did their job effectively. The hotel reception/lobby is the busiest I've ever seen, doesn't matter what time of day it is, there is a constant flow of people coming and going. We had a standard room on the 16th floor. Our room was fairly small, with a small bathroom, which had a shower. The room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. Unfortunately, the room was very dark, and most of the time we needed the light on. Our breakfast had to be taken in the hotel opposite, which is the Sheraton Manhattan. They have a bistro called Russo's and we took breakfast there. Although it was a bit inconvenient having to go to another hotel, the actual breakfast was very good. The main advantages for this hotel is the location. It is a short walk to Broadway and Times Square and in the opposite direction, Central Park is about a 10 minute stroll away. Overall, this hotel is OK, no frills, but is ideal as a base for exploring Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: proppy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before and after being quite impressed the last time, I decided to not risk a dump and go back to this hotel. It is the last time I stay there. I must have been very lucky the last time I stayed as this time the staff were unfriendly, rude and very unhelpful. We have been upgraded both times and were pleased by this. The staff in the club lounge argue in front of the guests over tips and make it quite clear that they are hanging around for a tip. I'm a good tipper but if I sense someone is eagerly awaiting one, I hold back a bit! The nicest staff were the security guards and the door men. The rooms are not bad (the refurbished ones). One day there were matresses, a head board and other bits and bobs in the hall way all along the corridor just near my room and they were there all day. Unfortunately I won't be staying again. I now see that it's a bit of a lottery as to whether you will have a good or bad experience as the staff attitude varies so so much. Last time we had the nicest service this time it was really unwelcoming. I do hope they change things and sort this problem out as it is a nice hotel, if not slightly to big and business oriented.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasent stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself my wife and my baby daughter stayed here for a week whilst we got married in central park. Initially my wife thought the room was very small, especially for the occasion that we were there for. We tried for a bigger room but the hotel was so busy that there was nothing available. The lobby was exceptionally busy but check in was very quick. The staff were very helpful and polite, better than 90% of hotel staff in England!!! The room services were very good. I think this hotel is better suited for business meeting and business personel. Overall we were quite dissappointed that it didnt match our expectations, especially as we were there to get married and have one of the best weeks of our lives.

Reviews.Title: “Not a pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: mspitt55
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not satisfactory! The blinds were so dusty that when you opened them, you needed to cover your face. Dust an inch thick! There was mold on the ceiling in the bathroom. The location is fabulous, but some good old elbow grease in the rooms would be great! The TV is not in the center of the very small room so only can be seen from one bed. TV very old and outdated.

Reviews.Title: “No 5 Star Service Here...!”
Reviews.Author: LeilaJake
Reviews.Content: My Husband and l stayed here for 3 nights in mid Oct 05. We have been Sheraton/Starwood members for many years and have stayed in Sheraton Hotels all over the world and it is beyond me why Sheraton would put there name to this hotel. To say it was awful would be an understatement. Like many of the reviews before, the location is great but thats the only plus. Firstly we booked a king room but were given a double being told that this was on a Starwood Member Preffered floor and that it had been recently renovated. We could not believe this floor was recently renovated. The walls in the corridors were so badly marked, and the room was old, dark, EXTREMELY musty and unpleasant. The room was so small we could hardly move around the bed. I asked for milk to be bought up for our coffee and was charged $13US for the effort. On our first night we had a drink in our room and glasses were not cleaned/replaced even up until we checked out 3 days later....!! The top of the television was covered in coffee/drink stains which hadn't been cleaned since l don't know when. This was a TERRIBLE start to our trip. We will NEVER stay in this hotel again and have complained to Sheraton about this, but to date have not received a reply. There are so many hotels in New York around this area....any ONE would have to be better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - but .....”
Reviews.Author: lilley1
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed here Sept.20th for 5 nights after mixed reviews. I can say that this is definitely a great place to stay if you want to be close to Times Square as it is only a 2 block walk. But I would sure check Hotel prices and do a good comparison - to expensive for the problems. Do not count on getting the room you reserved even if you double checked with them before arriving. The room we reserved was not available and after being sent to 4 different rooms we finally "settled" on one. The Hotel is still trying to renovate I guess - at least I hope so with the state of some of the rooms. Ours was a bit stuffy and old looking with the shower curtain falling down and you showered with a tub full of water - with the plug taken out. And that was the best one we were shown!! We were treated as if we were a bother to them arriving 9:00pm and then trying to get the room we reserved - somehow a double room just doesn't seem to satisfy me when we reserved a king, hmmm. For a Sheraton Hotel I couldn't believe how dirty the hallways were - do they vacuum?? Our room even went 2 days with the garbage not being emptied or it being vacuumed. I hope the sheets were changed... I couldn't find a Manager to talk to and they never got back to me when I left my name. Actually it is now Oct.18th and I am still waiting to hear from someone! However on a good note - the Restraunts had very friendly staff and the food was pretty good. We found though that little Restraunts around the area were cheaper and had even better food. If I ever return to New York, it would definitely not be to return to this Hotel and we use Sheraton quite a bit when we travel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: wlcasper
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a New England cruise. Came to NY two days before the cruise to enjoy a couple of Broadway plays, etc. Stayed at the Sheraton. Nice hotel, clean, well kept. Polite and helpful personel. Check-in and check-out was a breeze. Very centrally located right in the heart of all the action, time square a theatre distrcit a very short walk! A bit on the pricey side, but hey that's New York. Stay here with confidence.

Reviews.Title: “A Great NY Weekend”
Reviews.Author: gordo824
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the NY Shearton for two nights at the end of a weeklong road trip. Parked the car at a friend's place in Queens and caught a cab into midtown and was pleasantly surprised to see how close we were to the action at Times Square. Room was on the 18th floor, newly renovated, with a beautiful Sheraton sleeper bed and nice desk area in front of the bay windows. A bit small overall, but it is New York. We got the Wedding Night special (no, we didn't get married), which at $199/nt was a steal. A fruit and cheese plate and bottle of wine was sent up upon our arrival, and we got complimentary breakfast for two (actually, it fed my parents, too) sent to the room each morning. Staff was nice and attentive. The lobby area was often incredibly crowded, mainly with 12-15 yo girls in town for gymnastics or something. Overall, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property during a trade show at the NY Javits Center. There was a shuttle to the center that stopped right across the street from the hotel and saved on taxi rides. Overall the staff was friendly and helpful. I, however, was dissappointed that the cost of the baggage check could not be charged to my bill or paid with a credit card. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel...ask for a renovated room though”
Reviews.Author: quilty
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days here with families of hurricane Katrina from New Orleans, the weekend of the 24th of Sept. The Sheraton NY was kind enough to gift them rooms so we could take them to the Broadway Celebrity benefit for Katrina. The hotel could not have been cleaner, prettier or more comfy... I did find out that they are working on renovating rooms from the top down...so ask for one of those... we were on the 18th floor with a great view and the best bed I have slept in...in years. Even DOWN pillows (and I did not have to ask) and very soft cotton sheets. The room was VERY clean and bright. There is a Starbucks in the lobby (isn't there one everywhere?) with sandwiches and snacks at the same price you'd get them for back home... The LOCATION is the best for Broadway...with great restaurants close by (for a cheap but fun meal go to Ellen's Starlight Dinner and listen to out of work Broadway singers sing as they serve)...they open at 7:00 a.m. and have adelicious french toast with strawberries and syrup... 2 blocks from the hotel are plenty of upscale places to choose from that have large portions that two can share easily. Azalea restaurant has the BEST fried Calamari and Champagne Chicken with grapes, entree. The Palm and Blue Chili's resaurant were also delicious....and opened their doors to our families from Katrina ..with a free meal....and it was a divine dinner! I will go back!... The restaurants are all around 50th and Broadway...Near the show WICKED playing at the Gershwin theatre. ( A GREAT show but buy tickets months in advance...and don't bother going to the TKTS kiosk cause they don't have WICKED discount tikets there). The hotel is a good place to stay if you are in town for business as it has a full wall to wall desk area for computer hook up and I believe is wireless in the newly renovated rooms. I'd also recc'd it for families as it is easy to get to so many areas quickly... Don't worry if you forget your camera...etc... there is a gift shop in the lobby, with the things you may have forgotten at home and need. ...and across the street are great camera stores with what seemed to be bargain prices for cameras and other stuff like CD players,etc. Re: The rooms are Large ( mine had 2 full size beds) with an average size 1 sink bathroom with full tub and shower . Shampoo and conditioner as well as nice soaps and shower gels were plentiful. I apprecitaed the Magnafying mirror and hair dryer that had some decent power to it. There is a pool and fitness center which my friends used by I did not. They said it was nice as well as clean. The hotel bell men, Concierge and front desk folks are all very polite and helpful. Getting a cab was easy....the bell man out front simply whistle one down for you... Staff were all kind ...No bad attitude here...they aim to please. And as the head of a non-proift, I'd like to thank them for coming to the aid of hurricane victims by gifting them hotel rooms so we could take them on the town and give them some relief and respit from hard times. Highly Recc'd!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience with this Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: dreamdb11
Reviews.Content: This is not my usual hotel when I'm in NYC, but we stayed because we needed multiple rooms and at our usual hotels that was just way too expensive, at $250/room it was a GREAT rate for NYC! I found every single employee to be so helpful. Had a problem with room charges, called and with no questions asked it was taken off of my bill. Our room was smaller than the average hotel room, but I didn't mind. The beds were comfortable and loaded with extra pillows. Everything was extremely clean and had no problems with anything in the room. The area is close to everything necissary for a tourist, like public trans, cabs and attractions. Because it is near a busy area, I was really glad we were up on the 35th floor because there was no noise what so ever. I'd highly recommend this as a great hotel, especially if you can get the price we got.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Hotel and Towers”
Reviews.Author: jansue
Reviews.Content: Just returned from holiday in the U.S, which included five nights at the Sheraton Towers, New York. Good location with a short walk to Times Square and Broadway. Tour bus stopped right outside. We found the hotel to be very, very busy all the time, not sure if this is always the case but it was a holiday weekend whilst we were there. We were very unhappy with our room, everything was in need of decoration, very grimy, and the bathroom was the smallest I have ever seen in a hotel. The ceiling had mould and the plaster was peeling, you could see where it had been patched due to water damage. The plumbing was antiquated, every now and again there was a foul smell in the bathroom. You could not turn round without hitting an elbow or knee, to dry yourself off you had to open the door. We complained about the smell and was offered a refurbished room on a higher floor. On inspection we found this room to be freshly decorated but the room was much smaller and would not hold our luggage. The bathroom was the same size but had been re-decorated with new wallpaper. We decided not to move rooms, I cleaned the bathroom myself to brighten it up and helped to disguise the smell. It seemed the hotel had not bothered at all with the rooms not refurbished and were charging the same as the refubished rooms so it was pot luck on check in. We loved New York but would not return to the Sheraton. Last note they did receive a godwill discount off the bill which paid for a meal with drinks which we accepted.

Reviews.Title: “Quality, Sheraton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a top Sheraton hotel- probably one of the best I've stayed in, considering its location and the fact that NY always has smaller rooms. I would recommend it to anyone, although the Westin Times Square is still my favorite.

Reviews.Title: “overrated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked this through priceline, which said it was a 4-star hotel. I disagree. Small rooms, narrow hallways. pay $20 extra to use the fitness center. Location is great. I got a good price but was expecting more.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Saruhhh
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night and liked the hotel. Our room was clean and had two very comfortable queen beds. I didn't have any staff interaction, so, I can't comment about that. The gift shop was crappy. The bar was nice and the restaurant looked okay, but I didn't eat there. The best thing about the hotel is the location. We walked to Letterman, Central Park, Carnegie Deli, Carnegie Hall, Times Square, Broadway, 5th Avenue, The Plaza Hotel, etc. They were all fairly close. I'd definitely stay there again, based solely on location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: prodog
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel as part of a post cruise package, so all checking in procedures were already taken care of on arrival. Our room was on the 9th floor and was clean and comfortable, the bathroom was fine with a really good shower and although there was evidence of some renovations needed here and there - overall the room was good. We heard nothing from the rooms on either side of us and the windows were well sound proofed. We had breakfast at the hotel in Streeters Cafe, but once again as part of the package our breakfast was paid for. The waiting staff were very helpful and pleasant and there were copious offers of coffee and juice and and nothing was too much trouble. The hotel location is superb, situated very close to Times Square and Broadway, all mid town Manhatten sights are easily walkable. The lobby is very attractive although they could do with providing a bit more seating, the Library Bar was very pleasant and the prices for drinks were on average with other NY bars. We didn't use Starbucks or the Restaurant so can't comment but the restaurant appeared to be very dark. We would go back without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Eh...not too bad”
Reviews.Author: urbanshopper
Reviews.Content: Solid Sheraton quality, nothing terribly special but certainly far from horrendous. It's used mostly by guests on business as they have a huge convention center. Location is pretty good, away from the hustle of times square but within a 3-5 minute walk. Close to several subways which is always convenient. Didn't eat at the hotel as there are a million places to choose from outside. Rooms were a decent size (I've stayed at the Hudson before, and their rooms are tiny!) but not large. Beds were comfortable (just wish the sheets had a higher thread count but I suppose that's nit-picking). A few problems with the housekeeping (burnt out bulbs, missing towels), but nothing serious (they were quickly remedied). I got a decent deal via the starwood website, so if I could stay there again for the same price I'd go for it.

Reviews.Title: “never going back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed one night after going to a show. The room cost $300 with taxes. The lobby was very nice and the service was O.K. However, once we got to our floor, the halls were shabby with stained old carpet, old wallpaper and a musty smell. It was depressing. The room was small, but clean, with the same old stained carpet. Dust and dirt could be seen in the air vents. It took forever to get hot water for a shower and equally as long for the water to drain. This place needs a major makeover. We won't go back.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: colbuck
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel on the first stop of our honeymoon. And being on honeymoon, we were ready to spend $250 per night hoping to be hosted in a luxurios room in the heat of New York. When we stepped in we were smiling: the hall is gorgeous and check-in was done in a second. But when walked in our room we were quite disappointed: it was a good room with all amenities but didn't give the impression to be "grand" as we hoped. The bathroom wasn't that big either and amenities just average. Newspaper was abandoned on our doorstep, rather than being carefully folded and presented to us. And you could hear wind sweeping hard in the elevator case, while waiting for it, which made me a little fearful. However, do not get me wrong: it's a nice hotel in a great location, but it's just not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Reoryn
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, I was a little worried about staying here after reading some of the stories, so I'm happy to report that it didn't let us down in a single area. The reception area is quite impressive to walk into and it didn't take long to queue up to get to the reception. I could have checked in at an automatic terminal with my credit card but decided to do it with reception so that I could request a renovated room as so many here have suggested. The receptionist was a little cold, but polite and upon my enquiery, confirmed that the room we had been allocated was indeed a renovated room. The room was located on the 18th floor. The corridor outside looked very new and was decorated in Dark blue - very nice. The room wasn't a bad size and was clean and looked fairly newly decorated. I can't say I had any complaints at all about the room and we were very pleased one day to come back and find all our toiltries in the bathroom had been arranged on a towel next too the sink by the cleaner for us. The only slight problem we had was with a blocked toilet, but a quick call down to the Promise Help desk and they said they would send someone straight up as we were just going out for dinner. Sure enough, when we got back it was unblocked and we had an answerphone message waiting to confirm that everything was ok and asking we call back if we had any more problems, a nice touch. Overall, I was extremely pleased with the hotel. No troubles with the Paper thin walls that others have mentioned. While we could hear people in the corridor, we never heard anything from the adjacent rooms. I'd be more than happy to stay there again, especially considering the excellent location which I honestly think it would be hard to best.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly and shabby”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in several Sheratons which have always been good value and clean but this was the exception. We had a pokey little room with a filthy, stained carpet and poor decor. There were very few seats in the lobby area and when I sat in the empty bar area I was told to move by a very unpleasant barmaid. We had an afternoon flight so stored our cases for a few hours at a cost of $3 per item. There is a starbucks in the lobby but on each occasion I wanted a cup of coffee it was shut. The location of this hotel is good and if you are only sleeping in the hotel and don't want to use the facilities then try to get a deal.

Reviews.Title: “The tip of a Perfect Trip!”
Reviews.Author: christine8270
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Hotel and Towers - New York - August 1-7 Have a seat because this is lengthy but worth it! We had booked a club room with the buy 4 nights get 2 free offer and thus paid only $186 per night (not including taxes and add fees) for 6 nights. Our room was ready when we arrived at 10:30 despite their 3:00 check in time, Yay. It was on the 50th floor and had free access to both the gym (Lower Level) and the Club Lounge (44th). We groaned when we noticed that it was right by the elevators, but throughout our stay we never heard a peep from anywhere :) The club lounge offered breakfast from 6:30-11:00 and orderves from 5-8pm and there was a computer with internet access in the lounge as well as free bottles of water. Our room was fantastick! We had a lovely king sized sweet sleeper bed, made for heavenly sleeps :) There was a desk in the room that ran the span of the room with a really comfy desk chair too. From our window we could see times square, and there are thick wooden slat blinds on the windows and once you figure out how to operate them they are great! (and do keep out the light if you close them tight). Also in the room - tv, 2 telephones, a programmable code safe in the closet - you program it yourself, a nice comfy robe and lots of closet space, also internet access (add. charge). The bathroom was small but nice. It had a clean tub with shower head (heavenly rainfall) and a nice grip on the floor of the tub. All the usual trinkets, shampoo, cond, sewing kit, mouthwash, hand cream and such were provided. I think the sink counter was marble, very nice and it had chrome accents, as well as a very feminine friendly magnifying mirror. The elevators in the hotel were so fast, it is nearly impossible to imagine how fast you are moving. There are two sets of elevators 1 set going to floors 1-24, and the other set going to 24-50. Check in and check out were easy enough, we got a late c/o for 2 pm no charge. And we paid after that $3.00 per bag to store them till we left. We tried out the room service, and though it is obviously expensive they pull out all the stops. They have gratuity incl in the bill, and they will collect your table when you are finished (check picture). The gym is great, life fitness machines and comp towels. It is free to club floor members but $10 a day i think for other guests - both have to sign in upon each visit. Area: Carnegie Deli is right across the street about 1 block north, and times square is south about 5 blocks. The theater district is about 7-10 blocks south in the times square area. And the best restaurant to eat at - Virgil's BBQ check it out it is on W 44th street between 6th ave and broadway. Also check out my pictures that I added for this hotel. Can't wait for my next New York Trip, Hope yours is just as fun! If you have any questions about the hotel feel free to email me :) Christine ~now wants to move to NY~

Reviews.Title: “ICK!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at this hotel for three nights on a business trip, and it was completely not worth the so-called "best available rate" of $329 that I paid. I stayed on a "Starwood Preferred Guest" floor, but the rooms were tiny, with multiple stains on the carpets, dirty and torn wallpaper in the bathroom, hairs in the sink and toilet (?) left by a previous guest, an air conditioner that rattled like the dickens and didn't even work sufficiently. No matter, since I had to open the windows to get a gross sickly-sweet perfumey stench out the room. You know, the kind of smell you might expect at a Motel 6, not a Sheraton. Clearly, this place is well-overdue for a renovation. When I complained about the air conditioner (necessary since it was about 85 and humid), I was moved to a different room (note - I first called downstairs to inquire about switching rooms and was put on hold with the front desk inexplicably for 15 minutes, at which point I just walked down there to find the front desk staff doing nothing). I was switched to another room - supposedly the best one available - which was just a different room on the same floor. It had the same dirt and the same problems as the prior room except that the AC didn't rattle (it still didn't work very well). Since it was past midnight at this point, I decided to just stay in the room, but sleeping was another issue. The insulation is TERRIBLE; kind of like what you might find at a one-star motel. You can hear everything in the hallway and adjoining rooms, like guests slamming their doors and talking, watching TV, etc. Basically, the three nights I stayed at this place, I didn't get to sleep much due to the door-slamming every 5-10 minutes or so until well past 2am. I had early meetings every morning, and not being able to sleep on a business trip is the worst. It seemed like the other guests on my floor were either large familes, loud teenagers, or drunk twenty-somethings, and none of these people apparently need to sleep. Oh, and I was a little annoyed to discover that, in addition to the $329 room charge, it was also $10 per visit to use the fitness center, and $3 per bag to store your luggage in the luggage room. So it was another $6 to basically hold my bag for two hours (I had to check out at noon but had an early evening flight). Bottom line, I wouldn't ever stay here again or recommend that anyone else stay here, especially if you're a business traveler. If you need to stay in this area, there are much better alternatives like the Marriott Marquis (larger and more upgraded rooms, cleaner, QUIETER, no charge for the gym or luggage storage, etc.). This makes me never want to stay at a Sheraton again, either.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: SweetPea
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed one night at the Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers. Check In: The check in process was very smooth. The woman at the front desk was friendly and when we discovered that our reservation reflected two double beds vs. a king bed, she was quick to make the correction for us. The Room: Our room was on the 24th floor. It was larger than I had expected - given the typcial size of NYC hotel rooms. It was tastefully decorated and had a great view of 7th Avenue below. Everything was clean and the bed was incredibly comfortable. The bathroom was small - too small for two people to get ready in. The Lobby: The hotel is big and as a result, the lobby is very busy with lots of people coming and going. However, we had no issues using the services of the concierge or the bell captain. The Location: This hotel is in a very convenient location on 7th Avenue. It seemed that everything was within a reasonable walking distance. We were very pleased with our stay at the Sheraton Towers. We paid $175 for the night and it was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: mavo
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel because it was a Sheraton and i got a good offer (get the 3rd night free if you stay 2 nights). I was so excited about getting there, but when i finally did, my deception was big. Good things: Check-in and check-out were fast. Concierge service was efficient. Bed and pillow felt like heaven. Magnifying mirror in the bathroom. Good looking lobby. Elevators worked properly. Good location (close to everything: attractions, restaurants, buses, tours). Bad things: Many groups (dancers, models) go there to conventions and meetings. Pipes in the bath of the room were awful. Bad tv image and channels. Terrible and expensive breakfast at Streeter's cafe (tip: eat in a greek cafe acroos the street, next to the visitor information center). In sum, it isn't as good as i expected a Sheraton to be, but if you find a good offer, and no other hotel seems good for you, think about it. Anyway, it's your call. Enjoy New York, and please don't go in the summer season (it's too hot).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Sarah_CT
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with my teenage daughter. We arrived 3 hours earlier than the 4pm check-in time but had no problem checking in. I was hoping to just leave my bags at the desk but was told that a room was ready for us. The lobby is beautiful and yes, it is busy. The hotel is big and people are coming and going constantly. The elevators are fast and you won't have to wait long to get one. There is a bar in the lobby that serves Starbucks coffee and pastry most of the day and there is a restaurant in the lobby called Streeters. We ate there for breakfast. The buffet is expensive but very good. It was $21.75 per person and that included awesome pastry, eggs, bacon, sausage, ham, potatoes, fruit, oatmeal, cereal, bagels, coffee, juice, etc.. They only charged my daughter half price which I thought was awesome of them since she ate more than I did. The Sheraton directly across the street has a swimming pool on the 5th floor and Sheraton Towers guests are welcome to use it. Just show your room key and you can go right in. This hotel has a great location. Walking distance to Times Square and wonderful shopping on Madison Avenue, and also very close to Rockefeller Center. The famous Carnegie Deli is only about a block away, on the same street as the Towers, 7th Avenue. The beds are very comfortable, the rooms are clean. I didn't think the room was as small as some of the reviewers have said. I found it to be very adequate in size. The bathroom was on the small side but it was fine. In short, the hotel is comfortable, clean and has a great location. I got it online for $190 per night through a bidding site. I thought that was a good price for it.

Reviews.Title: “Noisey, busy”
Reviews.Author: pmcojm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last weekend and did not enjoy our stay at all. We checked in with two adults and two children, ages 8 and 12, and were told that they only had rooms wih one king bed available. After we insisted that four of us could not sleep in one bed, they finally "found" us a room with two double beds but we immediately realized that the air conditioning was not working in that room. After waiting two hours (and tipping the engineer), we were moved to a room with two beds on the "preferred guest" floor. This room was fine, although all the rooms are tiny. As another reviewer stated, there was a dance convention at the hotel that weekend, and we had our share of young teens on our floor. They ran up and down the hall all night, slammed doors, shouted, laughed, etc. I finally called security at 1:30 a.m. It was horrible. I would never stay there again unless I was with a convention. This is not a place for vacation. The lobby was loaded with people at all times, and the concierge was swamped all the time. There was a 10 minute wait to retrieve luggage from the bellman. Forget it--I don't need this on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms in this hotel because we were told it had been renovated in 2004. We expected the rooms to be renovated and clean. To our surprise, both rooms had not been renovated and had dirty, dusty carpets. Hair pins, buttons, pieces of plastic, pieces of paper and paper napkins from the previous guests were on the carpets. We called to have the rooms vacuumed the day we arrived, and it was not until four days later that they sent someone to clean them. The hair pins and some pieces of plastic were still on the carpet when we left. The bathrooms were dirty and in need of updating. Every morning, the housekeeping staff yelled to each other in the corridor disturbing us, and even though we had placed the “do not disturb” sign in our doors, every single day housekeeping would knock at our doors to see if they could come in and make our rooms. A toilet brush was left on the corridor’s carpet until we called to notify the staff. It is perhaps the worst housekeeping service we have ever encountered! The safe in our room did not work, and it was never fixed. To make matters worse, a mob of girls was staying at the hotel and they were quite noisy at all times. Apparently it was a group of dancers. We do not understand why this hotel could not separate this large group from other guests. We were very happy with some aspects of our stay, though. The beds were very confortable, the air conditioning was very quiet, and the curtains blocked the light very well.

Reviews.Title: “How I took a Bite out of the Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we flew from Minneapolis to New York (La Guardia) with no problems. Collected our bags and went downstairs to the exit to see a man in a black suit (wide lapels), black shirt, black tie and for all the world looking like a mafia hit man, holding a sign that had my name on it (I had made arrangements with the Sheraton for transportation from the airport to the Hotel, I did not expect a limo, but it was wonderful!). We identified ourselves to him. He got on a cell phone and called someone Else and said "They are here". He then escorted us outside, where a long black limo pulled up to the curb. Another Man got out wearing the exact same outfit as the first, but he was twice that man's size! He looked like a brick wall wearing a mafia outfit. He opened the doors to the limo, and as we were getting in he said "How ya doin', I am Mario, your Driver" and closed the door. DH then turned to me and said "I don't want to wear cement overshoes!". Now the fun started, here we are in the back of a long limo, and our driver was driving like he was in the game "Crazy Taxi"!! We were going like 80 miles per hour, weaving in and out of traffic, barely missing other vehicles by millimeters!! (It was great!), we made it from La Guardia to 53rd street downtown NYC in just 20 minutes!!!!!!!!! an amazing feat! We pulled up in front of the Sheraton Towers New York where the doorman took our luggage to the check in desk for us. Check in was a breeze (our room was on the 22nd floor), and our luggage was taken up to our room for us, and we were escorted upstairs to our room. Our room had all the amenities we needed, internet access, a coffee maker (stocked with both regular and decaf, sugars and creamers), a room safe, blow dryer, Iron and ironing board, and the most Incredible king size bed! That was the most comfortable bed ever! We then hit the town with a vengeance! We did some amazing things..My Husband took a picture of me with a mounted Policeman and his horse!, we walked down to the SoHo District and took in a comedy show at Ha! (I have never laughed so much in my life!!), went to Greenwich village to a restaurant, then wandered back to the hotel as by this time it was around 2 am! We got up at 6 am to go downtown to the New York Library (I wanted Pictures of the stone Lions), went 2 more blocks to Grand central Station (Beautiful place...and HUGE!!!!) got on the subway (very clean, and very friendly!) and rode the subway to wall street, were we took pictures of where George Washington took his oath of office, pictures of Wall Street. and found an Art Gallery of "The 70's", we wondered through the art gallery for over an hour looking at pictures of Blondie, Rod Stewart, John Lennon, Any Warhol, lots of statues, and a movie about New York, before and after 911 (I was bawling by the end of it). Then went a few more blocks to Bowling Green, where we saw (and took pictures) of the eternal flame and tribute to 911. bought tickets for the ferry to the Statue of Liberty (and was searched, x-rayed, belts and shoes removed etc by the New York SWAT team.) Finally we boarded the ferry to Liberty Island, where I got some amazing Pictures of the great lady herself! Then the ferry to Ellis Island, went through the Ellis Island Museum, and back on the ferry to mainland. We then walked a few more blocks to ground Zero, where I cried again, and got some more great pictures! We then wandered around The Century 21 store where we found deals like $600 Prada bags marked down to $20 (The real deal too!) We figured out why NY'ers are wonderfully dressed and thin...you can find designer clothing for a lot less than food in NY!!!! Restaurants are EXPENSIVE!! We then wandered around and found a few really cool parks, and Art pieces (like the miniature of the city where my Husband posed as King Kong on the Mini Empire State building..LOL) We then went back down in the subway, watched some break dancers, caught the subway to the Empire State building, (It was light when we entered, and full dark when we got through more searches, lines and the ride up!) We then got back on the subway, went back uptown, to a pizza joint and back to the Hotel, on the way we saw a film truck drive by us, filming an ambulance and fire truck whizzing by!! When we got to the Hotel, I ran into (literally ran into as I was not watching where I was going) into a handsome Black man that looked familiar.....I apologized and he said no it was his fault...then it dawned on me it was the Reverend Al Sharpton!!!! and his entourage leaving the hotel restaurant! The next morning we slept in, and packed up, checked out at noon and had the hotel store our bags, as our flight was not scheduled to leave til 6 pm. We decided that since we had got everywhere we wanted to see for the most part, and I still had plenty of pictures left, that I wanted go to Central Park and I still wanted to see Strawberry Fields. (Very Moving!!!) We had a late lunch at tavern on the Green, and decided it was getting about time to go back to the hotel, where we had a Limo waiting for us (and a different driver than previously) who took us to the airport at a leisurely pace! We made it home around 1 am, and now I can't walk because of all the blisters on the bottom of my feet...but would do it again in two seconds flat!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Beds and Great Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ocalico
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton Hotel and Towers and really enjoyed my visit to New York. The hotel is at a great location---close to Rockafeller Center, Central Park, Radio City Music Hall, Times Square and Broadway Theaters and shopping. The beds are so comfortable and the room was clean and inviting. All of the staff I dealt with were very friendly and helpful. I even forgot something in my room and I called two days after I had checked out, the housekeeping dept. took my telephone number and said they would call if they found my item; two days later I received a telephone call from the housekeeper saying that they had located my item and would mail it to me. I received it in the mail the next day! Great service! I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Stay - Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: mborkey
Reviews.Content: Stayed the week of June 26 - July 2, 2005, at the Sheraton New York & Towers for a combination business/family vacation trip and found it to be a very uncomfortable, overpriced, miserable stay. I usually stay at the Marriott Marquis when in NYC, but could not book it on this trip as it was sold out for those dates. As a "platinum" starwood guest I was "upgraded" to a "corner" room on the 47th floor and was told this was a "larger" room. The room was tiny compared to the corner rooms at the Marriott Marquis. I'd hate to see what the "normal" sized rooms are like. Since my family was with me, we got a room with two double beds. The room was so small, two people could not walk in front of the beds at the same time. If the closet door was open you could not get into the bathroom, which was tiny as well. The air conditioning in the room did not work well despite having maintenance "fix" it three times during our stay. They finally said "that's as good as it gets". NYC was hot ('90 degrees), humid, and rainy all that week. Being from Houston, I know how a good air conditioner should work and this one didn't come close. The first two days, we were told they were completely "sold out of two bed rooms" and could not move us to another room, later they offered us a room on the 7th floor - which we declined since it was a smoking room and the noise from the streets at that level. The room is supposedly designed to make business travelers comfortable, but this room only had one phone, no outlets on the desk to plug in your PC, Cell recharger, etc. you had to climb under the desk and unplug the desk lamp to be able to plug anything else into one outlet. The shades in the room would not close properly, so every morning you were awakened by the sun streaming on your face. The walls are extremely thin, so you could clearly hear every word in the room next to us, not to mention the slaming of every door down the halls all hours of the day or night. The halls were dark, narrow and dingy. They reminded me of a dungeon. We had "lounge" access on the 44th floor, and that too was a big disappointment. It was crowded every morning no matter what time you went there with a bunch of kids - apparently there was some dance competition being help at the hotel. Being used to the lounge at the Marriott where soft drinks are complementary, my daughter asked for a coke to drink one day and we were shocked to learn that it was $3.75 for a four ounce drink in a glass that was mostly ice. We paid the "best available rate" of $299.00 (plus taxes) per night which was a miserable, overpriced place to stay. I will never stay here again. The Marroitt is ten times better for about the same price.

Reviews.Title: “FLOODED ROOM”
Reviews.Author: kingaf
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with 2 girlfriends. First of all the room had 2 double beds yet it was so small and so was the bathroom. The air conditoner was so loud we had to get a maintence man to come and fix it. After a long day of shopping we came to find our room flooded and water everywhere in the bathroom. After waiting in a flooded room with all our bags expecting a room we were notified we had one on the 12 floor. Well it just happened that people who called us at the old room such as boyfriends, parents etc were told we checked out and left to go to boston. ( guesss they got people mixed up) Sheraton did not tell them we relocated rooms and we missed alot of phone calls and had lots of people worried. My friends boyfriend thought she was having an affair with some guy in boston and that we never made it to NYC in the 1st place, after lots of explaining they worked out their differences. Rude people, slow and arrogant.

Reviews.Title: “Watch Out for Large Groups Booked in”
Reviews.Author: Travelin-GalPepin
Reviews.Content: First stay in NYC, and since the hotel was booked for us by a relative of my travel friend I didn't want to complain, but... the hotel was booked with literally hundreds of dance competitors from all over the USA. Now, I like kids, but the biggest complaint I had was that the club floor, with its special breakfast (I agree with other reviewers that it was well provisioned) and horsd'ouerves, was PACKED with many children lacking supervision, and most coming up from floors that were not the preferred club floor. I don't know if these folks were allowed to 'upgrade' to get the floor's amenities without actually staying on the club floor or what, but the normally quiet club room was more of a teen-time party than a happy hour. If the hotel is going to allow anyone with an extra $40 to upgrade for the 'free eats' then management needs to be more on the ball in keeping suffiecient staff to keep the club room stocked and cleaned up. It was obvious they were understaffed, so many dirty tables, etc. The floor was full of ground in crackers, the hot foods for happy hour disappeared in a twinkle. I felt sorry for the few staff trying to keep the place from being totally swamped under. Management better look into the policy of allowing anyone to upgrade to the club floor and rethink how much business they my lose in future if this plan continues. I know we were not the only ones to complain about this.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: Geordiegirl35
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location it is slap bang in the centre of where everything is happening. Short walks to everything, Times Sq, Central Park etc etc. The hotel is really nice, rooms were small, but this is what we expected, great coffee machines, ironing board, toiletries, hairdryer etc etc. Conciege very helpful when booking a helicopter flight down the Hudson River. Hotel is very very busy and the coming and going in the reception area makes it look unorgansied, but it isn't ~ it is extremely well managed. Tip top place, great location for all your sightseeing, so close to Broadway for seeing shows. My advice, book it!!!

Reviews.Title: “For Business Only”
Reviews.Author: LAGIRL74
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a business hotel, this is a great choice, the lobby is nice, many super fast elevators, nice views from the rooms, clean rooms and cumfy beds. I'm not too thrilled about the bathrooms, they're small and older. It's an average hotel at best, wouldn't recommend it for leisure travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: imorgan
Reviews.Content: Have frequent business travel to NY and choose this property often. OK - so it is at times a bit noisy (so are most other NYC hotels); and have also had occasional problems with A/C -- not pleasant, to be sure, but I don't like my room freezer-temp anyway... But the big plus is that as Starwoods member (which, incidentally, has terrific rewards program) always get renovated room (wonderful bed & bedding), and access to Club Lounge, where one of the best complimentary breakfasts is to be found! Not just coffee and stale muffins, but truly deluxe continental -- an abundance of fresh fruit (including melon & berries), yogurt, Starbucks coffee, hard-boiled eggs, good bagels, even a bit of smoked salmon. And all served in a lovely restaurant-style setting, complete with excellent wait staff and great bar for evening; unlike more typical lunchroom-cafeteria type settings at other hotels. Not only is this an extremely pleasant way to start your day (go early to avoid the families) but if you "do" breakfast this is a great value. This hotel also has great location, and computer work station (in Club Lounge) with free internet access. Happy travels.

Reviews.Title: “not impressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: maybe I am spoiled from my many stays in Asian upscale hotels... however I was several times in similarily priced hotels in NYC but was never as disappointed as this time. The crib for our daughter arrived only after two reminders. The laces of the shutter where all messed up in one huge knot, after asking 4 times to get it fixed, we did it ourselves the second day. The checkroom has been outsourced and is far from the belldesk at the very end of the lobby, when we wanted to leave we where left alone with 5 bags, a stroller and a baby and no one to assist to take the whole stuff down the lobby. The cornice was rather dirty. The carpet doesn't look like you want to walk barefoot on it, but they didn't even provide any slippers. The gym and the checkroom are NOT complimentary, I staid in hundreds of hotels, but this NEVER happened to me! Our neighbour's room service trolley table was in the aisle for 24 hours, the leftover food on the plate became alive again! I only booked there because the sheraton had a worldwide 3 nights for the price of two promo.... at the end I was billed 3 nights anyway and I lost half an hour with a front officer who was instructed to play the fool in case of customer complaints... "you staid for 3 nights but only whant to pay for two?! What the (-) is wrong with you!?!?" There is only one good thing about it... the gym has a punching ball. :-) Needless to say, not only was it my last stay at the Sheraton Towers, but probably my last stay at a sheraton at all!

Reviews.Title: “A little noisy, but a good price and good location!”
Reviews.Author: bgkdlady
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 2 nights in this hotel. I have to agree with others who said it is noisy - but this is NYC! The walls truly are paper thin. We had neighbors who were not noisy at all, but we could hear most all of their conversations. Even on the 37th floor, we could hear a lot of street noise. BUT, that said, invest in a good $2 pair of waxy earplugs and stay at this hotel! The location is perfect - not smack in the middle of busy Times Square, but close enough to walk to everything or to a subway stop. Very close to most of the Broadway theaters. We didn't have a lot of dealing with the staff, but when we did (I lost a key), I was greeted by the very pleasant Helen who burst out with "don't you worry a bit about it honey, it happens all the time!". Cab to the hotel from LGA w/traffic was about $37 (w/tip). Cab to LGA w/no traffic, $34. We paid $229/night for King/non-smoking room. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: bamafutbal
Reviews.Content: first trip to NYC, was our 10th anniversary on 6/17/05. i was a little disappointed that the front desk person did not know any details of the romance package that i had booked online. still not sure we got everything though. but anyway, the elevators are awesome, view from our room on 48th floor was great. something in the room had a dingy smell to it but not enough to ask for a different room. room was clean though. worst part of the room is the non insulated rooms, could hear every phone conversation from the rooms adjacent to ours. also it seems as though every door that shut throughout the night was a slam throughout the hallway, and last, the air conditioner was not the best. with the romance package you get special 44th floor breakfast which was plentiful of continental and sparse on heartiness overall a good room rate for nyc (269 night total with taxes)but will probably go to another hotel closer to broadway on return trip

Reviews.Title: “There for a conference”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Hotel and Towers for a conference in June. I was very happy with my room (small, but comfy). The bed was sooo comfortable! The breakfast and room service was VERY expensive, but seriously, it's NYC, most things are more expensive. The staff at the theatre desk worked with us and bent over backward to get the tickets that we wanted. Overall, the staff was nice, room was clean, and the hotel is very conveniently located. I would recommend the Hotel and Towers to anyone visiting NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Impressed”
Reviews.Author: davidnyhan
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent experience with the Sheraton. Initally it got off to a bad start with an issue with the room we were given, it was already occupied. But the staff were really apologetic and very friendly. They seemed quite surprised by it so I'm guessing its not a regular occurence. The hotel's location is amazing. It is just off Times Square and within walking distance of the theathre district, which will cut down on cab fare. I got the hotel at a reduced price on the net, so I am slightly biased by the great deal that I got, but I think it definitely deserves its four star rating and I would most certainly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: gunnercade
Reviews.Content: Given how unreasonably priced everything in NYC is, and given that we had a low conference rate, I guess we got what we paid for: a tiny room, no maid service for unknown reasons, a so-called concierge service that on two occasion gave us wrong directions (and almost caused us to miss the airport shuttle: kudos for the shuttle driver who took the trouble to find us!), and ridiculous surcharges on local phone calls. It costs less to make a long-distance phone call from your cell than to make a local call from your phone. They charge for pretty much everything except breathing. We certainly won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable but not great”
Reviews.Author: summerbeachmom
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Sheraton was fine. It was acceptable since I was paying a low conference rate, but I am not sure I would return when paying the regular rate. The room was not totally clean, and the air conditioning/heating unit did not seem to work properly. The faucets were leaky, and there were often long waits for the elevators. The bed was very comfortable, and the hotel was in a good location. However, I have stayed at other places in New York with nicer, bigger rooms for less than the regular rate at the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: noseaii
Reviews.Content: had a great stay at this hotel. Had preferred check in as a starwood member. Even though we had free nights, four different rooms, our check in person was great. Our rooms were ready early. Rooms were comfy and well decorated. Good beds(were thinking about purchasing one). We left a bag in our room at check out, which they found and are sending to us.. I was really surprised at the service in such a big hotel, one that isnt supposed to be a luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Stay Okay”
Reviews.Author: Sweettooth
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Sheraton Hotel and Towers in NY and it didn't impress me. I took pictures of the hotel and will post them if they turn out. My friends and I came from different parts of the US to stay in New York City for the Daytime Emmy Awards. We heard around that the stars would be having a dinner at the Sheraton Hotel and Towers before heading to the Radio City Music Hall for the awards and that some of the stars were also staying there that night. So we booked for this past Friday night. We arrived too early for check-in so we hung out at our friend's room who had arrived the night before until it was time to check-in. The hotel itself is very nice with a huge lobby. We arrived at the reservation desk and were told at first that the room had been already charged for the night before we even got there. We thought it strange since we gave no such authorization to put anything through. We only gave them a credit card number to hold the room for us. We paid for the room in full with money right then as we had originally intended, but then they charged us a holding fee of fifty dollars that they would refund tommorrow morning when we checked out along with any other refunds, since they weren't suddenly sure if they had put the room through on the charge card already.*shakes head* Anyways, we had put our luggage in our friend's room, which was very small, earlier and we went to get it. As with lots of hotels elevators were a problem that day. It was very busy and yes we did wait, but no more than ten minutes at most and we were packed in like sardines like elevators at many hotels. Also like most hotels seemingly in the area there are different elevators that go to different floors. There were elevators that go to floors 1-20 and others that went to floors 20 and above. Our friend's stayed in room 1444 of course on the fourteenth floor. We were staying in room 4036 on of course the 40th floor. We picked up our luggage and of course had to go back down to the first floor because the elevators on the fourteenth floor will not go up as far as we needed to go. Then from the first floor we had to get an elevator that went up to floor 20 and above. We got to our room and, of course as we now expected it to be, the room was very small and the bathroom matched. Our friend had a king sized bed room while we had double bed room. I was very happy to see that the coffee maker and condiments weren't stashed in the bathroom like in some hotels and the beds were really comfortable. Yes the room had a bench and wooden blinds that for us worked to keep the sun out for the most part in the morning. Unfortunately we did not know and could not get the windows open or figure out the heat/AC device cause it was humid in that room. The view from our window wasn't fantastic. It was also very dark like the bulbs were a lower wattage so we couldn't really see as well. We made the best of it. We crawled and walked sideways around what little space we had and there was the plus of finding we had extra blankets. The bathroom for me had only three really good features that stood out for me besides the negative about it being so small. The water pressure was excellent, the lighting in there was really nice and bright, and that it had an extra facial mirror sitting on the counter that you don't get in other hotels. We eventually went back into the hotel lobby to check out and maybe get some pics of the actors and actresses. Security was tight. I think they were just frustrated and I can't say I blame them cause they are just trying to do their jobs, but more than once they sat there and basically ordered us out of the hotel. The hotel we had a room at. Because there were hoards of us fans suddenly wanting pics and to say hi to these celebs and crowds do amazing things to frustrate security. Many people wondered at the crowds and kept asking what we were waiting for. Lol! Anyways, after we came back to the hotel from the Emmys at Radio City Music Hall we were looking to get drinks so we went to I guess the Hudson or whatever bar that is at the Sheraton and they told us they had already done last call so we made inquires. The lounge bar also in the hotel said that they were closing up, but were really nice enough to serve us all, there was like seven of us, all one round of drinks before shutting down. The next day we found out that the credit card wasn't charged and they refunded the fifty dollars that was promised. The hotel location is great, close to many sights, and the beds in the room very comfy. I just don't think the room for the size it is is worth the full price you laid out for it. We stayed at the Mariott Marquis the next night and the rooms were much nicer for about the same price. I also heard from our friends from room 1444 that they had stayed at the Sheraton Manhattan that was right across the street before and that the rooms there were much bigger than the one they had at the Sheraton Hotel and Towers. The fact was that the celebs we wanted to see were going to be at this hotel. That was really the deciding factor for me to stay there not the great price or room. The hotel in itself is alright so my advice to anyone looking into staying at this hotel is to shop for discounts or something else so that your stay would be more worth your money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but would choose a cheaper hotel next time”
Reviews.Author: daenis30
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton for five nights. Got a cheap rate from browsing the net. Certainly wouldn't have paid their rates. Its worth shopping around on the net rather than going direct with the hotel itself. Took advice from Trip Advisor and asked for a room on a higher level which we got. The hotel itself is impressive when you enter, wonderful marble lobby. The rooms I found although comfortable, needed to be updated. The beds and bedding are very comfortable. Its location is great. Right next door to the hustle and bustle of Times Square and Central Park. I would recommend you dine out for breakfast. Breakfast at the hotel is expensive. Plenty of choice outside your hotel, deli's and Lindy's next door at a much cheaper price (recommended to dine out by the bellman and concierge!). For all the people who moaned about the rooms, thats fair enough, but spending 5 days in New York, we didn't really stay much at the hotel. Too busy shopping and siteseeing! I would recommend you request a higher room as it would be noisy being on a lower level with all the traffic. Great views from the top. When enquiring initially about booking a room direct, we were told that to get a higher room you had to pay more. However, when we got there, we were put at the top when asked. So beware! not always the case! The concierge were helpful on both occasions when we asked for something. We didn't have alot to do with the staff as we were never in the hotel really, just to sleep. The bathroom I agree was small and there is no way you would stretch your legs in the bath but the shower is great! Overall it was comfortable but as I said I would go again to New York but stay at a cheaper hotel as your out all day so why pay lots for a room that your never in! Shopping I recommend you go to Woodbury Common. Its a bus ride away, about an hour and it can be got at the Port Authority. Its an outlet of over 200 designer shops. Well worth a trip to spend loadsa money!! Enjoy your break yaul !!

Reviews.Title: “MIXED BAG”
Reviews.Author: davidchilver
Reviews.Content: Overall a reasonable experience. Stayed 3 nights in an executive room with acess to the club lounge. On the plus side the lobby and reception were fine-the bed is very comfortable and the hotel is clean. Security is also good. As regards the lounge, the bar service was highly professional, and the room is comfortable. On the down side, the hotel has a gloomy feel about it largely due to the decor. The bedroom was on the small side and the bathroom especially so (and I'm from Europe so am used to small rooms!). The bath was a joke -although the plumbing worked well enough In the club lounge the waiters at breakfast were too pushy (ie making it clear they expected a tip) and noisy (ie joshing and/or arguing with each other). The food selection was mixed (fruit and juices very good, cold meats and breads poor, and coffee not hot enough)

Reviews.Title: “Expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: horstm22
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is an older hotel, and it shows. The hallways were narrow and rather shabby. Badly patched wallpaper, exposed drywall, dings and scratches everywhere. Our room was attractive, with all the standard Sheraton fittings, but quite small, even by New York standards (particularly the bathroom.) The room had wooden venetian blinds which, while attractive, did not fulfill their primary purpose of keeping light out of the room. All in all, not a terrible option, but I would definitely go for the Westin Times Square for the extra $30.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: mowglie02
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from April 13-18 2005. I found the hotel to be OK. The rrom was rather small, and there wasn't much to look out on (having said that there isn't in New York!), but it was fine. We found it to be a good base and the beds were wonderful. Just what you need after shopping all day. The location was excellent, and the staff are very helpful. We had a couple of problems with the heating and things. These were swiftly sorted and money was creditied to our account for the inconvenice. I would not eat breakfast in the Hotel though (unless it is included in your stay). It is very over priced. We went to Lindy's Diner which is literally next door and there is more atmosphere and it was cheaper. I would reccommend it. All in all it is a good hotel to stay in. The rooms are not that big, and they could do with a bit of decoration (and we stayed in a supposedly newly renovated room!) The bathroom was very small. If you are tall you will not be able to have a bath! The showers are great though. When you are in New York you don't spend too much time in your room anyway so this hotel is excellent for the tourist or business traveller. All in all I would stay there again if justf or the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Martinrankoff
Reviews.Content: Stayed here April 15th to 19th. On arrival the door man was very welcoming as were the check in staff. Bell man was great and all the usual great advise. We chose this hotel for location and it because it was also one of the few offering a double double bedded room. No Great deal was had $269 per night. The location was fantastic and the beds were the greatest my wife and I have ever slept in, the special quilts and pillows are truly fantastic, although it has to be said we did miss our kingsize. The room was adequate given New York sizes, we had tried to get into the Hilton Times Square but they were $319 per night. on reflection the way the dollar is at the moment for us brits it may of been a better choice room wise. However the room was pretty good, needed a bit of attenetion, paper peeling under the vanity unit, slight damp damage in the ceiling corner and repolishing to a stained desk would not of hurt.But on the whole I can say that I would stay there again. For Breakfast go two blocks up and across to Broadway for Applejacks diner,The hotel security guard recomended it after I asked where he went for breakfast, Good call!!!!!!!! If you are vacationing in NY then anywhere is great as NY is great, but the oppullance of the this hotel is evident when you enter it beatufully marbled Lobby. Oh yes the lifts are better that any ride at disney.

Reviews.Title: “New York, New York”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This 4 day girly shopping break was our first time in NY and all I can say is WOW!!! The hotel is perfectly located for everything, 5th Ave, Central Park, Times Square and the tube stop to take you everywhere else is just one block away! We were woken on our first morning by builders carrying out renovations but were moved straight away on request and given a $50 credit. We shared a double room and both had a luxurious 'Sheraton Sweet Sleeper' double bed, just what you need after 21 hours of travelling! The rooms were very clean with all the facilities you would expect, only thing missing for us was the mini bar and the bar downstairs stopped serving at 1am. The concierge was very helpful and advised us on restaurants and the nightlife. I would recommend a night time visit to the meat packing district, we ate in the Lotus but found the drinks particularly expensive. Great food can be found everywhere at all hours but if you want the party atmosphere, the locals don't tend to come out until late. We also took a taxi to Little Italy one night and had a great meal then stopped in a little local bar across the road. The locals are very friendly and make you feel completely welcome. Shopping is awesome, 5th Ave is a must although you have to spend a few days on it, it's huge! Macy's really is the biggest department store in the world and you're feet are telling you so at the end of the day! Visit Saks for something a bit special but be prepared to pay for it! FAO Schwarz is also worth a visit, even if it's only to take photos of the life like animals. If you're doing the sightseeing thing, be prepared to get up early. We queued for 1.5 hours at 10am to go to the Statue of Liberty. Also check the weather board outside the Empire State Building before going up, we got to the top only to walk around in thick cloud! I recently saw 'Hitch' and the Sheraton at night can be seen in the film! All in all New York was great and we'll definitley be back to do the things we didn't have time for!

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything--agree with thin wall comments”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I will start by highlighting the one and only complaint I have with this hotel. The walls are PAPER THIN. We heard each and every word from the guests next door to us (both sides) and they even woke us up a couple mornings talking. We stay in hotels at least 6 nights a month, so we are used to traveling and noise. But, there needs to be some major sound proofing done in this hotel. If you are a HEAVY sleeper, you should be o.k. Now, on to the positives. The location of this hotel is excellent. We walked every where. It is very close to Central Park and Times Square. We walked to both several times. We also walked over to see The Plaza Hotel (the one from the Home Alone Lost in New York movie, as well as countless other movies). We even walked to the Empire State building one night, but that is a LONG walk, that I wouldn't recommend. We took the subway back. There is a subway stop very close to the hotel. Don't take the stop at the Port Authority. There is one closer and much easier of a walk, especially if you are hauling luggage with you! We took the "yellow" subway stops to the hotel. This includes the R line and the N line and a few others. We were also very impressed with security at this hotel. We (as well as many others in the hotel) were disturbed by guests (children) running up and down the halls at 1:30 a.m. When we called the front desk, we were told that many other people on various floors of the hotel were calling about this same group of children. They were unsupervised and just running wild. But, the lady who answered the phone said, "Now that we know what floor they are on, we will send someone right up." The security guard was there in less than 30 seconds, no joke, I don't know how he made it that fast. But, that was the last we heard of the running, yelling kids. Thanks security folks! Now, a description of the room. It is very important that you ask for a RENNOVATED room. We did ahead of time and were given one at check-in (though they can't guarantee them in advance, they will give you one if they have them), a King sized, non-smoking room. We were originally going to stay at the Marriott Marquis, which we have stayed at before, but didn't because they didn't have any non-smoking rooms available. The rennovated room was nice. I liked the bathroom decor which was shades of blue and had a neat, silver and marble sink unit. The toiletries were nice, Pantene hair products and Vaseline Intensive Care lotion. There is no pool in this hotel, but you are free to use the pool at the Sheraton Manhattan across the street.
