We are glad we chose this hotel though, as it has much better tripadvisor reviews than its sister property. One other minor issue I had is that they have blinds, but no curtains, so the light comes into your room very early in the morning. We were on the 32nd floor and had a bit of a view of the street towards the Times Square area, which was nice. For the price, I would recommend this hotel over others. We did like the room in the Marriott Marquis better--it just looked newer, but apparently the elevator situation has gotten out of hand there. Speaking of elevators, the ones at the Sheraton were super fast and we never had to wait for one. They were so fast that your ears popped when you went up to our floor! We did see lots of school groups staying here, to see Broadway shows and to perform at various events--a lot of the groups milling about the lobby were dressed in costumes, etc. The location is everything and it would make a nice base for exploring NYC. One last thing, 2 luggage valets (the stands you put your suitcase on) were a very nice touch. Most hotels only have 1 per room.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via priceline.com and stayed for 1 night at only $145.00. Upon check-in they gave me 2 options: A Queen bed in a non-refurbished room or 2 twin beds in a refurbished room. Although traveling just by myself I opted for the room with 2 twin beds. Luckily, this was the right choice. The room was somewhat small, as many NYC hotel rooms are, but it was in perfect condition. Carpet, walls and bedding were nice and clean and the room had a pleasant scent. Sheraton features the "Sweet Sleeper Bed" which is an extremely comfortable bed with wonderful sheets, lots of pillows, oversized blankets and comforters. I tested the bed for a short afternoon-nap upon arrival and fell asleep immediately! Bad idea, so I missed some of my precious hours in NYC while just sleeping in the day. The Sheraton has a Restaurant and a Bar, as well as 24 hour in-room dining, but I didn't use any of it. The hotel is at a great location at 7th Avenue, just steps away from great Restaurants and plenty of Delis. If you're looking for a real New York dining experience, go to Carnegie's Deli, 2 minutes away from Sheraton. Their overstuffed Pastrami Sandwiches are terrific and so is the Cheesecake!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Before my trip, I read some of the previous reviews of this hotel and was a bit worried! However, when we got there we were all pleasantly surprised. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived in the morning, so we checked our bags and hit the town. We returned in the late afternoon and quickly checked-in and went to our room on the 30th floor. It was newly (but darkly) decorated, and clean throughout. The room was very small - we had to walk sideways between the beds and the walls. I'd read alot about the beds, but we found them small (double) and not amazingly soft like I'd read. They weren't anything special like I'd expected. The room was also warm and stuffy. There was a blower fan that we had turned up high, but it just didn't move the air enough. We ended up cracking the window open and that was a big improvement. The location of the hotel is great for first time visitors. Now that I know the streets and area better, I'd probably stay somewhere less expensive. The staff was all very nice and efficient, and the room was clean and quiet. On the day we left, after we checked out the charge to check suitcases was $3.00 per bag - a bit high in my opinion after all we'd spent to stay there. Having that as a courtesy would be a nice touch. On my next visit I'll probably stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton New York Towers”
Reviews.Author: kabh4655
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Sheraton NY Towers. The hotel is conveniently located and very nice but also very busy. The hotel rooms are nicely decorated but small. I would not recommend any more than 3 people per room and and the ideal would be 2 per room. My only complaint is that check-in is at 3PM and the people who were in our room prior to us didn't leave until after 5PM. They did provide us with a parlor to change in for dinner and a show. After the show we had to come back to the hotel and move into our room. Somewhat inconvenient. I would stay there again if I needed a room for only two people. The reception (check in/out) could use more staff in an effort to reduce the check in/out lines.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here in February for two nights. We booked our room through Priceline and got a good rate. When we arrived, we requested an upgrade to club level and we were given a room with a view of Central Park! It was an extra charge but worth it because you are entitled to continental breakfast and late afternoon snacks in the Club lounge. Our room was standard but the beds were extremely comfortable. The hotel is in an excellent location - close to theatres, shopping and the park. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: markgbyrne
Reviews.Content: I went to New York for St. Patrick’s Day 2005. I should start off by saying that I am very particular when it comes to hotels. I only stayed at the Sheraton because my brother had booked a room there. I’ve visited Manhattan several times, but this hotel is in the best location I have ever seen. The hotel is near to everything, including the subway, diners, a pharmacy, Broadway and Times Square. Fifth Avenue and central park are just a stroll away. The photographs on the Internet do not adequately portray the size of this hotel. The building is very large, and has a huge, bright and well-decorated lobby. I found the staff at the front desk to be very polite and helpful. The man who checked me in was very courteous, and chatted and answered my queries without the impatience that is so common in New York hotels. He gave me a refurbished room without my having to ask. Many of the reviews here mention the club level floors, so I enquired about this and was told that the rooms are exactly the same as the other refurbished ones, except that they have gym privileges and light food provided in the club room in the morning and evening. I decided to stick with my standard room. The elevators are super-fast and you rarely have to wait too long to board. My room was on the 34th floor. The room was clean and spacious, for New York, and had the wooden blinds and benches that you can see on the website. From my window I had a great view of Broadway and Times Square. I have to say that the modern business-like style of decoration in the room does not appeal to me. I prefer my hotels to look homely. I often felt like I was in an office! There were a number of lamps and wall lights in the room, but the use of energy-saving light bulbs gave that uncomfortable white glow to the place. My bathroom was fairly large, for New York, and was brightly lit. It had a small bath and shower. The hotel room also had a safe, which was easy to operate, and, for you Brits, a decent coffee percolator, with reasonably good coffee supplied. (Making your own hot drinks in your room: You are a tacky bunch!) The Sheraton beds really are as great as people have been saying here. They’re really soft! The only real problem I had was that you can hear everything that is going on in the rooms next to you. I could hear a high-spirited argument in Spanish on my first night, but I was exhausted from the flight from Dublin and slept anyway. Next day I went to the restaurant in the lobby for breakfast. 20 bucks gets you a buffet where you can eat everything and anything. (Hot and cold.) This allows you to stock up on energy that will keep you going well into the day. The service is great and the money is well spent. Overall, this is a good mid-range hotel. Rooms are fairly spacious, with office-like decoration, fixtures and fittings. The staff, facilities and service are excellent. The location is second to none. Noise is a problem!

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the Business Traveler”
Reviews.Author: Adam M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Towers in February during a conference. While the rooms are on the small and dark side, I didn't expect much more from NYC hotels. With a Club Level room, I got free access to a perfectly adequate fitness center, a plentiful and well stocked breakfast in the club suite, and free bottled water in the rooms. There is free wireless access in the lobby and a computer in the club suite. In room internet access is a pricey $15- should be free in my opinion. The staff was great and the new beds they're installing in all the rooms are absolutely incredible. Probably the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in.

Reviews.Title: “small room but otherwise perfect.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We came in from Amsterdam Europe, and arrived at Laguardia Airport. The Taxi brought us quickly to the Sheraton Hotel & Towers. We were greeted in a proffesional manner when we arrived and the Bell Hop took quickly care of our bags and luggage. We did not have to wait for check in.The bell Hop guided us to our room on the 47th floor which was concierge level. The room is very small according to other hotels around the world in the same class, but hey its New york. The breakfast in the club room was perfect each morning. Everybody in the Hotel was friendly and hospitable. The location is dead smack in the middle of everything. Central Park 5 minutes/Times Square 4 minutes. Park Aveneu/Fifth Aveneu etc.etc. And the open double decker tour bus system stops right in frontt of the Hotel for those who like to sightsee it this way. Al in al , thumbs up for the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having read some previous poor reviews, I was concerned about my impending stay in a economy double room at this hotel and tried to upgrade as suggested, but couldn't. Now I know why!. This hotel and its staff and service were truly amazing from start to finish and I couldn't fault a thing. Aswell as all this the great view from our room, a really quick check in and express checkout (via our television in the room - what a great idea!) made our short three day stay a really memorable one and for the right reasons. And obviously New York and it's people were fabulous and I will be recommending both the city and the hotel to everyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “Great location !!!”
Reviews.Author: Callas
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton New York Hotel & Towers one night February 28th 2005. We booked through Hotwire because everything was full on this saturday night. I was advised by reading the reviews on TripAdvisor to ask for a refurbished room. I was lucky enough to get one on the 27th floor although it was a handicap room (no bath, only shower). The room was great, very clean. The bed was absolute comfort. The location is also unbeatable. Just 10 minutes to walk to get to Central Park. The only negative point was the noise that our neighbors made all night long. They were fighting very bad. Parking is outrageous (47$ for 24 hours or so). Frederic, Montreal, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a terrific location, but charges for every amenity make it a bad bet. They charge to use the health club, to hold luggage, to use the internet, for just about everything.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: ZoyaG
Reviews.Content: Had a very good stay here. I did call in advance to ask for a refurbished room as other reviewers on this site suggested. Although I was told we would get one, at check in they told me that was first come first serve. They did however have one available on the 33rd floor. Room was spotless and fairly elegant. Size of room was decent by NY standards. Even had a tiny view of the river. The only slight problem was that the beds looked really lumpy on top. I even thought that might have been intentional to make the duvet seem really fluffy, but I think the duvet was just matted. Bed was still perfectly comfortable. Great location! Parking was outrageous at $37, but it's NY. Booked on Hotwire for $169. Would take the same deal again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT”
Reviews.Author: anonymousBA
Reviews.Content: staying at the sheraton in new york was truly a blessing. i went memorial day weekend 2004 and it was right outside the street fair in times square. after reading prior entries, we arrived early to get a room with two double beds since they are limited, and we booked the room on hotwire so it was not guaranteed that we would get two double beds. the rooms that are normally given at the hotwire promotional rates are in the older section of the building, which - at the time - had not been renovated. (i'm not sure if it has been renovated). that section is definitely not 4 1/2 star quality, although i would say it is a little better than your standard best western. the air conditioning dial was broken in our room, and so we got upgraded to another room in the renovated tower with no hassles. THIS room was DEFINITELY 4 1/2 star quality - although the beds and room seemed smaller, it was better quality. (it seemed to cater to businesses customers, though, and not vacationers). the bathroom was small, but very clean, comfortable, and provided more than adequate amentities. it was great to come back to the sheraton after a day out in the city and lie on a comfortable bed and be in a good, quality hotel room where you can have piece of mind and feel safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for seven nights in February 05. We got a great deal from Priceline ($120 / night), and I have to say we wouldn’t have wanted to pay more. First they gave us a room from the 6th floor, but there was a terrible smell of cigarettes coming to our room several times a day. We complained, and got a room from 24th floor. It was a little better. The rooms were cleaned well, and the staff was nice. We didn't use the hotel restaurants or the room service. But then.. Our toilet got stuck three times, the drains didn’t work well (e.g. there was water over your ankles after shower), and there was a renovation going on, and nobody bothered to tell us about it! One morning we just woke up at 7.30 AM when somebody was hammering the bathroom tiles off and drilling somewhere near our room. The noise was so loud, that we couldn’t even be in the room. Went down and asked about it, and the receptionist just smiled and told us the renovation would be going on from 8 AM to 4 PM. The drilling and banging continued the last three days we had left, and woke us up before 8 every morning. The overall stay would have been ok without the renovation. The best thing in this hotel is the location, subway is 20 meters from the main entrance (easy to arrive e.g. from JFK, AirTrain to Jamaica and E-train to the hotel), and Times Square in 5 min walking distance. But next time we will go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “After reading reviews here I was pleasantly surprised.....”
Reviews.Author: csulbxx
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews here I was worried about what the hotel would be like, but it was better than expected. As others had suggested, I asked for a room that was refurbished, and it was in excellent shape and kept clean. The public rooms (lobby, etc) are all very upscale. The elevators were great--up 36 floors in seconds. As others have also mentioned, the service could have better--we had to wait to check in, and it seemed understaffed. When we called down to the consierge, there was no answer, and when we went down no one was there at 9am! Another time however, he was helpful. Room service trays outside the rooms could have been removed faster. However, when we called down that we needed more caffinated coffee packets, someone came right up to deliver them. They also had someone by the elevator hallway who looked to see that people had keycards and belonged there. The location is outstanding and we walked to places all the time--Times Square, the theaters, Rockefeller Center, 5th Avenue, NBC for the Today show. There is a subway station at the corner outside the hotel. Since we didn't take cabs, we didn't have to deal with doormen who we could tell were there to get their tips. We also thought the charge for internet in the room ($15 or $17) was high, and when I went to the business center where some hotels let you use their internet for free, I was told it was $8 for 15 minutes!! Since we got this hotel on Priceline for $135 we felt it definitely was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Beware Policies - Lacks service - good location”
Reviews.Author: Winterblast
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for Thanksgiving in 2000 and had a nice room, so we went back for Thanksgiving 2004. Booked more than a year in advance (stated double bed a must because we had 4 adults and 1 teenager). Found out upon arrival that they booked us for 1 king sized bedroom. We stated that we booked so far in advance how could this happen? They didn't seem to care and said that there are NO GUARANTEES on ROOM TYPE. Beware of this policy! So they stuck us with one cot and 2 people had to sleep on the floor (they stated that 2 cots were a fire hazard). During the 3 nights we stayed, we were always only given towels for 2 people. It would take hours for housekeeping to deliver us additional towels. We'd call at 4:00 p.m. for the additional towels and they'd arrive at 3:00 A.M. - which woke us up every single night! We needed more toilet paper - one night (I called at 8:30 p.m. and again, the toilet paper didn't arrive until late, at 11:45 p.m. so we had to use the tiny tissues they provided until the toilet paper came). The rooms weren't as clean as they had been 4 years prior to our stay in 2004. The paint in the bathroom appeared to be melting off the ceilings, and every morning there'd be huge sticky paint chucks on the bathroom floor and in the tub. The food at the Thanksgiving buffet was sub-par (pre-packaged turkey) very little traditional Thanksgiving fare - you'd expect more for $50 a head. The only good thing about the hotel is that it's in a great location - close to many things and mid-way between many other places of interest. This hotel has gone down hill.

Reviews.Title: “Closed for the holidays”
Reviews.Author: xxqsme
Reviews.Content: We booked the club floor, but when we arrived we were told it would be closed for 3 days over the Christmas Holidays. A hotel not offering a service because of a holiday? Is the entire hotel closed on July 4th? If you venture far away and by cab make sure you have a few bucks for the doorman who will flag down a cab that is already waiting in line for your business. No money for the doorman? At least you and your fellow taxi-mates will be able to trade, " Doorman dirty looks" stories. We stayed on a non-smoking floor, but people were smoking. The front desk informed us that they would like to enforce the policy, but they were shorthanded because so many people were not working because of, you guessed it, the holidays. And that may explain why the carpets on our hallway were not vacuumed for the 5 days we were there and why the parade of cots never left the same hallway near our room. This is a really, really big hotel where personal service gets lost in the size of things. The Christmas season spirit ended with the tree in the lobby. The topic of conversation amoung staff and out loud was who got "stuck" working over Christmas. Sorry we showed up, we promise not to get in your way or cause problems or smoke, okay we might smoke! If that's okay with you, you just can't beat the location where you can walk to some of the best of NYC within minutes.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the NY sheraton on new years eve, what a drama! when we finally got ot the hotel, my family of 5 could not get anyone to help with bags,(despite 2 porters standing and looking at us struggling with them!), did not get the rooms requested, ( with no one interested about our problem), and had to wait until 7pm to get into our second room. Thr rooms were OK, great beds, but alot of things did not work, eg:A/C, the shower blocked up. Over all, for the price, I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “ok, but not much for the money”
Reviews.Author: parishoes
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an overnight at the Sheraton. After reading the variety of reviews here, I must say I didn't expect much; but I managed to be disappointed anyway. First of all, they put us in a room directly across from the Utility Room. Noisy all night. Also, they did not deliver a rollaway bed, as promised; and we needed to ask a couple of times before receiving it. There was only one bellman working the lobby despite the Christmas week rush. And so it goes...But the room was clean, and the bed was comfortable. I will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Compliments / Suggestions”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Many things I liked about the hotel but there were a few things that I felt needed attention. First the positive: The staff is first rate and very friendly, I had a King room - although the rooms are small they are very well designed and organized. There is good work space for one who is there on business and adequate closet space. The location is fantastic. I do not think it would be hard to fix the negatives but the High Speed Internet (Ethernet) Service is horrible. It was terribly frustrating considering that I had paid nearly $17 a day to use it. Room 2511 does not have an electrical outlet for a computer. I have never had high speed Internet service this bad in a hotel. The mirror in the bath room fogged over and that is inexcuseable in this day and time. Hotels who are several rings below you have mirrors treated so they do not fog. There needs to be a light blanket on every bed in addition to the comforter. Many times the comforter was too heavy and the sheet is too light. I do not see that it would be difficult to address these negatives items. Otherwise, my stay for 7 days was most pleasant. William Gray

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Honest_now
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four days of Thanksgiving week. Friendly check-in staff. Rooms were elegant and simple, good hot showers at all times. Lobby is very attractive; never had to wait long for an elevator. Location is awesome to Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, Times Square, Macy's parade except you can't see the parade from the hotel like one NY website stated. Housekeeping was good, fast. Would stay there again, especially if we could get better pricing - $300 a day was steep. Wish they had a mini fridge in room. Also, there are NO soda machines, and the gift store ran out of sodas every night. You would think they could at least stock enough drinks, even with the extra people! Not even bottled water. Also, one room had broken remote for TV, reported but not fixed for three days. Except for the lack of drinks, we really enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Melb33
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, with some of the best service I've had in a long time! We arrived very early the day after Thanksgiving (the hotel had full occupancy the night before). Our Club Level room was ready, as promised, by 11:00 a.m. The front desk clerk, Ann, personally went up to the 48th floor to check on the room's readiness for us. I will agree with other reviews that the room was extremely warm and the air conditioner was not adequate. However, the room was exceptionally clean and well kept. The complementary breakfast was very good and the staff excellent!! We would stay here again without hesitation! Great location, too! Close to Times Square and Central Park!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Audreybella
Reviews.Content: O.k i must agree with other reviews, the room is quite small for the size of the beds that you get but then again, how much time do you actually spend in the hotel room. The location of this hotel is PRISTINE!!! Not in the middle of times sq but 5 steps away and you are in the heart of the action! Do yourself a favor though, upgrade yourself to a Club Level room!!! You will not regret it. There are evening hors d'eouvres and they are delicious and make sure to ask for bottled water, it is free and teh breakfast served in the a.m, AMAZING but get there early!!!!!!!!!! Other than that, it is a good hotel overall.

Reviews.Title: “OK place/location, but there are better choices”
Reviews.Author: Ski_Bum
Reviews.Content: Hotel had the basics, but for $259/night, we expected a little more. Biggest downside was the size of the room (very small) and airconditioner didn't seem to be working (I resorted to opening a window).

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best!!!!”
Reviews.Author: trudy3649
Reviews.Content: I often travel to New York on business. A quick trip came up and after checking for a good rate on several web sites, I bid on Priceline. The Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers accepted my bid. Of course, I came to this site and read the reviews and was worried about the hotel. Well, let me tell you, my three days at this hotel were among the best I have ever experienced and I have stayed at some of the top hotels in Manhattan. We arrived at the hotel on Sunday around 11am. The lobby was packed afterall it was checkout time. The wait to check in was only about 5 minutes despite the crowds. I asked if it would be possible to get an upgrade to the Club level as mentioned in other reviews. I was willing to pay for this upgrade, but to my surprise, the woman just gave me the upgrade to the 48th floor at no charge. Of course, that meant I couldn't check in until 4pm but it was worth the wait. The room was beautiful and the bed was the best I have ever slept upon. There were guests on both sides of me, but I never heard any noise - not even running water. Yes there was street noise, but that is a part of New York - if you want quiet go to the country. There was a big desk and HBO and 5 pillows - I could have just stayed in the room and been happy. A great perk of the Club floor is the 5 - 7pm appetizers. Very good and could easily been a whole dinner. Breakfast was also included and the service was friendly - thank you Mohammed. Very good , fresh bread and raspberries. My only suggestion to those of you lucky enough to get to the Club room is to tip! So many of the people up there just stuffed their faces and left without so much as a dollar tip! Don't be cheap, these people deserve a tip and they will remember you if you do so. In addition to the Club room, there is also a nice health club and the hotel's location is perfect. So, if you are looking for a great hotel and you are lucky enough (or nice enough at check in) to get a club level room I assure you - your stay will be an outstanding one!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: EdinDC
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I have ever had the great displeasure of staying in. I've paid less for a room in NYC and I've paid more, but what you get for your money at this Sheraton compares extremely unfavorably with any other hotel I have ever stayed in. It's not because the hotel is busy and noisy -- although it's both of these -- one must expect this when staying in a large NYC hotel, but is solely the result of a poorly trained, extremely rude staff, who don't have the first clue about how to provide satisfactory customer service. First of all, when I called ahead of time to confirm my reservation (it wasn't showing up on SPG) and asked to be transferred to the front desk, I was transferred to a recording system, and then put on hold until the computer hung up on me. This happened three times. I hope some of you can understand the frustration of this, and the ominous feeling this would give a guest about their prospective stay. So I called back and asked to speak with an on-duty manager. They connected me to a woman named Andrea Williams. I explained my frustration at being hung up on three times, and that I just wanted to confirm my reservation. She simply confirmed my reservation and asked if there were anything else she could do for me. I said an apology would be great and some indication that she might look into whatever the problem was with the phone system would be appropriate. She very disingenuously said she would and hung up on me. No apology. Just rudeness. This is not an appropriate response for anyone in a customer service position. So I called Gary Sims, the hotel manager, and left him a voicemail letting him know about my experience and how it left me very unexcited about my coming stay. Of course, he never bothered to respond. Upon checking in, I found the hotel extremely noisy and busy, but as I said this is to be expected. There was a long line at the understaffed reception desk, but I was happy that my Starwood Gold Status saved me from that debacle. The room was small, but adequate. I noted that the room was quite warm, and immediately set the thermostat to its coldest position and put the fan on high. I then went down to meet friends for dinner. When I returned I had been out of the room for several hours, and it was still too warm for me to sleep comfortably. I like to sleep in a cooler than average room. Temps should be below 70 degrees, or I really have a hard time sleeping. This is why hotel a/c and heat units have thermostats...or so I thought. It was now about midnight, so I called down to the front desk. Again it was inadequately staffed and there was no one to answer guests questions...I waited on hold for nearly 15 minutes before getting to talk to someone. They said they'd send up someone from engineering. I waited....no one showed up. I tried to call the front desk again, but again too long a wait. It was now 12:30am and I just decided it would be better to visit the front desk personally. After waiting -- even more disgruntled guests were there now, and only two receptionists were present at this huge hotel -- I asked if I could change rooms to a cooler room, they said they would send someone up, I said that I'd already waited for someone to come up. They said they get him there quicker. Finally an engineer showed and -- of course -- told me there was nothing he could do. Oy! Back down to the front desk I went. After waiting another twenty minutes out came Mr. Long -- a manager -- to take care of me...Yeah! He came up to my room and announced that the temperature was fine! Hallelujah, I'd been up and complaining for absolutely no reason. All I needed was Mr. Long to tell me that my discomfort was all in my head. I explained it was not a comfortable temperature for me. He suggested I sleep on top of their "heavenly bed" blanket. "After all," he explained, "it's a heavy blanket." (I wouldn't allow this man to run a Nathans Hotdog stand in New Jersey, nevermind a hotel in NYC!) Absolutely, outrageously rude and incompetent. Where does Sheraton train its employees? Attica? I told Mr. Long that since they were unable to deliver an adequate room, I simply wanted to check out immediately so that I could check into the W Hotel nearby -- at an additional profit for his parent company Starwood by the way. He refused and let me know that I would be charged for that evenings accomodations no matter what. After a long argument he finally agreed to do me the "FAVOR" of not "PENALIZING" me if I chose to check out the following day. INCREDIBLE! I checked into the W New York the next day. And although the initial room they put me in was also too warm, you'll never guess what they said... They said, "we are so sorry Mr. Carp, please let us find you a more comfortable room." Which they promptly did...and I lived happily ever...well for the next two days. Point is, it takes so little to make a dissapointed guest into a satisfied guest. We can all understand when there are issues with equiptment or other things outside of the personal control of hotel employees. What is absolutelty unacceptable is a staff that cannot simply understand that all a guest needs is a sincere apology and a genuine effort to correct that which has gone wrong. Stores like Nordstroms, and many other companies have recognized the value of such a philosophy, and train their employees accordingly. In it's New York Hotel and Towers I urge Sheraton to start from scratch, as it will never serve its customers adequately until the replace all of its managers. Do yourself a favor and stay at any other hotel in Manhattan. My mother liked the Marriot in Times Square very much, and I've had excellent stays at the W New York, the W Tuscany, Swishotel's The Drake, and The Paramount. Very Sincerely, Ed Carp

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: 757jewell
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent! It's only a few blocks from Times Square, Radio City Music Hall, Rockefeller Plaza, and all of the theatres. The staff was very friendly and professional and they went above and beyond to accomodate our needs. The beds were also very comfortable. However, be prepared to spend alot of money because New York City is expensive. Especially the area where this hotel is located. If at all possible, try to book your hotel through Hotwire or Priceline rather than through Sheraton because you'll save yourself alot of money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ildianne1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton back in August 2004. It was for business for one week. I really liked this hotel. The hotel is very modern and clean. The staff was very attentive and pleasant. I decided to see a broadway play and the concierge was very helpful! The rooms were also very nice. NOthing beats the Sheraton beds, they are so comfy. The rooms are very small but keep in mind this is NYC and that is what you will find in most hotels. I had a room with 2 double beds and the beds barely fit in the rooms. But the furniture was nice and new. The only complaints was the A/C was not working very good, the room did get a bit hot. The internet was outragously priced, like $14 for all day high speed. Their is a lot of noise from the streets. I would not recommend staying below the 16th floor, if you do, try and complain to get higher. The hotel is VERY busy but like I said, the staff is pleasant. The hotel is in a GREAT location! It is only 10 or so blocks from times square which is a short walk! You are far away enough from all the noise and craziness of times square. The hotel is in a very high priced area, so get ready to pay a lot for food and what not. Try and go to other neighboorhoods to eat. All in and all, I would highly recommend this hotel. I really enjoyed my weeks stay! Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Will try another place....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed Aug 18-26th. Checked in late in the evening, and was welcomed by a terrific front desk receptionist. She was extremely friendly, and accommodating. We had a package deal with Expedia, but were paying separately for a different room since we were checking in a day earlier. She made sure we did not have to move rooms which was of great convenience to us. The rooms are so small (very characteristic of NYC). Two people will be slightly comfortable, but a third person joined us later and it was incredibly close quarters. We asked for a roll-a-way bed and it was completely pointless, and really funny! The other reviews that downgrade the cleanliness of the rooms are true. Our room was very dusty. There are wood blinds that need to be polished frequently and they are not. The dust was at least half an inch thick. There was all kinds of paper, wrappers, candies, and 'batteries' under both of the queen size beds. I reported this to the front desk on the club floor. He said he would report it to housekeeping. It was still there when we checked out the next week, probably still there today. They have this service guarantee, and the front desk said he would compensate me, he never did. The beds are very very very very comfortable. Pillowly, with just the right amount of softness and firmness. I'm thinking about buying one since they have them for sell on their website. One of the best parts of this hotel is the club floors. If you stay on a club floor, you recieve daily complimentary breakfast and hor'douevers in the evening. It was nice to save money on room service and to mingle with the other guests. The service in the lounge was great as well. Room service was expensive, but not surprising. They are very quick and believe in getting it right. My order was wrong the first time, and they sent up another one immediately and apologized for the mix up. The pool and fitness center are nice. The sauna is great and the shower facilities are impeccable. The location was great. Only a few blocks to walk to Times Square and bus service is across the street. Subways just a few blocks away. The Marriott is my first choice, the 2nd would be the Milennium Hilton, and the Sheraton would be 3rd. We're taking another trip next year. If my first two choices are booked, than we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very big, busy don't expect personal service”
Reviews.Author: Babenoname
Reviews.Content: We always stay at this hotel in New York. Having lived here before we prefer the location. It's great, near everything. The hotel is nice, most rooms are upgraded. There is no minibar in rooms. The hotel is usually very very busy so do not expect any personal attention even if you are a Starwood member. Rooms are clean, attended to. Granted the prices are a bit high at certain times of the year. But would recommend hotel. You're definitely not taking a gamble. There are a lot of dumps in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton great location, okay room”
Reviews.Author: sskelley
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton July 6-9, 2004. We bid on Priceline and payed $110 per night for a "4 star" hotel. Personally, I thought it was more like a 3-3 1/2 star because the room was basic and small. The bed was very comfortable and you don't really spend that much time in your room anyway. The location is what makes this hotel a good choice. It is close to Times Square and Rockefeller Plaza. We would stay there again because it was clean, safe and there were lots of tourists (like us!) Be aware if you do plan on bringing your car- parking is very expensive! We paid $110 for three nights- the price of another night's stay. One cool feature of the hotel is that they will let you check your luggage after you check out if you are not quite ready to leave. It costs $3 per bag but is well worth it. We wanted to squeeze in as much sight-seeing as we possibly could in the Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at NY Sheraton in early August. Club Level Room was recently re-done and was very nice, though a bit small for our family. Access to Club Lounge was a real plus. The staff at Club was very friendly despite the large crowds. Overall staff at hotel were very nice with exception of business center. Great location near Times Square and theatre district. Would definitely consider for future stay, although there are lots of choices in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Room was not clean”
Reviews.Author: cvelba
Reviews.Content: This was a very busy hotel. Great location. Staff was friendly. Rooms were small and in need of updating. I got a great deal on hotwire.com. The room wasn't well lit and was dusty. I doubt that I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location... good hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is superb.. between Times Square and Central Park. Rockefeller Center, MOMA, Broadway shows, etc. are short walks away. My only complaint (and the reason for not giving an excellent) is that that the hotel (rooms, hallways, common areas) on the floor I stayed, looked worn, dirty, and unkept.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff So-So room”
Reviews.Author: colecole2
Reviews.Content: After getting a great deal online, (Hotwire.com $118 + taxes +143) I really did not complain much. I am an ex NYC resident so I was familar with the hotel and surroundings. The location is excellent. A hop, skip and jump brings you right into the hussle and bussel of Times Square. Rays Pizza which is one of the best NY Pizzeria and opened late into the evening is less than a block away. Another great convenience is that the R-N subway is near and the express trains are only a few blocks away! The bed linens are nice and the bed has a feather top. The hotel also boasts about it's feather pillows and how it caters to good night of sleep. I actually did not sleep well... My complaints have to do with the AC. The room really was not cool. I had the AC on full blast and it just did not feel as such. The room also was not as clean as I would have liked it to be. There was something that looked like blood on the light switch and there was droplets of the substance on the walls. There was also hair in the bathtub and on the shower walls. Those findings made me question the bed and linens and the hotel in general. The lobby was quite busy so I did not make any formal complaints since I was checking out in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a weekend at the Sheraton New York Hotel & Towers at the end of July 2004. We read all of the latest reviews, however we were not influenced by the negative reviews, as we had been going to the Sheraton over many years during our many trips to New York. Although the room was small, the bed was excellent, the carpet was clean and the bathroom was clean and showed evidence that it had been remodelled. They did a very good job of remodelling and this was evident in the coordinating fictures, etc. We were on the 46th floor and enjoyed the free breakfast and evening hor d'oeuvres. Staff was friendly and polite. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Lena961
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I stayed at the Sheraton Hotel and Towers in NY City week of June 21 (5 nights). We got a great deal from Hotwire.com. We loved the location, and the hotel lobby! I think all the money we paid (discount) was worth it! IF I had to pay the regular going price of approx. $225 a night, I wouldn't stay there. Bed was very comfortable but room/bathroom needed repairs. We turned off the a/c at night but the motor/noise kept going CONSTANTLY. The faucet didn't turn off all the way, so it was leaking, wallpaper was torn up in the bathroom and the bathroom itself was TOO small. :) Advice: don't order room service... too expensive! Overall, location was great and bed was comfortable but it probably would have been the same at any other average motel/hotel. I expected more from Sheraton name!

Reviews.Title: “Provides poor Customer Service.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After having Reservations made in November of 2003 to stay at this Hotel for a week in July of 2004, I ended up having to be placed in a Studio suite (which contained only a pull-out sofa bed), because of the hotel being overbooked. This was very unacceptable, especially when you have back problems.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 Star! More 2-3 Star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would not rate this hotel 4 Star. Closer the 3 Star with 2 star rooms. The lobby and health club are nice, but the rooms lack amenities and the walls are like paper. Checked in recieved a renovated corner room on the 36th floor. Clerk was nice and helpful. Our room was a nice size with comfortable beds. However, not much else. Reminds me of a college dorm. The only other furniture was a TV cart that doubled as a coffee service with Maxwell house and built in laminate desk top. The TV had very limited basic cable. Warning! The walls are like paper -Unless you are a very heavy sleeper, you may have a problem here. We did! Also, the restaurant is not open at night. They told us to go to the other Sheraton across the street. Good location in Times Square, but a bit North out of the hussle and bussle around 50th St.- near Letterman. This hotel is fine if you are looking for 2-3 star, but NOT 4 Star as we expected - it was a great disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at October 2003. Very small rooms with very small bathrooms. Rude Staff. Very bad experience. Very expensive. Never come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton was very nice”
Reviews.Author: MarylandTravelinMom
Reviews.Content: Got a priceline rate of $125 per night for July 13 and 14th. While my reservation said check-in was at 4, I was able to get my room at 1 Pm when I arrived. I got a good sized room on the 21st floor(which is part of a smaller elevator bank)- my room had two double beds, two arm chairs, a desk, coffee service, room enough to set up the ironing board and not have it be in the way. The room was clean, there was enough room for me to exercise without sitting on the bed, my airconditioning was too cold!-I turned it down. The only odor I noticed was in the morning- someone was obviously smoking on the non-smoking floor. I guess the hotel must have a wide range of rooms since the reviews I see are so uneven-anyway, I had a great time, great location(Starbucks and juice bars right across the street) and would go back tomorrow!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was one of the worst hotels I ever stayed. Central Bus station atmosphere. Unclean and badly needs an update. Got it through PriceLine ($110). Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Will Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: killian02
Reviews.Content: I was a single traveler this past trip and chose this hotel based on user reviews and location. While I was not overly thrilled with the rate: $240/night, the location was excellent and I was pleased with my stay here. The hotel gym charges $10 per day to use the facilities. I felt for the rate I paid, it could have been an included perk. Also - you will pay $3 per bag to store bags for the day after you check out. There is no tipping - it is a set charge.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the reviews would lead you to believe!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I travel to New York a lot, usually staying at Ws or the Parker Meridien. When my favorite hotels were booked or outrageously expensive, I made a reservation at the Sheraton New York, where I got the best price through the Starwood website. Yeah, the rooms are small, but Sheraton has put great beds and linens in all the rooms, including those that have not yet been renovated. It is definitely worth it to pay the extra $20 a night for club privelages. The club room on the 44th floor is awesome, and the staff treats you like royalty. The free breakfast is better than what you'd pay for downstairs, and the evening hors deouvres are awesome. The staff is always bringing little treats, and sending you off with a bottle of water in the morning. We were there at the height of the tourist season, and while the place was jumping, the staff couldn't have been nicer. Probably the best value for the money in New York. This was my third stay, and we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Not a 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sheraton this past weekend for 3 nights. Good location. The room was small but the bed was nice. The carpet was old, there was blood under the light switch in the bathroom, the light panels in the bathroom were loose, airconditioning was so-so, and it was very noisy. We could hear the staff speaking loudly, there were some strange noises early in the morning, we could hear the traffic clearly even though we were on the 18th floor. Paid $150 each night through Priceline. I'm also a Starwood member, but that didn't make a difference. I thought that the amount paid through Priceline (which adds taxes to your bid) was all-inclusive, but at the end of our stay, Sheraton charged a $2.00 tourism tax for each night we stayed there. Last year we stayed at a "3-Star" hotel that was at a good location, cheaper, larger room and better staff.

Reviews.Title: “Better at the NY Hilton”
Reviews.Author: ClipperJon
Reviews.Content: I overnighted at the NY Sheraton & Towers on Sunday, 20 June. I was not impressed. Very long check-in line. The hotel could really stand a major renovation. However, I paid $150 via Priceline, so perhaps that I was given a so-so room, complete with major stains on the carpet and bedding. Bathroom was dirty. Hallway was littered with trash from the time I had arrived to the time I had left, plus room service items as well. I was taking a nap before going out to a benefit that night and I was awoken by "housekeeping" - strange - because housekeeping had not bothered to pick up all the hallway refuse. The NY Hilton is a MUCH better choice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel- we'll definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to visit NYC over Memorial Day weekend after finding great airfare and hotel prices on hotwire. I was a little nervous about our hotel room after reading some of the reviews, but was pleasantly surprised by the great service, clean room and EXCELLENT location! You couldn't ask for a better place to stay. The room and bathroom were good size (especially by NY standards) and very clean. When you walk out the big revolving door of the hotel you are in the Times Square, within blocks of theaters, Rockefeller Center, Central Park and there's a subway station right next to the hotel...it's very convenient. This hotel is a great bargain and a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “All's Well at the Sheraton NY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton NY Hotel & Towers over Memorial Day Weekend. Booked 2 rooms, one free with hotel points, one on the club floor at a discounted rate through starwood---. Upon arrival, the staff upgraded my free room to the club floor (44th) as well. The club was excellent...great view, great food - all included in the price of the room, except for the cash bar which was a bit expensive. The staff in general was courteous and helpful. This included the front desk, parking attendants, security, bellhops, club floor staff, and maintenance which resopnded rapidly to a broken remote in one of our rooms. The rooms were quite small, however they were clean and well maintained. Beds were very comfortable. Location was excellent...a few blocks from Times Square and Central Park right on top of the B & D subway lines, and across the street from the Carnegie Deli. Who could ask for anything more. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: spunkster
Reviews.Content: Great location. Room was nice, but small. Windows were filthy. Check-in was easy.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck...”
Reviews.Author: Inanreca
Reviews.Content: This was possibly the worst hotel I have ever stayed at and I travel a lot. To start of the room was tiny. For the rate that was in the high $200's, I expected better. We stayed there for 2 nights and 3 days. But the worst is yet to come. There was leftover food in the refrigerator, a coke form McDonald's and juice. And it didn't stop there. On the wall there was a huge whole that had been covered with wall paper...yes ladies and gentleman wall paper. The food on the from the room service menu was over priced...I have stayed at the Marriot in Time Square and the food was less expensive there. Moving on...the bathroom was dirty. It had black spots, looked like some form of growth. And what annoyed me the most was the bathroom. Every time we flushed it water came spraying out. I will never stay there again, once again the worst hotel I have ever stayed at.
